author: {'steamid': '76561198008360449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1590706239}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist zweifellos ein Juwel in der Krone des Point-and-Click-Adventure-Genres. Dieses zeitlose Meisterwerk von LucasArts hat nicht nur eine treue Fangemeinde über Jahrzehnte hinweg begeistert, sondern stellt auch heute noch einen Höhepunkt der Spielekunst dar.

Die Geschichte von Day of the Tentacle ist so skurril wie genial. Als Spieler schlüpft man in die Rollen von drei ungewöhnlichen Helden, die sich auf einer absurden Zeitreise befinden, um die Welt vor einem bösen, lila Tentakel zu retten. Die Dialoge sind voller Witz und Charme und die Charaktere sind so liebenswert wie schrullig, was einen unvergesslichen Eindruck hinterlässt.

Die Grafiken mögen zwar pixelig sein, aber sie haben nichts von ihrem Charme verloren. Jeder Schauplatz ist mit liebevollen Details gefüllt, die die surreale Welt des Spiels zum Leben erwecken. Die Cartoon-Ästhetik verleiht dem Spiel einen zeitlosen und einzigartigen Look, der auch nach all den Jahren noch begeistert.

Das Rätseldesign von Day of the Tentacle ist einfach brillant. Die cleveren Kopfnüsse und das innovative Zeitreise-Mechanik sorgen für eine herausfordernde, aber nie frustrierende Spielerfahrung. Die Rätsel sind logisch und einfallsreich und regen die grauen Zellen an, ohne jemals unfair zu wirken.

Die Steuerung ist intuitiv und benutzerfreundlich, was Day of the Tentacle zu einem perfekten Einstieg in das Genre macht, sowohl für Veteranen als auch für Neueinsteiger. Die Möglichkeit, zwischen den drei Charakteren zu wechseln und ihre einzigartigen Fähigkeiten zu nutzen, verleiht dem Gameplay zusätzliche Tiefe und Vielfalt.

Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle ein zeitloses Meisterwerk, das auch nach all den Jahren nichts von seinem Charme verloren hat. Mit seiner genialen Geschichte, seinem skurrilen Humor und seinem cleveren Rätseldesign ist es ein Muss für jeden Liebhaber von Point-and-Click-Adventures und ein zeitloser Klassiker, der noch viele Generationen von Spielern begeistern wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348368557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1585757511}
review:
Un viaggio nostalgico nel cuore dell'avventura

Day of the Tentacle Remastered è una gioia per i fan del genere avventura punta e clicca, e un invito irresistibile per coloro che amano i classici del passato. Questa versione rimasterizzata di un titolo cult del 1993 offre un'esperienza di gioco che è tanto fresca e coinvolgente oggi quanto lo era all'epoca del suo debutto.

Fin dall'inizio, ti cattura con il suo umorismo affascinante, il design del mondo bizzarro e i personaggi indimenticabili. Il gioco trasuda charme e creatività in ogni sua parte, dalla trama avvincente all'umorismo intelligente che ti fa sorridere anche nei momenti più difficili.

Gli aggiornamenti grafici sono stati eseguiti con cura, mantenendo lo stile unico e vibrante del gioco originale mentre lo portano al passo con i tempi moderni. I colori brillanti, le animazioni fluide e i dettagli affascinanti rendono ogni scena un'opera d'arte interattiva.

Ma è la trama che è il vero punto forte di Day of the Tentacle Remastered. Viaggiare nel tempo per risolvere enigmi e impedire al malvagio tentacolo viola di prendere il controllo del mondo è un'avventura avvincente e coinvolgente che ti tiene incollato allo schermo fino alla fine.

Il gameplay punta e clicca è intuitivo e gratificante, con enigmi ben progettati che richiedono un mix di logica, creatività e un pizzico di follia. La varietà di personaggi giocabili e le loro abilità uniche aggiungono profondità e diversità all'esperienza di gioco.

In conclusione, Day of the Tentacle Remastered è un capolavoro rimasterizzato che cattura perfettamente lo spirito del gioco originale mentre lo porta verso nuove vette di eccellenza. Se sei un appassionato di avventure punta e clicca o semplicemente desideri rivivere un classico intramontabile, questo gioco è un must-have assoluto. Preparati a immergerti in un viaggio nostalgico che ti riporterà indietro nel tempo e ti lascerà con un sorriso sul viso per lungo tempo dopo aver terminato l'avventura.

review:
Pure nostalgia. It was great to play in '93 and just as fun in 30+ years later, remastered with improved graphics to make it playable in the modern day and age. I have always been a big fan of the 90's point and click adventures. A lot of fun to play and added directors commentary are quite interesting to hear how things came together.
Purchased in a steam sale at a reduced price, even with my love of this game i'm not sure I'd pay the full price of £10.99 for a game from the 90's.

review:
Pro:
- Infanzia;
- Bella grafica e suono rifatto (considerando che lo giocai molti anni fa senza musiche, problema che affliggeva anche il pc di mio cugino ai tempi di Win95/98);
- Maniac Mansion incluso.

Contro:
- bug, bug e ancora bug. Stuttering insensati e crash improvvisi. Si può rimediare smanettando impostando la compatibilità con win98, ma a fine gioco l'ho dovuta togliere perché continuava a crashare. E per questo non mi darò pena nemmeno a sbloccare gli achievement che mi mancano.
- nonostante sia un titolo della mia infanzia, mi ha fatto capire che io e le avventure grafiche non andiamo d'accordo, perciò eviterò di comprare altre remaster di questo genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006004632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1710257616}
review:
Possibly the best Lucasarts point and click adventure game, and therefore possibly the best point and click adventure game ever made.

Hoagie, Laverne and Bernard travel through time and cause havoc in the 18th Century, the present day and a tentacle-ruled dystopian future . The original boasted fantastic graphics, hilarious off the wall humour and challenging but ultimately gettable puzzles.

The remastered version has all this, plus tastefully updated graphics and soundtrack (if you're old like me and prefer the originals you can switch between these and the remastered ones), developer's commentary and a fantastic gallery of the original background sketches and paintings by Peter Chan & co. 

It's a nailed on, cast iron classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995519602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1473574996}
review:
Wow, was für eine Zeitreise in die Kindheit mit Day of the Tentacle, Monkey Island, Full Throttle, Baphomets Fluch, den ersten Sam & Max Teilen und was es so gab.
Ich bin so dankbar, dass diese Spiele nochmal neu aufgelegt gekommen sind.
Wie schnell mein Hirn sich auch noch an alles wieder erinnert hat und damit fast schon zu schnell durchs Spiel gekommen bin. Das sah damals noch ganz anders aus - da war für das ein oder andere Rätsel sogar ein Lösungsheft notwendig.
Insbesondere Personen, die das Spiel früher noch nicht erlebt haben, kann ich dieses Spiel empfehlen. Allein der Humor ist einfach grandios und einiges davon würde wohl wegen "political correctness" und anderen Themen heute so nicht mehr ohne weiteres umgesetzt werden.
Wie eine interaktive humorvolle Geschichte mit ein wenig Point & Click.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580562', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1658618709}
review:
Auf dieses Spiel habe ich mich gefreut, wollte nach so langer Zeit dieses mal wieder Spielen. Habe noch die alte CD von damals, aus dem Jahre 1993. Der Nachfolger von Maniac Mansion, der damals wie auch heute im Remastered wieder als Vollversion dabei ist.

Spiel 8 von 10:

Auch heute noch ist der Humor dieses Games einfach super. Man spielt Hoagie, ein Metalfan der in die Vergangenheit zu George Washington festsitzt und wieder in seine Zeit möchte. Bernard, der Streber sitzt in der Gegenwart und möchte natürlich seine Freunde wieder hier haben. Und zum guten schluss noch Laverne die in die Zukunft geschmissen wurde und wieder zurück möchte. In der Zukunft haben die Tentaclen die Welt an sich gerissen und Menschen sind ihre Haustiere. Man steuert alle drei um die Rätsel zu lösen und die Tentacle in der Gegenwart zu hindern die Welt zu erobern. Gegenstände werde dabei über die Klo Zeitmaschine hin und her geschickt. 

Musik 8 von 10:

 Die Musik ist wie man sie aus den 90er Jahren kennt und untermalt das Spiel sehr gut. Passt zu der Art von Spiel und ich finde das sie nicht zu sehr nervt.

Gameplay 8 von 10:

Das spiel wird wie man es gewohnt ist bei Klick and Point Adventures per Maus und / oder Tastatur. Benutze das mit das oder sprich mit dem. Damals war das durch z. B. Maniac Mansion und Zack McKracken eine Neuerung. Die Figuren kommentieren, alles was man so von den möchte, meistens mit sehr ironischen und lustigen Kommentaren. Nach ein paar Minuten hat man den dreh raus und es geht einen total leicht von der Hand. Das Spiel selbst ist circa 6 bis 10 Stunden lang, wer Maniac Mansion 1 spielen möchte geht in der Gegenwart mit Bernard in das Zimmer von Fred Edison an seinen PC. Da kann man dann den Kompletten ersten Teil spielen. Nett, das es auch im Remastered so geblieben ist.

Grafik 7 von 10:

Über die Grafik müssen wir uns nicht wirklich unterhalten, sie natürlich nicht Zeitgemäß. Auf Knopf druck kann man in die Grafik von damals und heute wechseln. Die neue Grafik hat das Spiel nur angepasst und es nicht in die heutige Zeit geholt. Bei dem Spiel, aber auch nicht so wichtig. Es ist heute, wie damals Comic Artig und Skurril, sehr detailliert und voller kleiner Easter Ecks. Alles im allen sehr gelungen und vor allem sehr hübsch aufgefrischt. 

Wer Spiele aus den 90er mag und Retro Fan ist wird mit diesem Spiel, welches auch komplett Deutsch Synchronisiert und Vertont wurde, eine Menge Spaß haben. Für Retro Fans ein have must. Mir hat es auf jeden Fall sehr viel Spaß gemacht. Gut wusste ja auch viele Rätsel noch, deswegen war ich schneller durch. Kann es nur empfehlen, die Firma hat sich sehr viel mühe gegeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114662499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1708797128}
review:
Decades later, Day of the Tentacle is still holding its own, now as a remaster. It is definitely one of the better point-n-click games. The remastered version allows switching between the new cleaned-up graphics and the old way more pixelated visuals, providing a choice between a modernised or the old-school input scheme. Bonus developer commentary, game art as well as the included Maniac Mansion are appreciated.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is one of the easiest recommendations for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025103501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1707524811}
review:
Great remaster of a classic adventure game! Played this remaster with my daughter to introduce her to classic adventure games and she loved it. 

The option to flick back and forth to old and new was really appreciated, as well as all the little bonus features.
I admire the respect they put into the visual update - everything was redrawn but they kept all of the original artwork, colours and design without changing anything, so it just looks like a beautiful crisp upscale rather than some ugly 'modernised' redesign. Made me notice details that were always in the original scenes, just difficult to make out in the original pixel graphics. 

The sound restoration and re-recorded score was wonderful (the uncompressed dialogue is so crisp now)!

Though I would have liked an option to retain the classic verb interface, I can see why the change was needed, and the expanded wide-screen graphics more than make up for the occasional fiddly right-click options. 

Weird obtuse puzzles are all still there... We even got stuck a couple of times, which was a pleasant surprise for a game I've played half a dozen times. I appreciate the restraint in not adding a hint system.  

Strong recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981494710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1707751086}
review:
Schöner Point-and-Click-Klassiker. In den 90ern ist [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] leider total an mir vorbeigerauscht, aber auch 30 Jahre später im Jahre 2024 ist das Spiel ein angenehmer Zeitvertreib für ~4-8 Stunden.

Ich hab es ausschließlich im Pixelmodus gespielt und nur ab und zu mal in den neuen Modus gewechselt. Der neue Modus hat mir leider nicht gefallen, daher finde ich es großartig, dass der Wechsel [i]jederzeit[/i] bei DOTT Remastered möglich ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076290934', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1707677731}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de todos los tiempos remasterizada.

Day of the Tentacle se trata de un videojuego point and click de la antigua y querida Lucas Arts con un gran sentido del humor y una aventura bizarra llena de gags y viajes en el tiempo. Es una secuela del antiguo Maniac Mansion el cual no es obligatorio para entender este pero se recomienda jugar primero.

Esta versión remasterizada trae un lavado de cara que mejora los gráficos del juego original y trae mejoras en la jugabilidad. Aún así se puede jugar el original sin ningún cambio con solo apretar el F1.



Para quien no conozca este juego, pues se trata de una aventura gráfica protagonizada por tres personajes los cuales deben salvar el mundo de ser invadido por unos malvados tentáculos.

Y esto lo harán viajando a través del tiempo: Bernard en el presente, Hoagie en el pasado y Laverne en el futuro. Tres personajes que controlaremos en el mismo escenario pero en diferentes lineas de tiempo.

Lo que diferencia a Day of the Tentacle con el resto de juegos del mismo género es que aquí deberemos hacer que estos tres frikis se ayuden mutuamente de forma que lo que ocurra en el pasado afectará al futuro y deberán pasarse objetos entre ellos para resolver los puzzles, lo que amplia la escala de un escenario bastante grande y lleno de detalles a tres escenarios grandes y llenos de detalles.



Es una historia muy absurda, pero también muy divertida.

Day of the Tentacle viene a ser uno de estos juegos que no se toma en serio a si mismo y sabe crear escenas muy graciosas mediante diálogos desternillantes, así como escenas muy absurdas y puzzles ridículos que vuelve el juego un festival de risas.

Y todo sin necesidad de recurrir a humor estúpido que dé vergüenza ajena ni humor escatológico de mal gusto que trata a sus jugadores como si fueran tontos. Porqué aunque Day of the Tentacle esté dirigido a niños, no significa que los trate como idiotas. Es un juego para todos los públicos y todos los públicos se divierten por igual, razón por la que muchos adultos con nostalgia les siga gustando este juego.



Ahora bien, la parte mala del juego es que sigue siendo una aventura gráfica antigua y se nota demasiado. Y no lo digo porque el juego se sienta anticuado, sino porque a día de hoy su diseño es inaceptable.

Por mucho que moleste a los jugadores veteranos, este juego a día de hoy es indisfrutable si no juegas con una guía que te diga lo que tienes que hacer. Sus rompecabezas no siguen ninguna lógica y todo es adivinar por pura suerte lo que los desarrolladores habían pensado para resolver un puzzle.


Por ejemplo: para desbloquear a Laverne (futuro) tienes que cortar el árbol en el pasado. Eso lo tiene que hacer George Washington, pero solo corta cerezos y el árbol que está colgada Laverne tiene naranjas. Solución: Pintar las naranjas con un bote de pintura rojo.

Y este es todavía de los fáciles. Imagina cuando tengas a los tres personajes desbloqueados y debas transportar los objetos en las diferentes líneas de tiempo para resolver los próximos puzzles.


Vamos, que es un juego que solo puedes hacer dos cosas:
- O probar al azar los diferentes objetos con otros objetos y elementos del escenario, incluidos los NPC.
- O verte una guía para saber que es lo que tienes que hacer.

Obviamente esto antes era aceptable porque no habían tantos juegos como antes y 1 solo tenía que durar mucho.

Igual pasa con el tema de la dificultad artificial que antes era aceptable pero ahora sabemos diferenciar entre un juego difícil y uno injusto.


Day of the Tentacle es un juego que ha envejecido bastante mal. Y me sabe mal porque me gusta mucho sus chistes, personajes, gráficos (tanto los originales como el remaster) y banda sonora.

Pero las cosas hay que decirlas claras. A día de hoy un juego que no ayude a los jugadores a terminar su historia principal (el contenido secundario opcional no es necesario, podrían ser Easter Eggs escondidos o chistes ocultos que fuesen difíciles de encontrar) no puede ser aceptable a día de hoy. 
Esto no es alta dificultad, es una pérdida de tiempo.









En resumen:

De las mejores aventuras gráficas junto a Monkey Island y Grim Fandango. Ahora con un buen lavado de cara.


Day of the Tentacle, al igual que su primera entrega Maniac Mansión, no será de las aventuras gráficas más populares, pero si de las más queridas por ser de las más divertidas y tronchantes.

Pero como ya dije antes, si eres un jugador nuevo que nunca jugó antes al juego original o, peor todavía, una aventura gráfica, ve con la consciencia que este juego, pese a formar parte del género de rompecabezas, no sigue ninguna lógica y deberás depender de una guía a no ser que no te moleste perder el tiempo en resolver puzzles sin sentido.


Gracias por su lectura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031523753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1707582487}

author: {'steamid': '76561198872047952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1707480398}
review:
Sadly this game is very overrated. Its just an average game. Not good, not bad. Just okay. 

My biggest problem with the game is the setting. You stay in the same house trough the entire game. This kind of game needs more variety.  

Also its very short. Amanita games for example are much much shorter. But they offer a much bigger variety in characters, places and backgrounds. So you feel that there is much more contend made. In day of the tentacle you have lots of back tracking and need to switch your items around between 3 characters, which makes the play time much longer, without adding new content. 

The story plays in a house. Which is the most borring setting you can choose for a point and click adventure. Just a big house. Nothing special. I mean come on its called "Day of the tentacle". Everyone who reads this title thinks automatically about Cthulhu and all the cool places HP Lovecraft wrote. Like pyramids, antarctica, forgotten temples, swamps. Everything scary. And then you play in a normal house. Not even a spooky mansion. Most of the rooms look very normal. 

You have 3 characters they all go to different time periods. So you basically go trough the same house with all 3 characters just in other time periods. The house of course looks different in each time. But its still the same house. In stead of this, the game makers could have made different backgrounds to wonder around in. To me this feels like they reused the same assets to make production easier. This would not be a problem for me if the game would be much longer and we would later get to other places. But it stays in the house for the entire game, 

The humor most of the time does not work for me. Most of the characters feel very cartoony but fail to be funny. Like you meet the founders of america but none of them really say anything funny. I do not understand why they where in this game at all. All other characters are more interessting. 

The three time periods made the backtracking much longer. Because you always have to go to the time machine with both characters you want to exchange itmes. This takes away a lot of time. And if you are stuck you really dont want to sent any item to very time period to try it out there. This would take to much time. So people are much more likly to use a walktrough. Which is a bad thing. There should be a shortcut for sending items or to get to the time machine.

Like I said at the beginning its not a bad game. I only pointed out the negative points. Because the other reviews are mostly very very positive and I found this game on high spots on lots of best point and click adventure lists. And dont think it should be in any top 10 list. Because I played lot of point and click adventures which much more interessting settings and characters. That didnt have this much enoying backtracking. 

The story is fine. The main characters are funny. Some of the side characters didnt entertain me at all. Others where interessting to talk to. The game has some good moments, some average. I would buy it on a discount, not full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104197959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1707321625}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una de las grandes aventuras gráficas que hicieron grande este género, junto con The curse of Monkey Island. Tendremos que volver 1 día al pasado para evitar que el Tentáculo morado beba agua contaminada y se vuelva inteligente y despiadado, para que no conquiste el mundo.

Sin embargo, un pequeño error de cálculo hace que nuestros 3 protagonistas acaben en el pasado, presente y futuro, lo que nos llevará a tomar decisiones que generen paradojas temporales y así poder restablecer el orden del mundo. Una historia divertida, tensa y fresca.

Una joya atemporal que llega remasterizada, aunque también permite la opción de jugarlo con los graficos y jugabilidad original. Esta aventura gráfica es historia de los videojuegos, ¡No te la puedes perder!

author: {'steamid': '76561198200563011', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1706783608}
review:
[h1]Three teenagers against a tyrannical tentacle[/h1]

If you played the original Day of the Tentacle way back in 1993, you are already aware of how beloved it is in the point-and-click adventure community. If this is your first time playing, then I envy you. This game will always hold a special place in my heart, having watched and helped my dad complete it when I was young. It's one of those titles where everyone who enjoys adventure games should play at least once. Here's why this remaster needs to be checked out and why you should revisit it.

[u][b]Positives[/b][/u]

+ You can easily toggle between the remastered and the original graphics. The art in the remastered version has been redrawn, moving on from the pixel art from the original. The new detailed high-definition 2D visuals look absolutely glorious.

+ You can switch between the remastered and the original audio. In 1993, it was MIDI, but the remaster has CD quality, which means the voice acting is smoother and of higher quality.

+ The humour still holds up. There are numerous gags and the comedy is diverse enough to satisfy a wide range of players. The slapstick and zany-esque humour I gravitate towards. 

+ An updated interface. There is now a scroll wheel instead of a cluttered list of actions and verbs like the original. I personally much prefer the scroll wheel, but you can switch to either.

+ You can mix different settings together. For example, enable remastered graphics, but the classic audio and interface.

+ You can choose to turn on the developer commentary, which gives more insight into the making of the game from Tim Schafer and others, which I always appreciate. I would recommend not turning this on the first time for new players.

+ An interesting and captivating plot backed up by loveable and engaging characters alongside some of the best dialogue you'll ever come across in an adventure game. This game has soul.

[u][b]Negatives[/b][/u]

- There is no hint system implemented. Depending on the sort of player you are, you may see this as more of a positive than a negative. I wouldn't say the game is that difficult. Some puzzles might come across as a little more obscure than others, but overall, it shouldn't prove to be too much of a challenge.

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]

Day of the Tentacle has certified legendary status when it comes to point-and-click adventure games. If you had a blast playing the likes of Full Throttle, Grim Fandango and Monkey Island, then you NEED this in your life. Playing the remastered version only made me appreciate the game even more than I did previously. You can tell it was only handled with love and care from the original creators. Do yourself a favour and get it now!

[h3]💬 Comments 💬[/h3]
[h2]Short Game Description[/h2]
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a classic point-and-click game that features the story of three friends who have to save the world from the domination of an evil tentacle while travelling to the past, but they will encounter in their adventure many adversities.
[list]
[*][h3]Positives[/h3]
Discussing the positives, first of all, the overall gameplay feels solid; it's a point-and-click that has some original and revolutionary mechanics in the genre, such as playing three different characters with each of them in different frames, where they will occasionally need the help of the others to solve difficult and original puzzles. Secondly, even if it's a remaster, it aged well; the art style achieves a great setting supported by the music and sound effects that hold up well until today. Thirdly, the story is interesting; even if it's a bit childish, it achieves a short and enjoyable adventure with light touches of humour. Additionally, it features achievements that are interesting and fun to do.
[*][h3]Negatives[/h3]
On the negative side, I didn't find anything noteworthy.
[/list][h2][u]Conclusion[/u][/h2]
In short, the game is probably one of the best point-and-click games out there that has unique mechanics of gameplay that make it special in the genre as it features a fun story with light touches of humour. The game is an 8.25/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976354869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 32, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1712448207}
review: This game is wonderful. From the goofy story to the clever timeline-altering puzzles, this is a great remaster of a classic. In my opinion, this is one of, if not the best of the classic point and click adventure games. The puzzles are challenging, but not to the point of frustration. Whenever I figured out a way to progress, I had a sense of completion rather than frustration due to the absurdity of a puzzle, a problem in most puzzle games. If you're looking to get into these types of games, this is a great place to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043967856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1703765751}
review:
Never played or heard of the original and went in with no expectations, maybe seeking that ye olde gam experience.  But ended up using a guide to complete it without having to waste time navigating ridiculous puzzles.

Pros:
- interesting animations to seek out in the environment
- much of the dialogue is witty
- art style is endearing and gives ye olde art vibes of computer programs and games of the era

Cons:
- Puzzles start ok but you could make a strong case against several of the item usages.  Sometimes the absurdity is part of the fun - but sometimes it is also fun not to have to click every item on every object in the world to find out what it was "supposed" to do.  It really shows how far games have come in modern times
- Voice acting and recording is poor quality

Tiene detalles absurdos que a veces me pregunto cómo conseguí resolver en su momento (más disponibilidad de tiempo, más paciencia, más gusto por la prueba-error), pero sigue siendo una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de Lucasfilm/Lucasarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961114362', 'num_games_owned': 1408, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1487810951}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein klassisches Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiel, das ursprünglich im Jahr 1993 veröffentlicht wurde. Es wurde von vielen Spielern und Kritikern als eines der besten Spiele seiner Zeit gelobt.

Das Spiel bietet eine einzigartige und humorvolle Handlung, in der die Spieler drei Charaktere steuern, die in der Zeit reisen, um die Welt vor einem bösen Tentakel zu retten. Die Rätsel sind kreativ und herausfordernd, und die Spieler müssen oft logisch denken und verschiedene Gegenstände kombinieren, um voranzukommen.

Die Grafik und der Sound des Spiels sind im Retro-Stil gehalten, was dem Spiel einen charmanten und nostalgischen Touch verleiht. Die Dialoge sind witzig und die Charaktere sind liebenswert und gut geschrieben.

Es ist wichtig zu beachten, dass Day of the Tentacle ein älteres Spiel ist und einige Spieler möglicherweise mit der veralteten Grafik und dem Gameplay nicht vertraut sind. Wenn du ein Fan von klassischen Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspielen bist und den Retro-Stil magst, könnte Day of the Tentacle eine gute Wahl für dich sein.

review: One of the best LucasArts point-and-click adventure games. The remaster adds a ton of content. author: {'steamid': '76561198043905366', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1701868001}
review:
I've never played Day of the Tentacle in it's heyday those many years ago, but I have heard it's name tossed around a lot as one of the most recommended adventure titles to play for the PC. Like a lot of LucasArt-related games, it's got a lot of character to it and I remember LucasArts more for having done Zombies Ate My Neighbors before knowing the rest of their catalog.

I came into this game very blind besides what little I've seen of it in action. I do grasp it's charm even though a fair bit of it was over my head. I chose not to play this game with it's remastered visuals because really it felt like I was watching a flash cartoon from the early 2000s and it put me off, so I played the game with it's originally intended visuals.

The thing that kept putting me down from enjoying the game was three things. First, I knew that music played in this game but it didn't for the opening sequence. It also didn't recognize my input when I tried swapping characters after I've exhausted the main one in the lobby for options. And it appears that this game is very sensitive to being alt-tabbed considering when I went to look up something for it and came back, it crashed me to desktop.

These few things made me skeptical in what else I could expect if I decide to delve into this game further. It doesn't take away from it's own legacy, it is an established title that's remembered fondly. But the remaster is doing it a little disservice by not ironing out any problems it had which makes me teeter this game towards the field of just remastering it for modern controls, give it a slight facelift, push it out and make money because people can now play it on modern systems. Not really much of a good look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126171008', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1698597821}
review:
La regola d'oro del retrogaming?
Se qualcuno vi dice che "gioco X è un capolavoro"; DIFFIDATE, SEMPRE.

Day of Tentacle, a mio malgrado, cade proprio nella categoria di giochi che non merita la fama che gli si addice oggi giorno.
Purtroppo NIENTE si salva per me in questo punta e clicca.

La storia è di una semplicità veramente banale e, per quanto non sia così GRAVE, non ti spinge molto a continuare a giocare, soprattutto contando gli altri problemi che ha. Cioè, è carino che l'antagonista sia così strano, e devo ammettere che mi è piaciuto l'accenno "finale" al motivo per il quale sia cattivo, ma tutto viene rovinato da un finale che più cliché di così non si può.

I personaggi sono veramente uno spreco di potenzialità, soprattutto perché non interagiscono quasi MAI tra di loro, e quelli con cui puoi interagire non sono per niente memorabili ed o interessanti (anzi, spesso sono cloni di altri personaggi). Mi è piaciuta la dinamica dei tre protagonisti contemporaneamente, sia chiaro, ma secondo me poteva essere fatta DECISAMENTE meglio.

I puzzle sono a dir poco ridicoli, a volte sono la cosa più banale e logica del mondo, altre volte invece sono completamente insensati. Inoltre, passare oggetti da un personaggio all'altro è tedioso a livelli immani dato che devi farti strada per metà mappa OGNI SINGOLA VOLTA solo per provare un oggetto che poi non funziona comunque.

Davvero, non so come faccia la gente ad elevare questo gioco così in alto. E c'è da dire che Sam&Max: Hit on the Road era 10 volte meglio, nonostante fosse uscito praticamente lo stesso anno, e dalla STESSA IDENTICA CASA DI SVILUPPO.

A chi non ci ha ancora giocato, vi dico semplicemente: non fatelo. Davvero, non è quella madonna che vi raccontano, e non vi perdete NIENTE a giocarlo.
Piuttosto prestate attenzione, ed interesse, ad altri titoli della Lucas Art (come il precedentemente menzionato Sam&Max o Grim Fandango).

Magari all'epoca poteva essere decente visto che la concorrenza era praticamente nulla, però adesso è VERAMENTE mediocre.

Voto: RuttoDiOagie/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003299587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1019, 'last_played': 1568587947}
review:
Tam İnceleme için;
https://altdunya.com/oyunyorum-day-of-the-tentacle-remastered-2016/

Bazı oyunlar zamansızdır. Ne zaman oynarsanız oynayın aynı tadı alırsınız. Çoğu Lucas Arts oyunu o şekilde tat verir. Ama dürüst olacağım, DotT o oyunlardan biri değil. Evet grafikler güncellenmiş, oynanış düzenlenmiş, kolaylaştırılmış, konsollara daha uygun hale gelmiş ama nostaljik değeri bir kenara koydunuzda o gün aldığım tadı tam alamadım. Detaylı açıklayayım.

Şimdi öncelikle grafiklerdeki güncellemeler elbetteki başarılı. Pixeller falan güzel temizlenmiş, pürüzsüz akıcı ve orjinal halindeki gibi çılgın dünyaya uygun şekilde yapılmış. Hatta karşılaştırabilmeniz için tek tuşla eski haline dönüştürüp, aradaki farkı net görebiliyorsunuz. Bu eski haline çevirme özelliğiyle eski usül, altya yapabileceklerinizin yazdığı haliyle oynayabiliyorsunuz da, ki nostalji manyakları için paha biçilmezdir diye düşünüyorum.

Hazır oynanışa girmişken, eski “bir oraya tıkla, sonra gel şuraya tıkla” kısmı özellikle konsollarda pratik olmayacağı için orada da güzel güncellemeler yapılmış. Inventory’den bir şey seçmek için R2-L2’yi kullanmak gibi, objelere direk sağ kol yardımıyla gidebilmek gibi pek çok güzellik mevcut ve bunların oynanışı çok hızlandırdığı ve akıcı hale getirdiğini söyleyebiliriz. İmleç de eskiye göre hızlı geçiyor, o da bir yöntem ama bu kolaylıklarla oyun daha kullanıcı dostu hale gelmiş.

Artılardan bir başkası “commentary” yani yorumlamalar. Oyunun baş yapımcısı Tim Schafer’dan animasyoncusuna, sesleri yapan çocuğa kadar pek çok önemli isim (ki büyük ihtimalle Tim çoğunu Double Fine’a almıştır) oyunun üretim aşamalarıyla ilgili eğlenceli bilgileri paylaşıyorlar. Eğer bu işler nasıl yürüyor, kafaları basıl çalışıyor merak edenlerdenseniz, tam sizlik. Bunun tanında achievementlar, konsept art’lar falan da geliyor oyunla birlikte ki bu bonus içerikler oyunu fazlasıyla zenginleştiriyor.

Şimdi bu kadar artısına rağmen neden sadece orjinal oyunla duygusal bağı olanlara tavsiye ediyorum. Birincisi hikaye sanki yeni nesle çok hitap etmiyor gibi gelşyor. Deli dolu, ilginç bir girizgah, pek çok ilginç referans var, evet, ama oyunun genelinde hikaye o kadar sarmadı beni. Belki tek yön (linear’i çevirmeye çalıştım burada) ilerlemesinden kaynaklı (ki bu tür oyunların tümünde böyle) belki de oyunun tema olarak aldığı noktalar benim çok ilgi alanıma girmediği için de olabilir. Oyunun konusuna bir türlü giremedim. Monkey Island ya da Full Throttle’da yaşamadığım bir sorun mesela.

İkinci unsur bulmacaların zor olması ve farklı bir kafa gerektirmesi. Eskiden vaktimiz bol, alternatifimiz azken uğraşabiliyorduk. Ama şimdi ben de iyice köreldiğim için baya bir tıkandığım, çözüme bakma ihtiyacım hissettiğim yerler oldu, ki öyle yapınca da oyun tam amacına ulaşmıyor. Bu arada bulmacaları çözerken çok farklı bir kafa yapısına bürünmek icap ediyor. Yalnız bulmacaların bazılarının acayip eğlenceli olduğunun ve Tim’in alameti farikasının bu olduğunun altını çizmek lazım.

Yalnız bu noktada mizahının da yukarıda saydığım oyunlardan bir tık geride kaldığını eklemek lazım. Yani çözümü anladığımda yarıldığım kısımlar vardı ama genel olarak bugünki kafa yapımla tümüyle süper bir mizah, kahkaha tufanı sunmadığını belirtmek lazım.

Sonuç

Yukarıda anlatmaya çalıştığım gibi oyun aynı oyunun üzerine başarılı eklentiler yapılmış hali olmasına rağmen, eğer bende olduğu gibi eski oyun sizde derin izler bırakmadıysa, oynadım ama çok hatırlamıyorum durumundaysanız pek size hitap etmeyebilir. Özellikle yeni nesil oyuncular “bu ne saçmaymış” şeklinde yaklaşabilir ve kısmen haklı olabilirler. Ama eğer eski oyun hala aklınızdaysa, o günleri dün gibi hatırlıyor ve tekrar yaşamak istiyorsanız bu oyun size tüm beklediklerinizi ve daha fazlasını sunuyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561199001360438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1699762412}
review:
[h1] Day of the Tentacle Remastered - Análise [/h1]
Day of the Tentacle, também conhecido como Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle, é um jogo do gênero ''Apontar e clicar'' desenvolvido e publicado pela LucasArts em 1993. Ele é uma sequência do jogo de 1987, Maniac Mansion. A história é sobre Bernard Bernoulli e seus amigos, Hoagie & Laverne, tentando salvar o mundo de um tentáculo roxo consciente querendo dominar o mundo. Os três personagens são divididos por vários períodos do tempo e objetivo do jogador é arranjar uma forma de recuperar a passagem deles e salvar o mundo! Mas, vamos por partes...

[h2] Tópico 1: Uma Apresentação Esquisita [/h2]
Primeiro, vamos falar da mudança mais notável desse jogo...isso mesmo, ele é um REMASTER! E por conta disso, todos os gráficos, desde dos backgrounds até a própria animação dos personagens estão impecáveis! E deixa qualquer um poder sentir o estilo de arte; nojento; bisonho; esquisito; e, acima de tudo, divertido!
Porém, se você prefere ser um pouco fiel ao original, você tem a opção de colocar os gráficos para serem iguais ao original! O que é sempre uma boa opção de se ter. No geral, eu amei o estilo de arte e os gráficos fazem esse jogo ser ainda melhor!

[h2] Tópico 2: Uma Trilha Sonora...? [/h2]
Bem...mesmo a música sendo composta pelo Peter McConnell, sabe? O mesmo cara que compôs a música de PSYCHONAUTS?! Infelizmente, eu diria que diferente de Psychonauts, o trabalho dele nesse jogo foi um pouco...meh? Não dizendo que a música seja ruim. Mas a maioria das músicas não me prendem do mesmo jeito. Os arranjos, simplesmente, não são algo que eu escutaria fora do jogo. Porém, a trilha sonora serve perfeitamente para o propósito que tem que cumprir. Ela combina bem com os locais e situações. Porém, mesmo não tendo muito apreço pela trilha sonora, obviamente, que eu gostei de algumas músicas ao ponto de querer escutar de novo e de novo! Eu acho a música tema do jogo ÓTIMA e transmite bem o sentimento de estranheza, porém, divertido ao mesmo tempo! Mas, a melhor música desse jogo é sem dúvidas, ''Elevator Classics - Snuckey's Greatest Hits Volume 4''. É realmente uma obra de arte. É o tipo de música que tocaria no meio de uma discussão entre um casal. E já que estamos falando de música, devo dizer que a dublagem e os efeitos sonoros são impecáveis! É simplesmente uma diversão escutar os barulhinhos e as falas dos personagens. 

[h2] Tópico 3: A História e Os Personagens [/h2]
Devo dizer com certeza que se o que você procura em um jogo é uma história séria, dramática e cheia de reviravoltas...esse jogo não é para você. Pois, que jogo mais BESTA! E eu digo isso da melhor forma possível. Tudo nesse jogo me faz rachar o bico.[spoiler]O fato que tudo poderia ter sido evitado se o Benard pensasse um pouco, ou toda a parte final do jogo onde os três acham que são uma aberração quando na real é só os três usando a mesma roupa também é uma reviravolta engraçada.[/spoiler]Uma das coisas que eu também gostei muito foram os personagens em si, acho que todos eles, até os secundários são bem charmosos. O Benard, o cara que apareceu em Maniac Mansion, é muito charmoso. Eu amo quando ele é um completo nerd analisando algo do cenário, ou quando ele conversa com alguém e tenta ser todo educado. Ele é literal o https://images.app.goo.gl/DE2k8xN8tTzV2zBG6 e eu não poderia admirar mais ele por isso. Meu personagem favorito de se encontrar enquanto joga com o Benard é[spoiler]o filho do Dr. Fred, o Ed Edison. É resenha demais! Eu gosto quando você usa Tinta que Desaparece na coleção de selo dele e ele SIMPLESMENTE FICA LOUCO JOGA O LIVRO NA CARA DO BENARD POIS ELE ACHA QUE A TINTA VAI FICAR LÁ PRA SEMPRE, dai você simplesmente vai e devolve o livro, pois afinal, a Tinta desaparece e ele volta ao normal todo calminho.[/spoiler]Já o Hoagie, diferente do Benard, não é um nerd. Ele é um ROCKEIRO, YEAH! E, diferentemente do Benard,[spoiler]que continua no presente. O Hoagie ele volta para o PASSADO![/spoiler]E por conta disso, é muito interessante ver um arquétipo de pessoa que nem esse em um local, em um tempo, que nem aquele! É simplesmente uma onda ver ele interagindo com as pessoas de lá. O meu personagem favorito do ''caminho radical'' é o[spoiler]John Hancock! Eu nunca senti tanta pena de um homem quanto eu senti com ele. O cara só queria uma fogueira irmão, e ficaram chamando ele de marica por isso...a vida é dura...[/spoiler]E por último mas não menos importante, temos a Laverne. Que é a minha personagem favorita do jogo INTEIRO! Como diz o velho ditado, ''fé nas malukas''. Ela não é uma maluca qualquer, ela é uma maluca estudando MEDICINA! O que faz ela ser duplamente mais maluca que uma maluca louca em estado de loucura! Ou seja, ela é muito divertida de se acompanhar. Tipo, ela literal[spoiler]fantasia uma múmia, tenta comer um gato, esquenta um Hamster preso em um cubo de gelo em um micro-ondas e depois disso considera colocar o Hamster dentro do micro-ondas de novo só pra secar e explodir![/spoiler]E como eu pude esquecer! A Laverne foi parar no [spoiler] [b] [u] [i] FUTURO! [/i] [/u] [/b] [/spoiler] Infelizmente, o eu não tenho um personagem favorito em que a Laverne interage. Nenhum deles realmente me chamou muita atenção ou algo do tipo...para mim eles fazem o seu propósito, mas nenhum deles realmente é muito legal. No geral, um ótimo grupo de personagens! E isso é sem contar os diálogos! Tem vários personagens malucos e excêntricos que você vai encontrar na sua jornada durante esse jogo e cada um deles faz você rir de uma forma diferente.

[h1] Tópico 4: E a Jogabilidade? [/h1]
Bem, quando eu disse que o gênero desse jogo é ''Apontar e clicar'' eu não estava brincando. Tudo da jogabilidade martela isso na sua cara a cada segundo durante o jogo. Por eu estar acostumado com o gênero, para mim, foi muito fácil de entender os controles. Porém a jogabilidade do jogo pode ser difícil de compreender, porém, graças a mudança de como você acessa as ações, é mais fácil de se adaptar. Bem, vamos por partes o que eu quero dizer com isso. Nos jogos realmente antigos de ''Apontar e clicar'', você não poderia fazer o que quiser e como quiser, na na ni na não! Você teria que clicar em um outro botão e dai fazer o que você quer. Um exemplo disso, vamos dizer, que em um cenário hipotético, você tenha que apertar uma campainha de uma mansão. Em um jogo moderno do gênero, tudo que você faria iria ser simplesmente clicar na campainha e o jogo iria seguir o seu rumo. Mas, antigamente, na época dos meus país, não era assim! Você tinha que puxar a opção ''Use'', depois clicar na campainha e apenas AI você aperta de novo! Não é necessariamente complexo, mas é um trabalho a mais que se torna chato de executar toda vez. E, Day of the Tentacle Remastered não cometeu esse erro! Ao invés de ter uma parte da tela cheia de palavras e você tem que clicar nelas e depois clicar no item para conseguir fazer o que quiser, você pode apenas, clicar o botão direito do Mouse e escolher a opção que quer e PRONTO! É uma mão na roda que salva muito tempo! E isso sem contar os quebra-cabeças em si, que são bem criativos e divertidos de resolver. Não é nada TÃO complexo, tipo, se você só for ir de cenário em cenário e ir explorando cada cantinho você vai conseguir saber o que tem que fazer sem muito esforço. Eu, pessoalmente, acho que mesmo sendo um jogo simples, ainda iria ser bom ter um sistema de dicas para ajudar quem estiver com dificuldade em saber o que fazer. Um outro detalhe, é que ás vezes, a resposta do quebra-cabeça só pode ser resolvida com um item de uma outra linha do tempo, mas o jogo sempre deixa claro o que você precisa fazer e quais itens você precisa usar e quando. Contudo, não sei se isso é apenas minha mente já aceitando a lógica estranha desse tipo de jogo, ou se é realmente tão fácil de entender assim. Independente qual for a resposta, jogar esse jogo é uma diversão!

[h1] Considerações Finais [/h1]
★★★★★ (5/5) Recomendo para todos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198875316588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1699226270}
review:
Als ich damals mit 14 Jahren Maniac Mansion und ZakMcKracken auf dem Commodore 64 spielte, dachte ich nicht, dass es nochmal ein Adventure geben würde, das an die Kreativität und den Witz dieser Spiele ran kommt. Doch Day Of The Tentacle ist ein würdiger Nachfolger. Ein absolut tolles Point-And-Click-Spiel, das einen fesselt. Besonders klasse sind auch die deutschen Synchronsprecher.

Es wäre wirklich schön, wenn mal wieder so etwas von Lucas-Arts käme. Das waren noch richtig gute Spiele, in denen nicht nur darauf Wert gelegt wurde, die beste Grafik zu haben. Was nützt einem die beste Grafik, wenn das Spiel schlecht ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561199261855025', 'num_games_owned': 1338, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1699212084}
review:
Day of the Tentacle - remastered or not, it's great to have it back. There's always a risk with games like this that nostalgia can overload everything or that rose-tinted glasses don't work as well up close, but in this case, neither is the case here. It's every bit as well-crafted now as it was in 1993. I won't say that it'll ignite a new love for the genre if you don't already have it. Adventures games are what they are, and they're not for everyone, especially one that leans this far towards traditional puzzles instead of even as much story as other similiar games. Go into it expecting it to blow your mind or convert you and you'll probably be disappointed - though at the same time, hopefully amused and pleasantly brain-tickled.

PROS:
✓ Curvaceously colorful graphics
✓ Sprightly animations
✓ Fantastic comedic writing
✓ Memorable offbeat characters
✓ Creative era-spanning challenges
✓ Remastered eclectic music
✓ The ability to quickly switch between the remastered and original versions
✓ There’s a tentacle trying to take over the world, what more do you want?!

CONS:
- Some tough puzzles may stop you in your tracks
- Controls do not work well with a gamepad
- Maniac Mansion remained in its original version

author: {'steamid': '76561198007364080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1594569077}
review:
This remastered version of Day of the Tentacle does a great job on improving the graphics of this Lucasart adventure game. Compared to the original, the difference is really noticeable. The new interface is also good, though I do miss the old SCUMM system of command verbs.

Overall, a good title to revisit if you played the original; don't forget to find that easter egg that links to the prequel game to this. XD

review:
Just great. 

Some voice acting is not my taste but it doesn´t diminish the the game too much in my eyes. 

The new interface works, but sometimes it´s anoying to open a menu first, then switch Character. There might be a shortcut key, that I don´t know about, but thats it for mouse controlers, anyway.

The Music is often really great. My favourite is in the colonial timeline in the entrance hallway. The Music cousin Eds room in the future had me headshaking and the are many other nice musical moments as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027180015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1696146513}
review: Day of the Tentacle is rightly a classic and labor of love. For those who want to play Maniac Mansion and want to appreciate the similar game mapping and layout, inventory items/usage, and character-switching design (with many of the same characters), the game can be played on the computer in Ed's room (third floor, right room). Bonus: [spoiler] Unlike in Day of the Tentacle, the hamster can be microwaved in Maniac Mansion. [/spoiler] Overall, despite what a wild ride you end up going on, nothing ever felt too absurdist (perhaps because you start off the game trying to stop an evil purple tentacle by going back in time and end up getting stuck scattered in the past, present, and future thanks to a toilet time machine, so the idea of sending inventory items by flushing, going down the chimney like Santa, partaking in a human pet show, adding the right to a vacuum in every basement to the constitution, and much, much, more feel natural). 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198179566291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1700544936}
review: A certified classic. You really can't go past Day of the Tentacle for a nostalgia hit. With the signature Lucas Arts wit and ridiculous item combinations that of course make very little sense except in hindsight, this is classic adventure gaming at its best. To be fair, I have a real soft-spot for this style of game - and this game in particular. I enjoy it now as much as I did the first time around on DOS!

I guess as a kid I had more patience or maybe there was just less adventure games to play, but now I just got so frustrated I just played it with a guide and at that point I could've just watched a Let's Play instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037088421', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1694256488}
review:
[h1]If you want to save the world, you gotta push a few old ladies down the stairs.[/h1]
LucasArts adventure games hold a special place in my heart. 
I discovered their gaming catalog in the late 90s through Curse of Monkey Island. What made LucasArts so brilliant is their unique approach to adventure games. Colourful and whimisical art style, humor and puzzles that demands to think about how you solve them. The puzzles aren't unforgiven but they can be quite  hard some times and i find that's part of the charm. 

Considering dying isn't a part of lucasarts games it give you much freedom to explore, try and take part in funny and witty dialogue  with the characters in the game. Within the game options you can choose between remastered settings or if you  rather play it with the original 1996 settings. The LucasArts remasters of Day of the Tentacle, Full Throttle and  Grim Fandango is masterfully done because it's an improvement yet it feel exactly how i felt playing back in the day. This is what an remaster should be all about, improving graphical, sound and smaller quality of life changes but keep the aestetics and feel of the game because nostalgia do sell. 

Personally i'm an advocate of remastering old games to new system if and that is a big if, they do homage to the original game rather then doing a cash grab. I hope Tim Schafer gets to remaster more games from the LucasArts gaming catalogue. I would love to see remasters of Sam & Max, Outlaws, Curse of Monkey Island, The Dig and so on.
If you want to get into LucasArts, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a great place to start.

[b]Highly recommend.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006879847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1458859005}
review: "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" is a delightful journey back to the golden age of point-and-click adventures. The game's quirky humor, mind-bending puzzles, and memorable characters have been beautifully preserved, with updated artwork and animations that enhance the experience without sacrificing its original charm. The option to switch between classic and remastered graphics, along with the revamped user interface and streamlined inventory system, make solving puzzles and navigating the time-traveling plot a joy. The voice acting and reimagined soundtrack add depth to the game's already stellar storytelling. As a fan of the original, I'm pleased to say that this remastered edition captures the magic that made the game a classic in the first place, offering both nostalgia and a new way to experience the whimsical adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068458152', 'num_games_owned': 3594, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1693519938}
review:
The Lucas Arts Classic hand repixeled by  Tim Schaefer and Dave Grossman themselves. Full Audio remaster thanks to the Lucas Arts Archieve fund, lots of Bonus Drawings can be unlocked. Renewed controller compatible Interfaces modernizes the game. A reason to get this one.

Uhm... You prefer the old pixel art? No problem. There´s a retro button that switches back he the original 1993 Interface and pixels. Now stopreading this and buy it if you haven´t already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447470563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1690223411}
review:
A very well done remaster of the DOS original. The graphics are beautiful hires rendition of the VGA originals of the 90s. Everything else is also on par if not excelling the quality of the original, with a special mention going to the voice acting, crystal clear and as funny as ever.

For those who do not know the original and consider playing Tentacle for the first time, I can wholeheartedly recommend this version.

The story is not timeless, but the time travel element makes sure that it is not just obscure 90s in-jokes. The puzzle can be a challenge. I would not be judge you for using a guide. You will still get 2.5 hours of game time minimum and there is no reason not to explore all the dialog trees and wander around the environs before making for the main story puzzle locations. Going through the game blind it will take around 7 hours if actually go down to the level of combining everything with everything. 

The original Maniac Mansion - prequel to Tentacle from the 80s - is also in this remaster as it was in the original as a bonus, so in theory you get another 2 - 5 hours of gaming.

All around a very nice package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815610495', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1692473066}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de la puta historia. Lanzado en el año 1993, ahora su versión remasterizada nos permite una vez más volver a vivir la divertida aventura dentro de la mansión Edison. 

HISTORIA 
La narrativa nos trae a 3 peculiares personajes: Bernard (el nerd), Hoagie (el gordo rockero) y Laverne (adicta a la coca deshidratada). Bernard recibe un mensaje de su amigo Tentáculo Verde donde le cuenta que Tentáculo Púrpura se volvió malo y quiere conquistar el mundo. A causa de esto, el Dr. Fred Edison los encerró en la mansión y planea matarlos. Bernard, junto a sus 2 amigos, parte rumbo a la mansión para salvar a los tentáculos.  Al llegar, las cosas se retuercen porque Bernard deja libre al Tentáculo Púrpura y este se escapa con la intención de volver sumisos a los humanos y conquistar el mundo. El Dr. Edison manda a Bernard y a sus amigos al pasado para evitar que Púrpura se vuelva malo, pero se ve que en este juego todo sale mal porque la máquina del tiempo se rompe, provocando que Hoagie quede atrapado 200 años en el pasado, Bernard queda en el presente y Laverne viaja 200 años al futuro. 
De esta manera, nuestros personajes deben buscar la forma de volver al presente y salvar al mundo. 

GAMEPLAY
Como toda aventura gráfica, se trata de un point and click, es decir, dirigimos a los personajes y las acciones que deseamos que hagan con el mouse.  Vamos a dialogar, y mucho, para resolver los diversos puzzles que nos brinda el juego. Los personajes pueden hacer distintas acciones y transferirse objetos por la Cron - O - Letrina a través del tiempo, provocando que las acciones en el pasado tengan consecuencias en el futuro.  De esta forma, provoca que los puzzles sean muy ingeniosos y debamos estar atentos a cada detalles y pista de la mansión para resolver los mismos. 

APARTADO GRÁFICO Y BANDA SONORA
Usando el mismo motor gráfico del año 93, los sprites de los escenarios fueron todos renderizados en HD. Por lo tanto, las acciones y movimientos de los personajes son iguales al juego original pero en mejor definición, un regalo excelente <3. Por otro lado, la banda sonora es magnifica. Inspirada en los dibujos animados de los años 80 - 90s, le da un plus al juego para que cada línea cómica se complemente a la perfección. Definitivamente Day of the Tentacle es cine. 

CONCLUSIÓN 
Day of the Tentacle es un juego bastante corto pero muy entretenido. Sin dudas, esta en la cúspide de las aventuras gráficas gracias a su humor de caricaturas, sus personajes tan carismáticos y su alocada historia que enamora al instante. Un juego que recomiendo mucho si te gusta el género donde te vas a reír mucho. Si no jugaste a su versión original, te envidio sanamente, porque vas a descubrir una obra que no se consiguen en el mercado chino. 

Gracias por el espacio.

review: This is a blast from the past for me and even after all these years the puzzles are still challenging. I work in animation so to listen to how this game was made was like looking at a museum piece, it full of awesome animation and gaming history. The art style alone has influenced my own style and i cannot stress enough how great of a whack game this is. If your looking for a first click and point look no further this is maybe one of my top games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979953970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1691319106}
review:
When I was a teenager and started discovering the fantastic world of classic graphic adventures (in the late 90's, so after their glory years) I was always more of a Sierra fan than LucasArts, but Day of the Tentacle was, in my opinion, the culmination of all LucasArts had learned from their previous big 2D successes (alongside Full Throttle). It's a very well made game, sure of itself and masters all of the genre core mechanics.

This remaster is fantastic, it has that seemless transition from the original and enhanced graphics with a press of a button à lá The Secret of Mokey Island Remaster. Great stuff, always love when devs do that.

review: Still a classic after all these years and among the best of show from the golden age of Lucas Arts adventure era. The remastered graphics and retouches brings this classic to the modern audience and it doesn't disappoints. The humor of spot on, the plot is as crazy as ever, the controls work wonders and the gameplay is fun and amusing. Being from the old era it does suffer still from the pitfalls from old adventure games such as pixel hunting and leap of faith logic puzzles, not as bad as many out there but there will be moments. If you are nostalgic then yes this is among the games you can always go back to, if you are new its the best of the best of its genre of the era and worth your time for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989766649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1624374069}
review:
Of all the weird Lucasarts point-and-click games that came and went, Day of the Tentacle is one of those that really hit a sweet spot for me. It might not beat the campy jokey tropes of Monkey Island nor the unhinged insanity of Sam & Max yet it managed to place itself right in the middle of the pack with clever puzzles, an extremely pulpy plot, quirky characters cemented in stereotypes from the early 90s and one of my favorite villain of all time, the purple tentacle itself! 

The game takes place in a mansion of madness, actually the very same mansion that hosted the previous game, Maniac Mansion, and revolves around a previously friendly tentacle that by drinking some toxic waste grows tiny limbs and a maniacal flair to its previously rather chill persona. To stop the tentacular plan to conquer the world the heroes arrive at the scene and end up in 3 different timelines. They must now, through a series of weird interconnected paths, shape time and space to suit their and their comrades' needs in order to end the terror of the tentacle uprising..

The gameplay follows the standard formula, just wander around and interact with stuff while trying to figure out why the spoon can be assembled with the stuffed animal you found three acts before, and as always the puzzles can range from cleverly designed to outright mind boggling. In this game I think a neat balance between insane and clever has been reached that makes puzzling things out truly enjoyable. 

All in all Day of the Tentacle is a charming adventure game that has aged ever so slightly but the remaster truly brings it back from the dead. Of all the remastered Lucasarts this might be the best to begin with. It is tight, charming and demented in all the right ways..

author: {'steamid': '76561197963754875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1492700896}
review:
Day of the Tentacle was a classic back in its day and still holds up extremely well against its contemporaries of its time. Offering classic point-n-click gameplay, as you solve various puzzles across three timelines, the past, present and the future. Unlike many of its other contemporaries it isn't too obscure either, which was a pitfall of many of the older point-n-click adventure games from the same era.

The remastered version offers redrawn and detailed 2D graphics and a robust technical level.

Day of the Tentacle is a remastered classic from a bygone era, which delivers a comedic story that is still enjoyable to this day.

author: {'steamid': '76561199068948062', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1689556761}

Laverne is absolutely my favorite character. She just makes me giggle - the way she moves, her weirdness, ahh, I love her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198853297035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1689291126}
review: Day of the Tentacle es la secuela de la aventura gráfica Maniac Mansion. Nunca jugué a Maniac Mansion ni a la versión original de Day of the Tentacle, pero esta versión remasterizada me ha parecido maravillosa. El argumento se construye mediante tres narrativas diferentes (una por cada personaje protagonista) que se van desarrollando en paralelo. Los hechos discurren en el mismo edificio pero en tres épocas diferentes y esto es lo que provoca las relaciones entre los personajes. Es una aventura gráfica de corte clásico, relativamente extensa, muy divertida, con un diseño de personajes excepcional y un apartado artístico excelente. Comprendo que, aún después de tantos años, siga considerándose uno de los mejores juegos de este género.

review: Other than Loom, this is probably THE point and click adventure. Everything about DoTT is so endearing and lovable and silly. It uses a now-extinct 90's cartoon artstyle that is colorful and handcrafted. The writing is light, silly, dry and slapstick. If you like Sam & Max, you've definitely played this before. But for the one odd guy that hasn't... play it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198303490620', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1688241079}
review: This is a good game with a lot of charm.  Its age shows, though.  A lot of the puzzles are far too cryptic, and funnily enough the game doesn't do enough "hand-holding" in my opinion.  A lot of games have the opposite problem.  A proper hint system would've been a lot more satisfying, as it can get VERY boring searching for the specific thing you need to interact with in order to progress.  I'd still recommend it though, just be prepared to look up a walkthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062884834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1687458008}
review:
The remastered visuals improves on the cartoony feel of the game, yet feels just like the original. Every once and awhile I would turn on the original to remind myself, just to appreciate the enhancements. I've played this game before and it was nice to relive it. 
Not many of the 90s point-and-click have aged well, finding solutions to situations/puzzles can be a frustrating waste of time. Where this game really excels is the zany encounters with weird people in a wacky cartoon world. It was fun to relieve the game, and I got through it much quicker than the many years before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155602285', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1687717778}
review: First played this game in the mid-1990s and completed it without any hints or online guides, took me a while too.  Played through countless times since then, and even now almost 30 years later I'm still finding new things I hadn't noticed before.  What an absolute masterpiece of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211727760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1685876571}
review:
After playing this game to full completion, I can safely say that it was an interesting point-and-click adventure. You control three characters, in three separate timelines, which sounds great, but quite honestly, you'll probably be looking at an IGN walkthrough for both the normal game and achievements, rather than figure out the puzzles by yourself. The story had a lot of potential and was funny every now and again but ended up tripping on it's own shoes, becoming and experience you just want to end and pass on to another game. The following paragraphs contain two spoilers.

One big plus, i have to say is, during the game they reference a lot another game, Maniac Mansion (Which you can buy on steam but wait, there's more!) and the great part about that is that on the  3th floor, inside the room to your right, there's an old arcade game with a fully playable version of MANIAC MANSION, saving you like 5 bucks or so, pretty neat.

Probably the biggest plus of all is that, being an european see, you get to know quite a bit of the american history, and finally rewrite what's wrong with it, like having a flag with two flaming hot babes and a rad skull with machine guns. Also you get to s*it on washington, which is another plus.

I rate this game a 6/10, buy it on promotion or do it like me, go to HumbleBundle (Not sponsored but I wouldn't mind) and purchase a bundle with this, donate all to charity, non to the developers since they have f-you disney money now and be a better person. Namaste peeps.

review: As a big fan of graphic adventures, I can say that this is the best one I have ever played. The puzzles in this game are the best I have ever seen and the jokes are very good. In addition, the story, apart from being relatively short, is easy to understand and fun. Despite being a sequel, it is not necessary to have played “Maniac Mansion” to understand and enjoy this game. I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256246921', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1697319403}
review:
This game is a childhood favorite of mine. It's right up there with the likes of Sierra's King's Quest games and Freddy Fish. If I wasn't playing the harder more puzzling King's Quest games on my computer as a kid then I was playing Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle. I'm glad this game got remastered. The updated/remastered graphics makes the game more vibrant and colorful, and the comedic charm still holds up today. The only thing I have to complain about it that sometimes when a character is speaking the dialogue will either be skipped entirely or a character will be stuck on repeating a word for a few seconds but it didn't delay the game. I think my old laptop is to blame for that (even tho I have everything updated). 

If you dont mind a point and click adventure game that has no "bad endings' or game overs than this is the game for you. It has a lot of witty charm that carried over from it's predecessor and prequel, Maniac Mansion. And the voice actors in this game did a great job. This game is a solid A+, It's almost like playing a Saturday Morning cartoon with just a bit of adult humor sprinkled in.

review: A very cool remaster of the game, especially the fact that you can transition from the new enhanced graphics to the original pixel ones, whenever you want. First time playing through this game (when I was small), I remember that I lost myself, did not know what to do and just forgot about it. I do not judge myself for that even today, as most of the puzzles are absurd but also really funny and fun to solve. Either way, superb game, I highly recommend it for adventure game fans.

review:
Je ne peux pas être objectif, c'est limite LE jeu de mon enfance au point où je me souvenais de toutes les actions à faire (sauf une) pour le finir. 

C'est un très bon jeu pour moi avec un seul bémol : il a 30 ans.
Si des adolescents y jouent, il va falloir leur expliquer ce qu'est une "cassette vierge", un "magnétoscope" et comment les boutons fonctionnent ;) Ce coup de vieux que j'ai pris !

author: {'steamid': '76561198180412221', 'num_games_owned': 1455, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1684432142}
review:
[h1]Parlons de Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/h1]

Day of the Tentacle Remastered est un incontournable pour les fans de jeux Point & Click. Cette nouvelle version d'un classique des années 90 offre une expérience nostalgique et rafraîchissante, avec des graphismes améliorés et une ambiance remasterisée avec soin.

[list]
[*]Genre : Point & Click
[*]Durée de vie : 6 heures
[*]Temps pour le 100% : 8 heures
[/list]

[b]➤ Principe du jeu 🎮[/b]

Day of the Tentacle Remastered est un Point & Click qui propose une aventure captivante où le voyage dans le temps est au cœur du gameplay. Incarnez les personnages Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne dans leur quête pour sauver le monde d'un tentacule maléfique. Avec son humour intemporel et son gameplay ingénieux, ce portage remastérisé est une véritable réussite.

[b]➤ Remasterisation de qualité 🎨[/b]

La remasterisation de ce classique est impressionnante. Premièrement, pour les fans du jeu original, un bouton est disponible à n'importe quel moment du jeu pour passer de l'ancienne version à la version remasterisée et inversement.
Outre les graphismes redessinés avec soin, qui conservent le charme du jeu original, des ajustements de gameplay ont été apportés pour offrir une expérience encore plus fluide et agréable. Les améliorations visuelles ajoutent une nouvelle dimension à l'univers du jeu, rendant chaque scène encore plus vivante et détaillée. De plus, la nouvelle bande-son ajoute une ambiance unique au titre, accompagnant à merveille les aventures de nos héros.

[b]➤ Un classique intemporel 💫[/b]

Day of the Tentacle Remastered est un témoignage du génie de LucasArts à l'époque où ils nous offraient de formidables Point & Click. Avec son humour absurde et ses énigmes inventives, le jeu a su résister à l'épreuve du temps. Les doublages de voix exceptionnels ajoutent une couche supplémentaire à l'immersion, donnant vie aux personnages mémorables. C'est un véritable plaisir à découvrir pour les nouveaux venus.

[b]➤ Le 100% 🏆[/b]

Atteindre le 100% dans Day of the Tentacle Remastered est un véritable défi qui ravira les hunter chevronnés. Cependant, il est important de noter que certains succès sont manquables assez facilement, ce qui peut parfois être source de frustration. Pour éviter de passer à côté de ces succès, je vous recommande vivement de consulter le guide sans spoil suivant :
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1776279633
En explorant attentivement chaque recoin du jeu, en cherchant méticuleusement les easter eggs dissimulés, j'ai personnellement pris un vrai plaisir à compléter le jeu a 100%

[b]➤ Conclusion / Mon avis 🌟[/b]

Day of the Tentacle Remastered est un véritable joyau pour les amateurs de jeux Point & Click. Son mélange d'humour, de puzzles intelligents et de personnages mémorables en fait une expérience inoubliable. Que vous ayez déjà joué à la version originale ou que vous découvriez cette aventure pour la première fois, vous serez enchanté par cette version. Un incontournable pour les collectionneurs de jeux classiques.

[quote]Vous avez aimé cette évaluation? Retrouvez notre curateur pour plus d'avis ! - [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44157580/]Woof & Play[/url][/quote]

review:
Assieme a Full Throttle Remastered è una modernizzazione seria, fatta con cura e fedele all'originale. Si vede che alla Double Fine sotto la guida di Tim Schafer ci tengono ai giochi.
A parte un paio di enigmi laterali e alcune iterazioni con gli oggetti chiare nella logica, ma non nei comandi, è un gioco ancora oggi molto piacevole da giocare. Forse rispetto a quando ero piccolo, mi son goduto molto di pìù certe battute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004019081', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1683368929}
review:
Ze začátku jsem byl skeptický, protože hra je i na rok 1993 docela kryptická. Šílenosti typu použít křečka na krabici s ledem, abyste ho mohli vyzvednout v budoucnosti a použít na mikrovlnku, abyste ho mohli rozmrazit, pak k jeho usušení použít svetr, který musíte také usušit tím, že ho v minulosti hodíte do sušičky a naházíte do ní tunu čtvrťáků, abyste jej mohli o 400 let později ze sušičky vytáhnout? WTF?!
Ale každopádně hra je zábavná a velmi vtipná a výtvarný styl je, narozdíl od Monkey Islandů Special Edition, výborný, zachovává styl originálu, akorát vypadá mnohem lépe.
Takhle se mají dělat remastery, skvělá práce!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022973862', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1683317030}
review: The Remaster version of Day of the Tentacle is a true success! As a fan of the original game, I was delighted to see that the developers managed to recreate the gaming experience while adding modern graphics and sound improvements. The characters are just as funny and endearing, the humor is still great, and the puzzles are still challenging. I loved revisiting the wacky universe of this cult game, and it brought back many pleasant memories. If you enjoyed the original version, or if you're just a fan of classic adventure games, I highly recommend checking out this Remaster version of Day of the Tentacle!
