author: {'steamid': '76561198267841454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1700617156}
review:
Als Fan klassischer Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiele war ich begeistert, als Day of the Tentacle Remastered angekündigt wurde. Und ich muss sagen, dieses Spiel hat meine Erwartungen mehr als übertroffen.

In erster Linie sind die überarbeitete Grafik und der Sound absolut umwerfend. Das aktualisierte Artwork ist dem ursprünglichen Design treu, aber mit zusätzlichen Details und Tiefe, die das Spiel wirklich zum Leben erwecken. Die Sprachausgabe ist ebenfalls erstklassig, wobei die Originalbesetzung ihre Rollen wiederholt und urkomische und unvergessliche Dialoge liefert .

In Bezug auf das Gameplay behält Day of the Tentacle Remastered all den Humor und das Lösen von Rätseln bei, die das Originalspiel zu einem Klassiker gemacht haben. Die Zeitreise-Mechaniken sind brillant ausgeführt und ermöglichen es den Spielern, Rätsel zu lösen, indem sie Gegenstände durch verschiedene Epochen hin und her schicken. Die Charaktere sind alle einzigartig und einprägsam, jeder mit seinen eigenen Macken und Persönlichkeiten, mit denen es Spaß macht, mit ihnen zu interagieren.

Ein weiterer großartiger Aspekt dieses Spiels ist die Einbeziehung von Entwicklerkommentaren, die faszinierende Einblicke in die Entstehung des Spiels und die Herausforderungen bieten, denen sich das Team bei der Erstellung gegenübersah. Es ist eine seltene und wertvolle Ergänzung, die einem bereits großartigen Spiel noch mehr Tiefe verleiht.

Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle Remastered eine erstaunliche Hommage an eines der größten Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiele aller Zeiten. Mit aktualisierter Grafik, Sound und Entwicklerkommentaren ist es ein Muss für Fans des Originalspiels und Neueinsteiger gleichermaßen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1681631911}
review:
An opportunity to replay (or play) the 2nd best Pn'C from LucasArt, with a visual quality worthy of today.

Old annoyances are still present, like some inscrutable solutions (an infamous trademark of the brand,) a couple of gross moments, or backtracking abuse with a lack of fast walk. The latter should have been added; it wouldn't affect the game content.

Great story, generally good cartoon humour, great sound and voicing, It's an enjoyable adventure.
This version doesn't lessen the old memories, and is even more recommended to newcomers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255461651', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1681078947}
review: Ah, it's good to revisit a classic from  my childhood. Personally I'm not a fan of the remastered aesthetics, so I'm flad DFP went with the option to switch between the classic look and the remastered one. One thing I'm not a fan of though is the hiding of some achievements, I tend to be a bit of a completionist myself so making some non-obvious achievements hidden meant I had to go back and forth and replay the game in order to get some of them that I got locked out of. Regardless, this is a gem I recommend all to play. You will not regret spending money and time into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057680429', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1680458102}
review:
If you're thinking of playing this you probably already know what you're getting yourself into. Yes, there are plenty of obscure puzzles and it's nice to have a walk-through ready when you get stuck.
 
You shouldn't feel too ashamed for looking up solutions to puzzles since this game was very much made in a time where people would spend weeks trying to figure it out (and they would be happy to do so). I personally wouldn't be happy for it to take up that kind of time from my life when the answer is easy to find online.
It was worth playing through nonetheless for the charm of the setting and characters, interesting developer commentary and cool time-travel shenanigans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976202334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1680284607}
review:
DotT Remastered ist einfach klasse. Erstmal freue ich mich, dass man überhaupt die ganzen alten Games wieder zocken kann und DotT hat mich schon echt oft und lange in meiner Jugend begleitet.
Ich kann mich nicht erinnern, dass es damals eine Tonspur gab. Ich hab es immer nur mit Texten zum lesen gehabt. Die Stimmen sind etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber immer noch alle Male besser, als gar kein Ton. 
Die Grafik wurde nochmal aufgepeppt und die Farben sind noch satter. Das Gameplay wurde ebenfalls angepasst so dass man alle mit der Maus "on-Point" bedienen kann und nicht immer runter zum Befehlsmenü rüber wischen muss. 
Die Musik fetzt wie eh und jeh und die Witze und Dialoge sind einfach immer noch zum weg schmeißen. 
Auch die Entwicklerkommentare fand ich wirklich interessant und witzig.
Einziges Manko waren Grafikfehler, die ich öfters mal hatte, wenn ich die Figur bewegt habe und in einen anderen Abschnitt gegangen bin und die Kamera mit geschwenkt hat, dass ich ganz merkwürdige Grafiken aus ganz anderen Bereichen im Bild hatte. Das war unschön und hat schon was genervt. Das Game war aber trotzdem noch spielbar. 
Die Errungenschaften sind tatsächlich was schwer zu bekommen, da man auf manche Sachen echt nicht kommt, es sei denn, man spielt das Game zum ersten Mal und bekommt die ein oder andere Errungenschaft, weil man eh am rumprobieren ist. Aber bitte...wer drückt den bitte mit Bernhard 100 mal auf die Klingel im Foyer?!

review: Excelente juego. Es antiguo pero sigue estando muy bueno de jugar. Es un viejo clásico de Lucas Arts. Es la continuación del viejo Maniac Mansion. Sigue, al igual que su antecesor, siendo una aventura gráfica de tipo click and point.Muy graciosas las animaciones, los personajes, los diálogos y los escenarios. Una historia muy alocada y entretenida de jugar. Realmente es un juego que vale la pena tenerlo y revivirlo jugándolo una vez mas de tanto en tanto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993265691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1681517785}
review: Great remastering of one a classic point-and-click adventure game. The developer commentary is a great touch as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123997094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1696180904}
review: Day of the Tentacle hat nach über 30 Jahren für mich nichts von seinem Zauber, Witz und Unterhaltungswert verloren.Mittlerweile haben es meine eigenen Kids durchgespielt und dank des Grafik- und Steuerungsupgrades gar nicht als Spiel der 90er empfunden. Auch die  komplette Sprachausgabe ist (noch immer) Klasse. Die (alte) deutsche Syncho halte ich noch immer für gelungen, im Englischen macht's aber auch viel Spass. Besonders toll finde ich den zuschaltbaren (englischen) Audiokommentar der Entwickler,  der Einblicke in die Entstehungsgeschichte des Originals und des Remasters gibt.Die versteckten 58 Belohnungen haben meinen Spielerehrgeiz auch noch mehr angeheizt. Alles in Allem eine tolle Umsetzung des Klasikers. Ich wünsche mir mehr davon, gerade was Lucasgames angeht! Indy 3 und 4 wären doch mal was, oder die Special-Editions von Monkey Island auch in der deutschen Talkie-Version...Gern gespielt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117087936', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1678261682}
review: Other than Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis (Can we please get a remaster of that, please), this is the greatest Lucas Arts adventure of all time. Yes I could include the Monkey Island games, but they were playing on the tropes from games like this. And no, please don't ask me about Loom, wait, wrong game.  Anyways, this game is amazing and always remember it always seems to rain right after you wash your car. It's sad the impatience most modern young gamers have for a beautiful project like this, but what are you gonna do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043550750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 545, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1678637781}
review:
I remember playing the original back in the 90s.
The remaster is excellent and it's so awesome to play it with enhanced graphics!

The puzzles are still nonsensical as ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201646755', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1678590469}
review: There is no doubt that Day of the Tentacle and Maniac Mansion paved the way for both adventure games and point and click adventures alike. However, I've not until now played either of those games, so I can look at Day of the Tentacles Remastered with a modern lens instead of with rose-tinted glasses. As someone who really does enjoy both point and click and adventure games, there's quite a few things I liked about Day of the Tentacle, like its charming three heroes and the personality both they and the game's art style just ooze. Everything else kind of blows though. The music is pretty middling, the main villain's kind of boring, the puzzles rife with adventure game logic, and the overarching story is just awful. If you have nostalgia for Day of the Tentacle I'm sure this is a safe purchase, but otherwise I cannot recommend this game to new prospective fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960291325', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 2320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2053, 'last_played': 1678634424}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038293797', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 128, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1711986592}
review:
Now, if you're a fan of the genre, then you're probably already familiar with this game. But if you're not, then let me tell you, this game is an absolute gem.

First off, let's talk about the humor. Day of the Tentacle is hilarious. The writing is clever and witty, and the characters are all memorable and unique. It's the kind of game that will have you laughing out loud at every turn.

But it's not just the humor that makes this game great. The puzzles are challenging but never frustrating, and the game is full of creative and interesting mechanics. And the art style is timeless. Even though the game came out in 1993, the graphics still hold up today. The animations are smooth and the colors are vibrant, and the game has a charming cartoonish aesthetic that is just as appealing today as it was back then.

But what really sets Day of the Tentacle apart from other point-and-click adventure games is the time-travel mechanic. The game takes place over three different time periods, and you have to manipulate objects and characters in the past in order to affect the future. It's a brilliant mechanic that adds a whole new layer of complexity and depth to the game.

In conclusion, Day of the Tentacle is an absolute classic that every fan of the point-and-click adventure genre should play. The humor is top-notch, the puzzles are challenging but never frustrating, and the time-travel mechanic is a stroke of genius. And even though the game is almost 30 years old, it's still just as enjoyable and charming today as it was back then. So go ahead and give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

review:
This is my first actual point-and-click game. I had a really great time-- no pixel hunting and the solutions were silly but 90% of the time made sense :)
It's humorous, clean fun with very charming music. Allowing the character to talk about what they see in the environment makes the world feel solid and memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181861549', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1675533185}
review:
Oh boy... I feel like I might make some people mad here--if I'm not mistaken, this is a bit of a cult classic? Fair enough, I can see the appeal. It's certainly got a lot of... [i] personality... [/i]  

I tried. I really tried. But suddenly, after several hours, I just couldn't take it anymore. The obnoxious, braindead characters. The flat, bland artstyle. The irreverent, frequently unfunny humor. Hoagie [i] burping [/i] all the dang time. It's just... UGH. I kept telling myself, "I'm invested in the items, they were hard to get and I want to see what ridiculous things they get used for," but after a while they just weren't worth all of the everything else that is this game. It is, after all, a Point & Click that falls headfirst into the classic pitfalls of the genre: puzzles with solutions so bizarre and obscure that more often than not, you find yourself stuck, aimlessly trying anything on everything without any real hope of making progress. Honestly, I'm used to that with Point & Clicks, and am usually willing to put up with it for some element or another--the story, the characters, the world--[i] something. [/i] But not here. There's nothing for me here. It's far from a terrible game, but I just... I just [i] can't, [/i] man.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1675267317}
review:
pros

+ good-looking, cartoony, and colorful hand-drawn background artwork
+ a funny and cartoony story. Playing this game feels like watching a Looney Toons episode.
+ well made cartoony cut scenes
+ a diverse, wacky, quirky, humorous, and colorful cast of characters 
+ playable three main characters. you can easily switch and exchange items with them.
+ easy to use point and click interface
+ good character animations
+ decent voice acting
+ A good soundtrack perfectly fits the game's whimsical style.
+ there is auto save

cons

- there are plenty of obtuse and unintuitive puzzles with nonsensical solutions.
- there is no hint system for obscure puzzles with nonsensical solutions; therefore, generally, you don't know what to do. a hint system would be really helpful.
- the game has crashed a few times.
- characters' slow walking speed
- maybe too childish and juvenile for adult gamers

Despite the fact that I mostly dislike puzzles, I enjoyed this game's amusing story and characters. After playing this, I can understand why this game is considered a cult classic. It was also a well-made remaster of a cult classic adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039647286', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1675199881}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550311', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1674881863}
review:
A pinnacle of Point-and-Click.  Not just a fun game, but a piece of history.  I remember when the game came out and my computer wouldn't run it, so disappointed!  (Cue Kevin Sorbo)  Commercials were everywhere, and even the evening news reported on how it was ushering in a new era of computing games.

Remastered has better everything.  Graphics, quality of life - while maintaining everything about the origina; release.  It was so well done, I thought I was playing the original for awhile.  But that was the nostalgia effect, and the sleek new animations became apparent soon enough.

Unfortunately, I had several crashes, either going into or coming out of cutscenes.  The SCUMMvm version is still much more stable on modern computers.  Despite this one drawback, I would definitely recommend this game at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175275669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1675031546}
review: This is my all time favorite game, i've played it a million times and i always enjoy playing it again some time later. The story is just the best story of all videogames ever, the gameplay is unique, the voice acting is perfect (laverne's voice actor deserves an oscar), the graphics are eye candy and the music well fitting. This HD remaster makes it even better. I just miss the part where for the anti copy protection in the old days you needed to look at a plan for the super battery and adjust it ingame and you cant do it in the remaster, it was fitting to the story. If you never played this game this will be the best $4 you ever spent in your life!

author: {'steamid': '76561199085919414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1674846989}
review: Viejo gamer allert:Hacia 20 años que no lo jugaba, lo compre porque es un "remaster" y la verdad que esta muy bien, mantiene todo intacto y el nuevo sistema de inventario y opciones de interaccion es muy comodo. Todo el mundo deberia jugarlo. Gran acierto y no soy de los que le guste las "remakes" pero esta esta exelentemente cuidada y se nota. PD: tiene cromos y logros. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198396565187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1674759980}
review:
De chica me acobardé de jugar al Day of the tentacle porque no podía ganar el Maniac Mansion. Por suerte me lo recomendaron muchísimo por eso le dí una oportunidad! 
Es un gran juego, se disfrutan todos los comentarios y las animaciones que los diferencian a los tres amigos, que son los tres muy cómicos y queribles. Además los logros son disparatados como algunas de las resoluciones. Sin duda una aventura gráfica imperdible y que no envejeció!

author: {'steamid': '76561198246750072', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1673689028}
review:
Juegazo clásico, una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de la historia. Llena de humor y absurdos, se me hizo muy amena. Algo difícil, necesité ayuda al final para un par de puzles.

Pros:
- El lavado de cara de los gráficos le sienta bastante bien, permitiendo volver en cualquier momento a la interfaz original.
- El sentido del humor es muy característico.
- Los tres periodos temporales, maravillosos.

Contra:
- Sigo siendo más fan del sistema de verbos original que de las ruletas que se están utilizando en las remasterizaciones de SCUMM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015728380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 889, 'last_played': 1666387183}
review:
Très bon jeu pour qui aime les point&click humoristique avec un humour un poil trop décalé pour moi.
L'ambiance est bonne et les énigmes intéressante et pas trop tirées par les cheveux.
Malheureusement, je pense qu'il faut avoir un minimum une culture de l'histoire américaine pour s'en sortir car le jeu tourne clairement autour de cet univers. Personnellement je n'ai pas accroché ce point central de l'histoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809158367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1672250786}
review: One of my favorite games of all time, and the Adventure game I compare all others against.  This is an all-time classic of the genre.  Hilariously funny, gorgeous animation, cool story, and difficult (but fair) puzzles.  This game will stay with you for a long time.  Go out of your way to play this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116403301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1672008437}
review:
Fantastic remaster. I was afraid it might not feel like the original, but nope, same great game with improved graphics.
You need to have very very very basic knowledge of American Revolution history, and science for Hoagie's part. Very very basic. And at least a very very very basic sense of humour. This game has some of the most ingenious puzzles in adventure game history. I was also afraid I would miss SCUMM, but nope, I got used to the new control system really quickly. Can't recommend it enough (especially for anyone who enjoyed it 28 years ago).

author: {'steamid': '76561198053940839', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 730, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1670103365}
review: Day of the Tentacle ist und bleibt eines der besten Adventures aller Zeiten. Das gilt für das Original genauso wie für diese traumhafte Neuauflage. Die Story rund um Zeitreisen und machtbesessene Tentakel ist herrlich verrückt und die Dialoge versprühen immer noch den typischen Humor. Wer hier nicht zumindest ein bisschen schmunzeln muss, ist innerlich tot. Vor allem aber muss man sich immer und immer wieder vor den Designern verneigen, weil sie es geschafft haben, selbst für die beklopptesten Rätsel erschreckend logische Lösungswege zu präsentieren. Diese Erkenntnis ist fast sogar ein bisschen gruselig, wenn man realisiert, dass all der Blödsinn, den man mit Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne in Zukunft, Vergangenheit und Gegenwart anstellen muss, tatsächlich jedes Mal Sinn ergibt. Der Grafik und auch der Steuerung hat man einen neuen, modernen Anstrich verpasst. Möchte man auf die klassischen Verben und das Bildchen-Inventar im unteren Drittel verzichten und den verrückten Knobeltrip lieber im Vollbild erleben, kann man auf eine alternative Steuerungsmethode zurückgreifen. Dabei bekommt man eine kontextsensitive Auswahl an kleinen Piktogrammen rund um den Cursor, sobald man sie an entsprechenden Objekten per Knopfdruck öffnet. Das Inventar ist dabei auf einem separaten Bildschirm untergebracht. Man hat beim Remaster eine exzellente Arbeit geleistet und den Klassiker an genau den richtigen Stellen modernisiert und sogar noch aufgewertet. Das Meisterwerk von damals hat definitiv nichts von seinem unvergleichlichen Charme verloren. Die grandiosen Rätsel, die schrulligen Charakteren und die herrlichen Dialoge suchen absolut ihresgleichen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114298490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1671915457}

review:
Muy bueno si te gusta el género. Tuve que usar una guía en un punto, pero en general los puzles fueron razonables y muchas resoluciones fueron divertidas. Aunque la versión remaster está muy bien, se puede jugar la versión original apretando F1. 
Es una secuela pero no se necesita jugar al anterior.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096710908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1671487090}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered ist ein Point and Click mit viel Charme.

Die Handlung ist simpel und die Mimik der Charaktere ist häufig überspitzt. Ziemlich cool ist, dass durch den Zeitreise-Aspekt die kleine Spielwelt maximal ausgeschöpft wird. Alle Objekte liegen dicht zusammen, sodass Laufwege minimal sind.

Die Rätsel sind fair und gut durchdacht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000401434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1671212321}
review:
[b]Vielen Vielen Dank an Double Fine für das Remastern dieses epischen Meisterwerks der Point& Klick Ära![/b]

Nachdem sie schon Full Throttle von Lucas Arts wiederbelebt haben jetzt DoT!

Schönes Grafik-update [i](wobei man staunt, wie OK das früher einem erschien)[/i] und das Beste ... deutsche Sprachausgabe! Dafür gibt es richtig Punkte bei mir!

[b]Alles in Allem:[/b]

absolut schräges Point & Klick Advanture der alten Schule mit einer skurrilen Story, die drei "Helden" auf die Reise schickt um die Welt vor einem Lila Tentakel zu retten.   
Ganz in der klassiker Manie wie Sam & Max & Monkey Island gehalten, mit schrägen Dialogen und "super logischen" Kombinationen, arbeitet man sich hier über die drei Zeitebenen Vergangenheit, Gegenwart und Zukunft durch um sich die jeweilige Realität so zurecht zu biegen, wie man es eben braucht. 

[spoiler] Ein Trockner brauchte damals so um 90 min für ein Waschladung, wenn das Gerät 200 Jahre lang läuft (was den Absolut-Galaktischen-Hersteller-Rekord entspräche und man für eine Nutzung 0,50$ einschmeißen muss, dann heißt das, dass 200 Jahre = 105.120.000 min /90 = 1.168.000 Trockenprogramme   ergäben. Und das wiederum mit 0,50$ multipliziert bedeute, dass man aus dem Süßigkeitenautomaten 584.000$ rausgeholt haben müsste ... weiß nicht, klingt jetzt nicht soooo relaistisch [/spoiler]

[b]Resumé:[/b]

☆☆☆☆☆ (5/5)

Absolute Kaufempfehlung, nicht nur für Nostalgiker!

Ich wünscht Sam & Max - Hit The Road gäbe es noch eine Remasterte Version und von The Legend of Kyrandia ... epische Games!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048754893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1669330794}
review:
I played Maniac Mansion in the 80`s and it`s one of my first video game memories. That`s not to say that it was my first video game, far from it but it`s definitely one of the first actually memorable ones. Years later when I actually got  aPC I played this gem in it`s original glory and also have very fond memories of it.

So where am I going with all this nostalgia shit? I mean to say that I definitely recommend this game to people who have played LucasArts games in the past and enjoyed them, but not necessarily to younger people or modern gamers that have no nostalgia for them.

Don`t get me wrong, this is a fantastic remake. The redone graohics look great, it sounds great as well, it basically looks and sounds like you remember it looked and sounded like not how it actually looked, which is a great feat by itself. The cherry on top of it is that it also comes with a commentary tracks by the original creators of the game and a shit load of concept art that they pulled out of their boxes that have never seen before.

Great right? Yeah but with all the cool shit there also comes all the bad shit. The game itself feels incredibly dated and all the annoying things like illogical puzzle solutions, missing stuff because you can`t tell background apart from interactible items and especially the dated humor and pop culture references are there too and they are here to stay.

That being said, even though my humor evolved, the game still got chuckles out of me and I think there`s even people alive today now who find the game hilarious. If you`re new to 90s point and click adventures, grab a guide and play the game for the story. The gameplay is shallow and frustrating anyways and you play those games for their off beat humor and to see where the story and its characters go anyways.
It basically a visual novel type game of a bygone era and it`s one of the best of its time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977904226', 'num_games_owned': 1151, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1668383873}
review:
[h1]A day of point n' click to remember[/h1]
I grew up playing classic Lucasarts adventure games. The first of them I touched, in fact, happened to be Maniac Mansion on NES, which I was too young to know better about and beat. Fast-forward to the recent times and Day of the Tentacle was the reputed classic I have never touched before. What's the excuse for a fan of such games to not engage it, especially when it came out remastered?

Three friends are tasked to stop Purple Tentacle from taking on the world. Thanks to Dr. Fred, they get split up between the past, present and future in a time-traveling mishap and have to work together achieve their goal of saving the world. The strong point for me is that this game manages to make all events happen in a single house, with time differences adding to the freshness and variety throughout the gameplay. At least it's easier for me who got a bit burnt out on exploring places in adventure games, occasionally.

Puzzle solving applies a less common method of transfering objects between playable characters by using the, well, time toilet. Such liberty allows for the player to think up possible ways to a solution outside the box, courtesy of Lucasarts' adventure game trademark. What bothers me about the puzzle aspect is that trying stuff around has me find myself solving problems before I even knew what the obstacles really were, more than often.

In its remastered format, Day of the Tentacle sets an excellent example why it became a point n click adventure to follow for the future generations. With a colorful cast (besides the cringey voice acting of Laverne), unorthodox puzzle solving and persistent comedy value to go by, I am satisfied having it finally ticked off my bucket list. Fans of the genre should do themselves a favor to add it on their list, as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023335443', 'num_games_owned': 7936, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1668526797}
review:
十分推荐这个游戏，重制版继承而来的不仅有原来的幽默搞笑风格，而且还有那个时期冒险解谜游戏那种纯是为了娱乐而设计并没有严格目的的游戏内容。
当代的游戏和玩家是相互促成的，玩家只想直截了当玩游戏的关键内容，对没有实质意义的东西兴趣不大，所以冒险游戏在设计时往往也只在必要的地方下笔墨，不把资源浪费在（绝大多数）玩家根本没兴趣的地方，比如和剧情无关的场景互动内容很少、几乎没有无关的道具、围绕着剧情关键拓展出的对话等等。但是这个游戏就不是这样，太多可以探究探索的场景和物品，很多稀奇古怪、相互作用的道具，大量的仅仅是丰满人物的对话，时常能让人莞尔、欢乐甚至是惊叹和狂笑。
比如游戏中涂红一棵树让华盛顿去施展落樱神斧，这个涮得笑死我了；想给电池充电，让富兰克林去把电池挂风筝上引电，不下雨怎么办？去刷车啊，一刷车就必然下雨；试图用微波炉烤，用厕所冲仓鼠，在游戏中的游戏里真的把仓鼠扔进微波炉了；给华盛顿自动假牙让杰佛逊以为他感冒了....
总之是笑点太多了，值得一玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561198155533431', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1669479251}
review:
Classic LucasArts point-and-click and a pretty decent remaster here to boot. Visuals retain the same cartoony style, where everything has that fluid cartoon physics, and characters wouldn't look too out-of-place in something like Looney Tunes. Aside from some very rare and minor visual bugs, like one where Weird Ed's forehead has purple pixels over it, the graphics are pretty much spot-on in the remaster. The remastered soundtrack is also really well-made too, and faithful to the original tracks.

In terms of new players coming into the game who don't have any nostalgia, I'd say the game is well worth it. Backtracking is never really a huge problem as there aren't many places to go to and there's a lot of quality-of-life features, such as the way giving items to the other playable characters is automated. I was stumped on quite a few puzzles, but when looking up the solutions I never thought it was absurd or seemed like moon-logic, it all made sense and it seemed like I was simply overlooking something. Quite possibly some of the most well-designed puzzles of the earlier LucasArts point-and-clicks, honestly.

One flaw of the game, that wasn't even really a flaw at the time but is really showing in the modern day, is how poor the voice acting is. It's mediocre at best honestly. For its time, just having voice acting at all was on a whole new level. And having them be like actual voice actors too, instead of just LucasArts employees? It was something else. It was LucasArts' first game with voice acting, and one of the first video games with full voice acting overall. But yeah it hasn't aged all too well if I'm being honest. Some lines feel really under-delivered, some seem like they've been improvised but without any real context of the in-game situation, and some voices really just don't fit the characters.

Overall a great point-and-click remaster, and the original game has held up well in most aspects. Buy when you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302208299', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1669196193}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is considered a classic Point & Click Adventure game, originally released in 1993.  It a sequel to the game 'Manic Mansion', another classic.  I did not play either of these games when they were originally released, only the new remastered edition.  If you want to play both the games you only need to buy this 1 game as there is an in-game version of Manic Mansion on a computer inside one of the rooms.  

Since I never played the original release I can't comment how the remaster compares with it, but I can judge how well it performs on newer systems.  I have a newer laptop with a 4K screen and this worked perfectly.  I didn't have to make any adjustments to scale it or anything.  It opened and ran perfectly.  The graphics , though clearly still very much in line with the original have been updated and cleaned up to make the graphics cleaner and more modern.  They now look very much like a 90's animated cartoon.  

In addition to the graphics update the user interface was updated as well.  It's my understanding that the original utilized the classic Lucas Arts style with action verbs selectable on the screen and inventory items listed that you could interact with.  The new interface is instead a wheel type menu activated by right clicking on hotspots and inventory items.  While I found the original style cumbersome, I find this a moderate improvement.  I think there could have been additional work to combine actions like the open and close button into single action buttons, but overall I found this an improvement to Lucas Arts original system.  It was highly innovative when moving from text-parsers to true point-and-click games, but doesn't age well.  This remastered UI is a reasonable replacement.

As far as the game itself goes, its moderately entertaining.  It has a somewhat goofy sense of humor which makes it fun to play and a decently written story that keeps you engaged.  The puzzles in the game are a little more out there featuring several difficult 'moon logic' puzzles which become more difficult by having to switch between 3 characters who exchange inventory items.  If you don't mind having occasional moments where you will be randomly trying every inventory item on every available hotspot and then repeating with 2 additional characters each in a different setting, this won't be a problem.  The game isn't overly difficult, but it does take some time due to the walking back and forth from locations and waiting for dialogues and animation sequences.  If you've never played the game before I'd estimate it takes about 8-10 hours to complete.  If you've played it before you may be able to play through a little quicker.

If you're looking to play classic P&C Adventures, definitely give this a try, it remains an entertaining play the delivers some laughs and won't be over too quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1665432315}
review:
This is the remastered version of [b]"Maniac Mansion 2"[/b], which itself is the sequel of [b]"Maniac Mansion"[/b] from 1987, a game that is almost reaching its vintage age. For those who didn't know or too young to know, these are made by the same guys who later made the legendary [b]"Monkey Island"[/b].

Maniac Mansion is included in this remastered version as well and you can find and play it on a PC inside the game so you won't miss out anything if you didn't played the 1st game before.

And since both Maniac Mansion 1 & 2 are present in this remaster, i might as well review them both.

[h1]Maniac Mansion[/h1]
This game is one of the earliest genius design game from 1987 that introduced a real time exploring simulation that is very very rare back then...

To put it short for the newer gamer generation to understand, it is very similar to the not long ago viral [b]"Hello Neighbor"[/b] game, merged with the good old school [b]"Simon the Sorcerer"[/b] point and click layout in game UI wise...

It has multiple play-able characters, multiple endings and of course, choice matters that defines the route and branches in the game. It's a short game in overall with tons of solving methods so you can play the game over and over again with different combinations and ways to reach the ending, each filled with their own old school humor and each play through can be very different. So the replay-ability is very high and will probably take more time than the actual "Day of the Tentacle" itself if you went all out for a full completion testing out all possibilities... 

[h1]Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/h1]
The remaster is true to the original, but with all the artwork remade in HD. The cartoon-ish humor and all that really bring out a lot of laughter and childhood memories. Puzzle is still fun after all these years, and gives a lot of the "oooh" moment when they finally make sense... It can still be considered a masterpiece even when compared with recent point and click games. 

So, if you are a point and click adventure game lover, or if you played Monkey Island or Simon the Sorcerer before and loved them, you will surely love both Maniac Mansion in this remastered version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120092305', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1644525909}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103732873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1665393522}
review:
This is a great game. I played parts of the game when I was young and remembered that the game had some super original puzzles in it. And having played it through now, I must say that the remastered edition is absolutely great. The graphic looks very good, the voices particularly of purple tentacle are great, and quite a number of puzzles are truly brilliant, some of them also hard. (Typically solutions to puzzles are easy if you think of them ;-))

Some people said in their negative reviews, this game only has ratings as high as this out of pure nostalgia, but Day of the Tentacle is a great game on its own. The controls have been modernized and are state of the art, so you don't have the problem that you have with some old games that you have to adjust to controls that seem out of time.

Some people claimed the puzzles are illogical, which is definitely not the case. You might not think of all solutions to the puzzles (in which case just look them up in a walkthrough), but seeing the solution, you should also recognize the logic behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093531790', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1660533412}

author: {'steamid': '76561198204888712', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1664735722}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered es una versión actualizada del clásico juego de aventuras lanzado originalmente en 1993. Desarrollado por LucasArts, esta versión remasterizada presenta gráficos y sonidos mejorados, junto con otras características adicionales, como comentarios de desarrolladores y una interfaz mejorada.

La jugabilidad de Day of the Tentacle sigue siendo tan divertida y desafiante como lo era en el juego original. Los jugadores controlan a tres personajes diferentes mientras exploran el mundo del juego, resuelven acertijos y tratan de salvar el mundo de una amenaza tentacular. La mecánica de los acertijos es lógica y desafiante, lo que significa que los jugadores deben usar su ingenio y creatividad para superarlos.

La historia de Day of the Tentacle es divertida y emocionante, con una narrativa humorística que se desarrolla a lo largo del juego. Los diálogos son ingeniosos y están llenos de humor y sarcasmo, lo que hace que la experiencia de juego sea aún más divertida. Los personajes son únicos y carismáticos, lo que los convierte en algunos de los más queridos en la historia de los videojuegos.

La presentación visual y sonora de Day of the Tentacle Remastered es impresionante. Los gráficos mejorados son detallados y coloridos, y la animación es fluida y suave. La banda sonora es igualmente impresionante, con música pegadiza y efectos de sonido realistas que ayudan a crear una atmósfera única y envolvente.

En conclusión, Day of the Tentacle Remastered es una excelente remasterización de un clásico juego de aventuras. La mecánica de los acertijos es lógica y desafiante, la narrativa es emocionante y divertida, y los gráficos y la música son impresionantes. Este título es una excelente opción para cualquier fan de los juegos de aventuras y los juegos de acción en tercera persona, y sigue siendo una experiencia de juego emocionante y divertida incluso después de todos estos años.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104732194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1664550842}
review:
amazing game, all in all it's high for people who love adventure games.
in my run i used 3 hints (1 i do not think i would find myself, 1 i was blind to see an item and the last is an error (IMO) on a vcr button [spoiler] the aquare button is stop and the circle button is record, c'mon ppl [/spoiler]. Besides that the humor was solid, the puzzles were all logical (even the one i think i would not solve myself. The voice work is... ok, but it gets the job done.
pick it up on a sale it's a fun experience.

review: Possibly the best point and click adventure game ever made? I played this back in the day when it was first released. This remastered version looks simply stunning, although I remembered most of the puzzles from the old game so didn't blow me away like the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198968361120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1663885829}
review: A nice little story with an enjoyable cartoon aesthetic, so it's a shame that actually playing the game isn't fun. Obtuse isn't a strong enough word to describe how illogical and nonsensical the puzzle solutions are in this game. Some of them make sense, but then you've got the ones you'll only find by trying every item on every interactive object until you stumble upon the solution. That's more brute forcing than puzzle solving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012481544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1662903731}
review:
This game is absolute perfection*. Out of all the games I’ve ever played, DOTT stands out simply as a masterpiece. When I first played it over 20 years ago I instantly fell in love with this game, and picking it up again this year I was pleasantly surprised to find that not only did it stand up to the test of time, but the remastered version was so faithfully done, filled with much love and care.

*Now DOTT may not be my favourite game, as that title remains squarely with the Monkey Island series, but one thing that puts DOTT above the rest is that there is simply nothing to complain about. From start to finish this game is just…. Perfection.

review: Aventura gráfica divertida, con premisa interesante y personajes entretenidos. Tiene cadencias en cuanto a la lógica de ciertos puzzles, pero si juegas aventuras gráficas es lo que te esperas ya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003919468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 3944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3944, 'last_played': 1661729093}
review:
A highly humorous and slightly unhinged tale of simultaneous causality, interacting in cartoon logic's over 3 time periods, bringing new dimension's to the cause and effect of point and click video game! A master piece in the intellectual age of silly. Very funny Lucas Arts classic adventure game, remasterd sound and fx nicely by double fine, with added bonus of being able to hit f1 for the original pixels! oh and if you missed maniac mansion its actually complete in this game, on a computer within a computer...whaaaa??
Excellent voice over that stands the test of time and tentacles!
Dr Fred, A cataclysmic global event in a lab coat and iconic scientific role model to all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027306124', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1659280585}
review: 10 von 10 in jeder Hinsicht. Von einem kleinen Team wurde der Klassiker wiederbelebt. Wer dieses Spiel früher schon liebte, dem schlägt das Herz vor Freude bei diesem fantastischen Remake. Das Spielsystem, die Gags, selbst die Stimmen lassen Erinnerungen an das Zocken vor vielen Jahren instant aufkommen. Retro-Spaß für jedes Alter. Absolut zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302970410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1660502462}
review:
Bon bah voilà... J'ai à nouveau torché ce jeu pour la énième fois... 

C'est un remaster digne de ce nom. Il ne possède pas un simple lissage des textures mais a été totalement retravaillé, tout en gardant la patte graphique et bien sûr chaque action et scène animée est identique. Il y a d'ailleurs la possibilité de passer du mode retro au mode "retravaillé" avec une seule touche et cela ne coupe pas les animations puisqu'elles sont identiques. 

Le jeu en lui-même est sans doute l'un des meilleurs point'n'click (si ce n'est le meilleur... Avec Toonstruck et Sam et Max quand même). L'ambiance est drôle, la difficulté bien dosée. 

Un jeu culte en somme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084410087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1660479550}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197998538987', 'num_games_owned': 1074, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1652024687}
review: A többi értékelést elolvasva kétlem, hogy bármi újat hozzá tudnék még fűzni ehhez az alkotáshoz, ami már ne hangzott volna el száz és száz felületen, vagy ne tudná bárki is. Mivel nekem annak idején kimaradtak a Lucasarts által készített és közimádat tárgyává avanzsálódott point n' click kalandjátékok én utólag, visszafelé haladva az időben igyekszem bepótolni őket. A Day of the Tentacle egy olyan játék, amit ha nem előz meg a hírneve, egész biztos, hogy soha ki sem próbálom. Aki pedig tisztában van vele, miféle fáról hullott gyümölcsről van szó azt bizonyára nem lepi meg az, ha azt mondom, hogy ez is egy "találd ki, mire gondolok" típusú kalandjáték. Ebben is elég sok logikátlan kombináció és művelet található, de utólag belegondolva az ember valahogy úgy érzi, mégsem akkora hülyeség az adott probléma/szituáció esetleges nyakatekert megoldása. Viszont annyiban bonyolódik a történet, hogy a három irányítható karakterünk mind más és más idősíkban leledzik aminek hála olykor fennáll a szituáció, hogy például a jelenben talált adott tárgyat a múltbéli karakter fogja csak hasznát venni, vagy oda-vissza adogatva kell manipulálni és kombinálni azt. Ez pedig jelentősen megnöveli az amúgy 3 óránál nem hosszabb játékidőt. Nekem ezzel személy szerint nincs bajom, de a Grim Fandangoval ellentétben pont emiatt többször nyúltam videós segédlethez. Ha párhuzamot kellene vonnom a két játék között akkor a remekül megírt karaktereket emelném ki, amihez egy picit eltúlzott, mesés szinkron is társult, de szerencsére ez nem vesz ki az élményből. A humor itt is nagyon jól működik, bár egy erős történelmi illetve egy közepes angol tudás nem árt ahhoz, hogy igazán élvezni tudjuk a történéseket. A remaster újrarajzolt grafikai stílusa szerintem nagyon jóra sikeredett, új címként is teljes mértékben megállná a helyét. Aki pedig nosztalgiázni szeretne, bármikor visszaválthat a régi kinézetre. Néhányan ekézik az újrahangszerelt zenéket, melyek állítólag nem adják át hűen az eredeti dallamokat... ebben a versenyben nekem nincs lovam, hisz ez volt az első alkalom, hogy játszottam a játékkal, ezáltal nincs viszonyítási alapom. De így látatlanban én a zenét is megdicsérném. Manapság apróért hozzávágják az emberhez, aki pedig nem csak kíváncsi, de maga is ki meg szeretné tapasztalni a Lucasarts kalandjáték élményt, az biztosan nem nyúl vele mellé. Elakadni benne az internet korában pedig kvázi lehetetlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032092889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1660267560}
review: Beat this one without any hints or guides. The puzzles are all logical and funny. I didn't bang my head against the wall once! Looking at you Monkey Island...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012526616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1660228130}
review: Un clasicazo del género de las aventuras gráficas y con buenos golpes de humor. Lo jugué de pequeña con mi hermano y ahora se lo acabamos de terminar mi hija y yo y me alegro que lo hayan remasterizado para poder disfrutarlo de nuevo. Lo recomiendo al 100% si te gusta este género.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388402355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1673900069}
review: I grew up playing the Pajama Sam series of point and click adventure games, but needed something a little more challenging as an adult. I will admit I had to use a guide a few times. Some of the puzzle steps don't quite make sense, and others rely on you picking the exact dialogue to make something happen. Finished the game in about 6 hrs. There is little replay-ability unless you forget about the game and play it once a year. A nice casual/comedic point-and-click finish-in-a-weekend game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000313700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 813, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1657217656}
review:
Vorsicht, lieber Leser, es geht wieder ab ins wunderschöne Nostalgie - Hausen!

Das liegt gleich neben "Romantisch Verklärte Vergangenheit - Stadt" und nur ein ganz klein wenig oberhalb von "Rosa Rote  Retro Brille - Burg". 

Da mach ich manchmal Urlaub, wenn die stressige Realität (Bäh, die konnte ich noch nie ab!) mir wieder mal einen Kurzurlaub voll von wundervoller Wirklichkeitsflucht und Schönwetter-Gaming-Gute-alte-Zeit-Schwelgerei abnötigt.

Aber ich will Dich nicht mit Fachbegriffen langweilen (sondern lieber mit einem mal wieder viel zu langen Review und dadurch, dass ich hier noch ewig weiter tippe, wirds irgendwie auch nicht besser... puh.), stattdessen nehm ich Dich in diesen tollen, aber manchmal ach so wichtigen Kurzurlaub einfach mit.
Nett von mir, oder?
Und heute gehts auch an ein ganz besonders Ziel. 
Wir reisen ins Land der Tentakel und nein, nicht in so ein obskures Asia Tentakel Spiel, wie Du sie immer heimlich zockst, wenn keiner hinguckt...
... wir reisen nach Day of the Tentacle, dem Nachfolger von Maniac Mansion und genauso verrückt, liebenswert und schrullig, wie auch schon der Vorgänger es war.

Und ja, so war das damals, Point and Click Adventures waren DAS Ding schlechthin, grafische Wunderwerke in ihrer Pixeligkeit unerreicht und der PC Speaker Sound piepte aus allen Nicht-Boxen. Sogar von echter Musik und Vertonung munkelte man gar. Nur hinter vorgehaltener Hand natürlich, man konnte geistig fast nicht mehr mithalten mit dem ganzen technischen Fortschritts-Wahn.

Was man aber wusste und da waren sich alle einig, war, dass Humor ein elementarer Bestandteil einer guten Adventure Story sein musste. Ein Glaube, der sich heute sogar noch bis in zahllose witzige bis peinlich blödelige Indie Perlen durchzieht.
Und weil ja damals immer alles besser war, so wars dann eben auch der Humor. Schenkel klopfend und nach Luft japsend saßen wir dicht gedrängt vorm Bildschirm und versuchten, irgendwie den Lachflash zu überleben, von dem wir noch nichtmal ahnten, dass er so hieß.

Und ja, Lucas Arts war die Speerspitze all der Komödianten und Witzchenreißer in der großen, weiten Adventure Welt. Das waren echte Könner und Kenner ihres Fachs. Da saß jede Pointe und zündete jeder Gag. Kein Auge bliebt trocken, aber hoffentlich jede Hose, auch wenn bei derartigen Lachattacken nie eine Gewähr übernommen werden konnte.

Und dann war irgendwann einfach Schluss und Ende und aus und finito.
 
Es hatte sich ausgelacht und von da an begann eine trübsinnige Ära des Spiele-Ernstes, die grau und bleiern bis heute jeden Anflug von Humor in jeglichen Games erdrückt. Punkt!

Zum Glück keimen ab und zu dennoch die kleinen, zarten Pflänzchen des Lachens hier und dort immer mal durch, aber im Großen und Ganzen war genau zum Zeitpunkt der großen Lucas Arts Produktionen die Hochzeit des Spielehumors erreicht. 

Und hier kriegst Du wirklich ein Paradebeispiel. Die Story um die drei absolut liebenswerten, weil endlos behämmerten Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne sprüht vor Charme und Witz. Purpur und Grün Tentakel sind bis heute Kult und jeder kennt den Wahlspruch der Familie Edison in und auswendig...

Zuviel von der Geschichte mag ich gar nicht vorwegnehmen, aber Du wirst die drei Deppen in verschiedene Zeitperioden begleiten, in Echtzeit und je zweihundert Jahre in der Zunkuft und Vergangenheit Rätsel lösen, bei der Grundsteinlegung der Verfassung herumpfuschen, die Menschheit retten und und und und und....

Der Grafikstil ist auch heute noch eine wahre Pracht, natürlich ein wenig angegraut, aber das heißt dann einfach "retro" und damit ist jeder, ders nicht mag, automatisch ein Banause. 
Aber bisschen prächtiger gehts trotzdem noch, Du kannst auch in eine High End Comic Version umschalten, dann aber auch mit modernerer Bedienung. 
Vom Sound fang ich nicht an, sonst komm ich nie aus den Begeisterungsstürmen raus, die Synchro ist einfach der HAMMER (Linkshänder-Hammer, das ist wichtig, wie Du im Spiel lernen wirst.) und die Musik dudelt Dir noch Tage nach dem Zocken lieblich durchs Hirn.

Und da stellt sich nun die Frage: Hätte man denn unbedingt ein Remake rausbringen müssen?
Nö.
Schadet es, das gemacht zu haben?
Nö.

Alles gut also in Tentakel - Hausen, Der Urlaub von der Wirklichkeit kann also losgehen, aber stell Dich auf knackige, meist logische Rätsel und ein Füllhorn extrem charakterstarker, um nicht zu sagen: verrückter Typen ein, von denen jeder und jede einzelne Dir noch lange im Gedächtnis bleiben werden.

Und beim Entdecken oder Wiederentdecken dieses wunderschönen Tollhauses voller Ideen und Esprit (und nebenbei eines meiner Top 5 Spieler aller Zeiten überhaupt) wünsch ich Dir wie immer...

... viel Spaß  ;-)






Und hey, wenn´s Dir gefallen hat, ne Runde von mir zu lesen, dann klick hier
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41622336/
und da gibts mehr von mir auf meiner Curator Seite. Schmökern for free: Also stell Dir nen Tee bereit und viel Spaß beim lesen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198113957001', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1638666641}
review: A fun and colorful adventure game that is unfortunately still an adventure game. The world is fun, the characters all funny and engaging. most of the puzzles can make you feel like the cleverest person alive, while others even knowing the solution feel designed by an alien. It is truly one of the greatest in the Point and Click genre and deserves praise for what it is, but the genre has died out for a reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970458445', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1656896252}
review:
Classic LucasArts adventure game, well remastered, worth a playthrough if you enjoyed it back in the day or if you like other Lucas Arts adventure games like Monkey Island or Sam and Max games.

Also you can play Maniac Mansion in-game in this game. So two classic adventure games in one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068473335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1656738353}
review:
Hace casi 30 años que jugué Day of Tentacle y las sensaciones no cambiaron, es un clásico, una obra sátira divertida con humor de otros tiempos, el aspecto audiovisual está al día con esta remasterización, todo lo que está bien para hacer una aventura gráfica se encuentra acá. Quisiera ver muchas más experiencias así en los tiempos actuales con tanto clon.
Un tema es que el enfoque de la narrativa (sin spoiler) puede no ser para todos los gustos. En mi caso por la edad que tenía cuando lo jugué originalmente no comprendía la relación de los personajes con la historia, hoy lo disfruto más en ese sentido.
Una recomendación para este juego y cualquier aventura similar, NO mirar absolutamente nada en internet, no buscar ayudas y si es posible ni siquiera iluminar los objetos interactivos del escenario que viene de fábrica, dejarte llevar en el absurdo y a veces incomprensible pensamiento que resuelve los acertijos es el conducto para pasarla bien.
Cómprenlo, juegos así valen la pena y fueron el germen de la inspiración para muchos productos en la industria.

PD: Este año vuelve el Monkey!!!!!!! (Por favor no lo arruines Ron !!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027208826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1656688395}
review: Un humour sans égal. Selon moi, l'un des jeux d'aventure les plus loufoques jamais créé.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042687424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1656769294}
review:
Loved the original and was looking forward to this... but this game was BUGGY as hell!!!
Art was glitching at many places; i would see just half a screen or part of it was the graphic of a different location with character models strewn over it - the game just seemed unfinished... but then came the worst part:
The first time a 'newspaper sequence' showed up, the last beat of the musictrack just replayed EVERY 6 SECONDS after that, over the normal soundtrack THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE GAME! I tried reloading, switching to the old version via F1 (still there in MIDI) or just triggering anything in the game that would stop it. Never have I ever experienced promised 'highquality' in such a bad state...
I'm also writing this so someone might give me a hint how to fix this issue, because apparently not everyone has had this problem. But for now I am not recommending this version!

review:
Un clásico de las aventuras gráficas que nunca había jugado. Un juego a mi parecer algo difícil ya que muchas veces no sirve la lógica, simplemente la locura. La idea de controlar 3 personajes y que todos los mundos se entrelacen es un plus para el juego. Es un buen juego para el precio que tiene, sobretodo de oferta.

NOTA: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198026322890', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1656445447}
review:
Leider ist das Spiel deutlich schlechter gealtert als die Monkey Island Remasters und anders als mit purer Nostalgie kann ich mir die extrem positiven Bewertungen nicht erklären.

Nicht nur, dass das Spiel an der typischen Comedy-Adventure-Krankheit leidet, dass Rätsel schwer nachvollziehbar sind (Beispiel: Einen festgeklebten Kaugummi mit einer Brechstange vom Boden lösen) und häufig um mehrere Ecken gedacht werden muss, auch der Comedy-Aspekt selbst ist für die heutige Zeit doch sehr... begrenzt komisch. Ein paar Mal musste ich durch die Nase stoßartig ausatmen, aber das war es dann auch.

Ab der Hälfte meiner Spielzeit musste ich dann auf ein Walkthrough umsteigen, weil ich schlicht keinerlei Anhaltspunkte hatte, was ich wie machen muss. Im Walkthrough ging es dann, simplifiziert, nur darum, Gegenstände durch eine Zeitmaschine an die anderen Charaktere zu schicken. Das fügt eine zusätzliche Rätsel-Ebene hinzu, was diese teils nochmal deutlich schlechter nachvollziehbar macht.

Es hilft natürlich auch erst recht nicht, dass ein Doppel-Klicken auf einen Ein/Ausgang nicht sofort zum nächsten Raum springt. Man schaut also konstant den Charakteren dabei zu, wie Sie langsam durch die Hintergründe spazieren. Das macht das omnipräsente Backtracking nervtötend.

All dies hat dazu geführt, dass ich irgendwo zwischen gelangweilt und genervt sein pendelte.
Wer Interesse an den älteren Adventures hat und, wie ich, die Monkey Island Spiele toll findet, sollte definitiv doppelt prüfen, ob Day of the Tentacle die gleiche Kerbe trifft. Denn ohne Rosa-Rote Nostalgie Brille kann es hier ganz schnell ätzend werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046246867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1656378873}
review: HINT you can play the original Maniac Mansion in Weird Ed's room after using the computer 5 times. For what it is it's a fun little distraction for a casual play which will probably require the use of a guide. I got 13hrs out of it playing the original within the game and the game itself. If you like point and click I suggest getting it on sale

author: {'steamid': '76561198061538501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1655872341}
review:
26년만에 해본 텐타클. 최후의 날.

당시 상당히 어린 나이의 나는 영어교육조차 되어있지 않았기에
OPEN, CLOSE, USE 등 기본적인 단어조차 읽지 못하였고
캐릭터들간의 상호 대화나 대화선택지에 나온 문장들을 이해할 수 없었다.
그저 멘땅의 헤딩하듯 그림으로서 보이는 사건의 흐름과 스토리를 유추해가며
이리 저리 클릭해보는 것으로 풀어나가야했던 어린 나의 추억이 떠올랐다.

그 당시에는 인터넷의 보급이 없었던 시기였기에
두껍고 커다란 게임잡지나 공략집이 존재했는데,
그 당시 우연히 읽다가 '텐타클 최후의 날' 공략이 실린 공략집을 발견하여
그대로 따라 플레이하며 막혀있던 부분을 풀었던 기억이 있다.

이 게임은 내가 살아오며 했던 어떤 게임보다 내 머리속과 내 마음속에 크게 남아있었으며
특유의 그림체와 익살스런 표현들을 다시 보고싶어
20대가 되어서도 원작을 구하려 애썼던 기간도 있었다.


플레이하며 F1 을 눌러 그 때의 도트그래픽을 느끼며
가슴이 간질간질하고 눈물이 날 것 같은 기분이 들었다.


장면의 표현이나 연출은 어쩌면 어린이들을 대상으로한 카툰, 코믹스의 느낌이나서 유치하게 보일 수 있으나
게임에 나오는 표현이나 많은 이스터에그들은 어른이 되어서야 이해할 수 있는 것들이었다.
촌스러운 효과음들을 사용한 사운드는 게임 출시당시 93년이었던 것을 생각해야한다.
이것을 현대적으로 풍부한 사운드로 개선하여 리마스터했다면 오히려 나는 이 게임을 하며 실망했을 듯 하다.

특히 200년전 과거로 돌아간 호기를 플레이하며 마주할 수 있는 NPC들은 미국의 역사에 실존했던 인물들이니
그들에 대한 상식이 있다면 더욱 재미있게 플레이할 수 있다.

게임을 끌고가는 방식이나 스토리라인이 정말 훌륭하니 이 게임을 접하지 못한
젊은 친구들이게도 한번쯤 플레이해보도록 권하고 싶다.

review: this game manages the impressive feat of "not being fun to play", "not being funny", and "not being good to look at", which were all three things that critical reviews of the game have made clear were points in its favor. moon logic puzzles, anti-jokes written by people who read too much Far Side and delivered by "voice actors" that had no interest in trying to make them funny, and confusing environments where key items easily blend into the background. i'm starting to wonder if i downloaded a bad copy of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198235546988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1654975110}
review:
Una premisa absurda que en ningún momento se aleja del humor en sus situaciones. Mantiene un nivel simpático sin grandes chistes pero no son pocos los que se pasan por alto por ser referencias de Estados Unidos o estar lejanas en el tiempo.

El gran factor diferenciador de sus puzles es separar a los personajes en pasado, presente y futuro por lo que algunas veces se tendrá que tener en cuenta para que nuestras acciones afecten al resto. Muchos están bien pensados y planteados aunque como es habitual en los juegos de este género en la época... siempre hay alguna resolución rebuscada casi imposible de deducir sin una guía. No ocurre hasta que se ha avanzado bastante de ahí que pille tanto por sorpresa.

Como remasterización cumple suavizando los gráficos, música menos electrónica, galería de bocetos y comentarios de los desarrolladores (que en ocasiones tapan a los del juego).

author: {'steamid': '76561198079658251', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1654961746}
review:
Ich spiele gerne Point & Click / Puzzle Adventures.
Dieses Spiel bringt auch Einflüsse in andere dieser Spiele was es zu einer ziemlichen Ikone macht.
Durch die Zeit mit den dreien zu Reisen und Amerikanische Geschichte zu lernen ist zwar nicht direkt meine Hauptbeschäftigung.
Aber es ist durchaus Spannend verschiedene Rätsel zu lösen und die Geschichte zu durchleben.
Ich hatte keine großen Bugs gefunden was öfter bei anderen/älteren Spielen passiert.
Deswegen würde ich dieses Spiel gerne Empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004099954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 731, 'last_played': 1654943474}
review:
也是學生時代的回憶，重製版滿滿的誠意，
畫面音樂都有重新製作的更為精美，二周目
全成就，充滿美式幽默的冒險遊戲，不過
應該是語言及文化差異，有些梗跟笑點是看不懂的，
加上英文不夠好，可惜了製作安排的一些地方
很不錯的遊戲 Lucas Arts  就是讚啦!!
或許有翻譯好的中文版會再玩一次!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024423322', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1652025851}
review:
Ich bin froh, diesen Klassiker der Videospiele endlich gespielt zu haben. Das Remaster sieht schick aus und bleibt dabei meiner Meinung nach dem Stil des Originals treu. Der Stil selbst ist genauso wie die deutsche Vertonung am Anfang etwas gewöhnungsbedürftig für mich gewesen, aber mit der Zeit habe ich es zu mögen gelernt. 

Der Aufbau des Spiels war spannend, da man mit drei Charakteren gleichzeitig unterwegs war. Was mich gestört hat, oder womit ich Probleme hatte, war, dass ich ohne Hilfe aus dem Internet auf einige Lösungen wahrscheinlich nie oder erst nach viel Trial and Error gekommen wäre, auch wenn sie im Nachhinein Sinn gemacht haben  - an dieser Stelle würde ich gerne auf uhs-hints.com verweisen, die nicht gleich die Lösung spoilern, sondern stufenweise Hinweise geben.

Würde ich Day of the Tentacle Remastered empfehlen? Definitiv! Der Humor ist klasse, die Charaktere interessant und gut geschrieben und dank des Remasters sieht es wie ein modernes Spiel aus.
Würde ich es Einsteigern von Point 'n' Click Adventures empfehlen? Wahrscheinlich nicht. Dafür ist es meiner Meinung nach etwas zu schwer, weil manche Sachen zu gut versteckt oder manche Rätsel etwas zu knifflig waren.
Ein großes Plus übrigens noch dafür, dass es ein Spiel im Spiel gibt, denn Maniac Mansion ist auch in dem Remaster versteckt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208906941', 'num_games_owned': 17, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1669493577}
review: Maybe I am too nostalgic (and too old) but I still find these games a lot more fun than many currently available. Gameplay is easy, characters are funny and the story is amusing.. unfortunately they are quick to complete against the huge effort to develop them. Thanks LucasArts for all the fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198966855837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1650831288}
review: Tappa obbligatoria per tutti gli amanti del genere ma che potrebbe risultare un po' duro da digerire per chi non ha mai toccato un gioco punta e clicca in quanto non c'è alcuna possibilità di avere dei piccoli aiuti quando si rimane incastrati in qualche enigma e talvolta le risoluzioni possono non essere particolarmente intuitive costringendo il giocatore più svogliato, me compreso, a guardare una guida online e aver spoilerato più del dovuto. Altra critica che faccio stavolta alla remastered è il commento degli sviluppatori che molto spesso si buggherà con l'interfaccia in game non permettendo al giocatore di disabilitarlo all'interno delle cutscene, esempio molto fastidioso, non capendo bene a cosa corrispondesse iniziato il gioco l'attivai ed ebbi la cutscene iniziale completamente rovinata dall'overlay dei commenti degli sviluppatori che oscuravano totalmente i dialoghi e che per l'appunto non era possibile disattivare se non a scena conclusa. A patto di questi piccoli difetti rimane un gioco estremamente divertente e stimolante, con una moltitudine di oggetti ed ester eggs ai monkey island che consiglio di giocare quantomeno il primo prima di imbattersi in questa avventura per familiarizzare al meglio con il genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075146545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1650623828}
review:
Spaßiges Adventure, die Point und Click Steuerung ist einigermaßen komfortabel und die grafische aufhübschung macht es ganz ansehnlich.
Man kann im Spiel Maniac Mansion spielen, wem das gefällt.
Wenn man diese Art Spiele mag wird man hier bestens versorgt, die Rätsel sind interessant und teils knifflig, aber man kann wohl nicht in einer Sackgasse landen.
Völlig unlogische, bzw. fast unmögliche Dinge gibts nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036524507', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1520790139}
review: Eines der geilsten Adventures aus der guten alten Zeit. Ein chemikalisches zeug dass im Abwasser geraten ist landet im Bauch eines dahergelaufenen Tentakels, der dann eine merkwürdige Wandlung durchmacht und davon besessen ist die Welt zu beherrschen. Eine Menschengruppe soll die Welt vor diesem wahnsinnigen retten, wobei jeder Mensch seine ganz eigenen Rollen spielt, dabei findet man so einige Szenen und Sachen vor wo man sich immer wieder kaputt lachen könnte. Wer sich an Monkey Island erinnert: ja genau so in diesem Setting ist auch Day of the Tentacle. Einfach nur herrlich schräg und vorallem witzig. Diese Spiele kommen noch aus Zeiten, wo Unterhaltung deutlich mehr wert hatte in der Spieleentwicklung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1650048365}
review:
[h1]Day of the Tentacle – Remastered[/h1]
...is a point & click adventure. Purple Tentacle has become more intelligent and has vowed to take over the world, so it is up to Bernard and his friends to return to the Maniac Mansion and save the world.

[h1]⚙ [u]Game Description & Mechanics[/u] ⚙[/h1]
A remake of the Lucas Arts classic from the golden age of point & click games, you move your character around fixed 2D screens, going in doors, up and down stairs, and other passages. You control three different characters across time: Bernard is in the present, Hoagie is 200 years in the past, and Laverne is 200 years in the future. Things you do in the past may affect object placements or availability in the future, but it's best not to overthink the time travel and paradox.

On your way, you collect items you store in your inventory. This can be used on specific locations in the environment or with other objects, or given to other characters you come across. Using your Chron-O-John time capsule, you can send items to other characters, but once you've done so, you can do it from the menu without actually needing to travel all the way to the time capsule to send or retrieve them.

Depending on the item, person or interactive environment element, you can specify whether you want to open, close, push, pull, use, or talk to them. The answers aren't always straightforward or logical (this is a cartoony comedy, after all), and the game expects you to experiment using objects in different ways until you come across something that works, even if you don't know what it'll be used for at that time.

[h1]☺ [u]What I enjoyed[/u] ☺[/h1]
I can't stress how faithful the devs have been to the original game. Some might want to argue that translating a 320x240 resolution game to modern resolutions could really look like anything, but the entire game was recreated based on the original 1992 and 1993 concept arts used in the original game (which are unlocked once the game is completed). Even the audio is taken directly from the limited-edition CD-ROM version of the original game. And if you really want the original game, the option to play on the original 320x240 resolution (adapted to modern monitors) is available as well!

The game is packed full with slapstick and goofy humor. The characters are weird caricatures, the environments are deliberately twisted and exaggerated, the script is full of corny jokes. The use of objects is ridiculous, with a bunch of hidden achievements from misusing them (here's a free one: [spoiler]using the coffee with the decaf mug will get you the "And then the world explodes" achievement![/spoiler]). Even the very premise is ludicrous: a pet tentacle drinking toxic waste grows two arms (no hands or fingers mind you, merely two small stubs), and that's enough for it to feel empowered enough to attempt and succeed at taking over the world.

[h1]☹ [u]What bothered me[/u] ☹[/h1]
It feels like the game was short, a lot shorter than I remember it to be (my playtime includes being AFK for a few hours, and replaying multiple times to get missed achievements). This is without a doubt because I remembered what to do from my past playthrough, but that might just be it: the game heavily targets the nostalgia of gamers who played this game and others like it some 30 years ago, but doesn't have anything new or novel to add to them. It feels like when those old VHS movies were ported to DVD for the first time and they were trying to enhance it with additional content that fell flat. Here, you get images of concept arts, you can turn on a commentary voiceover while playing, and that's about it. I'm not saying I have better ideas of my own, but still...

Some of the mechanics haven't aged well at all. Even back then, having to clarify whether you're pushing, pulling, or using the object was slowly being phased out of point & click games. It's somewhat tedious to have to clarify that I wish to PUSH the button, or that I wish to OPEN the door. I clicked on it, isn't that enough? I understand that the original game was like that, so of course, they kept it here, but that doesn't change the fact that it's a mechanic that aged terribly and may annoy anyone that isn't playing this game with rose-tinted glasses.

[h1][b]My Verdict[/b]: ★★★★☆ - [i]"Next on your list!"[/i][/h1]

There isn't much to say about [i]Day of the Tentacle – Remastered[/i] except for what an absolutely perfect remastered edition it is. It has everything it should have: an impeccable port of the original game for modern computers, an aesthetically faithful modern resolution with the optional original resolution kept for posterity. It is the best possible way to introduce new or younger players to point & click classics.

[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995788914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1463031934}
review:
My favorite point-n-click adventure from my childhood, Day of the tentacle (DotT) is a super interesting game that offers puzzles from three different timelines (Past, Modern, Future) where you'll need to solve problems using creative solutions from items that exist at different time, trying to change a terrible future from happening. Sure, you'll probably affect causality along the way, and cause other... weird changes, but that's fun, right?

The game has no fail-state that I know of, being from an era where experimentation and screwing up was part of the fun, rather than a reason to punish players. It's why I love it so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996999492', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1647365642}
review:
I was a teenager when the game was released. LOVED it and was probably of of my favorite of all times.
I guess when you're a certain age and with all the walkthroughs available a fingerclick away, you dont have the patience anymore for all the weird puzzles. I remember DOTT was easy. Almost 30 years later, i had no patience for this.
It is still a great game and a marvelous remake but i guess my fond memories were better than playing it today.
I recommend it and its an important game to teach all gamer generations but today i enjoy other adventure games more:
Sam & Max, Gabriel Knight 1,2, and the Dig.
