author: {'steamid': '76561198054279933', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1646930582}
review:
Puzzle games are fun, especially those humorous ones. I really like them.

This however is not fun. The puzzles are pure nonsense and the humour... well, if you think a fat guy scratching his belly and burping is hilarious and the word 'toilet' makes you giggle, this game is definitely for you. I however was not amused.

The game is known to crash occasionally but I was lucky enough not to experience it so perhaps you too can play it through if you have patience and you actually like to do it, even for the achievements - which are also mostly moronic; you even get an achievement for idling (and cursing the day you bought this game though this is purely optional). And yes, of course you need to watch every painfully idiotic cutscene to get another achievement.

Voice acting, if you can call it that, is beyond terrible though I must admit my acting would also be terrible if I had to utter sentences that stupid over and over again. At least the actors were paid unlike us poor idiots who paid to play this game.

I played this halfway through, solving stupid obscure puzzles one after another until I just gave up and finished the game with a help of a walkthrough, and have absolutely no plans to play this Double Fine Mess ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030334206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1648848779}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989324756', 'num_games_owned': 623, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1646442790}
review:
거의 25년만에 이 게임을 다시 플레이 하게 됐다.
당시 이 게임은 여러모로 내게 큰 의미가 있었던 게임이었다. 어렸을 때 모은 용돈으로 세운상가에 있는 PC게임 판매점에 가서 정품으로 구매했던 게임인데 디스크 한장이 빠져있었다. 그럼에도 설치와 실행이 되었는데 나머지 한장이 게임속 보너스 게임인 1편 매니악매션이었던 것 같다. 게임속 게임인 매니악 맨션을 플레이 할 수 없었지만 본편은 모두 완료할 수 있었다. 그런데 그때 난 디스크 한장이 누락된 걸로 결국 다른 게임으로 교환을 받게 되었는데 그때 사장님이 너무 쿨하게 교환을 해주셨다. 그때 교환했던 게임이 웨스트우드의 롤플레잉 게임 지혜의 땅이었다. 인생 롤플레잉 게임인 지혜의 땅을 만나게 된 계기가 되어준 또 그 자체만으로도 훌륭했던 게임이 된 것이다. (그때 게임을 교환해줬던 사장님께 감사를 드리며...)
어쨌든 이 게임은 완전히 세련되고 깔끔하게 업그레이드 된 그래픽을 가지고 돌아왔지만 여전히 당시 어드벤처의 감성은 그대로 남아있는 게임이다. 루카스 아츠 특유의 유머와 퍼즐이 다시금 정말 추억이 가득한 세계속으로 빠져들게 만들었다. 당시엔 과거와 현재, 미래를 오가며 플레이 하는 구성이 꽤 어렵게 느껴졌다. (매니악 맨션도 캐릭터 3명을 적절히 활용해야 해서 어려웠다.)그래서 그땐 공략을 많이 참고해 가며 클리어 했었는데 이번에는 그렇게 어렵게 느껴지진 않았다. 물론 좀 헤매기도 했지만 공략을 하나도 보지 않고 10시간 정도로 클리어할 수 있어서 더욱 뿌듯하게 다가왔다. (사실 25년만이라 퍼즐은 기억이 초기화 되었다 봐도 된다)
이런 클래식 어드벤처가 더 많이 리마스터 혹은 리메이크 되어 나왔으면 좋겠다. 어드벤처 게임 팬들에게 정말 너무나도 큰 선물과도 같은 게임이다. 이제 아직 해보지 않은 풀스로틀 리마스터와 그림 판당고 리마스터를 플레이 할 차례이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991507400', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1645653558}
review:
I remember playing this game back in the day. So here it is a newly remastered version let's see what it brings.

So when I finally sat down and played it .... it was okay. Like all point-n-click games of the time, it suffered the same "What next?" problem. These days if you get stuck you just go online and within minutes you have an answer (usually.) Back then, you usually had to wait for some gaming magazine to publish a walkthrough, and when you live in a small town your options in that regard are limited. However, this is what made point-n-click games so compelling. The challenge. DOTT in this regard was far too easy and I remember this was one of the few games I didn't need a walkthrough. So my criticism is that it was too easy.

Graphically the game was colourful and pretty, making it stand out from other games of the genre. The cartoony graphics were a bit refreshing, with a noticeable Chuck Jones feel to them. Voice acting was pretty good for the time.

So, what do I think of the remaster? Well, it gives me hope. This game has been so well remastered to current-gen systems that it gives me hope that more old LucasArts games get the same treatment *cough* Fate of Atlantis *cough*. Hint, hint, wink, wink.

Visually the HD remastered graphics are great and you can almost forget how old the source material is, however as another reviewer said, they can be a bit bland and lacking detail. However, this is just in contrast to current standards, back then it was detailed.

Story-wise, DOTTR is as funny as it was back then. A few dated jokes that the younger generation are unlikely to get, but otherwise it holds up.

Overall:
Day of the Tentacle remastered is a fantastic remastering of a cult classic for current-gen systems. However, if I had to be honest, this game is primarily aimed at its long time fans. Newer/younger gamers are likely to not get a lot of it and hold it on par with an interactive cartoon (whether that is a good thing or not may vary depending on personal taste.) The bottom line is this is a great game with which I had a lot of fun, both then and now.

Side Note:
Don't play this game with a walkthrough or trophy guide on your first playthrough. Get any missed trophies on subsequent playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234547376', 'num_games_owned': 1753, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1645380815}
review:
Day of the Tentacle eines der Klassikern unter den Point & Klick Genres wurde  als Remastered aufgehübscht. Purpur-Tentakel will die Weltherschafft an sich reißen und die Menschen versklaven für ihren "Menschenshow!" Drei Spielbaren Charakteren sind hier vertreten: Bernhard der Nerd, Hoagie ein Rock Musiker und Laverne eine Medizinstudentin. Deren Ausgabe es ist, diesen fiesen Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten. Dr. Ed Edison ein Verrückter Wissenschaftler, wie all seiner Vorfahren ebenfalls Wissenschaftler waren erschuf er einen Zeitmaschine in einer Toilette! Durch Neugier wollten Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne sie testen...Unglücklicherweise wurde Hoagie in die Vergangenheit geschickt. Laverne in der Zukunft, Bernhard blieb in Gegenwart. 

Lob an die Entwickler für das Handgezeichnete Remastered Liebevoll & guten Design Wahl! Die ursprüngliche Grafik aus den 1993 ist auch enthalten für die Retro-Dudes!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2749525802

Pro:
+Humorvolle Story
+Switchen durch alt/neu Grafik
+Wechseln an Charakteren um manche Lösungen zu lösen
+Deutschen Synchronsprecher TOP
+Maniac Manision spielen (ein Spiel in ein Spiel)

Con:
-Subtitles sind langsam
-Maniac Mansion leider kein Deutschen-Untertitel

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2751795839

Fazit: Top Spiel, wer es gerne hat, in verschiedenen Charakteren hineinzuschlüpfen + Zeitzonen zu bereisen ist hier genau richtig!

author: {'steamid': '76561197964040220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1651955331}
review:
Great original, perfect remaster

author: {'steamid': '76561198082117469', 'num_games_owned': 12527, 'num_reviews': 568, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1644271242}
review:
Excellent jeu du genre Pointer et Cliquer qui a vieilli, mais le format Remastérisé le met au niveau des Des autres jeux du même genre.
La direction artistique est fun surtout (que vous pouvez repasser au format du jeu d'époque en appuyant dur F1.
Par contre les énigmes sont très loufoque comme les jeux avec une ambiance très Cartoon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964761231', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1644489273}
review:
Amazing remaster of one of the best puzzle adventure games of all time.

The gameplay is peak LucasArts, using the 9-verb interaction system with inventory visible on screen.  You can swap between 3 characters in the past, present, and future, and share (most) inventory items between them.  Actions taken in the past will cause changes to appear in the present and future.  The puzzles are clever and the situations are hilarious.

The graphics are perfect.  The original art style is completely preserved in the new high resolution widescreen graphics, unlike some other remasters that made questionable art decisions.

The music is good too.  It sounds like very high quality MIDI, and works exactly like the classic iMUSE system in synchronizing with onscreen events.  I do wonder if it might have sounded better with real orchestral recordings, but the MIDI-style playback is rather nostalgic.

One complaint:  I had to add --DisableFMODDSP to the launch options to fix choppy sound and music.  Apparently this has something to do with Realtek High Definition Audio, which is very common on motherboards.

review:
Probablemente llego mil millones de años tarde a escribir una reseña sobre este juego. Yo jugué esta aventura gráfica en su día cuando era pequeño y la he rejugado un montón de veces. Sin lugar a dudas una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de la historia, con sus toques humorísticos, sus momentos en los que no sabes como seguir ect.

Una historia disparatada pero a la vez graciosa, si te gusta el género de las aventuras gráficas, esta es una de las que hay que pasarse al menos una vez en la vida porque es una de las mejores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044030747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1642270528}
review:
La crème de l'humour Lucas Art de la grande époque. Mais.. 
C'est aussi un point and click qui vous laisse dans une zone immense qui représente pratiquement l'entiereté du jeu dès le début avec un quasi accès à tous les objets ce qui peut être pas mal perturbant, se retrouver avec un inventaire de 20/30 objet au bout d'une heure et pas la moindre idée de quoi faire avec, c'est du jeu à l'ancienne quoi. Heureusement qu'il existe une certaine logique dans les énigmes qui fait que les objets reste relativement évident à utiliser (pour la plupart).
L'interaction temporelle entre les 3 personnages est super, surtout quand le fait de changer un élément du passé se répércute dans le futur. Et l'humour est au top du top avec des dialogues super qui reste drôle des décennies plus tard !
Je recommande grandement pour tous amateur du genre cherchant à faire les classiques !

author: {'steamid': '76561198000211939', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1580945442}
review: A very good remake, you can change between the classic view and the remake at any moment pressing F1. A classic point & click adventure of Lucasarts. The puzzles are difficult to solve if you don't follow a guide, you have to explore a lot and try a lot of combinations, but that's the way it was designed to be. If you like this kind of games you'll loved it, if you don't have the patience to play like this you can always follow a guide and it may also be enjoyable. Also, it works in old PCs, that's a plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158454682', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1642394206}
review: Un loquillo, No tengo en mi historial muchas aventuras gráficas, pero tengo entendido que este es un clásico, nunca había tenido la oportunidad de jugarlo, me animé y para que, gratamente satisfecho, un juegazo, mucho carisma en esta divertida comedia llena de absurdas locuras y referencias a la cultura friki y pop. Creo que por algún tiempo voy a extrañar seguir acompañando a estos tres desfachatados.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037247239', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1675439381}

author: {'steamid': '76561199214354783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1686761006}
review:
Einfach ein Kultspiel ! Ich liebte damals diese Point&Click Spiele. Day of the Tentacel, war eines davon. Aktuell fehlt mir die Zeit für dieses Spiel. Dennoch gekauft und ich bin gespannt ob ich es, nach all den Jahren, noch hinbekomme, es durchzuspielen!! Klassiker und definitiv eine Kaufempfehlung! Aber ehrlich... im klassischen Modus...hat was nostalgisches , aber heute bekomme ich Augenkrebs davon.

Edit:

Ich habe es durch gespielt und bin stellenweise an meine Grenzen gekommen, simpel und doch so schwer. Aber wenn der Knoten einmal geplatzt ist, läuft es wieder wie geschmiert.

review: Яркий бриллиант в короне лукас-артс. Необычный мультяшный стиль с ломаными линиями интерьеров. Гротескные персонажи, которые решают оригинальные загадки, механика и логика которых завязаны на перемещениях во времени предметов и влиянии на события путём изменения истории. Если вы ещё не играли в эту игру, то исправьте эту ошибку и вы узнаете, что ждёт человечество в будущем и как стать лучшим питомцев для новых хозяев земли.

review:
Point & Click culte, DOTT est juste un must. Drôle, irrévérencieux, du grand art ! 

Certaines énigmes sont franchement capillo-tractées, mais la plupart ont une vraie logique et accessibles donc. 

Bref du tout bon pour un jeu à découvrir ou à refaire, mais à côté duquel il ne faut en aucun cas passer, à plus forte raison pour les fans du genre !

author: {'steamid': '76561198278759216', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1541192453}
review:
This graphic adventure has probably the most interesting concept ever seen: the three characters interact in the same location but in three different ages and everything they do in the past can influence the future. This settings allows several absurd and funny solutions for the puzzles.
If we add cartoonish graphics, great voice acting, funny dialogues and the return of "Maniac Mansion"'s cast (the game itself is included as an easter egg), we have a definitive product!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1640991711}
review:
A classic! If like me you played and loved the original back in the day, believe me, this remastered version is its worthy tribute. The graphics are top notch, the remastered music too, the gameplay is smoother (wheel of actions)... An excellent upgrade to a classic game without ruining it or changing it too much.
Now, if you have never played it, this remastered version is worth a try, it does not look like an old game at all! Just old school style. This is a traditional point and click, with many items to look at, many places to explore, an insane scenario with quirky characters and absurd dialogues, tons of items to gather and combine, loony music, super clever narration with time jumps, but most of all: a crunchy taste of humor that still holds up to nowadays standards. Do not expect a huge game, this is a little gem, and you have to accept the derisory tone and slow pace of typical 90s good old quirkiness. When on sale at a few bucks, this is a steal that any gamer should do, as it is a piece of gaming history!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087475757', 'num_games_owned': 1643, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1564261035}
review:
Not a game for me: Mediocre story and characters, obscure and convoluted puzzles in three different timelines with lots of riddles and no clear solving order. I read a guide to proceed to the end since I realized I didn't have any fun solving these puzzles, there are only a few gotcha moments but lots of "what?" reactions after "solving" them. 

However, this remaster's commercial success still makes me glad that adventure genre is thriving and has evolved, so we can have various sub-genres in adventure games to choose from. Here are some of my favorites: What Remains of Edith Finch, INSIDE, Danganronpa, Unavowed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961161335', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1459019466}
review:
I played this game in the 90's originally on floppy disk, then the CD version came out that ran on the millennium edition of Windows. Safe to say it was probably the first point and click game I ever played; and the first I completed from start to finish without a guide.

You'll probably see a lot of nostalgic reviews here on steam, and they absolutely have their place. But if we look at this game from the point of view of someone who didn't play it back in the 90's it still has a solid story, interesting mechanisms to solve and a great art style. Well worth a play whether you're coming back to it or if you're trying out for the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974920140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1639499145}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996134990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1694963965}
review:
I played but did not finish the original version of this game.  The remaster really updated the graphics and engine.  It is an adventure/puzzle game and definitely casual.  This is one of those games that you don't get killed if you make a bad decision, you will simply not advance or be put back where you just came from.  Dialog is voiced nicely and tone of the game is fun.

Recommended if you enjoy lite puzzle adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004234335', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1590159142}
review:
One of the greatest gems of the LucasArts point-and-click era (Sam & Max, the Monkey Island series), this DoubleFine remaster is painstakingly perfect.

The animation is literally redrawn (google a video to check out the incredible attention to detail) and the audio has been cleaned up; an interface "wheel" has been added (and it's great) - but if you don't like any of that stuff you can play with any of those options in the original format. As a bonus you even get Maniac Mansion for free!

Day of the Tentacle has lost none of its personality and charm in the decades since it was released and this remaster just helps cement it as a timeless classic.

review: I loved this game as a kid long ago.  And playing it again all these years later didn't disappoint.  Even my kids like playing it.  My 8 yo daughter has already watched me play all the way through it and now she wants to play it through herself.  They just don't make games like these anymore.  You all can have your over-engineered Cyberpunk games that requires thousands of dollars in hardware yet full of glitches and problems.  I'll take classics like these any day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970397249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1561990101}
review:
Day of the Tentacle (1993 PC)

Oli aikoinaan huikea seikkailu joka pursusi hersyävää omalaatuista huumoria jopa kyynisyyteen ajoittain sukeltaen, huikeita henkilöhahmoja joihinka jos ei nyt samaistunut sentäs niin heistä alkoi oikeasti tämän pelin edetessä jopa tietyllä tapaa välittämään :D mutta vähintäänkin pitämään ja paljon.

Aikamatkailua kyseessä.. se on sillain tehty tässä erittäin nerokkaasti että kolmikko joutuu eri aikakausille mutta on ikään kuin samaisessa talossa touhuamassa ja auttamassa sitä kautta myös kavereitaan, jotta takaisin yhteen ja samaan aikaan taas pääsisi. Yksi heistä joutuu 200 vuotta menneisyyteen, yksi pysyy nykypäivässä ja kolmas sitten menee 200 vuotta tulevaisuuteen. Elottomia esineitä he pystyvät siirtämään ajasta toiseen ja tämä on olennainen osa puzzleja tässä point’n’click seikkailupelissä.

Tuohon aikaan kun peli ilmestyi, niin tämähän on tietynlaista jatkoa Maniac Mansion pelille, niin tässä pelissä jos käyttää erästä tietokonetta siellä pelin sisällä, niin sillä pääsee pelaamaan tuota alkueräistä Maniac Mansion peliä, huikea juttu oli, liekö tuohon aikaan aivan ennenkokematon idea ja toteutus sinänsä, ei varmaan tuota ollut hirveästi aiemmin tuollain toteutettu muussa pelissä vielä ennen tätä ?

Grafiikka oli todella upeaa ja kestää sitä ihailla tänäkin päivänä, sitä alkuperäistä grafiikkaa siis ! Nythän pelille on tullut sitten Remaster, jossa on myös tuo viime aikojen innolla käytetty ominaisuus elikkäs pelissä pystyy lennosta ihan milloin vaihtamaan grafiikat nappia painamalla joko alkuperäiseen muottiinsa tai sitten tähän uudistuneeseen ilmeeseen. Kummatkin näyttävät hyviltä, hitusen eri tavalla toki. Ajan patinoimassa alkuperäissäkin on kuitenkin oma suuri viehätyksensä, jos retroilihan silmin ruutua katsoo :)

Myöskään musiikillisessa annissa ei annettu oikeastaan kellekään mitään tasoitusta, mieleenpainuvat ja humoristisensävyiset musiikit, aivan loistavaa ja löi ihan täysillä kiilaa minkä tahansa animaatio leffan themelle, tämän tunnusmusa siis ! Ääninäyttelijät hoitivat myös upeasti duuninsa himaan, aivan korvia hivelevää kuultavaa :)

Pelin teossa olennaisena osana ollut, sittemmin yhdeksi pelimaailman suurista tunnetuista nimistä muotoutunut Tim Schaefer ja olihan siellä eräs Ron Gilbert kans messissä mukana.. Gary Winnick sitten vähän tuntemattomammaksi nimeksi suuremmalle yleisölle jäänyt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007425159', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1484003044}
review:
Ritka az olyan játék, ami kortalan. Hát ez teljesen az. Az eredetivel is játszottam, többször is végig vittem, így a HD változatot gyakorlatilag hibátlanul és gondolkodás nélkül végigjátszottam. Ez a játék a gyerekkorom egyik nagy kedvence és felnőttként is elő lehet venni. Ha annyit írhatok: a zene tökéletes, a történet kalandos és humoros, a HD változat (remastered) meglepően jól sikerült (ellenben pár más régi játék felújítással). Ajánlott életkor: olvasni tudó életkortól - 150 éves korig. Ja igen: van magyarítás verzió (sajnos nem beépített, de külső netes forrásból könnyen letölthető, egész jól sikerült), de ha tudsz angolul, messze több finom humort kapsz. (némi történelmi/tudományos/folklór/stb ismeret mellett pedig szét fogod röhögni magad!)
Amit külön is kiemelnék: ha ügyes vagy találsz egy játszható játékot a játékon belül. :D
Egyébként pedig PURPLE TENTACLE TAKE ON THE WORLD!
Mindenképp megéri a teljes árát is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198849702948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2714, 'last_played': 1701037188}
review:
Do you have a young child in your life that you would like to introduce to classic computer gaming in the safest, most enjoyable way possible? If so, this is your game!  I remembered it fondly as one of the funniest, goofiest computer games I had ever played, so when the remastered version popped up on sale for $4, I snapped it up. Played it over a Christmas visit with my 5-year-old granddaughter and it was a great bonding experience. 

It was still funny, but I had forgotten just how tedious those old point-and-click adventure games really were. But when you have a child copilot, that's no problem - little kids LOVE repetition. She needed help with the dialog trees, but quickly mastered the clunky controls and memorized the layout of all 3 versions of that old house in Philadelphia. So I'd help her figure out the next step and then let her run back and forth and up and down the stairs, switching characters, and chucking random objects into the time travel toilet while I looked up the answer to the next ridiculous puzzle in a walkthrough. Yes, I played it before, but it was 15 or 20 years ago, okay? And I'm pretty sure even at the time it didn't spontaneously occur to me to paint the fruit on the kumquat tree red so George Washington would chop it down  (oops, sorry. Spoiler). 

The remarkable thing about this game is that the humor works on so many levels that it is equally funny to a preschooler and a grandma. For an adult the replay value is limited, but as a collaborative game with a small child there is no limit. When we next saw each other a year later, Little L (now 6) could hardly wait to play it again. This time she could read more of the text herself and remembered the solutions to a lot of the puzzles, but not all of them, which gave Grandma something to do. So playing it again was still a bonding experience and still fun for both of us. And a great introduction to the Founding Fathers, right?

author: {'steamid': '76561199218610585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1678556864}

review: This is a classic! It requires a bit of patience for those who are use to the more modern, fast paced video games however, you will not be disappointed. Its silly, puzzling, and you will find yourself repeating the lines from the game among friends. If you are a young video game player you should really give this game a go as a way to step back in time and enjoy old school fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014242486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1635454638}
review:
Day of Tentacle Remastered is obviously the remastered version of the famous adventure by LucasArts. I was lucky to be a gamer during the golden era of LucasArts and this game was one of the brilliant examples of how an adventure game should be constructed. The remastered version makes it accessible to a new generation of gamers without making any compromises.

Pros:
+ excellent humour (skillfully integrated in the whole game), dialogs and writing. 
+ Excellent voices and music. 
+ Puzzles and riddles are really clever and all make sense as long as you manage to understand the general spirit of the game. The ability to change characters in past, present and future is working flawlessly. 
+ Cartoonish style of graphic and environment is very well executed.

Cons:
- Duration is a bit on the short side.
- As in all similar adventures you may get stuck in some puzzles trying  endless combinations.
- More save slots could be welcomed (especially if you are achievement hunter).

All in all a masterpiece of adventure game. It is a pity that such games are not available any more. I may not have now the time to invest in getting stuck in a puzzle (and internet and steam guides can be very helpful in this respect) but I definitely appreciate the talent and effort behind this game. In a nostalgic note these games helped me even improve my English a couple of decades ago: I still remember searching in a dictionary what fake barf is.  
Can we please have remastered versions of the Indiana Jones adventure games?

author: {'steamid': '76561198965280485', 'num_games_owned': 1144, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1705257825}
review:
Чем старше становлюсь, тем чаще охватывает чувство ностальгии по временам, которые зеленее и вкуснее. В своё время чуть ли не релизе (если такой термин применим к лохматым девяностым, когда игры доставались через знакомых и переносились на дискетах) довелось поиграть в DotT. Сказать, что неподготовленный молодой организм был ошеломлён графическим исполнением - не сказать ничего. Это была та самая фёрст-лук-лав, последствиемм которой стала лютая аддиктивность к жанру квестов.

Шли годы, сменялись предпочтения, операционные системы и девайсы. Вот только ностальгическое чувство к приключенческим играм в целом и двухмерным-рисованным в частности ничем заменить не удалось. Появление ремастера как-то прошло мимо меня, всего такого потерянного в серых буднях, и хотя о его существовании я уже знал, потакать ностальгии я был не намерен. И всё же бастион пал, когда после череды современных тайтлов с заматеревшей графикой мне вдруг захотелось сменить визуал, льющийся с экрана. Не буду лукавить, что холодным осенним вечером я просто перебирал названия в магазине и случайно наткнулся на ЭТО. Нет,  я конкретно знал, чего хочу. А хотел я обмазаться тем самым чувством, которое испытывал на протяжении прохождения оригинала.

Купил ремастер, поставил и за 4 часа пробежал, как говорится, на кончиках пальцев, ибо прохождение настолько въелось в подкорку, что я без труда, перерывов и каких-либо решений местных головоломок просто играл . Пожалуй, даже намеренно подзатянул с прохождением, чтобы опять насладиться озвучкой и оценить похорошевшую (и без того вполне безупречную) рисовку.

Без сомнения, ремастер удался. И это говорит не ностальгирующий олдфаг, а человек, достаточно обильно поглощающий продукцию нынешнего игропрома и способный сравнить качество игры с современниками жанра. Да и много ли их, подобных DotT'у, современников? То-то же. А потому - играть, ибо такие экземпляры - штучные.

review:
Превосходный ремастеред с возможностью переключения в режим оригинала.
Квесты от LucasArts - это эталон поинт-н-клика, поэтому каждый фанат жанра должен иметь эту игру в коллекции со всеми открытыми ачивками.
Интересные логичные задачи, шикарные шутки и куча пасхалок и отсылок.
Рекомендую!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064436569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1632706249}
review: An all-time classic of the Adventure Game genre, Day of the Tentacle REALLY shines in this remaster. The art looks amazing, the dialogue is enough to distract you from ever finishing the game, and the quirky completions to the puzzles make just enough sense to keep the typical Adventure Game Nonsense Frustration low. For older players it's an amazing nostalgia trip, and for newer players it may be a key ingredient into understanding and enjoying adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031018398', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1631956537}
review:
[b]TLDR[/b] DOTT still holds up pretty well with or without the remaster, but if you are a newcomer the updated UI will prove less intimidating. [20/20⭐, 8h🏅, 3/5💡]

[b]Context[/b] Disclaimer: I've played the original version several times so I'm not able to actually assess its difficulty. I'll try take off my nostalgia goggles. I play a lot of these classic adventure games, and many (most?) of them feel outdated. That's not the case of DOTT (regardless of the remaster). 

[b]Writing[/b] In DOTT, you control 3 characters that have to time travel to prevent a mutant tentacle (who developed arms!) from taking over the world. It’s all senseless, and it’s also one of the funniest game I’ve played. The jokes are timeless (pun intended) and I still feel this is one of the smartest uses of (cartoonish) time-travel in a game.

[b]Aesthetics[/b] The game has a cartoonish style that fits perfectly the overall tone. The voice acting is pretty decent for its time. As for the remastering itself, the updated graphics/sound are a matter of taste. I had some issues with the synchronization of the audio and subtitles.

[b]Gameplay[/b] Gameplay is quintessential point-and-click adventure: you have a set of actions to interact with the environment and with the items you collect. The puzzles are actually quite "logical" if you realize what you need to accomplish. The new UI in the remaster provides a more modern, lighter feeling to the game (although I was constantly annoyed by the pointer moving to the default action). The cursor highlights interactable objects when hovering, so there is little pixel hunting (already the case in the original game). There are no gameovers nor deaths. You can save/load at any time and autosaving is implemented, but for some reason the number of save slots is limited (inconvenient if you miss achievements along the way).

[b]Value[/b] It took me 8h to complete the game, which is fair for a game of this kind, although this also includes achievement hunting time. You cannot revisit previous chapters. Achievements force you to explore interactions that you might have missed, actually adding value. Since there are multiple save slots, they don't require multiple playthroughs if you keep saves at previous points of the game. The plot is linear, but DOTT is replayable just for the jokes.

[quote][i]For more puzzle-game reviews and curated lists check out the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43326007-The-Clueless-Adventurer-Puzzle-Trove/]Puzzle Trove[/url].[/i][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030738974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1465232288}
review:
Un immense classique du point & click, sorti à l'origine par LucasArts en 1993 et l'un des jeux les plus drôles de tous les temps ! Pour sauver le monde d'une tentacule mégalo vous alternerez entre trois jeunes gens coincés dans un manoir à trois époques différentes. Qu'est-ce qui pourrait mal tourner avec un pitch aussi loufoque ?

Absolument tout bien sûr ! Cependant, malgré des situations et énigmes capillotractées, il y a toujours un fond de logique aux idioties que vivent les personnages afin de ne jamais bloquer trop longtemps et de toujours trouver une voie pour faire avancer l'intrigue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024230479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1631460478}
review: A Lucasarts Point and click classic adventure. Got this game when it was released because I knew it was a sequel to maniac mansion. Bernard the nerd makes his return followed by new characters Hoagie a heavy metal roadie and Laverne a wacky medical student. The mansion and Crazy Dr. Ed and co. also are in the game of course. The three kids are stuck in different time periods and it’s up to you (and Dr. Ed) to help them stop an evil purple tentacle from taking over the world. Brings back a ton of memories of playing DOS games, definitely a classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065684542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1063, 'last_played': 1678653188}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058715527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1532132685}
review:
Este juego fue el primer aventura grafica que jugué en mi vida.

Solía ​​ir a la casa de mi primo, éramos solo niños, y entonces, él tenia en su computadora varios juegos entre ellos estaba esta obra de arte.

La sensación de resolver un puzzle es algo que no puedo borrar de mis recuerdos. Y el hamster congelado es lo mejor que me ha pasado en los videojuegos jajajajaja

10/10, uno de los mejores juegos de la era dorada de los juegos de aventuras graficas

author: {'steamid': '76561197976743513', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1696951390}
review:
....It's ok. Better than Full Throttle's remaster for sure. MOST of everything is here, plays well, no clicks pops or breaks in any of the music so great on that. However, as someone who still has a working win95 machine I can tell you exactly the bits that are missing and don't work properly, THANKFULLY it isn't many.

The intro's and by extension, the time warp swirl do not play right on new aged systems. My guess is due to refresh rates on monitors but it barely looks like it swirls anymore, numerous sound effects and areas COMPLETELY missing reverb and echo, once again the time warp sequence is a BIG example of this... there is no spacey echo on ANY of the characters voices anymore, even Edna's laugh is supposed to have an un-nerving echo to it as she disappears down the screen. It is also as usual with so many lucasarts "remasters" missing ALOT of sound effects, no birds chirping in the intro anymore, various cutscenes are missing the tentacle suck sound, the door creak noise on the cron-a-jon's opening and the list goes on.

The remastered soundtrack is extremely hit and miss, as well as the new remastered sounds (the tentacles sucker sound is ATROCIOUS compared to the original, there is nothing to it, barely sounds like they are moving atall), while the older music is using a modified MT-32 soundtrack, I know it's modified because I have 2 different MT-32 synths and they both have differing soundbanks compared to this release). 

I guess this one is more worth the money for sure, but as usual no time has been spent remastering it's sound and getting THAT working properly, but it isn't enough to ruin the experience entirely.

review:
" 'Disney, esso è un problema che non se come risolvere, e sta peggiore in nord america. Riavendo esso gioco in mia conta, hanno un fallimento di una linea spectrale, non se se è buonno, ma aiuta, parla a la squadra marvel per vedere esso. 




Io sono più pericoloso che il pericolo. Pero io non sono buonno in mentire, esso è mio problema. Io sono si il solo membro da Iz. Hanno cambiatto da Iz a Az, e hanno un mazzo di carte. Sto adesso chiudendo alcuni soggetto circa fantasmme, e di fatto è un problema maggiore quando hanno vanità di trovare perdone mentre giocando nostro problema in il resto di il mondo. E sta insultando alcuni, non è buono, ma per parlare di guerra sacra senza parlare di ipocrisia, è di fatto ipocrita, pero parlare che charla è ipocrità è libertare charla a parlare che noi sono gli opocritta, gli parola sono eguale, pero la fede è ma che parola, e la parola è sacro, pero da il boccio di quale? Io non hanno celibato, tu ha?


Finché adesso senza ritagliare, e mio martello è maggiore che 13 paese.' "

author: {'steamid': '76561198059280749', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1626531631}
review:
What's supposed to be so good about this? Even after reading some of the "most helpful" reviews I still have no idea. Even after playing for almost 2 hours I still have no idea.

Gameplay - Your goal is to do something, and the game doesn't tell you what. Basically "interact with everything until something does something". 
Story/art - Comedy-esque. No relationship to the gameplay.
Overall experience - Incredibly boring.

I hope to all hell I didn't pay full price for this. This is at most worth $2, even if the game were enjoyable to you, the main selling point is the humour and the style of humour is self-parody.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977277922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1626065497}
review:
I first played this game back in the 90s as part of one of the famously great LucasArts packs (it also came with a demo of Full Throttle, and Sam and Max Hit the Road). This game is the pinnacle of point-and-click games. If you ever played Maniac Mansion, it follows some of the same mechanics (using all three characters to accomplish the task). The difficulty isn't what it was in Maniac Mansion - a first-run playthrough might take you six hours before you get the all the puzzles solved (there are some tricky dialog puzzles, like any LucasArts point-and-click). I was impressed after twenty-five years that some of the humor still holds up, and even more surprised at how much I remembered from my first attempts to beat the game at ten or eleven years old.

Added bonus, this game comes with a full playable version of Maniac Mansion as a game within the game (just go to Ed's room and use his computer).

author: {'steamid': '76561199067046737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1660778629}

review: Great game. I'm not a fan of the character design or art style, but the game still won me over. Day of the Tentacle has an interesting game mechanic that pushes it beyond the first game, Maniac Mansion. DotT is worth the money and it fits right in with the rest of this era of Lucas Arts adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129411711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1625784731}
review:
Taking place about five years after the events of [i][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/529890/Maniac_Mansion/]Maniac Mansion[/url][/i] (1987), [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] has the evil Purple Tentacle trying to take over the world following an incident with toxic waste that altered him. Dr. Fred Edison, a mad scientist, plans to stop him by killing him and the good guy Green Tentacle. But Green decides to recruit help from a trio of housemates: Bernard, a stereotypical nerd, Hoagie, a roadie, and Laverne, an unhinged medical student. When Purple escapes, Dr. Fred figures the only way to stop Purple is to send the trio back in time before Purple had a chance to consume the toxic waste. However, a problem with the time machine results in Hoagie being sent 200 years into the past to early America, Laverne being sent 200 years into the future where the world is under the domination of the tentacles, and Bernard being stuck in the present. From there, they must figure out how to stop Purple's evil plans while returning Hoagie and Laverne to the present.

This game is a classic point-and-click adventure game and a sequel to 1987's [i]Maniac Mansion[/i]. Originally released in 1993 and often hailed as one of the greatest adventure games of all time, this specific Steam release is an updated and remastered version featuring improved graphics that was released in 2016. For the purposes of this review, I played the game with the remastered graphics, though an option does exist to play it with the original, early 1990s-era pixel graphics.

To start with the artwork, I found it to be excellent in this release. The developers who updated the graphics for the modern gamer did a great job of enhancing everything while retaining its iconic colorful and cartoony appearance, much of which takes inspiration from classic American cartoons. The graphics even contribute to the game's zany premise and comedy with many sight gags.

The sound design is another excellent aspect as well. There are plenty of musical tracks to listen to during the course of the game and all of it sounds great. I was impressed with the variety such as how some of the tracks from the early America segment of the game evoke traditional American songs. In addition to the music, this game is also fully-voiced. The voice acting all around is superb. The voice actors did a great job imbuing the various characters with unique personalities from Dr. Fred's mannerisms as a stereotypical mad scientist to Laverne's bizarre speech patterns as part of her strange personality.

If the above mentioned aspects were not good enough, where this game truly shines is in the story and writing. Befitting its rather cartoony presentation, this game's writing focuses on comedy with a healthy dose of slapstick and absurdity. It is pretty obvious playing through this that the developers really tried their best to cram in as much humor as possible and I found that it worked well in this game. The game never takes itself too seriously and it contributed to my enjoyment of it. I found myself wanting to continue playing when I should have been doing something else if only to discover the next sight gags or hilarious lines of dialogue. It often makes it worth it to talk to every character and exhaust every possible option to discover more of the humor.

As a point-and-click adventure game, most of the actual gaming is puzzle solving. This includes collecting items and figuring out how to use them. Unlike some other adventure games of the era, including [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] itself, there are no dead ends nor bad ends here. Therefore, the player can try any number of things to get through puzzles without fear of creating a no-win scenario. I did find that some trial-and-error was involved in solving puzzles as some solutions are rather unclear or obtuse. Still, I did not find any puzzle in the game to be unreasonably difficult.

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] is an undeniably classic video game and a seminal work of the adventure game genre. Even if you are like me and have never played [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (though that game is included with [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] as a bonus), people that like adventure and puzzle-solving games will be sure to enjoy this with its excellent, remastered graphics, great sound design, and hilarious writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308518676', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1669638773}
review:
El juego de 1993 remasterizado 23 años después.

Es una aventura gráfica, en la que has de volver a la mansión Edison a liberar a un amigo que hicistes en la entrega anterior (Maniac Mansion). Mientras lo liberas, dejas libre (sin acordarte) a alguien muy malo.
La única solución, cambiar el pasado.

Necesitarás ingenio y usar/mezclar objetos.

[h1][u]PROS[/u][/h1]

La música es excelente respetando la original.

Gráficos muy muy mejorados respecto a la versión de 1993.

Tecla para jugarlo como antes, con sus gráficos e interfaz antigua.

Situaciones muy divertidas y frases jocosas.

[h1][u]CONTRAS[/u][/h1]

Ninguno en particular.

[h1][u]CONCLUSIÓN[/u][/h1]

Muy buen juego para comprar con rebaja.
Así que lo marcaré con el pulgar hacia arriba.

[h1][u]RECOMENDACIONES[/u][/h1]

Como siempre, recomiendo ir haciendo copias entre sesiones de juego del directorio de saves.

[u]Linux[/u]
~/.local/share/doublefine/dott/savedata/

[u]Windows[/u]
<path-to-game>\savedata\

author: {'steamid': '76561198849991142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1621824795}
review:
Lo jugaba de chica y lo tenía en inglés, no entendía un huevo.. pero llegué lejos!
Lo volví a jugar en el celu hace unos años atrás con el emulador ScummVM para Android, lo pasé con un poco de guía porque es un juego bizarro que te sorprende siempre por su forma de llegar a resolver varias situaciones que no voy a spoilear.. 

Y ahora super feliz jugandolo nuevamente, recordando algunas cosas, la versión remasterizada está buenisima, algunos bugs pero es jugable.. 

Los puristas dirán que prefieren la versión original, pero a veces se pierde un toque la magia en cuanto a lo que recordabas del juego siendo niño/a, porque al volver a verlo luego de muchos años decís "wtf", la versión remasterizada está buena para safar de esa pseudo "decepción". Igual te permite jugarlo como original y mezclar entre remasterización y original (lo podés jugar con dibujos remasterizados pero con música 8-bit por ejemplo).

Este juego es re contra rejugable, siempre descubrís cosas nuevas, tiene un humor único, personajes encariñables y no es necesario haber jugado al anterior para disfrutarlo.

10/10 por 100pre

author: {'steamid': '76561197999124638', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1569020019}
review: Großartiges Remaster eines der besten LucasArts-Adventures und den 90ern! Bernard Bernoulli und seine Freunde müssen die Welt vor dem bösen Purpur-Tentakel retten - in Vergangenheit, Gegenwart und Zukunft. Jede Location wurde liebevoll neu designed und man hat die Wahl zwischen eben diesem Remaster oder dem Original. Ich habe es erstmals nun auch mit englischer Synchro gespielt und es ist einfach grandios. Uneingeschränkt zu empfehlen, die auf großartigen Humor und tolle Adventures stehen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995200857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1621229821}
review:
I wonder if I really have the patience for these old school adventure games anymore. With a lot of games nowadays if I try something 3 or 4 times and it’s not working I tend to start thinking I might be wasting my time and maybe start looking for solutions online.
This is also a very different feeling for me then a couple other adventure games like Grim Fandango. This one is meant to be stupid and silly so I didn’t really find the story quite as engaging. There are some legitimately clever puzzle solutions in here though and I appreciate the fact that you’re encouraged to apply cartoon logic to your problems but overall I appreciate playing a piece of gaming history, even if it’s a bit underwhelming by modern standards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393370650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1620251252}
review:
This is definitely one of the best point and click adventure games ever made. This remastered version is very nice and easily adapted for playing with gamepad as well. It also offers an user-friendly and intuitive menu when we wish to play with kids. My daughter could easily select the options to interact because the images were clear for her.
I strongly recommend to players of all age and particularly for those parents who wish to show to their kids one of their favourite games of their childhood (adolescence). 
I also recommend to play Maniac Mansion (the first one) that is included in this game. You can start the game from the computer located in Weird Ed Edison's room (in the present).

author: {'steamid': '76561198031084474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1682342055}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960388853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1622822704}
review:
The visual upgrade is the best out of these Lucasarts remasters, because it holds true to the original style. Unfortunately the same can't be said about the sound effects and some of them are quite bad, much more weak and lacking of proper bass. Good example is the suction cup noise the Tentacles make. It's more squishy and watery compared to the original.

I hope they remaster The Curse of Monkey Island or Sam & Max Hit The Road, but depending on the ownership rights, that might never happen :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198807980414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1683510677}
review: Animal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1619981596}
review:
What a weird ride it was to replay one of the best adventure games of all time after nearly 30 years! While the remaster certainly did a lot to make DoTT enjoyable in 2021, the core gameplay, which wasn't really changed, stood the test of time surprisingly well. The wacky humour is just as fun as it was in 1993, and while many of the puzzles are really weird, there are quite a few subtle in-game hints on how to approach them. Additionally, you need to do a lot with each character, and you can do a lot that in parallel, so if one of them puzzles gets you stumped, you can move on to other stuff and let your subconscious work on the blocker. The first 75% of the game went by really fast, the final part was a bit struggle-y, but still fun.
Kudos to Double Fine for making this remaster work so well - this one was nearly perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002450835', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1619895433}
review: Day of the Tentacle is a nostalgic adventure game whose humor holds up reasonably well with time. You'll want to have played Maniac Mansion before this one, which you can do from inside this game after a few minutes. It's much less stressful than its prequel in that nothing permanently bad can happen to you, though you'll probably want to look up the random sequence of steps required in a few spots rather than be frustrated for long stretches. With that in mind, it doesn't overstay its welcome.

review: Another one of the Lucas Arts games that I played on my Macintosh as a child. I love the humor, it got better as an adult. Sad to see adventure games like this die out to games like Call of Duty. Still, like a good book, nothing beats another play through for Nostalgia sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002601884', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1619454374}
review:
I have been playing Day of the Tentacle for so long now, that I can't imagine having a gaming collection without it. I originally played the game when it came out and have played it through various means over the years, this remaster easily being the best of the bunch.

Day of the Tentacle has been superbly remastered with fresh looking high definition graphics and lots of remastered audio, including voice acting and music. There has also been a change in the way the game controls. Some may think that the old way is a bit old fashioned and there for there is a new control system. It's a nice new inventory system for those young kids who can't handle things without menu's and controller support. It works very well, but isn't any better than the original. For those who liked that original design, you can still use it and with the original graphics too. All you need to do is hit F1 in the menu.

As a game, it's not the easiest of point and click games but easily one of the more amusing. The story results in three different characters being stuck in three different times in history and you're tasked with guiding them back to their original point in time. It's an interesting idea and works very well for the most part. It certainly helps that all three characters have very contrasting personalities. You've got a nerd, a oddly passive female and the third being a most excellent and chilled roadie. It's the usual pick things up and find out where they go sort of puzzles. But the twist here is that you can sent certain items over to the other characters. It can make things a bit confusing, especially for first time players. But it's quite unique and still holds up well today.

The dialogue is a highlight of the game. Each character has a very distinct personality and it really comes out in the script and voice actors work. They've been very well written and the jokes surrounding each character is very funny. I personally love playing Laverne. She comes across as quite harmless, until she comes out with certain hilarious lines. There's a darker side to her, that's for sure. The music and use of sound effects are also quite strong but it's very clearly from years gone by as no one uses audio like this in games anymore. It does sound date but doesn't reduce the overall quality, thanks to the great remastering.

I love Day of the Tentacle. It's a very unique game in the point and click genre. It has a very distinct look and style that should appeal to fans of the genre. I couldn't recommend it more, especially for the fairly low asking price. It's a classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194972613', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1597095055}

author: {'steamid': '76561198977882071', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1592672272}
review: Epic game remastered ever i play it so much back in the day I actually scratched the disc so bad it wouldn’t play anymore. Really easy to play but might need a guide to help u on the way. I was stuck forever trying to get past a point the solution was stupidly simple but not easy to spot. Even has a feature that puts the screen back to retro standards. Wish sam and max hit the road would join steam. That and many of my other games to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040106431', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1619364764}
review:
I've only played the current remastered version but there is the option of playing the older version from within the game by pressing F1. The game is a point and click adventure with zany and fun characters. The graphics are colourful and well done. Some of the puzzles can be a bit obtuse but nothing that can't be solved given enough time and brainstorming.

Recommended for fans of old school point and click adventure games.

review: Purely a nostalgia hit, this game is entertaining fun but very short.  Some of the jokes still fly around in my brain and I don't know how many years it's been since I first played it.  It's worth it for the nostalgia but also, seriously, it takes like two hours to do the whole entire game if you know what you're doing.  So know that going in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049452840', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1619241127}
review:
Remaster gry Day of the Tentacle to typowy przedstawiciel tzw. przygodówek w których logika nie koniecznie jest wymagana. Gra ma dosyć ciekawe rozwiązanie jeżeli chodzi o samą rozgrywkę bo w tej produkcji wcielamy się w trzech bohaterów będących w jednym miejscu ale różnych okresach. Co powala na "zabawę" czasem i przekazywanie sobie przedmiotów przez dziurę czasoprzestrzenną. 
Jeżeli chodzi o fabułę to jest raczej słaba i nieciekawa. Graficznie też nie powala, ale to bardziej kwestia gustu. Mnie ta kreska nie zachwyca. Fajnie że można jednym przełącznikiem wrócić do oryginalnego wyglądu gry. 
Zagadki i wykorzystanie przedmiotów jest raczej głupawe i bardzo mało w tym logiki, ale trzeba przyznać, że przez znaczącą długość rozgrywki wiadomo co trzeba zrobić i dostrzega się pewne schematy którymi musimy podążać. Czasem jednak możemy utknąć na dłużej. Na pewno osoby chcące zrobić osiągnięcia muszą się wesprzeć poradnikiem bo niektóre z nich są dosyć dziwne lub takie o których zwyczajnie nie pomyślelibyśmy, chyba że ktoś zawsze łączy wszystko ze wszystkim. 
Na plus trzeba dodać jeszcze istnienie w grze innej gry: Maniac Mansion - protoplasty oryginalnego Day of the Tentacle. 
Podsumowując, sama rozgrywka nie przyniosła mi na tyle radości żeby móc ją szczerze polecić. Nie jest to zła gra, ani zły Remaster, ale nawet humor się tutaj nie wybija. Ani to na poważnie brać ani na żarty, takie nie wiadomo co.

Ocena: 5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198159835077', 'num_games_owned': 2057, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1619037230}
review:
Antes que nada dejemos una cosa clara, Day of the Tentacle es una obra maestra atemporal, y si no lo has jugado en casi 30 años pues qué quieres que te diga... primero que te mereces una colleja y luego, que corras a jugarlo ya mismo. Gran continuación de ese Maniac Mansion con un sentido del humor sublime y unas situaciones hilarantes que harán que te partas la caja unas cuantas docenas de veces mientras lo juegas.

Dicho esto, y sin pretensiones de analizar un juego del que ha hablado hasta mi abuela, creo que lo interesante aquí es hablar de este Remastered y los cambios que ha sufrido (y que hemos sufrido nosotros) desde que salió el original.

Por un lado, están las mejoras gráficas que a mi personalmente, no me gustan. Los gráficos pixelados del original pasan a un estilo que pretende parecer dibujado a mano pero que parece más como jugar a un emulador de Super Nintendo petado de filtros y "shaders". Algo artificial para mi gusto y que en estático es resultón pero que en movimiento pierde mucho. Por otro lado, están los cambios jugables, que dejan el famoso SCUMM por un sistema de menús radiales que facilitan un poco las cosas, ya que por un lado en todo momento podrás resaltar los objetos con los que interactuar y por otro, solo aparecerán las opciones posibles. En este caso, todo un acierto que (en teoría) facilita un poco las cosas. Digo en teoría porque algunas cosas son tan absurdas que no se te ocurrirían ni en mil años...

Y eso me lleva al otro punto de vista de la reseña, y es en como hemos cambiado nosotros desde que salió el original. En su momento nos pasábamos horas y horas intentando buscar la solución al siguiente puzzle e intentar avanzar un poco más, cosa que por desgracia ya no es así. Hoy en día tenemos mil juegos por jugar y un internet que, a golpe de clic, nos da la solución que buscamos en cuestión de segundos, por lo que es importante tener en cuenta el tipo de juego que tenemos delante. Si estás dispuesto a volver a los 90 y revivir la experiencia de entonces, con la paciencia que eso requiere, adelante. Si vas a utilizar guías porque de paciencia andas regular, mejor juega a otra cosa.

review:
Für mich ist dieses Spiel nur eins - Nostalgie pur. 
Da es jetzt Remastered erschienen ist, musste ich mir das natürlich auch zulegen. 
Kniffelig war es immer schon. Aber selbst nun als "Erwachsener" ist es das noch. Die vielen Trophäen lassen sich mit Mühe auf jedenfall ergattern - einige sind jedoch versteckt. 
Ich kann dieses Spiel nur empfehlen - typisches Click and Point Adventure

review: Classic point and click adventure game where your goal is to stop a sentient tentacle fro destroying the world. The puzzles are insanely complicated and I was pleasantly surprised by this. If you enjoy Point & Click games you will have to play this golden oldie at least once in your gaming carrier. It's full of pop culture with a good dose of humor sprinkled all over it. Day of the Tentacle was cool way before Tentacle h3n@ai even was a thing, really ahead of its time this one. I would highly recommend playing this game as it's a real gem in the world of Point & Click games!

review:
One of the first games I played on my uncle's PC, along with The Monkey Island I & II. Even today, when I think about this video game, I remember the hours I spent spellbound by the drawings that appeared on the other side of the screen thanks to a simple floppy disk (God ...) that simply had little.
Great remastering, which only improves the original. One of those games that even those who are not fans of graphic adventure game should play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1580327438}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028542854', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1616065217}
review: Ben öyle küçüklüğünde "point&click" macera oyunlarını yalamış yutmuş bir insan değilim. Sonradan bu türe heves edip klasikleri tüketmeye devam ediyorum. Hal böyleyken bu tarz "remastered" yapımlar da benim ekmeğime yağ sürüyorlar. Nostaljik bir hevesle yanıp tutuşan bir fan olmayıp, 2021 yılında ilk defa gördüğü bir ürünü tüketen bir oyuncu olarak objektif yorumum bu oyunun hala taş gibi olduğudur. Yenilenen grafikleri, modernleştirilmiş oyun kontrolleri, hali hazırda zamansız hikayesi ile oynandığına pişman ettirmeyecek bir yapım doğrusu. Her ne kadar orjinali çok eski zamanlara dayansa da tarihdaşları gibi absürt, akla gelmeyecek ve hikayeye uyumsuz bulmacalara sahip değil. Biraz kafa yorulunca ve hikaye takip edilince ne yapacağınızı anlayabiliyorsunuz. Orta seviye bir ingilizce de genel olarak oyunu anlamaya yetiyor zaten. Ayrıca istediğimiz zaman tek tuşla oyunu 1993 yılındaki orjinaline çevirip tekrar "remastered" haline getirebilmemiz de pastanın üzerindeki çileği. Türü seviyorsanız tatava yapmayın, oynayın, oynamak isteyene önerin dostlarım.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062206693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1611385677}
review:
[h1]A 90’s cult classic returns in remastered glory for modern enjoyment[/h1]
[b]This review contains no spoilers.[/b]

[h2][u]Overview[/u][/h2]
[i]Day of the Tentacle – Remastered[/i] (DotT) is the enhanced edition of an old-school point-and-click adventure game from [i]LucasArts[/i].  This studio is no stranger to the genre and had produced classics such as [i]The Secret of Monkey Island[/i]. [i]LucasArts[/i] had maintained their well-respected reputation with the release of DotT a few years later. In this game, three friends must stop an evil sentient tentacle. Just a typical normal day, right?

[h2][u]Story and Characters[/u][/h2]
The player controls three characters: Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie. Bernard is a stereotypical nerd, especially as portrayed by media in the nineties. Laverne is a crazy-eyed goofy girl with a heart of gold. Hoagie is a total bro and probably my favorite. Dude is totally chill and quite fond of addressing anyone and everyone as “dude”. While they may seem like a group of misfits, they’re all lovable, quirky and clearly care for each other. Each character has their own unique dialog in which their personalities shine through. Hoagie is especially hilarious with his casual demeanor toward the highly unusual, as if everything happening is no big deal. Bernard surprises me with his dialog options. He is more than just a stereotypical nerd; you can play him as a total clown if you want to. Laverne tends to think outside the box, even for a point-and-click game. She has a very memorable and silly puzzle which really exercises her imagination as she makes use of the most odd combination of items. I also like that she has a soft spot for animals.

As for the story – the characters must all come together to defeat a sentient tentacle who is appropriately named Purple Tentacle. It’s totally a silly premise and the game knows it. But damn, does it own it and make it work. I mean, it is called [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i]. You got to expect some tentacles and other zaniness, right? What a crazy day the protagonists get themselves into – it is just full of surprises.

[h2][u]Gameplay[/u][/h2]
The player only controls one of the three friends at a time. They click around the screen on any object they can discover. Otherwise, they may click on the ground to maneuver the currently controlled character or progress to the next screen. They may then send any of the items they claimed to either of their companions not currently controlled. It is up to the player to pick up on hints through dialog and visual cues and piece together what must be done to progress. Really, the entire game is a collection of interconnecting puzzles.

All of the characters have challenges to overcome and some of the puzzles can really exercise the player’s brain. Many are also rather humorous in nature, which is a plus, especially anything centered around Hoagie’s interactions with other characters. Most of the puzzles require transferring items from one playable character to another in order to produce a desired result. For example, Hoagie may find an item but the player may determine he has no use for it. Instead the player can have him send it to Laverne to utilize. It sounds tedious, but item transfer is actually rather quick. Thankfully, it is as simple as dragging items over a portrait of a character rather than walking all the way back to any specific drop-off location.

There are more than just objects to interact with. Plenty of colorful characters are scattered throughout the game for all three playable characters to converse with. Such non-playable characters (NPCs) are often the key to producing new objects to interact with. Otherwise, they may also assist in progression through an event or new scene. There is also plenty of humorous fluff giving a lot of life into the game. Dialog is hands down the best part of this game. Even though the jokes are from 1993, they still hold up today and do not heavily rely on pop cultural references of the time. Anyways, when the player interacts with another character they are given a menu of responses or questions to select from. Once chosen, the character delivers the selected line and the NPC then responds in kind. Often, the character provides humorous commentary or berates the player for asking something stupid and trivial. It’s pretty funny. Only certain conversations and options are required to complete the game. Really, it’s quite fun to purposefully choose incorrect options or just irritate NPCs with a barrage of questions until they refuse to talk to you anymore. I swear I don’t do that in real life.


[h2][u]Presentation[/u][/h2]
Smooth cartoon graphics replace the original’s pixelated artwork. The style works seamlessly with the zany atmosphere of the game and the comical tone throughout the narrative. All sorts of weird objects are scattered about each screen. Everything is drawn super clear – I never once questioned what an object was supposed to be.

Every piece of dialog is voice acted along with optional subtitles. As someone with hearing difficulties, I always greatly appreciate the closed captions. Though, the voice work was well done and I did not always need the subtitles to follow along. Each character sounds quite distinct and the audio is crystal clear. The standout in my opinion is Hoagie and his excellent sarcastic mannerisms.

I don’t quite remember all the music so it doesn’t stand out too much. However, I do distinctly remember at least two tracks. One is an extremely loud rock track – loud enough to shake the house. Literally. It’s totally headbanging. The other was a theme that played for a NPC that was just so fitting I could not help but grin from ear to ear. 

Graphics and sound both still hold up very well in this remastered edition. The upgraded art is most definitely an upgrade from the original; it is so much cleaner.

[h2][u]Specs[/u][/h2]
The original game may be from 1993, but the remastered edition is relatively modern. The game shouldn’t be too demanding on a PC. It’s just an enhanced version of an old classic. That said, I do still run Windows 7 and can confirm the game works fine on the system.

Operating System: Windows 7
Processor (CPU): Intel Core i5-3570K CPU @3.40GHz
Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070
Memory (RAM) 16 GB

[h2][u]Summary[/u][/h2]
DotT is a bit expensive at fifteen dollars for a three to six hour game, so I would suggest to wait for a sale. However, it’s a beloved cult classic for good reason. I have no real complaint about the game – the remaster does a great job bringing it into the modern age. The writing and jokes are timeless and do not date the game – it’s super funny and a good kind of weird. Puzzles seem appropriate for a general audience. They aren’t so impossible that only an adult could solve; but they are also not so simple that a young kid would fly through the game at record speed. There will be some brain teasing. Most importantly, there’s a ton of fun along the journey with tons of humor abound.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986142110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1615338152}
review:
Remaster d'un grand classique du genre.
 Comme les Monkey island cette nouvelle version permet de jouer avec de nouveau graphisme... Ou pas vu qu'une touche permet de garder le mode pixelisé.

Le nouveau mode supprime également le système de verbe propre aux jeux de l'époque et le remplace par un menu-contextuel via le clique droit.

Day of the tentacle est clairement un jeu à faire, mais la bizarrerie, loufoquerie même des énigmes risque d'en rebuter plus d'un. (Au point de devoir trouver une solution.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119517149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1636644073}
review:
This game actually really surprised me. When I first started it and played for around 10 minutes I regret buying it, but after a week or so I gave this game a second chance and I am really glad I did. 

This game is truly amazing if I may say so, I played this game for 22.9 hours as of writing this review and I did two playthroughs. One to enjoy the full experience without a guide and the second one to collect all the achievements I missed. The achievements added a whole new dimension to the game and stimulated the player to explore the environment. I really liked that the same areas looked completely different for different time zones. The old house is in my opinion my favourite.  The game is pretty long for a point and click game which is a good thing. The graphics are on point and really drag you into the game. The game is full of silly humour and little easter eggs. 100% worth your time and money. The only con that comes to mind is that some puzzles are quite difficult, I got stuck around 3 times in total and had to use a guide to help me out. 

TL:DR: A must buy for every point & click adventure enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308470936', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1587953191}
review: I love this game. Before steam was even something I knew about and way before I got into video games I used to play this shit on repeat. I put at least 40h into a game that takes me as little as 55 minutes to get through. When I found out that there was a remastered version on steam I almost screamed. I shouldn't be this happy about a game being remastered but I was. I watched all the cut scenes again, played it with original graphics then again with remastered graphics and I loved ever minute of it.  tried to get some of the hidden achievements which has been fun and I've tried beating Maniac Mansion (and have failed every time thus far). Don't be surprised if I play it again because to me Day of the Tentacle is one of the most re-playable games ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000000237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1613427394}
review:
I know it's an old game, and it's very high on graphic. 
but it was a game that I had when I was a kid and I had difficulty to progress on it as i was around my 14s. I never could finish it because the computer having it got broken and didn't had the disks anymore. so I decided to retry an older game and see if I could manage this time. finishing it in an afternoon so it wasn't that hard but it was still fun and a cool story to go through. 

yeah I enjoyed it after all thos years and it helped me pass an afternoon a bit less wondering about stuff to help me relax. 
so, yes, I would recommend it to people enjoying "point and click games" that you have to use your brain but also have to think in a cartoon style and not like Mist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198238584202', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1619877786}
review:
Ich liebe dieses Spiel, pure Erinnerung an meine Kindheit. Ich habe es auf meinen ersten Windows PC gespielt als es gerade raus kam. Den Vorgänger Maniac Mansion hatte ich noch auf dem Amica 500 gespielt. In der original Version war dieser Vorgänger im DOTT Spiel noch versteckt enthalten. Bei dieser neuen Version hatte ich es vergessen zu überprüfen :-) aber dass könnt ihr ja machen. Ein kleiner Tipp seid kreativ beim lösen der Rätsel :-P
Dass Spiel ist absolut zu empfehlen. Habe DOTT bereits 3-4 mal innerhalb von 26 Jahren gespielt.
