author: {'steamid': '76561198140801438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1612629457}
review: The story and concept are nice, but the puzzles are way too convoluted and not that intuitive. There are also some red herrings mixed in with the clues found in the game in order to misdirect the player, and it doesn't help that there are different forms of interaction with objects to choose from (push, pull, use, pick up). I doubt that the majority of players are able to finish the game without guides or hints. I can just imagine how much a kid would struggle! The humour is also hit and miss. The game does have its charm, but I fail to see why it is lauded as one of the greatest PnC adventure games of all time. It does not hold up to the more modern games of the genre. Colour me disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966812756', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1609279761}
review:
DOTT is the best of the classic LucasArts adventure games. It's a blend of the nerdy humor of Dave Grossman, the subtle hints of Tim Schafer, the wild artwork of Peter Chan, and all the magic of the legendary LucasArts team. This game has all the good stuff, like mad scientists, tentacles, time travel, IRS agents, bowling, and much more. Now it's beautifully redrawn in high resolution, with remastered audio, and developer's commentary. The only reminder that this is a 30 year old game is the low frame rate of the animations.

Like the original DOTT, this remaster also contains a fully playable Maniac Mansion, but it's just the VGA version without any remastering. MM was the first point-and-click adventure game, the namesake of the SCUMM engine, and the first game to have "cut scenes". MM is an ancient game, but it's still fun to play, and it has multiple different endings depending on which kids you bring along. Beware: it's easy to get into an unwinnable state in multiple different ways, for example by using the paint remover on anything other than the intended target.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068011823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1555624886}
review:
Das Original war eines meiner ersten Point & Click Adventures und ich war damals schon begeistert vom durchgeknallten Humor und der überdrehten geschichtlichen Zeitreise. Das Remake mit seiner zeitgemässen Grafik war für mich darum ein must have. Hat mir viel Spaß gemacht es nochmal durchzuspielen :-) 

Kann ich jedem Point & Click Rätsellöser uneingeschränkt empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980563719', 'num_games_owned': 1881, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1646312709}
review:
In some ways, this game, and its brethren, are masterpieces.  But in the modern sense, their only kin, from what I've experienced, is something like the Phoenix Wright games, where they follow a certain logic, but that logic isn't strictly [i]logical[/i].  I love these games, and I'm sure some will find this to be a personal fault for me, but I just don't think the gang back in the day, like the developers of PW titles of the current century, really had a tight logic that was implemented through smart clues.

I guess the best example, and this is a spoiler, is [spoiler]the wine getting turned to vinegar.  I'm almost into my 30s at this point, and I really only learned that wine is a crude base for vinegar thanks to a recent video about vinegar on youtube.[/spoiler]  That's something that is specifically acquired knowledge through life, and in no way hinted in the game.  I'm not saying that this makes it a bad game, because frankly I love this title, even if I was only ever able to beat it years after I first played it as a child (probably around high school).  I'm just saying that if you plan to beat these games without ever resorting to a guide, good luck.  Perhaps there's a better hint system within the remastered version (I've only played through the og mode, using remastered audio), but I don't believe this is true.

As much as I complain though, I still think these are wonderful, approachable adventures titles.  These are games that I think could lead people into less approachable titles, since even earlier titles lack even the few training wheels this does.  If you even have an inkling of an interest to play these games, please, do so...just pack a guide book for when you get stuck, or play it with some friends, maybe those who have beaten it before.  I think that's part of the issue with games like these: back in the day, you had magazines to give you hints, and friends to talk about the game with, whether in real life or on a BBS.  But these days, those are all deemed slight forms of cheating, and while I'm sure people exist who beat these games with no hints or discussion whatsoever, I have to imagine they are few and far between.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963509361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1611426075}
review:
Recommended - but overall I would say it's not one of the best LucasArts point and click games. I was actually a bit disappointed after playing it. I admit my first foray into the genre was Grim Fandango (when first released) and Monkey Island 2 and felt this was weaker, but in terms of the story and humour. The puzzles are a bit more straight forward (for the most part) than the Monkey Island games and it is quite a bit shorter. It also removes the possibility of character deaths.

I did have this on Steam for years before playing due to all the technical issues when it was first released. I would definitely recommend this for fans of the genre but would suggest the Monkey Island games first, which some may think odd given that this was generally considered (at the time) as superior to Monkey Island 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964524379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1612016429}
review: Que decir de esta gran obra maestra de Lucasarts. Es el Day of the tentacle de siempre pero remasterizado en imagen y sonido. Con un nuevo sistema de control y gestion del inventario. Se puede elegir si jugar con los controles y el inventario mas actual o con el antiguo, al igual que jugar al juego original con el encanto de sus pixeles o remasterizado. Una de las mejores aventuras graficas de la historia, con un humor desternillante, puzzles ingeniosos y dificultad a la altura de las aventuras de aquella epoca, imprescindible, un juego de 10. Ojalá algun dia los creadores de esta joya puedan hacer un Maniac Mansion 3, el talento de gente como Ron Gilbert, Dave Grossman, Tim Schaffer y cía es increible, no os lo perdais, seais jugadores jovenes o veteranos, os va a encantar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081249868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1611409299}
review:
Estamos frente a una obra que no da puntada sin hilo, llena de imaginación y humor. Nada sobra y todo está puesto por un motivo. Hasta aquí nada que no se sepa. Mi principal problema con El Día del Tentáculo es que es un juego de su época. Bebe mucho de los dibujos animados y de su absurdo, lo que lo aleja de las lógicas a las que nos tiene habituado el anodino mundo real (quién podría imaginarse esto cuando el argumento gira en torno a salvar el mundo de un tentáculo malvado mientras viajamos a través del tiempo). Esto se ha traducido en que me hubiese sido infinitamente difícil pasármelo sin guía. No porque ofrezca pistas trampas o carezca de lógica en la sucesión de los puzzles -al contrario, el juego no quiere hacernos perder el tiempo-; sino porque las reglas con las que juega difieren demasiado de los razonamientos planos y aburridos a los que estoy acostumbrado. Por eso, la resolución de según qué puzzles se me hacía inimaginable hasta que no miraba la receta y asentía ante el ingenioso razonamiento de los desarrolladores.

Si, como yo, no has salido nunca del grisáceo ABC de la vida real tendrás que devanarte los sesos si quieres completar la aventura por tu cuenta. Ten en cuenta que TODO está ahí para ser usado en algún momento, da igual qué rocambolesco método uses para tratar de resolver los acertijos, prueba. No trates de usar la lógica normal. Esto es un parque de diversiones y estamos para pensar como niños.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968379289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1610682528}
review:
I had played some point-and-click adventures back when this originally came out, but not this one.  This game is a blast.  The remaster is top-notch and cleans up the visuals, interface and audio.  The puzzles and are really clever and often funny, though I had to consult a walkthrough a couple of times as I was at a loss for what to do next.  I love the interplay between the three characters' stories and the interesting ways they can help each other.  Some of the jokes fall a little flat for me, but overall it was quite funny.  

I played through the remaster, and then speed-ran the classic version with the creator's commentary on.  I think there was a couple of issues with the classic version as I couldn't get to a menu to save or exit, and there were only about five or six scenes where I heard any commentary.  There were about ten other times where the screen showed "Press 'A' to hear commentary", but pressing 'A' did nothing.  Also note that when commentary is playing, if you leave a room the commentary will stop when the next room loads and you won't be able to go back to hear what you missed.

Good times!  Would definitely recommend for fans of the point-and-click genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1510581089}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is the re-release of the cult classic point and click adventure game from LucasArts.

Story:

Set 5 years after the events of Maniac Mansion, the purple tentacle drinks some sludge from a river next to Dr. Fred's Lab, grows arms, his intelligence increases and he plans on taking over the world. A group of friends Bernard, Hoagie and Laverne, get a call from green tentacle about his brothers plans and set out to stop his plan of world domination. 

Day of the Tentacle plot is absurd, but it's also insanely hilarious and charming to say the least. the writing is top notch and every character you meet is weird, crazy and absolutely hilarious. You can definitely see the reason why when talking about the funniest games of all times, Day of the Tentacle always comes up. The writing is top notch and while there are jokes that don't land, there's always one that will come up soon that will land.

Graphics:

The remaster cleans up the original games low resolution art style and from a pixel-y look, it looks like a cartoon from the 90's and since I absolutely adore that style, I love the art style of Day of the Tentacle. It's such a good looking game, all the colors are bright and pop out at you, it's a really eye pleasing game. Each environment is good looking and it's fun to explore and look around, there's a ton of stuff to see and do.

The character designs are also really good, they are simplistic, but everyone has such a distinct look, which is something I really appreciate. For some this new art style might be a bit too much, but don't fear, you also have an option to revert to the classic look of the game, which awesome for someone like that never got to experience the original version.

Audio:

The audio is also cleaned up and sounds much clearer than the original. The original, had this very Lo-Fi sound which was common for the time, so the music and voice acting was cleaned up for the remaster. There's nothing wrong with the new one, but I really prefer the original version of the audio as it's really much more appealing to me, since I played a ton of 90's adventure games. But again if you prefer it, there is an option to turn the audio back to the original version by playing the classic version of the game.

The voice acting is great, everyone does a great job with their characters. They really nail the crazy characters, like a demented med student, boneheaded rock dude and stereotypical nerd. Even the side characters are voiced incredibly well so that was awesome to hear, since like most 90's adventure games, the voice acting does not stand the test of time.

Gameplay:

Day of the Tentacle is pretty stock standard Point and Click adventure game. Walk around environments, pick up items, talk to characters and solve puzzles. I absolutely adore the genre, it's easily in my top three of favorite genres, however I always had a bone to pick with 90's adventure games, simply for the cryptic puzzles most of them have and sadly Day of the Tentacle is no exception.

A lot of the puzzles are incredibly fun to solve, albeit they are without a doubt leaning on the crazier side, it almost requires to adapt to the games crazy type of thinking to be able to solve the puzzles and I'll admit a lot of them are easy given the context of the story at that particular moment, however a lot of the time the puzzles are really cryptic, considering there's three timelines for you to go through. Each character is stuck in three different points in time and have to send items to each other to help solve puzzles, which immediately makes it much more complex to figure out who needs what, so it requires you to go around the environments and think who might need what from your inventory.

One thing that I have to mention is that this game is a package that includes multiple games for you to play. It includes Maniac Mansion, the original version of Day of the Tentacle and the remastered version of the game. I really liked the fact that I had the ability to play the original version as well as the new one to experience the game like it was in the 90's with the massive HUD that was common to the genre and not to mention play Maniac Mansion. 

Verdict:

Day of the Tentacle is a great adventure game, that I have no trouble recommending to anyone that is even remotely a fan of the genre, this game is simply amazing. It's hilarious, tons of fun and a really cheerful game, that I had a blast going through. Even if you don't like the genre, I still suggest checking out Day of the Tentacle. 

Final Rating:
9/10

Pros:
+ Hilarious story and writing 
+ Great art style
+ Includes original version of the game for those that don't like the remastered version
+ Some fun puzzles....

Cons:
- ....But quite a few cryptic ones too

If you liked this review please consider following our curators at https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198002082616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1607115422}
review:
[quote=Bernard Benoulli (1993)]Sometimes I do stupid stuff, and I don't even know why... as If my body were being controlled by some demented, sadistic puppet-master...[/quote]

I think this quote pretty much sums up the game experience. Also, I'd like to point out this game strongly suggests that [spoiler]killing the hamster using the microwave oven in Maniac Mansion is cannon[/spoiler].

[hr][/hr]

So, how did the remaster come out? It's OK. The new graphics are fine, but the animations limitations are way more obvious in HD. The music is nice, but not as big an improvement compared to the original when played through a high enough quality MIDI soundfont (also it's pretty broken in the current version and some cues play over and over instead of once, a pitty). The SFX is provably what has aged the worst (I really missed some sound ambiance and general sonorization).

Do I recomend it? Well yes of course, it's such a classic. It may be hard to understand how impresive this game is for new audiences, but it's still really fun. You may consider keeping a guide close by though. The game is actually better signposted than I remembered (you may find some very useful tips in item descriptions and conversations) but it can be pretty obtuse sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201613371', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1608222857}
review:
In Day of the Tentacle you play as three characters, Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne. You must time-travel back to yesterday to stop Purple Tentacle from gaining arms via drinking contaminated water and attempting world domination! This, naturally, is more difficult than you would expect. Especially when the crystal breaks mid-transportation and sends Hoagie 200 years into the past, and Laverne 200 years into the future. Also, why is the IRS at the door? Doctor Fred? Doctor- HEY! 

I very much enjoyed playing Day of the Tentacle Remastered. While a lot of people seem to be playing for the nostalgia factor, I don’t actually remember how this showed up in my library nor have I played it before. While I didn’t particularly like the music, the humor, some of the puzzles, and the whole situation you get yourself into is pretty funny. I can see why it has positive rating and I recommend you give it a go.

Ein Klassiker ohne Frage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084223806', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1607811200}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of the classic Lucas Arts games, with its crazy characters, trademark humour and puzzles requiring unconventional solutions.
I haven't played the original game, but it seems that this remastered version made by Double Fine is faithful to its source.
The key element of Day of the Tentacle is that you (almost the entire game) control three different characters thrown into three different time periods, but the characters can exchange items using... a toilet. This creates tons of possibilities and makes puzzles so interesting and creative.
This game is so much fun that, if you like humorous point-and-click adventures at all, there is not a single reason why you shouldn't play this game.

P.S. Actually, in this case you get two games for the price of one, because you can play the original Manic Mansion game inside this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150281233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1606688397}
review: Excellent point&click adventure. Having three characters scattered throughout different time periods demands a lot of creative thinking to solve the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202431291', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1607544079}
review:
[h1] Is it true about you and the cherry tree? [/h1]
Day of the Tentacle is among the best adventure games from Lucasarts, and to see it passionately preserved and updated by most of its original creative staff is great! 

The game itself is really fun, with odd and sometimes obtuse puzzles, great animation, memorable characters and stellar art by Peter Chan.

The character switching mechanic was really well explored too, although sometimes a bit excessive, it was really fun trying to see what could be done in the different time periods! 

The addition of a concept art gallery and developer commentary is incredibly insightful onto how the game was made, I very much appreciate it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198332070155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1607283666}
review:
Yup, that game is good stuff.
Not too easy, not too hard, no tedium walking all over the place or clicking pixels. Day of the Tentacle takes the best of the genre and avoids common pitfalls.

I am personally not a big fan of the art and beauty is in the eye of the beholder or so I heard :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091494295', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1629619201}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of those great LucasArts games that's a good time, with the usual fun characters and humor, puzzles that are just right, and some fun artwork and music that lends into the simple yet cartoony charm of the world as well. If that weren't enough, Maniac Mansion is also included, so one can also play the sort-of prequel.

The system of puzzle-solving in different time periods leads to some unique and challenging puzzles to solve, yet the solutions are almost never that obtuse when one explores the world a bit and when using the object highlighting feature. 

There really isn't much to be said: Day of the Tentacle is one of those good LucasArts adventure games that, while not ground-breaking or anything, is still really well-made, and that’s all it really needs to be. Day of the Tentacle can be fun for anyone willing to sit down and do some creative thinking, and the remaster improves practically everything already great about the game, making it easily worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260401907', 'num_games_owned': 1964, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1606145790}
review:
[b]"Day of the Tentacle" is another masterpiece coming from the golden era of the point & click adventure games genre back in early 90s'. In fact it is iconic. It is one of the best Lucas Arts' games that set some new standards. The story is unique, the puzzles are really clever and its humor is pure art. With this facelift it gets even better. The remastered cartoonish graphics, the sound and the gameplay feel up to date again. You can't miss it.


Manometer: 10/10[/b]


The good
 - This game is hilarious. Fantastic sense of humor. It packs some of the best dialogues and jokes ever written for an adventure game (something you should expect, if you consider that the main goal is to save the world from an evil tentacle).
 - Nice aesthetics. Good cartoonish visuals that keep the spatial deformations of the original game.
 - Puzzles are great. Some of them are really clever. Don't expect the solution to be obvious. You will need to think hard and try many different things to solve them.
 - The whole concept is so smart. The simultaneous development of the story in three points of spacetime is a unique idea (has a lot in common with the "Back to the Future" movie trilogy).
 - The gameplay decision to control multiple characters (as well as exchanging things between them) was not something ordinary at the early adventures games.
 - Nice music that sticks in you mind.
 - The characters are unforgettable. You will love them all. 
 - There are some distinctive smart political comments.
 - You will find some extra content in this version. There is a gallery with a bunch of concept art images. You can also enable developers' commentary while playing the game.
 - You can play the whole "Maniac Mansion" game (another Lucas Arts' masterpiece) from an arcade machine inside the game. What a nice addition.
- This remastered version respectfully refreshes the original version. It keeps the vintage experience of a good 90's adventure game.

The bad
- You can't double click somewhere and go faster. You can't also double click and go to the next screen immediately so walking around may get boring sometimes.
- The puzzles are already hard to solve and they get even harder because the original gameplay system with all these commands (push, pull, pick, talk, open, close etc.) is too complex and obsolete. I'm not sure, but It may should get simplified in this remastered version. On the other hand this change could easily ruin the original experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198990784417', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1689787463}
review:
[h1]Ein Meilenstein des Genres [/h1] 

"Day of the Tentacle" (DOTT) ist vollkommen zurecht in jeder ordentlichen Adventure-Hitliste vertreten. Eigentlich war das Original von Lucas Arts schon ein zeitloser Klassiker. Double Fine hat mit der Remastered-Version aber einen noch zeitloseren Klassiker kreiert, der auch noch in den nächsten Jahrzehnten mit seinem Look, Witz und Charme die Spieler begeistern wird. Egal ob jung oder alt.

Als ich DOTT das erste mal spielte, gab es noch kein allgemein zugängliches Internet und auch noch keine Komplettlösungen. Weder im Printformat noch digital, so wie man es heute kennt. In der Regel gibt es im Internet diverse Komplettlösungen zu einem Spiel. Damals hat man an diesem Spiel noch wochenlang gespielt. Man hing fest, man grübelte und knobelte, oder fragte Schulkameraden nach einem Tipp, wie man denn wohl weiter kommen könnte. Ach das waren noch Zeiten...

Da ich DOTT schon so oft gespielt habe, sind mir eigentlich alle Lösungen direkt wieder in Erinnerung gekommen. Also habe ich heute einen Samstagnachmittag dafür gebraucht, wofür ich bei meinem ersten Durchspielen ohne eine Komplettlösung Wochen brauchte.

Der neue cleane und klare Comic-Look in Fullscreen mit moderner Menüführung, optimiertem Sound und der heute noch erstklassigen deutschen Sprachausgabe macht DOTT heute wie vor 25 Jahren zu einem der besten Genre-Vertreter. Nostalgiker und Pixel-Art-Fans können mit einem einfachen Tastendruck auf "F1" zur Urversion wechseln.

[b] Fazit:[/b] 
Ein tolles Spiel! Wer es noch nicht kennt und gespielt hat, dem sei DOTT wärmstens ans Herz gelegt!

[b] Bewertung:[/b]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198126470078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1663105162}
review:
Great, classic game, definately my favourite one by LucasArts. I bought the game just to support the genre and hopes that Disney may someday resurrect the franchise(which I doubt will ever happen but...)
There's so much potential here.
The remake itself doesn't bring much new to the table... Graphics look like they've been auto-smoothed and anyway, don't really appreciate it so played it in one sitting, with original artstyle and music. Look MI Special edition, those remakes are worth it. 
I recommend the original game(which you can get on ScummVM), but this remake is just for hardcore fans

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1604871374}
review: Day of the Tentacle a classic from what I consider the golden age of adventure games, and this gussied up remaster is probably the best way to experience it. Just keep in mind that, as is typical of adventure games of that era, some of the puzzles operate on bizarre moon-logic that you'd never guess in a million years without a walkthrough, so expect to need to consult a guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148725040', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1527375839}
review:
Classic Point and click game from the 90s, made by Lucasarts before they became Disney, it has charm, humour and a short game for any completionist that wants to 100% it.

To compare to the original, it's totally the same game with improve graphics, i would liked new content or extra gameplay after beat it or new events/puzzles to resolve.

In the end the game is great and was a enjoyable ride for me that played the original DOS game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049213193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1635643257}
review:
I love this game.  Way back in the day, this was the only point and click I'd ever completed.  Mostly because it was on my cousin's computer so didn't have huge chunks of time to play, but still.  I loved it then, and love it now.

I find the remaster fantastic.  It looks, feels, sounds and plays great, and the fact you can press a key and go back to the old school format is very fun.

I really feel this has been handled well overall and can't recommend it enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022824643', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1658789223}
review:
L'avventura grafica che più preferisco in assoluto. Il mio sono sincero non è un giudizio completamente imparziale, è un gioco che mi ha accompagnato da quando sono bimbo. Detto questo la trovo una delle migliori avventure LucasArts: Assolutamente bizzarra, personaggio sopra le righe ed enigmi ben equilibrati (non è il più difficile del suo genere).

Questo remastered è fatto piuttosto bene, Ma l'aumento di risoluzione e grafica mostra in modo più palese i limiti del gioco originale. Parliamo di animazioni a 10frame in un ambiente che va a una velocità di molto superiore, il che rende tutto un po' strano. Ottimo remaster anche delle musiche che risultano più pulite e perfettamente fedeli alla versione originale in MIDI.

Purtroppo per questo gioco niente doppiaggio italiano, ma solo sottotitoli. Se non sbaglio i sottotitoli sono quelli realizzati dalla CTO all'epoca, e se così fosse diciamo che non è proprio accuratissima.

Nota QUASI negativa: Maniac mansion (gioco che si può trovare nascosto nel pc in camera del figlio degli edison) è solo in lingua originale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063328110', 'num_games_owned': 2366, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1596983881}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561197966760304', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1602332204}
review:
I love this game. And old school 90s adventure games. Especially LucasArts/Film & Sierra games. 

I originally played the 'non-talkie' floppy disk version of this way back in the golden age adventure games. I have finished this game numerous times pre-steam (imagine that) and, having not played it for for about 15 years and I still remembered about 90% of it.

Can't recommend this game enough (and ones from this era), these guys had a winning formula back around the early-mid 90s with Loom, Sam n Max Hit the Road, The Dig, Monkey Island, Indiana Jones Fate of Atlantis.

SHOULD I BUY IT: As a remaster in the 20Xs, it holds up really well - story is great, characters are likeable, puzzles aren't stupidly obscure and graphically it runs well on an ultrawide monitor (although with black side bars) but sometimes the audio and text lines would come out of sync - and once I had to reload a save due to being stuck in a 'cut scene' near the end of the game. And coming from ye olde schoole, some of the modern sound effects didn't quite suit compare to it's MIDI counterparts, but this was VERY rare.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970359185', 'num_games_owned': 1332, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1478330580}
review: Au contraire du (pourtant excellent) Grim Fandango - dont la version Remastered s'avérait un peu décevante - Day Of The Tentacle a bénéficié d'un lifting à la hauteur de sa légende. Il est vrai que la mission était grandement facilitée par les graphismes cartoonesques en 2D là où Grim Fandango proposait un jeu pour partie en 3D et s'écartait parfois de la maniabilité classique des jeux d'aventure (ce qui n'excuse en rien la finition désastreuse et d'avoir conservé certaines faiblesses de l'original). Mais Double Fine a vraiment mis les petits plats dans les grands : d'une part les graphismes remastérisés sont magnifiques et l'utilisation d'un menu radial permet à ceux-ci d'occuper tout l'écran et d'autre part les bonus (commentaires audio, dessins préparatoires) feront plaisir aux fans. L'aventure reste ce qu'elle était : un monument d'humour, de situations inventives et farfelues, et de puzzles retors - qui flirtent parfois avec la limite du n'importe quoi sans jamais vraiment la franchir (et les raccourcis sont suffisamment nombreux pour ne pas s'épuiser en vains allers et retours) - pour la plupart liés au fait de contrôler trois personnages à trois époques différentes d'un même lieu. Un pur bijou en terme d'écriture, signé de la dream team du genre. Seule l'animation, exceptionnelle à l'époque, accuse aujourd'hui le coup mais sans venir ternir l'excellente impression laissée par ce Day Of The Tentacle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043114427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 825, 'last_played': 1601437745}

author: {'steamid': '76561198013735252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1600918701}
review: Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a classic old-school LucasArts adventure game that is a must play of all adventure game fans! You'll be playing as 3 different characters in the Past, Present and in the Future to stop the Evil Purple Tentacle! This game is a bit more difficult than other LucasArts adventure games with lots of items, different options and some obscure puzzles. The game has a good story, awesome music, sound and gameplay, highly recommended! I love the nostalgic feeling and the Remastered version retains all of it. Plus, Maniac Mansion is included within the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043991646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1600641639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029608584', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1600646539}
review:
[h3]Hell, did people SOLVE this in 1993?[/h3]

I'm amazed how much time and patience we had in our childhood and youth. I didn't play this back then (rather a fan of Monkey Island and Indy), but lots of friends did.

Playing this now was
[h3]a lot of fun[/h3]
but I seriously couldn't have done it without the guide. Seriously: Who has time for this?

Short list of pros and cons:

+ Relatively small game world (same house, 3 "time zones")
+ Funny characters
+ Great dialogues
+ Antagonist with World Domination Führer-complex

- Music is rather annoying than atmospheric
- I'm not a fan of the abstract style backgrounds

Both cons are actually a matter of taste. The game is great in the bottom line. Sooo much to do and to try. Experiencing the story myself, was a nice walk down memory lane back to my childhood years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166681279', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1612718397}

author: {'steamid': '76561198233456184', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1600591923}
review:
Il giorno del tentacolo rimasterizzato si aggiunge alla lista delle avventure Lucasarts riproposte per dare la possibilità di giocare (o rigiocare come nel mio caso) un classico intramontabile. Stesso iter di The Secret of Monkey Island, anche Day of si presenta ben più di una remastered, ridisegnato da zero pur mantenendo i tratti originali (animazioni e ambienti), si potrà tranquillamente vedere la differenza ingame premendo F1. Rifatte con la stessa cura anche le musiche mentre inedito il doppiaggio, solo in inglese (sottotitoli in italiano presenti). La scrittura è da manuale con il suo humour surreale ricco di gag che ancora oggi funzionano, il gioco è lo stesso di oltre 20'anni fa quindi nulla da aggiungere se non qualche curiosità come essere la prima avventura che vede Tim Schafer e Dave Grossman alla direzione, assieme agli immancabili Ron Gilbert e Gary Winnick (tra l'altro curatori dell'episodio precedente, Maniac Mansion). Parliamo del team creativo che ha dominato le avventure grafiche degli anni '90 e Day of ne è una delle massime espressioni.
Nel complesso l'operazione è riuscita, a corredo troveremo immancabili bozzetti e commento degli autori originali, cloud save e obiettivi.

In conclusione vorrei spostare l'attenzione su alcuni problemi in cui sono incappato per quanto riguarda le musiche che sostanzialmente a volte vanno a volte si fermano, dovuto a qualche incompatibilità con windows 10 stando ai forum della community, dovrebbe essere sufficiente modificarne la compatibilità. Ben più grave il recuperare un paio di dll (msvcp110 e msvcr110 entrambi in versione 32bit e copiarli nella cartella di gioco) perchè nonostante sia installata la versione necessaria di Microsoft Visual C++, il gioco non la becca e non parte. Fastidioso come workaround ma risolve la situazione.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988613991', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1599407943}
review:
First off, a disclaimer for all those old-school white knights out there: I'm not saying the game is bad. I'm saying it's not for everyone.
------
With all this game's charm and humor, with all that "critically-acclaimed" stuff and the reputation of "one of the best quests in video games history" we forget that all this was valid over 20 years ago, when literally anything was much, much worse than Day of the Tentacle and often — pretty ridiculous. Back then game design was usually so bad that we were supposed to make progress in quests not by using logic and wits but via pixel hunting and guessing.

Unfortunately, Day of the Tentacle, having many nice traits that made it stand out in the past, is still one of those quests where you might not be satisfied when you solve a puzzle. The infamous "sense of accomplishment" is not what you feel when you accomplish something *randomly*, only after you have run out of choices and just kept using random items on random objects. And with all the possible combinations (that sometimes make no sense even when they work), you'll get tired guessing pretty quickly. While some puzzles are obvious, other can drive you mad shouting "Really?! How were I supposed to--".

It is often unclear if you are supposed to interact with an object/NPC at all or it's just a decoy because out of dozens of possible interactions none actually work. It is often unclear what you are supposed to do at all. With the slow process of transferring items between characters you'll lose time just doing mechanical work.

You know, what spending time with little to no progress despite the person's best effort called?
Waste of time.

If you have plenty of it, go on and enjoy. I can't just ignore the fact that thousands of people played and enjoyed this game. I believe this is possible.

If you expect making progress only because you are smart, that just might not be enough. You'll HAVE to waste time doing random stuff and praying it does something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004404059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1480111475}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023508607', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1591635801}
review:
L'idée du voyage dans le temps est géniale pour un jeu d'aventure et brillamment exploitée ici.
L'humour Lucasarts est à son pinacle et la stupidité des dialogues et de l'univers font mouche.
La version 2016 transcende l'ambiance cartoon du jeu d'origine, qui reste graphiquement honorable vis à vis des standards actuels.

Seul véritable défaut : certaines énigmes sont tordues, mais moins que celles de Monkey Island 1&2.
Il reste par moment ce côté frustrant : "j'ai plus d'idée, je tente toutes les combinaisons d'objets possibles au pif" mais heureusement pas trop souvent.

Si vous ne devez jouer qu'à un seul jeu d'aventure Lucasarts, c'est celui-là.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085968842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1594895450}
review:
4/5 Day of the Tentacle Remastered on point ‘n click tyylisen seikkailupelin uusintaversio. Itse en ole alkuperäistä peliä koskaan pelannut, mutta uusintaversio maistui sujuvuudessaan oikein hyvin.

Tarinassa seurataan kolmen hahmon edesottamuksia heidän yrittäessään pelastaa maailma ilkeän purppuralonkeron maailman valloitukselta. Suunnitelma menee pieleen jo alkumetreillä ja päähahmot päätyvät aikakoneella eri aikakausiin. Eri aikakausien välillä hyppeleminen nouseekin keskiöön ratkottaessa ajoittain hankaloiksi äityviä, mutta pääosin piirretyn tai sarjakuvan logiikkaa noudattavia puzzleja. Muutamissa kohdin eteneminen meinasi tyssätä, mutta varsin usein tavaroiden siirteleminen eri aikakausien välillä osoittautui ongelman ratkaisuksi ja ongelman ratkettua jäi fiilis, että olisihan tämä pitänyt aikaisemmin ratkaista, duh! Huumoria viljellään joka käänteessä ja vaikka vitsit ovat pääosin melkoisia puujalkoja, onnistui ne muutamaan kertaan houkuttelemaan myös spontaanin naurun hörähdyksen. Sarjakuvamainen grafiikka sopii peliin kuin se kuuluisa nenä päähän, eikä äänimaailmastakaan jäänyt ainakaan pahaa sanottavaa. Plussana pelimaailman sisältä löytyy ilmeisesti kokonaisuudessaan alkuperäinen Maniac Mansion, joka kannattaa myös kliksutella läpi, mikäli se ei ole entuudestaan tuttu. Tosin tämä on alkuperäisasussaan.

Joka tapauksessa mielestäni ehdottomasti kokeilemisen arvoinen seikkailupeliklasikko.

review: There's not much I can say about this game.  It's an incredibly faithful reproduction of a beloved classic (and it also includes classic mode).  The puzzles are doable but require thought.  There's comedy and inane sillyness everywhere.  You seriously can't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029312407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1503959781}
review: I played this as a kid, so when I saw it was remastered I had to get it. I'm a sucker for nostalgia. Anyway, it didn't disappoint. It is still the same story line with maybe a little better graphics, but still with the clever sluthing and puzzle solving as the original. I enjoyed it then and enjoyed it again. Took me a lot less time to complete this time around and it isn't a game I'd play over and over again, but it was worth the price to relive my childhood for a moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137293738', 'num_games_owned': 1638, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1596989614}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered ist eine Neuauflage des gleichnamigen Titels von 1993.
Mit viel Witz, Charme und einer gehörigen Packung Selbstironie rätselt man sich durch dieses gelungene comic look art style pnc adventure game durch.

"Genau genommen sind es sogar 2 games in einem, da man am PC von Ed den ersten Teil komplett nochmal spielen kann, sollte man diesen verpasst haben und nachholen wollen (leider aber nur als englische Version)."

Den ersten Durchlauf hat man in ca 2-4h, je nach dem wie schnell man auf die richtigen Lösungen kommt, geschafft.

Ich habe, auf der Jagd nach allen Achievements, das Spiel ganze 3x durchgespielt und habe mich dabei keinesfalls gelangweilt.

Ich kann es nur jedem empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561199072450111', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1680802726}

author: {'steamid': '76561198284125683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1596599316}
review:
Elle était tant attendue ! Elle est désormais là !

La version remasterisée de Day of the Tentacle est un véritable coup de maître ! L'équipe de Double Fine Productions s'était engagée à nous faire rêver les yeux grands ouverts et l'objectif est atteint !

Retrouvez Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne pour de folles aventures à travers le temps comme.. au bon vieux temps !

Parviendrez-vous à sauver le monde de la Tentacule Pourpre ?

Contient un Bonus: En progressant dans l'aventure, vous aurez l'opportunité de jouer à Maniac Mansion, le jeu aux origines de l'aventure !

author: {'steamid': '76561197997358197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1596925694}
review: This is a classic point and click adventure in the LucasArts style.  Enough challenge to keep you from walking through without stopping to think.  Enough oddball humor and puns to make it interesting.  Most of the solutions make sense.  (I'll admit I had to reference a hint for one of the puzzles that was an interface issue)  No pixel hunting for items.  Playing through Maniac Mansion within the game demonstrated how far these games had come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106146334', 'num_games_owned': 1189, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1596911470}

review:
Классика квестов от мэтров Лукас-Арта! Юмор, колоритные на всю голову персонажи, альтернативная история Америки, злодейский захват мира, и четырехмерные (в пространстве-времени) квестовые загадки - что еще нужно чтоб ублажить ценителя жанра? И каким же приятным сюрпризом, через столько лет, стал ремастеринг!

10 пылесосов-в-каждом-подвале из 10

review: I absolutely love this game. i played this game when it first came out on PC many many years ago and still have the original CD (unfortunately don't have the cardboard box it came in). The remastered version brings back the nostalgic feel but with updated visuals and audio. i have played this game that many times, i know all the puzzles of by heart. double fine studios have done a great job on this remaster. i hope there maybe a sequel at some point. if your into point and click games with dumb comedy fun, then i can't recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088033314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1595508652}
review:
[h1][b]This must be that Woodstock place Mom and Dad always talk about.[/b][/h1]

[h1][b]Full review at [url=https://gamedragons.net/viewtopic.php?f=6&p=266]GameDragons.Net[/url][/b][/h1]

[b]Presentation[/b]
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an overhaul of 1993's LucasArts classic, bringing this almost 3 decades old game to modern hardware with graphical and control improvements while still keeping the appeal and humor of the original untouched, something that is still worth experiencing today. If you've never played or heard of Day of the Tentacle, the original game itself is a sequel to 1987's Maniac Mansion which follows Bernard Bernoulli and his friends Hoagie and Laverne as they attempt to stop the world from being taken over by an evil tentacle. As the tentacle has already set his world domination plans in motion the trio decides to help Dr. Fred Edison, a scientist responsible for the creation of the tentacles, by going back in time to the day before it happens in order to stop it. As that being a success wouldn't set off the premise for an interesting plot spanning more than 5 minutes, the time machine malfunctions sending each character 200 years apart in time from one another, leaving Hoagie stuck in the past during the time of the US' founding fathers and sending Laverne 200 years into the future in a world where tentacles have become the dominant species and humans have been downgraded to being their pets, while leaving Bernard in the present.

By doing this the game spans three different timelines all of which take place in the same location, Dr Fred's mansion, which as you will find out is used for various things in the past and future depending on who inhabited it, but as it is the same location doing different things in one timeline will affect the outcome in another and based on that the game creates intriguing puzzles that require you to send items back and forth in time. Once you get past the introduction you will be able to switch between characters at will and while each timeline has puzzles of its own, many of them require you to pass items between characters using the Chron-o-Johns, which are toilets with the ability to transport items between timelines, allowing Bernard to send items to Hoagie or Laverne and the same thing in reverse for those characters. Each character has a quirky personality that fits the humorous tone of the game perfectly and sets up the stage for many jokes and references which are still funny and relevant today despite the game's age. There is a little bit of humor infused into every part of this game starting with dialogue that even though doesn't influence the outcome of conversations in any way, allows you to respond in various ways and ask other side characters outrageous questions that often lead to funny punchlines.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The interaction system has various options depending on the item you click on, as you can close and open doors, pull or push objects or more basic options like looking and using which are available on most items, but despite the many options you have when clicking on an object that is actually not the part that makes Day of the Tentacles' puzzles confusing because they often make sense from an approach perspective, instead the problem comes from the large variety of items that you can gather in each character's inventory and have to find a use for later on, but remember that you can send items between characters, so picking up an item with one character in one timeline doesn't necessarily mean you will use it there, so you never quite know what is supposed to be used where especially because just like any other early LucasArts games item interactions are often illogical. This is once again not a problem for people who have played the game previously or enjoy this constant exploration aspect for your next movement that clicks, but it will likely be a problem for players who aren't used to this methodology in game design and the remaster doesn't do anything to address that issue, which could've been fixed with a hint system. Even if you are generally good at puzzle games you will most likely end up looking up a guide at some point because the interactions required to progress forward are always something you wouldn't normally think of and the fact that you never know which timeline has to make the next move expands on that problem with more options than you might have the patience to try out.

Unlike some other games in the LucasArts portfolio, Day of the Tentacle never really had camera issues because despite using the same technique and camera system as some of the other titles, the scenes in this game are small in scale, with each room in the mansion being a different scene that you will transition to when you walk through a door, so the action feels smooth and fluid and passing items between characters is easily done using a single menu that opens up your entire inventory which has replaced the chaotic text based system of the original, allowing you to drag and drop items to the other character's icons to the right of the menu in order to send them. 

[b]Graphics[/b]
The graphics have been drastically improved, showcasing the true artistic direction the game was originally going for, but was limited by the early 90s hardware and if you want to compare there's also an option to switch between the remastered version and the original, which gives you a nice perspective on how modern non-pixelated design has such a big impact on the look of the game without omitting anything from what made the original so unique. While the characters and scenery have been reworked into something incredible the effects have received a somehow superficial overhaul with smoke effects for example looking better than the original, but still a bit off compared to the standard in modern visual effects.

[b]Audio[/b]
All of the original actors are still here with Denny Delk taking on the roles of Hoagie, the tentacles and George Washington, while Jane Jacobs takes on the role of Laverne and Richard Sanders plays the role of Bernard and even though they haven't rerecorded their lines for the remaster, the work Double Fine has done on the audio side is enough to bring their voice work up to modern standards, but don't expect anything fancy like Dolby Digital or spatial audio. The soundtrack still hits the same highs it did back in '93, but just like everything else the tunes have been reworked to come as close as possible to modern standards; on the other side the effects range in quality, some seem to have been replaced or reworked while others seem neglected, but it's always something minor like the sound of a drawer opening.

[b]Extras[/b]
If you knew what you were doing from top to bottom you could finish this game in less than 4 hours, but if you've never played this before and want to go through it without a guide you could spend much more than that just trying different item combinations in order to move forward and even with that in mind you might still give up at some point and look up a walkthrough regardless. There are some extras included with the remaster such as concept art and developer commentary, but those are mostly for fans of the original game who want to find out more about the game's development.

[b]Verdict[/b]
Day of the Tentacle Remaster is an amazing redesign of the 1993 classic which still stands tall today in terms of jokes and character design, but has been completely obliterated by the passage of time in terms of gameplay as players nowadays are used to always knowing what the objective is, something that may come as a hurdle for anyone looking to get into this game now, but if you don't mind using a guide or spending many hours looking around trying different combinations, this game is still worth it for the humor and characters alone.

[u]Rating: 6.8[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970394126', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1594842342}
review:
I guess I'm getting old. I picked up the remastered version of [b]Day Of The Tentacle[/b] during the summer sales and realised it's been 27 years since I bought the original version of this game. It's at least 25 years ago since I last played the original but when I launched the game I still remembered all the intro dialogues. The game is even funnier than I remembered, mostly because I didn't get all the jokes and historical references back in the day.

[b]Day Of The Tentacle[/b] is a classic [i]point and click[/i] adventure game with a great story, wacky humour and lots of time travel. When they try to stop a megalomaniac tentacle that is trying to take over the world, three friends are separated in time by a malfunctioning time machine. One character is sent back 200 years in the past, one remains in the present while the third one ends up 200 years in the future. The puzzles are very cleverly designed and quite a few of them rely on the whole time travel aspect of the story.

This is actually a sequel to 1987's [b]Maniac Mansion[/b] but apart from a couple of microwave and hamster jokes, you don't really need to know what happened in the first game in order to enjoy this sequel. However, if you are eager to learn what did happen, you can always play [b]Maniac Mansion[/b] as a game-within-a-game. Being able to play the first game on a computer that you find somewhere in the sequel to that game is exactly the kind of thing that set this game apart from the competition more than two and a half decades ago.

I really enjoyed playing this game again after all this time. The graphics were state of the art back then but have been completely redrawn for this remastered version. As with most (if not all) remastered LucasArts games, you can switch between the original and remastered graphics, which is a nice bonus.

If you've never played this game but you enjoy [i]point and click[/i] adventures, go buy this game. You won't regret it.
If you did play the original game but you haven't played the remastered version yet, go buy it as well. You won't regret it either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031057749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1595371957}
review: A classic point-and-click advenure remastered to look great on today's hardware. Great humor and lots of funny references to the real world. You get to play three different characters who are operating in three different time periods--an interesting twist--and have very different personalities. You can even find the original Maniac Mansion to play for a nostalgia bonus within this game. Great story and interesting puzzles. Overall, a must-have whether you played it back in the day or not...Recommended 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357862916', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1533679331}
review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about this timeless classic? 

Just as when it was released back in 1993, Day of The Tentacle continues to remain as one of the best crafted, comically written, point and click adventure stories ever released. From the opening credit sequence to the epilogue, you will find yourself enjoying some good laughs as you spend more time with each of the unique personalities from the main cast, while navigating them through the constant eccentricities of all the supporting characters.

Double Fine Productions did an outstanding job remastering and preserving this game.

"Damn good coffee!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197996685479', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1458926161}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is among my favourite P&C adventures from Lucasarts. I love the art style, I love the whacky protagonists (especially Laverne, she's a treasure) and I love the idea of having 3 different timelines to play with.

The puzzles aren't something impossible to figure out, but I wouldn't say that they're obvious. They're a good, balanced challenge.

What we get in this remastered version is higher quality sound and 16:9 cartoon-y art, instead of the original pixelated 4:3. The original was already stellar, so this remaster is nice, but not revolutionary.

It's a game I'd recommend to anyone, especially to those who like P&C adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120266234', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1645423593}
review:
Te voy a dar razones para comprarlo, escribiría una muy buena reseña pero me pase toda la noche exprimiendo todos los logros tomando 2 cafés para mantenerme despierto, mira

1 - Compralo si es un juego de tu infancia
2 - es un juego de culto y también unas de las mejores aventuras gráficas con su humor al mas puro estilo de lucas arts
3 - Tiene muy buenas mejoras que se puede encontrar en un remastered, todo esta muy bien hecho
4 - Si es un juego que te memorizaste de chico sea jugandolo a la antigua o viendo walkthrough en youtube con el tema de sacarle todos los trofeos, te sera fácil y muy entretenido, los logros no te estremecen 
5 - Podes Jugar a la precuela del juego en una computadora dentro de la aventura (Maniac mansion) En mi caso la primera entrega no me gusta pero es un buen detalle, Cabe aclarar que hay una actividad dentro de ese "mini juego" para desbloquear un logro

Y para terminar lo único malo que le encontré al juego es que hay diálogos que como que se pausan por que mientras que los personajes hablan en ingles y el texto esta en español como que se buggea el dialogo pero pasa como dos o tres veces en la aventura, no es para preocuparse

mi nota un 9/10, Ahora me voy a dormir por que el café ya esta perdiendo el efecto xd

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 15562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15562, 'last_played': 1593940066}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered brings one of the funniest adventure games of all time back in a way which does not induce eye bleeding while completely retaining the spirit and feel of the original.

There's literally only one thing I can negatively say about Day of the Tentacle. It's neither Curse of Monkey Island nor Grim Fandango, but that's it for criticism.

Well and by today's standards it's a tad short, to be honest. Still, this is definitely worth playing, being one of the major games which impacted the entire genre for the decades that followed after.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007312861', 'num_games_owned': 1364, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1593816911}
review:
⭐Extreme Makeover⭐

Day of Tentacle, sorti en 1993... plus de 25 ans... à l'époque, j'étais jeune et innocent, pas un cheveu blanc, la truffe humide et le poil soyeux... Et que vois-je un remaster ? Et la question que je me suis posé : est-ce que le studio Double Fine a su soigner ce chef-d’œuvre du Point and Click de ma génération ? Oui parce qu'on ne va pas se mentir, il faut dire que la version originale a pris un coup de vieux et pique les yeux. Alors sommes-nous face une qualité qui permet de céder aux chants des sirènes ?

Déjà, je vais rassurer les vieux clous. Le studio a laissé intact les dialogues ainsi que l'histoire. Pourquoi modifier ce qui, à mon sens, constituer déjà à l'époque l'un des plus gros point fort du jeu ?

Un jour sans fin ?

Vous vous retrouvez à diriger Hoagie, Bernard et Laverne, trois personnages aux personnalités bien tranchées. Nos protagonistes vont partir dans l'espace-temps via des chrono-wc pour sauver le monde de la tentacule pourpre qui suite à une expérience se voit dotée de pouvoirs extraordinaires !

Malheureusement rien ne fonctionne comme prévu et nos trois compagnons se retrouvent bloqués dans trois époques différentes : l'un 200 ans dans le passé, l'autre dans le présent et le dernier 200 ans dans le futur.

Fracture de la rétine et double rupture du cristallin

Clairement on constate que les gars du studio n'ont pas chômé. Les textures ont été retravaillées et le pixel est plus fin, plus propre, plus agréable et flatte l’œil. Mais ils n'ont pas bossé uniquement sur un retexturage, ils ont également planché et retravaillé l'interface afin de proposer une sorte de roue d'action. Au début déroutant (oui, je suis vieux...) mais finalement, le système est plaisant et facile à prendre en main.

Est-ce que je recommande cette refonte d'un jeu de plus de 25 ans ? Oui, oui et oui. Le jeu de base était parfait et ici, le studio Double Fine lui rend ses lettres de noblesse sans changer ce qui faisait la force des jeux Lucas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1591519533}
review: Day of the Tentacle est une légende. N'ayant pas eu l'occasion de faire ce jeu à l'époque de sa sortie, je me suis lancé dans l'aventure sur cette version Remastered. Le jeu propose de basculer entre les graphismes d'origine et les nouveaux simplement en appuyant sur la touche F1. La démarche est appréciable car elle permet de voir le travail réalisé. Et c'est une réussite. Les graphismes sont réussis et colorés dans le style du jeu d'origine. Le jeu est plein d'humour et on s'attache à ces personnages complètements fous. Un must have pour tous les amateurs de point & click. Ceux qui ont connu le jeu à l'époque de sa sortie initiale seront heureux de voir le superbe travail réalisé et ceux qui comme moi découvrent le jeu pour la première fois auront le plaisir de découvrir cette pépite du jeu vidéo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1537077312}
review:
This is a nicely remastered version of the classical Day of the Tentacle ScummVM (Monkey Island, Indiana Jones) classical point and click adventure.  Guide three "nerds" through a time travel adventure to stop a pair of intelligent tentacles created by a mad scientist from taking over the world.

The remaster works nicely on modern PCs and for fans of the old game or for people who never played it, it might be worth picking up, but not for the full retail price Double Fine are charging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024995538', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1711072277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079795608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1591815741}
review:
I basically got through it in one swoop.
My memory had all the bits still saved. Sorta sad, sorta convenient.
I still love the humor in this one.
As much as I didn't connect with Grim Fandango, this one is brilliant.
Not sure if it's due to better puzzles, my nostalgia for it or the absolutely wacky nonsense going on.

I don't know if I'd suggest anyone to try it as a game, but as the memory that I love it for, I sure do.
I never solved puzzles, I merely remembered them.
So my judgement on the quality and logic of the puzzles doesn't work.
It's done in a way that makes the story funny and wacky.

I'm very thankful that they offer a quick change-switch for the old version.
Some of the new orchestrations are bad, so switching to the iconic sound of the nineties was very welcome.
Good nostalgia, done right. I enjoyed it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138124077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1591518738}
review: I played DOTT as a child back in the 90s on an old MS DOS pc, where voice-over hadn't yet been invented (whaoh!) and sound was limited to MIDI. These where the days where you had to choose your sound card before starting the game (sound blaster anyone??). I fell in love with the game in seconds, and it paved the way for my obsession with LucasArts adventure games for years to come incl Sam & Max, Indiana Jones, Grim Fandango, and all the Monkey Island series. The nutty jokes, the personable style, the hairpulling puzzles. It was only able to beat the game until much later, since walkthroughs weren't a thing just yet (neither was the internet). Still. This game captured my imagination to the max, and has been perfected in this remastered version. It takes everything I loved and made it 2020 incl beautiful art design, voice over, and I love the commentary by the original LucasArts designers. Point and Click at its finest.

review:
It's a pretty funny and charming point and click adventure. There are all kinds of sight gags and the dialogue is great to listen to. It will get a chuckle from you from time to time.
A lot of the puzzle are easy enough to solve on your own and won't give you too much trouble. Solving a puzzle is very rewarding because you are rewarded with another well written cut-scene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198854140232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1662854784}
review: An absolute favorite of my childhood, this remaster is done very well. Deep down I will always prefer the pixel graphics and grainy audio, but it's nice to an update done well when others have failed so miserably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068639706', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1591665719}
review:
This game is simply legendary and defined the Adventure Game genre.

TONS of humour, beautiful art, perfectly balanced difficulty with the puzzles.

Some puzzles might look hard, but they always have a logical explanation. The game's life expectancy is directly tied to you figuring out those on your own. A single clue taken from a walkthrough can remove quite a few hours of gameplay and this game has no replayability, so up to you if you choose to go that way. We used the walkthrough way too much back in the days and I regretted it immensely.

Every gamer should try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032387023', 'num_games_owned': 1899, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1588546426}
review:
I generally dislike adventure games with illogical puzzles. Many people would consider one of the Monkey Island titles their favorite adventure game, whereas my favorite ones would be Sanitarium, Beneath a Steel Sky or the first Broken Sword. My preference generally falls outside Lucas Arts’ scope, but I nevertheless loved Day of the Tentacle.

Similar to its prequel, Maniac Mansion, you control three different characters interchangeably. Your goal is to save the world from the evil purple tentacle! Day of the Tentacle is easily one of the most hilarious video games I have ever played and I thoroughly enjoyed it, despite not appreciating several puzzles.

One word on the perfect remaster. Tim Schafer did an amazing work with this and enhanced the visuals without losing the game’s spirit. You can also press F1 anytime and enjoy DoTT with the good old graphics and audio.

PS: You can access the original Maniac Mansion from within the game too.  

[b]8.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197978976045', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1459114120}
review: Grandes personajes en la aventura gráfica más extraña de LucasArts. Por momentos muy difícil, pero compensa con otros momentos hilarantes. Excelente arte tanto en su versión original como en su versión remasterizada. Si te gustan las aventuras gráficas, las historias sin sentido y pensar fuera de lo común, este juego no aburre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002442896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1589661523}
review:
Esta crítica es una de las más sencillas de escribir ya que hablamos de un referente en el género. Una pieza legendaria. 

Está remasterización supone la fantasía cumplida de todo nostálgico de la época ya que permite disfrutar simultáneamente tanto de la versión clásica como de la modernizada con un estilo de arte exquisito dejando la posibilidad en todo momento de cambiar de un estilo a otro a criterio de cada uno. 

Adicionalmente y para deleite de los incondicionales se pueden activar las voces de los desarrolladores para escuchar sus comentarios mientras se avanza en la historia. Este añadido por si solo es, si es que necesitaban alguna, la excusa de cualquier fan para rejugar este clásico atemporal una vez más. 

El nuevo apartado visual es sobresaliente, una clase magistral de como presentar una remasterización sin alterar nada del juego original. La interfaz se ha simplificado para hacerse accesible tanto a nuevos jugadores como al uso con mando que es otra de las novedades a destacar. 

Sobre el juego como tal no hay mucho que decir a estas alturas. Hablamos de uno de los mejores juegos que se han hecho hasta la fecha en su género. Un título obligado para cualquier entusiasta de las aventuras gráficas o de los videojuegos retro en general. Una auténtica obra maestra marca de la casa (Ron Gilbert) que sigue siendo igual de divertida que entonces. 

La historia es desternillante y algunos chistes y puzzles memorables. Los personajes son historia de los videojuegos y creo que la dificultad está en el promedio de este tipo de juegos con algunas combinaciones locas de objetos que los que vengan de otras aventuras de LucasArts no se sorprenderán en encontrar.

Como detalle no menor mencionar que se puede jugar al Maniac Mansion original que abrió el camino al resto de aventuras con motor SCUMM desde cierto lugar dentro del juego. Un auto-homenaje y un regalo para el que juegue esta secuela de aquel juego primerizo. Un dos por uno en toda regla. 

En resumen está versión remasterizada es la guinda a una obra que marcó la infancia de una generación a la que el boca a boca y los años han convertido en eterna. Uno de los mayores éxitos que se recuerdan de los años dorados de LucasArts en los '90. 

Injustificable no figurar en cualquier biblioteca decente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048498273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1599774520}
review:
TL;DR - One of the best (and funniest) point 'n click adventure games from the most productive era of Lucas Arts.

At Length - This is a true classic in the point 'n click adventure game canon right next to the Secret of Monkey Island. A sequel to the OG Maniac Mansion done in the updated style of the 90s and one of the main reasons Tim Schafer, and now Double Fine is even a thing. This port works really well at bringing the experience to modern PCs with updated visuals for higher resolution monitors and some achievements to help push your playthrough into some interesting directions you might not have realized existed. 

All in all, it's a simple package. But there's good value since Day of the Tentacle is downright hilarious, the puzzles are pretty forgiving but still engaging, and if you press into the game a bit, you also get the OG Maniac Mansion as a bonus, just like you always did. Hard not to recommend to anyone who likes humor. 

Which, is . . . everyone? I hope.
