author: {'steamid': '76561197983887008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1588177332}
review:
One of the best adventure games of all time... but has it aged well? I think it has and the added commentary is great.
I wonder how well the game translates to newer players. I remember this taking longer on my first playthrough years ago, but now it's like a 2-3 hour playthrough because I know all the puzzles. I wish game developers would get on that selective memory erasing technology so i can get more replay value out of this ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198264305879', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1585410746}
review:
This game (and Maniac Mansion) has been somewhat of an obsession for me since I was old enough to play computer games in the mid-90s. My neighbors had the copy of Maniac Mansion before we even had a computer (my parents were weird), and even if we did have one I doubt they would've bought the game.  Eventually as I grew up, my brother supplied me with a plethora of games, including Day of the Tentacle. Which I'm sure most know actually has the full Maniac Mansion game as an Easter egg inside of Day of the Tentacle.  That said, I've probably played Maniac Mansion and Day of the Tentacle more than any other computer game I've ever owned. 

Maniac Mansion came out in 1987, and Day of the Tentacle came out in 1993, but was later remastered (this version). With that being said, the game play is a little more challenging than today's puzzle type computer games because there was not necessarily several ways to progress through the game, and you had to do specific things in a specific order sometimes.  However, that doesn't mean these days you can't get a little help from a walkthrough ;-) 

The sense of humor in the game is somewhat...rare, but hysterical.  The art style is fantastic, but that may be in the eye of the beholder. It definitely appeals to me. It may be my bias talking, from said obsession since I was a kid, but I genuinely do love this game and I would recommend it to anyone who likes The Cave or Thimbleweed Park, etc. because they are incredibly similar and fun games to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119477704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1478630245}
review:
Points positifs : 
- L'univers. Le jeu a beaucoup d'humour au niveau de ses personnages loufoques et ses situation rocambolesques. 
- Les graphismes. En normal ou en remaster, le jeu est beau et fourmille de détails. 
- Le gameplay. Si vous avez toujours voulu expérimenter l'effet papillon, ce jeu est fais pour vous. En effet il repose sur le fait d'avoir 3 personnages à 3 époques différentes : le passé, le présent et le futur. Par conséquent, certaines énigmes pourront se résoudre qu'en pensant en 4 dimensions. 

Points négatifs :
- La difficulté variable. Comme beaucoup de jeux du genre, certaines énigmes s'avèreront assez tarabiscotée.

Pros:
- Escrita cômica fantástica
- Caracteres excêntricos memoráveis
- Gráficos deliciosamente coloridos
- Música eclética
- Desafios criativos da era

Contras:

author: {'steamid': '76561198029266503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1587153149}
review:
Schöne, lustige Animationen und Sprüche bringen das komplette Spiel über Spass. Und wie man es natürlich aus anderen Lucas Arts Produktionen kennt, fehlen auch hier nicht die Verweise zu anderen Lucas Arts Spielen.
Manchmal sind Animation und Sprache nicht synchron und zeitlich etwas versetzt, was aber das Spielgefühl nicht beeinträchtigt.

Kleinere Fehler mit eingestellter Sprache (Audio) "Deutsch" festgestellt:
- Während Sequenzen sollte man nicht den Rendermodus wechseln, denn es könnte passieren, dass das Bild verschwindet und man dann nur noch den Ton hört.
- Intro > Hamster klingelt "Ding Dong" aber statt eines Klingelsounds spricht Hoagie: "Ich glaube, den brauche ich für die Band, Laverne... Du wießt schon, wir könnten ihm den Kopf abbeißen oder so."
- Sequenz Jefferson, Washington oder Hancock springen durch das Fenster, weil der Kamin qualmt: Anstatt dass Sie Feuer während des Sprunges rufen, ertönt von Washington: "... wer war der Idiot, der das Feuer gemacht hat?"

Absolut empfehlenswert.

Aktuelle Content-BuildID: 1377745

author: {'steamid': '76561198304311842', 'num_games_owned': 609, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1634351041}
review:
¡La una de las joyas maestras de LucasArts! Una pieza vital de lo que conocemos como aventura gráfica. Llena de humor, innovación para su época, un pixel art hecho con amor, personajes inolvidables y una historia que te mantendrá adherido al monitor hasta el final, repleta de guiños a películas y juegos de la franquicia, y que recuerdo y sigo jugando con mucho cariño, lo genial de esta edición es que se puede jugar tanto el modo original como el remasterizado, con logros que no son imposibles o tediosos y la jugabilidad de primera como siempre. 

No puede faltar en tu biblioteca si te gustas las aventuras gráficas.

review:
(Test à retrouver sur https://canigeekit.blog/)

Il est difficile de juger un jeu qui a bercé son enfance. J’ai joué à pas mal de Point and Click avec mon père quand j’étais gamin, et Day of the Tentacle était l’un de mes préférés. Je l’ai fini en quelques heures et je me souvenais encore de quasiment tout, 20 ans après. Autant dire que ça rentre mieux que les règles grammaticales.

Day of the Tentacle nous propose de suivre les aventures de 3 potes atypiques et relativement crétins, appelés par un scientifique cinglé pour sauver le monde de tentacules mutantes et maléfiques. Rien que ça. Après une petite erreur technique, nos trois amis se retrouveront dans la même maison, mais à trois périodes temporelles différentes. Il faudra trouver un moyen pour que tout le monde rentre dans le présent, et botter la ventouse de ces envahisseurs visqueux.
On a affaire à un véritable classique du Point and Click : c’est la suite du pionnier Maniac Mansion, développé par les mecs qui ont fait Monkey Island ou encore Zak McKraken. Les mecs qui ont posé les bases du genre quoi. On retrouve donc l’habituel déplacement à la souris, l’inventaire infini, le curseur qui vous indique les éléments du décor, la sauvegarde manuelle. Version remastérisée oblige, certaines vieilles mécaniques de jeu ont été dépoussiérées. Ainsi, les classiques verbes d’action sont remplacés par une roulette d'icônes autour des objets utilisables et des PNJ. Un bouton vous permettra également de passer en surbrillance les objets. Une bonne chose pour les novices du genre, que le gameplay original aurait pu déstabiliser.
La difficulté du jeu est par contre bien d'origine. Vous devrez vous creuser le crâne et être patient pour finir le jeu sans regarder les solutions. Il faudra fouiller les tableaux de fond en comble, être bien attentif au décor pour ne rien louper, bidouiller vos objets entre eux, et dialoguer avec tous les PNJ pour ne louper aucune information. Day of the Tentacle demande de faire preuve d'imagination, d'ingéniosité et de perspicacité. Et si la réponse pour débloquer la situation n’est souvent pas évidente à trouver, elle n’est jamais vraiment tirée par les cheveux non plus, ce qui est un défaut inhérent à de nombreux Point and Click. Le jeu n'est pas spécialement long, mais fait donc preuve d'une résistance qui lui donne une certaine espérance de vie. À noter qu'il n'y a pas de Game Over ou autres temps limités. On est tranquille pour réfléchir, c'est déjà ça.

Le contrôle des trois personnages se fait très facilement, puisque l'on passe de l'un à l'autre en un clic. Malgré leur éloignement, ils pourront s'envoyer des objets (de manière très classe) et devront agir dans la timeline des uns et des autres pour avancer. Les énigmes temporelles sont vraiment bien ficelées, et trouver la solution seul est assez gratifiant.

Une des grandes forces de Day of the Tentacle est son univers totalement barjo. Le scénario n’a rien d’intéressant en soit, mais la situation que vive les protagonistes est un terreau fertile pour des situations absurdes et des rencontres historiques loufoques. Les graphismes et le sound-design sont parfaitement cartoonesques, l'OST un peu vieillotte mais pertinente et rigolote, les personnages complètement tarés, les dialogues bien écrits et très drôles, sans oublier les doublages complètement dans le ton. On savait se marrer dans les 90's.

Cette version remasterisée est l'occasion parfaite de (re)découvrir un grand classique des Point and Click, avec une prise en main simplifiée et des graphismes qui piquent moins les yeux. Je ne peux que conseiller d'y aller. Et j’espère que vous y trouverez le même plaisir que j’ai pu ressentir, il y a bien longtemps. #Lancien.

(Pour info, il est possible de jouer à la version complète de Maniac Mansion dans Day of the Tentacle ! À vous de la trouver, c'est pas si bien planqué).

review:
Faithful remastering. Obviously it's best enjoyed with lots of nostalgia, but I think it's pretty decent point & click adventure even if you haven't played the original game. Considering the original was released -93, the game design is kind of amazing. 
There are couple annoying, nonsensical puzzles but comparing to other games from this time period, I think the puzzles are mostly well designed and can be solved just by trying stuff out and think a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241192086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1584711972}
review:
Das Original ist ja schon etwas älter und das merkt man an vielen Stellen im Spiel auch.
Das macht das Spiel nicht schlechter, es ist nur etwas ungewohnt, wenn man eher Point&Click-Adventures der neueren Zeit gewöhnt ist. [spoiler] Z.B. gibt es keine Funktion, die einem alle Hot-Spots in der Szene anzeigt. Des Weiteren verbleiben benutzte Gegenstände, die man nicht mehr benötigt, trotzdem im Inventar. Ebenfalls eher ungewöhnlich und dadurch verwirrend im Vergleich zu Adventures der letzten Jahre. [/spoiler] 
An sich hat mir das Spiel großen Spaß gemacht. Der Humor ist sehr speziell, aber auch äußerst kreativ. Die Rätsel sind nicht unbedingt offensichtlich lösbar und dadurch zum Teil wirklich herausfordernd, aber dennoch logisch in dieser Spielwelt mit zum Teil doch sehr kreativen und humorvollen Lösungswegen. 
Besonders cool fand ich, dass man hier drin auch den allerersten Teil, also Maniac Mansion spielen kann (wobei der vom Gameplay noch um einiges anstrengender ist). 
Auf jeden Fall klare Kaufempfehlung. Sehr unterhaltsam und Köpfchen braucht man auch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021187376', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1584506546}
review:
I'm not a big fan of adventure games and their illogical puzzles, pixel hunting, and item hoarding. But I've gone back and played a handful of The Classics (most recently Loom and The Dig) and was able to find some entertainment in them. Day of the Tentacle is way worse than all of them and after an hour and a half I could tell it wasn't the game for me.

The humor is fairly juvenile and nothing I saw got even a slight smile from me. The real killer though are the nonsensical puzzles. There's a point early on where you need to collect oil, vinegar, and gold in order to save the world. There are a half-dozen people around to talk to but none of the conversations are about any of those things. There is a "gate" and the only way forward is to find some red paint, paint a kumquat tree red, tell someone that it is actually a cherry tree, then bet him he can't cut it down. What does any of that have to with finding oil, vinegar, or gold? Other than wandering around the entire house, clicking on every single thing, trying every single item combination, and going down every pointless conversation tree...why would you even think that's something you should do?

I did not look forward to several more hours of "puzzles" like that, so I uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999450193', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1462682065}
review:
When I was a kid, my uncle bought me a LucasArts game pack. It was an incredible gift with a plethora of games, one of them was this one. It had me fully immersed, attempting to figure out the puzzles this wacky and bizarre game had to offer. I had never played Maniac Mansion, but that didn't prevent me from being fully engrossed in the story and characters. 

I'd spend hours trying to figure out how to progress and there was no guides online, and the game steers away from common sense with it's hilarious and strange puzzles. It was one of the most satisfying feelings eventually figuring out something and I got to experience it multiple times. 

I can't comment on what it would feel like for someone brand new coming in to play this game, as I knew how to do everything from memory. But it's High Definition rendition made me feel nostalgic, to the point where I called my parents to see if they'd kept it in my old stuff. 

10/10 Would have paid double.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205199873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1583277168}
review:
Ein Klassiker unter den Point & Click Spielen und LucasArts in Höchstform - Ein muss für jeden Genre Fan!
Spielzeit lag bei mir bei ca. 9 Stunden.
Die Remastered Version verleiht dem Spiel einen neuen Glanz, so dass man es nach mehr als 25 Jahren erneut spielen kann, ohne Angst den Augenkrebs zu bekommen oder die Maus wegen original Steuerung nach 10 Minuten entnervt gegen die Wand zu werfen. Wer auf Schmerzen steht, kann das Spiel per F1 jederzeit in Original-Modus umschalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015756989', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1582923519}
review:
Six years after Maniac Mansion, LucasArts mustered up all they had learned about making great adventure games, merging witty humor with interesting and fun conundrums.

Time travel really is a valuable feature here, not just some thoughtless addition, since the game mechanics are nicely tied into the overall premise. The puzzles were still quite hard, but very often after finding a solution to a problem, it suddenly all made sense and a feeling of accomplishment took over my sense of pride for a few seconds before realizing the next obstacle was just moments away.

On top of that, the remastered version only made the game more enjoyable and if you’re ever going to pick up one of the classic adventure games, you should strongly consider Day of the Tentacle.

[b]Rating: 76/100[/b]

[b]Video Review:[/b]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ofav09oHaHk

author: {'steamid': '76561198065346736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1590624684}

review: Very good point & click game from back in the day. It was a childhood favourite of mine! Unique universe. One of the nicest things about this game is how easy it is to just pick up and play. Not nearly as difficult as some other old P&C games, but that's part of its appeal in my books.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081680598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1582620265}
review:
To get straight to the point: I love this game! 
It's been 20 years now since I played it last, back then in the VGA version. It's a good thing that the revised version is just as fun as it was back then! The perfect mix of weird graphics and weird humor - delicious! I can only recommend Day of the Tentacle! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198274484258', 'num_games_owned': 275, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1582420839}
review: Vaya experiencia volver a jugar este juego!, parte de mi infancia y parte de la historia.  A ver la primera vez que lo jugué era muy joven y como el juego estaba en inglés pues me perdía parte del argumento y no entendía algunas cosas, recordaba si algunos movimientos pero no la totalidad, pasaron los años y cuando vi que había una versión remasterizada en steam con subtextos en español fue como un sueño hecho realidad. Al re jugar me di comprendí muchas cosas que en su momento no entendí, y me fue más fácil solucionar el juego sin ayuda. Un juegazo en toda regla, es una gran perdida que la empresa de Lucas Arts haya desaparecido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1582119507}
review:
In questa remaster del classico Day of Tentacle, ritornate ad impersonare un trio composto dal nerd e unico personaggio proveniente da Maniac Mansion: Bernard. Il nuovo personaggio batterista e metallaro Hoagie e infine dalla studentessa Laverne. Storia: Dopo aver ricevuto una lettera dal pacifista tentacolo verde, che li avverte che tentacolo viola è diventato più malvagio del solito dopo aver bevuto delle sostanze tossiche. Ha deciso a conquistare il mondo. Il trio in questione parte verso la villa dello scienziato pazzo Fred Edison. Una volta arrivati vanno alla ricerca del suo laboratorio e una volta trovato, Bernard spiega la situazione e lui li invita ad andare indietro nel tempo per la precisione il giorno prima, per spegnere la macchina che produce rifiuti tossici. Peccato che grazie ad un diamante falso utilizzato per far funzionare la macchina del tempo. Spedisce i tre in tempi diversi dello stesso luogo, Hoagie a 200 anni nel passato, Laverne nello stesso lasso di tempo ma in futuro, per finire Bernard è rimasto nel presente. Ora il trio dovrà trovare il modo di ritornare nel presente e ritornare il giorno prima trovando anche un vero diamante. Questa remastered è fatta veramente bene graficamente e anche il nuovo sistema dell'uso dei comandi, fa diventare Scumm veramente obsoleto. Ma non vi preoccupate, se vi mancano quei tempi, potete sempre scegliere di giocare con la grafica originale, ma solo se lo selezionate nelle opzioni. in più con il tasto f1 è possibile cambiare grafica tra la versione classica e quella rimasterizzata. I punti di forza di questa avventura sono gli stessi dell'uscita originale con scene divertenti, enigmi a volte fuori di testa, tipo quando lavate il carro che puntualmente si mette a piovere. Anche in questa Remaster c'e ovviamente la possibilità come nell'originale di giocare a Maniac Mansion, peccato che non hanno voluto usare la nuova interfaccia anche qui. Ma essendo un bonus, non ci si può lamentare più di tanto. Le pecche di questo titolo sono poche, per lo più di contorno, tipo che in alcuni casi il parlato finisce mentre i sottotitoli ovviamente in italiano, continuano e vediamo il personaggio continuare a parlare senza dire nulla mentre continuano i sottotitoli. O qualche bug grafico del crono binetto che si trova nel futuro e pochi extra, solo il commento degli sviluppatori e le bozze del gioco. Per finire, se volete rivivere un classico delle avventure grafiche, specialmente se non lo avete mai giocato, questa versione è quella che fa per voi. Altrimenti lasciate perdere specialmente se non siete amanti delle avventure grafiche.

P.s: E' possibile giocare il titolo con il joypad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971788120', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1581115735}
review:
This game should not be missing in any serious collection!

DOTT happens to be the first video game I ever played back in 1993 when I was just 9 years old! I remember how fascinated I was about the fact that I was able to interact with the characters for the first time and by doing so proceeding the story step by step. This was a whole new world to me. I also recall myself laughing sitting infront of the screen of my fathers first personal computer that was running on Windows 3.1 with 8MB of RAM and a hard drive with 200MB capacity. Don't get me wrong here, I was not laughing about the system specs, because this system was the bomb back in the days! I was laughing because of how funny and entertaining the story was and how rediculously funny the puzzles where which I was able to solve by giving absurd commands to the characters.

When I saw that the game was remastered I was sceptical at first, because the game was pretty amazing already when it first came out and the visual style is still beautiful until this day. But when I saw how respectful the developers proceeded to preserve the essence of the game by just transforming it to be a little bit more polished without changing the spirit of the game, I had so much fun again today and I got a bit nostalgic when I started to remember some of the combinations one has to find out to proceed in the game. This game is not only beautiful, funny and surprisingly intelligent but very well executed and was way ahead of its time as it is a timeless master piece today! I am looking forward to share this wonderful game with my son some day so he can hopefully have the same experience when he gets old enough to play.

A big THANK YOU to everyone who was involved in the making of the orignal game and all the developers regarding the remake of it.

review:
A long time ago, in galaxy far, far away, George Lucas had a game studio.
Which must have had a restraining order or something against him, or something, because otherwise he never would have let them release a game even half this good.
Classically wacky point and click action and a bizarre story come together to make something most developers today can only dream about - a simple, fun game that people can enjoy playing without breaking the bank.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152174860', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1532272912}
review:
Day Of The Tentacle é um jogo de aventura, lançado pela LucasArts em 93, e é a continuação do jogo Maniac Mansion (de 83). A história do jogo ocorre cinco anos depois do seu antecessor, e começa com o Tentáculo Roxo tomando esgoto tóxico e desenvolvendo várias habilidades e uma vontade insasciável de dominar o mundo. Doutor Fred, o criador do tentáculo, tenta matar o Roxo e seu irmão bom Verde para resolver o problema. Verde pede a ajuda de Bernard Bernoulli e seus amigos Laverne e Hoagie para conter a ameaça de seu irmão, e salvar a sua pele. Contar mais é spoiler. 

Uma mecânica interessantíssima desse jogo é o uso de um banheiro portátil (chamado Chron-o-John) para as viagens no tempo, ideia do Dr. Fred para combater o Roxo. Pode-se controlar os três personagens durante o jogo, e vários puzzles dependem disso e da capacidade de se viajar no tempo para serem resolvidos. Fora isso é um jogo point-and-click normal da LucasArts, com seu humor acertado, gameplay simples e intuitiva, e seu estilo artístico peculiar.

A versão remasterizada, que é a vendida aqui na Steam, foi totalmente melhorada. Os gráficos foram refeitos a partir das artes originais, a trilha sonora foi revisada, e você pode mudar para a versão original sempre que quiser.
Com certeza, esse é um dos melhores jogos de aventura já feitos pela LucasArts, e ainda vale a pena ser jogado.

P.S. O jogo Maniac Mansion pode ser jogado em um dos cômodos da casa do Doutor Fred, em um computador que parece um Commodore 64.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115199273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1578549597}
review:
Day of the Tentacle; a great traditional point & click adventure with a couple of fun jokes to boot.

This remaster improves on all tech levels whilst still retaining the charm of the original. Great Cartoon Style Graphics, Improved sound quality and overall better quality of life enchancements (e.g. U.I & Character Action Menu).

The story of the game is unaltered with the nice addition of developers commentary. The story is about Purple tentacle drinking radiated slug which gives him enhanced intelligence, arms and desire to rule the world. It's up to Bernard, Laverne & Hoagie to all work together throughout different time periods to prevent Purple from achieving world domination.

I Highly recommend this game to anyone who likes story heavy games, point & click adventures or anything Luca-Arts or Double Fine Studios makes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969527004', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1558989688}
review:
Of all the remasters of older games I've played so far, this one is my favourite. It's a faithful 1:1 remaster where they upgraded everything that needed upgrading, namely the visuals and audio, and the end result is just gorgeous.

What makes it so good is the addition of an old-school mode whereby the original graphics and audio are restored at the touch of a button. Press F1, and boom, I'm back in 1993 again... which my old-school heart really, really appreciated.

And best of all the game itself is just so utterly charming and laugh-out-loud funny, that even jaded modern gamers who may never have played a point & click adventure before will find a lot to love.

Thank you, developers, for such an amazing remaster of one of the nineties' very best adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038981648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1475413518}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061892853', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1578261975}
review:
Ein wirklich schönes Spiel, war ein netter Nostalgie-Trip zurück in meine Kindheit.
Die moderne Umsetzung ist recht anständig geworden.

Es steht dem Spieler frei, zwischen Original und Remaster zu wechseln und dabei getrennt die Grafik, den Sound, die Vertonung und die Verb-Steuerung einzustellen. Bei den Verben steht eine Option wie in Monkey Island 3 zur Verfügung, außerdem natürlich die alten, anklickbaren Verben und eine Art "Automatik", mit der ich mich aber nicht beschäftigt habe.

Die neue Grafik sieht bei mir in Full HD super aus, aber in einer anderen Rezension erwähnte jemand, dass es ab 4K Probleme geben soll. Zum Sound und zur Sprachausgabe kann ich leider nichts sagen, da wählte ich die altmodischen Optionen.
Für neue oder ein wenig überforderte Spieler gibt es offenbar eine Möglichkeit, Objekte grafisch hervorheben zu lassen.

Wie auch im Original, ist hier der erste Teil der Maniac Mansion-Reihe im Spiel enthalten und über den Computer im Spiel spielbar.

Bugs: Mir sind nur kleinere Soundbugs aufgefallen. In zwei Situationen wurde die Hintergrundmusik unangenehm laut und überdeckte die Dialoge. Manchmal brechen Charaktere ihre Dialoge ohne ersichtlichen Grund ab, aber das ist mir in der ganzen Zeit vielleicht drei oder vier mal aufgefallen. Kein Beinbruch.
Außerdem wurde im Intro ein Satz zu früh abgespielt und dann an der korrekten Stelle wiederholt. War ein unschöner Einstieg ins Spiel, aber danach lief alles ganz normal weiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058860432', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1578256140}
review:
Im Prinzip werden hier alle Wünsche erfüllt, denn das Spiel lässt sich mittels drücken von "F1" von der Remastered Edition in die klassische Pixel-Version mit original Interface, etc. jederzeit nahtlos umstellen!

Ihr bekommt somit das klassische Spiel und die grafisch überarbeitete Version! Besser geht es nicht...
Im Übrigen mochte ich erst die "neue" Grafik nicht, aber am Ende dachte ich... Wow, klasse umgesetzt!! Man muss sich daran gewöhnen und dann freut man sich, dass dieser Klassiker SO nochmal umgesetzt wurde!

Ich hatte das Spiel damals als Disketten-Version und später als CD-Version, welche noch immer im Original-Karton im Schrank steht. :) Demnach hatte ich das Spiel recht schnell durch, weil ich mich einfach an sehr viele Stellen und Abläufe erinnert habe.

Ich empfehle jedem der das Spiel schon kennt, es einfach zu spielen und (falls man ein Achievement-Jäger ist) es später nochmal durchzuspielen. Der zweite Run sollte innerhalb 1-1,5 Stunden erledigt sein (je nachdem ob man im "Minigame" länger braucht). Run 1 und Run 2 haben bei mir zusammen 9 Stunden gedauert.

Für alle die das Spiel nicht kennen, kann ich Day Of The Tentacle voll und ganz empfehlen, wenn man ein Point n Klick bzw. Adventure-Fan ist. Das Spiel gibt sehr viele Hinweise, die einem auch wenn man mal verzeifelt ist absolut weiterhelfen und es nicht nötig ist einen Walkthrough zu lesen!

Nur bitte... als Tipp! Schaut euch die Achievements NICHT an, bevor ihr das Spiel beendet habt - denn diese sind durch die Bilder ein übler Spoiler!! Beendet das Spiel ganz normal und nehmt euch nicht den Spielspaß... im Zweifelsfall hilft das Prinzip "verwende alles mit allem" wenn die "Logik" im Kopf mal versagt! ;)

Nach meinen ersten Run hatte ich 7 Achievements offen... habt kein schlechtes Gewissen, wenn ihr diese noch mit dem Guide holt, denn auf 3 Stück davon könnt ihr im Prinzip nicht von alleine kommen! Die anderen 4 Stück hab ich einfach verpasst, weil ich gleich "richtig" gedacht hab und somit die falsche Lösung nicht angewendet oder diese nicht mehr möglich war. Wie gesagt... ein zweiter Run dauert max. 1,5 Stunden (die trotzdem Spaß machen!).

Ansonsten besticht Day Of The Tentacle durch verrückte Grafik, tolle Story, Humor und komplexem Lösungsweg (von der Idee her). Eine klare 10 von 10 und absolut sein Geld wert!

Wenn jetzt noch "Sam & Max" als Remastered Edition mit Achievements kommen würde, wär's ein Traum!!

review:
Day of the tentacle ist ein wundervolles Spiel (beachtet meine Spielzeit nicht, da ich eigentlich meine Platin auf der Ps4 schon habe und damals auch die normale Version immer gezockt habe). Ein klassisches click and point adventure, was man von damals noch kennt wie bsp. Monkey island, Maniac, usw.
Wer ein Sprung in die Vergangenheit wagen will, sollte hiermit anfangen. 
Die Musik, als auch der Still ist einfach die pure Zuckerglasur. Kann ich jeden nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450301278', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1577364849}
review: What can I say that has not been said about this game already? I grew up playing this and other Lucasart/Sierra games from that era so they have a special place in my gamer-heart, so trying to be objective might prove hard! Nevertheless this game provides a lot of funny memorable moments that you just dont see in videogames any more, thanks to the style of the developers involved. Its an "easy" game to play, but does require you to think things through, as well as pay a lot of attention to its details, or else you will get stuck wondering around. Still, as long as your on top of your mental game, this game will make you laugh out loud and give you memories for life. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286908061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1575662962}
review: Ce jeu de style "point and click" est la suite de maniac mansion. On retrouve la plupart des personnages du manoir (la famille Edison et les tentacules) et l'histoire est toute aussi délirante et astucieuse. Ce qui rend le jeu intéressant c'est que les objets trouvés dans une époque peuvent servir dans une autre. De plus, l'humour est toujours aussi présent.  J'ai apprécié les petites améliorations qui ont été apportées au niveau de l'interface. Toujours un plaisir de jouer et rejouer à ce grand classique. Thumb up !

author: {'steamid': '76561198084204367', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1536672315}
review:
[Quote][b]Per altre recensioni segui 👍 il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34310167]Curatore in lingua inglese[/url] e il [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url].[/b][/Quote]

Il caro vecchio Day of The Tentacle, gioco che mi riporta alla mia infanzia, ora rifatto con la grafica migliorata.
Divertente come non mai, battute esilaranti e interazioni da morire dal ridere, oltretutto molto facile da platinare, lo consiglio a tutti coloro che vogliono passare qualche ora a divertirsi senza troppe pretese.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986697530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1500816666}
review: It is so easy for an adventure game to go astray, especially one with as complicated of a premise as Day of the Tentacle. DotT takes place in one central location with 3 characters stuck in 3 different periods of history that can exchange inventory items between each other. The fact that this game turned out playable let alone one of the greatest adventures ever made is a miracle. DotT is peak Lucasarts and this remaster gives it the treatment it deserves. Funny, wacky, and filled with clever puzzles that are a joy to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031135822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1575060252}
review:
Großartig!
Jetzt musste ich 26 Jahre warten bis ich DOTT endlich durch gespielt habe! Das warten hat sich aber gelohnt! Ich hatte eine Menge Spaß und konnte zusätzlich in alten Erinnerungen schwelgen!
Als das Spiel raus kam war ich  13. Gespielt habe ich es mit meinem älteren Bruder. Damals war das ja fast noch ein Kampf mit der Steuerung. Außerdem gab es Lösungen(shilfen) nicht irgendwo online (wo wir ran kamen). Damals gab es über einen Freund, der einen Freund hat, dessen Bekannter jemanden kennt, der... die... kannte damals jemanden ...  aus irgendeiner Computer-Zeitschrift gerade mal eine Fotokopie mit einer mehr der weniger guten Lösungsbeschreibung. So war es bei uns zumindest bei Monkey Island (hab ich damals schon durch bekommen. Aber muss eigentlich auch dringend noch mal sein!). Bei DOTT gab es die Lösung bei uns leider nicht. Und ich muss zugeben, ohne Hilfe wäre ich auf das ein oder andere nicht so schnell gekommen! Trotzdem war ich erstaunt, dass das ein oder andere von damals tatsächlich hängen geblieben ist.
Klare Kaufempfehlung für alle die solche Spiele noch mit 10 Disketten auf einem DOS-PC gespielt haben und auch für alle anderen Fans von Point-and-Click Adventures! 
(Aber erst Monkey Island und Indianer Jones durch spielen!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198093227644', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1678555828}
review:
Game's just good ol' nostalgia and glad it's got remaster now, plus you can even play Maniac Mansion while in DOTT. So basically 2 games in one, what an awesome deal and nostalgia flowing. 

But the main problem in remaster that ruins all the joy and nostalgia is the music...
Yep goddamn music dies out whenever feels like it during game and even in idling, wow....
Also sometimes loops some depending on cutscenes, endlessly and that's just goddamn dissapointment. Contacted Double Fine on site and email to fix the problem, but guess there isn't fix and just abandoned game with no new patch to fix goddamn music issue. No music playing = kills the nostalgia mood to continue playing
Another Double Fine mess, end of discussion!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971030586', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1572755421}
review:
I played this as a child, still offline, with no availability to online walkthroughs or guides, it was an utter blast and getting to replay this with renewed graphics and audio felt just as good as it did in my childhood. The remastered version does include the ability to easily switch back to the original graphics and sound, but I can hardly recommend that unless you are a giant pixel enthusiast.  

This version also includes developer commentary, which as far as I recall was not available in the original.

Overall, if you feel like having a laugh at some zaney madness or reliving that zaney madness through vastly improved graphics and audio, then, I highly recommend this game.

420 out of 69.

author: {'steamid': '76561198336244271', 'num_games_owned': 5148, 'num_reviews': 387, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1571580621}
review:
Отличный ремастер, практически от самих авторов. [Шейфер большой молодец, а в плане ремастеринга своего "старья" вообще молодец. Один недостаток - отсутствие перевода на "великий, могучий, правдивый и свободный". Ждём реставрации Психонавтов.]
Полно всяких "дополнительных материалов": и комментарии разработчиков и эскизы тех же разработчиков...
У меня ощущение что ремастеринг самой картинки - это перевод из растра в вектор. [Мне это не шибко по душе и я пользовался исключительно не реставрированной версией - дай бог здоровия, оригинальная версия присутствует тоже]

Рекомендую исключительно любителям оригинальной Day of the Tentacle / фанатам раннего Тима  Шейфера и LucasArts.
Людям посторонним это вряд ли будет интересно.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975748594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1479656557}
review: This game is somewhat hard for me to recommend, although I am not quite sure why. It’s obviously a classic and beloved by many people. Nostalgia alone can’t be the secret to its enduring popularity, because I am old enough to have played “DotT” way back in the day as well. It wasn’t one of my favorite point-and-click adventures back then either, but given LucasArts’ track record of churning out masterpieces in the 1990s, I wanted to give the remastered version another try. Perhaps the specific kind of humor and the characters just never really resonated with me all that much. It still strikes me as one of the weirder and more eccentric adventure games of that era. But the game undoubtedly does have its moments and the use of time travel makes for some fun interactions and creative plot beats. The remake did a good job of bringing the game back, so I will give it that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025286003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1565752951}
review: A fun little game, even has manic mansion within the game itself. It's standard adventure game from the 90's. The updated stuff is a good edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968699211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1574658088}
review:
Perfect remaster. If you played it back in the day, its just the way you remember it. And if you're new to it and looking for a good point and click game, this is one of the best.

The main reason I call this remaster perfect, is that you can switch between the remastered version and the original look/sound just by hitting F1. Great to hear the old songs, and see how it used to look, then switching over and seeing the uncompressed greatness.

In the "remastered" mode,  you can hold Shift and see all interactive objects, making it a little easier. Excellent for kids, great for adults. An endless classic for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392780792', 'num_games_owned': 1441, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1569408059}
review:
It was an ok experience for me. Started to get stuck on the puzzles around halfway of the game. Finished it with a guide after that. Some of the achievements are pretty hard to get because they are pretty well hidden and would either require hours of trying or refering to a guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437708451', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1597228780}
review:
Este juego es, sinceramente, la mejor aventura gráfica de Lucasarts que he jugado en mi vida. Gracias a DoubleFine por remasterizarlo.

Pros:
-Una banda sonora impecable (excepto por una canción que esta diseñada para ser mala)
-Unos gráficos hermosos tanto en el modo clásico como en el remasterizado.
-Unos puzles muy inteligentes y originales.
-Unos diálogos muy divertidos e ingeniosos.
-Los logros son bastante interesantes y te invitan a conseguirlos todos

Contras:
-Se te puede hacer un poco corto
-Hay objetos que no usas para nada pero te dejan cogerlos igualmente (el tapacubos del futuro)
-El hecho de que tengas que enviarle los objetos que necesites a otro personaje antes de cambiar a este se puede hacer un poco tedioso.

Nota: 89/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198045783578', 'num_games_owned': 1383, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1568445841}
review: Yeah this is still a classic and its one of the best remastering of any game I've seen yet.  The modern textures are really well done and the revamped music is the best anyone could hope for.  You still have 90's Lucasart puzzles to deal with and with no hint system still at that.  Your mileage will vary if you can put up with that or not unfortunately, probably best to avoid if this is your first adventure game, but good for veterans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123430465', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1562128226}
review:
Not really much to say on this one, beyond the fact that it's a classic point-and-click adventure game, if a bit short.

I could talk about my late Uncle, who introduced me to this game, and how he passed earlier this year. About what a fantastic person he was, and how our family was shook by his sudden passing. How this game reminds me of him, and how much I miss him.

But most people don't want to read about that in a review for a game about an evil time-traveling purple tentacle.

8/10 for it's actual quality.
10/10 for it's sentimental meaning to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091853591', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1566742960}
review: It seems to me this one is for people who have already played the older game. Nostalgia is literally the only thing this game has to offer. I was not familiar with any of this game's history. Given that, I just picked it up because good reviews, but as a few people have already pointed out, if you judge this game by modern standards and ignore the historically roots of this game, you probably won't like it. The voice acting is terrible and the puzzles are just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994461439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1563998216}
review:
Для любителя квестов - хорошо, ознакомиться с классикой с пристойной картинкой самое оно (как и в прошлых ремастерах по нажатию F1 вернётся старая версия игры). Но пройдя всю игру, отмечу несколько минусов:
1) анимацию особо не трогали, дёрганая как в старые времена
2) управление чуть переработали, но всё ещё не комфорт
3) ачивки портят процесс игры (если собрались выбить их все), ради многих придётся переигрывать большие куски игры, чтобы вернуться и соединить предметы неправильно. легко сдаться и уткнуться в прохождение с ачивками.
4) русификатор существует (не в стиме), но у него свои огрехи - от редких неточностей/косяков, до переведённым ужасным транслитом встроенную в игру "Maniac Mansion" (ей графон не делали, просто обыграли, что типа запустил на старом компе)
Итог: любителям олдскула
P.S. теперь узнал откуда была отсылка в "Петька и ВИЧ спасают галактику" (сцена с поджёгом фальшивой сигары)

author: {'steamid': '76561197987709516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1581974489}
review:
I have played this game so many times I know every move by heart <3 It is one of Lucas Art's most beloved classics - An Epic Point-&-Click Adventure with rememberable characters, fun story, mind f-ing puzzles, an A LOT of humour.
_______________________________

Play this game if:
- You are already in love with the genrea
- You are willing to use a guide cause you might need to
- You want to stop them tentacles from taking over the world!

Do Not play this game if:
- You want the tentacles to enslave us all!
- You ain't got no sense of humour


Verdict: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030643073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1563330635}
review:
Day of the Tentacle has some of the most personality I've ever seen from a point and click adventure, and while it holds up fantastic to the sparse amount of titles in the genre we see now a days, its puzzles and logic are sloppy at times.

The game starts out with a simple premise: take control of three characters in tandem across the past, present, and future to prevent an evil tentacle monster from taking over the world. None of the characters are particuarely likable, but they, much like the world they inhabit, are all written with large amount of personality. The devil is in the details however, as the writing shines the most with the sheer number of little interactions you can find when attempting to use items or interact between characters. It's a level of polish and thoroughness you just don't see. 

Second to this, the game play is slightly uneven.  This is not to say it is bad, but there were certain times I got lost and it became unclear what I really should be doing. You would miss the smallest interaction or prerequisite action and it didn't really feel fluid. When it works it works though. There are times when your objective is clear and you are pulling your resources across the time lines to solve it, but be prepared to use a guide on occasion and then ask yourself how you were meant to figure that out. 

As an addendum to the game play, the three timelines seems conceptually neat, but it is somewhat overused. A mechanic exists that lets you swap items almost at will. Physically using something like a time capsule to send items to the future and playing around with the actual timeline is criminally underused. There were only 4 times that I counted where you make such interactions, and only one of those felt substantial where it physically changes the world around you. The time travel elements are mostly for story and flavor more so than puzzle solving, which is slightly disapointing. 

The game looks great, with what look to be hand drawn animations for much of what happens. The music is serviceable. I can't say I have strong opinions one way or the other. 

Overall, I think this game is great, but I'm not so sure it rises to a level that I could recommend it to people who aren't fans of the genre. If you generally don't'like these games; stay away. If you do or you haven't played something like this, then I would highly recommend it. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198046442428', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1563237183}
review:
Não consegui jogar esse game na sua época, porem tive o prazer de jogar ele atualmente; esse é remake de qualidade.

O jogo é um Point and Click rechegado de puzzles divertidos e com uma boa dificuldade; ele continua sendo dos melhores jogos do gênero ainda hoje

Nota pessoal: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198972954614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1564146914}
review:
瘋狂搞笑的老遊戲，充滿誇張有趣的情節，
雖然帶有一些美國歷史梗，但並不影響遊戲進行。
三位主角分成三路，而前人所做的事又會影響到後人，
彼此分工合作解決問題，設計的很有創意。

author: {'steamid': '76561198050198462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1577757964}
review:
[h1] Tag der Enttäuschung [/h1]

[u] Warum Day of the Tentacle kein zeitloser Klassiker ist [/u]

Es mag am Älterwerden liegen, aber ich ertrage die alberne Story, die absurde Adventure-Logik, die schrägen Figuren (von Charakteren kann man nicht sprechen, eher von einer Freak-Show von gewollt auf komisch getrimmten Klischee-Karikaturen), die windschiefe, bonbonbunte Comicgrafik, überhaupt den ganzen, äußerst infantilen Humor des Spiels nicht mehr so gut.

Als Kind/Jugendlicher habe ich die [u] Lucasarts-Adventures [/u] geliebt, habe aber das originale DotT zu seiner Erscheinungszeit nie gespielt. Es kann also sein, dass ich DotT zu unrecht für etwas kritisiere, was man den Lucasarts-Adventures allgemein zum Vorwurf machen sollte; aber in meiner Erinnerung waren die ersten drei Monkey Islands oder Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade dennoch witziger, hübscher, die Rätsel wenn nicht logischer, so doch immerhin teilweise interessanter und lustiger, die Figuren und Spielwelt lebendiger und abwechslungsreicher, der Soundtrack vielfältiger, liebevoller und einprägsamer, mit einem Wort: diese Spiele waren einfach besser als DotT.

Dabei kann man Double Fine für ihre [u] Remastered-Version [/u] kaum einen Vorwurf machen: Ich habe zwar fast ausschließlich die Klassik-Variante gespielt (die auch problemlos funktioniert hat), meine kurzen Eindrücke von Grafik, Sound und Technik der Neuauflage legen aber nahe, dass Double Fine einen ordentlichen bis guten Job gemacht hat, die Bonusmaterialien sind okay, die spielmechanischen Anpassungen und Komfortfunktionen sinnvoll und zeitgemäß. Das Problem ist eindeutig das Original.

Manche [u] Klassiker [/u] spielen sich (wenn auch technisch veraltet) immer noch genauso hervorragend wie zu ihrer Erscheinungszeit, bei anderen lässt sich wenigstens erahnen, warum sie früher einmal als bahnbrechend galten (und wenn es nur die Grafik war) bzw. was sie dem Medium Spiel an Neuem hinzugefügt haben. DotT aber gehört zu denjenigen Titeln, bei denen man sich heute fragt, wie sie jemals herausragende Wertungen kassieren und zu Klassikern ihres Genres erhoben werden konnten. Sicher, die Unterteilung in drei parallele Handlungs- auf drei unterschiedlichen Zeitebenen (mit entsprechender Interdependenz von Rätseln und Handlungsoptionen) ist ganz nett, bereichert aber die absurde Rätsel-Logik letztendlich nur geringfügig und sorgt zudem für unnötiges, lästiges Hin- und Herlaufen, damit man Gegenstände von festen Punkten aus per Klospülung (ja, auf diesem Niveau bewegt sich der Humor des Spiels fast durchgehend!) in andere Zeitebenen transportieren kann (was sicher einfacher zu lösen gewesen wäre). Und weil sich das Spiel dadurch auf einen einzigen Handlungsort mit mehreren Räumen (wenn auch zu unterschiedlichen Zeiten) beschränkt, wirkt es auch noch redundanter und abwechslungsärmer, Items dagegen können gleichzeitig in vielen Räumen ausprobiert werden, die Lösungen für Rätsel sind weniger offensichtlich und damit insgesamt lästiger (nicht herausfordernder).

[u] Fazit: [/u]

Wer DotT früher schon gespielt und geliebt hat und dieses Erlebnis noch einmal wiederholen möchte, der kann ruhig zum Remastered greifen. Allen anderen rate ich eher dazu, sich unter aktuelleren Titeln umzusehen: mit besseren Geschichten, interessanteren Gameplay-Mechaniken (oder, wenn sie schon kein besseres Gameplay sich ausdenken können, dann immerhin ganz darauf verzichten wie die "Walking Simulatoren" und sich auf ihre eigentlichen Stärken konzentrieren) oder schlichtweg subtilerem Humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121539011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1656193951}
review:
O que falar deste jogo..Joguei ele pela primeira vez em meados da déc. 90 (creio 1995), fiquei embasbacado, foi uma grande época no qual a lucas arts nadava de braçada com seus títulos. Foi uma época que o jogo tinha que ter alma, pois não dava para se garantir com gráficos. 
Enfim, voltando ao day of tentacle, o jogo é curto, mas com uma boa história que entretém do início ao fim.
Apesar de curtir muito, recomendo comprar em promoção.
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198448984535', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1562871446}
review:
Day of a the Tentacle is a Lucas Arts masterpiece and the remastered edition brings it up to speed to today’s graphics. While the voice-acting and audio still does feel a little dated, this is still a solid adventure game, even for today’s standards. Going into this, I was afraid the game’s puzzles might have the dreaded “moon logic” issue older adventure games had. I remember struggling with those as a kid. But I’m glad to say that, for the most part, it avoids this problem.

However, I couldn’t beat it guide-free unfortunately, as there were still a couple of puzzles I had to use the walkthrough because of the ambiguous nature of the puzzle.

Still, I just had to consult a walkthrough only once during my entire playthrough and that’s a good thing. The game’s puzzles are not breezy, mind you. You will still need to use your noggin and they will stretch you but never to the point of frustration if you play close attention. There will be a couple of puzzles here and there that might stump you but don’t let that deter you from playing this game.

The wacky humour in the game comes from the typical old-school Lucas Arts Monkey Island-esque writing. I loved the cheeky dialogue from the beginning to the end. Laverne’s section in the future is easily the funniest in the game though all the absurd puzzles are quirky, sure to draw at least a mental chuckle.

If you like adventure games, don’t skip Day of the Tentacle. It’s a gem that still is very much worth playing in 2019.

Final verdict: 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970583371', 'num_games_owned': 3095, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1523865813}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039818408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1551893794}
review:
[h1]Затертая до дыр классика.[/h1]
	Относительно этой игры я не испытываю никаких ностальгических чувств. Причиной тому, то, что я ознакомился уже с переизданием, и незнаком с оригиналом. Но этот квест оказал большое влияние на весь этот жанр. Отсылки к нему или художественные заимствования встречаются довольно часто как в отечественных так и зарубежных играх.
	Игра является продолжением «Особняка маньяка» в который кстати можно поиграть совершенно бесплатно на одном из компьютеров в игре. Игра наполнена юмором, но как минимум треть его сосредоточена на американских президентах и политических деятелях прошлых времен, а значит скорее всего будет совершенно чужда отечественному игроку. Несмотря на это проходится бодро и весело. Но на мой взгляд есть игры получше.
	Переиздание качественное есть два режима прохождения обычное и с комментариями разработчиков. Система из переиздания Monkey Island 2 мне понравилась больше, поскольку там в любой подходящий момент можно нажать клавишу и услышать комментарий.
	Замеченные проблемы: у меня несколько раз возникали проблемы с музыкой. Не знаком с оригиналом возможно так и должно быть.
	[b]Вердикт:[/b] Исключительно любителям жанра, и желающим ознакомится с классикой.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984554624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1696017909}
review:
A masterpiece in its time, this game first graced my screen when I was at primary school. Its stuck around in the collective memories of me, my brother and many of our friends and here it is remastered for modern times.
I absolutely loved the original and doublefine have done a stellar job with the update, showing much love for the original material.
If you like the idea of time travelling nerds, mad scientists and mutant megalomaniac tentacles, then this is the game for you.
Unconvinced? Try it, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112229241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1562441772}

author: {'steamid': '76561198824517887', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1562779915}
review:
I've played this game back in the 90s as a kid. Didn't understand a single word of English language and got some pirated version from my dad as purchasing was not possible here back in the days. I really loved the art style and I've played it over and over as I grew up understanding more and more of it. 
It became some kind of a ritual for me to finish this game, as well as Monkey Island 2: LeChuck's Revenge, at least once a year. Now I'm 33, I've played it at least 40 times and I just did it again, but it was my first time to play it as a remaster and I freaking LOVED IT! This here is one of the best games EVER MADE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971003262', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1688286774}
review:
I have the original on CD somewhere, along with a lot of other Lucasarts classic adventures - Sam n Max hit the road, Monkey island 1 & 2 (though that CD was lent to a friend and he never returned it!), and (although they're not as 'classic' to me) Full Throttle and The Dig. 

I never completed it when I got it, and being pre-ScummVM I had all kinds of problems getting audio to work properly. I ended up giving in on it for a long time (until I discovered ScummVM and tried again). The remaster manages to change just enough to "look better" without changing the art style at all. Nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068332490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1493597629}
review:
Ich habe damals schon das erste Day of the Tentacle gespielt (so mit Drehscheibe als Kopierschutz und Midi-Sound) und damals war es schon Kult. Heute auf modernen PCs und Laptops hat es nichts von seinem Charm verloren. Natürlich kann es grafisch nicht mit den neuen Highend gerenderten Spielen mithalten, hat aber eine schönere Comicgrafik als die meisten neuen Spiele die so auf den Markt kommen.

Auch der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist perfekt, nicht zu schwer, aber auch nicht zu einfach. Man muss schon manchmal ein bischen grübeln. Dafür verzichtet das Spiel auf nervige Laufwege, die die Spielzeit künstlich erhöhen sollen.

Ich kann dieses Spiel nur jedem Adventurefan ans Herz lesen. Ein absolutes MUSS

author: {'steamid': '76561197971196940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1685740331}
review: Ouep fidèle au jeu base donc sympas et marrant. Si vous avez 40 ans c'est un retour au source lol

author: {'steamid': '76561198046755024', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1562014525}
review:
Having been born in the late 90's and growing up without access to good computers, I had never even heard of this game until youtuber Yogscast Sips started a playthrough of this remaster.

Upon discovery, I wondered where a game like this had been all these years.

To say it is witty is an understatement. The game has such brilliant cartoon zaniness written into it; it really is a shame that the series didn't get a cartoon back in the day. I still find myself reminiscing on my favorite moments and jokes.

Although the puzzles can can be somewhat strange or difficult at times, I still highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090641945', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1549759733}
review:
All right, this is gonna be the easiest review I've ever done in my whole life.

1) Open your favorite browser
2) Browse with your favorite search engine
3) Type "Best Graphic Adventures of All Time"
4) Hit Enter
5) Navigate through the results.

You will find this title in almost all the lists made by sites of up to a minimum reputation (maybe is not at Tito's Blog).
And besides, this title will be at the top in more than half of them.

So it really doesn't matter what I think of it
it really doesn't matter what you think of it
it really doesn't matter what ppl who gives thumbs down thinks of it

This title was, is, and will be, one of the greatest graphic adventure of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027056885', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1554669826}
review: DOTT is a really classic game - one of the first games I ever played as a kid and was one of my favourite games for a long time. Wen I played it back then, it was on a floppy disk so I was really glad to hear it was being remastered so I could revisit it once more. This game is really quirky with a really original concept, funny writing, great characters. It can be challenging at times to work out how to progress, with 3 different periods of time to work between but I was able to beat it as a kid so It's definitely doable. The remaster is done really well too - I love that they kept the option to play in the original graphics and switch at any time.

review: I never played the original, but of course heard much about it. I can only say: I love it! True enough there are some puzzles that are pretty much impossible to solve if you're not either a Point & Click-veteran and or have endless patience with trying every single interaction on every single object, but there are quite a few guides out there that only give hints. And with one of these I had a great time - the humour and charme still works great after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142696065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1638023046}
review:
„Day of the Tentacle Remastered“, kurz „DotTR“, ist das Remake des von Lucas Arts entwickelten und 1993 veröffentlichten „Day of the Tentacle“. Das Spiel ist ein Adventure-Point & Click-Spiel und das Remake wurde von Double Fine Studios entwickelt und vom gleichnamigen Publisher am 22. März 2016 zu einem Vollpreis (VP) von 14,99€ veröffentlicht.

Umfang 
Die Remastered Version beinhaltet die komplette Story von „DotT“ in neuer HD-Grafik, in der man die Welt mit den drei Helden Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne retten muss, da Purpur Tentakel durch das Abwasser (Matschmaschine) komplett durchgedreht ist. Das wollen sie mithilfe der von Dr. Fred geschaffenen Zeitmaschine so schnell wie es geht tun, wenn da nicht etwas schiefgelaufen wäre. Hoagie ist 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, Laverne 200 Jahre in der Zukunft und Bernhard in der Gegenwart ist. Hoagie und Laverne müssen irgendwie zurückgeholt werden, und das ist das mehr oder weniger schwierige Rätsel, grob zusammengefasst.

Die Story dauert, je nach Spielweise und Lösen der Rätsel, um die 2-7 Stunden. Die Rätsel sind mehr oder weniger schwierig. Besonders sticht das Übergeben von Items über das Chron-O-John heraus, was das Spiel um einiges anspruchsvoller macht. 

Es gibt jede Menge Easter Eggs und Anspielungen. Ein besonderes Easter Egg ist das komplett spielbare „Maniac Mansion“, der zeitliche Vorläufer von „DotT“, den man bei Ed Edison am Computer spielen kann.

Außerdem gibt es noch Bonus-Inhalte, wie Entwicklerkommentare und Konzeptzeichnungen, die man ebenso sich anhören und anschauen kann.

review:
Great point and click game. Love the 90's humour! One issue that I faced was that the left-click didn't work a couple of times when I was playing Hoagie BUT I used the SCROLL WHEEL to complete the actions that were required (so it is still playable). Another issue was that I didn't like was how the poor hamster was being treated in this game. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME FOR YOUNG CHILDREN because of the theme of animal abuse that is required for some achievements.  

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197974021466', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1501372394}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045197808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1558988461}
review:
Esse jogo é muito nostálgico pra mim, pois o joguei pela primeira vez há uns 20 anos atrás quando ainda era no DOS!

A história consiste num mundo meio maluco onde existe uns tentáculos vivos e falantes com ambições e um doutor mais maluco ainda querendo fazer viagens no tempo.

Um dia ele captura três pessoas e coloca uma em cada máquina e os envia para diferentes épocas, um para o futuro, um para o passado e o outro continuou no presente.

O objetivo do jogo é fazer os três se encontrarem novamente, mas não pense que por ser um jogo de animação, no estilo Point and Click eu é fácil.

Além de muito divertido, rende boas horas de quebrar a cabeça tentando chegar ao final.

Vale muito a pena!

review: Versión remasterizada de una de las aventura gráfica más míticas de los 90!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980283507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1559333443}
review: Compared with Full Throttle Remastered, Day of the Tentacle Remastered truly shines. A lot of the tweaks made in Full Throttle did not make a great deal of difference as it was quite well mastered originally. DOTT however really needed the remaster it got. The graphics are far better, the sound is fantastic and nothing is lost in the process the game is perfect to the original. They even left in the Maniac Mansion portion of the game and if I remember rightly the DOS version did not have a save feature for MM, this one does which means 90s nostalgia kids like me who did not play MM can finally link the references between MM and DOTT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016534480', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1561301670}
review:
Exactement comme dans mes souvenirs quand j'étais plus jeune !
- L'aventure est complètement dingue
- Les personnages sont complètement décallés
- L'humour est omniprésent
Bref, un point & click LucasArts comme on les aime. 

Seul hic - vis à vis du prix - le jeu se termine en 4 ou 5h

author: {'steamid': '76561197980560121', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1685822255}
review:
Un classique absolu. L'humour est décapant, le style graphique complètement délirant, et les puzzles sont drôles tout en demandant une certaine réflexion (ok, il faut quand même penser à cliquer partout, on reste dans un point & click issu des années '90, quand même).

J'aimerais dire que si vous aimez les point&click, Day of the Tentacle est un indispensable mais... si vous aimez les point&click, vous l'avez probablement déjà ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198012341692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1687996419}
review: A masterpiece of the Point-n-Click adventure genre. Great artwork, Brilliant voice acting and tough but fair puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111049310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1561666433}
review:
I loved the fact that this remastered edition retained the aesthetic of the original [spoiler](as opposed to the new version of "The Secret of Monkey Island" for instance)[/spoiler] because that was what made me fall in love with the game back when it came out. 

Now with the hand-drawn art this gem is also easy on the eyes so there is infinite re-playability value (I play it every few years after I half-forget the riddles/puzzles)!

And the sound is amazing too! Sometimes I just let it play in the background and just enjoy the music. But my favorite is Laverne's voice ("Yoohoo! Mr Tentacle guy!") and the cartoony sound effects.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009500075', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1561833817}
review: Отличный представитель жанра классических адвенчур с прекрасными музыкой, графикой и юмором. Особенно радует хороший дизайн головоломок, несмотря на типичную для жанра абсурдность и мультяшность происходящего. Есть, конечно, некоторые трудности из-за необходимости обмениваться вещами между персонажами, а так же есть пара не очень очевидных решений из-за управления. Но в целом очень хорошо, особенно с поправкой на время выхода игры. Тебе дают подсказки через окружение и через диалоги. Нужно всего лишь быть внимательным. Хотя для новичков это не самая легкая игра, все же стоит отметить.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996403855', 'num_games_owned': 524, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1605531365}
review:
Recuerdo cuando lo jugué por primera vez cuando salió a la venta por el año 1993 o 1994, sus gráficos en ese tiempo sí que se disfrutaban, todo lo que venia del mundo del pc se miraba con asombro, y este juego, al jugarlo, no solo fue eso, si no entretención pura junto a los amigos.

Hoy lo encuentro con mejoras gráficas, pero sigue siendo el mismo, tan entretenido como siempre, no pude evitar mostrárselos a mis hijos y todos lo jugaron a su manera y lo terminaron, ahora paso a ser un juego no solo a gusto mío, si no de ellos, y sé que recordaran esto en muchos años más, si me hubieran preguntado cuando lo jugué por primera vez que mis hijos lo jugarían después, no lo habría creído :D.

Recomiendo este juego a todos en el grupo familiar, es entretenido, fácil de entender, si todavía no lo juegas dale una oportunidad, no solo 5 minutos, si no una media hora y veras que no te despegaras de el después.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084019881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 480, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1560613232}
review:
«Золотая классика квестов» во всей своей жуткой славе!

[h1]Abstract[/h1]
"Golden classic the point-and-click quests" in all its terrible glory! Sequel of the Maniac Mansion. Works fine in a window mode. Ubuntu 16.04.

[h1]Классика, как она есть[/h1]
Это то, во что играли дети и «как бы дети» примерно четверть века назад. Если вы не боитесь фрустрации от того, что не понимаете что нужно сделать дабы продвинуться хоть немного по сценарию, то имеет смысл глянуть. Ну и опять же интернет под рукой, чтобы подсмотреть прохождение. Но сразу предупреждаю, что с логикой тут весьма и весьма неважно. Графика, благодаря ремастеру вполне терпимая по сегодняшним меркам, а вот шутки и мемы, увы, двадцатипятилетней давности, хотя юмор вполне себе узнаваем.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]
В полноэкранном режиме игра может зависнуть при переключении по ALT+TAB и так как данное действие просто необходима для регулярного подглядывания в решение, то лучше запустить игру в виде окна. Благо окно без проблем масштабируется. Мир спасён на интеловском ноутбуке в среде Ubuntu 16.04.

[h1]Обзор входит в список [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1103944566]Игры, Linux, Steam, обзоры[/url].[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198935860349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1560468375}
review: I played this game when it first came out.  It always held a special place in my heart.  Me and my cousin were huge maniac mansion fans.  I never knew they remastered it.  SO MUCH FUN!  I don't really recommend it if you didn't play it as a child, but for us old gamers it is a trip down memory lane you need to take.  Only took 3 hours to do the entire game, but it all came back to me pretty quick....

author: {'steamid': '76561198073435460', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1560454863}
review:
Rhooo ! Trop génial ce jeu ! 18/20. 

Et pondu en 1993... Il n'a pas pris une ride. J'irai même plus loin en disant qu'il est bien plus aboutit que des tas de jeux modernes où le boulot est prémâché pour le joueur avec des énigmes soit trop simples, soit tirées par les cheveux. Là, on a des énigmes par couches, un cheminement non linéaire, il y a un vrai boulot sur les fausses pistes et si on réfléchit bien, on finit par trouver la solution à un moment ou à un autre. Enfin, l'histoire et les personnage sont débiles à souhait et on rit très souvent.

Bravo, Bravo et encore bravo pour ce Point'n Click à l'ancienne !

author: {'steamid': '76561197970680482', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1560089177}

The remastered looks are great, looks sharp and sounds great. 

Play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046685379', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1555016027}
review:
This one is for the ages. If you've been in PC gaming (or gaming in geneal) for as long as me you'll know the swet nostalgia pixel art brings forth. Back when times were simpler, games were longer and required some creative thinking.

When I die i want a list of all the gems I've played engraved on my tombstone. This is one of them. It's going to stay im my Steam library forever. One day the kids of my kids are going to play it and say: Who tought of this BS?! I won't care. I'll be dead with a smile on my face :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198072398496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1560095555}
review: Excellent game all-around. The puzzles can be quite challenging at times, but most of the time they are quite fair. That being said, a few puzzles seem unfair either because they are dated or because its solution may not seem logical at first. I did have to resort to looking for the answer to a few puzzles online, but I must say that if you play this game without any help it will be much more enjoyable. The characters and humor are spot on and I found myself laughing so hard my chest hurt. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who loves puzzle games or the wacky humor of LucasArts games.
