author: {'steamid': '76561198025177115', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1531773910}
review:
I really enjoyed this game
The humor is so funny,
The riddles are nice and fit into the story properly,
They are not too hard, but sometimes it takes time to see the solution.
The mechanics of the game is by clicking on the mouse, and sometimes you have to click on the command that the game writers meant - not what you think - that it's a bit annoying, but bearable.

I had to play a bit with the settings of the sound - and change them to 48000 Hz
 
The humor of the studio always "knocks me down"

author: {'steamid': '76561198370793813', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1531602930}
review:
Просто каноничнейший представитель жанра "point-and-click-квест юмористический", выдержавший проверку временем и ремастером графики только украшенный. И вот только не надо тут с типа умным видом вещать про "жанр квеста умер". Ну, может, с точки зрения replay value (стремящегося, увы, к нулю) и возможности выпускать всякие DLC несколько коммерчески невыгоден, что уж там. Но перестал ли быть приколен и интересен сам по себе? Не считаю, а посему по крайней мере эту классику жанра поставить и попробовать всячески рекомендую.

Да, юмора и ржаки будет много - как типичных туалетных шуточек и ситуаций, вызывающих в уме цитаты из "Красной Плесени" (о, да - "естественно, Ваня был очень культурным…"!), так и достаточно тонкой сатиры с попиранием святынь и шатанием их местных американских "духовных скреп" вокруг Founding Fathers и прочего исторического пафоса. Тут, чтобы оценить юмор, надо всё же врубаться в контекст хотя бы минимально. А чтобы всё это пройти, надо очень и очень обращать внимание на то, что персонажи говорят. Подтексты и намёки очень даже имеют значение!

И надо отдать должное сценаристам - несмотря на некоторый абсурдизм сюжета, сам квест достаточно логичный и простой. За все те 20 с лишним часов, что я за ним провела, в гайд я подглядела всего один раз, на слегка неочевидном для меня моменте с [spoiler]перетаскиванием матрасов[/spoiler]. Обо всём остальном вполне себе можно догадаться самостоятельно, благо предметы используются в большинстве случаев по назначению, и без совсем уж хитровыделанных извращений. Ну, в самом крайнем случае, можно использовать в качестве хинтов/недоспойлеров список ачивок (даже без текстового описания для скрытых, картинки там хватит за глаза), или попытаться поговорить с мелькающей то тут, то там мумией. В общем, тот случай, когда цель - именно развлечь игрока и заставить его подумать, а не банальным брутфорсом комбинировать все предметы со всеми, дабы выпендриться "а мы отакое сложное запилили, хрен догадаешься". И это, как мне кажется, хорошо.

Ещё о сценарии можно сказать, что даже через все ремастеры графики всё равно очень и очень заметно, когда на самом деле делалась игра, и тот самый сценарий во многом остался приметой именно своего времени. Многие ли из тех, кому сейчас меньше 30 лет, навскидку вспомнят, зачем был нужен SP/EP переключатель на VHS-видеомагнитофонах, и как эти самые видеомагнитофоны использовались вообще? А многие ли из детей 21-го века будут удивляться автоматическим дверям так, как мамзель из 1993 года? То-то же. Так что игра вызовет ожидаемый приступ ностальгии у поколения 80-х… и может использоваться в качестве занятного "учебника бытовой истории" и расширения кругозора для поколений уже более поздних - если им, конечно, интересно.  Да и типажи главных героев, вкратце описываемые как "зaдрот" и "гoвнaрь", узнаваемы по сей день и по-своему милы.

Если говорить о более приземлённых сторонах геймплея и общем качестве продукта - порадовало, что откровенных багов замечено не было, и крашнуться игра могла разве что при совсем уж жёсткой нехватке оперативной памяти. Графика перерисована красиво (а если кому и хочется ощутить тёпло-ламповый дух классической DOSовской эпохи - в настройках можно переключить на "старый" режим), звуковое сопровождение тоже достаточно прикольное и не вызывающее диссонанса. Сделано добротно и с любовью. В общем, игра для поднятия настроения - и с этой задачей прекрасно справляется. Однозначный win и полный recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971039128', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1531593517}
review:
A classic Point n' Click adventure game from LucasArts, remastered with updated graphics and UI that keep true to the original aesthetic, and new tunes (retro audio and visuals can be switched to at any time).  Fair warning that the game does not include a hint system, be prepared to have a guide or spend a lot of time clicking on items and verb combinations and seeing what works.  Classic adventure gameplay!

The humor is odd, even for a game set in the 90s.  The talky jokes at first seem lame because of the voice acting, but after envisioning as subtitles the jokes are EXACTLY as I remember these classic LucasArts games.  You have three playable characters existing in three time periods that can be switched to at any moment, with the goal to change the past to prevent the evil Purple Tentacle from taking over the world.  Puzzles can be quite clever, often involving one action as a character in the past to manipulate an event for a character in the future.

As an avid fan of the Monkey Island series this game really hit my nostalgia button.  It's pretty much peak LucasArts adventure gaming and should be checked out for any fan of the style.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083815420', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1498751937}
review:
Ein toller Klassiker in Neuem Gewand. Ein Muss für jeden Adventure Fan. Rätsel alle gut durchdacht. Der Humor kommt nicht zu kurz. Toller Sound. Ein Evergreen. Sollte jeder einmal gespielt haben. 
Aber mir gefällt die alte Version besser. Liegt wohl am Nostalgie Faktor. Negativ viel mir nur auf das bei einem Gespräch die Kamera nicht mitschwenkte zu den sprechenden. Das war in der alten Version besser.
Da Videos mehr als Tausend Worte sagen hier mein Let´s Play:
Remastered: https://youtu.be/7cThbABoV-c
Original: https://youtu.be/xxunXFNTX2o

author: {'steamid': '76561198274245321', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1531260156}
review:

Se non lo avete ancora giocato rimediate SUBITOO

author: {'steamid': '76561197991011889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1465729779}
review:
[h1]Allgemein[/h1]

"Day of the Tentacle" wurde 1993 veröffentlicht, damit ist es älter als viele Spieler. Das 2D Abenteuer ist ein klassisches Point-and-Click Adventure. 

[b][i]Pro:[/i][/b]

Die aktuelle Remastered Version unterscheidet sich kaum vom Original und für alle Gamer Ü30 bringt sie sicherlich Erinnerungen zurück. Das Spiel ist aber nicht nur etwas für weißhaarige Greise. Die Comic-Grafik, der abgedrehte Humor und die schrägen Rätsel kommen auch heute noch gut an. 

Das Spiel ist insgesamt vergleichbar mit den aktuellen South-Park-Titeln, selbst der Humor ist ähnlich. Fans der South-Park-Spiele werden sich bei "Day oft he Tentacle" nicht langweilen.

[b][i]Kontra:[/i][/b]

Eine kleine Warnung an Leute mit wenig Geduld: Die Rätsel sind teilweise sehr anspruchsvoll! Schon damals, im letzten Jahrtausend, wurden Lösungshefte angeboten. Online sind die Lösungen heute kostenlos leicht zu finden. Wenn man selbst nicht weiter weiß, muss man eben die Lösung online suchen (das unterscheidet "Day oft the Tentacle" nicht von aktuellen Point and Click-Spielen). Wer mit nicht intuitiven Rätseln überfordert ist oder Sarkasmus für ein Tiroler Käse-Mus hält, sollte die Finger von diesem Spiel lassen. 

Dass das Spiel schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat, merkt man besonders beim Sound, den müssen jüngere Spieler ertragen können.

[h1]Zusammengefasst[/h1]

Das Spiel ist ein Meilenstein der Videospielgeschichte und für echte Gamer eigentlich ein Teil der Allgemeinbildung. Auch heute noch lohnt sich der Kauf und das kann man, aus meiner Sicht, sonst von keinem anderen Spiel aus dem Jahr 1993 sagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048695648', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1531155424}
review:
Uno de los clásicos de las aventuras gráficas que tenía pendiente. Tim Schafer y su paso por los videojuegos es maravilloso, solo recordar juegos de este mismo señor, como Grim Fandango, me da una idea de la calidad que tienen las obras que dirige.

La animación es sencillamente maravillosa, el estilo artístico es único y el humor está en todas partes (así como las referencias al cine, los videojuegos, etc.).

Vale la pena darle una oportunidad a estas grandes obras una vez en la vida, sobre todo si te gusta este medio, porque de aquí surgieron un montón de conceptos que hoy en día se toman en cuenta para desarrollar un videojuego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043110160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1556336487}
review:
A remastering done right. One of the best point-and-click adventure games ever made. Well worth playing even today.

Some of the cultural references and jokes are dated; and a few puzzles are harder or less intuitive as our home applicances have changed over time. But the pacing of the narrative, the temporal puzzles and distinct characters (within the limits of 1990s game budgets) are all exceptional.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964851886', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1530180461}
review: Great game and well worth playing, graphics are great and the puzzles aren't as crazy as some of the other lucas arts games. Well worth picking up and playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173517226', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1530239423}
review:
A short, but fun game. 

It might be an older game, but the updated graphics really do a ncie job modernising the game.  And for what it's worth, the writing and jokes haven't lost too much of their punch. 

The game can be a little difficult at times, the puzzles aren't your standard fair.  But in context of the absurdity of the game, they make sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078182908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1530171797}
review:
So, this is the remastered Version of one of the Lucas Arts Masterpieces. In my list it's in the same line as Monkey Island I+II and The Legend of Kyrandia 2. 

What stands out is that you have three parallel characters to play:
Hoagie - in the past
Bernard - in presence
Laverne - in future

So, anything you do in those times affects the future time. There are hilarious but even somewhat "educational" or better:
hilariously educational puzzles to solve. The best thing is: They all make sense somewhow. I remember back when I played it my first time I would go to bed chewing how to solve a puzzle, wake up and have the solution for it xD

Also it was one of the first adventures that had complete voice-over. My computer would crash when I turned it on because it had not a 100% compatible Soundblaster Card although otherwise marketed :D So I had to wait years until I could play it on ScummVM to listen to it.

See, I played A LOT of the old school Point-and-Click Adventures back in the days as that was my childhood.
I never liked the later classics like Myst or Lighthouse as I hate those old-type 3D render graphics. What Lucas Arts Adventures made stand out was their unique type of humor along with hilarious puzzles and beautiful graphics(now known as "Pixel-Art"?).

After classics started to re-emerge as Special Editions like Monkey Island, Grim Fandango, Full Throttle and of course DOTT- I saw people at forums complaining that 25 year old games should be free... I mean... serious?

Since the late 90s I played those games again and again through ScummVM on WinOS, PSP or other Handhelds and finally Android.
I always wished there would be some sort of modern remake so you could play it on big screens... and here it is. More beautiful than ever.
Sure, they also changed the input controlls of which old-skoolers like me need some time to get into it but that's ok.

I'd call these games timeless- especially with the now HD Graphics and new controlls they're wonderfully playable.

Coming back to the people that say 25+ year old games shouldn't cost anything:
There is already a generation that doesn't know these games and probably wouldn't go through the hassle of pixelated graphics on 32" screens but now can.

Get, play and enjoy them! There simply aren't any Point and Click Adventures of this type anymore.
The only thing I regret from the bottom of my heart is the feeling of playing this game the first time of my life again. But I do remember ... <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198072674293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1530036773}
review:
Ein Meilenstein der Videospielgeschichte. Es ist mit Abstand das beste Puzzle-Andventure Game, auch wenn dies nur die Remasterd Version des Originals von 1993 ist hat das Spiel noch immer Eigenschaften und Charakterzüge denen es heutigen Spielen fehlt. Die Geschichte die in dem Spiel erzählt wird ist erste Sahne auch wenn das Spiel bei einmaligem durchspielen nur eine Zeit von 3-5 Stunden beansprucht, jenachdem wie schnell man die einzelnen Punkte lösen kann. Im Spiel selbst sind die Charakter, Stimmen, Synchro und Grafik sehr gelungen für eine Remaster-Version eines Spieles. Man bezahlt also 5€ für einen echten Klassiker vergangener Tage.

Fazit: Wenn man auch nur Ansatzweise an dem Ursprung von Videospielen (vorallem Adventure Games) interessiert ist sollte man sich dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall aneigenen.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081524016', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1530007777}
review: This game brings me memory of the cartoons I used to watch. Comedy in this game is phenomenal and the whole experiment is awesome and enjoyable. However, the hidden achivement is too difficult to figure it out since there are no tips to find it, therefore a guide for the acheivement is essential if any players want to get 100% on this game, which will be relatively easy,

author: {'steamid': '76561197992555166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1478111388}
review:
Ignore my playtime since I played the original at least 5 times already since it's original release. It's the best Point & Click ever made.
And the remaster did a great job! If you still haven't played this masterpiece, now is your time. If you aleady did, do it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083355719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1529194689}
review:
C'est un plaisir de retrouver ce point and click mythique que je n'avais pas eu l'occasion de jouer sérieusement à l'époque, n'ayant pu y jouer que chez un aml quelques heures. J'ai donc fait le jeu dans son entièreté sans aucune aide extérieure et malgré les quelques moments de galère à tourner en rond, le plaisir est toujours présent. Les énigmes ont du sens, l'humour est omniprésent et j'en ai retiré beaucoup de satisfactfion.

On pourrait regretter une interface qui a vieilli un peu, notamment au moment de passer les objets d'un personnage à un autre (ou alors j'ai manqué un raccourci).

Dans l'ensemble, je le conseille à toute personne patiente aimant les énigmes et l'humour absurde. Sachez toutefois que l'intérêt du jeu est quasi nul s'il est joué avec une soluce sous le nez (c'est évident mais sait-on jamais...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198217121273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1679020973}
review:
Un final épico... ¡Y una hermosa remasterización para esta joya, dibujada a mano! Valió la pena comprarlo. Además, te da de elegir de jugarlo remasterizado o la versión original de 1993. La historia está buena, porque todo lo que se hace tiene algún sentido. Creo que es la mejor aventura gráfica que conozco.

10/10 Totalmente recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150601647', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1529795996}
review:
I bought this game because the nostalgic vibe this game gave me when looking at trailers and i bought it during the summer sale for less than $5.00, but it was'nt what i really wanted. Taking into consideation that this is a remasted, the visuals look pretty good considering this game origianlly was released back in the 1990s. As most comments say, this is just a click game and trying to solve small puzzles. The characters are very engaging, but i wasnt fully satisfy with the game. Some of the puzzles are actually difficult in figuring out what to dobecause theres not that many leads and I eneded up following a walkthrough to figure out what to do. 

Nevertheless, would i recommend this to a friend? Maybe, I wasnt fully satisfy, but maybe it was my fault for expecting something out of an old game. I will say no just because I did find it annoying that I have to look at a walkthrough at times because the puzzles got too difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019049547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1528900698}
review:
Wow, what a delightful little game.

It's an adventure game so no shame in having to hit the interwebs if, say, the keys were behind the door and you had to walk into the room and then close the door behind you to see them, but overall I got through it with minimal crying for help and had a blast.  It's nice to be reminded that despite his post-Psychonauts productions, Tim Schafer is still one of the greats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145877348', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1601198085}
review: I played this game as a kid and it was as funny as I remembered it to be. Luckily I was able to solve most of the puzzles pretty easily, likely because of I had completed the game years ago as some of the puzzles are quite hard to figure out. There's not as much content in the game as I remembered, but with the hard puzzles it took me over 5 hours to complete the game, so I guess it was worth the buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064705993', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1528053549}
review: A point and click adventure filled with challenging puzzles, a story with a silly sense of humour and fun colourful design. Although I didn’t find the game to be an enjoyable experience,  the time travel element could get frustrating such as storing a hamster in the freezer to be used later on in the future time, or the dialogue lines which aren’t skippable and I found to be irritating and the sound design while appropriate was not appealing to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198319958365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1501118273}
review: Played this game as a kid and remembered enjoying it so picked it up for a grown-up replay. It was just as fun as I remember it being. Such a fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106023045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1527885152}
review: Eine wirklich tolle "remastered" version. Ich habe das Spiel als Kind bereits gespielt und ich muss sagen, dass es mich auch jetzt noch gleichermaßen gefesselt hat. Einfach genial die LucasGames: Stets humorvoll und dennoch ansprechend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044379270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1527763430}
review:
Brought this game for nostalgia, definately worth the low price to bring back old memories.
The remastered version is a great improvement to the visual and audio, they also cleaned up the hud which looks better. 

The only problem i've encountered is the 'squeeky matress' puzzle which you cannot use the command properly unless you go to options and change back to classic mode.

Very fun game to play espeically if you want something short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101871748', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1527712725}
review: Aventura grafica de puzzles tipo moneky island. Es un juego que ha envejecido bien, divertido aunque los guiones pueden cansar un poco. La mayoría de los logros son automaticos, otros no tienen ningún sentido y hay unos cuantos que te los puedes saltar si no los consigues en su momento, pero hay guías muy buenas en internet para ello. Totalmente recomendable sobre todo para gente de los 80/90.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342275395', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1569355743}
review: Day of the Tentacle, es ist einfach nur Kult wie die ganzen alten Spiele von Lucas Arts. Egal ob es sich um Monkey Island oder ZacMcKracken handelt. Die Rätsel, wenn man Sie nicht kennt sind vielleicht etwas schwer aber mit ein bisschen Gedult und vorallem "LESEN" der Gespräche, um was es geht klappt das auch ohne Sorgen. Nostalgie pur, die ich selbst mittels ScummVM auf dem Handy habe und ich kann selbst nach Jahren immer noch lachen. Mittels dem F1 Button kann man übrigens die Grafik umstellen auf die alte Zeit. Kurz gesagt, es ist ein muss für jeden Adventure Fan, das Geld sicher angelegt und der Spaßfaktor ist einfach Klasse. Die neue Grafik und der neue Sound machen die Remastered Edition zu einem farbenfrohen und liebevollen Erlebniss, das man gerne wiederholt zu spielen (selbst wenn man nur die Errungenschaften bekommen möchte) die ganzen alten Lucas Arts Aventures sind alle Zeitlos, egal ob es sich um Monkey Island und die anderen Teile handelt. Wer gerne in Erinnerungen schwelgt, der ist hier richtig aufgehoben :) ich hab´s sogar auf meinem Smartphone in ScumVM laufen und spiele es unterwegs ab und an :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123194404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1709566857}
review:
Okay, da ich nun auch dieses Spiel mit Freuden beendet habe, kann ich mich auch zu dessen wirklicher Qualität äußern.
Mir fiel als erstes die Liebe zum Detail auf, so erinnert die Grafik stark an die alten Cartoons wie Scooby Doo, so gefällt mir die altbackene Grafik des Originals genauso gut wie die neu aufgesetzte  Grafik des Remasters (wobei man nicht wirklich altbacken sagen kann, da der Retro Look, ähnlich wie bei Sam and Max: Hit the Road ziemlich zeitlos wirkt), wobei das klassische Spiel eindeutig vom Retro-Charme lebt. 
Das Spielprinzip ist einfach erklärt und schnell verinnerlicht, wenn man noch nie ein Point 'n Click Adventure gespielt haben sollte, für die anderen wie gewohnt: Alles einsammeln, was nicht niet- und -nagelfest ist und im Verlaufe des Games clever kombinieren, sodass man voranschreitet, neue Items bekommt und irgendwann den Abspann des Spiels erblickt. Was dabei wichtig ist: DIESES SPIEL HAT ES RÄTSELTECHNISCH IN SICH!!!
Nun komm ich auf den Sound zu sprechen. Dieser hat sich im Vergleich zum Original nur qualitätsbedingt verändert, ansonsten hat man immer noch "die guten, alten Launemacher" am Start.
Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: DIeses Spiel ist für jedermann ein Muss, der sich als kultivierter Videospielkenner bezeichnen will, aber auch für die, die nichts mit dem Point 'n Click Genre am Hut haben, wer es also (noch) nicht hat: KAUFEN, KAUFEN, KAUFEN!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977158883', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1558818919}
review:
[H1][b]ANÁLISIS DE "DAY OF THE TENTACLE REMASTERED":[/b][/H1]

Producto obviamente enfocado a los nostáligicos que disfrutamos con el clásico hayá por el 93, aunque también lo recomendaría para los que no pudieron jugarlo en su día y quieran conocer una de las aventuras gráficas clásicas estilo "point & clic" más míticas de todos los tiempos. 

Se trata de un remaster genialmente realizado: se ha redibujado todo el apartado artísitco a mano en alta resolución, respetando 100% los diseños originales y pudiendo jugar en alta resolución, habiendo remasterizado también los efectos sonoros y la música. Lo mejor de todo es que podremos disfrutar del clásico tal y como lo conocíamos pulsando una sola tecla, pudiendo disfrutar también del aspecto gráfico, interfaz y sonidos originales.

Aparte se han añadido logros como uno de los principales alicientes para hacerlo más rejugable, cromos y sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube.

También se ha incluido arte conceptual e incluye la opción de escuchar comentarios de los creadores.

Os dejo mi lista de pros y contras:

[H1][b]PROS:[/b][/H1]

- Un ejemplo de cómo hay que remasterizar un juego clásico

- Muy entretenido

- Remaster 100% fiel al original

- Posibilidad de cambiar al modo clásico tal y como lo conocíamos pulsando solo una tecla

- Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de todos los tiempos, un clásico

- Los diálogos son divertidísimos, muchas risas aseguradas

- El carisma de los personajes

- Traducido al español

- La música y los sonidos también han sido remasterizados

- Posibilidad de jugarlo con mando (aunque mucho mejor con ratón como toda la vida)

- Incluye Maniac Mansion completo

- El surrealista argumento, simplemente genial

- Tiene logros Steam

- El hecho de tener logros lo hace más rejugable

- Incluye bocetos extra

- Incluye comentarios del director

- Tiene sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube

- Tiene cromos Steam

- Se puede encontrar a muy buen precio en épocas de ofertas


[H1][b]CONTRAS:[/b][/H1]

- Algunos fallos en la traducción

- A veces el juego se bloquea en la transición del modo clásico y el remasterizado

- Maniac Mansion está completamente en inglés, no ha sido traducido como el resto del juego

- Algunos puzzles se hacen complicados de solucionar sin ayuda de una guía

[H1]Conclusión:[/H1] ​

Un ejemplo de cómo se deben hacer las cosas, genial remasterización del clásico más de 20 años desde su lanzamiento. Hará las delicias de los nostálgicos y es una muy buena opción para los que no lo disfrutaron en su día. Si te gustan las aventuras gráficas clásicas cómpralo sí o sí. Además incluye dentro Maniac Mansion totalmente jugable (y con un par de logros, eso sí, en inglés).

Duración: He tardado en torno a unas 8 horas, aunque esto puede variar bastante dependiendo de la habilidad que tengamos en este tipo de aventuras gráficas.

Si mi análisis te ha gustado o te ha servido de ayuda, agradecería que dejaras un voto positivo para que pueda llegar a más gente. ¡Gracias por leerme! No dudéis en dejar vuestros comentarios o dudas, responderé lo antes posible. 

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34246137-Raziel_BPN]>>>¿Quieres jugar gastando poco dinero? ¡haz clic aquí para seguir mi página de mentor si quieres ver mis análisis de juegos gratuitos, baratos o en oferta!<<<[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198080640831', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1527353441}
review:
En lila tentakel, som jobbar som labbassistent till doktor Fred Edison (galen vetenskapsman), dricker lite giftigt avfall som släppts ut ur laboratoriet och utvecklar armar, utökad intelligens och en stark lust att erövra världen. Han fångas in för att oskadliggöras av doktorn, tillsammans med sin gröne beskedlige tentakelbroder. Men brodern, som inte vill bli tillintetgjord, skickar sin kvicka hamster till en gammal vän efter hjälp. Vännen, Bernard, är en stereotypiskt lagd allmännörd som delar hus med en läkarstudent (Laverne) och en råddare (Hoagie). De far till laboratoriet, som ligger i källaren till ett sjaskigt motell, missförstår situationen och släpper åter ut den lila tentakeln i världen. Nu finns det bara ett sätt att rädda situationen för mänskligheten, och det är att resa en dag tillbaka i tiden för att göra det gjorda ogjort, men komplikationer uppstår då vissa besparingar i konstruktionen gjort tidsmaskinen mindre tillförlitlig. Så kan äventyret börja.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered är ett äventyrsspel av “den gamla skolan” där man pekar och klickar sig fram för att lösa problem på mer eller mindre långsökta sätt. Originalspelet släpptes för nästan precis tjugofem år sedan, och man måste säga att det var stilbildande och nyskapande när “den gamla skolan” var ung och fräsch. Omarbetningen och moderniseringen har varit varsam. Spelet ser betydligt modernare ut och låter betydligt bättre, men annars känns det tillräckligt bakåtsträvande för att nostalgin ska få sitt. Spelet rör sig framåt med en godmodig humor, men en del av standardklyschorna har helt klart åldrats. Detsamma gäller själva pusslen, som ju är hjärtat i den här typen av spel. Många av lösningarna känns väldigt långsökta, och har inga egentliga ledtrådar. Man får helt enkelt prova sig fram genom äventyret. Exempelvis sitter en skämtspya fast i taket i rummet där spelet inleds och man vet att den kommer att behövas till något någon gång under spelet, men hur man ska få ner den ([spoiler]ljudligt bombardemang[/spoiler]) och vad den ska användas till ([spoiler]framtida tävlingsfusk[/spoiler]) finns det inga som helst skäl att kunna lista ut i förväg. Det här är förvisso ett klagomål på hela genren och inte på just Day of the Tentacle Remastered, och det är mer en källa till frustration i spelandet än ett klagomål. Det gör ju att man blir så glad när man faktiskt listat ut vad det är tänkt att man ska göra, och det är ju det som är den stora charmen med det här spelet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401970277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1542879144}
review: Within two minutes of starting this game my brother and I were nervously laughing at the sheer cringeworthiness of it all. But it quickly became apparant that this aura of awkwardness and cringe was entirely intentional, and once we accepted that, this game became quite a delight. I can't help but think of how fun it must have been for the voice actors and animators to make this game. But aside from its quirky and hammy aesthetic, Day of the Tentacle Remastered really is a solid point-and-click adventure game. It's difficulty is nothing to scoff at, yet for the most part all of your needed actions make sense in the given universe. The time travel mechanic especially makes for some unique puzzles that left me with a good sense of accomplishment when I realized the answers. Granted, at the moment of writing this review, I am somewhat stuck as to what to do next. However, this can just as easily be chopped up to my own lack of perception as it can be blamed on any lack of intuitiveness in the game. Overall, it's a fun romp and a good laugh. Well done, Double Fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993516952', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1526707907}
review: Fantastic adv game that plays like a silly child's cartoon, a la Looney Tunes. Smart puzzles, very interesting time travel mechanics and jokes galore. Should you get stuck, there are plenty of lenient hint sites around, but definitely give it an honest go before you give in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069635016', 'num_games_owned': 2885, 'num_reviews': 808, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1526049382}
review:
Типично качественный, стёбный и сумасбродный квест от Тима Шейфера и Ко.
В этот раз мы впутываемся в нереалистичную историю о перемещениях во времени и противостоянии с осьминожными конечностными отростками, которая в свою очередь является продолжением совершенно неизвестного для нового поколения игроков проекта Maniac Mansion.
Да, в оригинал можно сыграть прямо во второй части, но изначальное восприятие сюжета от этого не улучшится (у него еще используются аж 25 кнопок для управления с клавиатуры).
Однозначно радуют возможность визуального возвращения в 1993-й нажатием одной кнопки, а также бонусы - полторы сотни артов и режим комментариев разработчиков.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198110663078', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1515429526}
review:
Äußerst geduldige und verständnisvolle Spieler, die über allerlei technisch Veraltetes hinwegsehen können, Spaß an purem Point-and-Click finden können und sich von konterintuitivsten Rätseln nicht abschrecken lassen, die könnten tatsächlich viel Spaß an diesem Spiel finden.

Wer sich unter "Remastered" ein wenig mehr erwartet wie primär bloße Aufhübschung, sich bei Point-and-Click intuitiv lösbare Rätsel wünscht, auf deren Lösung sich auch eigenständig kommen lässt und mit technisch veraltetem Gameplay noch niemals wirklich warm geworden ist, der sollte die Finger von diesem Titel lassen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094432643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1525664478}
review:
A classic point-and-click adventure game, though some of the puzzles are on the silly side if that isn't your bag.

Pros:
+ light-hearted slapstick humour
+ imaginative, if paradoxical, time-travel puzzles
+ select from updated artwork, or classic pixel version
+ different menu systems available (dial/verb menu)
+ now includes Save/Load options for the original Maniac Mansion (a deterrent to playing MM in the original version of DotT)

Cons:
- the remastered animations have a strange quality to them that I can't put into words... not as fond of the remastered cutscenes compared to the originals
- sometimes the captions can't keep up with the audio, especially in Remastered mode
- "." skips text but not animations
- some of the animations seem stilted (Bernard takes far too long to react to successfully getting the cigar)

I do still like DotT best of the original LucasArts titles, and it belongs in the library of every point-and-click connoisseur. Definitely pick it up during a sale if you can!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2241, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1525303831}
review:
Last time I played this game was something like 20 years ago and I remembered it fondly.
Original looked fine and it was good sprite work, but this remaster looks even better in my opinion - it shows the cartoon style even better. And if you hate it, you can go back to original without issue, but in 1440p this remaster looks gorgeous.
Humor is great in this game and it is somewhat random, just like other LucasArts classics - and so are the puzzles. 
[spoiler]But personally, I like Sam and Max Hit the Road more and found it funnier, but that's my opinion ;)[/spoiler]
There is not much to say, really, because the game is as fun as it was, plays great, and it looks even better. What's not to like?
If you never played it and like point and click games, this game should be somewhere near top of your list to play, because you miss out on classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993680740', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6112, 'last_played': 1706574524}
review:
My [url=http://cheesetalks.net/porting_dott.php]previous article[/url] on my experiences with working on Day of the Tentacle Remastered cover a lot of my own history with the game, but don't dive deep into my feelings about the remastered edition itself - after all, the game was more or less finished before I came onboard and I had plenty of time to play through it before I started working on it.

Re-creating low fidelity assets with greater detail removes a degree of ambiguity that different players invariably fill with different impressions. To one person, a few pixels here, might be interpreted as a smooth shape, while to another, the pixel edges define something more jagged - are the ends of Laverne's fingers square or rounded? Are outlines fixed or varying width?

Interpreting a low fidelity work at a higher resolution is daunting work, and having now done a little of that sort of work myself, I can appreciate the potentially conflicting sense of opportunity and responsibility that that represents. I can also appreciate that the very act of removing that ambiguity will generally alienate or disappoint whatever portion of the low fidelity version's userbase didn't have interpretations that align with the higher resolution version.

With that in mind, I feel that Day of the Tentacle Remastered does a decent job. It embraces the original game's cartoon influences and for the most part maintains the original colour palette. There are a few stylistic inconsistencies (for example, some of the moon-lit trees in the intro cutscene have a smooth gradient on them, while others have discrete bands of colour) and less-faithful interpretations of small details (such as Bernard's mouth during the intro cutscene), but on the whole, it's pretty solid.

The remastered UI lets the game's visuals take up the full screen and presents interaction verbs as a radial interface instead of the Sam & Max Hit the Road/late Sierra adventure style cycling interaction cursor. From a usability perspective, the wheel is great, but it hides verbs that don't trigger unique responses/actions - something that feels like it reduces the possibility space that the verb bar originally represented, drawing attention to puzzle solutions that were originally a little less obvious and making hidden dialogue more discoverable. On one hand, I feel like this is a bit of a loss, as it feels like it affects the game's pacing and reduces periods of uncertainty during which players might reflect on the story and their actions. On the other hand, Day of the Tentacle was the first LucasArts game to feature a contextual hint system (presented as "meanwhile" cut aways when enough time has passed without the player making progress on a certain puzzle) and was full of cues and shortcuts to reduce friction, and maybe this is a natural progression of that - it just takes things a little too far for my tastes.

Building on the options available in the Monkey Island 2 Special Edition (upon which DotT Remastered's codebase is based), Day of the Tentacle Remastered lets players to toggle new and old music, UI and graphics independently - something that seems to be one of its most appreciated features as it allows existing players to start with the game they love and add the bits they like without bringing the bits they don't, and allows new players to interactively explore and compare what's new and what's not.

It's still the game I know and love, but the one feature that I would have really liked to have had in the game would have been an option to review commentary tracks/review which ones still hadn't been found/listened to before. Without some hints on where to look, commentary tracks attached to obscure places can be easily missed, and that's a bit of a shame.

When I play, I usually go with remastered graphics and UI with original music. I'm not sure how much of it is nostalgia and how much of it is taste, but there's something about the original MIDI that resonates more with me. That said, I still can't hear the bird fall in the opening cutscene without feeling a sense of [url=http://cheesetalks.net/porting_dott.php#foot4]dread[/url] and [url=https://twitter.com/ValiantCheese/status/751269403623174144]panic[/url].

[i]This was originally written as part of [url=http://cheesetalks.net/gamesRoundup2016.php]a retrospective[/url] on games I finished in 2016.[/i]

review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time.  I still have the box, CD and the little book.  Used to use an emulator to play it after computers got too high and mighty to run it so was VERY excited to see it on Steam. It's a point and click game with a good story and very funny dialog.  Lucas Arts made a lot of funny titles back in the day...this is one of the best.

Side note:  I don't recommend using emulators...they put real stress on the CPU!

review: One of my child hood games, spent many months trying to complete it. I never had Internet to look up walk through.... Or thought about it at least... Basically didn't cheat. It was fun trying many different options to try to solve puzzles and the glee you got when you did it write, often treated to a funny crazy cut scene.... Or in game event. Usually puzzles are logical, but the characters and story are wacky and crazy.... Just a fun enjoyable well put together game. This enhanced edition is great and doesn't lose any of its charm!

author: {'steamid': '76561198318281356', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1521976399}
review:
精品情怀作品重置，可惜情怀是人家老美的情怀，和我们一般人没啥关系。

Day of the Tentacle是Maniac Mansion的续作，初版由著名的LucasArts发行于1993年，并在2016年重置。游戏的剧情（以当今的视角来看）非常直白：变异后的紫色触手怪想要统治世界，主角一行人得通过时间旅行回到昨日阻止此事的发生。时间旅行——和所有时间旅行一样——出了岔子，裤腰带高得很没必要的Bernard被弹回了现在，仿佛嗑药嗑多了的Laverne穿越到了两百年后触手怪统治人类的世界（还不小心挂在了树上动掸不得），仿佛是肥版Slash的Hoagie则来到了两百年前，恰逢美国几位国父在此地起草宪法。这两位穿越了时间的选手的时间机器都基本没电了，所以玩家得想办法给机器充上电，让三位死党（？）重聚首。

要怎么做呢？这游戏最有意思的地方在于，你可以通过时间机器来传送道具——需要一瓶四百年窖藏的红酒吗？让Hoagie想办法把它在四百年前埋起来，再让身处四百年后的Laverne把它找出来，通过时间机器传回去。Voila!真藏实窖。

身处同一地点，不同时间的三人如何相互协作，让Laverne和Hoagie回到现在的过程，基本上就是游戏的全部剧情，之后三人通力协作，和触手怪斗智斗勇将其一波带走则只占10%不到的篇幅。

这个游戏应该是幽默的，至少大部分英文评论都这么说。但是上世纪90年代老美的幽默吧…我是感受不来，而且我认为大部分其他中国人应该也不太能。对我而言，这个游戏唯一的亮点在于谜题本身，而不是台词、剧情、画面和配音。老实说，这配音我觉得挺糟的，仿佛是给声优们塞卡片让他们随便读一样——或者人家就是想要这个效果。

谜题确实很难，其中的诀窍之一在于记住，你在过去做的事情会对未来产生影响。游戏初期，玩家需要让挂在树上的Laverne摆脱困境，该怎么办呢？答案是，[spoiler]让身处Laverne400年前的Hoagie说服华盛顿把那棵树砍掉[/spoiler]。于是未来的那棵树就不存在啦。这是群敢作敢为的家伙，丝毫不怕修改历史——他们甚至篡改了美国国旗。

总体而言，这是个历史价值大于实际游玩价值的游戏。因此，[b]不推荐[/b]，除非你单纯想解一些有难度的谜题，其他对你来说完全不重要。但那样的话，你的选择就太多啦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198072298009', 'num_games_owned': 4503, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 2642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2642, 'last_played': 1507093238}
review:
Just like the original game, the original unchanged "Maniac Mansion" can be played on the computer in the room upstairs, so buying this game technically gets you both games, however the original is not remastered.

Classic Game, redone with updated graphics, audio, and voice acting.  Has the ability to switch between new and old style layouts just like other remastered LucasArts games.  Has commentaries that can be turned on, but play automatically over the current audio and could contain spoilers, so recommended to have them off unless you'e played the game before.  I missed this one when it came out so I had to turn this feature off.  Great game however, you control 3 different players at once (similar to Maniac Mansion and Thimbleweed Park).

------------------------------
Control Scheme I Used:
Keyboard and Mouse, point and click after all

------------------------------
Worth the current price (CDN$ 16.99)? If you're a fan of the genre for sure.
What I actually paid: $10.19

------------------------------
Completionist Review: 
DLC Achievements: No DLC.
Rating: Standard Adventure Game Style... a few random things.
Can be completed in one run: Yes
Chapter Select: Will need multiple save files, or a complete replay.
Did I need/use a guide? Probably for 1-2 achievements only.

This is no different than any other adventure game from LucasArts or other companies in terms of completion, most story related with a few others thrown in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1521505282}
review:
Ich habe das Original damals nicht gespielt, aber hab mich sehr gefreut, dass ich es als Remaster nachholen würde können. Man muss nicht erwähnen, dass es als Remaster an sich gelungen ist, aber das wusste ich ja vorher schon. Die Frage war hauptsächlich, ob das Spiel denn gut ist. Die, für mich, wichtigsten Punkte im Folgenden:

1. Ich bin zwar kein Fan von Zeitreise-Stories, aber ich konnte bei Day of the Tentacle spielerisch sehr gut damit leben, weil das verschicken von Items in Zukunft/Gegenwart sehr angenehm gelöst wurde, sodass alles sehr flott geht ohne ständig die gleichen Wege zurücklegen zu müssen, bloß um etwas auszuprobieren. 

2. Die Rätsel sind die meiste Zeit gut lösbar, da man durch entsprechende Dialogzeilen oder Beschreibungen von Hotspots schnell merkt, ob und was man machen könnte um das Problem zu lösen. Es gibt zwar ein paar Rätsel, deren Lösung nicht ganz so einfach ist, aber das meiste sollte für die aufmerksamen Spieler zu lösen sein. Ist auch hilfreich, dass die Welt nicht zu vollgestopft ist mit unnützen Hotspots und der Bildschirm immer sehr übersichtlich ist.

3. Die Story und Humor sind wohl Geschmackssache. Den Ansatz mit dem Tentakel fand ich zwar nett, aber die Charaktäre und den Humor, da konnte ich dem Spiel nicht soviel abgewinnen. Es war okay, aber für mich an dieser Stelle in den Erinnerungen wohl überbewertet. Außer dem Tentakel wird bei mir nicht viel hängenbleiben von dem Spiel.


Fazit: Ich habe das Spiel zwar gerne nachgeholt, aber sehe es auch nicht als totales "Must-Have" der Videospielgeschichte. Lucasarts hatte stärkere Adventure. Wer aber zumindest ein Point and Click sucht, dass vor allem Comedy bieten will, dann kann man ruhig bei Day of the Tentacle sofort zuschlagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218969712', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1511651043}
review:
Ya terminé este juego en la ps4 - regalo del psPlus - y, aunque lo terminé, no me ha convencido de todo.

No me ha gustado el sentido del humor y los puzzles eran - por lo menos para mi - demasiado complicados y extraños como para ser capaz de completar el juego sin ayuda de una guía para bastantes partes.

El juego es un remake de otro más antiguo - de hecho en el propio juego puedes cambiar al estilo visual de la época y jugar de forma completa al juego anterior a este a través de una máquina arcade - así que el humor del juego se puede explicar por ese detalle.

No es mal juego, pero a mi no me gustado nada por complicado y una historia poco llamativa que no me incitaba a continuar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036851146', 'num_games_owned': 1742, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1600970022}
review:
[b]This is game is completely weird. I love it![/b]

This is a classic point'n'click adventure stacked with a bunch of nonsense and hella weird riddles.
Some of the hints the protagonists give you are pretty strait forward while sometimes you have to think pretty far outside the box. The main plot point is that you and your friends have to save the world from an evil, mutated tentacle by traveling through time. You can operate in different timelines, change the future and send items to your friends to solve their puzzles, which is a neat feature.

Completing the whole story took me around 4.5 hours. But I gotta mention that I googled twice. First time I just screwed to use a VCR, because last time I used one was ten years ago. The second time I just couldn't see the wood for the trees. I had the item I needed right since the start and was just not able to combine the right components.

After eight hours I managed to get all achievements in the game and find all the secret dialogues and easter eggs. And believe me, the game is full of such. Brilliant character design, nice art style and neat story telling.

[i]If you like hard point'n'clicks, you gotta play this![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002555075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1520880444}
review:
Mein erster Gedanke war: "Und noch ein weiteres unnötiges Remake..!" 

Hier habe ich mich aber definitiv getäuscht. Im Gegensatz zum Remake von Monkey Island 1 z.B. ist die Steuerung dieses Mal sehr gut gelungen. Schaltet man Ingame dann mal mittels F1 auf den alten Stil um, sieht man dass das Spiel doch schon ein paar Jährchen auf dem Buckel hat. :p 

An der Story selber wurde natürlich nichts verändert und die schaffbaren Steam Achievements haben mich motiviert einfach mal einen DOTT Day einzulegen! :) Von mir gibt es, vor allem bei den derzeitigen "Angebotspreisen" eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung für Liebhaber des Originals!

Would recommend to fans of the adventure gaming genre, or anyone thinking about trying one out (this isn't quite as impenetrable as Monkey Island).

author: {'steamid': '76561198807033432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1521044075}
review: I played this back in '93 and was immediately hooked. It was my first love of point-and-click adventure games. But I wondered if it would hold up in 2018. I was seriously very pleasantly surprised. There are certainly some elements that date this game, but overall, the creativity, writing, humor, and clever puzzles make this game hold up incredibly well. You can tell a ton of thought and detail went into it, and that's felt throughout. I recently played a bit of Broken Age and longed for the heydays of LucasArts. It just didn't compare. DOTT is where the inspiration lies. And this set the stage for the great Grim Fandango. Also, this is an excellent remastering. Loved the updated graphics and sound. And I was able to suppress their voices, which was good, because I preferred to read their dialogue and imagine their voices for myself. I'm looking forward to checking out the commentary!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036770967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1527942467}
review: Soo good. Such an awesome game from back in the day and really well remastered. I only wish i could wipe my memory clean and play it all over again not knowing what to do

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1558005648}
review:
Advance warning, this review is written partially with nostalgia glasses as I played this and other Lucas Arts games back in the day <3 I had the remaster on my Steam wishlist and won it on Steam Gifts. I immediately binged on the HD remaster and then replayed it again with pixel graphics and commentary on. <3

Day of the Tentacle is a quirky game with bizarre (not just for the 90s) humour, and at times even crazier puzzle solutions. You really gotta think out of the box here to move forward sometimes. In this Point & Click Adventure, you have to prevent/undo Tentacle World Domination! (And no, this has NOTHING to do with certain Japanese animation. They're not that kind of tentacles.) With Hoagie stuck in the past and Laverne stuck in the future after your world saving effort went awry the first try, all characters have to work together to reunite in the present and try for a second time. By changing subtle details in the past, consequences will appear in present and future... Whether you let a hamster endure a century through unconventional means or let a mummy win a beauty pageant, there's whimsical fun in all corners of this adventure, including the dialogue options.

If you played this game before, the improved graphics, commentary and the steam achievements and cards just made it a whole lot better. If you haven't played this game before [strike]what's wrong with you[/strike] then you've been missing out on something hilarious. This cult classic is a must-have in any game library and a piece of gaming history (more info on that in the commentary, should you decide to play it with that on).

author: {'steamid': '76561197984110635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1494196873}
review: They made this game great again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044028830', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1520203699}
review:
Juegazo. Indispensable jugarlo. Clásico de las aventuras gráficas.

Personajes carismáticos (aguante Hoagie), humor y situaciones totalmente disparatadas.

Me encanta como hay que combinar los distintos personajes en los tres tiempos (presente, pasado y futuro), modificando la historia para moldear el futuro a nuestro favor.

En cuanto a esta versión remasterizada, esta muy bien lograda. Y si no te gusta, o sos más nostálgico tenés la opción para jugarlo a la vieja escuela con los gráficos pixelados.

Recomendado? Recontra recomendado: 9/10

review:
This is an historical game.
Anyone knows that "Day of Tentacle" is a great game into the Graphic adventures or Click and point.
It is a funny game, a funny story, with funny characters. I recommend this game if you are starting to game this games type.

Meanwhile the technical aspect: It is a great remasterization. It provide a new graphical engine but keeping the original animations, a good mix between the game old and the new graphics.

The usability is not Scumm, but you could adapt in 10 minutes of game.

I want highlight the compatibility between different SO. Specially on Linux.
Works very fine.

review: I never played this as a kid so don't have any nostalgia for it. This game is really funny, the dialogue is great, some of the puzzles are difficult in an old school point and click way. I would recommend it for anyone who is a fan of point and click games or games with a good sense of humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020912848', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1467410102}
review:
I loved this game as a child. I still love it as an adult. If you've never played what I would consider to be the best in the lucas arts style point and click adventure genre, then get this game. The characters are interesting, the story laugh out loud funny, and the puzzles are just the right balance of logic and wackiness the genre is built from. The added developer commentary was a nice extra and I enjoyed listening to it on my second playthrough.
The only downside was just how memorable this game was for me since I played it back on my first computer in the 90s, I could recall the vast majority of the solutions to the puzzles so there wasn't much challenge this time around. It was however an awesome nostalgia trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994074257', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1518651781}

author: {'steamid': '76561198401836024', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1518468343}
review:
Hola. Antes que nada, quiero que entiendas que estas comprando.
A la hora de definir un juego, podemos decir que es un metodo de entretenimiento que baila entre "Narrativa" e "Interacción". Ambas, como regla, son ejes paralelos. Es decir, en ningún momento podrán cruzarse, ya que cuando agregas narrativa, restas de interacción (Para poner un ejemplo, yo como desarrollador quiero que tu personaje hable con tal persona, para así destrabar una side quest, te estoy mandando por una narrativa, pues tendrás la interacción unicamente con el personaje al que yo te doy permiso).
Day of the Tentacle, se caracteriza por ofrecer la interacción como tarjeta principal, y deja la narrativa dentro de lo más basico. Una aventura gráfica, comparable con los conocidisimos " Elije tu Propia Aventura", pero en formato digital. 
A grandes rasgos, uno puede limitarse a decir " Es bueno", otros dirán " Es malo".
Yo te diré, compralo. Es un hito en la historia de los videojuegos por un motivo, y no creo que puedas comprender dicha facultad limitandote a leer los analisis. Animate, pues como mínimo tendrás la oportunidad de reirte mucho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030192100', 'num_games_owned': 1993, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1514114921}
review: Good remaster of an excellent game. This game grabbed me like a tentacle until I was finished with it. Most of the puzzles are sensible and extreme lateral thinking isn't required. Art is decent and animations don't look choppy, clearly care was taken to make homage to the original one and not just cash in quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023449685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1515019575}
review: Per chi conosce Maniac Mansion e ha la passione per le avventure grafiche del periodo d’oro, The Day Of the  Tentacle è un must irrinunciabile, da godersi in versione originale oppure nella fantastica versione aggiornata nella grafica e nelle musiche di gioco. E inoltre, è l’opportunità per fare un tuffo nel passato e giocare di nuovo a Maniac Mansion, a cui si accede nel corso dell’avventura. Umorismo, dialoghi, atmosfere surreali di altissimo livello, Un vero capolavoro che tutti gli appassionati devono avere! E gli anni passano ma il Tentacolo Viola è inossidabile!!

review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a must game to get if you are a fan of point and click games especially LucasArt games. I played classic DOTT years ago and couldn't wait to get Remastered version.

 Ever when I won this game, I replayed it by trying to get all of Steam Achievements. The interesting thing is that when you replay, you can try different approach.

It's one of my favorite games and you won't be disappointed with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087331768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1527446553}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141473509', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1514482868}
review:
Never played the original version of the game but I preferred playing this in the classic view. Simple point & click game to solve puzzles to progress through the storyline.

Interesting idea of using three controllable characters where you are able to give items to one another that can be found in their respective worlds. So it makes you wonder which character needs that specific item and you must send it to the other person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393817448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1517853174}
review:
Ho rigiocato a Day of the Tentacle dopo un bel po' di anni e devo dire che la versione Remastered è perfettamente identica alla controparte classica nei contenuti, ma con grafica ed audio completamente rinnovati. Peccato per il mancato doppiaggio in italiano (il doppiaggio è solo in inglese). L'interfaccia "azioni/inventario" è stata migliorata e resa funzionale ai fini dell'utilizzo del mouse; a mio avviso, tale interfaccia è migliore di quella presente nella Special Edition di The Secret of Monkey Island.
Il gioco è la classica avventura "demenziale" punta e clicca della LucasArts, molto godibile nella trama e con enigmi di difficoltà medio/alta. Il gioco dura poche ore, ma va considerato che per l'epoca (1993) era più che sufficiente.
[spoiler]NOTA: Nelle vesti di Bernard, è possibile giocare alla versione integrale di Maniac Mansion (capitolo antecedente Day of the Tentacle, ambientato cinque anni prima) utilizzando il personal computer che si trova nella stanza di Ed. Il gioco è completamente in inglese.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198132323578', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1517432809}
review:
Jeu tout simplement culte et divinement barré. J’ai longuement lorgné dessus, avant qu’un ami décide de très gentiment me l’offrir. Après avoir dressé une statue à son effigie pour cette superbe découverte, il m’a fallu trouver quelques mots pour pouvoir en faire une review sur Steam.

Disons que le jeu vaut absolument le détour pour son ambiance et son scénario, complètement décalé, dont les énigmes ne répondent qu’à la logique même des devs’ (M’enfin, faire dormir un ch’val pour récupérer son dentier, peindre un arbre en rouge pour berner le grand Washington, etc.). Bref, il a fallu énormément de courage et de patience pour les joueurs de l’époque qui sont parvenu à terminer le jeu sans utiliser de soluce. Je dois avouer avoir craqué par moment et m’être tapé sur le crâne lorsque j’ai découvert comment résoudre une énigme sur laquelle je bloquais depuis quelques heures. 

Autrement, le jeu est à essayer de toute urgence si vous êtes friand des scénarios qui sortent de l’ordinaire. Les personnages sont attachants, grâce à des dessins et animations fidèles à leur personnalité. Parcourir le futur avec Laverne était un régal, découvrir le passé en compagnie d’Hoagie et des pères fondateurs l'était tout autant. J'ai un peu moins apprécié le personnage de Bernard et ses pérégrinations, beaucoup plus classiques malgré la présence de la famille du Dr. Fred.

Pétit bémol aussi pour la font utilisée pour les textes. Faite main, certes mais pas très lisible par moment. Il m'a fallu un temps d'adaptation avant de ne plus être gêné lorsque je lisais. 

Tordant, barré et culte. Trois mots qui définissent finalement très bien cette aventure Schaffer et Grossman.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061686401', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1488168731}
review:
A hilarious point and click adventure game that received critical acclaim back in 1993. In [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i], you play as three teens who must work together through different time periods to thwart the plans of an evil tentacle. You'll do this by finding items and solving puzzles, all through humorous dialogue while enjoying the colorful cartoon visuals.

This remastered version allows you to switch between the original graphics and the updated visuals at the press of a button. There is also a developer commentary track as well as the ability to view old concept art. In addition to all of this, the original Maniac Mansion game is an unlockable, so you're basically getting two games for the price of one.

Everything about this game is a blast, as I genuinely can not think of any real downsides. [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] is a must play for fans of point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961362559', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1522784536}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420790', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 399, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1516468186}
review:
Good game. I played every other Lucas Arts adventure aside from this!

I always thought DOTT looked a bit rubbish compared to Indy4 or Monkey Island 2. Looking at it now, in hindsight, I suspect it's due to the way they downscaled the art for DOTT. If they'd only waited a few years they could have relesed it on the same SCUMM engine Monkey Island 3 was released on and I imagine it would have been fabulous.

So this remake is a welcome improvement (though I'm not totally sold on the way the HD art is presented)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031534770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1515967812}
review:
I've played this game for the first time in 2017. So I'm not influenced by any nostalgia. And it's now my favorite point'n click. You can switch any time between the three heroes, in their own path, to help them travel back in time. You can tell the guy had fun writing this delirious game. It's humoristic from start to end, through all enigmas, all dialogues, all situations. Strangely, there's kind of logic in all these puzzles, but it's still make you laugh when you find the solution.
It's hard, very hard, not predictable but I've never got annoyed and always felt the answer was close. You can find all of them by cleverness, without help of coincidence.
In this genre, it's clearly a masterpiece, a must-have game without any discussion about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148894348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1515955007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080226932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1516015898}
review:
Depuis le temps que j'en entendais parler, il fallait bien que je me lance un jour. Et franchement, aucun regret.

Les animations sont magnifiques, les dialogues (et donc l'humour) juste géniaux, et la difficulté juste comme il faut. Bravo LucasArt : déjà que je considérais Monkey Island et Grim Fandango comme des chefs d'oeuvre, tu n'as décidément pas fini de me surprendre (oui, j'ai découvert le jeu un peu tard) !

Je dois quand même avouer avoir bien tourné pour pouvoir avancer un petit peu, et certaines énigmes sont vraiment capillotractées (il faut aussi dire que j'ai mis trois ans à comprendre la véritable utilité des toilettes, j'en dis pas plus).

Bref, j'ai adoré et je recommande à 100%. Mention spéciale pour le hamster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031001936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1463532334}
review:
This is another example of a classic point and click game done well. As a spin off from Maniac Mansion, I was skeptical when I first played this game years ago that it would try to be a fun game, but ultimately would fall flat. I was pleasantly surprised. Set in the same world as the original Maniac Mansion, the game thrusts three characters into chaos as one goes into the past, one into the future, and one stays in the present. All three of them must work through puzzles and finding items to get everyone back into the same time. Chopping down trees, spitting out dentures, and getting electrocuted by a kite are all adventures to be had, and in a hilarious way. The items needed to be used together or to complete puzzles are used in logical ways. There are few combinations that may seem frustrating, but they are few and far between. There are no random combinations that do not make sense. The game does not have a hint system and there are a few puzzles that will take a lengthy amount of time to figure out. Or you can check a guide. 

There are wonderful characters, such as the American founding fathers, who constantly fight with each other, the purple and green tentacles, Dr. Fred, and the main three characters you will play, Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne. The story and events that happen are consistently funny and never forced.

The graphics work perfectly for a zany, laugh out loud, silly story. The music is equally great as well as the solid voice acting. This is still an outstanding game from the 90's that will have you laughing and wish there were more games like it.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165959236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1515717481}
review:
Encore un super point and clic culte et drôle signé Lucas Games !
J'aime beaucoup les graphismes remasterisés et la possibilité de passer à tout moment de l'un à l'autre. 
Certaines énigmes sont un peu tirées par les cheveux mais pas pour autant impossible à trouver et ça va dans l'esprit du jeu.
La bande son est géniale et j'aime beaucoup l'idée d'alterner entre trois personnages et trois époques.
Bref si vous aimez les point & clic, l'humour absurde et les histoires what the fuck, ça va sûrement vous plaire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048038590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1544138228}
review:
Day of the Tentacle,..wer kennt diesen Klassiker aus dem Hause Lucas Arts nicht? Naja gut, jeder der nicht das Glück hatte in den 80ern oder 90ern großgeworden zu sein und somit eines der besten Adventure-Spiele spielen konnte, die jemals erschienen sind. Zusammen mit Monkey Island, Sam und Max Hit the Road oder Full Throttle gehört dieses Spiel eindeutig an die Spitze der Adventurespiele. Diese Version ist eine Remastered-Version mit schön aufgebesserten Originaltexturen sodass das Spiel in heutiger Optik erscheint.

Der Spieler übernimmt in diesen Adventure die Kontrolle über drei Protagonisten die unterschiedlicher nicht sein können. Zum einen haben wir Bernard, einen augenscheinlichen Nerd, dann Laverne die durchgeknallte Blonde im Bunde und Hoagie, einen Rowdie wie er im Buche steht. Diese drei leben zusammen in einer WG, bis eines Tages ein Hamster vor der Tür steht mit einem Brief für Bernard. So fängt das Abenteuer an,...welches im Verlaufe der Geschichte dazu führt, dass man Automaten knackt, absolut gegen den Tierschutz verstößt, den Vereinigten Staaten eine neue Flagge schenkt, unsagbare Dinge mit einer Mumie anstellt und mal eben 2 Millionen im Teleshopping verpratzt und viele viele andere Dinge anstellt die abseits jeglichen gesunden Menschenverstandes liegt. Und warum? Um die Menschheit zu retten!

Ich habe das Spiel damals in der Originalversion schon geliebt und bin sehr zufrieden mit dieser Remastered-Version. Einziger Nachteil ist, dass das Spiel in mehreren Zwischensequenzen einen Bug hat und ohne die Überspringen-Funktion das Spiel nicht weitergeht, wodurch es unmöglich wird die letzten beiden Achievements zu erlangen. Wenn man nicht unbedingt die Achievements haben muss ist dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert und natürlich für alle Fans der Adventure-Szene die diesen Klassiker zuvor noch nie gespielt haben.

Nachtrag: Die beiden letzten Achievements kann man im Fenstermodus erhalten, da im Fenstermodus die Zwischensequenzen nicht stehen bleiben, so habe ich es jedenfalls jetzt geschafft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045195484', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1508972481}
review: If, like me, you fondly remember the hinjinks of Maniac Mansion, then you will enjoy this game. It is much more plot driven than Maniac Mansion, but the humor and item flexibility is still there. Also, you can play Maniac Mansion on a console on the second floor of this game (so Maniac Mansion is basically included with this game). This game is more linear though. The controllable characters are set, and there is only one way to beat the game. Still a lot of fun though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139965182', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1518507427}
review: If you dig "Classic" point and click adventure games, such as Monkey Island, you will love this game.  If you haven't played games like this, you wil be hooked.  This game features great humor, and puzzles that don't hold you hand too much.  You can even play Maniac Mansion (the prequel to this game).  Worth the money and has pretty decent replay ability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106436438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1583270725}
review:
Tenía que pillarlo porque era un clásico y porque así mi librería parece más cool. Si el tiempo (como bien dijo FN) es un círculo plano, el téntaculo es como la puta aguja que lo recorre como si fuese una manecita en un reloj. Dos finales posibles para romper el bucle: la consecución de la perfección o el fracaso. Y ambos terminan a su vez en otro común: la muerte.

Y ahora la historieta:

"Me lo compré súper ilusionado. Leyendo diálogos me di cuenta que esto es una secuela del Maniac Mansion. Entonces me entraron ganas de jugar al Maniac Mansion. Pero sólo lo tengo en un cartucho de NES y paso de jugar con el mando hijoputesco de NES. Entro en una habitación y me meto en el ordenata de un payo (esto dentro del Day of the Tentacle) y resulta que puedo jugar al Maniac Mansion ENTERO, con posibilidad de guardar partida etc."

11/10 lo compraría dos veces más.

PD: El juego está guapo en verdad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966385727', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1514061053}
review: I personally find this less intriguing than Maniac Mansion, almost like it was trying too hard to be "the next Maniac Mansion", instead of being a sequel to that game and being allowed to evolve into its own entity.  The humor also feels forced most of the time.  No bugs or anything of that sort in my time with this Remaster, the game and its themes just didn't suck me in at all.  I remember thinking this the first time I played it at a family friend's house when it first came out, I thought I'd give it another shot now that a significant amount of time has passed.  No change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068718142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1514535775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198368481028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1512883063}
review: This was a game I played back when I was learning English :D it's interactive, hilarious, and all in all worth playing imo. It also has different languages, and I'm kinda using it to listen or read German (with English). The remastered artwork looks mighty good too. Back then before I knew Steam, I used a SCUMMVM emulator to play, and boy paying a little bit for the game is waaay better (with HD graphics and everything). I have absolutely no regrets purchasing this :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981134427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1514568707}
review: This really is a trip down memory lane and I think a really well remastered game. I still the think some of the puzzles in this game are really hard/random to find. Keep in mind this dates from 1993 and it still provides a lot of joy with funny references and one-liners. I think full price is a bit too much, but couldn't let this go in the winter sale to play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161950116', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1514490493}
review:
Um clássico!

Tenho meu Cd da coleção da Lucas Arts até hoje, mas fiz questão de comprar a versão remasterizada. 

Point-and-click dos bons! A história é muito interessante, com viagem no tempo e vilões improváveis. Ainda dá pra treinar aquele Inglês maroto.

O charme permaneceu, o estilo de jogo ficou mais fluido e a remaster tornou o jogo mais limpo e bonito do que já era.

É um jogo que tem q estar na coleção de quem já jogava no seu PC 386 dos anos 90. Se não jogava, experimente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043291968', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1514510239}
