author: {'steamid': '76561198105863871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1509795462}
review: I played the original as a kid and although I prefer the older style (you can switch whenever you want in-game) I was really impressed by the remastered version, everything including the music was so neatly polished, cool!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013451694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1480717668}
review: Una maravillosa obra maestra de la mano de Lucasart. Icono del género de la aventura gráfica, que vino al mundo en 1993 gracias a Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer, entre otros.  Personajes carismáticos, diálogos desternillantes, situaciones peculiares ,cuando menos surrealistas, con viajes en el tiempo incluidos. Múltiples referencias a otros videojuegos y obras cinematográficas de la época que podrás indentificar si estás atento . Si te gustan las aventuras gráficas de principio de los años 90 y todavía no lo conoces, este es sin duda TU JUEGO. A la hora de disfrutar de él dispones de la opción más pixelada y original, permitiendo que tu también puedas transportante en el tiempo,  o la remasterización con una calidad gráfica más contemporánea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079507138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1710224994}
review:
10/I0

 was already excited when this was first announced. Day of the Tentacle is one of the games i played the most when i was a kid. And seeing it being remastered and just the fact that i was able to play one of the games from my childhood filled my heart with so much glee. 

I was blown away seeing how the animation and style was made much smoother, the interface is much easier to use and the ound being balanced out made reliving this much more worth it. 

And guess what, if you miss the old classic sprites and classic interface of old style point-and-click games? well with the press of a button, BAM!, you can now play in the classic style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147229819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1458748090}
review: A classic, aged like a good red wine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198435642240', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1593992582}
review:
una excelente aventura grafica, para aquellos que tuvimos la suerte de jugar este juego en el antiguo DOS es un placer poder disfrutar de esta version completamente remasterizada. Tiene una banda sonora genial y unas animaciones excepcionalmente comicas, en esta version, ademas, se pueden activar los comentarios de los creadores que son hilarantes.
Una verdadera joya para los que tuvimos la suerte de jugarlo de chicos y un gran descubrimiento para aquellos que nunca lo hayan jugado. Horas de entretenimiento garantizado

author: {'steamid': '76561197960315634', 'num_games_owned': 900, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1514253732}
review: A point and click adventure where most of the puzzles make enough sense that you can figure them out without blindly clicking on things. Humor is dated, but still a lot of fun in most places.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147965492', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1514295969}
review:
Ein Klassiker aus dem Jahre 1993.
Einfach lustige Charakter Sprüche ect. :)
Ein sehr kniffliges Spiel wenn man gut ist und es zb. schonmal gespielt hat hat man es in 1 2h durch (Abzüglich von zwischen sequnzen und Dialogen dann so an die 3 4h) und sollte man nicht so gut durchkomme sind bis zu 8h Spielspaß drinne. Es ist ein must Have und sollte auf jedenfall mal gespielt worden sein :) Nostalgie für die Kids von Damals eine spanendes Erlebnis für die jüngeren unter Euch. Um die Nostalgie zu erhöhen kann man von der Remastereden Version auf die alte Grafik mit einem Knopfdruck umschalten GEIL!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967876062', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1514189494}
review:
The Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a cute little game and quite humorous.  I remembered when it originally came out and heard it was a fun adventure game, but I never got it or other great games like The Seceret of Monkey Island, etc because I've never really been into adventure style games.  However, when I saw the remastered edition on Steam and for a decent sale price, I decided to pick it up and at least try to experience it.

It's good.  

The main recurring complaint I've seen about the remastered edition is that the voice acting was bad and that it should have been updated or something.  I think this is kind of B.S. because I think people have gotten a little spoiled and used to modern games where game companies pay high priced actors to come in and do voices.  Day of the Tentacle came out in a different era of games production.  In early games most voice acting was done in-house by developers and such.  With that in mind, I actually enjoyed the voice acting.   I am actually glad they didn't re-do Laverne's lines with a new voice because once I got use to her, she was the most interesting.  I felt Laverne was very funny and fit with the personality in how she physically moves throughout the game.  Hogie was also quite funny as well.  Some of the jokes are a little dated, but overall still quite good.  The tentacles were all enjoyable too.

The story had a neat little premise and overall I am glad finally I picked up Day of the Tentacle Remastered. 

Thanks for the fun.

*edited spelling*

author: {'steamid': '76561197972925219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1514407184}
review: Un clásico de Lucas Art al que siempre quize jugar, tuve la ocasión en estos días y me gusto. Este juego formo parte de la época dorada de las aventuras gráficas allá por los años de Monkey Island, Broken Sword, etc y que los más viejos del lugar recordarán con nostalgia. Se nota como cuidaban sus aventuras los de Lucas Art, con puntos graciosos en casi todo el juego. Si no habeis jugado deberias hacerlo ya simplemente por respeto a la historia de los videojuegos :D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039987043', 'num_games_owned': 769, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1514054424}
review:
Juvenile "humor", if it was meant as an attempt at humor.
Didn't bother to "remaster" the voices, which sound like they were just done by whoever was nearby rather than anyone with talent.
No particularly clever puzzles.
Doesn't even come with the good version of Maniac Mansion from the NES, it's their ugly deformed-graphics beta version they released on floppy disk.
The people who made this are clearly completely useless without Nintendo backing them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117638960', 'num_games_owned': 911, 'num_reviews': 245, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1663820791}
review: Day of the Tentacle é um clássico do gênero point-and-click, tendo sido lançado originalmente pela LucasArts em 1993. Ele é uma sequência do Maniac Mansion, que pode ser jogado dentro desse jogo no quarto de um dos personagens. A história é memorável, os personagens são carismáticos e o humor é ácido, se está procurando um jogo engraçado esse é com certeza uma boa escolha. Quanto à remasterização, os gráficos estão muito bonitos e o áudio com uma qualidade excelente. Ainda é possível jogar a versão original ao pressionar F1. Recomendo aos que nunca jogaram, e também aos que jogaram o original e querem reviver a experiência de um jeito novo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193588787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1583963451}
review: A trip down memory lane. Would highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoyed Lucasarts games way back when.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165730808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1513912501}
review: It's still funny, but it's also still full of illogical rando-mix puzzles.  Bonus that you can play the original Maniac Mansion if you feel like slogging through 8-bit graphics and the old interface for nostalgia.  I like it, but it's showing its age, and I'm glad I got it at a steep discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993472383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1513934894}
review:
Nostalgie
Es ist immer mal schön zu sehen, was für eine tolle Zeit man mal hatte und durch Day of Tentacle kann man diese Zeit wieder zurück holen. 
Hier werden Jugenderinnerungen wach!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971256349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1496221463}
review:
What a heap of crap.  Yes I did have it on CD-ROM, yes we are talking in the mid ninties.

Nostalgia got the best of me, so I decided to "have another go" some 20 years later.  

What a huge mistake that was.  My memories of this game were obviously, so very wrong.  It is a sad piece of crap!   
Illogical puzzles, to much toing and froing.  The jokes are more cringeworthy than any Jake Paul video.

Maniac mansion, the predecessor to this game.  Far, far, far superior, so superior, you could not get something that is more superior than what Maniac Mansion to DOT.  

I revisisted that one too btw.  (I remember having it on about 4 x 3.5" floppys for the amiga.) 

Download this heap of crap from abandonia or some free sight.  Play it for five seconds, relise I have saved you money!!!.

Your welcome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046578845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1482430839}
review:
I really recommend it. Great remake of an awesome old fashion game. I really hope that they remake Maniac Mansion.

For old fashion gamers it is a game worth to buy. You can choose to enjoy the new graphics, play with the game or even play the old Maniac Mansion. It is a very nostalgic and fun experience. For people who is less familiar with this kind of games it can be either an amazing experience or a frustrating one. I know that old fashion 'adventure games' have a very specific logic (try every conversation, touch everything and try to combine every object) and I understand that before enjoying this kind of games you need to understand it. But if you accept this 'game logic' it really becomes an enjoyable game. 
I really recommend it. Great remake of an awesome old fashion game. I really hope that they remake Maniac Mansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1512922643}
review:
A time traveling point and click adventure where you control three different people in three different times trying to prevent an uprising by the Purple Tentacle. The puzzles are well designed and the humor is great, especially if you’ve played a lot of adventure games in the past, as there are a lot of call backs. 

On the other hand, it isn’t very long. That said, it is worth picking up.

One last note, you can transport items through time by dragging them from one inventory and dropping them on the other two characters. This is much faster than the using items on the Chronotron and the only way to get Master Plumber in a reasonable amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970460797', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1466958984}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992913445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1512881235}
review:
I loved the cartoon style.  The pace was a bit slow compared to an actual cartoon.  But it was ruined by the unintuitive leaps of logic the game requires you to make to solve the puzzles.  Basically, you might have to try one of the 20 objects in your inventory with any of 100 random things in the environment.  How am I supposed to know to combine a squirrel with a battery?  They may have been focused on selling access to their hint phone line line back in the day.
If you do play it, do yourself a favor and have this walkthrough playing off to the side to refer to in case you get stuck...which will happen every 5 minutes.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eW283uY3sLI
(Remember, YouTube shortcuts are > to speed up and right arrow to skip forward 5 seconds.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198290445268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1512688963}

author: {'steamid': '76561198165538850', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1512365540}
review:
Сюжет уровня среднего платформера, а не хорошего квеста, примерно две смешные шутки на всю игру и самый раздражающий в мире перебор инвентаря (три управляемых персонажа, которые передают друг другу предметы в отдельной локации, которая еще и расположена вдали от основного места действия). 

Почему эта игра получила статус классики -- для меня загадка.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970773304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1500419259}
review:
Grandpa: Hey Kids!
Kids: Hey Grandpa!
Grandpa: Do you wann know what games we played back in the 1990's?
Kids: Yay. (obvious lie)
Grandpa: We called them Point and Click Adventures. It was called Point and Click Adventures because we had to point at a certain spot on the screen and click it and it was very adventurous to find the exact pixel because we had no internet to google its location...
Kids: Whats a Pixel Grandpa?
Grandpa: Back in my days pixels where everywhere.
Kids: Even in Shooters?
Grandpa: Exspecially in Shooters!
Kids: What did those pixels do?
Grandpa: They annoyed us whenever they could. But then 3DFX Grafic accelerrators where invented and hexed us with thier voodoo (ultrapun).
Grandpa:... ...
Grandpa: Now that I think about it, that was about the same time when Point and Click Adventures suddenly dissapeared. I guess so cause it became to hard to point at the exact pixel and click it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027205841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1516227443}
review:
To me this is the best point and click adventure of all time. I played it numerous times before and now while playing remastered version I must say it haven't lost any of the old charm.

Story, characters and puzzles are all funny and even silly. Some puzzles could seem difficult and illogical but figuring those out becomes very rewarding and funny experience because they have some silly logic that at the end just makes sense! Rare games are able to accomplish that.

Day of the Tentacle was one of the games that drawn me to the game industry. I was never fortunate enough to work on a real point and click adventure, but it's still an inspiration for characters, puzzles, dialogues... but also is an example of a great product which has equal quality of all game elements throughout the whole game. This, again, is something rare games are able to achieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997208286', 'num_games_owned': 1575, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1606593396}

Éste, y otros grandes clásicos que están siendo remasterizados, es debido a que fueron, son y seguiran siendo unos juegazos. Por aquel entonces donde no habia tanta variedad de juegos se cuidaban mucho de hacer un gran producto final.

Si te gustan las aventuras graficas locas y pasar un gran rato. TOTALMENTE RECOMENDADO!!!
DOBLEMENTE RECOMENDADO!

review:
SO glad this classic game has finally been rereleased!  I first saw a friend play it back in the early 90's and loved the simplicity & humor in it so much that I've been able to remember it despite not playing till now.

I still have to finish it, but I nominated it for the “Suspension of Disbelief” Steam 2017 award because though it really is a little out there it's fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314739827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1626850454}
review: This was always one of my favorite games as a kid. Back in the day when you played games, it was mostly console gaming - playing good games on the PC were uncommon. But one day I got this game, and how the gaming landscape changed for me! Fully-animated characters and cutscenes with voice-acting (on the CD-ROM version), puzzles that wracked your brain, and time travel to boot! I played the original "Maniac Mansion" for PC (and now you can too!) but this was such a wonderful sequel. I was delighted to find out this game got a remastered treatment, as newer (WinXP or above) systems won't really play the original anymore. This game should be played at least once to be appreciated, and is enjoyable for anyone regardless of their age.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027167645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1480335891}
review: A point-and-click műfaj nagy klasszikusa, zseniális alkotás. A történet vicces, a szereplők komolytalanok vagy pedig egyenesen őrültek. A feladványok olykor nem könnyűek, de a legtöbb esetben logikusak. A remaster minőségi munka, megmaradt az eredeti audiovizuális világ, csak a minősége lett korszerű. Bármikor lehet váltani az új és az eredeti élmény között, így megtapasztalható egyszerre eredeti és felújított formában is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971052095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1511736386}
review:
I loved the original game back in the old days, this remastered version is exactly the same but with better graphics and optional commentary.  Puzzles are fun, especially with the time-travel aspect to consider, and story/dialog is funny!

I recommend to anyone who remembers the game and wants to relive the experience on modern hardware or to anyone who may have missed out (or wasn't born yet) looking for the perfect example of the best adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972001726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1567073890}
review:
Ein Klassiker aus meiner Jugend bekommt eine Neuauflage? Klar, dass ich dieses Spiel haben musste. Und ich wurde nicht enttäuscht, denn das Spiel wurde 1:1 übernommen und lediglich optisch und akustisch ansprechend modernisiert. 
Für alle, die es nicht kennen: Day of the Tentacle ist ein Point&Click Adventure aus den 90ern, als dieses Genre Hochkonjunktur hatte und Lucasarts die Meisterschaft darin errungen hatte. Es ist der Nachfolger zu Maniac Mansion und kommt im überdrehten Comic-Look daher. 
Die Story ist dabei herrlich blödsinnig: ein lila Tentakel - "Purpur" genannt - trinkt einen Schluck verseuchtes Wasser und mutiert zu einem Super-Tentakel mit Armen, das die Welt beherrschen will.
Dr. Fred, der das Desaster ausgelöst hat, schickt die Freunde Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne mit je einer zur Zeitmaschine umgebauten Toilette in die Vergangenheit, um das Problem rückgängig zu machen. Dummerweise explodiert der Diamant, mit dem die Maschine betrieben wird und Hoagie landet in der Kolonialzeit, Bernard bleibt in der Gegenwart und Laverne landet in einer fernen, von Tentakeln beherrschten Zukunft. 
Das Ziel ist es nun, die Freunde wieder zusammenzubringen: Bernard muss einen neuen Diamanten besorgen, Hoagie braucht eine Stromquelle und Laverne hat in der Zukunft ganz eigene Probleme. 
Der Clou: man spielt alle drei Charaktere (bzw. zunächst nur Hoagie und Bernard) und kann gefundene Gegenstände durch die Toiletten in die jeweils andere Zeit spülen. Hoagies Aktionen in der Vergangenheit wirken sich dabei direkt auf die anderen Zeitlinien aus, wodurch dort bestimmte Probleme umgangen werden können. 
Die Rätsel sind allesamt logisch und durch die Dialoge mit den unzähligen Figuren bekommt man teils recht eindeutige Hinweise zur Lösung. Da aber von Beginn an die meisten Areale begehbar sind, ist es gar nicht so einfach, die ganzen Möglichkeiten im Blick zu behalten. Schnell hat man einen wichtigen Ort vergessen oder einen offensichtlichen Gegenstand übersehen. Hinzu kommt noch das Tauschen der Gegenstände über die Zeiten hinweg. Somit gehört DotT trotz aller Logik definitiv zu den anspruchsvolleren Titeln. 
Der Humor ist aber einzigartig, die Figuren herrlich schräg und die Ideen wunderbar originell. Nur ein paar Stichworte für Kenner: Linkshänder-Hammer, Ozo der Clown, die Mumie, George Washington, die Steuerfahnder, entkoffeinierter Kaffee, tiefgekühlter Hamster...
Zur Technik: die Grafik ist nun hochaufgelöst und das Bild wurde auf Breitbild angepasst, indem die Menüleiste und das Inevntar am unteren Bildrand weggefallen bzw. ausgeblendet wurde. Zusätzlich wurden ein paar subtile Effekte, wie Unschräfe, Schatten und andere Details eingefügt.
Die Soundeffekte wurden an einigen Stellen aufgepeppt, entsprechen aber sonst weitgehend dem Original. Die deutsche Sprachausgabe wurde 1:1 übernommen, klingt dabei nicht so professionell, wie es in modernen Grafik-Adventures heutzutage üblich ist (z.B. in Edna bricht aus), aber die Frage ist, ob das hätte sein müssen, denn für den Kenner muss es der O-Ton sein, schließlich kommt dadurch ein Stück der alte Charme zustande.
Das Interface ist nun kontextbasiert und bietet über ein Kreismenü die gängigsten Funktionen an. Unzählige Steam Errungenschaften runden das ganze schließlich ab. 
Fazit: nach fast 25 Jahren hat es mir wahnsinnig Spaß gemacht, dieses Spiel erneut zu zocken und trotz diverser Vorkenntnisse dauerte es gut fünf Stunden bis zum Abspann, da eben nicht mehr alles geläufig war. Für Anfänger sicher eine harte Nuss, aber immer fair und lösbar. Die einzige Strafe, die man bekommt, wenn man nicht optimal spielt, ist das Laufen von Umwegen.
Daumen hoch und ich hoffe, dass dieses Remake Schule macht und auch die anderen Klassiker, wie Indiana Jones 4 oder The Dig eine Remastered Version erhalten. Ich würde jedenfalls sofort zuschlagen...

author: {'steamid': '76561197977090925', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1484011074}
review:
Here's why I think this game should be nominated for a steam award in 2017:

The whole point of this game is for everybody to work together in order to be able to come home.  Teamwork is the complete opposite of conflict.  The fact that the game has an INSNAE sense of humour furthers it's point.  If you want to play a game that is non-violent, yet provides a GREAT cranial workout, this game is a must!

Played this many times over the years, from the original Dos version.

If you haven't played it yet then you will be missing out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993451249', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1590139755}
review:
Begleite den Nerd Bernard, den Roadie Hoagie und die leicht verwirrte Laverne auf ein verrücktes Abenteuer durch die Zeit.

[list]
   [*] klassisches Point-and-Click Adventure von LucasArts
   [*] schräger Humor
   [*] abgefahrene Story, die dich im Bann halten wird
   [*] ein Bösewicht, der dem Wort "Bösewicht" gerecht wird
   [*] fantastische Gastauftritte vieler Prominente aus dem Zeitgeschehen
   [*] liebevoll überarbeitete Version des Klassikers aus dem Jahr 1993
   [*] faszinierende, tief einblickende sowie witzige Kommentare der Entwickler
[/list]

[h1] Grody! [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197960594988', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1621344368}
review:
Day of the Tentacle habe ich vor vielen Jahren; das müsste etwa 1995 gewesen sein, mit und bei meinen Freunden in der Nachbarschaft als 12 jähriger Jüngling zum ersten mal spielen dürfen. Bereits den Vorgänger Maniac Mansion habe ich gespielt,  allerdings nicht annähernd so intensiv und bewusst wahrgenommen, wie seinen Nachfolger.
Für mich ist DOTT daher der absolute Inbegriff des Point and Click Genres. 
Damals wie Heute bin ich vor allem von der witzigen, verrückt-verdrehten und raffinierten Storyline sowie den liebevollen handgezeichneten Grafiken begeistert. 
Die Kombination aus abswechslungsreicher Story, schönen Grafiken, witzigen Dialogen und einem herausforderndem Schwierigkeitsgrad machen es zu einem ganz besonderen Spiel.
Was aktuelle Point and Click Games angeht, bin ich nicht mehr up to Date, allerdings würde ich dennoch pauschal behaupten, dass sich die DOTT-Remastered Edition heutzutage nicht zu verstecken braucht.
Die Grafik kann auf den OldSql Look umgestellt werden, was alle Nostalgiker, die es damals schon gezockt haben, analog zum Spiel auf eine Zeitreise der ganz besonderen Art schicken dürfte.
Die neuen Grafiken sind allerdings sehr gut gelungen, kaum verändert und treffen den Charme der damiligen Zeit perfekt.
Zum Inhalt selbst möchte ich garkeine großartigen Worte verlieren.  
Man muss sich einfach selbst auf diese Zeitreise begeben! 

Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung für Jung und Alt. Für Rückkehrer und Neueinsteiger!

review: J'avais crée un poste il y a plusieurs années sur le forum de steam pour ajouté se jeu, ce souhait a était réalisé et c'est un bonheur, de l'humour, de la difficulté bien dosé, un univers marrant, un design bien finis. Pour -10€ foncé .

author: {'steamid': '76561197960304071', 'num_games_owned': 2778, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1697374539}
review:
Ich habe DOTT damals 1993 mit 11 Jahren nach Installation mehrerer Disketten zum ersten Mal gespielt und lieben gelernt. 
Ein absoluter Klassiker und ein Muss für jeden Fan des Point & Click Adventures. 
Ich möchte in meinem Review einfach auf nichts eingehen weil ich nichts spoilern möchte. DOTT muss man einfach spielen und selbst erleben. 
DoubleFin hat mit dieser Remastered Version alles richtig gemacht und durch die vielen Ausbesserungen hat das Spiel absolut nichts an Charme verloren. Absolut zu empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002580000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1460750202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198091489118', 'num_games_owned': 2272, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1605381295}
review:
There are few games that manage to traverse time, few that manage to stay current, regardless of the developments of each generation. These are games that captivate the imagination and manage to attract even those hostile to the genre. Day of the tentacle is such a game, filled with overinflated, amazingly funny and memorable characters.

It is both an adventure game and a movie at the same time and its filled with truly funny moments and clever puzzles that will stay with you for the rest of your life.

The story is absolutely hilarious and so over the top that you cant help but want to see it through to the end. The remastered version graphics are simply great and I doubt it will ever need to be remastered again, but even in its original incarnation it would still be a great game. Play it, love it, finsih it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035465702', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1479386987}
review:
Es un clásico entre los clásicos.

Recuerdo cuando era un crio de 5 años y jugaba a este juego con mi padre.

Su nivel de complejidad a la hora de realizar los diferentes requisitos para avanzar en el juego es lo que te deja ese regustillo en la boca de querer mas y mas.

Y con la remasterización, lo han petado ya que la jugabilidad de antaño se vuelve tosca a los tiempos que corren.

MUY recomendable

author: {'steamid': '76561197994571616', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1510979397}
review:
Si en los 90 te encandilaron las aventuras gráficas de Lucas Arts, no dejes pasar la oportunidad de revivir El día del Tentáculo con unos gráficos redibujados para estar adaptados a los tiempos de hoy pero sin perder su esencia. Resulta más cómodo el menú de acciones nuevo que el de verbos de toda la vida, y el inventario se oculta, dejando mas pantalla para ver el escenario.
Tienes la opción de jugar al juego tal y como era en su origen, alternando entre la versión clásica y la remasterizada pulsando F1. Muy recomendable el jugar escuchando los comentarios de los creadores del juego, que si bien están en inglés, se muestran traducidos en unos subtitulos que salen en la parte superior de la pantalla,
Como en las aventuras gráficas de la época, tiene puzzles con los que puedes atascarte sin saber qué te falta o qué objetos utilizar sobre qué parte del escenario. Eso si, ¡¡sin llegar al extremo del puzzle de la cabra del Broken Sword!!
En aquella época no era extraño tener que recurrir a amigos o incluso a escribir a una revista de videojuegos pidiendo ayuda. Hoy en día, si te atascas no hace falta pasarlo tan mal. Consultas una guía para ese puzzle y sigues adelante. No te sientas mal por ello, y si alguien se ríe de ti, rétale a un duelo de insultos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046169569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1558803672}
review:
"Mutierte Tentakel wollen die Weltherrschaft übernehmen und durch eine Zeitreise soll dies verhindert werden. Allerdings schlägt der Versuch fehl und so landen zwei der drei Hauptprotagonisten 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit bzw. 200 Jahre in der Zukunft. Somit sind sie darauf angewiesen sich durch Austausch diverser Untensilien, die sie durch ihre Zeitreise-Toiletten in die verschieden Epochen schicken können, und durch Beeinflussung ihres Umfeldes und Ausnutzen der vierten Dimension einander zu helfen, um die mutierten Tentakel aufzuhalten!"

Day of the Tentacle Remastered schafft es nicht nur, das Original mit seinem Charme und Witz unverfälscht aber dezent aufpoliert in das 21. Jahrhundert zu befördern, sondern vielmehr auch jenen, die das Spiel im Original nicht gespielt haben, den Eindruck eines modernen und lustigen Adventures zu vermitteln. Mit seiner überarbeiteten comicartigen Optik und dem zeitlosen Humor, weiß das Spiel voll zu überzeugen. Gerade zum Angebotspreis sollte sich kein Point & Click - Fan diese Perle entgehen lassen. Ein erster Spieldurchgang dauert geschätzt ca. 4 - 6 Stunden, aber wer das Spiel bereits kennt, wird eher 2 - 3 Stunden für einen Spieldurchgang benötigen. Allerdings können sich Errungenschaften-Sammler ohne Komplettlösung auf einige Stunden mehr einstellen. Das Spiel ist äußerst linear, aber ein gewisser Wiederspielwert ist den Errungenschaften, der tollen Optik und dem interessanten, wenn auch nicht allzu realistischen Zeitreise-Setting zu verdanken.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999627735', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1511644218}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Special Edition is a classic point and click adventure game originally created by Tim Schaefer for Lucas Arts. It is an enhanced version of the original game that sees completely redrawn graphics that replace the originals.

Pros:
The game has a cartoon art style as well as animation that is meticulously detailed without taking shortcuts like reusing frames when a unique one would work better. The game also plays like a cartoon as well, with the same silliness and gags that you would expect from a classic episode of Loony Tunes.
The major unique gameplay mechanic in DOTT is time travel, which lends much more depth to puzzles. Instead of dealing with one linear feeling storyline, there are 3 different time periods that interact with each other making for more unique gameplay and allows you to attempt many different puzzles in parallel which can interact with each other through the passing of time.
DOTT's puzzles are a bit more out there than your typical adventure game flair, but while they'll leave you scratching your head, when you solve them, you wont just feel accomplished, but it will also be hilarious.

Completely new re-drawn graphics:
In order to update the game for modern hardware, the graphics have been entirely re-drawn from scratch for HD displays. This makes for a much improved experience in the graphical department that sees a classic improved for modern use. Luckily the new graphics still exude the excellence of the original, meaning there is no loss of quality or feeling of the game.

Cons:
There is no in-game hint system to help them when they run into the few unintuitive puzzles, meaning the player will either have to tough it out, or consult an online guide. Both of which can be immersion breaking and disrupts the flow of enjoyment of the game.


Most of the puzzles in the game make sense, with item combinations that one can usually think about coming to a useful conclusion. But some of the puzzles take this a step too far and are not as logical in their conclusions, this can be frustrating for the player and may turn some people off of the game.

review:
Easily one of the best classics in the genre you could find!

Set aside the wave of nostalgic memories from better days past for those who played the original, you still get an intriguing piece of puzzle solving with an amazingly funny and twisted humor. 

Those who like a good laugh and riddles in the evening (or any other time of day) should definitely grab it and everyone else should at least give it a go when it is on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198153402206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1683033017}
review:
[h1]Back to the day of adventure gaming[/h1]

[b]If you are an old gamer:[/b] This remake will take you back to the days of SCUMM. The days of two floppys and no hd computers where you used one floppy for DOS and one floppy for Maniac Mansion or Monkey Island.

[b]If you are a young gamer:[/b] You will experience a good old classic adventure game on a modern system and you will have a lot of fun.

[b]What does this game have to offer:[/b]

[list]
  [*] Entertaining story
  [*] Good humor (nothing your kids can't see, rated Teen for a few references but compared to today's TV this is super safe)
  [*] Great animations, cartoonish style. It was awesome back in the day!
  [*] The ability to switch between modern graphics and classic pixel graphics
  [*] Good voice acting & sounds
  [*] Classic point & click adventure
[/list]

If you are a fan of adventure games or want to see what all the hype was about back in the 90's then get Day of the Tentacle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015901950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1512260648}
review: Good remaster of the classic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294982069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1460432930}
review:
This was my favourite game in my youth. I've played it many times and have never tired of it.

It's fun, smart, interesting, well-paced, with good amusing puzzles. The best of the best of "Point and Click" games.

This new version prettys up the image and keeps the original recorded dialogue (which is great).

One downside, however, is that sometimes items aren't placed correctly within the 3 dimensional space. This is only mildly distracting and many may not even notice (except maybe now that you've read this!). A small quibble.

Great job, and thank you for bringing this game back!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003235908', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1558985962}
review:
The original was an amazing game, and this remake has allowed a new generation of gamers to experience the slapstick silliness and humor of this work of art. Is it perfect? No, but so many parts of the game are so memorable that they overshadowed the annoyances like illogical solutions or missing items.

Highest recommendation in the 'adventure' category.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022301000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1500587849}
review: LucasArts Adventure games are the best!  Good puzzles, funny story, interesting characters, and (for me) a great bit of nostalgia as I used to play this on my first computer in 7th grade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021360703', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1668371137}
review: Tive a oportunidade de jogar esse jogo na infância no meu bom e velho 486... ele era hilário tempos atrás e continua sendo melhor que muitos games até hoje. Divertido, inteligente, elaborado, arte perfeita, história e personagens sensacionais, viagem no tempo, história antiga, paradoxos temporais, mutantes dominando o mundo, múmias em concursos de beleza e.... hamsters em microondas. Calaboca e compra logo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031569409', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1511291846}
review: Very good game, with WTF puzzles through time and characters switchs. The graphics of this Remastered Edition are amazingly done, very cartoon-spirit, the humour didn't age badly, but the Audio Commentaries are less good than the ones of Grim Farango. This remastered edition make Day of Tentacle still one of the best Point'n'click on the market :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198101825184', 'num_games_owned': 1130, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1511028155}
review:
Jeu bourré d'humour, Day of the Tentacle est un jeu très réussi.

Le scénario original et humoristique est bien exploité pour résoudre les énigmes, qui peuvent être parfois assez compliquées.

N'ayant pas joué à la première version du jeu, je trouve le remastered très réussi (on peut switcher rapidement d'une version du jeu à l'autre) et plus facile à prendre en main pour un non habitué de ce type de jeu.

En résumé, c'est un jeu qu'il faut tester.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970007557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1511139834}
review: Oh goodness. What a fantastic game. I played Maniac Mansion a long time ago on the NES. It was a brutally difficult but fun adventure game, I remember replaying it over and over again trying to find out what I missed. Adventure games back then had such odd solutions for puzzles that often you couldn't think it through and instead you had to try every single possible combination on everything. Day of the Tentacle, the sequel to Maniac Mansion, is no different. It is difficult but thoroughly entertaining. The game has aged well when playing even the old version. The new HD version offered with the remastered version doesn't just boast smoother and sharper graphics, but also an improved soundtrack and developer commentary. It has a wonderfully ridiculous story, interesting characters and top notch voice overs. It is quite difficult so before giving up on certain parts within the game I recommend looking up solutions online because some of them are so obscure you probably wouldn't be able to figure them out on your own. If you are a fan of adventure games or maybe used to be and are considering giving them a try again, Day of the Tentacle is a must buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989243222', 'num_games_owned': 2201, 'num_reviews': 301, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1697806865}
review:
Bernard rossz hírt kap: az első részben megismert fura csáplények egyike tudatára ébredt, és meg akarja hódítani a világot. Felkerekedik hát 2 társával, hogy megakadályozza a szörny tudatára ébredését, azáltal, hogy visszamennek a múltba. Az időgép azonban véletlen elromlik, és a három lakótárs három időzónába kerül.

Körülbelül 7x toltam ki a játékot az idők során, most először HD-ban. Ez egy olyan kis gyémánt a játéktörténelemből, amihez talán alap angoltudás, egyetemes történelem, logika, és humorérzék szükségeltetik. Emiatt tehát ajánlom is meg nem is. A játék igyekszik vizuálisan kisegíteni a játékost, még akkor is ha nem nagyon ért dolgokat. Legyen ez a kifejező arc, vagy a jól elkülöníthető sziluettek sorozata. Mindig válaszolhatunk marhaságot, de soha nincs visszacsinálhatatlan végeredmény. Előről kezdhető a beszélgetés. Miután a beszélgetés és kipuhatolózás a játék fő eleme, ezért ez fontos is nyílván.

Node mit tud a hd, és érdemes e nekimenni a soundfontos scummvm emulátor után:
- A rövid válasz az, hogy nem feltétlenül. Immáron meg van minden rajzolva kézzel, amin sokan joggal kételkedtek. hiszen egészen hasonlít a fent említett emulátor 3xos hq textúra filteres megoldásához. Valószínűsítem, hogy közrejátszatott, de nagyon sok esetben jól kihasználja a játék a szélevásznú képet, és látszik, hogy az eredeti hosszú rajzokat vették alapul.
- A hangok és a zene valamilyen szinten rendhagyó, amit sajnálok. Az intróban levő kugli hang már akkor sem illett a játékba, és most sem illik. Egyes hangok teljesen marhasággá lettek kicserélve. Maga a zene tűrhető, de hallottam már sokkal jobb soundfontot is, és a lucas által készített Monkey Island remakeben helyet kapott zeneátváltás itt pl nem került alkalmazásra. így amikor új szobába kerülsz átvezetés nélkül hirtelen új zenét kapsz.
- A dialógusok ki lettek tisztítva, és normális minőségben halljuk a beszédeket. Nagy plusz!
- A hd kapott még egy új felületet, ami viszont piszkosul jó lett, Igényes, célratörő, és nem foglalja el a fél képet mint a régi UI. Immáron láthatóak az interaktív elemek a képen, nem kell minden pixelt végigkattintani a képen.

Végeredményben jó lett a hd remake. 8/10 rágható műanyag egér.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1204988809

author: {'steamid': '76561198052570888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1510490036}
review:
Cette version de "Day Of The Tentacle" (DOTT) est un remaster du jeu sorti originalement sur PC en 1993 qui lui-même est la suite du jeu "Maniac Mansion" sorti en 1988 (!). On y retrouve le personnage de Bernard qui, accompagné par deux amis Hoogie et Laverne, devra sauver l'humanité de l'emprise des tentacules, le tout dans un monde aux graphismes cartoonesques. 
L'humour et les anachronismes sont omniprésents dans cette aventure qui se déroule simultanément dans trois périodes temporelles : le présent, le passé colonial et un futur dystopique. On y rencontrera au passage toutes sortes de personnages : des archétypes excentriques, des tentacules anthropomorphiques et même des personnages historiques effrontés.
Le gameplay et les graphismes (lissés) ont été modifiés de manière à davantage coller aux standards actuels mais il est toujours possible de passer en mode "original" et de jouer au jeu comme il y a 25 ans. 
La difficulté est sans doute moins relevée que dans son prédécesseur mais on passe tout de même un très bon moment. Comptez environ 5h pour terminer le jeu en ligne droite mais largement plus si vous vous attardez sur tous les dialogues et les références cachées ici ou là (mon temps de jeu est bien inférieur car j'avais déjà terminé le jeu sur iOS).
Quelques petits bugs sont parfois présents (notamment des décalages entre les sous-titres et le son/les animations) mais ces rares inconvénients ne doivent pas vous empêcher de foncer sur ce grand classique du jeu vidéo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029691537', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1699735180}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979337638', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1558980059}
review: The correct way to rerelease an adventure game.  Clean up the graphics and audio but leave the original gameplay alone.  Alas this only works so well with the old adventure games.  Half the fun of the game is discovering all the hidden responses to strange combinations. Still just as enjoyable as it was back when it first came out.  The fact you can play the original inside the game is a bonus with two adventure games for the price of one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243443620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1510032489}
review:
Classic Lucasarts title from when they ruled the genre. It's funny, has a wonderful cartoon aesthetic, entertaining puzzles and everyone looking to buy it already knows all this. It's a masterpiece you should force your kids to play while they can still appreciate old games.

The remastered edition unfortunately does no justice to the artstyle. It may just be nostalgia glasses, but it really put me off - fortunately you can switch right back to pixel art. Everything else works seamlessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978676128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1510136018}
review: Simply a beautiful adventure game which will keep you entertained and challenged. The remastered version is done with loving care to the genre and this is a MUST for the library of any adventure fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968386135', 'num_games_owned': 595, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1509906878}
review: My favourite title of the ye olde LucasArts classics. It's not so easy to make me laugh, but it's impossible not to chuckle at the American flag redesign and other such unexpected consequences of time travel. The well-written protagonist trio are likeable characters and fit perfectly in this fun little story. Well worth the money and I spent a surprising number of hours with the game. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026999552', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1510035456}
review: A point-n-click puzzle classic. While they require a fair bit of experimentation -- as all puzzles in such game did in that era -- the puzzles aren't TOO random, and make sense once you finally figure them out. If you played Grim Fandango, I found Grim Fandango's puzzles to make less sense, overall. The humour is too American-cartoon-like cheesy, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1485323268}
review:
When you think about classic adventure games, you simply can't forget this title. I can still remember the first time I've played, where you still had to use that code card to avoid piracy. Well, not only that. Since back in the day there wasn't internet available, whenever you'd get stuck in a certain part of the game, you had two options: Find a magazine with some hints, or find a friend that could help you out. 

Ok, things changed, now everything is so much easier and it was really refreshing to play that game again. I was really surprised to find out that I remembered how to solve almost every puzzle in the game (only got stuck in a couple of parts). The story is cool, the characters are really funny, the music and sound effects are great too. The graphics are still pretty much the same, and I don't think that it's a bad thing at all. 

Yeah, since the original game is so old, there's no better way to describe it than with memories and nostalgia. Either way, I still think that new players who are into the adventure genre can have a lot of fun while playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029330113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1498510823}
review: Remains one of the most enduringly enjoyable gaming experiences I've had in my life.  Some games fail to live up to the appeal presented by nostalgia tinged spectacles; this is not one of them.  Everyting from the art style, writing, jokes and puzzles is top notch and a most enjoyable time awaits anyone willing to give this game a chance.  Not to be missed!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998196677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1509625579}
review:
어릴적 너무 재밌게 했던 기억이 남아 좋은 가격으로 리마스터판을 
구매하였습니다. 도트의 추억은 사라졌어도 여전히 넘치는 유머러스한
대사들, 3명을 번갈아 플레이하며 문제들을 해결해나가는 독특함, 재밌는
캐릭터 등등 이 여전히 명작임을 느끼게 해주네요.

오랜 시간이 지났어도 과거 클리어했던 기억이 솔솔나서 별 어려움없이 
엔딩까지 직행한게 오히려 아쉬웠을 정도로 재밌는 게임입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1509662189}
review:
A very cute adventure game. I never played the original, so I was coming into this with no expectations or nostalgia. I would say that it stands up well to modern adventure game design, and the few rough spots it has are more than made up for by the very unusual characters and amusing dialog.

Rough spots: The animations and dialog can be a bit tediously slow. I don't know if this is an intentional nod to the source material, but I found it a little annoying to wait for tentacles to jump across the screen just so that dialog could continue.

Some of the solutions were pretty out there. But they were at least able to make fun of themselves for it ("You Call That A Hint" achievement). But some of the solutions involved more "try everything in my inventory on every possible target" attempts than I would normally like.

Cool spots: As stated, the characters are very interesting and amusing. But it also uses a very clever "three-state" configuration for most puzzles in the game, where you have to interact with the puzzle from the perspective of each of your three characters in order to solve it. Those were quite fun to play. Also, their game-within-the-game was surprisingly well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991638297', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1509558582}
review:
[b]My rating:[/b] 9/10
Based on: one full playthrough

[b]Full disclosure:[/b] I played and enjoyed the MS-DOS original around the turn of the century on my first home PC along with its predecessor embedded inside, Maniac Mansion, which I previously played on my Commodore 64 a decade or so back.

[b]Pros:[/b]

(+) nutty storyline involving 3 playable characters (clever but awkward nerd Bernard, lazy but wise-cracking roadie fatso Hoagie and loopy but sassy Laverne) stranded in 3 distinct time periods (the present, the colonial past and the dystopian future) trying to stop a purple tentacle monster hell bent on world domination
(+) a varied cast of supporting characters including quirky archetypes, cheeky historical figures and anthropomorphic tentacles
(+) unique time travel, inventory sharing and character switching mechanics involving high-end, state-of-the-art porta-potties
(+) freedom to explore the interconnected time periods (worlds)
(+) the wickedly irreverent and hilarious writing by the supreme LucasArts trio of Dave Grossman, Tim Schafer and Gary Winnick, ranging from potty jokes and clever easter eggs to high-brow references, delivered through the remastered, deliberately cartoonish voice acting
(+) wacky, often slapstick humour and animations reminiscent of classic cartoons with the original hand-drawn art style by the masters Peter Chan and Larry Ahern redone completely, but respectfully and beautifully in high resolution and with full widescreen support
(+) the properly goofy SFX and music are a blast from the past, but hold up splendidly, especially remastered
(+) the classic point-and-click controls improved by substituting the original unintuitive SCUMM command syntax with a streamlined radial selection menu
(+) logically sound puzzles with only a few verging on the absurd, their solving aided a bit by some easily missable hints hidden in cutscenes, conversations and throw-away lines
(+) you can switch back and forth between the original and the remaster at the press of a button
(+) the first Maniac Mansion is still playable in-game, a feature unheard-of in 1993, but imitated many times since
(+) newly introduced Steam achievements make for thorough exploration and manic experimentation
(+) vast concept art gallery and extensive developers’ commentary by Schafer, Grossman, Chan and Ahern, along with the composers Peter McConnell and Clint Bajakian
(+) perfectly playable with a mouse and keyboard, but analogue controllers are also supported
(+) expanded language options: English, French, Italian, German and Spanish interface and subtitles options, but only English and German audio
(+) another fine and masterful remaster from Double Fine overall worth paying through the suction cup for (all puns intended)

[b]Cons:[/b]

(−) developers’ commentary sometimes plays on top of the on-screen dialogue, which makes it confusing to hear
(−) infrequent, but annoying stops in character dialogue delivery while waiting for the subtitles to catch up
(−) some background dithering and low-framerate animations are more noticeable on a modern widescreen monitor
(−) occasional textual mistakes in developers' commentary subtitles (not enough proof-reading?)
(−) the first Manic Mansion playable in-game has not been remastered, only updated with a new menu, including a save/load/resume feature
(−) minimal hand holding (some easily missable hints can be gleaned from cutscenes or conversations, but there’s no journal nor check-lists to remind you)
(−) some of the more complex and multi-step puzzles may throw you for a (time) loop
(−) not nearly enough tentacles for hentai enthusiasts ;-)

[u]Check out my reviews of other Double Fine’s games:[/u]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/232790/]Broken Age[/url]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/225260/]Brütal Legend[/url]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/228360/]Full Throttle Remastered[/url]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/316790/]Grim Fandango Remastered[/url]

review: Point and click adventure games used to be the kings of the PC Gaming mountain, and this game shows exactly why. Don't expect any white-knuckle action or tense moments--this game is for those who love lateral thinking and quirky story telling.  If you've never experienced it, now is the time. It's the best paced Lucas Arts adventure game and its puzzles never get so obtuse as to need a guide. And it's funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035822222', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1509317900}
review:
Another LucasArts classic point-and-click adventure, and a good one, to say the least! If you are a fan of LucasArts games, you need no reviews for this one, but if you find this game on a sale or Steam recommends it to you, here are a few things worth noting before you try it and rate it negatively.

1. Humorous point-and-click adventures from LucasArts are known for their quite silly logic in terms of combining items and using them on the environment. Often you have to think very out of the box to progress further. Or just force your way by trying each and every item in the inventory on eveything until it works. This gets a lot easier the more you play such games, but be warned.

2. LucasArts adventures often have quite a lot of puns to real world events and phenomenae, and also many hidden references to their previous products, like Monkey Island series or Grim Fandango. So many in-game jokes might not be funny for you at all.

3. The general way LucasArts point-and-click adventures are built is that at the beginning of the game you have a task that seems to be quite easy to complete, but the whole game consists of an enormous amount of silly obstacles preventing you from completing that task. Say, at the beginning of the game you might just need to cut a rope, but you won't be able to find or craft anything that is able to cut the rope until the very end of the game. Which makes most of the fun, of course.

Hope this helps you to judge this great game honestly, and I really enjoy you would have as much fun while completing it as I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002986755', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1660202754}
review:
Una de las mejores piezas producidas por LucasArts. Difícil encontrar otra con un nivel similar como no sea Monkey Island 1/2. Joya especial en la edad de oro de las aventuras gráficas. Reconozco que me gana también por el vínculo sentimental de ser un chaval que se aficionaba a los ordenadores cuando aparecieron pero esta destaca por el nivel de gráficos, sonidos, humor, nivel de los puzzles, originalidad en la historia...

Esta versión remasterizada es justo lo que necesitaba aquella vieja aventura que he jugado en multitud de ocasiones en emuladores. Un lavado de cara de los gráficos y el control para que no chirríe en los tiempos actuales.

En resumen, si la jugaste en su día, la volverás a disfrutar. Si aún no la conoces ¿a qué esperas?

Edito: acabo de jugarlo por primera vez en una pantalla 24" a fullHD y me he quedado sobrecogido. Todos los gráficos parecen vectoriales. ¡impresionante!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1509051160}
review:
I played the original. I had a rush of nostalgia. Then I pressed F1, which - in real time - switches from the modern look to the original 4:3 640x480 look with countable pixels. My memory of the game's original look should have never come back. 

The point and click adventure is one of the best of its genre. That means three things:
- It looks great with its humor fitting toonish visuals.
- It has a funny and very strange story, that is compelling to follow through. It has timetravel and mutations!
- Most importantly, it has rather logical puzzles or well implemented hints through "meanwhile"-cutscenes or commentaries on different things with few exceptions. That means depending on your awareness you probably don't need a walkthrough.

Play it, it is rightfully a classic! 

Follow my curator at http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/?appid=680310

PS: George Washington and Harold the Pet have the same face. Noticed?

author: {'steamid': '76561198028724797', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1509008362}
review:
Voto: 8/10 

Questo gioco è un regalo di mio fratello. Avevo l'originale ma è successo qualcosa di brutto: https://videogamegeek.com/geeklist/231309/item/5700790#item5700790 

La versione rimasterizzata è tanto buona quanto l'originale, la grafica aggiornata ricostruisce perfettamente quella vecchia (molto più di quella in monkey 1 e 2). L'ho apprezzato davvero tanto. 

Come sempre si può passare alla vecchia versione del gioco semplicemente premendo un tasto. 

L'unico problema che ho avuto è inerente ai sottotitoli e alla voce, che non combaciava e causava lunghe pause nella seconda metà del gioco. Ma per fortuna c'è un tasto speciale (il punto) che si può premere per saltare un dialogo, quindi in qualche modo il problema  è gestibile. 

Non ricordavo la maggior parte degli enigmi (ci ho giocato nel 1994 o '95!) quindi mi sono divertito a raccapezzarmici da capo! 

Molto consigliato! ^^

+ Grafica perfettamente rimasterizzata
+ L'epoca d'oro delle avventure grafiche Lucas arts!!!

- Alcuni problemi

author: {'steamid': '76561198002790851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1509006205}
review:
Ein gutes Spiel aber warum trotzdem einen Daumen nach unten?

Ich besitze das Originalspiel, welches unter SCUMM auch heute noch einwandfrei funktioniert, wenn ich also 15€ in ein Remake investiere muss es sich folglich auch lohnen, leider hat es sich für mich nicht gelohnt ;(
1. Die Story des Spiels ist identisch mit dem Original, alle Konservationen sind identisch, also rechtfertigt die Story alleine nicht den Kauf des Remakes.
2. Die Grafik wurde klar verbessert, sieht zwar ab und zu so aus als wurde einfach der 4xBR-Filter angewendet aber dennoch eine Bereicherung für das Spiel.
3. Musik und Soundeffekte wurdem angeblich verbessert aber neue Sounds und Musikstücke wurden nicht implementiert. Eine große Änderung erfuhr die Tonspur: Hier haben ein paar Laien sehr unprofessionell ihre Stimmen den einzelnen Protagonisten geliehen, dabei haben durchaus auch einzelne Sprecher mehrere Charaktere synchronisiert. Alle Stimmen kommen irgendwie unmotiviert und lustlos rüber.

Für mich sieht das Spiel so aus, als hätten es ein paar Hobbyprogrammierer in ihrere Freizeit erstellt. Daran ist natürlich nichts verwerfliches und ich ziehe meinen Hut für dieses Engagement aber ein Preis jenseits der 5€ halte ich für dieses Spiel, deren Programmierer den größten Teil, also die Stroy, einfach kopiert haben, für überteuert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040485548', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1655371964}
review:
If you like Point and Click adventure games then this is a great one to play, even if you haven't played a Point and Click before then this is a great game to start with.

 • The cartoony visuals are great, if you prefer playing it in the original pixaly visuals then that's an option as well.
 • The characters are lovable, they certainly won't bore you with their oblivious minds and goofy antics.
 • The story isn't too long, but it isn't too short either. If you know exactly what you gotta do then you can beat this game in less than an hour.
 • You can get every achievement in a single run, considering if you know what you gotta do.
 • There were some times playing this game where I got stumped and had to use a guide, the game is simple but it does have it's moments where you're like "Ah! There we go!"

It's one of the more lasting Point and Clicks out there, but if you played it once there isn't really a reason to go back other than cleaning up some achievements or nostalgia.
7/10 -  Good game for your first Point and Click that isn't TellTale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995424732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1483500712}
review: Great fun to return to a classic adventure game. Doesn't take terribly long (~10 hours), but it's quite fun. Puzzles are mostly silly cartoon logic, which is part of the charm. Not as affecting as some of the other classic adeventure games, but light and amusing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114177291', 'num_games_owned': 1564, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1508478438}
review: Farkin' Good!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025484337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1514666598}
review:
Viele haben es schon geschrieben: Tolles (und in der Historie wichtiges) Spiel. die Rätsel, Dialoge und die verbesserte Grafik sind schon ne schicke Sache.
Doch warum gebe ich ein Daumen runter? 
Bei mir ist das Spiel extrem verbuggt. 
Es ist mir während des Intros einfach stehen geblieben, jedoch läuft dann dennoch die tolle Musik im Hintergrund. 
Dachte am Anfang "hm... vielleicht irgendein Problem beim Installieren".

Erstmal Fehler korrektur gemacht und nix gefunden. dann nochmal installiert und es lief... jedoch nicht lange: Obwohl ich jetzt 3/4 des Spiels druch bin, ist plötzlich der gleiche Fehler passiert. Ein Raum verlassen und dann war nix mehr zu sehen. Jedoch lief wieder die Musik. Dies ist einfach nur Schade, da dies komplett aus dem Spiel haut und man somit immer angst haben muss, dass es im nächsten Raum wieder einfriert. Jetzt könnte man sagen, dass es vielleicht meckern auf hohen nivau ist, da doch die Speicherstände automatisch bei jeden erfolg doch dann vorhanden sind. Dies ist leider nicht der Fall bzw. wird es ausgewählt, darf man gern raten, was ich sehe und höre... 

Also funktionieren nur die selbst erstellten Speicherstände und bei jeden Gang zu speichern ist echt nervig und da Spiele ich doch lieber die CD aus den 90iger. 

Falls dieses Problem gefixt wird, kann man das Spiel natürlich eine 9 von 10 geben und definitiv weiter empfehlen.
Ich freue mich schon, wenn die ganzen Indiana Jones Teile remastered werden

author: {'steamid': '76561197992552621', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1527437918}
review:
I was really impressed by Day of the Tentacle. Typically I usually find point and click adventure games to have obtuse puzzles   which halt progress, and I was able to complete this game on my own without any outside help. 

There are a ton of puzzles in this game but they seem smaller, more modualr. There was never a point where I couldnt do   something else if I couldnt figure out what I was doing wrong. Alo there are a ton of items so if you get stuck you can try new combinations or talk to non player charecters for possible hints through conversation. 

Which isnt to say there arent frusterating parts. The game still uses cartoon logic and some things might not make sense right away. But through taking breaks and trying new things I was able to finish the game and that contrubited to my enjoyment of it. 

Also the game Maniac Mansion is available inside Day of the Tentacle as an Easter Egg. I played that game a long time ago on NES and while it hasnt aged as well it is a really nice touch for a trip down memory lane. I recommend this game if you are a fan of the genre or as a jumping on point if you havent played a point and click adventure game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971267030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1477804763}
review:
[i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] is a great way to revisit the golden ages of adventure games. As a game in its own right, it employs roughly the right level of moon logic to be charming while avoiding most of the big pitfalls of insane adventure game puzzles. And as a remaster, it's one of the best around.

What makes [i]DotT[/i] largely unique among adventure games is its extremely loose structure. You're free to jump between three characters & time periods, and there's never a shortage of puzzles available & solveable at any one time. So while you might have no idea what to do with the smarmy horse blocking a doorway, you can set it aside for later rather than having to sit there hunting for pixels or trying every noun+verb combination in the game. And in service of that, the overwhelming majority of puzzles will mention key hints every time you revisit them rather than expecting you to remember a single line of dialog you came across hours prior. The end result is that the game skips along at a brisk pace and never punishes you for having forgotten to put the cereal bowl in you car's glove compartment 12 hours prior, or whatever.

In terms of the remaster, I waffle a bit on the quality of the new graphics - they can be a little flat and Flash game-looking in places. But you're able to freely toggle between the new and old graphics to compare and contrast, and frankly the biggest factor seems to be that the old pixel art was better about suggesting detail that wasn't actually there. IE, it's a faithful translation, even if it's not necessarily always an upgrade. The audio likewise can be toggled between old and new, and there's some developer commentary sprinkled in as well.

Bottom line, if you're looking to try out classic adventure games, this is the first I'd recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055963083', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1502901336}
review:
1. I do not share the halcyon memories of playing these old adventure games w/ many in my peer group. I played them, yes. I had fun for sure but they do not exactly reach the highest heights of refined gameplay. Once I got done microwaving the hamster or telling the text parser to go fuck itself, I always just got frustrated at the trial and error halfway through and either cheated or quit.


2. I still do that.


3. For what it's worth, if you do have halcyon memories of playing these games, this remastered version of The Day of the Tentacle really gets it right. They smooth out the pixelated graphics and bring in brighter, more vibrant colors. They updated the compressed, cruddy sounding audio w/ a clearer, modern sound. There's controller support. That's it. It is still the same game just presented w/ a bit more polish.


4. I can see how someone might find the humor in this game charming but I don't believe anyone who says they think it is actually funny. I smiled a few times but never laughed.


5. The setup here is a tentacle drinks a bunch of toxic waste and takes over the world. A mad scientists recruits a stoner, a nerd and a ditz to travel through time and fix things. This is could maybe be the plot of a straight-to-VHS movie full of post-rehab 80s brat packers. Like I said, this game is not actually funny.


6. The way this game works is you solve puzzles by clicking on things until it's time to stop clicking on things.


7. I'm not going to say there aren't some clever puzzles here but I'm also not gonna say you don't  have to sometimes just do some random-ass bullshit to figure stuff out. Or use a walkthrough. This game is a quarter century old, you won't be the first person who cheated.


8. The voice acting was done in 1993. God help us.


9. One actor who does a bad impression of Woody Allen and uses it to voice both some random nerdy guy and John Hancock. I will admit, that was one of the things I smiled at in the game. Of course, I did not laugh because this game is not actually funny.


10. Early on, your characters get split up between three time periods. You can easily send items to other time periods using a time traveling porta-john. You can also leave things some place in the past and have them be there in the future, normally changed to some degree. This turns the whole game into one giant puzzle made of sub-puzzles you need to puzzle through.


11. While number 10, sounds good on the surface, the execution of this idea is problematical. For starters, some items are available way out of context and way before you need them. Combine this w/ some of the goofy, not-actually-funny puzzle solutions and you wind up w/ a lot of Day of the Tentacle being needlessly obtuse and frustrating. This being said, this frustration is at least tempered by the fact that you can not put yourself in a situation where you cannot finish the game. Believe it or not, in some of these old adventure games, you could get yourself in a failure state where you couldn't win and the game didn't even have the courtesy to tell you that.


12. This is the golden age of this type of game in some people's minds. I don't get it.


13. So yeah, at its heart, at this point in time, this is really a nostalgia trip or a history lesson depending how old you are or how much attention you were paying in the nineties. If you are after either of things, absolutely, you should play Day of the Tentacle. If you are looking for the most fun way to spend a few hours of your time, don't play a decades old adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962099132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1507393864}
review:
Day of the Tentacle, das ist Point-and-Click-Klamauk vom Feinsten. Aus den Tiefen der Neunziger hat Double Fine Productions eines der großartigsten Adventures dieser Zeit gekramt und dem ganzen einen aktuellen Anstrich verpasst. Dazu noch eine etwas komfortablere Steuerung und fertig ist die Remastered Edition. 

Das Spiel: 

Day of the Tentacle ist ein ganz klassisches P&C-Abenteuer. Man steuert per Maus die Charaktere Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne. Knifflig dabei vor allem, dass man die drei simultan steuern kann und muss. Dabei müssen teilweise auch Gegenstände untereinander ausgetauscht werden, was am Anfang nicht gleich gänzlich offensichtlich ist.
Aber zurück zum eigentlichen Thema... 
Worum geht es eigentlich?
Schnell erzählt ist folgendes passiert:
Purpur Tentakel hat von Doktor Freds (verrückter Wissenschaftler) Matschmaschine kontaminiertes Wasser getrunken, hat dadurch zwei Arme bekommen sowie Allmachts-/Weltherrschaftsfantasien. Um ihn aufzuhalten, wollen der Nerd Bernhard, der übergewichtige Hardrocker Hoagie und die selbstzerstörerische Lavern mit Doktor Freds Hilfe und dem Chrono-Jon in die Vergangenheit reisen, um das zu verhindern. Weil Doktor Fred allerdings einen billigen Industriediamanten für seine Maschine verwendet hat, geht der Plan gehörig schief. Bernhard bleibt in der Gegenwart, Hoagie reist versehentlich 200 Jahre in der Zeit zurück zu den amerikanischen Gründungsvätern und Ben Franklin, während Lavern 200 Jahre in die Zukunft verfrachtet wird, in der die Tentakel die Welt beherrschen und Menschen als Haustiere halten. Und diesen Schlamassel muss man als Spieler nun wieder gerade rücken.

Klingt ganz schön verrückt? 
Genau das ist es. Neben derben Witzen und lustigen Lösungswegen ist das Spiel ein abgedreht verrücktes Abenteuer, das riesigen Spaß macht. Durch die erneuerte Steuerung geht vieles außerdem schneller von der Hand als im Original. Für Leute, die das Originial gespielt haben, sind als kleiner Zusatz zahlreiche versteckte Steamerrungenschaften integriert, die es freizuschalten gilt. Um die 100% zu erreichen ist schon einiges Ausprobieren notwendig.
Die Rätsel sind durchaus knifflig und aufgrund der drei verschiedenen Erzählstränge, die aber paralell gespielt werden können, nicht immer gleich zu durchschauen. Frust kommt dennoch selten auf, denn für annähernd jeden "bescheuerten" Lösungsversuch, wird man mit einem kruden Kommentar oder Aktion der Charaktere "belohnt". So macht selbst das planlose Klicken und herumkombinieren irgendwie Spaß. 

Sound und Videoqualität sind deutlich aufgehübscht und angepasst, wobei das eigentlich auch reine Kosmetik ist, die das Spiel eigentlich nicht brauchte. Es ist  einfach ein Point and Click Adventure, das durch seinen verrückten Ansatz und die durchgeknallte Story lebt und genau dort seine Stärken hat. 

Insgesamt?

Ich bin dennoch froh gewesen, dass es noch einmal aus den Tiefen der Vergangenheit gebuddelt und entstaubt wurde. Denn auf diese Weise bin ich nach etlichen Jahren ein zweites Mal in den Genuss eines absolut lustigen, abwechslungsreichen Klassikers gekommen. Die Spielzeit war zwar aufgrund der Vorerfahrung wesentlich kürzer, aber es hat einfach Spaß gemacht und darauf kommt es doch am Ende hauptsächlich an.
Darum gebe ich auch guten Gewissens eine Empfehlung für diesen aufgehübschten Genre-Klassiker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050442719', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1507085642}
review:
If you look at the positive reviews for this game, you'll see a LOT of them reference the fact that they played this game when it first came out.  I'm not saying that nobody trying this out in the modern day will like it, but I am saying that most will probably not.  I think there is a serious case of nostalgia-goggles here.

I went into this game not knowing much about it.  I just knew that it's considered one of the great classic point-and-clicks, and I've enjoyed quite a few P&C so thought I should try it.

What I found was a heap of terrible voice acting, writing that didn't come together into anything coherent, and humor that would probably fall flat for anyone over the age of eight.  Things like "haha, that nerd's pants are pulled up too high" and "haha, that guy tripped and fell!"

If this game were new today, it would be ripped to shreds by any critics, and then promptly forgotten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034939130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1493130373}
