author: {'steamid': '76561198035913360', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1479933478}
review:
7.9/10

Double Fine has a good reputation for creating fun games with lots of laughs and good dialogue. Day of the Tentacle is no exception.

Losely following Maniac Mansion, this game let's you explore the vast mansion of Dr. Fred again, but this time in multiple time-periods to prevent an evil tentacle from enslaving the entire world. You do this by controlling 3 teenagers with their own personalities and quirks, spending most of your time solving puzzles or interacting with the goody characters. If you have played the Monkey Island games or Grim Fandango you shold feel right at home especially with this remaster.

What's so good about this game is that most of the time the only thing controling the pacing is you, the player. If you get stuck it's often solved by talking or interacting with most of your environment and you should be able to figure out the way to progress forward. And exploring is fun, often rewarding with great dialogue and a couple of jokes.

Also worth mentioning that the entire first game, Maniac Mansion, is fully playable within this game! Two great games for the price of one!

If you like fun point and click-adventures, give this game a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016487911', 'num_games_owned': 1972, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1506545229}
review:
This is one of the classic point and click adventures from back in the day. For anyone who has some nostalgia for the game, then this game is a no brainer. It has been lovingly remastered. They have updated the user interface as well as the graphics. It is intuitive and easy to play, unlike the original Maniac Mansion game which is included and can be played inside this game. It certainly made me appreciate the new user interface.  And made me wonder how I ever played the original Maniac Mansion game without going mad! 

The game is wacky and fun and has some great writing in it. If you don't cheat and look up the solutions, then it will take you some time. It is always best to sleep on some of the puzzles. And the writing is so good that you want to try every dialogue option anyway, just to hear all the jokes. There was only a couple of places where I was really stumped more by the user interface than by the puzzle itself. One time I didn't get the dialogue I needed and another time Bernard would not use an item. But quitting the game and trying again later I solved the puzzle straight away even though in my head I was trying the exact same thing. The game only bugged out once, which is good for a double fine game. The game would let me move my character but I could not interact with any objects or other characters. I could not even get to the menu to quit the game. 

If you have never played the game, and want to try a point a click adventure, then this is a good fun choice. It looks and sounds good, the user interface is intuitive. The remastering makes it feel pretty modern, I only hit those 2 puzzles that felt clunky and frustrating, and unlike most of the original point and click games, there are no totally impossible, totally stupid puzzles/solutions. You are NOT forced to click every object on every other object in every location like some games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971452301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1710645957}
review:
¿Como podria describirse este juego?

Yo siempre lo he calificado como una obra maestra, en el momento cumbre de las aventuras gráficas, es cierto que no es excesivamente largo, pero si lo suficientemente complejo para tenerte entretenido númerosas horas. La aventura tiene un gran arte el cual se ha mejorado sustancialmente con esta remasterización.

A diferencia de las remasterizaciones de monkey island 1 y 2, las cuales tenian un control pesimo, un arte no acorde y encima el modo "antiguo" no estaba ni traducido, está es todo lo contrario. Lo primero la remasterización es el mismo juego pero con los gráficos acordes a día de hoy (el pixelado de las animaciones ya no se ve, si no que es dibujo del bueno), Lo segundo, el control no ha empeorado y es totalmente digno de una aventura gráfica y lo tercero si pones el modo antiguo sigues teniendo el juego en Español.

¿Hay alguna cosa mala?

Bien aparte de que el juego solo esta traducido y no doblado, el juego incluye una aventura de maniac mansión (el primer juego de la saga) el cual se activa ejecutando el pc. Esta aventura gráfica extra la cual es muy buena (aunque muy dificil, pero tiene varios caminos para realizarla), tiene el problema de que no se ha traducido, (es decir esta en ingles) y tampoco ha recibido remasterización. Hubiese estado bien que al menos hubiese estado traducida.

Recomendablep ara todos aquellos que amen este tipo de juegos. No defraudará.

author: {'steamid': '76561198310540345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1505777748}
review:
If Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure had a baby with the Monkey Island Games they would create Day of the Tentacle.

Typical Lucas Arts puzzles - always making you look for outside the box for solutions. Funny storyline. Beautiful artwork/animation/graphics and seamless game play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1505419538}
review:
This is a great point and click adventure game. It's got all thats needed:

+ Good voice acting and dialogue
+ Puzzles that are not necessarily easy, but that have sensible solutions once you work them out
+ A wide world to explore
+ A funny story with interesting characters
+ A unique twist that makes it different to other games (in this case the multi-character puzzle solving)

In addition, it's also very nice to see:

+ Controller support
+ The very fluid in game comparison between remastered and classic versions

I'm actually not sure there's anything bad I could say about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975149085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1502977947}
review: This is Day of the Tentacle, just as I remember it. The graphics are exactly as I remember them in my mind, only sharper and higher resolution than a 386 with a 14" CRT can do. Unfortunately, I still remembered most of the solutions to the puzzles, so I only spent about 4 hours in this fun wacky world. Highly recommended if well drawn crazy cartoon characters in a world of madness sounds appealing to you, and you don't mind a few "moonlogic" puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091310320', 'num_games_owned': 925, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1479565027}
review:

The newer graphics work well too. In fact they are exactly what I wanted them to be.
Can't think of anything to complain about, from the top of my head.

review: A game from a simpler time...  A modernization of the past brought into the future.

review:
This game is simply amazing, even if you take the nostalgia away.
The remastered version polishes graphics in a better view (even though I don't like the new dial verbs interface, I switched back to the old version) and the developer comments are a nice and interesting add-on.

The only downside of this is the 15€ price... come on, the Monkey Island remasters are 10€, that's a fair price.

review: This was the game of my childhood. My father had it and would out me on his lap at the age of 2 as he played it. It is probably a big reason why I love video games. As much as I love playing the original version for reminiscing, the remastered version is much easier and user friendly. If you're up for a vintage point and click I highly recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080028990', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1707621029}
review:
If Grim Fandango was the zenith of Lucasarts Adventure games, then Day of the Tentacle was surely where they began to hit their stride. This was about the time when they started moving from the awkward SCUMM system of the early Monkey Island games, became confident in their humour, gained a distinct art style (and I do mean art), and finally added voices. Glorious, glorious voices.

I've had three versions of DotT. I'd played the original version on floppies. I'd played the CD-ROM versions. I, at some point, downloaded a copy of it to run on SCUMMVM, first on my laptop, then on my phone. And now I have the Remastered version. Is it worth it?

Well, I got it on sale for USD 3.00, which seems about right. Obviously, the graphics are a lot better. No more pixels, no more jagged edges, everything looks like a hand-drawn image. The animations are unchanged, so everything still moves at 10 frames. There are achievements (one of which is very annoying, and I'll have to play through again to get it). There is now a menu, which is very nice, with the save menu being through a floppy drive, and looking like a DOS interface (which I love). There is a developer commentary, which while enlightening, isn't as great as the one for Grim Fandango.

Get DotT:R if you're a completionist, or you want to see what a real adventure game was like back in the day. It's not highly recommended, the way that Grim Fandango was, but it's good for a few laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191355649', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1503866616}
review:
Day of the Tentacle (originally released in 1993) is a game that I had not played before this remastered version. However the beautiful animation that was almost like a 90’s cartoon come to life and the silly humor were more than enough to keep me hooked from beginning to end. I’ll come right out and say it, I had to use a walkthrough for this game. Some of the puzzles were incredibly tough and I have no shame in throwing that out there. It did not take away from my overall enjoyment of the game though, in fact I liked it so much that I have changed my laptop wallpaper to the one offered by the official site for the game.

I think The Well-Red Mage said it best when he described the humor in this game as “Dad Jokes”. They make you laugh and cringe at the same time, which is not the type of humor everybody is into so be aware that things do get quite a bit cheesy.
 
So onto the game, you play as a group of three that find themselves in quite the perilous situations. Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne are palling around with a bit of a mad scientist named Dr. Fred Edison. This lands them a trip in the time machine to three separate destinations (one of which being the present) and from there it is time to point and click adventure your way back to the present day with all characters and defeat the tentacle foes!

So what is it with these tentacles? Well there is an evil purple tentacle and a chill green tentacle who wants nothing to do with Purple’s world domination plot. Green calls in a favor to Bernard to stop Dr. Fred from putting him down along with Purple, thus allowing Purple to escape and getting the lot of them into the whole situation.

Day of the Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion, a game that I haven’t played through entirely but I really enjoyed the bit that I did play. The amazing part about my time playing Maniac Mansion? It happened right there on Day of the Tentacle Remastered!

The full game is available on an in-game computer and I was hooked all the way until I got very stuck and decided I should get back to the main game. I am not sure if this was a feature in the original before the remaster, but I thought that was an incredible addition to the game. I actually didn’t even know that Day of the Tentacle was a sequel at all until doing some research after completing the game. I did notice the subtle similarities between the games and assumed there had to be some sort of connection between the two.

There is some really cool functionality with the three characters being in different times in Day of the Tentacle, you are able to send objects back and forth between the times as you desire and objects you get in one time may be necessary to move on in the other. Hoagie finds himself back in colonial times with the nation’s founding fathers among other characters and figures, Bernard is in the present with Dr. Fred, and Laverne is in the dystopian future with the tentacle overlords. It is easy to swap back and forth between the three by a simple click on the picture of the character in your items menu....



To read the full review please visit here https://thewellredmage.com/2017/09/05/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered/

And be sure to follow on IG, Twitter & FB @SublimeReviews or just follow my blog at http://www.sublimereviews.wordpress.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198107892313', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1496855450}
review:
Well, well, well..... Look what we have here!

This game is the kinda game that makes you laugh anytime when it can. It's perfectly made in any sense: Hilarious story, lovable characters (by the times i write this i even have the steam name Purple Tentacle, thats how much I love this game),
great music/soundtrack and easter eggs everywhere! It's a cult classic point and click adventure game by any sense.

My first playthrough toke me 6.9 hours, BUT it doesn't mean it's a short game (mainly because I used some help. Shame on me). This was also the first game where i got all the achievements (I don't buy/play  trash achievement hunter games) and it toke me 10.3 hour to do it (I got lot from the first playthrough), also it's preaty easy to speed run (I tried it myself but when i finished with like 55 mins and checked whats the best time, I stoped it)

So this game is one of the best Point and Click adventure game (along with Monkey Island)
For me it's easily a [b]9.5/10.0[/b]
[b]It's a game that everyone who likes point and click adventure games even just a little bit should play once (or 3-4-5 times)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1504553436}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Ja (persönliche Wertung: 9/10)

Errungenschaften: Ja (Einige sind schwer zu bekommen)

Positiv:
- Abgedrehte Zeitreisestory
- Humorvolle Texte
- Grafik einfach gehalten
- Gutes Point & Click - Adventure

Negativ:
- Musik mit der Zeit nervig

Fazit:
Dies ist eines der abgedrehtesten Spiele die ich je gespielt habe. Jahrelang wurde es mir empfohlen. Jetzt habe ich es mir mal angenommen und bin absolut nicht enttäuscht. An so vielen Stellen musste ich herzhaft lachen. Besonders wie übel dem Hamster zugespielt wird ist herrlich. Geschichte findet in diesem Spiel auch statt. Man trifft auf historische Persönlichkeiten, wie George Washington oder Benjamin Franklin (Warnung nebenbei: So schön es auch inszeniert ist - es ist nicht so geschehen). Die Grafik ist in diesem Spiel einfach gehalten. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen Zeichentrickstil, welcher liebevolle Details aufweist. Die Musik kann mit der Zeit nervig sein, kann aber auch leiser gemacht werden. Die gesprochenen Texte sind humorvoll gestrickt und wirklich gut zu verstehen, es sei denn die Musik ist zu laut. Ich kann mich nur dem anschließen was mir gesagt wurde: Empfehlenswert für jeden der Mal eine Packung Humor braucht!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016365353', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1503527313}
review:
Che dire: la mia infanzia è legata a doppio filo alle avventure grafiche made in Lucas e Day Of The Tentacle è, senza girarci troppo intorno, una delle migliori, nonché sul podio delle mie preferite.
Ho sempre adorato lo stile esagerato, i personaggi folli, gli enigmi strampalati ed al limite della logica ([spoiler]il carro ed il sapone...[/spoiler]) e gli intrighi spazio-temporali; rigiocare questa remastered è stato come farsi un giro, da adulti, nel parchetto sotto casa dove, da bambini, si trascorrevano le giornate in assoluta spensieratezza, provando felicità, nostalgia e malinconia in ordine sparso.

Cheers...a tentacolo verde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067916056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 840, 'last_played': 1503517221}
review:
A játék elődjét nem ismertem, ezt a párom ajánlotta.
Magyarítással játszottam végig - végre egy point&click amit teljesen értettem! :D  -, és tetszett a sztorija. Először megijedtem, hogy három karakterrel kell párhuzamosan játszani, kicsit megnehezítette a dolgom.. Pár alkalommal megakadtam, és ért pár "facepalm", mikor tök egyértelmű dolgokra nem jöttem rá... (Gyakran fordul elő velem ilyen játék esetén, hogy túlbonyolítok.) Jók a poénok, a dilis karakterek. A zene olykor már sok volt, de az a probléma könnyen kiküszöbölhető. :) Egyetlen gondom az volt, hogy a kitűző megszerzésekor egy tök béna hátteret kaptam... :'( :P Ettől függetlenül természetesen csak ajánlani tudom a csápokat! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198088380930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1503387273}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is the sequel to the acclaimed Maniac Mansion. At first you might be saying "Why play the sequel, if I haven't played the original?", well the game Maniac Mansion is playable within the gameplay of the sequel. Once you are able to control Bernard freely in the mansion to go to the third floor, and enter the room on the right and access the computer where you will immediately be able to play and save Maniac Mansion in its' entirety. If you want to know the whole back story to the prior events of Day of the Tentacle then this is a nessacary side quest to focus on. So let's first talk about Maniac Mansion before talking about the sequel. Maniac Mansion was an adventure game from LucasArts, the plot consists of a meteor crash landing next to the mansion owned by the macabre Edison family(no relation to Thomas Edison). The head of the household Dr. Fred Edison came into contact with the meteor and tried to examine it for scientific purposes. The meteor was not your average shooting star as it has hypnotic powers that put Dr. Fred into a trance and now has the urge to take over the world. 20 years later, Dr. Fred kidnapped a college girl named Sandy as a means to conduct his experiment in taking over the world. Sandy's boyfriend Dave Miller tracks down his girlfriend's whereabouts at the Edison Mansion with two friends of his for back-up knowing his girlfriend was abducted by a mad man and that the rescue attempt will be dangerous. The mansion itself is a big place to cover ground there are many locked rooms and the presence of the Edison family members and their pets which are two large disembodied tentacles. With various items to obtain and many secret passage ways and rooms to discover, Dave will most likely succeed in saving Sandy and try to put an end to the master plan of hypnotised Dr. Fred. 

Maniac Mansion was an innovating adventure game for its time as it was the first game to utilize in the SCUMM game engine. A type of game engine that would be used in the much of the later LucasArts games, where the command options consist of give, use, talk, push, etc. Directed by Ron Gilbert who would go on to creating the Monkey Island games and additional staff work done by Tim Schaffer who was just starting in the computer game business at the time this game went into production. The game took two years to make and drew heavy inspiration from B movies and horror genre films for the basis of the story. This was a game that requires trial and error, as anyone playing it for the first time might mess up at first but will get better as you play it. There are multiple endings to the game, and with a selection of a few different characters to help out Dave, its a mix and match option that offers plenty of possibilities. Since the sequel features Bernard, it's recommended to have Bernard in the party to create continuity. The game was cool for offering more than other adventure games had at the time of its release. 

Now to finally talk about the sequel, Day of the Tentacle. The game is set five years after the events of the original game. The game starts off with one of the pet tentacles own by the Edisons(In this case the Purple Tentacle) drinks sludge that's been polluting the river by the Edison Mansion. Purple Tentacle began to grow small flapper arms, intelligence, and the urge to dominate the world. Dr. Fred tries to rid of this problem by killing both of the tentacles so that way the world will be sparred from deranged tentacles. Green Tentacle sends a plea for help via mail to his friend Bernard, knowing he will save him and his purple brother. Bernard receives the letter from his green friend and agrees with himself that he must comply to the plea of help. But that also means he must return to the mansion, a place he'd hope he would never have to revisit again. So after recruiting his roommates Laverne the crazed medical student and Hoagie the roadie travel to the mansion to set the tentacles free. They made things worse as Purple Tentacle escapes to continue his conquest. Because Purple Tentacle is smarter and quicker than an average human it would be impossible to foil his world domination plans. Which is why Dr. Fred cooks up a plan by sending Laverne, Bernard, & Hoagie back in time via three time traveling porta-potties to the day before Purple Tentacle drank the sludge to prevent the incident from ever happening in the first place. The plan goes abust when the fake diamond instead of a real one used for the power source breaks down the time machines. Bernard ends up where he last lifted off while Hoagie is stuck in the colonial times 200 years in the past and Laverne is stuck in the 22nd Century where tentacles have already taken over most of the planet. Bernard much help his friends by sending items through time to help his friends power up their own individual porta-potties in order to travel back to the past and stop Purple Tentacle once and for all. They must hurry as Purple Tentacle quickly rises in power as the game progresses. 

This sequel was better than the original game in contrast with the plot and gameplay. This time around you only play as three default characters with Bernard being the only protagnogist from Maniac Mansion to return. The gameplay is more linear meaning no matter what you do the out come remains the same. The art style was improved as it looked like an interactive cartoon on par with the earlier Humongous Games and the first Sam & Max game. It was one of the earliest LucasArts games to feature voice acting, something that wasn't too common for computers games to offer at the time. The game was Tim Schafer's first time directing along with Dave Grossman who later directed the second Bone game from Telltale and wrote for the the first two Monkey Island games. The characters were all great and the humor is right up there with the Monkey Island games. Anyone who loves the Monkey Island games will love the Maniac Mansion Duology games. These games played an important role for both adventure genre games and future LucasArts games a like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212769343', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1503534370}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

The Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game.

+ Interesting plot
+ Odd sense of humor
- Hard to figure out

[h1]Review[/h1]

The Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game. In this game you control Bernard, Hoagie and Laverne to stop the Purple tentacle who is trying to take over the world.

In order to stop plans of world domination you will have to go back one day to the past but things don't go so well and each of your controllable characters get to different points in time: past, present and future. You can switch characters and you will have send items through time in order to beat the game.

The game has a odd but creative sense of humor that takes advantage of the different time lines. Interestingly the characters you find in the past have descendants of the future that somewhat preserve their personalities. Some characters are historical figures. The graphical style is wacky cartoon styled and fits the game plot.

The main issue with this game is that it is very hard to figure out what to do. The puzzles often don't really have much logic and sometimes lacks tips entirely so you may end up brute forcing by attempting every possible action or reading a walk-through. This is somewhat typical of these kinds of games but you will see what I mean if you try to beat the game.

The game also includes Maniac Mansion so it's actually two games in one. In fact Day of the Tentacle is considered to be Maniac Mansion 2.

I did enjoy the game for what it is even though the puzzles are very hard to figure out so I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098287608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1503193394}
review:
Joguei Day of the Tentacle pela primeira vez há mais de 20 anos, na minha adolescência. Na época, mal sabia duas palavras em inglês, então joguei-o do início ao fim de forma instintiva, testando todas as combinações possíveis e imagináveis até conseguir realizar alguma coisa, e entendendo apenas o que poderia ser entendido pelas imagens do jogo.

Tendo a possibilidade de jogar a versão remasterizada, pude entende-lo melhor agora, mas é incrível como ainda me lembrava de vários detalhes do jogo. Então talvez seja o motivo de tê-lo terminado tão rapidamente (Na minha memória o jogo parecia muito mais longo).

Pode até parecer datado para algumas pessoas. Mas para mim é um jogo divertido que mantém seu charme mesmo depois de tanto tempo. 
Pena que nunca fizeram uma continuação.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071724143', 'num_games_owned': 748, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1478801800}
review:
Dejando al margen que posiblemente sea de las mejores aventuras gráficas de la historia, el remaster está genial. Han hecho un trabajo muy bueno y no hay queja alguna de esta obra maestra.  

Sobre el juego si no lo has jugado: comentarios muy graciosos y dificultad tirando a alta en algunos puntos, pero dificilmente quedas atascado ya que hay mucho por hacer y siempre puedes probar por otro lado.

review: I love these point-and-click games and this is one of the best.  It's challenging and funny.  It doesn't go wrong where a lot of other point-and-click games do, which is making puzzles that are so contrived that you'll never figure them out.  The puzzles in this game are challenging, but not frustrating.

review:
Pros:
Time travel makes some interesting puzzles.
Bernard is pretty funny and Laverne is disturbingly adorable. 
Voice acting is  great.
I like that everything happens in this one location
Like the art.
Ted Edison.

Cons:
Hoagie isn't that funny at all(I don't find people like him funny).
A good chunk of the humor didn't hit me or felt dated.
There were a few puzzles I had to get a guide to figure out like the two involving cats.

author: {'steamid': '76561198413105060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1613616339}
review: Je démarre seulement l'aventure mais je suis déjà conquis. La remasterisation est impeccable et ça fait vraiment plaisir de découvrir ou de se replonger dans un des meilleurs Point And Click de tous les temps! C'est déjanté, cartoonesque, et ça n'a n'a pas pris une ride! Foncez!

author: {'steamid': '76561198143702787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1653068624}
review:
Per chi già l'ha giocato è la solita storica avventura grafica, solo più bella da vedere.
E' incredibile come me lo ricordavo praticamente identico al remake in ogni sua schermata, eppure il passaggio tra la versione pixellosa e quella vettorializzata (possibile in qualsiasi momento) è sempre sorprendente.

Per chi non l'ha mai giocato, è un titolo carismatico e divertissimo, assolutamente da non perdere.
Peccato per il mancato doppiaggio in italiano, ma le voci americane sono troppo forti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085725324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1502058773}
review:
SUBTITLES: Press + (not sure if it works with the number pad one) until the speed of the subtitles is ok to you!!! 
Of course, - slows them down.

The default is so slow it misses whole last sentences of each speech, and using . to skip the dialogue one risks missing further sentences from the same "unit" that can be important hints.

Nice game, but had to use "Universal Hint System" website several times even when I knew what I wanted to achieve.
It's Lucasarts so you can't die, etc. so no stress. The 3 parallel timelines gives it nice mechanics/ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010012994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1502056050}
review:
This was surprisingly as fun as it was when I first played it back in the 90's!

The only down side was having played the original release, which nearly brought me to tears trying to work out the what worked with what to get the desired results/progress, I remembered quite a lot of it meaning it was less of an adventure but a lot of nostalgia. Maniac Mansion in-game-game is still fun also (classic graphics).

Worth a play if you like and have the patience for simple adventure problem solving games, or enjoyed the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025745213', 'num_games_owned': 1305, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1502036006}
review:
[b] Clásico atemporal  [/b]

Un trabajo de remasterización sobresaliente que si pudiera resumir en sus aspectos [u]positivos[/u] sería : 
 [list]
[*] Muy buena adaptación de los controles. Ahora es cuando te das cuenta que los de 1993 eran un engorro
[*] Genial banda sonora y efectos de sonido
[*] Gráficos muy bien remasterizados conservando el encanto cartoon intacto
[*] Buena traducción
[*] Volver a jugar al Maniac Mansion original desde el ordenador de Weird Edison
[*] Comentarios de los creadores muy interesantes
[*] SIgue siendo igual de divertido que en 1993
[/list]
¿ Y en el lado [u]negativo[/u] ? Pues poca cosa, por poner algo : 
[list]
[*] Las animaciones podrían haber estado algo mejor hechas que en 1993. Son demasiado fieles y bruscas.
[*] Lo mismo que en 1993, es demasiado corto ! Te quedas con ganas de más
[*] Algunos logros son un poco absurdos y obligan a jugar una segunda vuelta en modo speedrun (e.g. Apreciación musical)
[*] Los 3 anteriores son estupideces, [b]COMPRA ESTA JOYA[/b]
[/list]

En resumen, un gran trabajo de Double Fine. Quizás no guste a todo el mundo (nuevas generaciones), pero los viejos rockeros lo disfrutarán a lo grande con un atisbo de lagrimas en los ojos. Para saborearlo de verdad había que haber estado ahí en 1993 con tus diskettes de 3 1/2,  jugando en un 386 a otros clásicazos como Sam & Max, Monkey 1 (VGA) , Legend Of Kyrandia de Westwood, etc... 

Recomendado al 200%. Un 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016632416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1493701149}

author: {'steamid': '76561198252118904', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1501488466}
review:
Day of the Tentacle offers a quite unique experience playing with 3 characters simultaneously. New graphics are solid and true to the original game. The sound is pretty much the same. To sum up, it's pretty much the same game.
I'd consider it a good buy for nostalgic fans and for the adventure gamers alike. The game is fun and humorous now as it was back in '99 when I first completed it as an 11 year old. It's maybe even more humorous now that I am older.

There aren't many negative aspects to it and I'll adress all I have encountered. 
The game may be short for hardcore adventure gamers since you can complete it under 10 hours of gametime. Also, there are a few glitches of music stopping while alt+tabbing and subtitles lagging behind sound but nothing game breaking in my opinion since all of the issues can easily be fixed by saving the game, exiting then loading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081029343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1664128441}
review:
This game brings back so many great childhood memories. It may be basic compared with todays games but you can't beat a good point click puzzle classic.

Upon starting the game your immediately drawn into the story, it doesnt take long to understand what the plot is and what your goal is. The dialogue is smart and witty with various references....(mainly to star wars).
For those new to the game the puzzles can be a little tricky to solve and you may be left with very little guidance on which items are needed and where. However, a bit of common sense and sometimes a dark sense of humour is all thats needed to solve certain situations.

The remastered version is fantastic, with the ability to alternate from the classic/remastered appearance with the click of a button during gameplay. Interesting commentary adds to the history of how the game was developed for those interested. The artwork is what pulled me into the game originally and with the smoother graphics i've fallen in love with it all over again.

This game is great for old fans and new ones. This is definately a biased review with nostagic influence although I don't care, I'd recommend this to anyone who want's to kill some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1809, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1501691187}
review:
This game is a brilliant classic point and click game. Its also another great remaster from Double Fine who I thought also did a brilliant job with their Grim Fandango remaster.

Day of the Tentacle gives you control of 3 characters. One in the past, one in the present and one in the future. You can pass items between characters via the toilet in a portaloo time machine (dont ask). Other than that its pretty standard point and click gameplay but this game offers a lot of challenging puzzles to solve. I loved the humour and zany characters and ths is what makes it stand out.

The remaster has been masterfully done. The game has had all its animation redone and modernised as well as the sound and music. I hadn't played the original but you can switch to the original style with the press of a button and this really highlights the improvements. It's also possible to play the entirety of Maniac Mansion, the prequel of DotT, wihin the game.

There are a couple downsides. Some of the solutions are really out there and can be very difficult to figure out. Also very occasionaly I had problems with the sound where the music would randomly cut out though this would be fixed on moving to another room.

Overall this is a brilliant game and if your a fan of the point and click genre then this is worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067321382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1501545623}
review:
Questo titolo, uscito negli anni 90, l'ho giocato da adolescente. Nel 2016 lo portano in una versione remastered e non potevo non prenderlo. Un divertentissimo gioco punta e clicca, come ci ha sempre abituati la LucasArts. Nei panni di un nerd, un metallaro ed una studentessa di medicina con la testa per aria, dovremo fermare i piani diabolici di tentacolo Viola, diventato cattivo a causa di certe scorie. La particolarità di questo titolo sta nel fatto che i nostri protagonisti saranno sbalzati in epoche diverse e dovranno, tra loro, interagire cambiando la storia e cercando di passarsi le cose utili attraverso le rispettive macchine del tempo (dei gabinetti). Un gioco adatto a tutte le età. La grafica è bella, in stile cartoon. Le musiche godibili. Gli enigmi non sempre facili, ma sicuramente divertenti. Forse, conoscendo la storia americana, si apprezzerebbe addirittura meglio questo titolo in quanto i riferimenti a personaggi storici è continua. Inoltre, fanno capolino diversi camei di altri personaggi di Lucas apparsi nelle varie avventure. Se vi piacciono le avventure grafiche in vecchio stile, vi consiglio questo gioco. E vi consiglio, ovviamente, tutti gli altri giochi della LucasArts.  
P. S. All'interno del gioco stesso, c'è un modo per giocare al titolo precedente della serie (completamente indipendente e slegato da questo, sia chiaro), Maniac Mansion. 

Voto personale: 8

author: {'steamid': '76561198172392767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1501286209}
review:
Very mixed feelings on whether or not to recommend that one. It's not really about what's in the game but more about whether or not you want updated graphics or not.

There are new features, like skipping dialogue and button press = highlighting of objects you can interact with, but other than that and the updated graphics it's still the same game as the classic.

You can toggle the in-game graphics between the new and the old design flawlessly at all times but then also lack some of the features tied to the new graphics and their engine. Art-wise the design is a flawless improvement of the classic.

Mentionable issues others had are crashes and freezes which I can't verify as I didn't have a single issue like that up to the point of completing the game. What issue I encountered was merely noticing that if you enable not just audio but also the display of the text spoken that there are most often mismatches or delay issues with the text.

So... if you just disable the text and leave the audio on that won't be an issue.
Size-wise this remake is rather large, compared to the slim, old classic, playable with ScummVM: 2.65 GB of the remake compared to ~140 MB of the classic.

Your choice whether or not and what you want to pay for better graphics and a few new features.
I'm gonna give it a thumbs up because it's well done aside from that one issue I had, even though it happens throughout the game. The new features and good controls allow to compensate for that, imo.

The major conflict is more about the remake vs the classic with ScummVM and available for free.
Just wait for a discount if you're sceptical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093402962', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1558904315}
review:
Man what a blast from the past. We kids got it in ~1997 on a second-hand PC and spent weeks discovering every single clickable thing in the present-day mansion. I managed to recall quite a few tricks during this playthrough 20 years later. We used to always get stuck at a point where the game asked us to insert something from 'the manual'. I've always thought it was some kind of old school DRM. Was it actually? I found out online now that the feature was only in the 'non-talking' version and it was basically a combination lock with 4 * 4 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 = 256 possibilities (you had to mess around with croutons and stuff). I managed to accidentally crack it once during my childhood, but then lost the savegame : ( So you could say I had this game on hold for 2 decades.

DOTT is a classic not unlike the Monkey Island games. Great plot, writing and lots and lots of warm humour. The puzzles are quite tough and if I hadn't had my memories and I admit, 3 little peeks in the walkthrough, it would have probably taken me something like a day instead of 4 hours to complete.

The remastered version also features developers' commentary and Maniac Mansion as a game-within-a-game, but I didn't bother with those since the original game was largely unexplored territory for me and I didn't need any extra nostalgia to spice things up. But those may be really interesting for people who have DOTT memorized backwards.

They don't often make complex games any more. As I said, without cheating DOTT is a bit difficult to figure out and millennials will probably have trouble attention span wise. But if you're on a mission to play through, say, 100 essential video games, DOTT definitely has to be on that list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225697292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1500629376}
review:
Pour tous  les de RetroGaming et ceux qui ont la trentaine d'années doivent connaitre car c'est un jeu auquel j'ai joué dans les année 1995 et qui m'as marqué et m^émé en remasterisé il est toujours aussi sublime.
c'est un jeu jeu dans lequel on rentre facilement dans l'histoire qui est en soit originale. Le graphisme, quand on joue à la version non remasterisé est en pixel et bien fait, et le remasterisé est bien mais mon choix perso se tourne vers la version pixelisé. Le son est parfait et colle bien au jeu avec les bruitages des objets et des éléments du décors comme l'orage.
Je le conseille fortement même si vous n'aimez pas les point'n'clik, celui là est un jeu à faire au moins une fois.

~ 𝕯𝖗𝖆𝖈𝖔

author: {'steamid': '76561198040904558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1693865659}
review: I was surprised that the game was more for adults than children. It's like Sam and Max except a little more tame. The puzzles can be seriously hard. There were a few times that I needed to use a guide or find hints because I was clueless. I'm happy with the difficulty. It gave me a challenge rather than being a complete cake walk. One hint that I would like to have known is that the game will try to use all the game mechanics that it offers you. The pushing, pulling, closing doors, etc are all used in the game. Don't overlook them like I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969738396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1498988993}
review: Da man sich mit Musik in 90ern nicht rühmen kann, die Point and Click Adventures bleiben grandios. Auch wenn man sich noch an viele Rätsel erinnern kann.... an manchen Stellen hängt man doch länger als erwartet und genießt den triumphalen Moment des Erfolgs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015878999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1500037308}
review: Day of the Tentacle is without a doubt my favourite game EVER. I used to play all the Graphic Adventures that were out back in the day, and when DOTT came out it blew my mind away - and it's up to this days that the hilarious humour, the cartoony graphics (remastered now!), the ingenious puzzles, the great characters, the witty dialogues, the music, the animations, and EVERYTHING in between, stand out as what a "Point n' Click" game should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071989178', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1500163061}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993488562', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1499940100}
review:
When I look at a remake of an old classic game, I always wonder 2 things. 1) How many of the positive reviews are pure nostalgia? And 2) How buggy is this remake?
Well, I had tons of fun playing this remake, and I had never played the old version, so it's not all nostalgia. And I experienced no bugs at all. 

The game's not perfect. Some of the puzzle solutions don't make much sense, so that can be frustrating. The setting is a little dated, and the characters are shallow dated stereotypes. But... 

It's a ton of fun. A very funny, quirky game. A lot of the puzzles are straightforward and fun to figure out. It's fun to figure out how to change the past to affect the future. The game in one word: Fun.

This game is a must have for people who like quirky humorous games, and classic 90s style point and click adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997432749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1498621181}
review:
A remake must make the good aspects of the game better and eliminate problems with the game.  At the same time, it needs the authenticity of being the original game (in contrast to a reboot).

Dott remastered does improve on graphics.  It also improves on the adventure game "menu" (talk, look, take) by elimating its living place at the bottom of the screen to make the game full screen. 

What would have been nice is an improvement on some of the other things.  There were some awkward pauses in transitioning in and out of cut scenes that were kept.  It would have been nice to see mouths match the speech too, which makes itself more obvious than before with the sharper graphics.  It also would have been nice for some improvement on the backgrounds now that everything is not pixelated (at least beyond the Jar-Jar Binks photo (love it by-the-way!) hidden in the past.)  After playing Ducktales Remastered, Dott Remastered feels more like Dott "Updated."  And that is a good thing if you want to play a classic Lucas Arts game on your new machine.  

In conclusion, the title "remastered" is a bit of a misnomer, but breathing life into a classic adventure game is nice to see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234901172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1563950763}

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1586456731}
review:
Okay so I haven't played this game in twenty years but I'm surprised by how much I remembered.  

First of all, this is one of the best adventure games I've ever played because it's hilarious and offers a decent challenge especially when compared to modern ones.  The characters are interesting and I liked it better than the original.  What's cool is that it offers the original game as well so if you missed out on both of these you don't have to worry anymore. 

As for the remastered features, I like the graphics and they help you out when it comes to seeing what items can be used in the game.  It's much clearer than the original pixellated game.  I also think the sound is terrific and I didn't notice anything different.  

The price was a little steep when I bought it, however, since it doesn't take too long to beat.  I would recommend waiting until it goes on sale.  

If you enjoy Adventure games, you cannot go wrong with this one.  It puts anything that Telltale does to shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040791464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1499545615}
review:
Une version remasterisé d'assez bonne facture. Les musiques n'ont pas été "dénaturé". La nouvelle interface (au revoir la liste de verbes) peu surprendre et laisse sa place pour quelques chose de plus intiutif.. (pensé pour une manette PS4! -lol-).

Jeune c'était un de mes click and play préférés, résultat je l'ai fini extrémement vite, y compris avec l'ensemble des succés (qui ne demandent pas de faire des "choses absolument improbables" il faut le dire).. Comme quoi j'ai du y jouer bien plus que je m'en souvenais.
Moralité, il est clair que mon avis ne sera pas objéctif.
Je vais tout de même essayer de le diviser en deux temps.

Coté nostalgie, évidément le service est là.. On a une version remasterisé correcte, des nouveaux thèmes presque identique (qui crachent moins), le "swap" des tentacules qui saute à changé malheureusement...Mais on peu de toute manière jouer avec l'anciennes bande son, indépendament de anciens décors etc. C'est extrémement appréciable. Le fait de pouvoir changer la version d'une simple touche en temps réel, aussi.
De même, chose EXTREMEMENT appréciable pour tout Fans du jeu: les commentaires audios !

Cotés jeu du genre, d'une part on est là face à un des classique parmis les classiques, sans doute le plus réussi sous le moteur SCUMM (pour le jeu de mot: "ordure/pourriture").
L'humour très présent est une marque de fabrique de Lucasart. On peu dire que c'est tout de même assez réussis, et reste intemporel... (En fait il n'y qu'une seul blague qui devrait être "incompréhensible", une faisant référence à Helms qui est "vexxé" par la candidature de Pourpre*).
Les énigmens restent extrémement logique, les solutions des manoeuvres "complexe" toujours soufflé et induite par les discusions. Il n'y a pas d'actions absurde à effectuer sans raisons, comme on peu parfois en voire dans certains Point and click de cette époque.

Un immanquable pour ceux qui ne s'y serrait jamais testé et apprécie les jeux du genre.

Un gros bémol tout de fois... Le Prix... Hors solde steam 15€ pour un jeux qui à pratiquement 25 ans est un prix abusif, que le lifting ne justifient absolument pas (ce soins fait bondir le jeu à 2.5Giga pour un jeu pesant à l'origine 15 méga -version disquette-, autant dire qu'on parle d'une optimisation "à l'arrache") et s'insèrre dans le banditisme assumé de Lucasart qui n'hésite d'ailleurs pas à nous revendre à 7€ des jeux de la même époque non remasterisé avec en "bonus"... la perte de la version française !(on pensera aux Indiana Jones par exemple).

Si le jeu reste excélent le rapport qualité/prix n'y est pas. 
Bien que Lucasart est toujours refusé de déclarer ses logiciels "abandonwear", exigeant de tirer profit de jeux qui n'étaient plus commercialisé, on parle d'un jeu qui était gratuit jusqu'à présent (pas "légament" certes, mais il aurat fallu attendre 20 ans pour une réédition, ceci est une autre question), comme la plupart des jeux qui ont un bon quart de siècle, le "remasteur" ne vos clairement pas vos 15€. Nous sommes toujours ici dans des logiques déplorable visant à maximiser des profits à moindre coût.

Pour résumer, je donne un avis positif général. L'ayant acheté en solde, je suis très largement satisfait de mon achat, le jeu en lui-même est excpétionnel.
Mais 15€ pour un patch graphique, c'est du vol.

*Jesse Helms était un sénateur ultra-réactionnaire. Farouche défenseurs de la ségrégation raciale (il avait voté contre le civil right acts), sa nostalgie raciste l'avait poussé à s'opposer à l'établissement du Martin Luther King Day -jour férié- en cumulant plus de deux semaines d'obstructions acharnés. Il s'était opposé début 90 au fait qu'on soigne les malades du sida. Le titre en anglais est plus claire, Pourpre candidate à être Vice-Président des Usa investi par le partis républicains, Helms est donc "vexxé".

author: {'steamid': '76561198129129306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1646357088}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1499529699}
review:
Day of the Tentacle, both the original and the remake, looks really nice and sounds pretty good (if quite a bit outdated by today's standards). But most importantly, it tries to keep things fresh and creative from start to finish. There are no repeated puzzles, no tedium (don't forget you can transfer items between characters from the inventory itself), 3 characters actually interacting with each other and helping each other solve puzzles and a simple but fun story.

There are also infamously poorly conveyed puzzles, a bit too much focus on purely american history and in-jokes and the game does have a very, and I mean VERY strong focus specifically on puzzle solving, not on story and adventuring. Which is pretty much the main reason why I never cared much about Day of the Tentacle. But even with that, revisiting it now I cannot ignore just how well made and creative that game is. It's full of puzzles to solve, most of them actually make perfect sense and at the same time they're actually funny. So I'm not surprised people still hold it as a good example of what a puzzle focused comedic adventure game should be about. It's truly timeless (no pun intended).

author: {'steamid': '76561198395254963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1652994742}
review:
Inprescindible jugar a este juego. Sin duda uno de los refentes de su género.
Revivir las aventuras de estos tres amigos a través del tiempo en su lucha contra el malvado tentaculo púrpura no tiene precio. La remasterizacion es espectacular. Los graficos se han actualizado de una manera maravillosa sin perder la escencia del original, la música se ha llevado a otro nivel y poder escuchar los desternillantes comentarios de los creadores te da una nueva visión de este juego que nunca pasa de moda.

Además, si no te convence el nuevo estilo o quieres volver a sentir el original tienes la opción de configurarlo a tu gusto.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198315514704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1508469758}
review:
Extremely fun, one of the first games in a long time I've actually been childishly excited to come back to. Finally figuring out the answer to a puzzle youve been struggling with is a great feeling, and the bizzare yet clever solutions never failed to make me laugh. The original pixel work and art design was amazing, and the remastered keeps the style of the original while adding in just enough detail to give it a modern appeal. I loved the characters, the ridiculous scenarios, and the intrinsic rewards of feeling smart, or feeling stupid but relieved when I finally realized how the answer was right in front of me.
I would very much reccomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141227888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1493354554}
review: This is a pretty good adventure game. Music is really nice, voice acting is alright. Its fun and pleasent, plsu you can play the old game, in this game. I recommend getting this if you like point and click adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174279502', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1499350986}
review:
La remasterización hace que el juego sea más atractivo y fluido, algo casi imprescindible para que sea jugable en la actualidad. De hecho, la mejor parte de la remasterización no es el apartado gráfico o las voces (que, sin duda, son una mejora más que notable en la experiencia) sino los cambios en el inventario, la interfaz y los menús.

En cuanto al contenido, he de decir que me esperaba algo más: habiendo jugado otras aventuras gráficas, creo que algunos puzzles son demasiado difíciles por lo absurdos que resultan y las pocas pistas que el juego ofrece (no la mayoría pero sí hay alguno en concreto, quizá en función del orden de resolución de los enigmas). Sin embargo, la idea y el diseño de personajes me resulta muy divertida si nos paramos a pensar en que el juego original fue lanzado en 1993.

Es un juego recomendable, sobre todo para aquellos que disfrutamos de rememorar tiempos pasados del mundo de los videojuegos (tanto por cuestiones de edad como por motivos de interés en la historia del videojuego). En la actualidad, sin embargo, se puede disfrutar de otras aventuras gráficas más interesantes para mi gusto (aunque quizá menos absurdas, todo sea dicho). Para mí un 7/10, porque la remasterización es buena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 795, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1499080595}
review:
as point and click games go this one is one of the better ones

I have found I'm not huge on point and click games but even I can see this one is better than a lot of other ones as other then voicework that sounds like 2 people doing all the different voices, and a slowish walk speed there really wasn't anything that I could fault this game with as the puzzles had solutions that made sense and it had an interesting giving premise

very minor spoiler
[spoiler]I wish I had known earlier that I could instantly swap items by clicking the item then the persons icon instead of bringing each person down to the toilet then sending the item through the toilet[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968981432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1711212544}
review:
As with many i played the original game back then, and finished it a couple of times.
Today i played it again, the remastered version. What a great edition!

Switching back and forth between classic and new edition made it clear to me that this new release really is an upgrade for current times.

I remembered some things, but also had to think really well about how to progress in the game.
I am sure i will finish it again soon, i will not look for a walkthrough.

It is not as hard as Maniac Mansion, but still a very good point and click adventure with a lot of humor and a nice story.

Hope that one day Steam will release more remastered point and click adventures, like Maniac Mansion i.e.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960703887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 786, 'last_played': 1467749756}
review:
A fully HD remade version of one of the most classic and best point and click adventures ever made. All I can say is this: If you're into intelligent layered humor and truly clever but always logical puzzles then this is an instant must buy. Simple as that. 

Now excuse me as I wander off to drink more radioactive sludge and contemplate on how to try taking over the world. Muahahahaha! *Slowly turns a subtle purple*

author: {'steamid': '76561198054062986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1498948275}
review:
Le jeu n'est pas très long, mais pour peu qu'on en apprécie l'humour, il est très sympathique.

Un mauvais point cependant : la traduction française me paraît vraiment douteuse par moment. Beaucoup de blagues disparaissent à la traduction, il y a parfois des fautes de français, et surtout, il y a parfois des erreurs ! Un des pères fondateurs dit être membre du BARREAU et les sous-titres indiquent qu'il est membre du...bar ? 

Il est tout à fait dommage qu'un bon jeu soit affublé d'une traduction française aussi paresseuse ; je vous le recommande tout de même largement :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198054787819', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1499020033}
review: Le scénario est bon. Fun, loufoque à souhait, j'ai beaucoup apprécié. Par contre, le format point and click, c'est clairement pas pour moi, qui n'y ait pas joué durant mon enfance. C'est tout simplement obsolète. Le choix des verbes est lourd, quelle que soit la méthode (liste en bas ou roue), les personnages prennent des plombes à se déplacer vers chaque petit truc que tu cliques, et avec la quantité d'aller-retours nécessaires, ça en devient chiant. On ajoute à ça le coup classique des trucs à faire parfois capillotractés. Plus le fait que dans ce jeu, t'as trois personnages et donc trois lieux, avec possibilité de passer les objets d'un lieu à l'autre, pour encore plus de temps passé à utiliser tous les objets sur un endroit au cas où y en aurait un qui marchait. M'enfin bon, je me plains, je me plains, ça n'a pas été une expérience désagréable pour autant et je lui accorde quand même un 7/10... ceux qui lui mettraient plus sont sans doute des dinosaures nostalgiques du point and click.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974264367', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1499007719}
review:
[h1] 루카스 아츠의 명작 어드벤쳐. 텐타클 최후의 날 리마스터[/h1]

폐수를 먹고 힘이 쎄진 퍼플 텐타클의 세계정복을 막기위해 시간여행을 한다는 내용의 어드벤처.

도스로 나왔던 텐타클 최후의 날을 리마스터한 작품이다.
원숭이 섬 만큼은 아니지만 루카스 아츠답게 개그요소가 풍부하다.
90년대 초반에 나온 게임이지만 조작과 그래픽을 현세대에 맞게 리마스터링해서 거부감이 없다.

앞으로도 루카스 아츠의 많은 고전 어드벤쳐(더 디그, 인디아나 존스 4 등)가 이렇게 리마스터 되었으면 좋겠다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095876002', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1576360030}
review:
Absolutely fantastic game, absolutely fantastic remaster.
While the game is relatively short, if you know what you're doing, that doesn't stop the fact that this game is hilarious and very interesting. They did a great job on this remaster, with improved art, music, and even sound effects. There are loads of achievements, and even though it took me 3 hours to get all of them, it's quite fun seeing an achievement pop every time you do something relatively smart.

Get this on a sale for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254257458', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1562884036}
review:
Probably one of the finest games of its genre ever created.

Having been a massive fan of this game, Full Throttle, Discworld 1, 2 and Noir, Monkey Island etc; I was delighted when it was remastered with updated graphics. The game is every bit of funny as it's always been and one of the best things that's ever been created.

I'd love for Double Fine or Tell Tale Games to do a sequel to this one day though it's probably a stretch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992357930', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1498739809}
review:
A very unique graphic adventure game, the story and plot are just as ridiculous as the name and you'll have no problem wondering what the hell is going on most of the time, but believe me; 99% of the time you'll be wondering what is going to happen next. This game involves the three main characters; Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne, as well as the supporting cast of Doctor Fred and his family members and associates. Honestly the storyline is just crazy enough to make you want to find out what happens next, despite the fact that you may have no idea what might happen, the solutions in this game are almost always a bit out of the box.

I got this on the Steam Summer Sale of 2017 because I've been feeling a certain craving for adventure games, and I ended up completing it as soon as it finished downloading. I stayed up until eight in the morning just to see what all the fuss was about. It's an amazing game and at the moment it seems silly to pass up on buying it for less than four dollars, this Remastered version of a game is one of the best I've ever seen, it even allows you to switch seamlessly between the old version and the new version (This includes the sound files and the graphics). Even though I didn't play this in its original form, just being able to play it as it was meant to be was incredible and despite today's standards for graphics and sounds I found a very real sense of charm in both the original design and the new one, the latter being very faithful to the former to a precision I didn't think would be possible.

Give it a go, the story is as ridiculous as it sounds and that is a good thing, this is a very good example of a graphic adventure game. It even includes the full version of Maniac Mansion within the game, I've yet to try it but since I've beat the main game I'll definitely be trying that since this Steam version includes many achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152692495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1498545423}
review:
Ok, so I know that negative reviews on popular games don’t fare well with the communities, but I’ve got to type how I felt about a game.

Day of the Tentacle is the sequel Manic Mansion (that can be found and played in game) in which you play as three characters, who have to use a time machine to stop a tentacle from taking over the world. After using the machine two of the characters have found themselves trap 200 years in the past and future while the third must get the machine working again. This version is a graphically updated version that can be reverted back to the original with the press of a button.

I like point and click games, I don’t love them, but I like them. Some are hit or miss depending on how well they were made and with a Lucas Arts game I’ve found to expect a good game. However, this game just didn’t feel that great to me. There wasn’t much in the way of interactions, there were only a few characters to talk to, must of which were just annoying, and the humor that is usually found in a game like this wasn’t very funny. 

As for the puzzles, I always get frustrated when playing a point and click puzzle games, but with this I was actually getting angry with a few puzzles in this game. I did like the concept of the puzzles, having three maps which you must solve puzzles and find objects to send to other character, but there was some poor execution to some of these puzzles. To explain, there are some background objects that you can view, but just a few, only enough to disguise a couple items as useless background objects early in the game only for them to be a critical item later. While this may seem like a normal thing for the style of game, it doesn’t fit well with how solvable most of the other puzzles are. There is even one puzzle that is unsolvable unless you just happen to stand around long enough or get lucky enough to see an idle-animation of one of the NPCs.

With the amount of frustration, flat Humor, and in my opinion, a not to good story. I can’t really give this game a good recommendation. I can recommend others remastered Lucas Arts games like The Secret of Monkey Island, Monkey Island 2, The Dig, and (Also by Double Fine and personal favorite) Grim Fandango.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287256909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1642781444}
review:
Pros:
Creative, funny, interesting, challenging, terrific graphics.
Loved the surprise mentions: Star Wars, Star Trek, Deponia, etc., wished there had been some ET (need to phone home?).
Voices were not too annoying (though the girls voice was right on the edge). Also noticed she walked just like the crazy version of _____ (can't remember her name - the one in braids) from Deponia.

Cons:
Just wish they had also included a map the characters could use to jump locations. There is a LOT of traveling back and forth. 
Also, any kind of hint, objective, or journal to use would have been super helpful as it was a lot to remember jumping back and forth from three characters and three time periods.

Overall fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020165042', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1562084855}
review:
Sehr gut gemachtes Remake. Trotz überarbeiteter Grafik und Sprachausgabe bleibt der Charme von DOTT komplett erhalten.
Macht genausoviel Spaß wie beim ersten mal spielen vor vielen Jahren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088275951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1558908000}
review:
Keine vielen Worte: Wenn es ein Adventure gibt, dem wir die Prädikate legendär und zeitlos geben können, dann ist es Day of the Tentacle. Diese gelungene Remastered Edition befriedigt nicht nur die nostalgischen Anwandlungen derer, die das Spiel ebenso wie mich schon in den 90er Jahren in seinen Bann gezogen hat, sondern ist auch für jeden Neuentdecker ein Must-have!

Nach knapp sechs Stunden habe ich nun Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne erfolgreich durch Zeit und Raum geschickt, die Welt vor Purpur-Tentakels Schreckensherrschaft bewahrt und jede Minute gefeiert - besonders positiv herauszuheben ist m.E. die Funktion per Druck der F1 Taste fließend zwischen den beiden Render-Qualitäten hin und herswitchen zu können.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010841112', 'num_games_owned': 1077, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 106, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1711815494}
review:
Another LucasArts classic, remastered by Double Fine Productions, Day of the Tentacle is still probably the greatest point-and-click adventure game ever made. In this sequel to Maniac Mansion (which is also included within this game itself), three moronic college students travel through time to save the world from an army of evil tentacles taking over, and somehow fluke their way into doing just that, despite their overwhelming levels of ineptitude.

The humour still holds up for a game made in the mid-90's, the voice acting is still on the nose, the music is excellent, the puzzles while weird do for the most part make some quirky sense (except that damn making it rain puzzle), the art is good. It's still the original Day of the Tentacle, which was an amazingly good game, and one that actually still holds up, unlike the Monkey Island series.

The remastered edition doesn't actually add a great deal to the excellent original game; the updated graphics actually seem to lose something versus the original pixel art, but graphics modes can be switched between the two on the fly, meaning the player can pick which they prefer. The developer commentary is also rather basic; despite bringing together several LucasArts alumni, they don't have a great deal to say about the game

But it has achievements, and we all know that's what really matters, right? Right?

Day of the Tentacle Remastered can be found for sale by itself, or also in the very low priced Double Fine Bundle, which also includes Psychonauts (Amazing), Costume Quest 1 (pretty fun), Stacking (fairly good), Iron Brigade (uninvolving), Brutal Legend (weird), Broken Age (underwhelming), Grim Fandango Remastered (amazing), Hack 'n' Slash (decent), Spacebase DF-9 (very under featured and dull) and Full Throttle Remasted (really good), which I think works out to be a pretty good deal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972089994', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1644850540}
review:
Best adventure game of all time IMO. Perfectly integrates clever puzzles, humor and plot. Not much else to add -- it's a classic.

Regarding this remaster, it's generally very good. The voice quality is superb relative to the original, and the graphics are much sharper. DOTT was a game that really bumped up against the old 320x200 VGA resolution. VGA didn't work very well for cartoony graphics, and the move to modern high-res has done wonders for the looks of the game.

At the same time, it's not perfect. Had DOTT been made today, the graphics would have been sharper and involved more detail. Instead, the detail that's in the game is just what was barely visible in the VGA version -- they didn't want to taint it by adding more. This results in a game that looks very good to people who remember the original and is clearly the best version of that game we remember, but isn't particularly impressive graphically to newcomers. There's no easy answer here though: had they added more detail to the graphics, purists would be complaining.

All in all, it's a terrific game. If you've never played it, you should, and if you have played it, this is the best version there is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054816907', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1497440778}

Entertaining, funny and light-hearted. This game manages to take point-and-click to a whole different level and seamlessly tie up 3 completely different time zones. Totes a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094282979', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1498786405}
review:
Hay juegos que me han hecho reír, y está éste.
 
Recuerdo haberlo jugado extensamente allá por los noventas con un amigo, y en cada escena y cada diálogo nos destornillabamos de la risa.
 
Por supuesto, lo que resultaba gracioso en hace 20 años puede que no causa la misma gracia. Muchas bromas “ya se han visto” mucho (El efecto “Seinfeld Is Unfunny”), pero lo sostienen sus retos y rompecabezas bien construidos, su ingenio y un super talento artístico a todo lo que daban 16 bits y el máximo talento de LucasArts.
 
Siempre recomendado para los que disfrutan los juegos de aventura a la antigua. Es excelente compra.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964084562', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1498971601}
review:
This is such a fun game. Great sense of humor, tricky puzzles that involve going back and forth through time. It's a great experience with great writing and silly voice acting. It's a game you can't help but smile while playing.

If you can handle the occasional pain in the butt puzzle then you'll love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015916974', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1629947619}
review:
Maniac Mansion : Day of the Tentacle
1993년에 LucasArts에서 발매한 어드벤쳐 게임.
 
처음 이 게임을 접했을 땐 당연히 영어 버전이라 상당히 난이도가 느껴졌는데,
지금은 한글판(비공식)도 나와 있....어도 그래도 쉽지만은 않았다.
 
사실 발매 당시 영어사전 뒤져가며, 어찌어찌해서 엔딩을 한번 봤는데다가
이제 어드벤쳐류 게임으로는 잔뼈가 굵다고 생각하는 편인데도 메뉴얼 두세번은 참고해서 클리어 했다.

과거,현재,미래에 3캐릭터가 나뉘어져서 동시에 문제를해결해야 하는데 미래에서 필요한 아이템을 얻기위해
과거의 캐릭터가 어떤 행동을 취해야하는 그런 식, 게다가 코미디 요소가 강해 넌센스와 아이디어가 필요하다.
 
리마스터링이 아닌 음성과 한글패치된 버전까지 포함해서 3번을 클리어했지만
클리어할 때마다 '재미있는 만화 영화' 한편 본 것 같은 생각이 든다.

게다가 리마스터링 버전은 그래픽, 인터페이스, 음악 등 모든 요소를 리마스터링 버전과
기존 올드 버전을 동시에, 실시간으로 스위치해가며 즐길 수 있다. (F1키 하나만 누르면 OK)
게다가 제작자의 코멘터리도 즐길 수 있으니 참고.

그래픽은 말할 것도 없지만, 어레인지된 조작법이나 음악도 아주 만족스럽다.
쓰다보니 칭찬만 늘어놨는데, 워낙 오리지날 게임이 완성도가 훌륭해서
딱히 단점이라고 할만한 게 없다.

루카스아츠식 어드벤쳐 올드팬이든, 그냥 어드벤쳐류 좋아하는 게이머든
누구에게나 꼭 한번 해보라고 추천해주고 싶은 작품.

** 교훈 : '촉수물'은 동서고금을 막론하고 좋은 테마인 것이다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991097379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1509084641}
