author: {'steamid': '76561197999753053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1640072413}
review: Bottom line, this is a great game.  The BEST adventure game. The humor is great without being sophmoric, and the puzzles are hard enough to challenge without being too obtuse.  Granted I played the original, and remember having to step away from the game when I was unable to find a way forward, but that just made the solutions that much sweeter.  I didn't have as much trouble this time around, in spite of having a lot fewer brain cells working.  I still remembered most of the solutions 20+ years on as the puzzles were that good.  Give it try without a walkthrough...it builds character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015845005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1497376441}
review: I was never a big point and click fan, the only one I honestly ever played was Pajama Sam when I was really young at a friend's house. So I decided to pick this and up see how these games hold up. I have to say I was delighted to see how well this game aged. The only noticeable thing that didn't age well is the audio even in the remaster. I can only describe it as clunky sounding. However, I would not let that dissuade you because it really is a great game even if you're not riding on the wave of nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960461306', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1497225865}
review:
I was big into adventure games when I was younger (King's Quest era), but don't have the patience for them anymore. Somehow, I missed this game back in the day, despite loving Maniac Mansion. Even though I haven't been able to get through an adventure game in a decade, I finally gave this one a try and couldn't put it down.

Some of the puzzles are kind of out there, but none are truly random. I managed to beat it without having to look anything up, and I'm pretty dense. Several of the harder puzzles are hilariously rewarding when you figure them out. Highly recommended.

Protip: you can press "." to skip a line of dialog. Voice acting is great and funny, but sometimes you just want to move things along. You can miss an achievemnt that way, though, if you care about that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165063939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1476300902}
review:
Great shot to the past!
I remembered almost ALL of the hundred hours I played it growing up. Finishing this game without any kind of FAQ or Walkthrough was one of the best feelings in my teen years (at least in the gaming area).
I bought it out of nostalgia, but I'm glad. The achievos helped me find a lot of secrets. And also the walkthroughs helps a lot. 
It was a GREAT game when I was growing up and it STILL is a great game nowadays

author: {'steamid': '76561197993862065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1592741046}
review:
A bit too slap-dash for my tastes, but has the complete Maniac Mansion game as an easter egg

TL;DR If you want to play a classic SCUMM game with updated graphics, and don't mind the Looney Tunes plot, then get this on discount.

The whole game feels like you're trapped in an episode of Pinky and the Brain (1993 all over again!) It's alot sillier than it's predecessor was (Maniac Mansion). The very cartoonish take on viewing perspective heightens the atmosphere. I got this game mainly for the easter egg (a complete version of Maniac Mansion hidden on a computer in the game). If you've played the recent Thimbleweed Park, you can see its origins in the two games.

The puzzles are supposedly the best part of DotTR, although I can't say I'm a huge fan. The remastered artwork is quite nice, even if I'm not too keen on the cartoonish style. It's tough to feel empathy for the main characters, as the plot and such are just so crazy from the outset. But I got this at 50% off, and felt I got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000625849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1494453788}
review: This game is great! A couple of the puzzles are a bit unfair, but generally the game follows a sort of slapstick cartoon logic that's satisfying to figure out. Streamlined controls and updated graphics also help reduce potential headaches. If you want a clever game that makes you feel clever for playing it, this is a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121047663', 'num_games_owned': 461, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1496574417}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered w skrócie:
+ to wciąż ta sama świetna przygodówka
+ zremasterowaniu uległa nie tylko oprawa graficzna, ale i również dźwięk oraz muzyka
+ świetny humor
+ rewelacyjny voice acting
+ bardzo dobra muzyka
+ ukryta pełna wersja Maniac Mansion (ale nie zremasterowana)

- naciągane i absurdalne zagadki
- bez poradnika ciężko przejść tą grę
- dość krótki czas przejścia

Ocena: 9/10

Podsumowanie: To wciąż kawał świetnej gry, która dodatkowo została jeszcze ulepszona i została do niej dodana jedna równie świetna gra. Jednak niektórych odstraszą trudne zagadki. Gra na 2, bądź 3 wieczory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1498332880}
review:
I completed the original version many years ago when it first came out. I thought it was great then and replaying it now makes me realize what a classic it is.

Its really hard to do humour in an adventure game, DoTT is really funny. The remastered graphics are great, as is the voice acting. 

So far I'm enjoying this game much more than most of the recent adventure games I've played. I wish the original developers would do a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072129817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1525328407}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140215971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1496259105}
review: This is the first LucasArts game I've played that isn't related to the Star Wars franchise, and I'm a bit disappointed that I found out so late. Good God, this game is funny as hell, and I couldn't help but smile as I played this. Compared to other adventure games I've played, I'd say this was the most challenging for me because you're controlling three characters, which took some getting used to but made for some really interesting puzzles. But yeah, if you aren't familiar with the non-SW related games from LucasArts, this is a good place to start in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971981173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1497236105}
review:
Some remakes and remasters lack the character and quality of the original game, but this is absolutely not the case with the Day of the Tentacle (DoTT) remaster. It feels fresh 24 years after the original release, and is every bit as fun to play. The original art concept scans are a nice addition and help prove that this version of the game is true to the original design.

If you have never played DoTT, you'll want to buy it and finish it at least once. In addition to DoTT, it includes a non-remastered version of Maniac Mansion within the game.

If you're like me, and had not played DoTT in 20+ years, you can buy it again and it will seem brand new, yet familiar; Even though I can't remember how to solve most of the puzzles, solving them is enjoyable, because, unlike most adventure games, they make sense and don't require the player to resort to hint books or guides. The Steam achievements add even more value. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060733145', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1527273213}
review: Было чертовски приятно спустя где то 20 лет вернутся в игру детства так сказать. Помню играл я в нее где то в середине 90-х(черт какой же я старый) на своем 486 ведре. И помню что конечно же ее не прошол, тк небыло почему то перевода, хотя в то время многие квесты переводили пираты. И мне всегда было интересно, чем же закончилась все же игра. И вот ремастер(как то поздно я его заметил но не суть) Вот думаю сейчас то точно трехнем стариной, да и к тому же замутили даже любительский перевод. Ну сейчас то я точно эту игру одолею..... и..... да хрена лысого спустя 8 часов блужданий я просто не смог въехать, ну как забрать мантировку у мужика который взламывает машину. И пришлось мне всетаки лезти в прохождение( за что его автору низкий поклон). Читаю и не верю своим глазам НЕТ! я бы точно до этого ни когда не догодался. И это наверное самая главная проблема игры, она в некоторых местах очень не логичная(как и многие квесты 90-х). 90% времени все боле менее понятно, но рано или поздно наступает момент, где ты просто ну не знаешь реально что еще делать, даже не помогает банальный перебор всех предметов. Ну вообщем спасибо Тиму Шейферу и ко... за настольгию  (хотя мог бы гад и рус локализацию сразу сделать но видимо на рус аудиторию им пофиг, дальше слов дела не пошли) итог для таких старичков как я 9/10. а новому поколению думаю лучше вообще с игрой не связываться, хотя кто хочет окунуться в ту золотую эпоху квестов добро пожаловать!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969656754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1647826543}
review:
One of the more cartoony adventure games. Keeping that in mind, it's also one of the best.

The remake just reinforces the cartooniness with clear graphics and sound to match what the original developers intended.

A must have for adventure game and cartoon fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010335843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1495959054}
review:
Great, classic adventure game, funny story, charming characters. I never played the original so one concern I had going into the game was if the puzzle solutions would be obtuse and frustrating. I'm happy to say I got through most of the game only consulting a walkthrough once or twice for one of the more weird sections of the game (the cat puzzle was not very well relayed to the player unfortunately). So if that's your concern as well you can lay that to rest. But walking around aimlessly for awhile and occasionally wacky solutions are part of the experience and if you hate that then this game won't change your mind. 

In this game you play as three different characters trapped in 3 different eras of the same mansion. You can give each other items and sometimes things you do in the past will affect the future. The point is to power up the time machines and get a diamond to go back to the present. Some of the changes you can make include to the American flag and even the Constitution. Overall a great game and great way to introduce yourself to point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960437531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1461984076}
review:
If you played the original Day of the Tentacle back in the 90s, you owe it to yourself to buy this. Double fine did a great job with this remaster; it's exactly the same game only with updated graphics. Being able to switch between the new and old graphics on the fly is really cool too, makes you think 'wow, were the previous graphics really THAT bad?!'

If you haven't played this before, you'll enjoy it if you're looking for one of the most classic and famous adventure games of all time. It's a great game with lots of humor and imagination, memorable characters, a fun story, and really cool artwork. Some of the puzzles are very difficult to figure out, but you- unlike those of us who played it back in the early 90s- have the internet and google to help you with anything that has you stumped, so you're good to go :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198306070727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1495982006}
review:
Après avoir passé des heures mémorables pour finir ce jeu il y a plus de 20 ans, c'est un vrai plaisir à redécouvrir en version remasterisée. Incontournable à l'époque, le jeu a très bien vieilli et...reste un incontournable!

A moins de détester les [i]point and click[/i]...si vous n'y avez jamais joué, allez-y les yeux fermés...et surtout ne vous laissez pas tenter par la recherche de la solution sur le net quand vous êtes coincé, cela gâcherait tout le plaisir (et ça arrivera souvent d'être coincé, les innombrables possibilités d'utiliser chaque objet à chaque époque apportant leur lot de difficultés à la résolution des énigmes toutes plus loufoques les unes que les autres).

author: {'steamid': '76561198207898023', 'num_games_owned': 2369, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1495976288}
review:
Let me first start out by saying this is one of my all time favorite games. I got it when it first came out and had to install multiple floppies and use diagrams found in the manual that acted like copy-protection, each time you'd have to fix a diagram in game to match it with one found in the manual, I always liked that. But now with this Remaster the graphics are all the same quality you'd find on a Saturday morning watching old Chuck Jones shows. Everytime I play it sends me back 20 years to when I first fell in love with the SCUMM type games like Sam and Max, Full Throttle, and Day of the Tentacle.
I saw this game go on sale and HAD to get it immediately, if you are unsure of a gift for young or old alike I recommend this game, the puzzles, dialogue, characters, and over all design just scream fun times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031129196', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1467308118}

review:
I used to play this game back in the days on my 486 DX2 66. I have no idea how many playthroughs I had, I just know that this game is one of the best of its kind. It's a classic!

I recommend this game to anyone who likes point-and-click-adventures. However, if you are impatient, you should pass on this, since you have to think a lot outside the box in order to solve the puzzles. 

No matter what, this game is a gem and earns a thumbs up!  

Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273592', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1495221237}
review:
Day of The Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion, the adventure game that kicked off Lucasarts' legendary SCUMM series of games, as well as the game that introduced Tim Shafer of Double Fine.  

The plot is very silly, moreso than its predecessor, and far less dark.  It really feels like a cartoon.  And once you think of things in cartoon logic, the game's puzzles start to make a weird kind of sense.  There's something very Looney Tunes inspired about the game.  

Bernard, one of the optional characters in the original game, has returned to the Edison mansion with some new friends as Purple Tentacle is mutated by toxic waste into a super villain bent on conquering the world.  In this, the Tentacle is successful, enslaving humanity for centuries to come.  Dr. Fred, the villain in the previous game, is now free from his mind control and is just a crazy, senile mad scientist.  In order to stop the reign of the Tentacle, Fred reveals he has been working on a time machine.  Made out of port-a-potties, of course.  

The time jump malfunctions, stranding the three characters in different time periods.  

Bernard, the stereotypical nerd, is stuck in the present.

Hoagie, a roadie, is stuck in colonial America during the drafting of the Constitution. 

Laverne, a crazy, manic medical student, is caught in a future where humans are pets and Tentacles rule.

The gameplay is based around solving puzzles by using items and commands in unusual ways, and sending items back and forth in time.  Sometimes the item you need to solve a puzzle is in another time period, so you have to try stuff out.  For anyone familiar with these kinds of games, this is expected, if this is your first point-and-click adventure, I am sure it could feel tedious.  They can be straightforward, such as "put the videotape in the VCR" or outright insane (chattery teeth to make a fire!).  Again, the game uses weird cartoon logic.  If it would fit in a Bugs Bunny cartoon, it's possible in this game.  

For the most part, it is not an overly difficult game of its kind, but some of the puzzles are unintuitive enough to be frustrating.  I ended up having to look a few of them up.  

As for the Remaster, it's wonderfully done and with the ability to switch between the original and remastered version at will.  Pressing F1 will switch the artstyle between the original pixel art and the new hand-drawn HD version.  The commands and audio can also be changed at will between classic and remastered, as well as optional subtitles.  

The remastered graphics are very well done, though they really bring out the cartoonishness of the game.  There are a few places where the graphics update helps with some frustrating stuff as some objects are indistinct in the original pixel art.  The overhaul matches the original concept art (which is included as a bonus), and so it doesn't seem like a big departure.  

The sounds have all been remastered from the original recordings, as well.  The commands in the original release were underneath the screen, in a list of actions and inventory.  In the Remaster, a dial system like those in later SCUMM games is used (right click on an object and choose a command from a dial).  Like everything else, this can be switched - but using the dial, the game will expand to fullscreen, making it nicer to look at and less cluttered.  It is perfectly playable either way - but the dial looks better.

And as a bonus, the original Maniac Mansion is included as an easter egg - if you can find a PC in the house, you can access the first game.  

Overall, it's another great game in a line of great adventure games from Lucasarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033967307', 'num_games_owned': 12144, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1495123361}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006679072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1495407132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036767762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1664427243}
review:
Honestly, DoTT was a fantastic game, and one that got me into adventure gaming, something I had trouble with before. It just did a lot of things right... It went to town on the art, to the point where it was one of the closest things to playing an interactive cartoon at the time, and it also weeded out a lot of the frustrating aspects previous adventure games had... Being one of the first (if not THE first) adventure games to remove game overs completely, cutting out a lot of obnoxious trial and error while also not making the game too easy. The puzzles can still be daunting, though thankfully not as abstruse and nonsensical as the ones in Monkey Island 2. It was essentially the next evolution in adventure gaming, setting the model for many games in the genre that followed.

However, this was all a review of the original game from 1993. How does the remake fare? Wellll honestly, it's pretty average. The upscaled graphics vary in quality, often looking like they simply ran a filter over the original. The voice acting now uses much less compressed versions of the recordings, but it's still the same stilted, awkward acting as before, and many of the animations just haven't aged well.

The thing is, all these faults seem primarily due to the feature to switch between the remastered game and the original game on the fly, which, quite frankly, was a really cool feature when it was introduced in the Monkey Island remaster, but has since become a bit of a worn-out gimmick. Needing to sync the new version of the game completely with the old one just holds back the ability of the developers to give the game the updates it really needs, and I'd have preferred they ditched the remaster/original switching entirely for some reworked animation in the new version, as well as actual timing in the dialogue.

Aside from that, the additions I ended up appeciating the most were the added commentary mode, as well as the new achievements, which (for the most part) encourage players to find little extra touches and bits of dialogue in the game, and that's something the lucasarts developers have always been good at.

I believe this remaster is very worth it for those who haven't played the game before and would like to witness an incredible piece of adventure game history. Those as old as I, who've played the original and enjoyed it back in the day, way want to wait for a sale. That is my verdict!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286498657', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1501586419}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein Spiel, welches ich jedem Fan von Click-Adventures ans Herz legen kann. 
Man kann in dem Spiel zwischen  drei Characteren hin und her wechseln und muss einen Gegenstand nach dem anderen finden. Manche Gegenstände lassen sich dabei kombinieren. Da aber jeder Charakter ein anderes Inventar besitzt, gibt es eine art Teleporter, durch den man die Sachen zwischen den Characteren hin und her schieben kann.
Des weiteren ist die Story total lustig. Man muss die Welt vor den Tentakeln retten und hilft z.B. Benjamin Franklin dabei den Blitzableiter zu erfinden. 
Deshalb kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011233147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1492723662}
review:
Masterful remaster!

I played this game when it first came out in an earlier millennia and loved it so much that I played it over and over again. The nostalgic value of this remaster is pretty damn high for me personally, which means this review will be highly subjective. One thing I think I easily can say in an objective way though is that this remaster is done right. This is how you make a masterful remaster.

Often when you play a remaster of a game that you remember as a vital contribution to your gaming history it does not live up to the way you remember it. This has happened to me on several occasions. This is because your selective memory gives you a vision of how it would look by todays standards, and most games can not live up to that vision. This game though, to my shock, did that to the fullest. They managed to update this game to my visions of the classic based on my selective memory, and that to the fullest. That is simply amazing. I don't think I've ever experienced that with any remastered game before. Bravo to Double Fine!

To this day I could remember most of the gameplay and puzzles from when I played it many years ago, and because of that I kind of breezed through the game this time. But even with the lack of challenge, reliving the experience with this game was a blast. Reciting lines just before they are said and giggling in anticipation of what you know is going to happen when you do certain things. Even the retro game (Maniac Mansion) within the retro game had me excited (Yes, I am so old I can even remember playing that some time before this "sequel"). I had so much fun that I might play this remastered version over and over again like I did with the original way back when.

If you are an old school gamer like me and used to play adventure games you have probably played this before and know what to expect. In fact if you at all played this game at one point or never got to play it the first time around you can not let it pass this time. Play or replay it. It is a must. However, today there is several younger generations that never got to play this, but I bet most of them too have heard about the greats that was LucasArts and the times of point 'n' click adventure games. If you want to experience what every father, uncle or any other older gamer was bragging about, now's your chance to try for yourself. But there is a few things you need to know in advance:

Going through this game for the first time is not going to be as easy as it looks. There are some brain twisting moments in this game and few things are straight forward. Yes, you might also consider several puzzles to be a bit far fetched or illogical, or like us older gamers call it, creative :o). It is not a game with a lot of action and high pulse, though you might experience moments of heavy frustration over not figuring out how to advance the story and welts on your forehead because of facepalms after you figure it out. Though it might seem impossible or unfair at times, the game always hints you in the right direction. You need to pay attention though or you might miss them. The game is cleverly designed that way. Do yourself a favor by trying to use guides or walkthroughs as little as possible. The fulfilment you sit with after getting through this game without help is worth it.

The graphics and artstyle is suitable corny and comedic, well fitting the premise of the game. You'll love the characters, both main and secondary. They are even wonderfully voiced. I even dare you to not laugh out loud playing through this game. There is so much great stuff in here it is impossible not to. Another good thing is that I did not experience a single glitch or bug at all playing through this, something that seems rare lately.

I have to recommend this game to everybody and their mother, father, brother etc. It is that damn good. You owe it to yourself to play this so you know what all the fuzz is about. Even if you should end up not liking it, it would still be worth it. Just for that.

To me it is one of the pinnacles of gaming history and the fact that I enjoyed it as much now after all these years and after all these playthroughs attest that to me it simply is and always will be a masterpiece. That is why I simply have to rate this 10/10.

In fact, I enjoy it so much I feel like I could... TAKE ON THE WORLD!

What are you waiting for.... go get ;o)

Other people migh not share my opinion of this game so it could always be worth reading other reviews....and tell them they are WRONG, and then run to buy it yourself ;o)

Happy gaming :o)

TJ

author: {'steamid': '76561198070389028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1492989075}
review:
Story-rich, goofy, point-and-click adventure with time travel puzzles. Collect and move items between characters from the past, present, and future to ultimately prevent a hostile tentacle takeover.
 
Has settings to toggle between 1993 version and the remastered version to fit with the demands of modern game graphics + design.

Solid 10+ hours of gameplay; more for those achievement grinders.

Bonus Content: Includes 1987 classic game "Maniac Mansion" within the game. (Precedent to DotT)

This game will remind of you the good old days. But the bad news is that the money from this goes to the current Tim and not the awesome Tim from the past.

review:
Vous aimez les point and click ? 
Vous aimez quand la logique est absurde ?
Vous aimez Bernard ?

Achetez le "meilleur point and clic" de tout les temps. Un scénario nettement supérieur aux productions actuels, un humour indémodable et un game play on ne peut plus facile à prendre à main. Ce Remastered cse doit d'être dans toute machine des fans du genre (et même des autres).

author: {'steamid': '76561197974299727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1703814350}
review:
Day of Tentacle is remaster of sequel.  Game involve many puzzle which involve flushing item down shitter.  Event that happen in past can impact future event.  All that is missing is Delorean.

Some people say game look like Polished cartoon but I did not see what Warsaw.  Graphic much better and you can see difference with F1 key.  Sound effect and music not improve as much.

If you like flushing every day item down toilet and microwaving pets then this game is for you.  Number 1 game in Jalalabad on release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011129687', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1489875744}
review:
I played this game as a part of my 52 games in 52 weeks challenge. My review is also on my facebook page https://www.facebook.com/Kayasarcade/


I have never played a Tim Schafer game that I did not like, and DofT is no exception! The humor is on point (..and not something you will see in newer games), I laughed so many times and really enjoyed the easy going story.

For someone that do not know American story that well, it was actually funny to see DofT version of the founding fathers and how they wrote the United States constitution - I didn't learn much, but I had fun!

I remember how much I loved the "Gobliiins" games on the MS-DOS back when I was a little kid. I wish that I could go back in time and play DofT as mini-me, and experienced the LucasArts games and the love i have for them now, back then.
After seeing the remastered and the orginal compared, i really think that Double Fine Productions did a great job - But I would love to try the original, just to enjoy the great pixelwork.

I don't think this will be the last LucasArts game I will be playing in this challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042148145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1492432054}
review: Fantastic game, some of the best humor from the point-and-click era.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968406757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1492379090}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is Maniac Mansion 2.  This is your old-school point and click adventure game, where you play as 3 kids trying to find the things they need to defeat the evil Purple Tentacle (who just was mutated with arms!)

There are some hilarious lines in this game, that could only have been allowed because it was made in the 90s.  Gameplay is very similar to that of the typical 90s adventure games as well.

If you have the patience, this is a classic title for this genre, and highly recommend it.  If not, you can read a review and a walkthrough and have the puzzles told for you, and still enjoyable.

Achivement Quest:  This is an easy 100%, but there are missable achivements which make it scary.  Look up a guide, find the missable achivements, and make sure to look for those along the way.  All achivements can be earned in 1 playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357907452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1620935302}
review: Gruwelijk goed. Meer van dit graag!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053311662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 699, 'last_played': 1653770884}
review: Это был моя первая игра в жанре "квест" на компьютере, в которую я играл в 1996 году. И именно с нее я начал увлекаться квестами и адвенчурами.  Любой уважающий себя квестоман просто обязан иметь эту игру в своей коллекции. Она великолепна!

author: {'steamid': '76561198171085615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1640998693}
review: Buena trama, entretenido. Recomendado para toda la familia

author: {'steamid': '76561198004511311', 'num_games_owned': 1635, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1492080115}
review:
El juego sigue siendo genial, no ha envejecido ni un día. El humor es buenísimo y el estilo gráfico tiene muchísima personalidad.

El remaster es perfecto. He pasado un montón de tiempo cambiando entre el modo antiguo y el remaster solo para ver cómo han mantenido cada ápice del diseño.

Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de todos los tiempo y un remaster perfecto. No se qué más se puede pedir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045234840', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1492061617}
review: Was too young to play the original game, now I had the chance to play it in a visually modernized version. It's a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067183541', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1492051467}
review: Very fun game, funny, and lots of puzzles. Do yourself a favor and play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077249145', 'num_games_owned': 828, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1492032580}
review: DotT is a beautifully polished point-and-click puzzle game. The humour is great, as is expected of DoubleFine, and the puzzles and time-travel mechanic is unique and interesting. A great game if you're into point-and-clicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049206800', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1480463716}
review:
Aaaaah ! Un très grand classique complètement refait pour être jouable à notre époque, quelle belle idée !

A découvrir absolument si vous aimez les point n' click. A découvrir absolument de toute façon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140118346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1492015418}
review: 24 años después al fin lo he terminado! Tranquilamente podría sentirme estúpido, pero me siento orgulloso, incluso puedo decir que sólo miré una guía para acertar tres acertijos. Es mi récord en una aventura gráfica, aunque no sé si es un motivo para sentirme feliz o debería buscar un psiquiatra urgentemente. Al menos creo que he llegado a sentir algo de empatía por el tentáculo púrpura y su odio a la raza humana y al Doctor Fred en particular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000275990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1558915591}
review:
Day of the tentacle was my favorite point and click adventure game when I was young, so I'm absolutely happy to see a version playable on modern machines.
The remasterd version is really well done and it gives completely new life to this classic.

This is a funny, dorky, strange, interesting  point and click adventure game: Highly recommended.

Pros:
Remaster done properly
funny and dorky
interesting time travel mechanics and interesting story

Cons:

Some text delay within cutscenes ( just a few in all the game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025187473', 'num_games_owned': 688, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1491937856}
review: This was my first time playing and I can see why this is one of the classics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006807283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1483886788}
review:
Кто может защитить землю от щупальца и его подопечных? - Ботан, Рокер и Дурнушка! 
Может показаться, что игрока ждет глуповатый квест с соответствующими шуточками... Но! Есть несколько "плюшек", которые в корне меняют игровой процесс и отношение к сценарию.
Действие происходит в трех временных измерениях: прошлом, настоящем и будущем. Влияя на прошлое вы меняете будущее, начиная от замороженного кота в холодильнике, и заканчивая политическими деталями в свершении истории. Подобрав предмет одним из героев вы не просто можете применить его, а передать в другое время. От обилия возможностей теряешься в догадках, да и загадки тут не из простых, но более-менее логичные.
Попадая в прошлое вы общаетесь с прошлыми президентами США, влияете на их мысли и поступки. (Просто невероятно, при завязке-то со злым щупальцем.) Так что юмор здесь разный - и глуповатый, и комедия места, и историческо-сумбурный.
Римейк содержит обновленную графику, звук, комментарии разработчиков. Графика изменена довольно бюджетно, в неестественном стиле, - видимо это очень затратно, в современном мире, но глаза не режет и привыкаешь быстро. Переключится в старую версию с графикой, звуком можно на лету.
Веселый, глуповатый, сложный и неожиданно интересный квест проверенный временем.
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028395313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1491907932}
review:
La migliore avventura grafica di sempre (insieme alla serie di Deponia). Questa versione rimasterizzata è straordinaria: l'interfaccia è stata svecchiata e alleggerita in maniera impeccabile (ora l'inventario è a comparsa). Le immagini sono a tutto schermo e in alta risoluzione. Il gioco mi ha fatto tornare indietro di vent'anni, facendomi assaporare lo stile delle vecchie avventure grafiche. Ringrazio i ragazzi della Double Fine Productions per aver svecchiato questo splendido gioco. Davvero un ottimo lavoro. Consiglio l'acquisto di questo gioco nel periodo degli sconti.

Consiglio: I personaggi possono passarsi gli oggetti direttamente dall'inventario (clikkate sull'oggetto nell'inventario e poi sull'immagine del personaggio destinatario) senza andare necessariamente ogni volta al crono-gabinetto.

Voto: 9

author: {'steamid': '76561198054842342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1491684180}
review:
[h1]Eigentlich bin ich kein großer Fan von remastered Versionen aber hier habe ich mich gerne eines Besseren belehren lassen.[/h1]

Damals wie heute ein Super Spiel, eine klare Empfehlung für alle die es früher schon geliebt haben und sich wieder zurückversetzt fühlen wollen und die teils lustigen und meist kniflige Rätsel lieben, durch die Möglichkeit die Render Qualität auf die Verpixelte retro Grafik umschalten zu können ist dies meiner Meinug nach auf jeden Fall möglich. Aber nicht nur der Retro Modus ist sehr gelungen, auch die neu designte Grafik hat einen gewissen Charme und macht das Spiel sehenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219643357', 'num_games_owned': 8543, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1491659966}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054447980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1698892679}
review:
A very fun and spunky game with an old-school Lucsarts flair. As a bonus, you can even play the original Maniac Mansion in-game!

The puzzles can shift from obvious to pretty conveluted, I"ll admit I had to consult a walkthrough a couple of times. I like how you can seamlessly switch from the old to new version like in the Monkey Island remastered games. One thing I wish theyd add would be an in-game hint system to help you instead of having to go straight to the internet for answers. But if you like point-and-click games, this is right up your alley

author: {'steamid': '76561198180314211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1481495449}
review:
Obra maestra absoluta, aunque en contra de la opinión general, bastante por debajo de Monkey Island. Vale mucho la pena, el planteamiento es original, el combinar los tres personajes y las tres épocas y por supuesto el sentido del humor. La remasterización está bien, aunque queda un poco Tiny Toon, y le resta algo de personalidad. Es un tanto limitado en cuanto a escenarios, pues todo se resume a la mansion en tres épocas diferentes, pero está muy bien resuelto.

Uno de esos juegos que has de jugar y terminar en tu vida, incluso aunque no te guste el género.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076167173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1642989295}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015790495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1527185985}
review: The original game was my first adventure game and you can say it is the easiest adventure by lukasarts. The remastered version is a nice makeover. The audio and grafics are better. There is also an audio commentary of the creators of this game. They tell us how some of the puzzles were created (Let it rain...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998334516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1490743694}
review:
I last played the game when I was 17 or so. I'm 40 now; this remaster is how I remembered it in my mind's eye. This is a brilliant achievement; the repainted art, the remastered audio from the original voice recordings.. it gives completely new life to this classic. I bought this remaster at first to prepare my adventure muscles for the release of Thimbleweed Park, to get back in the mindset, but I ended up enjoying it immensely on its own. I was pretty happy that I completed it without any hints in 7 hours  - I recalled some puzzle chains from my last playthrough as a teen, but had to rediscover most and got stuck on a few silly things.

Highly, highly recommend if you're a point and click adventure fan; DOTT was the unbeaten high point of this genre and it still is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979434471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1468275628}
review:
This game works in so many ways. I remember playing it back in the day and now having the opportunity to play it again in a modern time machine without losing any bit from the original it's great. The ability  to switch between classic and remastered mode is always a good addition for those nostalgic days when you miss the pixelated graphics.

I definitely recommend this game as one of the classics of adventure games

author: {'steamid': '76561198051194348', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1479588756}
review:
Brilliant remaster of the classic point-and-click comedy adventure.

Although some of the puzzles are a little esoteric they do all fit together when you figure it out (or look it up). The jokes are still solid and for an old game it really hasn't dated much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053319880', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1492525828}
review:
[h1]*** VERSIONE SINTETICA ***[/h1]
[b]pro[/b]:
[list]
[*] un [i]grande classico[/i] consigliato a chi non ha avuto la fortuna di scoprirlo a suo tempo
[*] il fascino dell'originale è rimasto intatto negli anni, in una veste rispettosa della tradizione ma con un occhio agli standard attuali
[*] mantenuta la possibilità di giocare per intero anche [i]Maniac Mansion[/i]
[/list]

[b]contro[/b]:
[list]
[*] la grafica remastered non sembra andare aldilà di una ripulita dei pixel
[*] commento degli autori a tratti deludente
[/list]


[h1] *** VERSIONE ESTESA ***
[i]Il giorno quando tentai di colare un tentacolo[/i] [/h1]
Spesso e volentieri quando si recensisce un'avventura grafica (o punta & clicca, a dir si voglia) si cade nel tranello di sbrodolarsi nella sindrome del "Ai miei tempi...", degni del miglior osservatore di cantiere italico. A maggior ragione se si sta parlando di un classico [b]LucasArts[/b] come [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i]...
   Si è scritto così tanto sul mondo delle avventure grafiche che non penso abbiate bisogno della mia opinione in merito. Va da sè che una remastered ha due ragioni d'esistere:
[list]
[*] dare la possibilità a giocatori giovincelli di avvicinarsi a pietre miliari della storia videoludica
[*] far riscoprire ai nostalgici un po' più "datati" una parte della propria gioventù ludica
[/list]
C'è da aggiungere che una qualsiasi remastered (soprattutto se si parla di avventure grafiche) ha in sè una componente fortemente "documentaristica", grazie alla possibilità di integrare al gioco ulteriori contenuti bonus, primo fra tutti il commento degli autori.
   L'uscita della remastered di DotT era una delle più attese, quantomento da parte mia: la prospettiva di vedere la grafica cartoonesca in alta definizione era un richiamo irresistibile, e [b]dopo aver goduto del commento degli autori della remastered di Monkey Island 2[/b]... beh diciamo che l'aspettativa aveva completamente stravolto la mia regolare salivazione. Devo ammettere, però, che una volta calatomi nei panni di [i]Bernard, Hoagie e Laverne[/i], la sensazione è che quell'aspettativa non sia stata del tutto soddisfatta.
   Non del tutto, certo: Effettivamente è una goduria vedere in una veste del tutto nuova uno dei giochi che ha profondamente segnato la mia giovinezza, sia dal punto di vista meramente ludico che da quello più ampiamente culturale. e Day of the Tentacle si conferma come un'opera invecchiata in maniera ineccepibile. [b] Ma c'è un ma [/b]. Probabilmente anche due.
   Complice la benevolenza della memoria umana, [i]la veste grafica remastered non mi ha dato la sensazione di meraviglia che un'operazione del genere vorrebbe suscitare[/i] - soprattutto messa a confronto con quella di Monkey Island 2. Nel mio immaginario Day of the Tentacle era come se fosse [b]già[/b] in alta risoluzione. Ovviamente se ci si mette con occhio clinico a paragonare le due versioni, le differenze vengono a galla e sono ben evidenti... eppure non c'è stata una trasfigurazione sbalorditiva. Il che - si badi bene - non è data dalla scarsa qualità del lavoro svolto dai ragazzi della [b]Double Fine[/b] (basta dare un occhio alla remastered di [i]Grim Fandango[/i]) quanto dal fatto che Day of the Tentacle di per sè è invecchiato in maniera splendida.
   Una delusione vera e propria, invece, la ho avuta per quanto riguarda [b]contenuti bonus[/b]. Aldilà dell'efficace e ben fatta impostazione delle interfacce e soprassedendo sul gradevole art book, dal commento degli autori mi aspettavo molto di più. Troppo pochi gli interventi, e spesso poco incisivi. Ogni tanto ho avuto la percezione non siano riusciti a trovare particolari argomenti da trattare o aneddoti da raccontare - dando un'atmosfera di riempitivo che dispiace. Peccato.

[h1]In sintesi...[/h1]
La mancata sensazione di sorpresa e di riscoperta che manca in questa remastered, da una parte sembra puntare il dito sulla (a volte) legittima critica di [b]"speculazione nostalgica"[/b] che le edizioni [i]remastered/special/enhanced[/i] si portano inevitabilmente dietro; dall'altra non si può notare che a volte - e fortunatamente questo è il caso - [i]non è l'HR che fa il gioco[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198136622158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1491330847}

author: {'steamid': '76561198280146831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1490505058}
review:
因为买了个bumble包所以相当于包货的副产品？
然后闲着无聊就玩了一下，浪费了5个小时，最后看攻略快速过掉了。。。
这个游戏的难度挺高，反正我不看攻略完全想不出应该怎么解谜，而且画风我不怎么喜欢

游戏没有中文，但是四级水平完全可以玩的，就是感觉耐不下心读对话
而且有一些美国历史人物爱迪生、富兰克林、杰斐逊之类的梗，感觉get不到点

总结一下给7.5/10分吧，上世纪的作品重置蛮良心的，游戏内容还是很丰富的
但是如果不是 英语好+解谜控+能容忍画风 就不要浪费时间玩了。。

最后B站攻略：www.bilibili.com/video/av8095026/，攻略是英文的解说，
如果英语听力不好的话可能会漏掉一些攻略里提醒你注意的话，然后拿不了全成就，
但是看视频把游戏剧情过一遍没啥问题

author: {'steamid': '76561198027004672', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1510091472}
review:
Eins der besten LucasArts Adventure Games!
Lohnt sich auch es 20 Jahre später nochmal zu kaufen. Dafür kann es nun auch HD, braucht kein ScummVM mehr, hat Entwicklerkommentare, Konzeptzeichnungen und die Sprache kann man bei Installation auch ändern.
Schade, dass das Benutzerhandbuch nicht mehr dabei ist, das war passend lustig gestaltet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993503552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1482798215}
review:
Потрясающая игра.

Помню, проходил её ещё в детстве, при этом, абсолютно не зная английского языка, и без каких-либо солюшенов (интернета то не было). Как мне это удалось, для меня и самого сейчас загадка. Просто тыкал во всё подряд всем подряд. Судя по всему, тыкал я достаточно настойчиво, ибо точно помню, что игра мной была пройдена.

Сейчас же, спустя столько лет, было невероятно приятно заново пройти эту игру, теперь уже понимая все шутки и приколы, оставленные авторами. Классно, что такие игры перевыпускают.

Ремейк отличный, всё сделано на уровне. Команде Double Fine и лично Тиму Шейферу громадный респект за то, что они продолжают возвращать нам классику LucasArts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302934578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1489891586}
review:
今は無きルーカスアーツより1993年に発売されたPCゲーム。日本ではなじみが薄いが、スチームのレビューを読むと若き頃の黄金の思い出として印象深いそうだ。本作はそのリマスター版であり、絵や音楽、操作方法が現代向けに作り直されているだけでなく、当時の画面と音楽でプレイできるモード（F1で切り替え）がある。更にはアートワークやオーディオ・コメンタリーも付いており、どれだけの人に愛されてきたゲームかを窺い知ることができる。

ゲームの内容を簡単に述べると、世界征服を企む触手「紫」を止める為、バーナードとその友人ホギーとラバーンが現代・過去・未来の三つの時代に分かれて暗躍するアドベンチャーゲーム。操作は左クリックで移動、対象を右クリックで動きを指定するポイント＆クリック方式。難易度はかなり高く、良くある理不尽な解決法（いや、悔しいけど伏線は貼ってある）もあり、ノーヒントでクリアするのは相当苦労すると思う。ヌルゲーマーの私は後述の煩雑さもあり、数回ほど答えを見たことをここに白状する。当時の人は良くクリアできたなぁ。

評価は思い出補正増し増しかと思っていたが、そんなことはなかった。絵、演出、物語、音楽、どれを取っても文句なしの作品だと思う。ただ一つ言わせて欲しいのは、持ち物をキャラ別にする必要は無かったのではないかと思う。正確には時代を跨いで移動できる小物に関しては共通でも良かったのではないか。わざわざアイテム授受の為にキャラを（マップ端にある交換場所へ）移動させなければないのが非常に面倒だった。この点を除けば、時系列を利用したギミックやコミカルなアニメーションはプレイしていて楽しいので、是非ノーヒントクリアを目指して挑戦してみて欲しい。

なお日本語はない。基本は適当に動かしていれば解決できるが、会話パートもあるので多少は理解できないとやり辛いかもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561197971023228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1488170037}

author: {'steamid': '76561198348937843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1490616642}
review:
전편, ’매니악 맨션'에서 매드 사이언티스트로 부터 애인을 구출한지도 어느덧 5년. 그 저택에서 전 인류를 위협에 빠지게 할 새로운 사건이 태동한다. 저택에 상주하던 애완 동물 중 하나인 퍼플 텐타클이 유독 물질을 마시고 천재가 되어 버린 것. 천재가 된 퍼플 텐타클은 본격적으로 세계 정복을 노리고,퍼플 텐타클로 부터 세계를 구하기 위해 '버나드'는 다시 그 저택으로 들어가야 한다. 이번엔 자신의 친구 '호기'와 '래번'을 데리고...

1987년, 아직 게임 업계로는 신생 업체였던 루카스아츠는 게임 역사에 길이 남을만한 어드벤쳐 게임을 출시한다. 국내에서는 '공포의 저택'이라는 이름으로 출시했던 '매니악 맨션'이다. 이 게임을 통해 루카스아츠는 포인트 앤 클릭이라는 혁명적인 인터페이스를 선보였다. 게임 또한 걸작이어서 서양에서는 아직까지도 매니아 층이 있다.
 
'매니악 맨션'을 처음 접했을 때, 영어의 압박과 여러 사정으로 초반부만 플레이하고 포기했었다. 이 후, '텐타클 최후의 날' 출시 소식을 들었지만, 매니악 맨션을 리메이크 한 작품으로 착각하는 바람에 큰 관심을 두지 않았다. 리마스터 버전이 나오고 나서야, '매니악 맨션 2'임을 알게 되었다. 참고로, ‘텐타클 최후의 날’ 게임 내에서 오리지날 매니악 맨션을 즐길 수 있다.
 
어드벤쳐란 장르에서 가장 중요한 요소라 할 수 있는 스토리는 재미있고 흥미진진하다. 전반적인 분위기는 코믹하지만, 스토리 구성은 은근 복잡하다. 저택이라는 한정된 배경에서 진행함에도 불구하고 스토리의 스케일이 작다는 느낌이 별로 들지 않는다. 이유는, 과거, 현재, 미래를 오가는 시간 여행을 도입한데다 그로 인한 타임 패러독스까지 스토리에 영향을 끼치고 있기 때문이다. 이런 요소 덕분에, 게임을 즐기다 보면 고전 명작 영화인 '백 투더 퓨쳐'나 '엑설런트 어드벤쳐'가 생각 나기도 한다. 기상 천외한 스토리는 게임을 계속 플레이하고 싶게 만든다.
 
도트로 표현된 캐릭터들의 행동 연기와 성우의 목소리 연기 또한 훌륭하다. 이 게임이 출시된 시기를 생각하면, 지금 봐도 어색하지 않은 품질을 구현해 니었다는 것이 놀라울 뿐이다. 참고로 이 게임은 풀보이스를 지원한다.
 
 
'매니악 맨션'의 후속작인 만큼 당연하게도 정통 포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐 형식으로 진행 된다. 명령어를 선택하고, 명령어를 적용할 게임 내 오브젝트를 선택하면 된다. 만일 적절한 명령어와 오브젝트를 선택했다면 그에 따른 이벤트가 일어나고 다음으로 진행되는 식이다. 단, 이런 이벤트가 순차적으로 일어나지 않고, 병렬적으로 일어나기 때문에 어떤 것을 먼저 풀어도 상관은 없다.
 
넓은 의미에서 일종의 퍼즐이라고 봐도 된다. 다만 퍼즐이라고 보기에는 논리의 비약이 너무 심다. 좋게 말하면 기상천외하게 해결하는 재미가 있고, 나쁘게 말하면 정상적인 생각으로는 풀기가 힘들다. 때문에, 논리적으로 퍼즐을 푼다는 느낌 보다는, 모든 명령어와 아이템을 한번씩 조합해보는 조합 노가다의 느낌이 강하게 난다.
 
조합 노가다로 인한 시간 소요가 있긴 하지만, 난이도 자체는 쉬운 편이다. 난이도 하락의 가장 큰 이유는 루카스 아츠 어드벤쳐의 특징이기도 한 캐릭터 사망이나 게임오버가 없기 때문이다. 생각해보니 조합 노가다를 위한 최적의 시스템이 아닌가~
 
 
 
게임 특유의 미술 스타일은 지금 봐도 시각적으로 멋진 그래픽을 선사한다. 도트가 주는 특유의 각짐만 눈에 익으면, 개성 가득한 캐릭터와 건물, 물건 디자인을 보는 것 만으로도 즐거움을 선사해준다. 일각에서 도트 또는 픽셀 그래픽이 다시 유행하는 지금, 이 게임은 현세대의 같은 스타일과 비교할 때도 최상위권에 위치한다. 요즘에야 도트 그래의 품질이 순전히 아티스트의 역량에 달려 있지만, 이 게임을 개발할 당시만 하더라도 아티스트의 역량과 기술적 역량의 총 집합체였다. 그 당시에 이 게임이 왜 대작으로 불렸는지 알 수 있는 그래픽이다.
 
 
게임 사운드는 게임의 분위기를 적절히 살려주면서도 죽독성 있는 멜로디를 들려준다. 각 장면마다, 캐릭터 마다 특유의 멜로디가 있어서 게임하는 맛을 높여준다. 반복되는 배경음임에도 불구하고, 지겹다는 느낌이 들지 않고 플레이 내내 유저의 흥을 돋구어 준다.
 
 
게임의 가장 큰 재미는 어드벤쳐란 이름에 걸맞게 흥미진진한 스토리다. 스토리가 단순히 좋다라기 보다는, 스토리와 그 스토리로 인한 코믹함과 기상천외함이 재미의 포인트다. 이 게임을 한다면, 메인 스토리를 따라가는 것 외에도 명령어와 오브젝트를 다양하게 조합해보자. 메인 스토리 그자체로도 재미있고 황당하지만, 게임에 직접적인 영향을 미치지 않으면서도, 게임 특유의 약빤듯한 연출과 특유의 세계관을 더 알 수 있는 서브 스토리 또한 읽는 재미가 있다. 게임을 플레이 하다 보면, 어느순간 제작진의 약빤 유머에 낄낄대는 자신을 볼 수 있을 것이다.
 
스토리만큼이나 개성가득한 캐릭터 또한 이 게임을 재미있게 하는 요소다. 매력적인 주인공과 조역인 에디슨 박사, 악역 텐타클은 물론이거니와 감초처럼 등장하는 NPC들도 모두 제 각각의 매력이 있어서 대화하는 재미가 있다. 캐릭터 성을 잘 살린 게임의 모범을 보여준다.
 
아쉬운 점은 퍼즐 요소들이다. 퍼즐 요소들은 스토리에 녹아있다기 보다는 다음으로 넘어가기 위한 관문에 더 가깝다. 역할이 역할이다 보니, 가장 재미있는 스토리의 진행을 방해하는 부작용이 생겨 버렸다. 명령어-오브젝트 조합 노가다로 퍼즐 풀다 보면, 현재 스토리나 퀘스트가 어디까지 진해왿었는지 곧잘 잊어먹기 일쑤다. 퍼즐이 주는 기상천외한 재미는 분명히 있지만, 스토리와의 부조화에서 오는 단점이 더 크게 느껴진다.

 
이 게임은 꼭 한번은 즐겨봐야 하는 게임이다. 이 게임은 영화와 소설의 중간 어딘가에 있다. 게임으로 스토리를 풀 때, 같은 스토리라도 영화나 책과 비교했을 때 얼마나 다른지 알 수 있다.
 
당시엔 혁명적이었지만, 요즘 시대엔 오히려 조금 불편한 '포인터 앤 클릭' 방식도 조금만 하면 익숙해지고, 익숙해지면 오히려 재미있게 느껴진다. 가끔은 불현 한 것이 더 재미있을 때도 있다. 리마스터에서는 개선이 되었지만 개인적으로 장단점이 있는 듯 하다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294995465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1490131660}
review: I first played the original of this game when I was 8 years old, going back 24 years ago now. I enjoyed this just as much the second time through at the age of 31 =). Was super excited to see this was remastered and as always can sometimes assume will be old and not that entertaining but there are so many jokes and scenes which I would not have understood as a kid that found funny today. The best remastered old pc point and click games (my favourites) are those that when you play remastered it seems and feels just like you remembered it, until you turn on the old-style play graphics! Captured the game as I remembered perfectly, great story line, funny and fab quirky characters. Brilliant game that will not burn months of your life but get you thinking outside the box and give you laughs along the way. Thanks for making me feel 8 again! Loved it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067095535', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1556960986}
review:
Ein Haus voller Verrückter, Zeitreisen und ein machthungriger Purpur-Tentakel. Unter Zockern meiner Generation klingelt‘s bei Erwähnung genannter Stichpunkte sofort, und wem schon bei der Titel-Abkürzung DOTT augenblicklich der Groschen fällt, der bekommt 100 Gummipunkte extra. *g* Natürlich ist von „Day of the Tentacle“ die Rede, einem DER großen Adventure-Meilensteine überhaupt – und zugleich eines der populärsten Genre-Meisterwerke der ehemaligen Kultschmiede Lucas Arts. Ein Must-Have-Titel den man als PCler in den 1990er Jahren einfach haben musste. Jaahaaaa, lang ist’s her…
Und nun, 23 Jahre später, darf auch die neue Generation in den Genuss dieses Klassikers kommen. Tim Schafer, dem geistigen Vater von DOTT, sei Dank. Nach „Grim Fandango“ hat das unter seiner Leitung geführte Entwickler-Studio Double Fine Adventures auch hier Hand angelegt und den ergrauten VGA-Hit fürs Full-HD-Zeitalter wieder fit gemacht. Das Resultat, welches sich nunmehr „DOTT – Remastered“ nennt, kann sich ohne Frage sehen lassen.

Für all jene die die DOTT-Story noch nicht kennen sollten – falls das überhaupt möglich ist-, hier eine kurze Zusammenfassung:
Das geknackte Dreier-Gespann Bernard, Laverne und Hoagie eilt zum Edison-Haus um den durch Dr. Freds eigene Giftbrühe mutierten Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten, der mit seinen nachgewachsenen Stummelärmchen Welteroberungsambitionen an den Tag legt. Doch weil das Kind längst in den Brunnen gefallen ist muss die Katastrophe verhindert werden bevor sie passiert. Also gestern. Klar, kriegen wir hin. Denn wie es der Zufall will hat Dr. Fred drei zu Zeitmaschinen umfunktionierte Dixie-Klos im Keller stehen – für nen DeLorian fehlte wohl das Geld *lach* -, ergo schickt er bebrillten Tollpatsch, wirre Medizin-Studentin und korpulenten Rocker auf Zeitreise um die Menschheit vor Purpur zu bewahren. Doch leider geht alles (wie zu erwarten) schief. Hoagie landet 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, Laverne selbe Zeit in der Zukunft, während Bernard weiterhin in der Gegenwart festsitzt. Obgleich zeitlich voneinander getrennt müssen alle Drei alles daran setzen den verursachten Schlamassel wieder zu korrigieren…

Zur Beruhigung aller Alt-Fans:
„DOTT- Remastered“ ist kein (!) Komplett-Remake geworden. Die Handlungsabfolge, die Rätsel(ketten), die Dialoge, nahezu alles was das Ur-Spiel eben so kultig macht ist unangetastet geblieben, das Einzige was Schafer und sein Team an Verbesserungen durchgeführt haben ist rein kosmetischer Natur zuzuordnen. Der unvergleichliche, comicartige, aber aus heutiger Sicht auch arg grobpixelige Zeichenstil erstrahlt nun messerscharf 1:1 nachgezeichnet und im bildschirmfüllenden 16:9-Format, während das alte SCUMM-Interface mitsamt Verb-Leiste einem modernen Popup-Menü weicht. Wer sich zu den Puristen zählt und nicht auf SCUMM verzichten möchte darf dies glücklicherweise weiterhin nutzen, muss aber dann auch mit einem klassischen 4:3-Bild leben. Gleiches gilt für die Original-Grafik zu der man – wie bei den „Monkey Island“-Neuauflagen – per Tastendruck schnell hin und her switchen kann. Ansonsten gibt es keine nennenswerten Neuerungen. Die Animationsstufen der Charaktere sind weiterhin beschränkt, weshalb die Bewegungen von Bernard und Co. altmodisch, sprich leicht abgehakt aussehen, während die knallbunten Hintergründe in der Regel recht starr bleiben. Dafür erfolgt das horizontale Scrolling - anders als früher - nunmehr butterweich. 
Richtige Anpassungen lassen sich eher auf der tonalen Ebene herausfiltern. Die neu abgemischte Musik klingt etwas frischer bzw. minimal satter und einzelne Geräuscheffekte wurden ausgetauscht, was aber letztendlich nix an der eher spärlichen Soundkulisse großartig ändert. Neben der alten, leicht dumpfen Deutsch-Sprachausgabe steht nun auch die englische Tonspur zur Verfügung, welche klar vorzuziehen ist. Zwar nicht ganz auf dem Niveau der Original-Fassung von „Sam & Max“ und Co., aber insgesamt doch passender als die deutschen Sprecher. Multilinguale Texte und eine Entwickler-Kommentar-Funktion gibt’s noch dazu, und das „Spiel im Spiel“ – gemeint ist natürlich der DOTT-Vorgänger „Maniac Mansion“ – ist ebenfalls noch enthalten.

Fazit:
Obwohl es nicht zu meinen persönlichen Lucas Arts-Favoriten zählt möchte ich „DOTT – Remastered“ nicht missen. Auch nach über 20 Jahren mag ich den schrulligen Humor und die besondere Rätselgüte des Originals, die mit äußerst schrägen, aber doch streng logischen Einfällen daherkommt. Dank an Schafer und Co. dafür dass sie diese nicht wegzudenkende Genre-Perle für die nächsten (mindestens) 20 Jahre liebevoll restauriert und für nachfolgende Generationen gerettet haben. Nun kann ich das nächste Remastered-Projekt ("Full Throttle - Vollgas") kaum abwarten. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039584690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1457943403}
review:
Los grandes clásicos nunca se olvidan, tarde o temprano vuelven, llegan mejorados pero como no, manteniéndose tan vivos y con tanta carisma como los conociamos.

Estamos antes la segunda parte del juego Maniac Mansion, un gran clásico dentro de las aventuras gráficas que allá por los noventa ya causó furor, y seguramente, con esta reedición siga ganando jugadores en los siguientes 20 años.

El argumento gira en torno a tres amigos que tienen que unirse y viajar al pasado para evitar que un tentáculo púrpura mutado controle el mundo en un mundo que se nos muestra al más puro “dibujo animado”. Todo esto plagado de un humor por doquier, y grandes momentos para recodar.

El sistema de juego utiliza el clásico point and click, en el que pincharemos sobre la pantalla para que nuestros personajes se muevan por el escenario. Como en toda aventura gráfica, las ideas más descabelladas y alocadas serán las que marquen el avance la historia. El sentido común no te será útil, tendrán que darle al coco para pensar una idea loca, y que harían nuestros personajes para resolver cada puzle que nos encontremos. 

Una parte que hace interesante el título es como juego con el tiempo. No hago ningún spoiler si os digo que muy pronto cada uno de los tres personajes viajarán en el tiempo, bueno… todos no, Bernard se quedará en el presente, pero los otros dos amigos si se irán, uno 200 años al pasado desde la actual fecha, y la chica 200 años al futuro. Lo interesante de esto es que estarán en contacto todo el tiempo gracias a las maquinas del Dr. Fred Edison, y cada acciones que hagamos en el tiempo afectarán a los momentos sucesores. 

Si te decides por comprar la versión de consola estas de suerte, porque Day of the Tentacle cuenta con cross-buy y cross-save, para disfrutar de nuestra partida en Playstation 4 a la vez en PS Vita.

Gráficamente el juego ha sido mejorado muchísimo, con unas ilustraciones en alta resolución, pero con la ventaja de seguir teniendo el mismo juego de siempre.
 ¿No te llega a gustar el nuevo diseño? No importa, si eres de los que no quieren cambios del diseño, y simplemente han buscado una excusa para volver a jugarlo, siempre tendrás a un toque de botón (pinchando en PS4 en la pantalla táctil) y así de sencillo pasaremos de vista moderna a vista clásica.

Un nuevo añadido, aunque ya estamos acostumbrado a ello con las remasterizaciones de otros juegos, es la inclusión de logros. Un aliciente más para los amantes de los trofeos, y para los coleccionistas de juegos completados.

El apartado sonoro también ha sido mejorado, brindándonos la oportunidad de escoger la música de esta nueva edición o de su antigua. Y no solo eso, contamos con el juego con todos los textos en castellano, que será más que esplendido para disfrutar plenamente de las graciosas conversaciones entre personajes. Respecto al audio no hemos tenido tanta suerte pero bueno, no se puede pedir todo. Si no te queda suficiente con todo esto, encima el juego cuenta con la posibilidad de habilitar al comienzo los comentarios de los creadores originales.

Si has leído este análisis es porque te gustan las aventuras gráficas, y en tal caso tanto si lo jugaste hace más de veinte años como si no, este juego se convierte en un indispensable al tenemos todo. Disfrutable en versión clásica o remasterizada, logros, diversión, entretenimiento y sobre todo mucho humor.

Más en: creativefuturegames(doc)com

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197978625167', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1661983373}
review:
Zeitreise in der Videospielgeschichte!
Wenn man einen Spieleklassiker wie Day of the Tentacle überarbeitet und neuveröffentlicht, kann man damit zwei Gruppen ansprechen: Jene, die damals bereits das Spiel liebten und ihre Sentimentalität mit einer den modernen Standards weitmöglichst angepassten Version ausleben wollen, und jene, die das Spiel bei der ersten Veröffentlichung aus verschiedensten Gründen nicht gespielt haben und sich womöglich nicht auf den damaligen Standard einlassen können oder wollen. Das Design des Spiels wirkt auf mich wie die Blaupause für weite Teile der kommerziellen „Nerdkultur“, wie ich sie kenne: bunt, überstilisierte Proportionen, charmant überzeichnete Charaktere. Der Humor schwankt zwischen wirklich clever und grenzenlos stumpf. Die Idee, dass Purpur-Tentakel nun, da ihm dank giftmüllverschmutztem Wasser Arme gewachsen sind, die Weltherrschaft an sich reißen möchte und drei Hauptprotagonisten, die zwar alle nur denkbaren Klischees erfüllen, aber dennoch irgendwie sympathisch sind, ihn nun völlig plan- und ahnungslos stoppen sollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990887735', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 9459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1525113388}
review: BEST STORY GAME

author: {'steamid': '76561198080365533', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1489120438}
review:
If you experience audio stattering on Windows 10, run the game in Windows 8 compatibility mode.

============================================

Old classic. Super funny story. Stylish graphics. Extraordinary voice acting.

While controls are remastered, they are still fundamentally point and click (i.e. designed with philosophy different from today's in mind), and can get confusing or even misleading at times.

Don't feel bad if you have to consult guides now and then, because the game can be cryptic at times.

8 out of 10, excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994000906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 800, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1489082156}
review: I think in some ways if a point and click has a part that no human could reasonably guess without a walkthrough then it's kind of an automatic F and this game has a couple of those. But I'm unreasonably hard on these Cherished Classics I guess. The graphics have certainly aged well and it's a good example of how to do everything right with a remaster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014622873', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1488842623}
review: Day of the tentacle, le père fondateur des point and click modernes, revient dans une version (légèrement) retravaillée ! Je viens juste de le finir à nouveau et quel bonheur ! Le jeu est toujours aussi fun et retords après toutes ces années ! Pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas et qui ne sont pas allergiques aux point & click, sachez que ce jeu est absolument indispensable ! Tout y est formidable : l'humour potache, la direction unique très inspirée où tout est dessiné de travers, les animations à la Tex Avery, l'aventure qui fait penser aux meilleurs moments de Retour vers le futur, les situations et les personnages, plus loufoques les uns que les autres. Bref, un gigantesque moment de bonheur à passer en compagnie du docteur Fred - savant complètement fou, de Bernard l'intello, de Hoagie le rockeur gras du bide et de Laverne l'apprentie chirurgienne à tendances sadiques. Quant à la version 'Remastered' proposée, celle-ci n'apporte que de menus ajouts, mais sympathiques : possibilité de passer de la version d'origine en gros pixels avec l'interface et la musique de l'époque vers la version remasterisée en appuyant sur la touche F1, sauvegarde automatique, succès et bonus débloqués quand on avance dans le jeu. La version Remasterisée consiste en un passage à la HD respectant parfaitement le style d'origine avec support des écrans larges, et sans le menu en bas de l'écran, remplacé par un menu contextuel en cercle apparaissant quand on clique sur bouton droit de la souris. Je trouve que le lissage graphique est sympathique, même s'il fait disparaître complètement le pixel-art d'origine. Cela dit, on peut switcher quand on veut entre la version d'origine et la nouvelle donc rien de grave à ce niveau-là. La musique remasterisée, quant à elle, est de l'ordre du sympathique également, mais n'est pas fofolle non plus. Un synthétiseur plus récent a été utilisé pour faire le rendu des musiques. Il n'y a pas eu de vraie réorchestration à proprement parler. Sinon, tout est là, y compris l'intégralité du jeu 'Maniac Mansion', jouable directement dans un des ordinateurs du jeu (ce qui était incroyable pour l'époque). Bon, je me suis un peu étalé, mais vous l'aurez compris : ce jeu est légendaire de par son génie et je pense sincèrement que tout gamer normalement constitué devrait l'avoir fini au moins un fois dans sa vie. Ah oui, une dernière chose : évitez d'utiliser une soluce si possible : les accomplissements n'en seront que plus jouissifs !

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1449, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1488129577}
review:
Was ist Day of the Tentacle? Dazu möchte ich erstmal sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel als Kind nie gespielt habe und dadurch keine Nostalgie für dieses Spiel habe, was meines erachtens in solchen Review sogar recht positiv ist. Also was ist nun Day of the Tentacle, ein Point and Click Adventure welchen vollen guter Idee, Witz, Charme, kreativen Rätseln, tollen Charakteren und noch so viel anderen großartigen Dingen steckt. Dieses Spiel ist 24 Jahre alt, das ist fast ein viertel Jahrhundert und es ist immernoch so unglaublich gut und viel besser als alles was derzeit erscheint. Jeder der Intresse an Videospielen hat sollte dieses Meisterwerk spielen weil es so viel richtig macht und zeigt warum dieses Genre damals so groß war. Aber um was geht es? Ihr müsst die Welt retten und habt dazu 3 Charktere welche jeweils 200 Jahre von einader entfernt agieren. Die Steuerung ist gut, die Ratsel sind gut Lösbar, es hat eine gute Vertonung und Unterhält einen sehr. Kauft es euch!!!!


kommt auch aus den 90ern:http://www.twitch.tv/thebenjaminkendrick

author: {'steamid': '76561197965046644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1464832953}
review:
A return to a good classic click adventure that I grew up with. If you like click adventures with some interesting puzzles along with humor then I recommend playing this. Now this game is also sort of sequel/spin off of Manic Mansion and don't worry if you haven't played Manic Mansion because you can play the game within Day of the Tentacle in it's glory old graphics (hint it's ingame and hard to miss). 

Now all we need is Full Throttle

author: {'steamid': '76561198012203940', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1488183516}
review: Rigiocato a distanza di tanti, tanti anni, questa splendida avventura punta e clicca rimane sempre un capolavoro, a maggior ragione con questa versione rimasterizzata. La storia è fuori di testa in tutto e per tutto, fantastica e ispirata, con continui momenti di umorismo più o meno velato. Gli enigmi non sono particolarmente complicati, magari bisogna ragionare e tentare un po' di soluzioni ma si possono fare piuttosto velocemente tutti; il gameplay, anche per la sua età, è quanto di più classico si possa avere. Il lavoro di rimasterizzazione è poi sopraffino, con grafica, audio e interfaccia totalmente riviste, pur restando molto fedeli all'originale e con la possibilità di scegliere la versione preferita in ogni momento. Da divorare il prima possibile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981345536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1488129147}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198033857334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1488075250}
review:
This game was one of the first titles I've played from Lucas Arts. I remember being very little (around 10) and not understanding english at all. But I struggled for a significant amount of time trying to figure out what to do. And I failed of course.

The game has a very cool mechanic where you need to alternate between the three characters to solve the puzzles (and save the world!). The story is very interesting, with smart lines and awesome characters. I am glad they did a remaster version so I could play today and be able to finish the game. This version turned out to be very good, like all the other remasters Double Fine did.

I recomend this game to all fans of adventure games and especially Lucas Arts games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086492066', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1526779116}
review: One of the absolute finest adventures I have ever taken part in, and a viable contender for my favorite game of all time. The remaster is brilliant and seamless, and the characters and puzzles all retain their beautifully quirky charm. If you are an avid point and click adventurer who has never played this masterpiece, or you've never enjoyed a point and click before, this is one of the greatest games ever made, and you are absolutely, 100% missing out if you don't have it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999718990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1483444259}
review:
Damals geliebt, heute verehrt

DotT ist auch in der restaurierten Neuauflage schlichtweg ein Meilenstein der Point ´n Click Adventures. Leider nicht mehr ganz so witzig wie damals (für meine geistige Weiterentwicklung kann das Spiel ja nichts). Wer das Spiel noch von früher kennt und Lust auf eine unterhaltsame und technisch gut umgesetzte Zeitreise hat, dem kann ich es sehr empfehlen! Alle anderen sollen sich ein "LetsPlay" ansehen oder ´nen Lolly lutschen...

author: {'steamid': '76561197996656102', 'num_games_owned': 847, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1488008225}
review:
Remaster przygodówki z początku lat 90. Wtedy by wyciągnąć sweter spod grubasa leżącego na łóżku należało wyjść na dwór gdzie rabuś próbuje się z łomem dostać do auta, dać rabusiowi kluczyki do samochodu, od odda ci wtedy łom, ty użyjesz łomu na gumie do żucia która przylgnęła do podłogi. Odlepioną gumę żujesz i znajdujesz w niej monetę. Monetę używasz na łóżku na którym przebywa grubas (pamiętacie o nim jeszcze?), moneta uruchamia wibracje pod materacem które wyrzucają grubasa na podłogę, a ty możesz wziąć sweter. A teraz... po co mi ten sweter?

Ale zawsze są bardzo pomocne poradniki na Steam. Dzięki temu można ukończyć produkcję i nadal pozostać przy zdrowych zmysłach. Sama przygoda jest bardzo przyjemna, bo rozgrywa się jednocześnie w trzech płaszczyznach czasowych. I na przykład by uwolnić koleżankę która utknęła na drzewie w przyszłości należy ściąć to drzewo w przeszłości.

"Day of the Tentacle" lśni w temacie kwestii wizualnych i dialogowych. Przyjemnie jest obcować w tym świecie i gadać z kolejnymi bohaterami. A do tego dochodzi jeszcze podróż w czasie, więc możemy opierniczyć Ojców Założycieli Stanów Zjednoczonych.


6+/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276825869', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1490805844}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1487553571}
review:
Incredibly charming point and click adventure with loads of great 90s humor. It's almost like playing a 90s cartoon. 

The logic puzzles are only arbitrary a couple of times (the horse, of course), and otherwise make lots of sense as long as you talk to people and pay attention to your surroundings.

I'm no big fan of point and clicks, and I'd still recommend people take a swing at this game. And it's frequently on sale, to boot!
