author: {'steamid': '76561197977895186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1506878077}
review:
Sehr toll gemachter Remake. Mir gefällt, dass man alles auf Original einstellen kann (insbesondere Sound wäre für mich unmöglich den neuen zu nehmen), aber auch in den Genuss neuer Grafik kommen kann, wenn man damit auch eine für mich bisher unverständliche Steuerung hinehmen muss.

Läuft auch unter Linux und scheint sehr leichtgewichtig.

Da dies mein erstes Computerspiel war, an dem ich als Kind tagelang hing, mag ich dieses Spiel besonders gern. Super!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024191409', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1481596463}
review:
No puedo ser objetivo con este juego. Para mí es, sencillamente, la mejor aventura gráfica de todos los tiempos.

Secuela de Maniac Mansion, un hito indiscutible en los videojuegos pero que distaba de ser la aventura gráfica perfecta (al fin y al cabo estaba arrancando el género), en Day of Tentacle nos encontramos con la perfección en cuanto a diseño. El diseño de los puzzles es absolutamente perfecto, jugando con las expectativas del jugador e integrados de una forma tan maravillosa que son simplemente parte de la trama y, sobre todo, memorables.

Los gráficos cartoon no pueden ser más apropiados para una historia de humor absurdo con... ¡viajes en el tiempo!

Aunque, como he dicho, yo no pueda ser objetivo, creo que cualquier jugador en cualquier época puede pasar horas disfrutando de este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019083325', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1463930373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025011697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1479994061}
review:
LucasArts and Sierra games were a mainstay of my early years with computers.  A time where I only was able to fit one game at a time on my hard drive.  Day of The Tentacle (after playing Maniac Mansion on NES) was one of the first CD based talkie games I ever owned.  It quickly ascended the ranks of personal favorite computer games to settle in a top five position among greats like the Space Quest series, Sam and Max Hit The Road, and a few select others.

I am so glad I played it long enough ago that higher education and the real world erased many of the puzzle solutions and plot developments from my mind.  Playing the remaster of DotT immediatly transported me back to sitting in front of the computer in the den trying to figure out where to go next and learning the most innacurate American history possible.

The remastered graphics are amazing and the ability to switch on the fly to the old pixelated look is a great feature.  The music and voice acting made the move over flawlessly and the puzzles are just as head scratching.  Much easier to get a hint now as well with the advent of the modern internet.  Bonus points for Mac support as well.  I played most of the game on a Mac without issue and spent some time playing on PC as well.  Both perform exceptionally.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a must play for classic adventure game fans and anyone who wants puzzles that are as far from obvious as you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994117737', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1561659463}
review:
One of the most iconing point&click adventure games from lucas arts. Like with previous remasters from Double fine, you are given a choice to seamlessly switch between original visuals and remastered ones. Similarly you can either switch between original midi sound score and remastered sampled one.  Personally i find of remastered sound with classic visuals and director comentary the most satisfying combination of the available options.  
A no brainer purchase for adventure newcomers and veterans  alike. 

PROS: 
Oldimers will appreciate updated sound and smooth gamplay without of hassle of messing around with either dosbox or scummvm. New players will appreciate timeless cartoonish style, hillarious dialogue and insane puzzles in style of early LA production 

CONS: 
Remastered visuals are somewhat lacking in detail as if original graphics had been just retraced in vector painting app, giving the the visuals feel of a browser flash game. 
Some puzzles may be a bit more challenging than what players are used to in current games. 
A large part of the puzzle design revolves around indirect interaction beween the 3 main protagonists via something akin to message in the bottle mechanic. While ingenious in concept, it can sometimes lead to being stuck for extended periods of time as the necessary interaction is not easy to guess. eaxmple: bernard(present) needs to stick hamster in into icebox so it freezes, so laverne(future) can thaw it and use hamster in solving the puzzle in future

author: {'steamid': '76561198026573171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1467375657}
review: So gut wie damals. Sowohl der Charme als auch der Witz des ersten Durchspielens vor vielen Jahren stellt sich ab der ersten Minute wieder ein.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999003590', 'num_games_owned': 2002, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1561923727}
review: One of the best LucasArts game remastered :).

author: {'steamid': '76561198088028789', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1666527766}
review: One of the greatest point and click adventures Lucasfilm Games ever created. I played this game probably 10 times, maybe even more, so there's a replay potential. I really like the overhaul of the remastered edition and that you can always switch back to the original game. The only advice apart from buying this game is not reading any walkthroughs because eventually it's more fun to explore and to find the solution to every riddle on your own (just remember to close every door you see).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008714069', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1480279117}
review:
One of the best point-and-click adventure games of all times gets the remaster it deserves. A remaster that doesn't dumb it down and doesn't "make the gameplay more fluid", but just makes the game playable on newer systems and updates the beautiful graphics. Even better, if you are the sort of purist who thinks only the original is worthy, you can always change the graphics back to the pixelated glory of the early '90s and it will seem like you never skipped a beat. 

The use of time travel as game mechanics is one of the coolest ways in which the story and the mechanics of a game come together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. Some of the best puzzles in video
game history can be found here and only a handful of them will seem frustrating or illogical. 

The only bad thing I can say about it, really, is that there seems to be a small, yet irritating, bug where after playing for a while, a random audio effects will begin looping every few seconds. This makes the game extremely annoying to play, but can be solved by quitting and restarting the game. It happened to me 3 or 4 times during my playthrough, making it something more than just a freak occurrence. 

An absolute gem, for both old and new players!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049076804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1479942739}
review: Todo un clásico atemporal, un pedacito de historia previo lavado de cara para adaptarlo a las pantallas y controles de hoy en día (aunque permite cambiar a la versión antigua y pixelada para los más nostálgicos). Obra maestra. Ya estás tardando en jugarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975533503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1604752054}
review:
Aventura gráfica de los tiempos en que ser friki era todo un honor y donde la profundidad de la historia y la jugabilidad prevalecía frente a los píxeles.
Se puede jugar en modo retro con la resolución y menus de antaño o remasterizado con gráficos actuales.
Es una joya que no puede faltar en la biblioteca si eres un aficionado a las aventuras gráficas.
Corre muy bien sobre ordenadores poco potentes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013321947', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1473207034}
review:
Feels and plays as good as it did back in the day, if you played it before and liked it it's a must have.
If you didn't you need to try it, point and click adventure games from the 90's are greatand  this is arguably best one of them.
Characters, jokes, puzzles, quirky humour all are one of the kind. 
I's not just a classic game it's one of those games you'll remeber 20 years after you played it last time, YES ITS THAT GOOD !

author: {'steamid': '76561198001240961', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1687791533}
review:
[h1]Es ist ein absolutes Muss für jeden Adventure-Fan!![/h1]
[b]Eines meiner ewigen Lieblingsspiele aus Jungendzeiten an!!![/b]
Allerbeste Unterhaltung und Rätselspaß sind garantiert! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197980885826', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1527235213}
review:
what to say.... I grew up with this. And look at me know: 37 and still a video gaming nerd.
I love it.

no, seriously - this game is my absolute favorite Lucas Arts Adventure (together with Grim Fandango) and I love every single aspect of it.
Thge graphical overhaul is realy cool, and for nostalgic moments, you can switch back to the original style any time.
Also the controller support is nicely done.

DoubleFine: great job, thanks a lot!
Now excuse my, I have to stop purple from taking over the world!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052888510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1480267623}
review:
This is one of the games of the old days that I still like to return to every now and then. Together with its nephew Monkey Island this one brings speech to the point-and-click adventures of Bernard and his friends. I am still hoping for a remake of the even older Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders game, another game of that age that will still work now.

The interface to this revamped version requires some getting used to if you've grown up with the original ones, but it works good enough. The drawing style is quirky, the animations feel a little jerky but fitting with the time, but that isn't what this game is about. This game is about dialogue, about humour, about getting stuck and trying odd combinations to get through. 

Quite good, a must for the fans of the old days

author: {'steamid': '76561198059297893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1527282640}
review:
Ohhhh mann, schon so lange her?

Eins der ersten Spiele die damals gespielt habe, die Remastered Version  forderte mich direct heraus es mal wieder zu spielen.

DOTT ist ein Klasiker im "Point and Click", die Story und der Humor ist zeitlos genial.

Schön wäre es, wenn es noch ein remake von "Sam and Max" kommen würde.

Ist immer noch nett zu spielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997377045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1567747514}
review: This was one of the earliest PaC PC games I ever played. Once I realized that Dr. Fred's secret plans were in the basement, I could finally enjoy the real absurdity and hilarity that was the rest of this game. The art style, dialogue, and plot are unique, amusing, and unconventional. Filled with easter eggs and cultural references, I enjoyed exploring every inch of this game. If you find you aren't making progress, you probably aren't being maniacal enough (it's the Maniac Mansion sequel, after all). I definitely recommend this Remastered version, as it contains developer commentary that fans will love. If you're new to DoTT, I'd also recommend playing with the classic graphics (not remastered) if you want an authentic and original experience. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021097111', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1666498806}

review: This and Sam and Max Hit the Road were a couple of my favorite games as a kid.  Limited replayability you would think, but I have finished each multiple times (YMMV, when I was a kid I also watched Star Wars at least once a week and it didn't get old).  The humor and the theme/setting are terrific.  If you are a fan of point and click, you need to play this.  If you are not, well, this isn't going to change your mind probably.. watch the cutscenes on YT instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998317676', 'num_games_owned': 4809, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1478879167}
review: Meilleur jeu d'aventure de tous les temps, Day of the Tentacle revient pour nous montrer qu'il n'avait pas besoin d'un redesign complet pour être à la page, et qu'un simple lissage graphique suffit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049835436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1480370107}
review: Impossible pour moi de résister à la re-découverte du jeu, avec en plus les commentaires des créateurs. Je ne dirai pas que les graphismes sont réellement améliorés tant le jeu original était beau et fin malgré les gros pixels. Il y a quand même eu un gros travail de refonte, et le plus agréable c'est d'avoir les voix originales en qualité audio parfaite. Bref ce jeu a un bon goût de madelaine, et je dirai que c'est aussi son défaut, il risque de ne pas forcément plaire aux joueurs qui n'y ont pas joué à l'époque car il demande d'accepter le gameplay de l'époque justement (essayer toutes les combinaisons d'objets, lire tous les dialogues pour trouver des pistes etc.)

Que de souvenirs ... 
J'avais adoré la première fois que j'y avais joué c'était ... y'a bien longtemps maintenant, à une époque où le jeu se vendait sur des disquettes !
Un humour toujours présent, des cass-têtes qui portent bien leur nom et un tentacule mégalomane ... que demander de plus ? Bref, un must-have si on aime le style "point'n click"

author: {'steamid': '76561198007364466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1705871145}

Dies war mein erstes Spiel zu meinem ersten PC Anno 1994. Ich habe es damals geliebt und liebe es immer noch. Ich pflege auch heute immer noch die Tradition, dieses Spiel mindestens einmal im Jahr komplett durch zu spielen. Um so glücklicher war ich bei diesem Remake. Visuell aufpoliert aber das Spiel an sich wurde nicht verschlimmbessert sondern so belassen wie es ist. Perfekt.

Pflichtkauf.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993377297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1478067823}
review: Still holds up as a great point and click adventure. It really would be nice if in this day and age we could come back to the passion writers had for dialogue and story like they did during this era of gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969440738', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1480195564}
review:
There are games, and there are "games".  This is one of those originals that helped shape the face of gaming today, without point and click adventures from Lucasarts, we would still be in the 8-bit stone age (or heading back there it seems....)

Its funny, comical, easy on the eye and a good story to boot.  Dont read a book (just yet...) play one of the best interactive adventures ever made, and pray that the gods see fit to remaster Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis.

Yes, the puzzles sometimes make you think "what where they thinking", but google will help and relax that back in those days, this was the norm - you had to think.......like the strange person who wrote the game, sometimes you got it, sometimes you didnt, but thats not your fault.

I have this game on IOS and GOG and STEAM, thats how good it is!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018213320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1480195298}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995304552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1517066006}
review:
Day of the Tentacle!
Es ist exakt so wie ich das Spiel von damals in Erinnerung hatte - nur eben mit besserem Sound und besserer Grafik - was will man mehr?

Interessant ist, dass ich alle Lösungen immernoch auswendig wusste obwohl ich das Spiel 10 Jahre nicht mehr angefasst hatte - manches scheint sich einfach ins Gehirn einzubrennen...

Fazit: Wer es damals mochte und auf der Suche nach einer "Zeitreise" ist kann hier bedenkenlos zuschlagen.
Und wer das Spiel noch nie gespielt hat MUSS eigentlich zuschlagen.

Nebenbemerkung: 2 kleinere Bugs in der Synchronisation sind wohl vorhanden (Sprache wird zu früh abgespielt in einer Zwischensequenz) aber ansonsten funktioniert das Spiel tadellos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046781319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1464086744}
review:
Old childhood favourite that has stood the test of time! Absolutely fantastic point and click adventure with a good humour! So happy this came to steam, I was getting sick of making the old DOS one on CD work! 

A purely brilliant game for any point and click fan, if you've never been into those kind of games give this a whirl! This along with the discworld series are, in my opinion, some of the best point and clicks out there!

review: A famous Lucasarts adventure game from the early 90s. PC Gamer often put it as pretty much the best point-and-click adventure game out there. review:
El juego ya era de lo mejor por si solo, y esta version remasterizada nos trae la posibilidad de revivir una vez más esta divertidisima historia.
El modo de juego, el arte, las voces, todo es maravilloso.

Solo una cosa me molestó de este remaster y es la música, no sé porque el juego se me queda sin música y solo escucho los sonidos de las acciones y las voces y esto a veces llega a ser muy molesto.

En fin, me sigue encantando Maniac Mansion (Y podemos jugar al 1 dentro del juego)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067041530', 'num_games_owned': 5990, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1641066855}
review:
Una delle avventure grafiche classiche migliori, forse la mia preferita in assoluto.

Il remaster è di ottima qualità, come del resto già per i due titoli della serie Monkey Island: la grafica è aggiornata ai tempi e ad alta risoluzione, ma senza stravolgere assolutamente l'ottimo lavoro fatto ai tempi.

Un titolo davvero consigliato per tutti... e indispensabile per chi non l'ha giocato all'epoca!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971180301', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1606343022}
review:
If you really don't know this game you probably didn't play any games in the early 90s.

This game is a classic point-and-click adventure, so it's almost entirely controlled with mouse. It is the classic adventure "Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle" in a remastered version with higher quality, a reworked GUI and - of course - lots of Steam achievements.

Day of the Tentacle (also called DOTT) originally was conceived by Tim Schafer for LucasArts, which sadly was eventually bought by Disney and closed only recently. In the late 80s and early 90s, LucasArts was THE high quality studio for adventure games, although some competitors such as Westwood managed to make similar great adventures in this style.

I won't go into the details of this game but one thing is very clear: This game is hilarious! The way it tells its story (underlying plot of time travel!) and how you will have to solve puzzles will stick with you for many years. I still managed to play through this game without any help 20 years later.

Recommended: For anyone who enjoys adventure games. In fact, everyone else should also try it on a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011667277', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1811, 'last_played': 1466758768}
review:
Nostalgia canaglia

Fiumi di ricordi nell’edizione rimasterizzata di Maniac Mansion I nostri lettori più giovani probabilmente non erano nemmeno nati quando, nel 1993, fu pubblicata una delle pietre angolari nell’industria videoludica, frutto della creatività di una coppia di autentici geni. Day Of The Tentacle, seguito di Maniac Mansion uscito nel 1987 (incluso in una easter egg, anche se non oggetto di revisione), si può considerare a giusta ragione come un’espressione della cultura popolare con la quale sono cresciuti tanti ragazzi (anche italiani) dei primi anni Novanta: un’opera con cui Tim Schafer e Dave Grossman, i due programmatori principali, sono inconsapevolmente diventati papà di una nutrita schiera di avventurieri. A volte ritornano Come ogni capolavoro che si rispetti Day Of The Tentacle non ha conosciuto un enorme successo commerciale: agli esordi ne furono vendute, secondo le stime dello stesso creatore, poco meno di 100.000 copie. La fama crebbe grazie alla critica dell’epoca e il titolo divenne un vero e proprio cult negli anni a venire, comparendo in cima in più o meno tutte le “hall of fame” che i siti di informazioni videoludica (e non solo) hanno stilato. Le logiche commerciali hanno quindi voluto che anche questo mostro sacro passasse sotto le forche caudine dell’ammodernamento: pratica dannatamente pericolosa che rischia di sacrificare il fascino che una produzione del genere si porta dietro, snaturandosi per incontrare i favori di una platea enormemente più numerose, eterogenea e, ci si passi il termine, meno “hardcore” di quella che oltre vent’anni fa si destreggiava con la configurazione dell’autoexec.bat per far partire il file dott.exe dal prompt del DOS. Il fronte della vecchia guardia, alla quale chi scrive appartiene, solitamente è molto restio a questo tipo di operazioni, ma bisogna ammettere che, nel caso di Day Of The Tentacle Remastered, il lavoro di update si è saggiamente limitato ad una ridefinizione grafica molto aderente alle idee originali della LucasArts e ad una leggera semplificazione dell’interfaccia SCUMM che però è rimasta concettualmente invariata. Il risultato è una copia 1 a 1 del titolo originale: fortunatamente non sono state fatte aggiunte di alcun tipo tanto che, volendo, è possibile portare a termine il titolo nella venerata e pixellosissima versione anni Novanta - basta premere il tasto F1 per fare un salto indietro nel tempo, proprio come quello di Hoogie, uno dei tre protagonisti del gioco. Preparate i fazzoletti Il futuro dell’umanità è minacciato dal tentacolo Viola che, dopo aver bevuto dell’acqua radioattiva, acquista dei superpoteri: viene catturato, assieme al più mite fratello di provetta, dal proprio artefice, lo scienziato pazzo Fred Edison che per evitare la catastrofe decide di eliminare le due creature. In soccorso dell’indifeso Verdone arriva il maldestro dottor Bern Bernoulli accompagnato da una coppia di assistenti: la psicotica studentessa Lavigne e il summenzionato Hoogie, degno esponente della categoria roadie. Il tentativo di salvataggio non va a buon fine perché Viola riesce a fuggire: per fermarlo dai suoi diabolici piani servirà tornare indietro di un giorno, grazie al prototipo della macchina del tempo appena messo a punto dal buon Edison. Come facilmente prevedibile anche questa mossa non funziona a dovere: mentre Bern rimane ancorato ai giorni nostri, i due ragazzi vengono catapultati 200 anni nel passato (Hoogie) e 200 nel futuro (Lavigne). Il fil rouge che li collega passa attraverso il gabinetto della cabina del tempo. Il giocatore si troverà quindi a zompare tra un’epoca e l’altra nel tentativo di mettere a posto le cose e di salvare la razza umana. Uno degli aspetti più riusciti di Day Of The Tentacle è la spiritosissima trama, alla cui stesura ha contribuito anche Ron Gilbert, padre del motore SCUMM e di Monkey Island. I nostri eroi si troveranno spesso in situazioni paradossali così come altrettanto assurdi, ma non per questo privi di logica, sono i numerosi enigmi la cui risoluzione fa proseguire nella trama. I tre protagonisti dovranno aiutarsi a vicenda gettando oggetti apparentemente insignificanti nello sciacquone: così capiterà che la pubblicità di un’aspirapolvere finirà con l’influenzare la costituzione americana, rendendo in futuro un diritto di tutti il possesso dell’elettrodomestico, il che tornerà particolarmente utile nello scenario di Lavigne. Il livello di sfida è piuttosto interessante per chi si avvicina al titolo per la prima volta: naturalmente un po’ meno per chi ricorda a menadito ogni passaggio del gioco, considerando che, come detto, si tratta di una fedele replica dell’originale. Nonostante il peso degli anni tutto funziona ancora a meraviglia: usando la nuova interfaccia utente, cliccando sugli oggetti compare un menù radiale in cui si può scegliere solo tra le azioni effettivamente disponibili per quel tipo di oggetto (ad esempio non si può parlare con una lavatrice, azione che nella vecchia release era invece contemplata). Questa impostazione rende la navigazione al passo coi tempi e permette allo stesso tempo di utilizzare anche l’ereticissimo joypad (il titolo è infatti previsto anche per PlayStation 4 e PlayStation Vita). Old but gold Per fornire nuova linfa vitale al suo capolavoro Double Fine si è affidata a Yujin Keim che ha avuto la benedizione di Peter Chan e Larry Ahern, i due disegnatori originali: il risultato è davvero encomiabile, perché l’artista ha rispettato fedelmente i bozzetti del 1993, riproducendo in alta definizione quello che un tempo si poteva solamente immaginare. Merita ancora un plauso la possibilità di saltare, in tempo reale, da una versione all’altra mediante la pressione di un tasto, giusto per ricordarsi come si giocava una volta e a che punto sono arrivate le moderne tecnologie. Anche la colonna sonora è stata rimasterizzata e si integra perfettamente con la veste grafica proprio come lo faceva all’epoca. La possibilità di attivare i commenti dei programmatori, inoltre, è una graditissima opzione che aggiunge un tocco di rigiocabilità ad un titolo che richiederà circa una decina di ore per essere portato ai titoli di coda. Kommento Il grande Vincenzo Beretta, caporedattore della storica rivista PCZeta, sosteneva che nessun gioco può meritare il massimo alla sua uscita: è necessario che trascorrano gli anni e che il tempo ne certifichi un’eccellenza che all’atto della pubblicazione non può essere pienamente compresa. Mai come in questo caso è quindi giusto tributare con una votazione ad honorem uno dei titoli più importanti della storia dei videogame, degnamente riportato al passo con i tempi da un’ottima rivisitazione tecnica che rimane fedele alle idee dei geniali ideatori di Day of the Tentacle, esempio, per certi versi più raggiunto, di creatività, originalità, umorismo e divertimento.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960321631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1480527858}
review:
I remember playing this on my P75 back in the 90s when it came on a bucket load of 3.5" discs. Since then I've relived it via emulators so naturally when I saw the remaster, I had to grab it.

I can't say my initial impressions have been great. Sure the graphics are nicely smoothed out, but I've encountered frozen cut-scenes and buggy looping music within the first 15 minutes of game play...

Grab it while it's in the sale I guess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014564639', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1532116550}
review: Vanha LucasArtsin klassikkopeli joka näyttää nyt entistä ehommalta. Mukana myös alkuperäinen Maniac Mansion, johon muutoksia ei ole tehty, pikatallennusta lukuunottamatta. Hauska peli jos pääsee yli pelin puzzlejen logiikasta. Seikkailupelien pelaajille pakko-ostos. Mukana mahdollisuus vaihtaa grafiikan tasoa lennosta F1 näppäimellä.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968919964', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1465643655}
review:
Perfekte Neuauflage des Lucasart Klassikers! Es hat wieder so richtig Spaß gemacht die alten Rätsel noch einmal anzugehen. Der schräge Humor war ja schon damals legen.... warte es kommt gleich... DÄR!
Dieses Spiel macht wirklich alles richtig! Ich warte schon sehnsüchtig auf weitere Neuauflagen von dem Studio (Sam&Max Hit the Road!!!)
10/10 - Must have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005764031', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1469384384}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein klassisches Adventure-Spiel aus den frühen 90ern: es glänzt mit einer phantasievollen Story, einmaligen Charakteren und jede Menge Witz und Charm -- aber wer das Spiel genießen will muss sich auch auf eine gute Portion Pixel-Jagen und Adventure-Spiel-Logik einlassen.

Nichtsdestotrotz, Day of the Tentacle ein echter Klassiker aus der goldenen Zeit der Adventure Spiele, und diesen Status hat es sich redlich verdient. Mit der Maus und den klassischen Aktions-Verben und Inventar-Quadraten navigiert man drei steuerbare Charaktere durch drei unterschiedliche Epochen - die Gründerzeit der Vereinigten Staaten, die Gegenwart, und die nahe Zukunft -, um dem tyrannischen Violett-Tentakel die Weltherrschaft zu entreißen. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle, ob man gerade den Gründervätern einen Streich spielt oder eine alte Frau die Treppe herunterstößt, das Spiel wirkt immer wie aus einem Guss; selbstverständlich gibt es überall Rätsel zu lösen, aber diese werden als Teil der Welt und Geschichte präsentiert.

Meine Meinung zu Day of the Tentacle ist dabei sicher stark durch Nostalgie und Jugenderinnerungen beeinflusst, aber wer nicht Point&Click-Adventures allgemein ablehnt oder beim Spielen grundsätzlich auf Spannung und Nervenkitzel aus ist, der wird an Day of the Tentacle seine wahre Freunde haben.

Fazit: bedenkenlose Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018559357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1601439356}
review: Timeless classic.

review:
A mere four words are needed for a review of this

Early Nineties Lucasarts Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973592214', 'num_games_owned': 898, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1533655904}
review: A simple but clean graphic and ost remaster for one of the best graphic adventures of all time. Pretty and respectful at the same time without the ankwark visual design in the Monkey Island remasters.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962919667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1466845035}
review:
Gutes Remake eines zeitlosen Klassikers.
Kann ich nur Empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004615009', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1527272523}
review:
Este juego es divertidisimo. Los puzzles y las situaciones bien pensadas nunca llega a ser frustrante. Poder alternar entre el estilo clásico y el remasterizado es un gran detalle (soy muy fan del estilo retro).

Y como guinda, incluye el Maniac Mansion original. Poco más se puede pedir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039988300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1463729056}
review:
Ein geniales Spiel, das auch nach über 20 Jahren nichts von seinem Humor eingebüßt hat. In den Neunzigern heiß geliebt und jetzt noch einmal gespielt und dabei sehr oft herzlich gelacht.

Hoffentlich kommen noch mehr Remakes der Klassiker (Grim Fandango und Monkey Island 1&2 besitze ich schon).

author: {'steamid': '76561197989929624', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1517176596}
review:
Best of its genre.
The thing with nostalia is that your memories often are better than the actual experience.
Not with Day of the Tentacle. It's a great a treat as it was back in then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036948807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1480093759}
review: Que de nostalgie, ce jeu est indémodable et le lifting qu'il a reçu est juste parfait, aussi bien au niveau graphisme que gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978804316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1514419287}
review: Fantastic graphics, funny dialog, multiple narrative threads, Hoagie, historical accuracy and backwards compatible game baked in - what more could you want?!  If you like pont and click adventures, pick up this Lucasarts classic today.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960274554', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1682784516}
review: This was one of my all time favorite point and click adventure games. It's a very well done remaster and the update UI is nice. It was great to go back and play this, although it did make me want the remasted Full Throttle even more...

author: {'steamid': '76561197980184704', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1512760966}
review:
Eines der großartigsten Adventures überhaupt (solange man nicht nur auf bier-ernste Adventures steht). Abgesehen von seinem einzigartigen Humor tragen die Zeit-Rätsel zu seinem zeitlosen Charm bei (Wortspiel gewollt).
Der aufpolierte Look und das - im "modernen Modus" - überarbeitete Interface beeinträchtigen den Witz und die Atmosphäre in keiner Weise - für alle reinen Retro-Fans lässt sich das Spiel aber natürlich auch im "originalen Modus" spielen; mit pixeliger Grafik und altem Interface.
Ein sehr gelungenes Remake eines sehr gelungenen Klassikers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028825552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1517014854}
review: Join Bernard and his friends to thwart Purple Tentacle's plan to take over the world and enslave humanity.  This game definitely has the best use of tentacles since Japanese pornography.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004553684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1490120724}
review: Juego que nunca muere. Historia increible y muy divertida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077934520', 'num_games_owned': 1093, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1478179915}
review:

Este esta perfeito!
Mesma jogabilidade de antigamente com graficos e sons melhores.

Recomendo!

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197984089002', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1476571835}
review: Best Point & Click ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139810295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1690655126}
review:
Un petit bijou du début à la fin !
Le côté cartoon est une vraie réussite, les animations sont déjantées au possible et les énigmes farfelues.
Quelques passages sont assez dur (j'ai du tricher 3 fois) mais c'était mon premier point & click.

Je le recommande pour tous les fans de l'esprit cartoon qui ont envie de se triturer les méninges dans cette quète d'aller et retour dans le temps. Un jeu fun comme il en sort rarement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198056333981', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1480080382}
review:
Bei dem Spiel werden Kindheitserinnerungen wach!! 

Normalerweise gehen Remakes in die Hose.
Dieses Mal aber NICHT!

Ich kann nur empfehlen sich Day of the Tentacle Remastered zu kaufen.
Lustige Sprüche, knifflige Rästel und ein Spiel im Spiel :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198175245279', 'num_games_owned': 3776, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1558880038}
review:
Hay veces que cuando uno vuelve a jugar a uno de sus juegos de la infancia se lleva una decepción. Este no es el caso, no ha perdido nada de su encanto.

10/10, lo recomiendo tanto si no lo has jugado nunca , como si ya lo jugaste hace años.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061115992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1489176123}
review: Que decir sobre esta obra atemporal, una aventura gráfica de las que hacen época, un juego en el que tienes que darle a la mollera, la remasterización de esta joya merece mucho la pena para los que disfrutamos en su tiempo y para todos los que no han tenido ocasión de jugarlo en su momento.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998021860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1478532541}
review:
[h1]DOTT, das perfekte Remake .. [i]und Gummikotze[/i][/h1]

Wenn man im Herzen ein wahrer Gamer ist, und besonders wenn man auf Meilensteine der Geschichte der Videospiele steht, dann muss man "Day of the Tentacle" einfach gespielt haben!

Dies eigentlich schon vor 20 Jahren, und das mehrmals hintereinander. Inklusive des retro Vorgängers "Maniac Mansion", welchen man sogar komplett als Spiel-im-Spiel bei DOTT finden und zocken kann. Nun, leider hat nicht jeder das Glück in den 90' groß geworden zu sein, aber dafür gibt es jetzt diese geniale Remastered Edition. Kindheitserinnerungen pur! Und auch heute noch wird es Erstspielern, sowie Fans von Point and Click“-Adventure Games, große Freude bereiten können.

DOTT war neben Monkey Island eines meiner ersten Adventure Games und auch heute kann ich noch sagen: "Absoluter Pflichtkauf!" Besonders wenn man das geniale Rätseldesign, die herrlich abstruse Story und die abgedrehten Charaktere einmal selbst erleben möchte und auch sollte. DOTT gehört einfach in jede Spielesammlung! Und auch nach 20 Jahren muss sich immer noch jeder Bösewicht mit dem Purpur-Tentakel messen. ^^

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=643197392

author: {'steamid': '76561197990243999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1680686841}
review: Der Klassiker frisch aufgelegt !   Richtig gut ! aber für Speedruns lieber das Original nehmen ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198014997407', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1480073816}
review:
It brings back lots of memories, there were no internet, no cds. You had to buy the game IF YOU REALLY WANT to play it.
Anyways, playing once more is not fun as much as the first time years ago. But you HAVE TO listen all the commentaries from the developers. That only can be the reason why you should buy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964658598', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1627907214}
review:
Mon jeu d'aventure préféré, complètement déjanté !
Le remaster est de très bonne qualité.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994527177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1498894059}
review:
It's just great to be able to go back and relive these masterpieces but in modern HD glory.

The humour used is timeless and DOTT has a good balance of characters and story-line.

If you've never played it, do it now!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081660229', 'num_games_owned': 718, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1672246711}
review:
Absolutely fantastic piece of Art - piece of "LucasArts" :-) - which is still really funny, really cute, really amazing and in a new "remastered coat" really Really REALLY Nice!

First time I played DOTT about 20 years ago and I was totally excited by its crooked design, cool to ironic humour, fantastic speech and absolutely amazing music. After 20 years, it still has this excellent atmosphere in all its aspects.

This is THE 5 Star Game!
Definitely RECOMMEND!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028098912', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1480067063}
review: Un classico sempre bellissimo. Difficile e frustrante in molti punti, richiede pazienza e inventiva. Le avventure grafiche odierne non sono così belle!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983541394', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1613336486}
review:
Probably the greatest game of all times! I played this through at least twice back in the 90s, as it is quite perfect in all categories: Character design, voice recording, comic graphics, story and humour. The remastered version is amazing and takes the game into the future, and it doesn't even need a Chron-O-John for that! ;)
If you never had the chance to play this, do it right now! This version includes the possibility to switch between the old graphics and UI and the remastered version seamlessly while you are playing, so you can go back and forth and compare them or just enjoy the "back in the days" feeling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123726975', 'num_games_owned': 3536, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1482017153}
review:
Endlich wieder da!

Damals in jungen Jahren  noch als Escom Bundle geholt und seit her mein liebstes Spiel im Bereich Point to Click.

Es ist kein Day of Tentacle 2, aber man merkt deutlich, wo hier noch gearbeitet wurde. Viele ehemals nicht vertonte Textpassagen wurden nach-vertont und als kleiner Bonus wird sogar noch der Wechsel von HD in die Retro Grafik angeboten, obgleich diese mir noch zu optimiert vorkommt. Sogar die alte Retro Steuerung ist in dieser Ansicht verfügbar.
Die Stimmen selbst sind nah am Original, aber doch merklich anders -  jedoch nicht schlechter... oder lag es doch nur an den damals schlechteren Boxen?? 

Alles im allen einfach wieder schön sich in das Chaos zu stürzen. Wer es noch nicht kennen sollte, es ist eindeutig eine Kaufempfehlung.

Performance ist technisch sauber umgesetzt. Habe es auf einem alten Laptop mit einem AMD E 250 und Linux spielen können :)

Ich bin noch nicht bis zum Automaten im Spiel, aber ich bin gespannt auf die Umsetzung von Maniac Mansion. Bisher eine gelungene, solide Überarbeitung. Einzig zu kritisieren ist die Voreinstellung der Entwicklerdokumentation, die im ersten Moment das Intro ruiniert, wenn man sehnsüchtig darauf wartet ins Spiel einzutauchen. Ein kleines Symbol im Spiel zum de- und aktivieren wäre mir lieber gewesen als dafür immer ins Menü zu müssen.


Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass es vielleicht doch irgendwann den 2ten Teil geben wird....

author: {'steamid': '76561197993149939', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1481840000}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034785025', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1480044602}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de la historia. Estandarte de una época en donde lo imporante era clickear cada rincón en búsqueda de aquel objeto deseado. 
Personajes facinantes, una historia que se desarrolla en tres períodos de tiempo, y por supuesto, tentáculos, muchos tentáculos !!!
Siendo una copia fiel del original, la versión remasterizada permite jugar con las gráficas nuevas, así como con las pixeladas, permitiéndote volver en el tiempo a voluntad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038754455', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1479916768}
review:
¿Qué hace que un juego sea rejugable?
La mayoría de las veces lo importante es que tengas diferentes opciones dentro del juego, que te lleven por diferentes caminos... en algunos casos con diferente final. Están también aquellos donde la adicción que produce la jugabilidad hace que lo juegues una y otra vez. No es el caso de "Day of the tentacle". Entonces... qué es lo que lo hace rejugable? Muy simple, en mi caso particular es la nostalgia, que va más alla del juego, es eso que viene por añadidura y qué esta fuera de lo que pensaron los desarrolladores: El recuerdo de lo que te generó cuando lo jugaste por primera vez.
 Y es que Day of the tentacle tiene eso y mucho más. Es uno de los mejores juego que he jugado, la historia es muy divertida y es un clásico de los juegos point & click, incluso en los 90, donde era la época dorada de este tipo de juegos.

 Así que si sos un veterano como yo, no podes dejar de comprártelo y jugarlo nuevamente, y si nunca lo jugaste no podes perdértelo.
 Incluso para los más nostálgicos, dentro del juego podés jugar al Maniac Mansion original (no al Maniac Mansion 2 que es este, sino al primer juego de la saga)

author: {'steamid': '76561198027439739', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1478040055}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979215168', 'num_games_owned': 8053, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1477339630}
review:
What is "Day of the Tentacle Remastered"?

It is the classical adventure "Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle" in a remastered version with higher quality and a load of Steam achievements, but also a reworked GUI.

As the game is a classical adventure, it is controlled almost entirely with the mouse. As I knew the game already and had finished it in 2011 for the first time over the course of a few days, I just rushed through the Steam version to get the achievements, so my time should not be an indicator for the time with "normal" play.

The game originally was conceived by Tim Schafer for LucasArts, which sadly was eventually bought by Disney and closed only recently. In the late 1980s and early 1990s, LucasArts was THE high quality studio for adventure games, although some competitors such as Westwood (Legend of Kyrandia) managed to make similarly great adventures in this style.

There is a comic style to the entire game, and it is comedic in nature with an underlying plot of time travel. Purple Tentacle is a purple tentacle (thanks, Captain Obvious!) who drinks industrial waste water and then aspires to conquer the world. The three anti-heroes to stop him are teenagers: A crazy girl, a nerd and their overweight friend.

The game includes its predecessor, Maniac Mansion, entirely to be accessed via an ingame computer. Following however the story of this game, Purple Tentacle becomes the leader of the world in a tentacle ridden future where humans are held as pets. With a time machine, two anti-heroes land in different stages of history, while the other one stays in the present. Arriving near a few founding fathers of the United States of America, ready to sign the Declaration of Independence, the past has to be altered to provide means in the future to fight against the tentacle oppression. Thanks to the flush technology of the time machine, almost all items can simply be sent to each time period, so the three characters can use them as they please.

As the plot advances, it becomes clear that this lovable game still is one of the best adventures of all time, deserving very well its plalce in - of course! - history.

The downside is that the voice actors don't sound very professional at too many times. In fact, if anything about this game is to be criticized, it is this point. Maybe a new set of voice actors would have improved the game, with options to switch between the voice sets, just as there are options to switch between the new and old graphics.

Recommended: For anyone who enjoys adventure games. In fact, everyone else also should try it on a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982183684', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1495985555}
review:
DOTT pour les intimes, ou tout simplement l'un des meilleurs jeux d'aventure point'n click de tous les temps. Le jeu introduisait à l'époque des graphismes à tomber, de nouvelles mécaniques de gameplay autour des trois personnages à travers le temps, ainsi qu'une ambiance totalement déjantée et bourrée de références/caricatures. C'est l'un des jeux auxquels j'ai le plus joué étant jeune, comme tous les LucasArts sur lesquels j'ai passé des moments extraordinaires, et ça a été un vrai plaisir d'y rejouer à nouveau en version modernisé.

Alors il faut quand même être honnête, cette version Remastered, qui fera découvrir un classique absolu à un nouveau public, aurait pu bénéficier d'un peu plus d'efforts de la part de Double Fine. Même si la base technique était excellente à l'époque, quand on a fait, refait et rerefait la version d'origine (merci ScummVM), on a pas mal l'impression de se retrouver devant un filtre HD du logiciel sus-mentionné, aussi bien fichu soit-il. C'est principalement ce qui a fait que je ne me suis pas jeté dessus dès sa sortie, ayant été un peu refroidi par les trailers. Ah, et on a droit à quelques bugs aussi qui n'étaient pas du tout dans le jeu d'origine, notamment sur les musiques qui par endroit se perdent ou répètent en boucle quelques secondes.

Mais au final, ce serait un crime de passer à côté, pour tout fan de point'n click qui n'y aurait pas encore joué.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024973689', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1480024903}

author: {'steamid': '76561197995636055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1458939105}
review:
Es ist und bleibt ein zeitloser Klassiker....damit wäre eigtl schon alles gesagt.
Nur ein paar Bemerkungen:
-tolle HD Grafik (auf Knopfdruck lässt sich in die Ur-Grafik umschalten)
-der Humor bleibt selbst nach dem x-ten mal durchspielen witzig
-die Rätsel sind gut durchdacht und immer nachvollziehbar (Storybedingt muss man wegen den unterschiedlichen Zeitpochen etwas um die Ecke denken)
-gute Sprachausgabe
-nette Extras
und als letzter Punkt: der Vorgänger "Maniac Mansion" lässt sich auch noch spielen.

Für jeden Point & Click Adventure Fan ein absolutes Must Have und eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung, wenn
auch nicht zum Vollpreis.Aber im Sale auf jeden Fall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086689873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1511739221}
review:
Ce jeu est intemporel, et le remaster bonifie encore plus l'expérience. Graphiquement parlant, les décors style cartoons font mouches. Ceux qui l'ont vu tourner chez moi ont apprécié ce qu'ils ont vu.
Le jeu est juste trop hilarant et débile, avec 3 personnages controllables totalement loufoques dont on apprécie la compagnie.
Si je devais citer un défaut, je dirais la durée de vie (8hrs la 1ère partie, 2hrs pour la deuxième partie)
On a l'un des meilleurs point-and-click de façon certaine, probablement le meilleur mais c'est mon opinion.
Bon courage et bon jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068700153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1622650972}
review:
The game is actually still as great as I remembered it from way back when I first laid my eyes on the Edisons. I still haven’t compared the remastered version with the original version that I kept over all these years—I’d have to take the old 80468 DX2 66 down from the attic and install it there.

However, this edition really transmits all the fun I had back when I was a teenager with his first computer, which is meant as a very big appraisal for the job Doublefine did here. Both thumbs up! The Far Cry 3, Fallout IV, and GTA V kids of today don’t know what they’ve missed—this game should be made mandatory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061628494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1480560893}
review:
Like many other reviewers, I'd like to say that I remember Day of the Tentacle (DOTT) from my childhood. Unfortunately (fortunately?), I'm too old to say that without lying. However, I can say that I remember the game from my (earlier) adulthood, which means I'm not too old to recall playing it.

It was nice to hear that they were doing a re-master of this game since I had been thinking of trying to get my CD copies to work on a modern computer. This made that task a lot easier. Now I could finally introduce my daughter to this fun and funny game. Unfortunately, after a short period of time she declared that the game was boring and had bad graphics. Then she went back to playing Undertale.

If you enjoy adventure games with a sense of humour and you're not a 13 year old girl prone to ironic statements regarding graphic quality, I definitely recommend Day of the Tentacle. Plus you're actually getting two games in one since, like the original, it also includes Maniac Mansion, the game that came before DOTT. You just have to find it...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970371124', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1662255837}
review: This game is an utter classic. I play the original at least once a year on average. Everything is on point. This remaster does a fantastic job of updating the game while keeping everything that made the original amazing. You can also still play Maniac Mansion inside the game, just like the original, if you know where to look! Perhaps Ed knows?

author: {'steamid': '76561198042160756', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1687757544}
review:
Sigue siendo Day of the Tentacle, una de las aventuras gráficas más divertidas que, al igual que la mayoría de LucasArts, tiene la virtud de que aunque no consigas avanzar, los chascarrillos que mete en sus diálogo hace que no se haga frustrante dar vueltas para seguir buscando la clave para continuar.

Como versión remasterizada deja un poco que desear el hecho de que los gráficos mejorados sean simplemente pasar los originales por un "filtro de emulador" y que todo parezcan manchurrones de color, pero lo compensa el hecho de poder cambiar a los gráficos originales en cualquier momento y la pista de comentarios de los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011337140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1488710833}
review:
It's a great product of a past, sadly, era during which point and click adventure games ruled supreme.
And while the game isn't the best of the best, it's definitely up there with all the other great games of its time.
Plus, it aged extremely well and still holds up to scrutiny.
Though, while the graphics in this updated version are nice looking, they weren't what I'd call mind blowing.
That is not an issue however, as this is still one of those rare must-play games for everyone.
If you're a fan of the genre itself, do yourself a solid and pick this one up even if you weren't part of the pc gaming scene during the glorious golden age of adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025702992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1480011196}
review: Un buena remasterización, aunque no tanto como la del Monkey Island. Espero que el éxito de estas obras abran camino a Maniac Mansion (el juego que dio origen a este), Loom y The Dig, mis favoritos que no han sido remasterizados.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989405827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1629116733}
review:
A milestone in adventure history. The successor to Maniac Mansion, which you can play as a game in this game, is a  masterpiece, with a great sense of humor.
The remastered version brings you this classic in a new modern look. Solve puzzles, think out of the box, enjoy a great vocal acting (both englisch [b]and[/b] german).

I'm a fan of both Maniac Mansion and Day of the Tentacle ever since, and being able to enjoy this game again brings back great memories. But this game is not only for those who liked to play it back in the times, it's still one of the best adventure games available. And it runs great on Linux/SteamOS! You probably know whom you have to thank for this ;)

review: One of the best point and click adventure games ever made remastered to the HD-era. If you never experienced this back in the days, you should buy this one right now and get ready to laugh at the jokes about (but not limited to) hamster sweatshirt, talking horse, human show and porting items through time using toilet time machines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005103482', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1542973592}
review:
Auch nach Jahren macht DotT einfach Spaß, und der Humor hat nichts an Witzigkeit verloren. Jedenfalls bei mir nicht. 

Grafisch sieht jetzt auch alles wieder genauso toll aus wie in meiner Erinnerung (in der 640x480 gleichbedeutend mit Ultra-HD war :) Nein, ernshaft - hier wurde ganze Arbeit geleistet. 

Gleiches gilt für den Sound, der sowohl in Deutsch als auch in Englisch daherkommt. Die Entwicklerkommentare (nur englisch) sind ein nettes Bonus-Gimmick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082191418', 'num_games_owned': 1786, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1655961286}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960436778', 'num_games_owned': 1411, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1661000979}
review:
Ah, the feelings!

This is an example of how great a game can be, no matter how much technology is available at the time. Fun, smart, crazy, and fully enjoyable, no matter when you're playing it.

Worth every minute and cent.

And remember, as Purple Tentacle says, 'Humans are so... stupid!'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029139485', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1494774447}
review:
Schon in den 90'ern geliebt und X mal durch gezockt. Meine geringe Spielzeit liegt auch nur daran, das ich immernoch jeden Schritt auswendig kenne ^^. Bin für die Errungenschaften flink ein zweites mal durch gerast und werde es sicher auch irgendwann einfach so nochmal durch zocken. Und ich hab die alte original Version immer auf m Smartphone installiert XD . 

Also kurz um: grandioser Titel mit einer genialen lekka Priese Humor ! 

Pur empfehlenswert !

author: {'steamid': '76561198014825237', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1479988140}

Bitte bringt auch noch die Indi Teile als Remastered

author: {'steamid': '76561197975942793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1467286021}
review:
This game is pure Awesomnes. 
I have played it many years ago and to me, it was one of the best (if not the best) point and click adventure. 
Sadly, those old versions wont play propperly on a modern PC. 

But then they made this Remastered. And what they made. Its nerly perfect. They put everything good of the original and remade it with new graphics. Thats all we wanted, that all they needed to do. 

If you love Point and Click Adventures, BUY IT. 
If you love DOTT, BUY IT! 
If you havent played stuff like this, screw you! BUY IT and start with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047321867', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1651442454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006336716', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1478634490}
review:
If you've never heard of this game give it a go - the original is one of the most often cited examples of a classic mid 90s adventure game...

If you have played the original give it a go too - the improvements for the remaster are really impressive and go beyond simple resolution scaling or applying a filter (like ScummVM) - they've even improved some of the game mechanics to make playing through a little less tedious!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990235484', 'num_games_owned': 1044, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1621020500}
review:
I remember first getting this game for Christmas as part of the original "Lucasarts Archive" collection, which had Sam and Max Hit the Road, Fate of Atlantis, and a bunch of demos.  At the time (I was ten, maybe eleven?) Sam and Max was by far my favorite, but over time that has become...Day of the Tentacle.  Let's be honest, if you're even looking at this you've probably already played the game in the past, so I'll touch on just a few key points.

1) The remastered graphics is probably the best balance between keeping the old style while cleaning things up for the "modern player."  Things don't change radically - really, at all - between the original and new style, which is more than Secret of Monkey Island can say.  Having played this almost annually for twenty years, I think I now prefer the updated graphics.

2) The developer's commentary is great.  I mostly play this on muscle memory (without being cognizant of it in the game), so the commentary on its own would freshen things up.  However, the fact that most of the original team (key players at least) were available makes this worth listening to on its own.  Say what you will about Tim Schaffer, he knows how to keep discussions interesting AND educational.

3)  The new controls are good, definitely streamlined, but I think this is one case where I prefer the fake "freedom" of the original SCUMM verbs.  Still, if you don't care about such things the new controls are very intuitive.

4)  You can no longer access Laverne from the start.  The commentary explains why, and although it's not how it was designed in the original I actually think it's a good call.  You couldn't do anything anyway...but at this point it's probably only going to be appreciated by new players.

IF you've played the original and still own it, this is definitely a must buy.  For those who - shocking - have not played the original, this is definitely the version to get.  Without a doubt my vote for standing the "test of time."

author: {'steamid': '76561197961384956', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1612640918}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991592861', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1515763280}
review:
PROS:
A technically competent remaster
Possibly the best old-school quest game ever released
Just like in the original, you get Maniac Mansion too

CONS:
On the graphical side, it barely looks better than the original game running on ScummVM
The references in the jokes are quite dated by now

10/10 would freeze a hamster for a hundred years before putting it into a microwave

author: {'steamid': '76561197999334292', 'num_games_owned': 3580, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1468739973}
review:
Not much can be said about this game that hasn't been said hundreds of times before.
It's a remaster of a classic 90's 'Point n Click' adventure game, written by some of the funniest people in the business.

The good:
+ Remastered graphics
+ Updated interface
+ Switch between the original and updated graphics at any time
+ High quality audio
+ It's a very funny game
+ You'll get stuck, but the puzzles aren't so hard you won't figure it out eventually.
+ Achievements

The bad:
+ The updated interface takes a bit of getting used too.
+ It's not as challenging as I remember

The ugly:
+ Nothing. The game is brilliant and 100% recommended if you like Point n Click adventure games. If you don't, and you're curious, this is definitely the one to start with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052646641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1605480592}
review: The original version of this game is one of the first PC games I ever played (It was an A: drive diskette back then) and I absolutely adored it. Sadly, I lost my manuel, and no longer have a diskette drive (Yes diskette, floppies were larger, and floppy and B: drive. Trust me, I was there. I was 4 or 5, but I was there.) So I thought I'd lost this game forever, when lo and behold they remastered it! The best part is, they remade it the way my imagination saw it the first time, so it  holds up perfect to my nostalgic memories!!! I still love this ridiculously funny crazy game so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970917047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1548777848}
review:
Back in the day, during the golden age of point and click, I had two lucas arts games that I loved, the first was sam & max hit the road, and the second was Day of the Tentacle.  Both games have completly bonkers puzzles that need solving, which is something that is seriously lacking in todays point and click games (with the exception of Deponia) that give it that extra challenge and Laugh out Loud moments.

the remaster has smoother edges on its textures, but I actually prefer some of the classic audio more than the remaster audio.  and there's plenty of acheviments to keep you playing, and many of the achievments are not story related and easy to miss (something for your next playthrough me thinks)

it's also worth mentioning that this game has its prequel game 'Manic Manision' as a playable mini game within the game (just like the original DOTT did)

author: {'steamid': '76561198117815599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1479795324}
review: One of my favorite games from childhood. The graphical update is nice. The commentary and concept art are interesting for fans. The puzzles and humor still hold up well! I'm proud that I remembered the puzzles well enough to get through it without looking up solutions. It's really a great game. Recommended for first-timers and those looking for a nostalgia trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970744853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1479846325}
review: I never played this game originally but playing it for the first time 23 years after it originally came out and it doesn't feel dated. The remastered art, sound, and UI does help it feel modern, but I think the original version is perfectly playable. The remade UI also accommodates controller usage while still working well with the mouse. I was also surprised by the humor in this game, which despite its age, is very good and timeless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974076417', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1706987526}
review:
In 1994 when I was seven years old I went over to the house of a girl I was desperately in love with. On her family computer was a game. I didn't recognize it, but I love the art style. She moved the mouse and clicked on, "Look at" in the bottom menu, then clicked on a door. The character walked over to the door and said, "Bitchin'." We laughed. 

I moved away a few months later and thought about her and that game for years. When I went to computer stores I would search through the game ailse for a game that looked like what she was playing. A few years later I finally found the game in a Lucas Arts adventure pack. It was called, "Day of the Tentacle." I bought it, played it, loved it, and thought of the girl I once loved. 

Today point and click adventure games are still my favorite genre and Day of the Tentacle is the best of them all.

review: Jogo clássico, simplesmente genial. Muitos puzzles de quebrar a cabeça, e um humor genial. Vale muito a pena jogá-lo, mesmo sendo um point´n click antigo, eu volta e meia estou reinstalando ele para jogar de novo. Humor e diversão garantidos. Compre e seja feliz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997833021', 'num_games_owned': 2810, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1479934485}
review:
Si hablamos de aventuras clásicas, sin duda una de ellas es Day of the Tentacle. Esta versión remasterizada nos vuelve a traer, para deleite de nuestros ojos, al trio de héroes en su afán por derrotar al villano tentáculo morado. Hay que jugarlo para apreciarlo en toda su dimensión.

La remasterización creo que es un gran acierto. Mantiene el estilo de dibujo original, tan sólo le han dado un lavado de cara. Y no añadiendo polígonos o simple potencia gráfica, al ser una aventura antigua con imágenes artísticas 2D han rehecho de cero todas las imágenes. El resultado es muy bueno, aunque también es verdad que la aventura original ocupaba unos pocos disquetes de 1.44 MB y ¡¡¡ahora son casi 3.00 GB!!!  :D
(1.00 GB = 1024 MB)

Una nota importante es que, al igual que en la versión original, dentro del juego hay otro juego completo: ¡Maniac Mansion! Este Day of the Tentacle es como la segunda parte. Así que para quienes no probaron la primera bien puedes hacerlo como parte de esta aventura.

Disfrutad de esta joya atemporal.

Nota: Imprescindible  9/10

review: I used to love this game when I was a child and when I heard that they were going to remaster it I wasn't exactly sure what to expect. A lot of times I'm not too fond of remastered versions of old games that I used to enjoy playing a lot but in this case they did quite a decent job. I enjoyed playing the game and what I enjoyed even more is the small easter egg they put in there. Now I'm just waiting for a remastered version of the first Maniac Mansion to complete the collection.

review:
It's Day of the Tentacle! The standard by which all point and clicks have been measured for a long time.

It's much harder than I remember it to be. Well, maybe I just got soft from all the modern games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102432184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1658596484}
review:
Ich hatte schon das Original vor Jahren ausgiebig gespiellt.
Das Spiel selbst is zeitlos, nur die Grafik war in Jahre gekommen.

Nun kommt es wieder mit verbesserter Grafik. 

Damit klare Empfehlung für neue und auch für alte Spieler

author: {'steamid': '76561198053059878', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1458922783}
review: Dott ist ein kultiges cleveres Spiel das nach über 20 Jahren nichts von seinem Charme verloren hat. Es ist teilweise richtig bockschwer die Zusammenhänge zwischen den Zeitebenen zu erkennen um in der Story voranzukommen, aber Spaß macht es allemal. Die Remastered Version sieht großartig aus und man kann mit einem Klick zwischen alter Pixel- und neuer Grafik wechseln. Für mich ist es das Beste Adventure aller Zeiten 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045272495', 'num_games_owned': 1879, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1475924578}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016062852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1543016056}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040720768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1482032260}
review:
Uno de mis juegos favoritos. Por lejos uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado. Los años simplemente no pasan para el.
Day of Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gráficas, llena de humor tonto (ese del bueno), puzzles (muy variados), buenos personajes y un diseño artistico muy agradable.
Para los que gustan de los juegos de aventuras y no lo han jugado, esta es una obra de arte a la que jugar por lo menos una vez antes de morir. 
Para los que ya la han jugado, esta versión te permite jugar la versión original en pantalla completa en los SO modernos.
Son unas 4 horitas de juego para aquellos que ya pasamos este título antaño y muchas más horas de diversión para los que nunca la han jugado.
Esta versión para Steam viene con logros que te haran descubrir cosas ocultas que quizás cuando jugaras la versión original no notaras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122874857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1479936862}
review: Puesta al día de la mejor aventura gráfica de la historia. Así, sin más. ¿Por qué? Porque estando a la altura de otras como Monkey Island 1 y 2, Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Grim Fangando o The Longest Journey, esta tiene algo que las demás no tienen: puzles transtemporales. Y eso es iniagulable. Y debería ganar el premio Steam al juego con mejor sentido del humor. Jugadlo y juzgad por vosotros mismos. Eso sí, de fácil no tiene nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013169719', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1545174505}
review: Double Fine did a surprisingly good job transferring this LucasArts classic to high definition. If you have never played DOTT before, it's a best way to do it today. It's one of the funniest point-and-click adventure titles which has successfully stood the test of time. You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009399963', 'num_games_owned': 2231, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1669218539}
review:
One of the best point & click adventure games, now in both the original form and a new remastered look with sharp HD visuals, remastered audio, music and sound effects and much more! In this superb version you can experience the game in a new perspective with the developers commentary (including Tim Schafer, Dave Grossman, Larry Ahern, Peter Chan, Peter McConnell and Clint Bajakian), there are also concept arts, achievements, full controller support (although a mouse is the way!) and steam trading cards.

Everything looks great and it's really refreshing playing it again with the new graphics and all the additions, the game is still a blast to play, I love the story, the amazing art, all the funny scenes and great characters, it's really a recommended game for everyone (unless you really don't like to read much, then point & click games are probably not your cup of tea)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048937538', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1513105935}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111372574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1480251630}
