author: {'steamid': '76561198018700924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1549806798}
review:
Mon tout premier jeu terminé à 100% sur steam ! Absolument génial, on retrouve le jeu d'origine remis au goût du jour. En plus de ca on peut alterné à n'importe quel moment entre le remaster et l'ancien. A noter que le jeu contient toujours Maniac mansion (non remasterisé). L'un des meilleurs point'n'click, on gère trois personnage en même et c'est assez bien foutu pour ne pas être trop dur sans être complètement facile. Vraiment a testé et à terminer pour son humour et son style graphique.
Nomination pour les steam awards :)

review: Para quem jogou na década de 90, conhece bem esse jogo e o quanto ele é bom. Comprei essa versão e não me arrependi. Levei horas e horas para relembrar como resolver todos os puzzles do jogo. Para quem não tem domínio no inglês ou não compreende nem a legenda, vai ter muita dificuldade por não ter legenda em português. Tirando isso, ele é muito bom e divertido!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013282449', 'num_games_owned': 1633, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1479932265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039382961', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1475850956}
review: Day of the Tentacle Remastered does a fantastic job of updating a true classic of point-and-click adventures. It manages to retain everything that was funny about the original game, and possibly (possibly...) even improve on it. The hand-drawn-style graphics are beautiful, the redone music is suitably unobtrusive, and you can always go back to Classic mode if you prefer. My only fault, and I'm splitting hairs here, is that the voice acting in the newly dubbed dialogue is a little lacklustre at times (though mostly it's still pretty good. 10/10, ten out of tentacle...

author: {'steamid': '76561197960596983', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1527278955}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048434162', 'num_games_owned': 1122, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1478428669}
review:
루카스 아츠에서 발매했던 작품의 리메이크 버전

원숭이 섬의 비밀이나 인디아나존스 시리즈와 같은

포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤처

내용은 예전 작품과 동일하고, 그래픽만 다듬어졌다

오리지날은 중학생때 발매가 되었는데 재미 있어서

여러번 엔딩을 봤더니 게임 진행을 다 외워버렸었다

진짜 간만에 플레이 하는데도 그때 기억이 생생해서

막히는 곳 없이 한번에 착착 클리어되었다

이래서 게임도 좋지만 뇌가 싱싱할 때 공부를 해야됨

review:
Essa foi uma ótima remasterização de um grande clássico point n click dos anos 90. 

História simples, divertida e com personagens muito engraçados. 

Para quem não conhece o jogo essa é uma grande oportunidade. Para quem já conhece e quer reviver a experiência do jeito que era antes, tem a possibilidade de trocar os gráficos originais/remasterizados em tempo real.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990127367', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1593710919}
review:
A faithful recreation of the original classic game. If you're a Lucas Arts/DOTT/point-n-click fan, this is for you - improved audio quality, reworked score and better interfacing bring the game neatly to the 21st century without sacrificing any of the original game's feel and genius.

The high-definition graphics mode will be hit or miss depending on who's asked: Others will definitely prefer the original VGA graphics over the squeaky-clean remastered backgrounds, and I personally felt the character sprites conversion was sloppy and rushed and didn't do the originals justice. It didn't affect the experience otherwise and it was a good call from Double Fine to include the choice - I'm sure there's plenty of people out there who will think the new sprites fit the wonky overall art style of the game. Still more than happy to give this a big fat thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993292474', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1479611492}
review:
:-/

I'm in the minority, it seems, but this game is ... terrible.  It's a classic case of "figure out what the designer wants you to do" -- down to the fiddly details of exactly what order you click on the relevant objects.

(puzzle spoiler in next paragraph)

For example, at one point I needed to wake someone up by giving them coffee.  I had coffee, but they were asleep, so I needed to use a funnel to make sure I didn't spill it.  (Already absurd.)  So I "use" the coffee "with" the funnel and I'm told "I can't do that, I might spill it."  ... Okay, I guess I'm not doing this right?  Nope!  Needed to use the funnel on the guy first, then use the coffee on the funnel.

(end spoiler)

If you're yearning for a classic, give this a go, I guess.  Otherwise skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160427703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1479406656}
review:
Parto col dire che non avevo mai giocato il gioco originale e come rimasterizzazione ci sta tanto, premendo il tast f1 si può switchare alla modalita "retrò" e dato che ho completato il gioco in modalità rimasterizzata l'ho rigiocato in modalità retrò.
Qui siamo all'apoteosi delle avventure grafiche, gli enigmi mettono seriamente alla prova la proria intelligenza e la propria fantasia .Day of the tentacle è il seguito di un'altra avventura grafica storica "Maniac Mansion" che sarà possibile giocare interamente come ester egg nel pc di pazzo ed edison , non vi preoccupate i richiami a Maniac Mansion sono veramente pochi e poco significativi
PRO:
-Rimasterizzazione fatta come si deve al contrario di altre ....
-Enigmi molto divertinte 
-Comicità e carisma dei personaggi 
-Achievement molto belli da scoprire e divertenti da fare
-Possibilità di giocare Maniac Mansion
CONTRO:
-Di negativo non c'è quasi nulla tranne un paio di volte che si è leggermente buggata la grafica
-Avrei gradito un sistema di suggerimenti per i neofiti, anche senza ci si arriva alle soluzioni ma posso immaginare che qualcuno si precluda dal giocare questo capolavoro per la complessità degli enigmi

VOTO: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071076154', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1479563741}
review: I was two years old when this classic point 'n' click adventure released and after more than 20 years I got the chance to enjoy the adventure of Bernard, Laverne, and Hoagie. It's no wonder that so many people have fond memories of this game,  in gameplay and humour Day of the Tentacle hasn't aged a day. It's quite an experience to control three protagonists through three different timelines including interconnected puzzles. I felt great triumph every time I reached the solution to a complex task, not to mention the joy thanks to the great characters and writing. I recommend this game without hesitation to anyone who is interested in good old adventure games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1481336019}
review:
10 / 10 - A perfect remaster of the perfect point and click adventure.

Comes with Developers commentary - a real time toggle choice between the original version and remastered - and the crem de la creme - It includes the authentic CD version of Maniac Mansion as an ingame extra, fully playable with its own save slots .

In my view this is the very best of Lucas Arts, and its a cleverer , more streamlined experience than the revered Monkey Island.

The mechanics are great, all the puzzles are fair and the jokes and dialogue are just as strong as they were in the 90's - very little is dated.

Well worth the asking price, I feel a little guilty I got as part of a bundle, I hope Double Fine are getting the revenue they deserver for this!!!

I'll keep wishing for more remasters of all the SCUMM games - Especially that bike one I , ah "Full Throttle" - that'd be great!.

Oh and by the way America - Jefferson brings up a great argument for the turkey instead of the Eagle as the US national symbol! And it's spot on!

Ok. time to mosey on to Grim Fandango remastered!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1589817818}
review:
There are hundreds of hilarious gags and memorable scenes in this game that still stick in my mind even 20+ years after finishing it for the last time. That's how you differentiate a good ol' game from an absolute, must-have classic. Its influence over the point & click adventure genre was priceless, too.
Plus, time travel-based logic puzzles. 'Nuff said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060867382', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1479155267}
review:
For those of us who may never have experienced the original glory, this is a great way to get a taste of that goofyness of that game. And you can even find the prequel in game! Game within a game. Awe yeah. 

I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065951775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1591916810}
review:
Man, the nostalgia hit so hard when playing this. The updated graphics were a really nice touch. They were drawn directly over the old graphis so it's pretty much the exact same, only nicer looking and in widescreen. You can also switch betwen the original and new graphics at any time by presing F1. Plus I like haveing the action wheel as opposed to the action bar in the original. 
Seriously, if you like point-and-click adventure games and you've never played Day of the Tentacle before, I suggest you treat yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1479044293}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

La version remasterisée est agréable : musique, graphisme, et surtout, plus besoin d'utiliser les actions en allant les chercher en bas de l'écran - elles sont accessibles directement sur chaque objet/personnage avec lequel on peut interagir.

Pour les nostalgiques, ça reste DoTT. Donc excellent, génial, et autres superlatifs.

Pour les autres, ceux qui n'y ont pas joué quand il est sorti... c'est plus difficile de le conseiller. Alors oui, il y a de l'humour un peu partout, des jeux de mots, ... mais honnêtement les 3/4 des puzzles sont insolubles de façon "logique". Après, si vous aimez tout essayer, tout combiner avec tout... alors allez-y. Ou alors, vous allez sortir le walkthrough bien trop souvent. SInon, il y a de bien meilleurs Point & Click qui sont sortis depuis !

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Ca reste un point&click linéaire - on peut jouer les personnages dans n'importe quel ordre, mais le résultat est toujours identique.

Les achievements qui obligent à refaire le jeu en entier si vous avez oublié un truc : vraiment, c'est complètement stupide, il faudrait arrêter avec ce genre là...

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Non conseillé, sauf si vous y avez joué à l'époque et avez apprécié, dans ce cas foncez :).

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai rencontré aucun problème.

OS: Linux Mint 18 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 3570K OC@4.5Ghz, Nvidia 670GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125145161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1527275306}
review:
Schon als Kind war ich ein großer Fan dieses Spiels! Zig Male habe ich mir den PC meines Vaters geklaut und meine Freude mit dem Point-and-Click-Adventure gehabt!
Umso mehr habe ich mich gefreut, als von einer Remastered Edition des Spiels die Rede war! So lässt sich das Spiel deutlich einfacher und bequemer auf neueren Rechnern spielen.

Der Hilferuf eines guten Freundes lässt den nerdigen Bernard, die Medizinstudentin Laverne und den 
Heavy-Metal-Freak Hoagie sofort zur Hilfe eilen. Wie sich herausstellt, ist einer der beiden von dem verrückten Wissenschaftler Dr. Fred Edison erschaffenen Tentakel böse geworden und versucht nun die Welt zu erobern und die Menschheit zu versklaven.
Die einzige Möglichkeit den bösen Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten ist die Maschine abzuschalten, durch deren Abwasser der Tentakel böse geworden ist.
Doch leider geht die Zeitreisemission ein wenig schief: Hoagie landet mal eben 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, während Laverne 200 Jahre in die Zukunft befördert wird. Nur Bernard kommt wieder genau dort hinaus, wo er gestartet ist.
Daraufhin entbrennt eine Schnitzeljagt in drei verschiedenen Zeiten, um die Menschheit vor dem Untergang zu bewahren und um Bernards Freunde wieder zurück in ihre eigene Zeit zu holen.

Day of the Tentacle ist einfach ein Klassiker, den man gespielt haben muss. Der Humor ist genial und die Rätsel, die sogar die Zeitepochen überschreiten, sind einfallsreich und gut gemacht!
Auch die Remastered Edition kann sich sehen lassen (selbst nach kurzer Zeit schon! :D)! Auch, wenn die Bedienung des Spiels ein wenig anders ist, als im Original, fühlt es sich immer noch genauso wie der Klassiker an! Und das in seeehr schickem HD. :D
Ich finde, das Spiel ist ein absolutes Muss für jeden, der Computerspiele mag!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033995360', 'num_games_owned': 2161, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1478591260}
review:
Comme trop de jeux de son temps, et encore plus lorsqu'ils étaient signés du sceau LucasArts, Day of the Tentacle est un [i]point & click[/i] aux énigmes parfaitement farfelues - et ce n'est pas un compliment. Même si la touche shift, utilisée comme la barre espace d'un Daedalic, nous simplifiera le travail en faisant briller certains éléments du décor avec lesquels interagir, on passera le gros du gameplay à essayer aléatoirement un objet sur un autre, à matraquer sa souris d'encore plus de clics que si l'on jouait à un [i]hack & slash[/i]. Issu d'une époque où on confondait la difficulté et l'absurdité, où l'on était heureux de gaspiller des heures sur une énigme dépourvue de logique parce qu'elle allait nous faire durer plus longtemps le seul jeu que maman nous achèterait pour ce trimestre, Day of the Tentacle est une aventure que beaucoup feront semblant d'adorer, puis ils se reporteront sur Grim Fandango qui est encore plus [i]hype[/i]. Oui, celui qui s'est longtemps fait qualifier de "meilleur jeu du monde" n'est qu'une imposture. Sans être le pire rejeton du catalogue Californien en la matière, il abuse des solutions fantasques pour des problèmes simples. Pas le graal qu'il promet être aux habitués du jeu d'énigmes, certainement pas non plus la meilleure des occasions de s'initier au genre, il est [i]juste[/i] un très bon jeu d'aventure de la famille LucasArts, qui en a toutes les qualités et tous les défauts. Comme une belle bouteille de Bordeaux, il ne dévoilera son arôme qu'aux initiés et aux plus patients. Les autres le traverseront en [i]let's play[/i] ou le liront en [i]walkthrough[/i].

Puisqu'il n'est que rarement logique (mais ça lui arrive), Day of the Tentacle n'est pas plus une promenade de santé qu'un Fate of Atlantis. Il l'est même moins. Celui-là a en effet la particularité d'être un sacré foutoir avec une progression non linéaire qui peut vite perdre le pauvre gus qui aurait le malheur de croire en sa bonne étoile. Les trois personnages jouables, dispersés aux trois époques d'un même lieu, s'échangent des objets et observent les effets de leurs actions d'un siècle à l'autre. On jongle entre les enfants pour résoudre les énigmes dans l'ordre de notre choix, quitte à tout faire de travers ou abandonner des pistes à mi-chemin. Quel bordeI. Mais n'allez pas croire que jouer à Day of the Tentacle n'est pas un plaisir : il est l'un de ces jeux qui procurent un sentiment d'accomplissement rare, même s'il récompensera plus souvent la chance et l'exaspération que le flair. Il suffit d'être téméraire et résigné.

En tant que remake, Day of the Tentacle Remaster est un sans-faute. La mise à jour graphique ne trahit pas le style de la première édition et un nouveau menu contextuel en allège les interactions. Quant aux nostalgiques et aux fous qui ont envie de découvrir cette expédition telle qu'elle a été jouée par les premiers aventuriers, Double Fine leur donne la possibilité de basculer à tout instant sur le jeu original, ses pixels et son interface SCUMM. Les commentaires audio finiront de rassasier les fans les plus obèses ; aussi le premier jeu de la série, Maniac Mansion, est-il inclus en bonus.

Derrière un humour souvent gras et absurde (dans le mauvais sens du terme), Tim Schafer et sa bande ont tout de même réussi à nous raconter quelques bonnes blagues qui sont drôles pour de vrai, glisser quelques jeux de mot bien sentis, des péripéties au ridicule si jusqu'au-boutiste qu'elles ne peuvent que déclencher le rire. Cette histoire de voyage temporel est un bon prétexte pour s'amuser avec des figures historiques, parodier les meilleurs romans d'anticipation ou encore provoquer des paradoxes en pagaille. C'est un voyage en Idiotie, une fresque colorée mais cradingue, une expérience dont on se souviendra longtemps, la mémoire garnie d'assez de bons souvenirs pour en atténuer les mauvais. Day of the Tentacle est pareil à une grosse tartine de gazole avec, sous trois couches de carburant, une fine peau de confiture : ça vaut le coup de se dégoûter pour en arriver jusqu'au coeur. On l'appréciera d'autant plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158905982', 'num_games_owned': 10695, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1561560070}
review:
La continuacion de Maniac Mansion traida por el capo de Tim Schafer por hacer cosas copadas como Monkey Island, que hicieron a los de LucasArts que se mearan de risa con sus boludeces le dieron pie para hacer otra joyita "Day of the Tentacle"

Toda la historia hace pie en el viejo Maniac Mansion, pero solo para tomar impulso, el doctor Fred estaba esperimentando y tiro porqueria al rio donde combirtio al tentaculo morado en un pibe re jodido y con dos brazos, y para variar el mas boludo de los protagonista lo deja libre.
Junto con nuestro nerd Bernard, viajan dos chabones mas, uno es Hoagie, el gordo metalero y la otra desequilibrada mental es Laverne una mezcla entre la sobrina del Inspector Gadget y Carlitos Tevez. 
Con esto contamos con 3 lineas de tiempo diferentes, cuando las letrinas fallan y dejan a Hoagie 200 años en el pasado y a Laverne 200 años en el futuro, y desde el presente Bernardo tiene que enviar huevadas para ayudar a sus amigotes para que puedan alterar la historia sin problemas.
Como si fuera Marty Mcfly, Hoagie tiene que cambiar la historia Yankee como alterar la constitucion, cambiar dentaduras para alterar el futuro y asi ayudar Laverne  que tiene que usar todo lo que le mandan del pasado para safarse de un mundo conquistado por los tentaculos.
Lo loco de esto es la linea de tiempo como Volver al Futuro que le pone una onda muy interesante.

Esta version trae un nuevo cambio visual que se hace notar, el audio esta muy bien mejorado y ademas comentamos con los comentarios de los desarrolladores.

Pasaron muchos años y estos juegos estan desapareciendo con la nueva generacion de pibes que quieren todo lindo y a 1000 fps, estos eran juegos FORRRO. Por suerte hay remasterizaciones copadas como estas que te permiten resucitar estas joyitas del pasado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132748965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1478601875}
review:
优点：
+谜题设计得似乎还不错。
+在三个不同年代间穿梭，通过改变过去来改变未来，这一点即便放在今天也颇新颖。
+恶搞历史。[strike] 华盛顿，你爸喊你回家砍树。[/strike]
+偶尔感受一下美国老卡通片画风也当猎奇了。
缺点：
-人设讨厌，三个主角只有胖子正常些，另外两个从造型到配音都像精神病加弱智。
-成就设计不合理。点击解谜游戏本来就缺乏重玩价值，因此绝不应该设置在正常流程中有可能错过的成就。为了在一次流程中拿到全成就，我不得不看着攻略玩，这也是为什么前面说谜题设计得“似乎”还不错，我TM根本没有深入体验。和本游戏一同进包的Broken Age和Grim Fandango Remastered也是这副德行，真希望点击解谜游戏开发者们能引以为戒，别为难我们这些成就强迫症患者。
-观念不合。以下内容涉及剧透：[spoiler] 游戏中有个拿微波炉解冻仓鼠的环节，把一个冰冻仓鼠复活了，或许担心玩游戏的小孩子会学坏，游戏借主角之口反复警告大家“这是未来的微波炉，而在现实生活中，小孩子这么干会被爸妈丢掉。”——让我感觉这是一个低龄向游戏，至少是有低龄受众的游戏。然而后面就打脸了，在游戏中某台电脑上，玩家可以玩到另一个内置的小游戏，而唯一一个与之相关的成就要求用微波炉热仓鼠，这次没有警告，仓鼠也没有奇迹生还，在微波炉里爆成了肉酱。反正我自己看到那一幕顿时心情就不好了。开发者到底是多想用微波炉热仓鼠？[/spoiler]仅仅基于这一点也要差评。

author: {'steamid': '76561198077203157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1477952219}
review:
I've played through this game about 5 times since the 90s and I've always really enjoyed it. The voice acting, humour and original art style were always delightful. The puzzles are mostly logical and it strikes and maintains a good balance of being challenging but not frustrating (there are no puzzles that come to mind that made me mad once I figured out the solution).

The update is mostly excellent, with clearer audio, and remastered music, as well as an old-style/new-style hotkey to toggle between the two (much like the Monkey Island SE games). All the original visuals and audio are still accessible this way. I flipped back a few times to watch certain animations throughout the game. For those familiar with the original, you may notice a few changes in the sound effects - nothing major, but you can get accustomed to the sound of tentacle suckers on the ground and overweight hotel guests falling off beds so it could be marginally jarring for purists in that respect.

The new verb wheel frees up a lot of screen space and, once you get used to it, works well. I slightly prefer the verb coin of Full Throttle/CoMI or the 'click through' style from Sam & Max, and the DotT's new one can get a little busy, but it's really not a detractor from the experience.

My only actual gripe (and it's a minor one) is with the new visuals. The classic LucasArts pixelated style was amazing at the time but this update could be considered *too faithful* in some respects. Things sometimes feel a little too simple - we have higher definition, but we really just get smoother lines with very little in the way of increased detail. This is especially noticeable on the main characters (as opposed to the backgrounds), which feel a little 'traced' at times and almost lose something stylistically from what the limited original artwork implied. This approach is understandable considering the exactness of the graphics toggle feature and the new artwork essentially being an overlay. While it was offputting at the very beginning, this became less of a concern as time went on and I got back into the story.

It's very hard to make a great game bad and, with this update, I can't say that's the case. It's extremely faithful to the original and still thoroughly lovable. There aren't too many games that have such well-written comedy and so few advenures where you seldom feel like you're doing busywork to fill time.

All-in-all, I'd strongly recommend this title as solid nostalgia for veterans or a hilarious new experience for the uninitiated. I'm extremely glad that this title has been brought up to modern standards so all its excellent qualities can be enjoyed by a younger generation (and not be lost to those who would have balked at the original, now 'retro', graphics). It really, really holds up, by any standards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135366765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1510363147}
review:
Résumé du jeu en 3 mots:
"Nique la logique"
Et malgré ça les énigmes sont faisables quand on arrive à réfléchir à l'envers. Quand on cherche une solution à un problême une illumination viendra et puis une idée viendra:
""Il faut que tu découpe la contrebasse à l'aide de bougies parfumées! Le grille-pain que tu cherches est sans doute à l'interieur!""
Et ça semblera normal dans cet univers, et ce sera la bonne chose à faire.
Je le conseille à tous ceux qui se nourissent de Nawak quotidiennement! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198339619462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1478156837}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered brings me back to the days of playing this game at my friend's house in the early 90's so naturally I'm a bit biased. With that being said, this remaster has been done tastefully so newcomers will be able to get into the game while at the same time it's able to satisfy old fans as it doesn't nix anything from the original version. All of the tiny details in the art evoke a sense of wonder and warmth, not to mention it's chock full of easter eggs. The remaster allows for the same excitement one felt yesteryear after initially booting this game up and admiring the graphics to still be there. As an added bonus there is an option to change everything back to the original graphics as well if that's more your speed so this package is truly the best of both worlds. 

Day of the Tentacle was so ahead of the times. There is a switching mechanic which allows you to alternate between three different characters who can interact and share items with each other to solve certain puzzles throughout the adventure. The characters are all completely different and equally loveable archetypes of American youth. My favorite character is Hoagie; a heavy-set Heavy rocker kid as he just screams Wayne's World to me.

My only gripe with the game is that a few of the puzzles are a bit illogical and ignore common sense however I urge you to not use a guide as it will taint the experience. Luckily these situations are few and far between and the quirky universe the game is set in allow for one to not mind back tracking a bit more than they should need to. If you want a wonderful game to play on a rainy day which will make you smile like a little kid again do yourself a favor and purchase Day of the Tentacle Remastered. You can feel the love oozing out of every aspect of both the original production and remastering. Mission accomplished Lucas Arts/Double Fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964135658', 'num_games_owned': 3837, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1580567593}
review:
Añoranza de otros tiempos diferentes en las que la idea era comerse mas la cabeza y pegar menos tiros. Simplemente estoy encantado de volver a revivir esta experiencia que en su época me encantó, con graficos muy mejorados y jugabilidad cambiada (si no conoceis el original, simplemente pulsar F1).

 En mi opinión es una de esas pequeñas joyas que me encanta tener en mi lista para poder revivirla cuando me apetece, la historia es entretenida, muy divertida y una cosa que siempre me llamó mucho la atención lo bien conectada que está entre si, es decir, todo lo que hagamos tiene su sentido y su reacción, no le ocurre como a otras aventuras graficas en las que empiezas a hacer una serie de tareas y tienes que parar casi inexplicablemente por razones que casi ni las entiendes, todos los actos que hacemos son muy intuitivos y tienen su efecto muy bien argumentado.

 Es una de esas pequeñas grandes historias que a mi me atraparon de pequeño, y aun siendo cortita, entre 4 a 5 horas de juego, a veces toca comerse mucho la cabeza y siempre es entretenida aliñada con humor, personajes estrafalarios y unos graficos muy divertidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045442328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1492468174}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 2977, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1659544031}
review:
Una de las aventuras gráficas clásicas mejor valoradas, de la escuela de LucasArts que dió tantas alegrías en la época de los 80's y 90's a los que adoramos este género.

Se trata de la continuación del juego Maniac Mansion (1987), si nunca lo jugamos estaremos un poco perdidos al no conocer las relaciones previas entre los personajes y su contexto, pero no es necesario para nada, de hecho el juego se esfuerza en mostrar detalles que nos hagan comprender todo con algo de profundidad. La historia es surrealista y cómica a cada paso, va avanzando y alternando acciones en varios momentos del tiempo, afectando unas a otras, eso da mucho juego y es básicamente la esencia de la trama, así hay momentos que rozan el absurdo mezclados con otros que nos dejan pensativos, incluso podemos jugar a su precursor, Maniac Mansion desde un PC de la mansión. La variedad de situaciones, puzzles y objetos a utilizar es bastante grande, los diálogos bastante divertidos e incluso hay un momento que lo caracteriza como aventura (al igual que Monkey Island se caracteríza por su batalla de insultos).

Además esta versión remasterizada es prácicamente perfecta, respeta al 100% al original, incluye un renovado aspecto gráfico adaptado al formato panorámico, una banda sonora más instrumental y un sistema de control más intuitivo que además evita perder espacio de pantalla (el famoso menú SCUMM) y permite jugar con mando, incluso los logros están bien integrados, se puede poner todo como era originalmente o mezclar por ejemplo el audio nuevo con los viejos gráficos, además incluye comentarios de sus creadores y una opción marca la posición de objetos para los menos pacientes. 

En definitiva, es mi aventura gráfica favorita y eso que he jugado a muchas, me alegró mucho saber que saldría remasterizada para Steam y he disfrutado al revivir cada escena, simplemente me parece perfecta a todos los niveles, hecha con un esmero enorme y que sin duda marcó una época y es parte de la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971440424', 'num_games_owned': 1806, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1478347217}

author: {'steamid': '76561198049237732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1478388863}

author: {'steamid': '76561198068508408', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1596425600}
review:
This game was my favorite point and click games in the 90s, and having found the remastered on sale I said why not.

The game plays fine, the new graphics are nice, though the old ones are rendered *better* by scummvm than this game... no point in filtering them I guess since there is better anyway.

I tried the new wheel thing, but it didn't feel right to me, especially with having to send items to other characters all the time, so I kept the old trusted bar instead,

The game is still DOTT, nothing changed about it, the intro even still has Lucas Arts instead of Double Fine, which makes me wonder how much work they really *improved* in this. It would have been nice to get some form of new content similarly to Broken Sword DC.

My main issue (which has nothing to do with the devs) is that I remember pretty much everything, so it took me about 3 hours to finish. I wish I didn't remember most of the solutions but I do :/ I guess I replayed it on scummvm too often :)

Overall, I still love DOTT, but it's not that much better than on scummvm...

Recommendation:
- If you've never played DOTT before, this is very very fine!
- If you have the original DOTT, get this on sale or stick to scummvm.

The game played well in Linux with Mesa drivers (radeonsi).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970304543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1478722768}
review:
Me lo he comprado gracias a un super descuento en un pack y lo he querido desde hace demasiado tiempo. Fué una espina clavada el no jugarlo como debe cuando era pequeño(cosa que con el indiana jones/monkey island, ocurrió y disfruté como un enano) ahora llega el momento de jugar a una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de toda la história.

PROS:
História simpática
Sabor añejo
Buena tradución y muy graciosa
BSO
Comentários del director
Doblado al inglés.

CONTRAS:
Solo cambia por el hd.
Puede desesperar si no estás acostumbrado a buscar por todos sitios.
Algunos puzzles/situaciones intrincadas(como la mayoría de aventuras Lucast)
Puede durar un poco menos que otras aventuras del estilo.
Doblado solo al inglés

El juego es bueno,como lo fué antaño,pero por el precio que tiene sin descuento,tendría que tener cambios sustanciales.Que conste...es la segunda parte de otro juego clásico(maniac mansion)por lo menos puedes jugarlo dentro de este juego en un pc a poco de comenzar (solo en inglés)

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032190908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1478196568}
review: the amount of flashbacks I'm having with this game are simply overwhelming! If you played the original one you MUST play the remastered version

author: {'steamid': '76561197964732360', 'num_games_owned': 5837, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1558818849}
review:
藉由時光機穿梭時空拯救世界的題材，可以說是屢見不鮮了。但時光機可以是書桌的抽屜 (哆啦A夢梗)，可以是電話亭 (Dr.Who 梗) ，用流動公共廁所就很罕見了吧？
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=685619527
主角是三個看起來很兩光的遜咖，加上極度偏執工作狂的愛迪生家族，以及不知怎麼搞的就統治世界的可愛反派角色～紫色觸角，巧妙的融合歷史人物軼事，在這棟旅館穿梭時空三百年的不停沖馬桶來拯救世界... 喔喔喔，可見得炒飯人人會做，讓人回味無窮的炒飯卻不是那麼容易做出來的，更何況復刻用的是米倉內的老米 XD
「瘋狂時代」(Day of the Tentacle)這款遊戲是1993年Lucas Arts工作室的作品，細緻流暢的過場動畫(320x200 256色)、動聽的配樂、逗趣的人物和腦洞大開又詼諧的劇情，在當年可是獲得各大遊戲媒體的一致好評喔！
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=685619399
多年來，不管是DOS版的或是透過ScummVM來回味，難免都會因為化學配方調製圖卡了好久(當年的防拷機制，要翻說明書才有正確答案)。
而這次的重製版蠻阿莎力的拿掉老舊的防拷 (那老方法早就防不了啦 XD )，保留了以前就有的完整版APPLE II的「瘋狂大樓」(Maniac Mansion) ，且人物場景全部配合這個時代用HD重繪，為了增加挑戰性也增加了58個成就，另外還加上原開發小組的語音講評，可以說是誠意十足的復刻了這款遊戲。不管老玩家回味、新玩家瞻仰經典或是成就控的全成就+1，都是相當適合，趁特價或同捆包入手更是不可錯過的好機會。
所以只要廠商有心，就算陳年舊米拿來翻炒還是有一番新滋味的，擁有大量陳年佳作的CAPCOM & SEGA，還不學著點？

I first played this game when I was a child and it's quite amazing to replay it several years after. And remastered. The humor is contagious, the esthetic is acid and the history is full with strambotic characters. Highly recommended!!

_________

Este juego lo viví hace años cuando era una enana y rejugarlo ahora en versión remasterizada es una pasada. La historia está llena de humor, de diálogos estrambóticos con personajes peculiares y la estética del juego parece sacada de un viaje a manos de un tripi. Lo recomiendo 100%!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980483936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1478058355}
review:
Great remake, but not a lot here for people who have already played through the original release, I remembered about 90% of the puzzles. Although I received this discounted in a bundle so I'm not entirely complaining, great nostalgia trip.

However if you've never played DoTT, or if you've never played a point and click before, this is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995284950', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1542728815}
review:
Bought this game from the Day of the Dev Humble Bundle.

What can i say to Day of the Tentacle Remastered? It's one of my favorite point and click adventure from the 90ies and the improved graphic made it look really pretty.
Also, i'm glad they gave us the option to use the old UI because i'm not a big fan of the tooltips on the mouse cursor when i pass over interactive objects, so that's a big plus.

If you want crazy humor and even crazier puzzle solving, this game is a must buy.

Can't wait for Full Throttle Remastered next year, if this is the quality i won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274508951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1476823512}
review:
This is a charming point and click adventure game.
The story is great, the characters and voice acting is amazing. Funny and witty dialogues to your hearts content!
With the remastered version you are able to play the game with creators' commemts as well as revamped graphics, which are gorgeous. The art style is diffinatly unique and memorable. 
Puzzels are fun to solve and although I had to look up guides at more than one point I never though the puzzels were unfair.
Plus you can play Manic mansion the prequel to TDOTT. 2 games for the price of 1!

클래식 포인트 앤 클릭 애드밴처 게임입니다.
리마스터 버젼으로 그래피기 업데이트되었고그래에이터들 코멘터리가 추가되었어요
잘 검색하시면 한글 패치도 찾으실 수 있습니다.
퍼즐도 아주 어렵지는 않지만 캐릭터들이 하는 말이 힌트가 되기 때문에 언어가 문제가 될 수 있습니다
워낙 클래식 게임이라 공략이 모두 나와있으니 중간에 막혀서 진행을 못 하는 일은 없을 듯 합니다
또한 전편인 "매니악 맨션"이 게임 속 게임으로 내장되어있습니다. 
"매니악 맨션" 전부가 플레이 가능합니다 (세이브, 로드도 가능)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1476543847}
review:
Grand classique des point&click du début des années 90, le jeu est présenté ici en version remasterisée.
On retrouve les graphiques cartoonesques, l'humour et les énigmes qui permettent encore aujourd'hui de passer un bon moment.
On contrôle trois personnages qui se retrouvent dans le même lieu à trois époques différentes. On peut à tout moment changer de personnage (et donc l'époque) et donner des objets de notre inventaire à nos deux autres camarades.
Pas de grande difficulté, les énigmes sont assez logiques si on est bien attentif. Certains dialogues donnent des indices sur ce qu'il faut faire.

Un must-have pour les amateurs du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067788711', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1693071149}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de todos los tiempos. La disfruté muchisimo cuando la jugué por primera vez hace ya 20 años y la sigo disfrutando hoy en día.

Un clásico inoxidable esencial para la biblioteca de los amantes del genero y una excelente puerta de entrada para quienes nunca probaron juegos de este tipo!

review: The game is fantastic. It was fantastic when it was first released, and I am one of the old dudes that used to play that version for the first time. The remastered version is brilliant. The option to play from remastered to original with one *click*, is also great, since it brings back that feeling of 90s. As for the full price, I don't get it. 15 euros? Thanks for all the great stuff you have done to an already wonderfull game, but 15euros is a lot. At least this is my opinion. [b] Add to wishlist, and wait for a sale![/b] Then buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964165856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1503244231}
review:
From the pages of the US Gold product catalogue 1994-1995:

Get to grips with Day of the Tentacle(TM)

Inspired by the cartoon styles of Chuck Jones and Maurice Noble, Day of the Tentacle (TM) is the sequel to Maniac Mansion - and it's like notheing else you've ever seen, heard, or played. In one zany adventure you've got bizarre interwoven plots, a liberal dose of outrageous humour, snazzy graphics and a hundred way-out sound effects. Plus that essential element in any big-time arcade adventure - brain busting puzzles. And when you're travelling through time, the paradoxical shenanigans are endless... Or is that beginning-less?

Down at Maniac Mansion, Dr. Fred is cooking up trouble. His beloved Purple Tentacle has gotten hold of some of the mutagenic pollutants oozing out of the doctor's lab. What's more, it's grown arms, not to mention thoughts of global domination.
Enter Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne - mankind's last chance. In the space of a single night they relese the Tentacle by mistake and spend 400 years timetravelling on the Chron-O-John to save humanity. Day of the Tentacle. It's going to grip you the second you press 'play'.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029240214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1643999776}
review:
Ich will jetzt echt nicht der Arsch sein, aber ich muss auch mal was Negatives loswerden.

Zunächst einmal: Ich liebe dieses Spiel. Ich hab es vor 20 Jahren ebenfalls schon mit einem Schulfreund gespielt, und es hat mich sofort gefesselt.

Aber leider haut hier was mit STEAM nicht richtig hin - jedenfalls in meiner Version nicht. Die Zwischensequenzen scheinen alle verbuggt zu sein oder mit Delay abgespielt zu werden. Die Spielfiguren wiederholen manche Wörter mehrmals hintereinander, bis sich das Delay gelegt hat.

Gleich am Anfang gibt es diese Szene, wo der Hamster an der Tür ist und Laverne und Hoagie die Tür öffnen. Eigentlich müsste zuerst Laverne was sagen und dann Hoagie, der vorschlägt, dem Hamster den Kopf abzubeißen. Bei mir war zuerst zu hören, wie Hoagie den Kopf-abbeißen-Vorschlag macht, dann erst sagt Laverne ihren Satz, und dann sagt Hoagie denselben Satz mit dem Kopf abbeißen noch mal. 

Ich habe das Spiel trotzdem gestartet und hatte schon im Vorspann, wo die 3 mit dem Pickup fahren, das Gefühl, dass das Spiel hängen bleibt bzw. Tonausfälle hat.

Dann hab ich bis dahin gespielt, wo der Diamant zerbricht und der Prof. Leonard auffordert, nach den Unterlagen zu suchen. Die Musik lief dann noch weiter, aber das Spiel ist total abgestürzt.

Also ich hab kein Plan, ob das an STEAM liegt, aber bei mir scheint das Game total verbuggt zu sein bzw. mit den Anforderungen nicht zurecht zu kommen. Vielleicht starte ich es nachher noch mal in der "nicht remasterten" Version. Mal gucken, ob das was bringt.

Aber wenn das dann immer noch so im Arsch ist, dann war das rausgeworfenes Geld. 

Bei wem es funktioniert: Ihr Glücklichen! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960340922', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1680425604}
review: Nostalgie quand tu nous tiens ! Que de souvenir avec ce jeu, toute ma jeunesse. Reste plus que Sam & Max et on est bon :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049701098', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 832, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1475934148}
review:
The early 90's were a great time for what we now consider as classic point and click games; the retro pixelated artwork, the high level of difficulty, the need for personal critical thinking and complex problem solving. Some didn't become quite as famous as others, leaving them to fall into the void of cult-classic status, remembered by their appreciative yet relatively small fanbase. Such can be said about Day of the Tentacle, a zany point and click adventure game from LucasArts from 1993, now Remastered with smooth high-definition art and sound thanks to Double Fine Productions.

For those who're already familiar with the game, I'll go ahead and start out with the Remastered stuff. The artwork is all hand-drawn; it looks fantastic, and it's very smooth. The color is extremely vibrant, and the gradients transition so much better thanks to how far technology has come within the last two-plus decades. Not to mention the wonderful use of lighting and angles that really make the artwork stand out above many other point and click games. The interface has also been updated to modern standards, and it's much more user-friendly than the old one. You have the option to transition from the original graphics, and sound, to the Remastered ones all throughout the game; one can even mix and match if they so desire, old graphics/new sounds or new graphics/old sounds. There's also a developer commentary available to those who're interested, and bonus content in the main menu. It's an incredibly solid Remaster, in functionality, performance, and design. I noticed that some people in the review section had problems with the audio, such as stuttering or other characters voices playing. I believe that the last patch, noted as June 1st, 2016, took care of these problems as I didn't experience any audio issues whatsoever. 

Day of the Tentacle is a sequel to another highly favorable point and click LucasArts game, Maniac Mansion. At the start of the game a scene occurs where two Tentacles, Green and Purple, are standing beside a radiated river. Purple Tentacle decides to take a sip of the toxic sludge coming out from the sewers, and he begins to mutate; a mutation so inconceivable and horrific at that... he grows... arms. In his new superior form, Purple Tentacle turns into an evil genius and begins scheming to have his army of Tentacles to take over the world. One of the main characters, Bernard, is friends with Green Tentacle, who lets Bernard know of Purple Tentacle's intents. Bernard gathers his two best friends, Hoagie and Laverne, in an effort to stop the evil plot.

What follows are events of wacky cartoon mayhem and eccentric wit. The dialogue and actions of the characters are absolutely hilarious, garnering more than a few laugh-out-loud moments from me personally; which I must say is hard to achieve, I'm more of a chuckler/internal laugher. Bernard is your typical know-it-all nerd, Hoagie is a heavy metal roadie, and Laverne is just out of her mind. You'll even get to interact with the founding fathers quite a bit, and the Tentacles are as memorable as they are priceless. Beyond question, it's an adventure that you really must seek for yourself.

Probably the only downfall that one could find about Day of the Tentacle are some of its nonsensical puzzle solutions. This again stems from the 90's era of point and click gameplay, though, and it's to be expected from a title that originally launched so long ago. A guide is highly recommended, as the game really is extremely cryptic with some of its puzzles. There are also dialogue conundrums that can sometimes only be solved by performing an event and then going to talk to the person again. However, some people still like their games mystifying and complex, so if you're one of those self-punishing loonies, you'll absolutely enjoy this game in its entirety.

Whether or not you played Day of the Tentacle back in 1993, you'll absolutely love this absurd, unpredictable, humorous experience. It's one of those classic games that are up there with Grim Fandago in the "you shouldn't miss this" category. Double Fine Productions have done a bang-up job on this Remaster, and they've presented in a way that lets the original design shine through, while also making it obvious that the remake was crafted by them; if only all recent remastered editions were this good. While $16.99 CAD is pretty steep for a 4 hour adventure, grabbing this game on sale for half off is a great idea.

[h1]Rating: [b]5.0/5.0[/b] - An astonishing achievement, this game must be played.[/h1]
The Horror Network [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28221963/]Curator[/url] | [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thehorrornetwork]Group[/url] Click for Gore

Still, no idea what to do with the trophy and that bloody hub cap!

author: {'steamid': '76561198314912646', 'num_games_owned': 594, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2496, 'last_played': 1581617706}
review:
[h1]Day of the Tentacle[/h1] (FSK 0 Jahre) ist eines meiner beliebtesten Adventures !!! 
Das gilt für das Original (1993) genauso wie für diese Remasterte Neuauflage.Selbst "Maniac Mansion" (Der erste Teil der in den 80gern für den Commodore 64 "C64" erschinen ist läßt sich an einem Computer im Spiel spielen "Game in Game".

Die Story rund um Zeitreisen ist herrlich verrückt und die Dialoge versprühen immer noch den typischen "Humor" wer hier nicht zumindest ein bisschen schmunzeln muss, ist innerlich tot.

Die Designer haben es geschafft, für die beklopptesten Rätsel erschreckend logische Lösungswege zu erfinden. 
Die Erkenntnis ist fast sogar ein bisschen beängstigend das der Blödsinn den man mit Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne in Gegenwart, Vergangenheit und Zukunft anstellt oft einen Sinn ergibt!

Ich hoffe das es in Zukunft auch mal eine Remastered version von "Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders" gibt.

Das Spiel ist bei Steam jetzt schon zum zweiten mal (mindestens) im 50% Angebot, 7,49 € ist für den Spaß geschenkt. 


Viel Spaß beim Spielen
MfG Pacman1305 !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977427189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1462991926}
review:
Weltklasse! Ein absoluter Klassiker überarbeitet. Es lohnt sich immer wieder... 
Ich habe das Spiel als Grundschulkind das erste Mal gespielt, damals, als man noch kein Internet hatte um Lösungen zu suchen. So begeistert wie früher bin ich auch heute, über 20 Jahre später. Die Rätsel sind logisch und fair, auch, wenn man manchmal um die Ecke denken muss. 
Die Story ist lustig und unterhaltsam. Die Remastered Edition ist ebenfalls gut gelungen, obwohl die Steuerung eine kurze Eingewöhnungszeit braucht.
Meiner Meinung nach eines der besten Point & Klick Adventure die es bisher gab.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986410992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1474324401}
review:
La entrada original podéis encontrarla en

https://thepastisnow.net/2016/09/20/maniac-mansion-el-dia-del-tentaculo-purpura-contra-todos/ 

Este juegazo de LucasArts de 1993 es la segunda parte del mítico Maniac Mansion (1987), gracias a Double Fine, 23 años después, podemos volver a jugarlo en una edición remasterizada, desde Marzo de 2016, que además nos permite ir cambiando al juego original simplemente pulsando un botón.

¡Estos locos Edison nos han vuelto a liar! Verde ha escrito a su amigo Bernard (ese friki que parece Steve Urkel versión blanco) porque Púrpura, ha bebido agua contaminada y esto ha provocado el crecimiento de un par de brazos y un plan para conquistar el mundo!

¡Púrpura se ha vuelto loco y ha escapado!

En  este ordenador puedes jugar a Maniac Mansion 1.

Este título salió durante una época conocida como “la época dorada de las aventuras gráficas” de la mano de Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer (quién además es el fundador de Double Fine) y utiliza un sistema de verbos a través de los cuales ejecutamos acciones para ir desarrollando el juego. Este sistema, se llama SCUMM que son las siglas de  Script Creation Utility for Maniac Mansion ya que se desarrolló para la primera parte de Manic Mansion.

Bernard era uno de los compañeros de Dave en la primera aventura en la mansión de los Edison.
Bernard, acompañado de sus amigos Hoagie y Lavergne, se dispondrá entonces a detener a Púrpura en su loco plan. El profesor Edison, creador de los tentáculos, les enviará al pasado para detener a Púrpura antes de que beba el agua contaminada.

Hasta aquí parece muy fácil, montar en la Cron-O-Letrina (con ese nombre, no hubiera accedido JAMÁS) volver un día en el tiempo y acabar con ese renacuajo, pero… algo sale mal y acaba cada uno en una época diferente de la mansión, pasado, presente y futuro.

Este detalle es lo que realmente me llamó la atención de El día del tentáculo, como las acciones que hacemos en las diferentes épocas tienen repercusión, detalles como talar un árbol para que desaparezca en el futuro o dar un mapa de anatomía tentacular a Betsy Ross (que tejió la bandera de Estados Unidos).

La Mansión Edison recogió grandes momentos históricos.
 
Con un humor muy ácido que te hará reír a carcajadas en tu silla comentario a comentario, situaciones increíbles y guiños con grandes sagas de LucasArts/LucasFilm que te seguirán por todo el juego (desde Star Wars a Sam & Max, pasando por Monkey Island) consigue hacer que te intereses por cada línea de texto de cada personaje.

Las animaciones son muy buenas, estética Cartoon, muy similar a Sam & Max, llenas de vida y color, con mucha sensación de movimiento, consiguiendo sumergirte en el juego. Al arrancar la edición Remastered, es curioso que te da la sensación de que el juego era así, y no ha envejecido, cuando cambié a la versión original, pude comprobar que el juego no había envejecido nada pero que nada mal.

Aquí os dejo algunas imágenes en comparativa sobre la versión original y la versión Remastered, algunos de vosotros me habéis pedido que indique donde se pueden obtener los juegos o como jugarlos hoy en día, pues bien, este juego esta disponible en Steam en su versión remastered, y en la misma se puede alternar con la versión original.

Da igual que versión juegues, un ejercito de tentáculos púrpura va a conquistar tu ordenador.
Hace poco, encontré unos Alemanes, que están desarrollando una secuela Return of the tentacle, que espero que aunque sea en inglés, podamos probarlo con nuestros propios tentáculos con nuestras propias manos.

En definitiva, es una aventura gráfica clásica point and click en la que hablaremos con muchísimos personajes y acumularemos muchos objetos que utilizaremos entre sí y con el entorno (algunos nunca sabremos que utilidad tienen).

Vale vale, salid ahí y jugadlo si aún no lo habéis hecho!
 
¿Y tu? ¿Conseguiste librar al mundo del malvado plan del tentáculo púrpura?

¡¡¡Nos vemos pronto!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1474842955}
review:
This is my first time playing through Day of Tentacle so I can’t truly compare it to the original entirely, but the remastering looks real good to me. Double Fine even added some modern conveniences such as a hotspot button.

Now I’m usually not a fan of old school adventure game puzzles, even in old school adventure games I adore such as Longest Journey and Gabriel Knight 1 I had to keep going back to guides because I hated some of the puzzles. Day of the Tentacle surprised me in that I only had to use a guide towards the very end, most of the puzzles make sense, and if even they don’t the game gives you some hints if you explore enough to help you along. The only really bad part is one piece of pixel hunting, but if you use the hotspot button you should be fine. (I didn’t, so that’s why I hit a brick wall) It’s almost like a modern adventure game in that the game’s puzzles don’t actively hate you and fit with what you’re doing. The time travel conceit makes the puzzle solving fun and the game is quite funny. It’s overall a real good game that still holds up more than twenty years later.

review: A great game that brings back a lot of memories.  If you have some spare time, you should definitely give this game a try, because hey, who doesn't want to fight against evil tentacles that are trying to take over the world in their spare time?  It is nothing spectacular, no eye popping graphis, no ear numbing music, no larger-than-life-kill-every-alien-and-demon action - it is just a straight forward honest and quality adventure game.  I'm glad they brought this game back remastered because even just about an hour into the game I'm having a great time clicking on every possible dialogue with George Washington, Ben Franklin, and other well known Founding Fathers. Well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017327922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5066, 'last_played': 1711150221}
review:
[h1]A brief overview...[/h1]
[b]Goal:[/b] To stop an evil triangle from taking over the world.
[b]Method:[/b] Travel back in time to the day before so that you can stop the triangle from becoming evil in the first place. However, the majority of the story revolves around blowing a large sum of money on a shopping channel product, and finding sources of electricity that you can plug toilets into.
[b]Heroes:[/b] The true heroes of this game are a metalhead who has zero book smarts, a trainee doctor who cannot be trusted with her own scalpel, and that nerd from the first game who used to be a coward. This trio receives help along the way from an ex-villain mad scientist, the founding fathers, a hamster and a dead guy.
[b]Events:[/b] This game lets you rob a vending machine, strike up conversations with historical figures, break out of jail, play numerous practical jokes on people, set off a fire alarm, throw a dead man down the stairs, throw a live woman down the stairs, cause it to rain at your own will, have way too much fun in a beauty pageant, and seek revenge on an inflatable clown.

[h1]... and now, let's get serious![/h1]
Day of the Tentacle is my favourite game of all time, so I guess ever since this remaster was announced I've had something of a positivity bias towards it. Why do I love the game so much? Wow... where do I start? The game is set in a cartoon world with fitting art and music, where slapstick humour is abundant. It is one of the few games that truly makes me feel like I am "playing" a cartoon. Combine that with everything you can expect from a LucasArts adventure game (y'know, stealing various items, getting creative with how you use items together, doing terrible things to NPCs just to get closer to your goal), and you are in for a treat.
Despite its Saturday Morning Cartoon setting, the puzzles are actually logical and very well thought out. What really makes the puzzles special in this game is its time travel element; most of the game deals with the three protagonists separated from each other in different time periods. Hoagie is stranded way back in colonial times, Laverne has ended up in a tentacle-ruled future, and Bernard is back in the present (well, the '90s). Naturally, your actions in one time period could have a direct effect on a later one. For example, Hoagie can change a significant part of American history in order to make Laverne's life (four hundred years later) much easier. See where I'm going with this?
Like I've already said, the graphics and music fit the game's cartoon atmosphere wonderfully. Even the original version of the game is fully voice acted (well, the CD-ROM version... those voiceover files wouldn't fit on the floppy disk version!) and that was a big deal back in 1993. The voice acting is done to a professional standard, and stars Richard Sanders (from WKRP in Cincinnati) as Bernard. Sound effects are typically cartoony, dialogue is well written, it's great fun exploring the mansion in three different moments in time (which is very well designed), and the characters are just amazing. I love them all.
Oh, and get this... the original Maniac Mansion (DOTT's prequel) is included and fully playable. So you're basically getting two awesome adventure games for the price of one.

[h1]What's new in the remaster?[/h1]
Those pixelly graphics from the '90s have all been redrawn - but not redesigned - so they look exactly as you remember them, except much cleaner! This has allowed artists to pay certain attention to detail that couldn't be done back when working with so few pixels; signs and other items have additional text on them now. One of my personal favourites is what the sign above the lobby door says. Also, smoother panning when the screen scrolls. Music has been digitally remastered too, for a more modern sound. Higher quality sound effects are in place, and the original, uncompressed voice over recordings have been used. The interface has been remastered too, and you can now play the game with a verb dial that has excluded the verbs considered "useless" on the item you are interacting with.
However, if you want to see the old graphics, hear the old music, or use the old interface, all of those options are there too! Unlike other remasters and special editions I've played, this one has a much more customizable experience. You don't have to use all the original settings at once or all the remastered settings; instead you can mix and match. You might want to see the new graphics, but hear the old music. Or perhaps you want pixel graphics while using the new verb dial. You can select each setting separately, letting you play exactly how you want.
When playing for your first time, you will unlock concept art as you progress further into the game and enter more and more scenes. Developer commentary is available; when starting a new game, you will be asked whether you want commentary on or off, but you can toggle it at any time in the main menu too. The Steam version also includes a great set of achievements, as well as trading cards and all the perks that come with those. Also, as can be expected in any modern computer game... [i]autosave[/i].
The first Maniac Mansion is playable like it's always been, but instead of the C64 version included with the original release of DOTT, the remaster includes the Amiga version, so the graphics and audio are notably better quality.
For newcomers, controls are displayed at the start of the game, and can also be found on the options screen (something the original didn't really have). Back when the game was first released, you were expected to read the manual. Or not. Whichever came first.

[h1]The final verdict...[/h1]
Am I recommending this game? Of [i]course[/i] I am! The only nitpick I could come up with originally was that the new sounds aren't as funny as the originals, but since then they have added an option to play with the original sound effects. The punches are punchier. The clown honk is sharper. Hoagie's belch is funny again. Awesome! And that's not all. Remastered graphics that make the game more appealing to a contemporary audience without losing the original's charm, concept art and developer commentary for the hardcore fans, and perhaps most importantly, an accessible way for new customers to get their hands on the awesomeness that is Day of the Tentacle.

[b]An excellent remaster of a most excellent game![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198015507927', 'num_games_owned': 2059, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1495907956}
review:
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/09/maniac-mansion-deluxe.html]Recensione  Maniac Mansion Deluxe[/url]

Seguito di Maniac mansion, Day of the tentacle ci dovrà far visita di nuovo alla famiglia Edison e alla loro casa.
Prima di tutto si, potete giocarvelo tranquillamente anche senza aver giocato a Maniac mansion (ci saranno poche frasi dove ci riporteranno all'altro gioco.)

[b]A livello personale è il mio punta e clicca preferito.[/b]
Mi è sempre piaciuto l'argomento del viaggio nel tempo, e vedere che in questo gioco si può stare contemporaneamente nel passato, presente e futuro, l'ho trovato geniale.
A livello di gameplay è abbastanza complicato, sia per gli enigmi/rompicapo demenziali tipici di Ron Gilbert, sia per il fatto che dovremmo usare 3 personaggi diversi e farci passare gli oggetti di continuo.
Comunque una cosa è certa, non sarà difficile come Maniac mansion (essendo uscito pure anni dopo): qui non si potrà morire.

[b]Per quanto riguarda la trama del gioco[/b] è abbastanza simpatica: Il tentacolo viola (apparso precedentemente in Maniac Mansion),  beve dei rifiuti tossici di una macchina, facendoli cresce delle braccia e facendolo diventare intelligente così tanto da voler conquistare il mondo.
Il nostro compito sarà quello di tornare indietro nel tempo di un giorno spegnendo la macchina che produce i rifiuti tossici. Ovviamente la macchina del tempo del dottor fred avrà dei problemi, e invece che farli tornare indietro di un giorno i nostri protagonisti li faranno viaggiare nel passato e nel futuro (l'altro personaggio è rimasto nel presente).
Quindi il nostro scopo principale del gioco sarà quello di far funzionare le macchine del tempo.

C'è subito da precisare che la grafica è molto cartoonesca, i colori sono molto accessi, e momenti di comicità non macheranno. Esattamente l'opposto dell'atmosfera di Maniac mansion.
C'è anche da dire che qua  l'unico protagonista che compare è solo il secchione Bernard, gli altri due personaggi che lo accompagneranno non si sono mai visti nel gioco precedente.

Ora passiamo al piatto forte del gioco, ovvero [b]"La remastered".[/b]

Non mi garba molto l'idea delle remastered dei giochi, su alcune sono d'accordo ma sinceramente su day of tentacle... potevano evitare.
Non lo sto dicendo perchè hanno fatto un brutto lavoro, ma perchè con tutte le loro avventure grafiche che avevano potevano concentrarci su giochi un po' più vecchi.
Comunque il cambiamento principale è la grafica, l'hanno migliorata non mettendola a pixel, ed hanno fatto un buon lavoro.
Hanno rimasterizzato pure la soundtrack e pure li hanno fatto un lavoro più che buono.
Ma sopratutto per gli appassionati del gioco ci saranno i commenti degli sviluppatori, sono veramente tantissimi e anche molto interessanti.

[b]Conclusione:[/b] Il gioco in questione come ho scritto prima è la mia avventura grafica preferita, quindi vi consiglio di giocarla se siete appassionati del genere (anche se penso che ormai la conoscano quasi tutti).

[b]Voto 9/10[/b]

PS: [b]come nella vecchia versione sarà possibile giocare all'originale maniac mansion.[/b] Purtroppo la lingua è solo in inglese.
[b]Per giocarvelo in italiano provate a scaricarvi la versione classica o la deluxe su internet.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027887410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1527508252}
review: Splendid refresh of the ol' classic, but pls fix the random crashes..

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1473268081}
review:
Le monde (des amateurs de point'n'click) se divise en deux catégories : d'un côté, ceux qui ne jurent que par [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i] ; de l'autre, ceux qui n'y ont jamais joué.

Je vais être honnête, je n'ai pas fait l'original ([i]pas lyncher, pitié...[/i]). En général, tout remastérisés qu'ils soient, ces anciens jeux accusent leur âge, surtout quand on les compare aux productions actuelles. Et pourtant... ce [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i]-là - un papi de presque 25 ans, pardonnez du peu ! - n'a pas à rougir de sa performance. Loin s'en faut ! En l'état, il n'a rien à envier aux point'n'click récents. Autant dire que cette version est un franc succès.

Difficile de lui trouver des défauts : un gameplay certes basique pour le genre (qui a toutefois le mérite d'éviter les lourdeurs), des graphismes très propres, une bande son excellente, le tout dans un univers complètement déjanté. Qui plaira sans nul doute aux amateurs de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/214340][i][b]Deponia[/b][/i][/url] et autres [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/255320][i][b]Edna & Harvey[/b][/i][/url]. Rien qu'un bémol : ici ou là, quelques problèmes infimes ([i]non, pas le pouce vers le bas, pitié...[/i]) de synchro textes/dialogues, avec des pauses dans l'un dues à la lenteur de l'autre. Anecdotique, en somme.

Bref, en ce qui me concerne, cette version remasterisée confirme le statut culte de [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i]. Si vous non plus ne vous étiez pas encore penché sur son cas, sachez qu'il n'est jamais trop tard...

[h1]Verdict : ∞/5 - A sa place au panthéon des jeux vidéos ![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032934450', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1472825615}
review:
Ein immer noch spitzenmäßiges, manchmal etwas abgedrehtes Adventure. Gelegentlich muss man ein wenig um die Ecke denken, aber man kann immer auf die Lösungen kommen.
Für die Experimentierfreudigen gibt es eine Menge Errungenschaften, zusätzlich zu denen, die man sowieso im Spiel bekommt (und im Spiel die eine oder andere amüsante Szene).

author: {'steamid': '76561197968322528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1472331697}
review:
Ich habe damals beide Versionen, die auf Diskette bei der nur das Intro Sprachausgabe hatte und auch die CD-ROM mit kompletter Sprachausgabe gespielt und besitze heute noch die CD-ROM mit Orignalverpackung.

DOTT ist ein Klassiker, der in keiner Sammlung fehlen sollte und bestimmt auch heutigen Generationen viel Freude beim Lösen der Rätsel bereiten wird.

Absolute Kaufempfehlung! Es macht noch immer Spaß Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne durch Dr. Fred's Haus und die verschiedenen Zeitepochen zu dirigieren. 
Die aufpolierte Grafik der Remastered Version tut dem ganzen keinen Abbruch und wenn man möchte, dann kann man die Grafik auch umschalten und Retro genießen. Das Gimmick, am Computer das Original Maniac Mansion zu spielen, ist noch immer enthalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969031618', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1472837972}
review:
Big Schafer fan, but I had the guilt of never having played the original of this.

So I had the pleasure of enjoying this fantastic remaster with lots of effort put into it. 100% of the artwork has been redone, and the interface changes as opposed to the old monkey island style are ones that I much prefer.

Obviously this game is a fantastic classic adventure game with a nice little twist on the traditional conventions. Also: Funny dialogue, clever puzzles (but not too obscure), good music, and a good length.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197967982736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 368, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1472726024}
review: Another masterpiece from Lucasarts: great dialogues, great animation...great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198045831583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1472647273}
review:
I used to play this game all the time as a child, but it's a sad thing you're urged to buy a digital copy; because with every new Windows release, the amount of old games you can play decreases.

Nevertheless, I'm a loyal fan.

When I started playing the game, the first thing I noticed is that the "HD remake" was not worth it. The pixelated artwork has a charm that the, honestly, cheaply redrawn HD images do not. It looks like it was drawn with Adobe Flash, and I was disappointed to see they didn't even bother to make the mouth movements fit the dialogue or improved the animations to make the new style fit. What was the point of making a remastered version. The remastered music was pleasant to listen to, though.

Anyway, I ended up playing the whole game in classic style, like you're supposed to, but even that didn't seem to be without flaws. I don't know if it's because I played this on a laptop; but certain musical cues and melodies were messed up. I know the game starts a certain melody line based on the scene playing, it looked like the digital transfer didn't go too well.

review:

DOTT even includes an extra game - Maniac Mansion (from the 80s), even though it's hidden.. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198136105594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1474215996}
review:
Brilliant, simply brilliant. No new fuss, simply the old game (graphically) remastered in a most brilliant way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056756001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1467760233}
review:
Per chi lo conosce non c'è nulla da dire, questa Remaster è uguale all'originale, con grafica migliore e funzionante sui sistemi moderni.
Per chi non lo conosce: è un gioco divertente e fantasioso. Gli enigmi non sono difficili ma questo non toglie nulla al divertimento. C'è la possibilità di giocare a Maniac Mansion, in inglese, con tanto di salvataggi. Approfittate e giocateli entrembi.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

For those who know him there is nothing to say, this Remaster is equal to the original, with better graphics and running on modern systems.
For those who do not know: it is a fun and imaginative play. The puzzles are not difficult but this does not detract from the fun. There is the opportunity to play Maniac Mansion, in English. You'll play both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071986424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1603476139}
review: è un'opera realizzata in maniera estremamente intelligente, e che ha senso di esistere: propone una grafica completamente rinnovata, così come un’interfaccia grafica più moderna e un audio rimasterizzato. Nonostante ciò, il titolo permette una flessibilità totale in tutti i suoi aspetti, consentendo combinazioni ardite tra la versione originale e quella moderna. Sul fronte del gameplay, c’è poco da dire: a più di 20 anni di distanza, il titolo proposto da Double Fine riesce ancora a divertire, risultando impegnativo, complesso, e capace di proporre una vera sfida. La narrativa, d’altra parte, presenta una delle storie più spassose e divertenti mai viste nel genere, risultando ancora oggi veramente godibile. Considerati tutti questi aspetti, dunque, non possiamo che consigliare l’acquisto di questa edizione sia ai nostalgici, che alle nuove leve: Day of The Tentacle, lo ribadiamo ancora una volta, è invecchiato veramente bene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1470512065}
review: "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" is a very nice updating of a fine point & click adventure game.  It's a good game with some decent humor.  The only issue I had with it is that it didn't give me the last Achievement I needed for a 100% Achievement rate (even though I did it correctly):  Music Appreciation Award.  I had to do a fast run-through (about an hour and a half) to finally get it.  But, other than that, everthing was great.  It took me a bit over 9 hours for my first run-through.  So, I'd say to wait for it to be priced at $9.99 or less to buy it.  Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986832049', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1470482162}
review: Dieses Spiel ist einfach ein Klassiker und jetzt auch noch hübsch aufgemacht, mit Erfolgen zum freischalten... herrlich. Musste es gleich durchspielen. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198024982599', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1470360911}
review:
Played this game for the first time after hearing it hailed as a classic, and it deserves it -- it holds up fantastically. From the very start it's designed to get you comfortable with all the mechanics and solving away. While the solutions to puzzles may not always make the most sense, they are all hilarious. Don't read a walkthrough without trying everything first! It's worth it for the gags.

Also, unlike other 'remastered' games, this one is a REAL remastering. All the animations and backgrounds seemed to be redrawn manually to really capture the cartoony spirit. And as usual for LucasArts, the characters and voice acting are top notch. The quintessential nerd, easygoing roadie, and unhinged medical student make a great cast for this time travel adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972601991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1632165564}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120860043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1468491462}
review: Nostalgische Erinnerungen werden wach bei der Remastered Version von DOTT. Grafisch aufgewertet ist dieses Spiel immernoch zeitgemäß und für den SPaß zwischendurch bestens geeignet. Persönlich würde ich mich freuen, wenn auch LucasArts Spiele von damals vielleicht mal ge-remastered werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047847408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1481307658}
review:
Hatte es auf meinem ersten PC -> 386er.
Habe es jedoch aus einen mir nicht mehr erfindlichen Grund bis dato NIE gespielt.

Obwohl nie etwas falsch ist, habe es dazumals erworben <hust>,  disketten eingesteckt, geladen und 5mins oder so getestet ob es funkt.

Muß das nun nachholen... in progress ;)

Ist definitiv empfehlenswert.

Kenne alle aus der 'Ron Gilbert' Reihe und dies ist neben Monkey Island Remastered ebenfalls eine geniale Umsetung.
Spiele es natürlich im Klasischen Modus ;)

Wie schon einige unter mir angemerkt haben ist es einfach einer DER Spiele-Klassiker aus der SCUMM Reihe ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561197970430735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1468712405}
review: Awesome! Just awesome! I felt like I was back in the 90s playing the game on my 386sx.
