author: {'steamid': '76561197976277892', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1459094829}
review:
Hach, das Spiel war Nostalgie pur! Lang, lang ist es her als ich irgendwann 1993 als junger kleiner Bub das Original spielte. Als großer Fan der Lucasfilm / LucasArts Adventures habe ich seinerzeit natürlich deren erstes Adventure Maniac Mansion und den genialen Nachfolger Day of the Tentacle gespielt. Das war damals ein echt großes Ding - sogar mit Sprachausgabe (ein Novum) ;)

Jetzt habe ich mich nochmals durch das Anwesen gekämpft und hatte viele schöne Momente, die mich an früher erinnerten. Allerdings musste ich auch ganz schön knobeln, da ich mich an die Rätsel im Detail eigentlich gar nicht mehr erinnern konnte. Und da ich aber den verdrehten Stil von LucasArts noch kannte, bin ich auch ganz gut weitergekommen. Wer nicht viel um die Ecke denkt, bleibt hier und da vielleicht ein wenig hängen. Die Rätsel sind zwar im Prinzip nachvollziehbar, aber eben auch recht abgedreht. 

Aber heutzutage ist das ja kein Problem mehr. Wer will kann ja im Internet nachschauen, solchen Luxus gab es damals noch nicht. Und ich habe mir wirklich öfters die Haare gerauft, weil ich einfach nicht weiterkam. :) Empfehlen würde ich habe nicht nachzuschauen, da sonst der Flair der Rätzel ein wenig verblast.

Technisch ist das Spiel nett gemacht, meiner Meinung nach ein zeitloser Comic Stil. Es sieht stimmig und atmosphärisch aus (typischer LucasArts-Stil), der Sound ist ok, die Sprachausgabe klingt allerdings doch ein wenig aufgesetzt und (unter heutiger Betrachtung) teilweise nicht gut. Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle wunderbar spielbar und sieht nicht aus wie ein Spiel aus der Mottenkiste. Als netten Gag kann man - wie auch schon bei den beiden neuen Versionen von Monkey Island - jederzeit mit F1 zur alten Originalgrafik (inkl. der ganzen typischen SCUMM-Verben) umschalten. Das gefällt - und alle jüngeren Spieler können mal sehen, welche Grafik wir damals gefeiert haben... :)

Jedem LucasArts-Fan kann man das Spiel wohl blind empfehlen. Meiner Meinung nach ist es aber auch komplett losgelöst davon wunderbar spielbar und einfach auch heute noch ein gutes Adventure.

Meine Wertung: 
Grafik: 8/10
Sound: 6/10
Umfang: 7/10
Atmosphäre: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197988076366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1493590840}
review:
Ahhhhh .. die guten alten Zeiten. Irgend wie fühle ich mich wieder einige Jahre jünger ;)
Wer den Klassiker noch einmal spielen möchte sollte sich die Remastered Version gönnen. Grafik und Sound sind an die heutige Zeit angepasst, man kann aber auch jeder Zeit auf die alter Pixelgrafik und den Piepssound mit F1 umstellen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299690769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1465990146}
review: I played this when it came out in the 90s and liked (not loved)it. But I remember then that I had to rely on a friend and a walkthrough to figure out a lot of the very random actions. Turns out I got older and that randomness is less fun. Still good humour and excellent 80s-ness, just less fun to play than I remembered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076200619', 'num_games_owned': 1699, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1469005846}
review:
I have very fond memories about Day of the Tentacle (DotT), back in the DOS days, Lucasarts was my favourite games company, their adventures were the best and their Star Wars games are pretty legendary in their own right. DotT is one of those games that was released when PC gained its status as superiour gaming platform. All previous adventures games still got released on multiple platforms (think Amiga etc), but not this one. It was also released on CDROM and the whole game features voice acting, pretty big deal back in the day.

And so, with rose tinted glasses I started playing this game, would it still be as good as I remembered it? Or would it turn out to be one of those classics that didn't age well, like a fine wine turning into vinegar. Well I can assure you, that none of the magic is lost. The game is still very much fun today, everything still stands, it only lost some of its freshness, but that was to be expected as it's a remaster that stays 100% faithfull to the original.

I'm also very happy that they did not change any of the graphics. When I learned that the Monkey Island series were rereleased, I was excited. Until I saw it at a friend of mine, that is when disappointment set in. They changed the graphics and the new graphics just didn't do it for me, in fact they were a big turn-off. If you never played the game before, you probably would have no issue with it, but the problem for me was that they changed too much. You could still play the original graphics, but what is the point of that? You could just as easily use ScummVM then.
This is not the case with DotT, the graphics have been retained. To be honest, the graphics had been retained as how I remembered them. There is a big difference, how we remember things is not how they really were, it's just our minds that make the memory more beautiful than it really is. In this case the remastered graphics just look like the originals with 100x Anti-Aliasing applied on them.

I was able to quickly finish the game as I still remembered a lot and the things i forgot were quickly figured out. You should not read any guides, as this will increase the enjoyment of an adventure game, the whole point is to figure these things out after all.

This game had a big impact on me as a youngster, I forgot how many things in the game I picked up in my vocabulairy and still use, though i completely forgot where they came from - this game!

Take this as you will, some guy has fond memories of an old game, the remastered version of said game is also liked by him. Does this mean it's a great game or that the guy is senile? That's up for you to decide when you're GOING BACK TO THE MANSION!

The game works flawlessly on SteamOS/Linux, the default Steam Controller setup is a bit weird, but ofcourse you can change it to your liking. Streams to the Steam Link without problems (great way to play the game btw).

author: {'steamid': '76561197975539033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1467915237}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971314809', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1589837952}
review:
I played this game in the 90s when I was budding gamer, and I have fond memories. I grabbed this game for $8.99 the other day basically for nostalgia. I wasn't sure if I'd actually like the game again - would I find it too silly? too easy? plain boring? BUT, it is actually a fun little puzzle game. I was cruising along for a while, half playing the game and half strolling down memory lane, and then I actually got stuck. I'll admit I've had to use google a couple times. Some of the puzzles actually make you think. My advice: click on EVERYTHING. Pick up ALL objects. Listen to what the people are saying - they often drop hints. Go back and re-explore areas - it's easy to overlook something that you thought was meaningless. As for the remaster side of things - it's perfect. The new graphics are how I remember the game looking back when graphics weren't superduperHD. The new controls are simple and easy, and the new sound is good.

All in all, this is a good remaster of a classic game. If you played this game in the 90s, I *definitely* recommend getting this.

review: Humour and geniously designed puzzles pack this wonderfully remastered version. Dev's commentary gives you insight of many interesting facts about this game and its technical limitations at the time of its making.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034498865', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1597502745}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game that is just amazing.

Storyline.Our story begins as 2 tentacles Green and Purple both are free from Dr Fred Edison and now planning a new life for  eachother however when purple tentacle jumps into comtaminated water he mutats and begins his plan to conquer the world its at this point Dr fred recaptures them and ties them up in his lab but Green sends a letter to Bernard for help Bernard with the help of his friends Leverne and Hoagie race towards the edison mansion once there they split up and Bernard releases both tentacles but Purple escapes. Dr Fred uses his Chron-o-John to teleport Bernard and his friends to the day before to turn off his sludge O matic machine which was responcable for purple's transformation however Dr freds fake diamond breaks trapping Leverne 200 years in the future and Hoagie 200 years in the past now its up to a unlikely truce between Dr fred and Bernard to get his friends back and stopping Purple tentacle from enslaveing the human race and conquering the world.

Gameplay.Its a classic point and click adventure where Bernard must collect items and share items with Hoagie and Leverne in order to progress combinding items and solving dialogue and phisical puzzles.

Graphics.The graphics in the game are great this remasterd version of a early ninties game is amazing it really feels like you're playing a saturday cartoon.

Sound and voice acting.Top class the sounds and the dialogue between the various charecters will leave you laughing theres is so many funny moments to mention truely a masterpiece.

Pro's.Great gameplay
         Great voice acting and sound
         Great graphics 
         Fun charecters and setting

Con's Sadly the game ends and wish its was longer


Conclusion.Should you buy this game yes if you love fun adventure games with a great story fun charecters and plenty of laughs then buy this if you dont enjoy these kind of games you are either new to gaming and missing out go get it.

Rating.9.5 out of 10

Trading card are avalible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974858281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1477327598}
review:
Great job DoubleFine remastering and porting the game to several platforms, including Linux. The remaster is extremely faithful of the original from mid 90s. It runs very smooth and it is as enjoyable as it was when I played this game for the first time more than 20 years ago.

I really wish the Double Fine guys would also remaster the Monkey Island saga (1 and 2 mainly), but I guess this is a bit too much daydreaming :)

Buy the game if you played it in your childhood. Buy the game if you haven't. You can't skip such a classic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198206213863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1468035979}

author: {'steamid': '76561198071231587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1468589884}
review:
This one is really a must get. Normally I am a bit ambivalent about re-Makes of game classics, but this one is done quite nicely. It completely retains the original atmosphere by just redrawing the original game with a better quality (unlike the very questionable re-makes of the Monkey Island Series). 
If you never played the game back in the day and want to get into late 80's/early 90's point and click adventures, this one is it. (The steam achievements don't hurt either.) 
For those of you who haven't played the original, the story line is quite witty (although some of the jokes might escape the non-US-american players, making the puzzles a bit weird at times).

review: This is absolutely the definitive version of the game. Is catches the spirit of the original (and lets you live it, too). Unfortunately I still knew too much about the game so I was able to finish it in 3 hours. Back in the day it took me weeks. Awesome weeks.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995140922', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1468500957}
review: Sometimes, all that's needed to make an old thing good again is a bit of the ol' spit shine, and credit where it's due to Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions for doing just that with the comical click adventure Day of the Tentacle. It was a whole lot of fun back then (the original game came out when I was a teenager) to explore the silly world they developed and I couldn't help but be amused at the myriad things you end up doing, such as getting revenge on a punch clown, seeing what really happened to Benjamin Franklin, and finding out your greatest ally in the future died thousands of years ago (trust me, everything is funnier than it sounds in-game). Plus you'll be pleased to know Day of the Tentacle's easter egg has been preserved here, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114249240', 'num_games_owned': 2107, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1618759320}
review: Pure Retro feeling  - even though some endings of the Maniac Mansion Version on Ed's PC seem bugged as they were in the original DotT - Bernards route works well though =D

author: {'steamid': '76561198058878811', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1468001722}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel letzte Woche zum ersten Mal gespielt und war direkt hin und weg. 
Als Aufgabe habe ich mir gesetzt das Spiel ohne Komplettlösung oder Hilfe zu spielen, um ein ähnliches Erlebnis zu haben wie das, von dem viele berichten, die dieses Spiel in ihrer Kindheit gespielt haben.
Manche Rätsel sind wirklich SEHR abgedroschen und ich habe auch Nachts im Bett immer überlegt, wie ich denn nur die nächste Situation lösen könnte - diese Erfahrung macht einfach Spaß.
Die Dialoge sind hevorragend geschrieben und ins deutsche übersetzt worden. Auch die deutsche Sprachausgabe kann man gut anlassen. Wenn man Englisch sehr gut versteht, kann man auch auf Englisch spielen, aber es gibt einige Wortspiele, die man mit nur durchschnittlichen Englischkentnissen nicht versteht. Beide Ausgaben sind gut.

(Vorsicht, Spoiler): 
Zu guter letzt muss ich noch sagen, dass ich am Ende dann doch etwas hing, weil ich einfach nicht auf die Idee kam, wie man die Plastikkotze von der Decke bekommt. Die Musikanlage hatte ich zwar angemacht und davon ging sie ja halb ab, aber ich dachte ich müsste irgendeinen Besenstil finden oder die Brechstange mit dem Kaugummi an irgendein anderes Item kleben, damit ich sie von der Decke kratzen kann. Ich wusste genau, was ich mit der Plastikkotze anfangen wollte, aber nicht, wie ich sie bekommen könnte. Da musste ich dann doch nachschauen :D 
Ich habe allerdings auch im Original-Modus gespielt, hatte also alle Aktionen immer verfügbar und keine ausgewählten Aktionen, wenn man ein Item angeklickt hat. Vielleicht hätte mir das geholfen, die Box umzustoßen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996931603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1468482575}

author: {'steamid': '76561197974810113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1631653015}
review:
Bueno, que tengo que decir sobre este juego.

Sin duda, una obra maestra por parte de la que fue la antigua Lucas Arts.

Tema a parte, hablando sobre los gráficos de la remasterización, puedo decir que actualmente los emuladores pueden dar unos gráficos y efectos muy buenos, por tanto en este punto el juego no gana mucho. Ya en su época este juego tenía muy buenos gráficos.
Respecto al sonido, yo lo jugué en versión original para MSDOS hace mucho, mucho mucho, mucho tiempo, entonces solo puedo decir que la música es exactamente igual y los mejores efectos se conseguían usando un controlador Sound Blaster Pro/16, por lo que todos aquellos que configuraban Adlib con MSDOS, perdían calidad y efectos.
Pero báiscamente conserva los mismos, exactamente igual que con el juego original.

Es de gradecer que a diferencia del original, obviamente por norma general en todos los juegos de la época, no hubiera voces en los personajes, y fuera todo con subtítulos. Esto es lo que han añadido de nuevo.

Un punto además positivo es que conserva el hecho de que se pueda jugar al original Maniac Mansion (desde el Pc en la habitación del hijo de Fred Edison en el presente), una característica que presentaba el juego original de antaño, pero totalmente en inglés.
Por tanto, técnicamente no compras un juego remasterizado, sino uno remasterizado y otro original, puesto que la versión de Maniac Mansion incrustada es la misma que la original salvando el sonido, que "simula" el sonido de Pc Speaker (solo que se oye por los altavoces de windows, por supuesto).

En cualquier caso, es un juego 100% recomendado para los amantes de aventuras gráficas, tanto de hoy como de ayer.
Espero que saquen una remasterización de juegos como Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, o The Last Crusade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061524642', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1678810826}

author: {'steamid': '76561198082836719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1465305466}
review: This is how remakes should be made! I know it's different from the original, but it doesn't make me pay any attention to that. The graphics are smoother versions of the originals, with all the great hand-drawn quality and no gimmicks, and the modernized controls make playing easier and give more room to the art. Really loved this game when it first came out, really love the Remastered version now. I highly recommend whether you've played the original for days or not at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133301700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1669375116}
review:
This is one of the very best games in video game history.
I played it in my childhood and now played it again after 20 years or so. Still remembered all the the things and managed to get from start to end in under 5 houres. Usually - if you are new to this game - you probably need more than 40 houres playtime to get to the end.
Btw. there are also possibilities of playing the old 1993 version of the game via Dosbox or ScummVM. But: those few Euros it costs on steam are completely worth this new version of the game. It has very pretty reworked graphics not giving up the original style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968804401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1468356201}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983794856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1468154752}
review:
Getting this remastered version of Day of the Tentacle is worth it. Not only have the backgrounds and sprites been redrawn to more closely resemble Peter Chan's original drawings and paintings, but the nutjobs working on this actually dug up all the audio tapes containing the voicework, re-digitalized them in higher quality, and then sliced and re-organized them and put them back into the game. Crazy. As in most of these Remastered game editions, you can switch to the old pixely graphics by pressing F1, which also switches you to more classical midi tunes instead of the slightly smoother music you get now.

My favorite addition, though, are the commentaries by the original team working on Day of the Tentacle. You'll get insight in how the game was made, and especially how they had to wrestle with the limitations forced on them by PC technology of the era.

It's a very lovingly done project, and while Day of the Tentacle isn't even my favorite Lucasarts adventure, I really enjoyed revisiting it like this. And if you're wondering, you can still play the entirety of Maniac Mansion inside this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035218858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1691705375}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964292858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1468872761}
review:
Einer DER Spiele-Klassiker meiner Kindheit; einer Zeit, in der Point&Klick-Adventures das Maß aller Dinge waren.

Meiner Meinung nach ein Spiel, welches man auf keinen Fall verpassen sollte. Adventure-typisches rätseln verbunden mit dem für diese Zeit einfach genialen Humor - zeitlos.

Klare Kaufempfehlung!

Schön, dass die Entwickler bei der Überarbeitung die Möglichkeit eingebaut haben, den "alten Look" einzuschalten. Das befriedigt den Nostalgiker. :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198075050082', 'num_games_owned': 2158, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1468056663}

author: {'steamid': '76561198103503798', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1467658262}
review:
Quanto à remasterização, o estúdio Double Fine fez um excelente trabalho. Tudo foi redesenhado e ficou ótimo em alta resolução, mas o estilo de arte original não foi alterado. Ainda é o mesmo "Day of The Tentacle" dos anos 90, porém com uma nova camada de tinta fresca. Mas se você não gostar dos novos gráficos, apenas aperte F1 a qualquer momento e reverta para o estilo antigo. Os diálogos ainda continuam com as vozes originais dos dubladores, o que é uma experiência nostálgica.

"Day of The Tentacle" é um jogo difícil de point and click que exige muita paciência e tempo livre (acredite, dá pra se perder facilmente nos objetivos do jogo), porém no final de tudo, apesar dos apesares que falei no início desse post, o jogo é bem legal.

Crítica completa: http://www.infogeekcorp.com/2016/03/day-of-tentacle-remastered.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197977195600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1617998747}
review:
Awesome, richtig gut und einfach nur geil remastered!
Wer Day of the Tentacle in der alten Version vor gefühlt 20 Jahren schon gespielt hat wird es absolut mögen. Sehr gelungene Überarbeitung von Interface, Texturen und sogar einem Menu.
Für interessierte und alte Hasen des Spiels kann man Kommentare während des spielens von den Entwicklern anhören.
Es lohnt sich zu kaufen und in Nostalgie zu schwärmen. :D Daumen hoch!
Euer PowerRager -> Youtube Kanal https://goo.gl/98Oso1

author: {'steamid': '76561197992319277', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2416, 'last_played': 1612638924}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978832484', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1558579415}
review:
Eka kerta kun tätä titteliä pelasin vaikka vartuin 80 ja 90-luvun seikkailupelien parissa. Jostain syystä tämä nimenomainen on jäänyt väliin. 

Kertakaikkisen loistava, hauska ja perinteinen ysäri seikkailu. Kaikki on viilattu viimeisen päälle uuteen uskoon aikaa ja vaivaa säästelemättä ja sen huomaa. Peli näyttää ja kuulostaa upealta.
Puzzlet ovat suurinpiirten kaikki täysin järkeviä ja pidemmäksi aikaa jumiin tuli jäätyä vain muutamia kertoja. Läpipeluuseen kului itseltä 5h.

Hienoa nähdä, että "kuollut genre" elää edes remasteroitujen pelien voimin.
Suosittelen lämpimästi myös nuoremmille polville!

author: {'steamid': '76561198012935998', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1467731892}
review: Einfach geiles Remastered, wer das Spiel noch von früher kennt  wird hier nix vermissen sondern einfach nur Spaß haben so wie es damals war alles ist gleich nur die Grafik und die Steuerung wurde verbessert aber man kann auch zur alten Grafik und Steuerung zurück schalten. Der Sound und die Deutsche Sprachausgabe gefallen ich kann es nur empfelen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060185354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1467834866}
review:
Was gibt es über DotT noch viel zu sagen?
Das Spiel selbst ist ein wohlbekannter Klassiker mit sehr witziger Handlung und liebevoll gezeichneten Grafiken. Die zu lösenden Aufgaben können dann und wann etwas knifflig sein, insbesondere für ältere Veteranen stellen sie aber kein großes Problem dar.
Die aufgehübschte Neufassung ist sehr gut gelungen. Trotz aufpolierter Grafik geht der Charme der Orginalgrafiken nicht verloren. Und wer dann und wann doch Sehnsucht nach dem Orginial-Feeling verspürt, kann ja im laufenden Spiel einfach umschalten. Das ist zwar nett, für mich aber ziemlich unnötig gewesen. :-D Ein nützliches neues Feature hingegen ist die Möglichkeit, anklickbare Bereiche sichtbar zu machen, indem man Shift gedrückt hält. Das erhöht die Spielbarkeit doch ungemein, da man nicht mehr den ganzen Schirm absuchen muss. Die überarbeitete Maussteuerung bei der man die möglichen Aktionen nach einem Rechtsklick auswählen kann, ist auch gut umgesetzt und entspricht gewohntem Standard.
Wie in der Originalfassung kann man auch wieder ManiacMansion spielen. Dort wurde allerdings außer dem Speicher-Menü nichts verändert, so dass der Unterschied zu DotT auf die Grafiken und den Spielkomfort bezogen noch größer ausfällt als früher. Ich denke, man muss schon alter Veteran sein, um sich diese nette Pixelschlacht noch einmal anzutun. :-D
Nettes neues Beiwerk sind die Achievements, die teilweise auf die ein oder andere Text-Perle hinweisen.

Alles in allem gibt es von mir für das kurzweilige (und auch leider viel zu kurze) Spiel eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Jeder, der witzige Click&Point-Adventures mag, sollte DotT haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093050932', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1523643547}
review: Ho giocato a questo gioco sul mio Pentium 100, qualcosa tipo 20 o più anni fa. Sino ad allora conoscevo solo giochi arcade o platform, per me fu una vera e popria rivoluzione. Mi si aprì un intero universo con le avventure gafiche targate LucasArts -pace all'anima sua- tanto che ancora oggi rimane, per me, la migliore software house per questo tipo di giochi. Ho comprato la versione remastered praticamente al day 1, fiducioso anche del fatto che è stato pubblicato da Double Fine. E non sono stato deluso. La DF ha fatto un lavoro magistrale, riportando il feeling del vecchio gioco alla perfezione. Spesso nei remastering viene fatto un lavoro dozzinale o vengono apportate modifiche che rendono il gioco troppo diverso dall'originale a livello di controlli, impedendo ai vecchi giocatori di ritrovare il feeling originale. Non è questo il caso: anche se il sistema di comandi è stato sostituito dal menù a scomparsa, la giocabilità rimane pari all'originale. Anzi sono stati apportati parecchi miglioramenti: risoluzione grafica adatta ai PC odierni ma senza perdere lo stile cartonesco dell'originle, miglioramento dei menù principali ed introduzione di contenuti extra ecc ecc. Credo di non sbagliare se consiglio a tutti i nostalgici di comprare questo gioco, è davvero il miglior modo per godersi una vecchia gloria del passato senza dover fare i conti con i contorni pixelati e le distorsioni dell'adattamento per i monitor odierni della versione originale per ScummVM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007963460', 'num_games_owned': 1329, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1463301107}

review:
27 minutes, five crashes.

Audio bugs, music loop errors, and after the first real 'moment' of the game (that I had to try many times to get to with crash2desktop) --- it hangs.

Not impressed. Back to SCUMMVM and the original disks. At least they freakin work.

Another Double Fine mess.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023055120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1467684325}
review:
Simply a classic. While it doesn't skirt all the pitfalls of classic era adventure games (some moon logic, a few confusing answers, and lots of backtracking), it contains so much charm that it's easy to forgive its few shortcomings.

The writing is fantastic, voice acting sublime and the whole romp is simply enjoyable. You can bang it out in a day, maybe two, depending on how stuck you get. But if you enjoy adventure games at all, this deserves a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971403117', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1467366760}
review: Many memories from my childhood trying to complete the puzzles. A wonderful remake with almost every detail exactly as it was in the 90s. I managed to remember many of the puzzles and could complete the game in around 4 hours. Great to see maniac mansion also included.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312497275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1662388716}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198020848508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1626385377}
review:
Ah la la, Day of the Tentacle, un classique incroyable de Lucasarts que je viens seulement de faire, en fait je n'ai pas beaucoup joué à ce genre de jeu étant un peu trop jeune à l'époque, ce genre de jeux n'était déjà plus à la mode dans les années 2000, et oui j'étais jeune dans les années 2000 et je n'ai pas connu le Club Dorothée ou certaines autres merveilleuses choses mais il y avait quand même Digimon, Pokémon et les jeux vidéos pour se rattraper ! Souvenez-vous de la trilogie du Samedi sur M6 ? Ou de la Nintendo 64 ou les jeux ne démarraient pas s'il y avait de la poussière dans la cartouche, d'Ocarina of Time et de son Open World (quoiqu'un peu vide du aux limitations cartouches mais passons), etc... 
Et je comprends très bien pourquoi ce jeu est devenu culte et a rendu Lucasarts ultra célèbre, tout a la classe, les graphismes sont incroyables et même si simplistes, ultra vivants, avec des couleurs ultra intenses, on a vraiment l'impression de participer à un cartoon interactif de la belle époque de la Warner, les Bugs Bunny, Bip Bip et Coyote, Sylvestre et Titi mènent l'enquête, etc... ou même les vieux Nickelodeon comme Hey! Arnold ou les Razmokets, etc...
La musique est elle aussi assez sympas quoique le MIDI ne m'excite plus trop en 2016 !
Des dialogues incroyables avec un niveau d'écriture dingue, des énigmes complétement barrées, j'en ai eu ras le bol assez rapidement, j'ai du utiliser une solution assez rapidement pour ne pas rester bloquer comme un con pendant 1000 ans. Un doublage incroyable et un humour devenu culte ! Petit défaut cependant, la fin qui selon moi aurait mérité bien plus d'attention, assez expéditive et un jeu trop court !
Pour ce qui est de ce Remaster, tous ne se valent pas, mon coups de coeur va pour ceux de Square Enix, les Kingdom Hearts ont d'excellent remasters pour ne citer qu'eux ! J'aime aussi les remasters de la série Sly de la PS2 ! 
La musique est toujours la même, mais les graphismes passent mieux en HD même si Double Fine a eu la main un peu forte sur les filtres graphiques, du beau travail ! 
Jouez-y ! C'est un ordre ! Un des meilleurs jeux de tous les temps ! Peut-être un peu trop overrated à mon goût ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198167255699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1467996085}
review:
I absolutely loved this game when it first came out, I played it many times over the years, I've played it so many times over the years that when I purchased the remastered version I pretty much knew what I doing all the way through the game! It's not just one game though as you get to play Maniac Mansion too (a game I loved on the NES) 
This game is full of nostalgia for me as it probably is for anyone that played it back in the 90's. For anyone who hasn't played it BUY IT, it's a great point and click, although the game is slightly short (but that might be due to how many times I played it when I was younger) it's well worth the money. 
Buy it and you'll love it =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024619791', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1559053744}
review:
A very fun cartoon adventure game.
It's a little short but there's enough there to kill an afternoon and to want to play through again to grab all of the achievements.
Might need a walkthrough on the first playthrough but try not to rely on one too heavily so you can still solve all of the puzzles for yourself and enjoy it more thoroughly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989202049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1523491643}
review:
Awesome game!  This is a game I have gone back to several times over the years and it was always one of my favourites growing up!  Thank you for the trip down memory lane.

Double fine did an awesome job on the remastering of this game, and it's very interesting switching back and forth between the original while you play through - quite the transformation!  The game looks great and has never played better!

Very excited to hear that they are also remastering Full throttle (Another AMAZING game!!!).  I hope Sam and Max hit the road get's some attention as well in the future!

review: Just as awesome as I remember the first time around.  You can even play the original Maniac Mansion.  Now I'm ready for a remaster of Full Throttle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049018927', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1467476516}
review:
Cara! Que nostalgia!

Cada fala, cada som, cada animação.
Jogando, fui lembrando quando eu instalava o jogo, em disket, e cada troca era uma emoção.

Na época eu era muito pequeno e não sabia o que eles falavam ou nem entendia a história direito, mas dessa vez tudo foi diferente.

A emoção em conseguir entender o que, na minha infância, eu não entendia e poder rir junto com cada jogada de humor que o jogo traz.

A remasterização do jogo tá muito bacana! De vez em quando eu apertava F1 para relembrar os pixels que me fizeram tão feliz.

Para quem jogou na época, como eu, é uma compra certa.

PS. Poderiam disponibilizar legenda em PT para quem não entende.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1560134564}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198315536606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1510023071}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198012662812', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1679758432}
review:
I have waited ages for this game to get the special edition treatment.  I spent ages on ebay looking for the original cd-rom version which i played many years ago.  Trying to play the cd version on my windows pc was a bit of a challenge without a program to simulate the os for the game.

I remember playing this game when it was 6 or 7 3 1/2" disc back in the 90s.

So to find this old classic on steam was great news to me.  No more trying to install floppies or using a extra program to get it to run.

So having not played this game for many years, I have to say it is still good, but the game is the same as the old one, apart from sharper looking graphics.  So after a 5 break since I last played this game.  It took me 3 hours to complete, this was pretty good considering I was playing the game from memory and not looking up the walk throughs.

I think the graphics on the special edition are sharper, but I don't think they are new drawings compared to Monkey Island Lechucks Revenge.

I don't know what this is going to do to the value of my cd version of the game as DOTT was pretty rare and difficult to find, so being available on steam will probably mean peope will no longer be after the physical version.

What I do miss about the game is the copy protection quiz, something where you had to make a battery up to match the page in the 16 page manual.

I just wondering if they are going to do, Sam and Max hit the road and Full throttle special edition, both which i have on the original cd-rom somewhere

author: {'steamid': '76561198080265345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1463335122}
review: Really fun game to play, and nice to look at. I enjoyed it very much. It made me happy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053855195', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1466767701}
review: One of the greatest point and click adventures games is back. It is short and sweet. I finished in one day (it took about 10 hours of actual game time to finish), but it felt the pefect length. The puzzles were not too easy or too tough. The voice acting is still hiliours after all these years. Pretty much everything that came out of Hoogie's mouth made me smile in not laugh outloud. The worst part about this game is that its going to be another year until Double Fine puts out Full Throttle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285237609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1465084057}
review: Very entertaining puzzle

author: {'steamid': '76561198080123161', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1467327765}
review:
For someone who really dislikes Point & Click games I liked this game overall. Since everyone was praising this classic and I never got to play it nor was interested in playing it, I struggled with buying it. In the end, I had some friggin frustrating moments , some facepalm moments and some moments, where I thought my game was broken and I was supposed to start over, which wasnt really the case, I was just stupid. The END.

I really like the voice acting (Played in english) the german subtitles, just for the heck of it, sucked. The translation was completely off, made no sense and sometimes even left out whole sentences.

Its nice to switch between the old and new graphic but for new people, the new graphic settings is pretty much the way to go! (especially the gameplay is way easier this way)
Overall, I enjoyed it. Tho it has no replay value for me personally but maybe for others.
Only reason for a replay are the achievements and some more dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965856467', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1467285701}
review: Hace más de 20 años ya disfruté jugando a esta grandisima aventura gráfica. Ahora con esta edición remastered he vuelto a disfrutar como un niño reviviendo toda la aventura con gráficos mejorados (de vez en cuando le daba a F1 para ver el aspecto del original por curiosidad). Habia puzzles de los que me acordaba y otros que me han atascado mucho, que ni me sonaban pero imagino que todo es exactamente igual que el original, claro. Al final lo he completado sin mirar ninguna guia, como debe de ser. A veces te desesperas pero ya forma parte de este tipo de juegos. Lo recomiendo mucho tanto a los que lo jugaron en su momento como a los que no. ¡Es una aventura mítica e imprecindible!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989050146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1467313658}
review: I've been waiting for this since the remastered versions of Monkey Island 1 & 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982039575', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1467617558}
review: Sah damal schon wunderschön aus, gibts heute noch besser! Witzig, fesselnd einfach ein netter zeitvertreib für groß und klein. Ist jedem zu empfehlen!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043676600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1646533578}
review: A very entertaining game bringing back to the early days of LucasARTS. I can't wait to see what other LucasARTS games Double Fine plans to remake. (Crossing my fingers for Sam & Max: Hit the Road)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972632885', 'num_games_owned': 936, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1467206601}
review: Growing up, this was one of my favourite adventure  games. I'm happy to say that that game is fully intact, with only a very impressive graphical and sound upgrade. The upgrades smooth everything out, but it's still the same game clearly inspired by old Warner Bros cartoons. Definitely worth getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026634493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1625311699}
review: This remastered version stays true to the original. It's a really funny point and click adventure game, a genre lost. If you played the original you could also enjoy some developer commentary to your gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081393670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1558809727}
review:
Wer das Spiel von früher kennt, wird nicht enttäuscht. Im Gegenteil.
Es ist ein perfektes Remake, alles genau so wie beim alten Spiel von früher, auch die deutsche Sprachausgabe ist gleich.
Sehr zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972941429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1467219504}
review: A faithful and technically sound remastering of a classic adventure game.  Well worth picking up regardless of whether you played the original.  Don't be afraid to have a walkthrough on hand if you get stuck, just try not to rely on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061412357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1542550372}
review:
Wohl eines der besten P&C Adventures aller Zeiten.
Leider konnte ich mich noch weitesgehend an das Original erinnern, sodass ich weitesgehend flüssig durch die Story "geschlittert" bin. Die graphische Aufarbeitung ist aber großartig gemacht und wer das Original nicht kennt und auf Point&Click steht, für den ist dieser Titel ein MUSS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964495539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1467127128}
review: Fun game just like I remembered from the old days

author: {'steamid': '76561198118281813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1466975495}
review:
[h1]DOTT[/h1]
Zu Day of the Tentacle braucht man ja nicht allzu viel sagen.

Das Remaster ist meiner Meinung nach sehr gut umgesetzt worden. Grafik, Sound und Steuerung sind aufgehübscht, verbessert bzw. vereinfacht worden. 
Alte Haudegen, die sich aber nicht mit der aufgehübschten Grafik, verbesserten Sound oder der vereinfachten Steuerung anfreunden können... Kein Problem! Einfach F1 drücken und schwups, macht man eine Zeitreise nach 1993 und kann DOTT mit Original Grafik, Original Sound und Original Steuerung genießen. Toll!

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Genau so und nicht anders muss ein Remaster aussehen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057606125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1466971949}
review:

If you like point and click, this is one of the must play classics, if you dont, this would be a perfect introduction to the gaunra. Highly recommend,

review: Overall its a pretty good looking and funny adventure but I have an issue, I played it about 4 hours and now I accidently added a stamp to a letter with a contract that was not signed. The stamp was gone after I signed the contract and now I cant play further because of the lost stamp

author: {'steamid': '76561198281409829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1706090364}
review:
I first played this game when I was a child and couldn't figure it out and had my brother help me. I remember installing it on the family PC with about six floppy discs! 

I waited for a long time for this remastered version to become available and I wasn't disappointed. I love this game. Even if it's not a nostalgic trip for you, it's so much fun and so odd that you can play it loads of times and still love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123425849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1466860394}
review: Great old school point and click game with a bit of humor and entertaining..

author: {'steamid': '76561198123207872', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1638004419}
review: Fantastic classic game. The ability to switch between remastered and original instantly is a great feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996921477', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1613862601}
review:
In meiner Kindheit habe ich regelmäßig die Lucas Arts Point & Click Abenteuer gespielt. Indiana Jones, Monkey Island, Vollgas und natürlich auch Day of the Tentacle, welches zu meinen lieblings Spielen gehörte. Der Humor in den Lucas Arts Titeln ist unvergleichlich und gibt es kein zweites Mal. Das Remake entspricht dem Original, nur eben das es grafisch aufpoliert wurde. Wer es nostalgisch mag, kann aber auch im Spiel auf die klassische Version umschalten. Man bekommt also die Neue und alte Version in einem. 

Auch positiv ist, das hier die deutsche Sprachausgabe vorhanden ist. Viele Hersteller verzichten ja inzwischen darauf, obwohl es diese im original Spiel gab. 

Wer das Spiel noch nicht kennt, sollte es sich auf alle Fälle anschauen, es ist jeden Cent wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993735213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1466776597}
review: Very well remade, just like the original but with none of the annoying interface issues of the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093511478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1555880275}
review:
This is an absolutely fantastic game! Believe it or not, this was the first game I ever played when I was about 3 years old (yes, I was really that young!) on the Windows 3.5 systems, and playing this again triggered good memories about the game which started it all off for me! 

The new generation of gamers need to try this, never mind your Call of Duty bollocks. This game will make you think!!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198049095231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1468910511}
review: Dette er en nyutgivelse jeg har gledet meg til å spille igjen, og det innfridde til fulle. Spillet er minst like godt som hva jeg husket fra midten av 1990-tallet, og remastringen er helt glimrende gjennomført. Skal jeg kritisere noe, må det være at en del av utfordringene er rimelig vanskelige å løse. Jeg hadde ikke klart det uten hjelp. Heldigvis har jeg originalutgivelsen komplett med tipshefte, men det er lett å finne tips på nettet også.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285402138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1465871687}
review: Si eres de los años 80 como yo este juego lo disfrutarás como un niño pequeño (o más bien, como el niño pequeño que eras cuando lo disfrutaste por primera vez) es una de las mayores obras maestras del mundo de las aventuras graficas. divertido, con argumento original... y con "sentido",, es de los pocos  juegos que realmente cada objeto que usas saben donde y porqué lo estás usando (no como muchos otros que terminas teniendo que usar cada objeto de tu inventario al azar en cualquier cosa de la pantalla hasta que suene la flauta).  ¡¡¡compradlo y disfrutadlo!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048457979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1466877718}
review: Ho nostalgie quand tu nous tiens ça fait du bien de se casser la tete dessus. je le recommande biensur pour les anciens et pourquoi pour passer un petit moment à se gratter la tete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129856140', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1465051955}
review:
My favorite point-and-click all time.
The remastered version gives the original story with better graphics and some extras like developers' commentary.
If you do not know this game (it is a real old-timer from 1993), you have to try it.
If you know, you have to play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011846236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1508609510}
review: Really happy to played this game again. Great remake. I hope they will (re)make more oldies like this. I wish they would remake the leisure suit larry series (not the first one, thats already there), or the orginal Maniac Mansion, or Indiana Jones and the last crusade, or space quest 3 (the part i loved the most) etc. I was still a kid playing this games back then but I would buy this game now a days directly if they come available. Finding DOTT remastered was a big suprise for me and I really want to thank te makers for the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970312142', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1479999633}
review:
[h1] Review Day of the Tentacle Remastered [/h1]

Hach, das Spiel war Nostalgie pur! Lang, lang ist es her als ich irgendwann 1993 als junger Erwachsener das Original spielte. Als großer Fan der Lucasfilm / LucasArts Adventures habe ich seinerzeit natürlich deren erstes Adventure Maniac Mansion und den genialen Nachfolger Day of the Tentacle gespielt. Das war damals ein echt großes Ding - sogar mit Sprachausgabe (ein Novum) ;)

Jetzt habe ich mich nochmals durch das Anwesen gekämpft und hatte viele schöne Momente, die mich an früher erinnerten. Allerdings musste ich auch ganz schön knobeln, da ich mich an die Rätsel im Detail eigentlich gar nicht mehr erinnern konnte. Und da ich aber den verdrehten Stil von LucasArts noch kannte, bin ich auch ganz gut weitergekommen. Wer nicht viel um die Ecke denkt, bleibt hier und da vielleicht ein wenig hängen. Die Rätsel sind zwar im Prinzip nachvollziehbar, aber eben auch recht abgedreht. 

Aber heutzutage ist das ja kein Problem mehr. Wer will kann ja im Internet nachschauen, solchen Luxus gab es damals noch nicht. Und ich habe mir wirklich öfters die Haare gerauft, weil ich einfach nicht weiter kam. :)

Technisch ist das Spiel nett gemacht, wenn auch keine Offenbarung. Es sieht stimmig und atmosphärisch aus (typischer LucasArts-Stil), der Sound ist ok, die Sprachausgabe klingt allerdings doch ein wenig aufgesetzt und (unter heutiger Betrachtung) teilweise nicht gut. Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle wunderbar spielbar und sieht nicht aus wie ein Spiel aus der Mottenkiste. Als netten Gag kann man - wie auch schon bei den beiden neuen Versionen von Monkey Island - jederzeit mit F1 zur alten Originalgrafik (inkl. der ganzen typischen SCUMM-Verben) umschalten. Das gefällt - und alle jüngeren Spieler können mal sehen, welche Grafik wir damals gefeiert haben... :)

Jedem LucasArts-Fan kann man das Spiel wohl blind empfehlen. Meiner Meinung nach ist es aber auch komplett losgelöst davon wunderbar spielbar und einfach auch heute noch ein gutes Adventure.

[b] Meine Wertung: [/b]
Grafik: 7/10
Sound: 5/10
Umfang: 8/10
Atmosphäre: 10/10

[b] Spielspaß: 87% [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983436072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1559707267}
review: This is one of my favorite games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060821109', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1460109487}
review:
A fantastic remastering of my all-time favorite point-and-click adventure game. A significant portion of my youthful gaming time was spent on LucasArts and Sierra adventure games, but DOTT was always my favorite and this version is stellar. The updated art is fantastic, the sound quality is solid, and everything ran well. I will absolutely continue to buy all of the remasters of old LucasArts adventure games if they maintain the quality that is present here and in the Monkey Island remasters.

So what if you don't have a nostalgic love of this game from 20 years ago or even a love of point-and-click adventure games? You should still play it. If for nothing else, the story and characters are entertaining enough to warrant a playthrough. Most of the jokes still made me laugh and it's just a fun world to be in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969263005', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1688747414}

review: Loved this back in the day so I had to buy the remastered version.  While I still love it, I'm not sure that it would be tons of fun for someone who is playing it for the first time.  I'd say that if you love lucasarts adventure games, you'll more thank likely enjoy it.  Excellent remake!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972068186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1601720531}
review: One of the best adventures ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029166068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1465741054}
review:
This is an excellent remaster of this original Gem from LucasArts. Although DotT was never my top favourite game from them, it was more than pure enjoyment to play it again, and also realize how much I forgot in the puzzles.

Anyone who wants to play one of the really great Adventure games from yesteryear or wants to relive this experenice with proper graphis that do not turn into post stamps on your new shiny Ultra 10K monitor. This is it.

highly recommended.

Oh and please do "Sam & Max" next ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198063519158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1464806035}
review:
A perfect remaster for an old classic point and click game that has not lost nor its humous nor its cartoonist charm and, despite being over 20 years old appears, thanks to this remastered version, fresher and more enjoyable than lots of recent titles.
Perhaps a bit quick to solve and finish (but was it because it was not the first time I faced the different puzzles, and reminded well despite the past time?), however how pleasant to deal again with this cartoon story full of humour and funny little puzzles to solve…
If you played it in its original version, and remember you enjoyed it, well I would say that it is well worth the money to replay and remind the joy of it through a worthy remastered interface; and if you didn’t, don’t hesitate to try it and face with the “hard duty” to save the world from an insane tentacle, when being characters… well… far from usual heroes…!

author: {'steamid': '76561198277551435', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1465715834}
review:
Aventura gráfica old school. 
PROS:
           - Corta pero muy divertida.
           - Remasterización muy bien hecha, con opción de jugar con gráficos, sonido y control originales sólo pulsando un botón. 
           - Incluye Maniac Mansion a modo de minijuego.
           - Diálogos hilarantes y trofeos desternillantes.
CONTRAS:
           - No es un tipo de juego para todos los públicos.
           - Minijuego Maniac Mansion en inglés.
           - Algunos puzzles son muy complicados.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046911536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1464976005}
review:
its really worth the money its a classic but if your not a fan of point and click adventures then you should pass.
its not too hard but there are a few things that are almost imposible to guess so don't be afraid to experiment,

there are a lot of jokes and charm to it but i recommend that you set it to old school art, it looks a little werid with the animation on the remasterd art setting you also get a hint of how it felt back then with the old school art.

you also get a second game Maniac Mansion .hey we heard you like playing adventure games so we putted a adventure game in your adventure game so now you can play a adventure game while your playing a adventure game. but just so its said Maniac Mansion is one of those older first types of adventure games type so its harder and got some dead ends if you do something wrong but don't worry there are no dead ends in the main game Day of the Tentacle. but there are diffrent endings on Maniac Mansion and you can choose characters in Maniac Mansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117869991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1465287721}
review:
A nostalgic trip with updated graphics. Played this back in the DOS-era, and it was marvellous. It's still great, although for different reasons (grasp of English and various references was a bit weaker then I reckon).

The puzzles are, for the most part, suitably coherent. There're some that seem way off base, but I guess YMMV. The humor is excellent, but that is to be expected.

I wish they did more of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138837554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1465138218}
review:
Ich erinnere mich daran wie ich als Kind viele Stunden mit diesem Spiel verbracht habe um alle Puzzle zu lösen. Weswegen es mich sehr überrascht hat, dass ich nach über zwanzig jahren nur vier Stunden gebraucht habe, und dass pbwohl ich mir noch Zeit gelassen habe um mir die meisten Dialoge, die ich immer noch sehr witzig finde, zu lesen. Natürlich konnte ich mich auch noch an die meisten Rätsel erinnern, was das ganze erheblich beschleunigt haben dürfte.

In meiner Erinnerung sah die Grafik damals so gut aus wie die in der remastered Version, aber im direkten Vergleich ist der Unterschied doch enorm. 
Eine große Verbesserung ist, dass das Eingeben des Codes aus dem Handbuch entfält. Vielleicht kam mir die Spielzeit damals deshalb so viel länger vor.
Die Sprachausgabe ist zwar etwas hölzern, was bei einer deutschen Synchro leider keine Seltenheit ist, aber die Stimmen an sich sind sehr passend und vor allem Dr. Fred klingt genau so wie ich es mir vorgestellt habe.

Nur für eine nostalgische Reise in die Vergangenheit (hehe), sind die 14,99€ doch recht teuer, finde ich, aber wenn es im Angebot ist würde ich den Kauf schon empfehlen. Immerhin bekommt man auch noch Maniac Mansion dazu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978266558', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1568221616}
review:
I went in to this game a little skeptical since I'd never player it at release and the design in some older adventure games has aged poorly. Turns out this is actually the masterpiece that everyone has always said it is, no nostalgia required!

After a short intro the game opens up a dozen rooms that can be explored in the past, present, and future. Most of the items in your inventory can be sent across time periods to solve puzzles, while others are done by taking actions in the past that change the future. It's easy to make forward progress and everything is rewarded with beautiful cartoony animations. The amount of detail in the visuals and audio must have been insanely expensive at the time and is a rare treat.

My biggest gripe is that eventually you'll hit the wall of not being able to make progress with no hint system or obvious direction. Why do you read a boring book to a horse to make it fall asleep? Maybe there's a joke or reference there I'm missing, but it doesn't seem to make any sense without looking it up. It's also annoying, and hopefully not intentional, that the game has 3 different sets of false teeth that could be interchangeable, but are all used for completely different solutions.

The UI overhaul works great and really streamlines problems with the old verb system. And of course you can flip between the old and new at any time to compare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036517709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1610806882}

review:
Played the original back in the 90s. This is perfect. I also like the F1 graphics render option so it looks exactly like it did in the 90s. I might play it though like that after this first play through, but I'm currently likely the updated graphics.

The puzzles maybe not to some peoples liking as some of them aren't logical but they are all funny and maybe because I remember most of them from back in the day, it holds a nostalgia feel.

I still say this is a must buy but it holds more to me and the people that played it back in the 90s than it might to new players.

TIP- Listen to the dialogue throughout as it will give you hints on solving the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044983093', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1464965893}
review:
[h1]A perfect remaster for a nearly perfect adventure game[/h1]

This game was formative for me. Not only was it the first adventure game I played, it also introduced me to a lot of American cultural staples. And its humour helped shape mine.

DOTT is a sort-of-sequel to Maniac Mansion, an older game (which is playable inside DOTT, by the way!). Friends Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie must travel back in time - courtesy of a shoddy time machine by Dr Fred - to prevent Purple Tentacle from gaining super intelligence (and arms!) and conquering the world. Instead, our three protagonists are accidentally scattered across time - far past, present and far future - and have to both rescue themselves and accomplish their original goal.
That's a summary of the silly premise, and the game is just as silly.

How that translates in terms of gameplay is that you have three playable characters occupying the same space - a motel where the events of the game take place - but at different periods in history. You control all three, solving puzzles, sometimes affecting the future, and sending items back and forth among them via the time machine.
This all makes your typical point-and-click puzzle solving a bit more interesting, as you need to think about what all three characters need and remember what items and NPCs and puzzles each version of the motel contains.

As for this modern remaster, I'm very happy to say they did an excellent job. It is basically how we imagine the original version in our minds. The music is also remastered, but I prefer the original. Lucky for everyone, the original art and music (and interface) are included and can be mixed and matched at will. I played modern art & interface with original music.

[b]What I enjoyed[/b]
[list]
[*]Triple the playable characters, triple the puzzles, triple the inventory, etc.
[*]Cartoony, funny, and not obnoxious (you hear that, Deponia?)
[*]The remastered art is excellent, making the whole game widescreen and crisp looking.
[*]The new radial action menu is a huge improvement on the old action bar, allowing for faster play while keeping the variety of options that give you all sorts of fun dialogue.
[/list]
[b]What I didn't like[/b]
[list]
[*]This being an early 90s adventure game, the puzzles can be nonsensical sometimes - you have to apply "comedy logic" to some of them, which can get frustrating.
[*]All the things you have to do across all the characters can get a bit overwhelming sometimes and you might forget what to do next. I'd suggest playing this game in as few sessions as possible, because you will forget stuff otherwise. Maybe take notes.
[/list]

I just relived a piece of my childhood, and it was just as good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007240790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1615881762}
review:
I cannot believe my good fortune that this game popped up on my screen the moment I logged into Steam today. This (and LucasArts' Indiana Jones: The Fate of Atlantis) was my favorite DOS game of all time back in the 90's so I bought this immediately. I'm pretty sure I still have the original CD lying around somewhere. If I find it, i'll upload it in the Artwork section for the game.

Needless to say, nostalgia can be a cruel mistress, especially nostalgia from 3 decades ago. Not so in the case of LucasArts DOS games. His company's products were always ahead of their time. I personally feel that the cartoonish graphics of this game still hold up today (and they did a great job with the remastering!), and from what I remember, the puzzles in this game were not only challenging (not impossibly so) but there was a lot to do and figure out. And they were [i]interesting[/i] puzzles. I still remember how it took me forever to figure out how to get the fake rubber barf off the ceiling. Awesome! I now had fake barf in my possession! Now what do I do with that!? xD

The voice acting was also superb. Instead of always using the bland, "I can't do that." or "That won't work." kind of line when trying to figure out object combinations and placements, you are greeted with lines like, "My therapist told me I'm not allowed to play with sharp objects." followed by maniacal guffawing. These are the kinds of things that stick with you and add so much charm to this game.

So, the basics:

[quote]This game is the sequal to the 1987 game Maniac Mansion and takes place 5 years after the events of the first game. It is a single-player point-and-click adventure that originally came out in 1993. You do not need to have played the first game in order to enjoy or understand the events in this one.

Plot:

There are two living, breathing tentacles that are wandering around. Purple Tentacle ends up drinking some radioactive sludge that mutates him into having arms so he feels he can now take over the world. His brother, Green Tentacle, tries to stop him and ends up having to contact the mad scientist that lives in the mansion. Once the three main protagonists arive on the scene, the mad scientist asks for their help and convinces them to get into Port-O-Potty time machines to prevent Purple Tentacle from drinking the sludge in the first place.

Something goes terribly wrong and the three main protagonists get sent to three different points in time. The "Dude Brah", named Hoagie, gets sent about 200 years into the past to colonial America times, Bernard stays in the present and the deranged medical student, Laverne, gets sent about 200 years into the future where the world is now controlled by the evil Purple Tentacle's rule and humanity has been enslaved. All three have to work together, yet separately, in order to help each other out by sending objects back and forth to each other through the Port-O-Potty time machines. In doing so, they are not  only trying to get back to their own original timeline but also trying to prevent Purple Tentacle from taking over the world,[/quote]

The premise sounds silly but it's such a fun romp through an interactive Saturday Morning Cartoon where the humor from the 90's was at it's best (There's also a computer in the mad scientist's room where you can play the original 1987 Maniac Mansion on it, right inside this game. I do so hope they kept that in this remastered version).

This game is absolutely worth the full asking price. But if you see it on sale, snatch it up in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132826449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1484412111}
review:
[b][h1]Meine Review zu "Day of the Tentacle Remastered"[/h1][/b]

[b][u]Vorwort[/u][/b]
Day of the Tentacle habe ich bereits in meiner Kindheit sehr geliebt. Als ich dann erfur, dass es ein Remake geben wird war ich natürlich voller Vorfreude. Natürlich hatte ich auch bedenken, da nicht jedes Remake gut ist (Bsp.: Monkey Island 1 und 2 Special Edition: Die Spiele kann man zwar in der Retro und in der neuen Version spielen, jedoch wurde die Retro Version nicht übersetzt und die Grafik der überarbeiteten Version ist sehr gewöhnungsbedürftig). 
Jedoch sind alle meine Bedenken unbegründet. Ich bin vom Remake begeistert!

[b][u]Über das Spiel[/u][/b]
Day of The Tentacle ist der zweite Teil der klassischen Point & Click Reihe "Maniac Mansion" von Lucas Arts. Das Spiel punktet mit sehr viel Humor und einigen Easter Eggs. Zudem befinden wir uns in der Bekannten Pension aus Teil 1 und es gibt bekannte Charakter (Spielbare: Bernard, Nicht Spielbare: Dr. Fred, seine Frau Schwester Edna und sein Sohn Ed Edison). In diesem Remake dieses Spieles kann man zwischen der Retro Version und der neuen HD Version mit der F1 Taste wechseln. Zudem gibt es nun auch Entwicklerkommentare.

[b][u]Story[/u][/b]
Dr. Fred Edison hat die Chemikalien seiner Matsch Maschine in den Fluss vor dessen Pension geschüttet. Purpur Tentakel (ein von Fred Edison erschaffenes Tentakelwesen) trinkt diese Chemikalien und Mutiert zu einem bösen Wesen, dass die Weltherrschaft an sich reißen will. Aus diesem Grund will Dr. Fred die Tentakel (auch den guten Grün Tentakel) töten.
Bernard, Laverne und Hoagie, die gemeinsam in einer WG wohnen, erfahren davon durch einen Brief von Grün Tentakel. Zu dritt fahren sie zu Dr. Fred's Pension um die Tentakel zu befreien. Doch durch das Befreien flieht Purpur und schmiedet Pläne für die Weltherrschaft.
Damit Purpur Tentakel erst gar nicht diese Chemikalien trinken kann, werden die 3 in die Vergangenheit teleportiert um zu verhindern, dass die Chemikalie in den Fluss geschüttet wird. Doch bei der Zeitreise geht einiges schief und ein witziges Abenteuer beginnt...

[b][u]Steuerung[/u][/b]
Je nachdem ob man die Klassische oder die neue Variante spielt ist die Steuerung etwas anders. In der klassischen Variante befindet sich links unten die Interaktionsbox, rechts unten das Inventar. In der HD Version befindet sich das Inventar unten links, wenn man mit der Maus in die linke Ecke des Bildschirms fährt. Eine Interaktionsbox gibt es hier nicht mehr. Mit dem Mausrad wählt man zwischen den verschiedenen Interaktionen und mit der linken Maustaste führt man diese aus.

[b][u]Rätsel[/u][/b]
An den Rätseln wurde in der HD Version nichts geändert. Dies finde ich persönlich sehr gut. Die Rätsel sind im Grunde einfach bis knifflig. Im Spielverlauf muss man ab zwischendurch Objekte unter den Charakteren tauschen. Dies geht einfach in dem man das Chron-O-John benutzt oder das Objekt mit dem Bild des jeweiligen Charakters benutzt.


[b][u]Musik und Sound[/u][/b]
Die bekannte Musik des Klassikers ist geblieben, wurde nur etwas überarbeitet. Im Menü kann man auswählen ob man die Musik des Remakes oder die klassische Musik wählen will, oder jeweils die Musik des Spieles will. Wählt man automatisch so hat man die jeweilige passende Musik der Versionen. 
Zudem wurde auch die alte, deutsche Synchro beibehalten. Dies ist für mich ein großer Pluspunkt.

[b][u]Grafik[/u][/b]
Auch das Spiel- und das Charakterdesign des Spieles wurde beibehalten. Lediglich wurde die klassische Pixelgrafik aufgefrischt und in ein modernes HD Design verändert. So bleibt auch in der HD Version der Erkennungswert des Spieles erhalten.

[b][u]Fazit[/u][/b]
Bis auf die HD Grafik, der etwas bearbeiteten Musik und der etwas umgestellten Steuerung in der HD Version wurde an dem Spiel nicht viel verändert, auch die alte Synchro wurde beibehalten. Die Rätsel sollten jedem Nostalgiker noch gut bekannt sein. Allgemein sind die Rätsel nicht sehr schwierig.
Für alle Nostalgiker, die das Originalspiel auf den neuen Rechnern nicht mehr spielen können ist das Spiel ein Pflichtkauf. Aber auch Neueinsteiger des Point & Click Genres, die z. B. die Daedalic Spiele lieben werden bei diesem Remake viel Spaß haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967112346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1709178232}
