author: {'steamid': '76561198001597265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1465686501}
review:
Oh man. Such a great game, a remastered version of an old classic wich stands amongst the games i enjoyed the most. The remastered version is absolutely beautiful, and if you prefer the old nostalgic experience you can switch between each on the fly with f-1. 

Pro's: 
* Remastered version is beautiful and stays extremely faithfull to the original. 
* Classic version's graphiqs are available.
* Great voice acting, as with the cd-rom version of the game.
* Game holds up well to the test of time. Even without the nostalgia goggles, this is a great game.
* Classic maniac mansion game available from within the game.
* Smart puzzles and humor.
* Charming.

Negatives: 

* Game is short if you know what to do.
* Might be expansive to people who are not aware of the game from back in the days. If that is the case, wait for a sale if you must.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971495933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1459012263}
review: Well, I guess there isn't much to say. It's Day of the Tentacle - one of the best and funniest adventure games ever made, remastered. Might not be as enjoyable to totally new players but I've liked it since the original release 1993. The remake is a solid homage to the classic. It even has in-built Maniac Mansion in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985827660', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1644440129}
review:
One of my favorite games of my childhood, and a great example of how a remastered game should be. It also includes Maniac Mansion (my all time favorite adventure game), but unfortunately unremastered and without save game option (you must use different saves in DOTT in order to have more than one MM saved state, a real shame considering that MM has four different endings depending on what kids you choose and/or what you do ingame). Anyway, the point is that they did a great job remastering this masterpiece and worth every penny it costs. Thank you Double Fine, from the bottom of my heart.

EDIT: I just realized that they've fixed the MM savegame system issue. Now are separate things, so MM saves no longer depend on DOTT saves. Better yet, now you have multiple-save slots plus the autosave system. Now it's just... PERFECT.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969775260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1534585149}
review: Da kommen Kindheitserinnerungen auf! Ein klassiker den man einfach haben muss wenn man in den 90ern groß geworden ist. Ich weiß noch damals, die Grafik war bei weitem nicht so gut wie heute, immer wieder hat es am Bildschirm geruckelt und im Computer gerattert, dennoch hab ich hier nur gute erinnerungen an das Spiel. Nach knapp drei Stunden spielen war ich durch. Geschockt war ich denn ich hab nicht mitbekommen wie die Zeit vergangen ist. Alles in allem wurde hier etwas richtig gutes gemacht, ein altes Klassiker-Spiel, was man einfach haben muss, neu aufgesetzt ohne das Veränderungen vorgenommen wurden oder "Verbesserungen", die den Flair zerstören würden. Die 10€ ist das Spiel auf jeden fall wert! Ich hoffe natürlich das jetzt auch noch weitere alte Spiele Remastered werden, wie z.B. das alte Sam & Max - Hit on the Road mit dem großen Wollkneuel oder das alte Kings Quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004463594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1487862534}
review: Nostálgicos y amantes de las aventuras gráficas, poder volver a disfrutar de este juegazo pero a un nivel gráfico un poco más acorde con el día de hoy es una gozada. Y para aquellos que no lo jugaron, es una buena oportunidad para conocer un juego que rompió moldes dentro del género. Además, si eres de los que preferían la versión antigua, sólo con pulsar una tecla durante el juego, cambias entre ambas versiones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972364092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1460899562}
review:
DOTT is probably one of Lucasarts' finest adventures. I have so many fond memories of playing this game way back in the day on my dad's PC.

So, how is the remastered version, you wonder? In one word: perfect. I like the remastered art and the improved music (basically better instrument samples). The art is in a higher resolution and keeps all of the design and style of the originals art intact. This is nothing like the Monkey Island 1 and 2 remasters. The optional commentary is interesting and integrated well into the game. As was promised, you really can mix and match options to play the game in the way you prefer. Want the old graphics, interface and sound? No problem!

I heartily recommend DOTT Remastered. This is how you remaster a classic adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971168490', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1459442099}
review:
For me the original Day of the Tentacle (sometimes called Manic Mansion 2) was the best point and click adventure game of the 90's; with the second best being Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis or the Curse of Monkey Island, or wait Beneath a Steel Sky was great too.. man there were so many great games in the 90's.  

Much of the plot and steps needed in the puzzles came flooding back as soon as I started playing, but for those not aware or familiar with the original should expect mind bending puzzles but a good and enjoyable time with a lot of laughs.  
The game doesn't hold your hand like modern titles.  You'll need to think on wild tangents.. How to get George Washington to cut down a kumkuat tree for you?.. of course paint it red, he likes cutting down cherry trees (apparently).

This remastered version of the game is faithful to the original even down to the playable version of Maniac Mansion hidden inside.  I never completed the "enhanced" PC version of Maniac Mansion which I got for a birthday in the late 80's; but during my DotT playthough have finally completed it. 

You could probably still find walkthroughs of the game online if needed and blast your way though the entire game in 2 hours.  But I'd say stay clear of the walkthroughs unless you get completely stuck.  It took me about 7 hours to complete DotT and Manic Mansion.

This trip down memory lane was easily worth the price of the game, but even for new players I would recommend it.

More fun than a jump-suit full of weasels. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198003272012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1709415391}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a great point and click game made by LucasArts. It fits into the same category of the original Monkey Island series. The remake is extremely great, especially the graphics. If you enjoyed the special edition of Monkey Island then this game I would highly recommend. Here is a list about the characteristics of the remake.

A. Gameplay - The gameplay is exactly the same as original. A puzzle to solve, decide what you need to get or do. Try to execute your decision, works or doesn't work.
B. Death - LucasArts games usually don't allow you to die like a first person shooter. If you don't solve the puzzle that fast, then no big deal. Just try something different with the item or action.
C. Humor - There is much humor in this game that ranges from the 90s, silly actions in some spots, and ridiculous dialogue.
D. Time - This game can be won in a single day or less if you already know how to solve the puzzles. I played it hundreds of times when I was a kid so remembering the puzzles from the past made me win the game in about 1 day. If you are new and have a difficult time or if you hit a roadblock you can save and come back.
E. Graphics - The remake turns the pixelated look into a great cartoon feel. The cartoon feel is smooth and nice.
F. Achievements - The remake has some silly achievements that you can get. Some of them just make you laugh.

Overall, the remake is great. I may be a tad biased because I loved this game as a kid but for the newer generation of players it can still be a laugh. Some jokes the younger generation may not get but it is still great fun.

review: I have such positive nostalgia for this game. It was one of the first PC games I ever played when I was a kid and getting to play it again 20 years later is so special to me. Everything is just how I remembered it; the updated art looks great! My illustraion instructor from my school actually helped remaster some of the animations which is pretty cool. I love the Monkey Island references; those were something I didn't pick up on when I was younger, even though I later went on to play that seires. If you don't like story /puzzle driven point and click adventure games, this may not be your thing but I love love love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990262691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1586754564}
review:
"Viajes por el tiempo, científicos locos, tentáculos, hamsters criogenizados, los padres de la patria, tres personajes jugables; Day of the Tentacle (DoTT a partir de ahora) lo tiene todo.

Esta es la continuación de Maniac Mansion, la aventura gráfica creada por Ron Gilbert y Gary Winnick en 1987. Cinco años después fueron Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer quienes tomaron la posta y cambiaron radicalmente la esencia de la saga.

En Maniac Mansion podíamos elegir a los personajes; en DoTT ya están preseleccionados, algo que permitió a los escritores poder crear una historia mucho más desarrollada y sin igual.

Pero ya basta de comparar, hablemos de DoTT haciendo de cuenta que estamos en 1993...."

Review completa en: http://www.checkpointvg.com/?page_id=7787

author: {'steamid': '76561198029592043', 'num_games_owned': 1218, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1608898887}
review:
Mir ist letzens noch dieses Spiel in meinen Gedanken gerufen wurden.
Dann ein Tag später war hier in Steam die Remstered Edition .
Ich wusste nicht das es Remaster wird deso Glücklicher war ich das ich das gesehen habe also nicht lange überlegt und sofort zugelegt.
Auch wenn fast 10 Jahre her ist als ich das Spiel gespielt habe war ich begeisert und fühlt mich direkt woll mit diesen Spiel ,dieses Alte Gefühl von früheren Zeiten und doch alles so neu und aufgefrischt das ich garnicht aufhören konnte dieses Spiel zu spielen. Ich war so begeistert wieviele Erinnerungen mir wieder ins Gehirn gekommen sind und dann wieviel ich mich noch Erinnern kann wieviele Kombination mir noch bekannt waren und trotzdem gabs paar Sachen wo ich doch bisschen nachdenken musste. Viele Stellen wo ich lachen musste und viele Stellen die ich als Kind wahrscheinlich garnicht verstanden habe aber heute deso lustiger finde. Ich bin froh das ich mir dieses Spiel geholt habe und nochmal durchgespielt habe ich hoffe das bald auch noch Manic Manison rauskommt als Remaster und Sam&Max.
Für jeden Spieler der dieses Spiel früher gekauft hat ein muss es sich nochmal zu holen weil Klassik ist einfach Klasse :)
Danke Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561197972271628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1666060241}
review:
Threw my wallet at the screen immediately when I saw this. That didn't do anything, so I entered my Paypal information and that seemed to do the trick.

The remastered visuals and music are lovely and totally faithful to the original, and when you hit F1 it changes the game back to its classic pixelated soundblaster goodness (which I still prefer).  It's exactly as I remember it when I was a prepubescent child, only now the sound doesn't skip like crazy and I didn't have to install six floppy disks.  The additional commentary is also enjoyable to listen to and gives a lot of incite on the development of this legendary title.

As for the game itself?  It's a classic.  It's what put Tim Schafer on the map, and one of the best point n' click adventure games ever made, right up there with Gabriel Knight, Fate of Atlantas, Monkey Island, Kings/Space/Police Quests, The Longest Journey, etc.  It's brilliant, and this is the best version yet.  I did, however, run into one bug where the music wasn't playing correctly during the final moments of the game.  Hopefully they'll fix that.  Otherwise, it was problem free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004698064', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1462824618}
review:
Video Review = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wjS_CUBJa6I

There are only two games that I have played and beat more times that I can count and that’s Max Payne & Day of the Tentacle. My gaming life was started in Atari 8-bit computers, but was groomed with IBM PCs and Lucasfilm & Lucasarts adventure games. Lucas arts adventure games were the main games I played growing up and they shaped my sense of humor and critical thinking skills. Day of the Tentacle is my favorite Lucas arts adventure game and this Remaster is PERFECT.

OVERALL

As far as this I’m concerned in terms of this REMASTER - it is ABSOLUTELY PERFECT. It does what I absolutely love about Remasters and think they all should include this. At any time you can switch back to the original Graphics, music, and sound with a push of a button. Why I particularly love this Remaster as well is because it doesn’t overdo or redo things to a distasteful amount - It’s updated the artwork, smoothing out the pixels, and making Day of the Tentacle Look FANTASTIC in HD. I didn’t particularly enjoy what the Special Edition Monkey Island games did - It kind of lost the original artwork for new artwork - 

The increased resolution improves Peter Chan’s amazing artwork and design and I have to give a big shout out to the lead artist on Day of the Tentacle which is Peter Chan - His artwork and design give Day of the Tentacle it’s mood and voice is you will. I love the quirky angles. and twists and the use of color - I cannot explain it, it’s just perfection.

GAMEPLAY

The gameplay simplifies the old the point and click verb style with removing the verbs and inventory from the screen to just show your cursor and you right click to bring up a radial dial all the available options for you to interact with an object. This simplifies the thought process to a degree; by showing you the available actions for something, but it’s a much quicker way to play and I imagine great for consoles- However - I also thought not seeing your inventory on screen all the time made thinking about puzzles a little harder if you didn’t know what to do whereas seeing the items on screen might help you realize you have a solution for something.

Luckily you can mix and match the art, verb and inventory style, and music anyway you like in the options so you can have the Old point and click verb style with the new HD artwork. I didn’t realize this until I had already played through the standard remaster and this made me even more happy than before, because while I played through the standard settings to experience the remaster, in the future I’ll probably play with old music, old verbs, and new artwork just because I’m an old school guy. 

You still can play the original Maniac Mansion on the commodore 64 computer inside of weird Ed Edison’s room - you can quit anytime and it will autosave your progress. So you’re getting two games for the price of one here.

MUSIC:

Now in my personal opinion I don’t really like the new “remastered” music - I feel like it was a transfer of re-allocating midi instruments and not for the better. Maybe I’m partial to the original, but I just found many times enjoying the original music and also feeling that it was more subtle, less in your face, and worked with the cartoon style and imuse system better. The best way I can give you an example is the difference between how Green Tentacles band sounds when you listen to his track in the video above.

As far as sound effects go, I believe nothing has changed there except bitrate perhaps. And Hat’s off to the voice actors and voice director Tamlynn Barra for making quality voice acting for a 1993 video game. Do you know how long it took other companies to get good voice acting? (Think Final Fantasy X)

Ultimately I am so happy with this Remaster and I highly Recommend to everyone - even if you haven’t heard of played it before or even wondered what an adventure game is since they kind of went away, but have been coming back. Play it! Just play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117526307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1533764683}
review:
WARNING!!! If you are looking for a boring, short, and overall stinky to the senses game, look much further! This game is NOT FOR YOU!!! 

"Day of the Tentacle Remastered" Is a ginuine, classic point and click adventure game with a pizzazz no other game can achieve. This is how you remake a classic game! You can even switch mid game between classic visuals, gameplay, and sound at the push of a button! It's like you are playing a cartoon, only it involves deep puzzles, and hilarious characters that don't come with your modern cartoon / game package. I felt like I had played for HOURS (In a good way), moping that the game was probably almost over, only to find out I was only 9% through the game! And may I tell you, I know I will be enjoying more hours on end attempting to 100% this game! Now all I want is a DLC soundtrack, and I'd be set for life!

-PixelDough

author: {'steamid': '76561197971495978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1467369124}
review:
I had fun playing this again, although I'm not really a fan of the interface (wasnt a fan with Full Throttle, or COMI either)... Switching back to 'Verb' mode, made that problem go away.

The achievements really add value to the replaying of this, they make you fully explore the mansion again (including playing Maniac Mansion through), to track down all the achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198005294326', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1558937322}
review: Genial Titulo que debe estar en biblioteca, si jugaste el Maniac Mansion, el Zack y otros mas sin duda alguna debiste de haber jugado el Tentacle, tal vez lo acabaste, tal vez no XD, en fin, los graficos mejorados le dan un toque especial al juego, aunque puedes alternar entre el modo pixeleado y el HD sin duda alguna aumenta la experiencia de juego de este clasico, el menu interactivo que se le ha incorporado en esta version de HD mas las caracteristicas de audio que contiene lo hacen sin duda alguna volver a brillar dentro de los titulos que puedes jugar actualmente aunque ya tenga algunos añitos de haber salido, Camarada Gamer realmente vale la pena tenerlo. 10/10. y solo una incognita, aunque puedes tambien jugar el Clasico MANIAC MANSION dentro del juego, MANIAC MANSION REMASTERED SALDRA??? XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198053465561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1459199985}
review: 5 Stunden Spielzeit (Mit großzügigen Pausen) und schon ist es vorbei. Und es war jeden einzelnen Cent Wert. Meine Güte, als ich hörte das das Spiel als Remastered Version rauskommt habe ich mich wie Bolle gefreut. 1993 hatte ich nicht mal einen eigenen Rechner. Zocken war noch gänzlich unbekannt für mich und durch einen Zufall kam ich an die Möglichkeit in einem Club das spielen zu dürfen. Erst Jahre danach fing ich wirklich an zu "zocken" aber dieses Spiel war definitiv mein Einstieg. Das Remake ist super gelungen und ich muss zugeben, das ich nicht mehr alle Lösungswege kannte. Um so mehr hats Spass gemacht und im neuen HD-Look ist es superschön anzuschauen. Die Rätsel teils Knifflig die Stimmen und die Stimmung hervorragend. Ich war direkt wieder bei 1993. Super Point and Click und noch immer Zeitgemäß. Wers kennt, sollte super in alten Zeiten schwelgen können. Wers nicht kennt...Viel Spass (Den werdet Ihr sicher haben). Klare Kaufempfehlung und das nicht nur aus Nostalgiegründen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197981371971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1667763054}
review: Ironic that his game is about time travel, as it brought me back 20 years and gave me the same great feeling as it did back then.  Possibly THE best point and click adventure ever made.  10/10, 2 thumbs up and 5 outta 5 stars!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342736', 'num_games_owned': 1601, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1461925503}
review:
Après avoir terminé le jeu on se rend compte qu'il a plutôt bien vieilli et ce remaster lui fait honneur.

Pour ceux qui n'étaient pas nés à l'époque il s'agit d'un jeu d'aventure point & click assez loufoque où l'on doit empêcher une tentacule pourpre qui a bu de l'eau contaminée de conquérir le monde. 

Le dessin très cartoonesque a été refait et y'a pas un putain de gros pixel qui traîne. C'est du superbe boulot. Le jeu est aussi désormais en plein écran alors qu'avant 1/3 de celui-ci était bouffé par l'interface. On peut donc profiter des décors et des animations en plein écran. Les musiques ont été également réarrangées.

Mais ce qui fait surtout plaisir c'est qu'on peut ne pas profiter des graphismes refaits d'un clic de souris, ou même de profiter de la musique MIDI d'époque plutôt que de celle réorchestrée, et ça c'est bon. ON peut personnaliser osn expérience.

A ça on rajoute les commentaires des développeurs, qui même s'ils sont pas forcément toujours bien trouvés ni intéressants, rajoutent une petite couche sympa pour les curieux.

Bref, que du bon si vous êtes nostalgique ou amateur de point and click :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053172119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1459188460}
review:
Outstanding!

Pros:
- Great classic with a clever plot and lots of bizarre and fun puzzles
- The new graphics are awesome and absolutely true to the original
- The audio quality is much better than in the original
- AWESOME controller support with a radial dial for selecting verbs! Even works with a PS4 controller :)
- Hamster in the microwave

Cons (all minor):
- Could be longer
- A few puzzles seem a little far-fetched
- The music is a little annoying at times

Verdict:
Absolutely worth it even if you've played the original several times. And seriously: I think it actually plays better with a controller and I really hope other devs learn from this great example for usability!
Oh, and don't worry about that hamster ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011775329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1467540274}
review:
Un remaster honnête du grand classique de Lucas Art. Passage au 16/9, graphismes retravaillés en vectoriel, nouvelle bande originale et interface repensée... de quoi justifier largement les 15 euros demandées. Un simple passage de la nouvelle version à l'ancienne via la touche F1 permet de prendre conscience du chemin parcouru.
La durée de vie est par contre assez courte, n'utilisez la soluce qu'en cas de bloquage sévère (1 ou 2 passages vraiment tirés par les cheveux) sous peine de gâcher le plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970178020', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1496964717}
review:
This game plays exactly like the Special Edition Monkey Islands.  I would not be surprised if DF wasn't using the same code-base to support this game.  This is all very good because Monkey Island 1/2 SE were fantastic.  This version retains the feature of being able to switch between the classic and enhanced versions of the game which is a must have for me.

DOTT is one of the products of Lucasarts' golden age of PC gaming.  I can't recommend this game enough, I had so much fun playing it when I was a kid (and Maniac Mansion that's also included).  The commentary feature is great too because it's just wonderful to hear what the constraints where when they developed this game...  Orson Welles once said: "The enemy of art is the absence of limitations" and that holds very true to these older PC games.

The only criticism I have is that the new art is vectorized, but fortunately stays true to the original material (Monkey Island 1 SE took too many artistic liberties, imo).  I'm a much bigger fan of pixel art so it would have been nice to see the pixel graphics updated, but that would have obviously been much more work.  This game will probably play better on a mobile device so you may want to wait for that, but this version is still fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963160817', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1479925489}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered signe le retour gagnant d’un des classiques, il est extrêmement plaisant de constaté le niveau de qualité du travail effectué par Double Fine pour dépoussiérer le jeu d’origine et aussi le faire découvrir à tout une génération de nouveau joueur qui n’ont pas connu la grande époque des jeux de Lucas Arts, où le jeu d’aventure était l’un des genres les plus en vogue et reconnu. S’il y a de petit défaut ici ou là il en reste une très bonne expérience qui ravira sans nul doute les connaisseurs du jeu, aussi bien que les nouveaux joueurs. Sans oublier la disponibilité de commentaires audio qui nous permettra d’en savoir plus sur la conception du jeu par ses créateurs.

[url=http://www.jeuxdaventure.org/view/625/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered-le-test]Test Complet[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991382476', 'num_games_owned': 928, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1459159544}
review:
Un bijou.Tout simplement génial... 
J'en attendais pas moins d'un jeu culte made in Lucas Art...Je n'avais pas eu l'occasion d'y jouer lors de sa sortie en 1993 mais autant dire que le premier jour de sa précommande, j'ai sauté dessus. 

Obligé de faire le parallèle avec Grim Fandango, un P&C qui nous propulse dans une aventure originale, surprenante, loufoque et terriblement drôle. La refonte graphique est sublime, la patte cartoonesque et les animations sont tip top. Un vrai travail de mise au goût du jour qui n'a rien à envier aux jeux d'aujourd'hui (je pense à ceux de Daedalic). 
D'un seul clic, on peut revenir à la version originale, ce qui est fort plaisant. Comme GF, il y a également la possibilité d'écouter les commentaires des développeurs en cours de jeu. La bande-son colle très bien à l'ambiance générale et aux diverses situations, cela-dit, en passant par curiosité à la version originale, je dois dire que la bande-son 8bit a plus de charme. 

Comme l'on pouvait s'y attendre les énigmes sont loufoques, très loufoques. Parfois à la limite de la logique. M'enfin, pourquoi devraient-elles être logiques quand le spitch, lui, fait intervenir des voyages dans le temps via des cabines de chiottes et des tentacules gluantes géantes qui veulent conquérir le monde et réduire en esclavage l'humanité? Non, le truc, c'est que honnêtement, j'ai parfois été bloqué sur des casses-têtes qui ont mis ma patience à rude épreuve. Mais globalement, le jeu est moins compliqué qu'un Grim Fandango. 

D'un point de vu personnel, j'ai bien aimé l'ambiance mais j'ai moins accroché que celle de grim Fandango. Les personnages sont moins charismatiques (Manny Calavera et Glottis <3) 

Mais très franchement, c'est un jeu à avoir dans sa bibliothèque et sans hésitation, j'ai envie de le classer dans mes jeux d'aventures préférés.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971300161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1696349298}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111932813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1458854175}
review:
[h1]Pas grand chose à reprocher à ce portage d'un Point&Click d'anthologie...[/h1]

Comme “Grim Fandango” l'année dernière, Double Fine continue sur sa lancée des remasterisations des perles perdues.
Comme “Grim Fandango” l'année dernière, si on peut critiquer le côté paresseux de la démarche, force est de constater que çà fait plaisir quand même, surtout qu'il est quasiment impossible de pouvoir jouer à “Day of the Tentacle”(DotT) par des moyens légaux de nos jours...

[b]Et puis surtout parce qu'il n'a pas pris une ride![/b]

Concrètement, tous les plans ont été redessinés pour offrir au jeu une [b]meilleure résolution[/b](ce qui évitera à tout le monde de se détruire les yeux) [b]tout en gardant les animations de l'époque[/b]. Si certains trouveront le tout quand même “cheap”, çà aurait été dommage de trahir la direction artistique de l'époque en proposant un rendu qui ne fait pas l'unanimité. Son style cartoon de toute façon donne un résultat qui passe très bien, et c'est un très bon choix de leur part, bon point.
[b]L'interface a été revu également[/b]; un clique droit sur un élément où on peut interagir vous donne toutes les options possibles(les drôles et celles qui marchent). Çà rend la chose plus lisible, çà fera moins peur aux néophytes, çà laisse plus de place pour admirer les dessins... c'est tout bon.
Au pire, les puristes pourront toujours avoir le rendu et l'interface de l'époque simplement en appuyant sur F1... donc tout le monde est content!

Techniquement on a là un portage de qualité qui permet de justifié le prix pour le travail fournis et permettra au nouvelles génération de se lancer dans ce P&C tordus au possible qui reste un des plus estimé du genre encore aujourd'hui.

Le pitch de DotT annonce la couleur: le professeur Fred balance des déchets toxiques dans la rivière, qui vont faire pousser des bras à un de ses sbires, tentacule violette, et qui va se mettre en route pour conquérir le monde. Malgré l'avertissement de l'autre sbire tentacule verte, le mal est fait et la seule manière d'arrêter tentacule violette est de retourner dans le passé. Le professeur Fred va donc envoyer 3 acolytes Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne dans le passé par l'intermédiaire de chiottes temporelles... et évidemment çà va pas se passer comme prévu:
-Hoagie est envoyé au temps de Georges Washington et Ben Franklin lors de la conception de la constitution américaine
-Bernard reviens dans le présent
-Laverne est envoyée dans le futur un temps où les tentacules contrôlent le monde.
Parviendront ils a rétablir la situation, à revenir à la bonne époque pour arrêter tentacule violette et sauver le monde?

A la question “DotT est il difficile?”, la réponse est “oui et pas qu'un peu!”.
[b]Les énigmes sont à l'image du pitch du jeu, tordues, loufoques mais inoubliables.[/b]
Si on considère que le joueur contrôle les 3 lascars, sur 3 époques différentes, qu'il peut envoyer la majorité des objets de l'inventaire à chaque personnage par l'intermédiaire des Chrono'WC(en tirant la chasse bien sur... des chasses d'eau temporelles, comme dans la vrai vie), et que les énigmes sont particulièrement absurdes dans leur résolution, on tient un P&C de haute tenue qui va mettre votre patience et votre logique à mal.
Je vous encouragerait bien à le faire sans solution si je ne l'avais fait moi même(la première fois y a plus de dix ans et même ici pour ce remastered... je l'admets, je suis faible...), mais la satisfaction une fois résolue sera d'autant plus grande pour vous.
[b]C'est tellement tordu que çà en devient génial[/b], ce qu'il faut retenir!

Deux consolations pour les novices:
-les objets avec lesquels on peut interagir peuvent être mis en surbrillance en appuyant sur “tab”
-pas besoin de revenir aux toilettes pour faire passer un objet à un des 3 larrons(se fait automatiquement depuis l'inventaire en faisant un glisser/déposer sur le personnage cible)
Personnellement, je trouve çà très bien! Çà réduit au moins les chances d'être coincé pour un manque d’inattention, pas la chose la plus passionnante dans un P&C.

Si on ajoute l'ajout de commentaires audio, d'un support manette qui marche pas mal, de succès plutôt marrant à trouver et d'ébauches à débloquer, on tient un portage de haute tenue auquel [b]il serait bête de passer à côté si on est fan du genre[/b] ou si on veut découvrir parmi la crème de la crème des jeux d'aventure Lucas Arts.

[h1][u]TL;DR:[/u][/h1]

+ Un P&C d'anthologie...
+ ...remodeler graphiquement et au niveau sonore sans trahir la DA originale.
+ bon choix d'interface
+ pouvant être jouer à la manette
+ des ajouts pour une plus grande accessibilité...
+ … sans un système d'aide qui ruine tout
+ Sous titres en français et en pas mal de langues

- quelques rares bugs sonores hérités de l'original
- aurait été bien de pouvoir réattribuer les touches

author: {'steamid': '76561197980692110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1669641749}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ( or dott if you like) 

A fun  point and click game that   became very popular  in the  90s.

Yor job is to stop a insane tentacle from taking over the world, and   to complete this , you need to  play as three  Kids which  is stuck in different  time periodes.
Bernard :   a nerdy geek  whick happens to get back to the present day Mansion
Hoagie:  a fat rocker that is sent back to the days when George Washington were the president of the USA 
Laverne:  A " strange " girl  which is being sent to the future

This  Review is short, but it  some how  sums up the game  fast ..  I  Would strongly recommend this game for  new players and  veterans.  And for the best  experience,  it is best played with a mouse and a keyboard. 

10\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011760042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1612134885}

review: La référence en matière de Point and Click. Laissez vous embarquer par un voyage complétement loufoque à travers le temps. Humour, ingéniosité et un plaisir à chaque avancée. Un chef d'oeuvre signé Lucas Art.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009910977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1477179855}
review:
Hier mein Review zu Day of the Tentacle Remastered.

Eins vorab...

Für alle die dieses Spiel schon damals gespielt haben:
Keine Angst, es wurde nichts verändert ;)

Wie der Titel schon sagt ist es ein Remake eines, meiner Meinung nach, besten Spieleklassiker überhaupt.

Das Spiel wurde komplett original belassen. 

Die einzigen 2 Änderungen sind:

1. Die Grafik wurde auf ein Augenfreundliches Niveau geschraubt. Aber der Grafikstil wurde beibehalten. Des besteht auch die Möglichkeit in Originalgrafik zu spielen.

2. Man kann Entwicklerkommentare dazu schalten, aber ich denke dass ist eher für Fans von damals interessant.

Zum Spiel selbst:

Da ich nicht spoilern möchte, kann ich nur sagen: absolute Empfehlung.
Das Spiel ist liebevoll und detailreich gestaltet. Auch die Charaktere passen einfach ins Spiel, mit ihren lustigen Sprüchen und Gesten. Auch das "Rätseldesign" macht Lust auf mehr.

Für alle die dieses Spiel nicht von früher kennen....gebt dem Spiel eine Chance, es hat es verdient weiter gespielt zu werden :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971017985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1459111913}
review:
Comme pour Monkey Island, Double Fine nous gratifie d'une version remasterisée de qualité.

Pas la peine de s'éterniser sur le scenario, le gameplay, etc.. c'est exactement le même jeu que dans les années 90, à la frame près, à la note près, et à la ligne de dialogue près. Toujours aussi drôle et déglingué, toujours aussi bien foutu, avec son histoire de voyage dans le temps menant les 3 principaux protagonistes à interargir malgré leur séparation de 200 ans chacun.

Néanmoins, les graphismes en haute résolution et les musiques remasterisées pourraient presque le faire passer pour une production récente. Par ailleurs, comme pour les précités remake, on peut passer à volonté de la version classique à la version remasterisée pour constater le travail effectué, ça se fait en transition douce, c'est très sympa.
L'interface fonctionne bien, c'est très propre, et il n'y a aucun bug à déplorer.

C'est donc une très bonne occasion de découvrir (ou de redécouvrir) un immense classique : l'un des tous meilleurs de l'âge d'or du point'n'click (et personnellement, mon préféré avec Monkey Island 2).
Et pour ceux qui comme moi le connaissent encore par coeur... et bien ça vaut le coup quand même :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000858135', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1459147567}

author: {'steamid': '76561198009040518', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1663740312}
review:
I had this game originally on my 386 with no CDROM when I was around 8-10 years of age.  I remember it taking forever to install via the floppy disks.  When it finally finished, I had reallocated memory by creating a boot disk.  When the intro sequence started up I was blown away.   I was drawn in by the cartoon effects and music.  I must admit though, it being my adventure game it did take me a while to get the games intro sequence to continue as I didn't know how to properly use the verb Pull on the Clock.  I had to ask a buddy at school how they did it while not admitting to them that I had spent more than 2 hours trying to get it.  lol.  Once I opened up the rest of the game, I was entranced by the story, humor, sound effects, and wacky puzzles.  I learned that vinegar is created from wine via my dad.  I found uses to my Looney Tune knowledge to solve puzzles (Pepe le Pew).  I was enamoured by the all the options to talk with the great Uncle Ted.  I think this game is the reason I love all time travel games now.  

So, when I found the chance to by a remastered version of this game I jumped at it.  This game helped shape my gaming childhood.  I was estatic that I could change the graphics mode from remastered to original.  All the puzzles play the same, so if you remember them the play through will be a quick one.  I turned on commentary and learned alot about how the game was made.  Also, in the floppy version, which the commentary mentions there is only voice in the initial opening sequence in the lobby.  So, hearing all the voices of everyone to include Harold made my day.  

To sum it up, this wacky, beautiful, and awesome game will get your mind going for a short bit.  As a fan of this game and point/click adventure games, I would had bought this at any price.  However, for someone new to this I would wait for a sale, as I think $14.99 is too much for a game this short.  

That all being said though, this game is on my top 3 list of the greatest games ever made.  

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162390461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1488353278}
review:
This game was iconic for me, growing up.  It's wrapped up in my childhood memories, along with the original Monkey Island series, Leisure Suit Larry, Indiana Jones and The fate of Atlantis, and the awesome Kings Quest series.   I could only play it staying at a relatives, twice a year, as we didn't have a PC man enough to run such a game!  Over the years, I have searched for it, hoping it may have surfaced to transport me back to my youth, so you can't even imagine my excitement, to find, 23 years later, that it was available on Steam!!
I love the puzzles, the dialogue, and the characters, and the remastered version is as amazing as it always was, although slightly more polished.  
I can't recommend this game highly enough, as it's always been a favourite of mine.  The only downpoint, for me, is that it isn't longer.  I can complete it pretty quickly, and am then snapped back to reality, mid 30's, four kids, blah blah blah.  But, anyway, classic game brought back to life, and I can't thank Lucasarts enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035368463', 'num_games_owned': 2149, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1705597533}
review:
An excellent remaster of an adventure game classic.
They kept the same art style like the original DOS version and even managed to keep the original voices from the CD version, only with more high quality.
And of course, the game is still packed with plenty of humor and time travelling hijinks that you'd expect from a LucasArts game at the time it came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960283998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1458839023}
review:
This is my favourite adventure game of all time. Not only does it have the amazing comedy you'd excpect from a LucasArts adventure game, it also has great characters and somewhat ridiculous puzzles and the greatest puzzle mechanic of all, Time.
The thing that sets this apart from all the other classic era of LucasArts adventure games is the scale of it all. Instead of you wandering from one puzzle area to the next this one uses the same layout of a single house but in three different eras of time. It makes for complex puzzles using time but also a great way to shift focus if you get stuck. 
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074470086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1459088185}
review: Yes

author: {'steamid': '76561197977257109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1459086036}
review:
Fantastic game! If you never had a chance to play the original and you enjoy adventure games then this is an essential purchase. Double Fine have done an excellent job with the remaster, including a lot of interesting commentary and improved visuals, dialogue and music.

The only bug I encountered was when changing the render mode during cutscenes. Sometimes I would be stuck in classic mode and unable to revert back to the remastered version afterwards, resorting to loading a save to fix the issue. This was a minor thing though.

Overall, definitely worth the money. There's no hint system like the Monkey Island remasters and the puzzles can be quite tough at times, but I don't consider this a negative. Pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044949746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1459550343}
review:
This is perfect. Way better than the Monkey Island Special Editions. 
This actually preserves the art style of the original game while updating it for modern PCs. 

Plus it even includes the original Manic Mansion as an easter egg. 

I hope all the old Lucas Arts adventure games get remastered like this. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971355045', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1459019037}
review:
[b]On the quality of the remake[/b]
This is a good exaple on how to remake a classic.
Redrawn graphics, remastered sound, and more modernised user interface, while the gameplay itself remains unchanged. And if you're a purist, you can switch everything back to the way things were back in 1993 - original pixel art, unremasterd soundtrack and traditional SCUMM(tm) interface are included for good measure too.

About the new artwork, my main gripe is that they didn't add additional animation frames - seeing high-resolution cartoons with such stiff movement is a bit weird. On the plus side, the game now looks very faithful to [url=http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4938/609071-day_of_the_tentacle_box_front_6534x8205.jpg]the original box art[/url], something that just wasn't possible 23 years ago.

[b]On the game itself[/b]
So, how does this game hold up, 2 decades later ? This is one of the most well-known point & click adventures from the '90s after all...
The good news is that after all those years, it still shows why it's a classic. It offers a non-linear approach to puzzles, plenty of funny jokes, an insane plot and a lot of hints towards the more illogical puzzles if you're willing to explore, experiment, and pay attention to details.
Yep, illogical puzzles. But this game is illogical in a consist way, so it could be said to run on it's own internal logic instead. Explore everywhere, get hint in one place of the game, apply the hint elsewhere, get unexpected, and probably hilarious effect. 
Or when you know what effect to achieve, find items you need where you would not expect them at first, and put them to use.

[b]Bottom line[/b]
If you're a fan of point & click adventures, you should own Day of the Tentacle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974755995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1458999890}
review:
Damals, in grauer Vorzeit, anno 1993, kam ich das erste mal in den Genuss von Day of the Tentacle- kurz DOTT. Es war für mich das erste Adventure, und viele weitere sollten folgen. Dennoch ist DOTT für mich eines der besten Adventures aller Zeiten! 

Die Story rund um machthungrige Tentakel und Zeitreisen ist wirklich verrückt, die Dialoge herrlich humorvoll und die Modernisierung ist sehr gelungen. An dieser Stelle vielen Dank an Double Fine- great work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006227562', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1650820022}
review:
Éste es quizás el mejor juego de aventura tipo Point-and-click que se ha hecho nunca (con el permiso de Monkey Island 1 y 2). 100% recomendado, claro!!

Aunque advierto que mi opinión puede estar muy sesgada, ya que me considero fan incondicional del juego desde que lo jugué por allá el 1996, cuando era niño. Lo habré jugado como unas 8-10 veces (sin contar esta versión remasterizada): en PC 486, en Win9x, en iOS jail-break, en ScummVM (en modo original y en modo subida de resolución juntando píxeles para hacer que se vea "menos" pixelado), etc.

El juego es divertido, intuitivo y no tan largo como los Monkey, lo que para mi lo hace mejor que estos dos. La estética es atractiva, los diálogos son divertidos, los puzzles son suficientemente intuitivos como para no estancarse demasiado, los personajes son únicos, la historia es hilarante y la conexión entre el pasado, presente y futuro es sublime, ¿qué más se puede pedir a una aventura point&click?

En esta versión remasterizada, han hecho exactamente lo que tenían que hacer: respetar al 100% el original, adaptando los gráficos a las pantallas HD, pero manteniendo exactamente la misma estética (tipo de dibujo) que el original, la cual, a pesar de sus píxeles, seguía siendo aceptable hoy en día. El sistema de verbos original ha sido cambiado (se puede activar el modo original) por la típica ruleta para facilitar la vida a los que juegan con mando (consolas), pero sinceramente, eso permite ver la pantalla al 100% y es mucho más ágil a la hora de interactuar con el entorno. El acceso al inventario es muy rápido y sencillo, no cansa.

Para mencionar alguna pega, podrían haberse currado versiones orquestadas de la música y doblajes en otros idiomas, pero supongo que no se puede tener todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057736408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 667, 'last_played': 1459158240}
review:
Played it for the first time. Another incredible LucasArts game. Gread job on the remaster, everything looks awesome.

If you want a great point-n-click game - you should definitely play it. If you don't - you should play it anyway. It's classic for a reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051155927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1458767565}
review:
Uno de los grandes clásicos vuelve a la pantalla de los ordenadores, gracias a todos los que lo han hecho posible enserio. Día del Tentáculo para mí era una de las mejores aventuras graficas de los años 90 (A parte de los Monkey island y otros grandes títulos de Lucas Arts) donde una se rompía el coco y no existía el internet para ayudarte. 

10/10 ¡Lo recomiendo muchísimo a quienes no los conozca y les desafío a que lo hagan sin guias! 

P.D: El único fallo para mi es que el maniac mansión esté en inglés pero que hayan arreglado el fallo que tuvo el Monkey Island remasterizado de que al poner los gráficos en modo antiguo estuviera en inglés y no en castellano hace que les perdone. ¿Quién será el próximo, Sam&Max, Full Throttle….?

author: {'steamid': '76561198068645969', 'num_games_owned': 387, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1479005717}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197964839663', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1459040523}
review:
Wonderful version of one of the greatest games ever. The graphics have been masterfully remastered, including subpixel scrolling for an ultra-smooth experience. The voices have been re-sampled from the original DAT recordings and are crystal clear. You can switch between the original presentation and the remastered one anywhere with a single keypress. Technically this version is perfect.

If forced to critique anything about the game, it would have to be the subtitle sync which seems slightly off, with longer sentences staying on screen long after they've been uttered. A subtitle speed slider would solve this.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974793790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1458768123}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960281953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1595196962}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990736879', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1529409339}
review:
C'est le vieux fan de la première heure qui parle : 
[h1]Si vous avez conservé la version CD du jeu, inutile d'acheter celle-ci, elle n'apporte rien.[/h1]

Ce sont les musiques originales, les bruitages originaux, les animations originales (avec même les lags originaux), l'interface originale et même les couleurs originales. Pas de nouveau doublage, pas de vue élargie, aucun re-design, pas de compatibilité Linux...

Vous avez ici le résultat de l'installation de votre vieux jeu DOTT sur un [url=http://scummvm.org/]ScummVM[/url] avec des graphismes lissés, un mode "cadran" et des commentaires, la compatibilité en moins. 

Rien à voir avec les versions remasterisées de Monkey Island. Je suis terriblement déçu.

Ceci dit, rien n'est retiré à l'excellent jeu original. Si vous découvrez le titre et appréciez le genre, l'achat est incontournable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048800222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1459025930}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073896814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1459011971}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116939136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1572519660}
review:
[h1]9/10 If you’re going to buy only one adventure game this year, make it [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i][/h1]

Purple Tentacle grew arms and with his new found mobility, is set on conquering earth - the advent of the age of tentacles. Bernard, Laverne, and Hoagie revisit the mansion to stop him when one of them gets transported 200 years into the past, the other 200 years into the future and one stays in the present. Though in different epochs, the three have to work together to save the human race from slavery and possible total annihilation.

[i][strike]Maniac Mansion[/strike] Day of the Tentacle[/i] (Lucas Arts 1993, Double Fine 2016), also known as DotT, is my all-time favourite point & click adventure game. I played both the German as well as American version of this game so often, that I can rush through this game in no-time. Needless to say, I had high hopes & fears for its remaster.

[h1]About the Game[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651719523

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] takes place a couple of years after the events of [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (Lucas Arts 1987), which was the first [i]”real”[/i] point & click adventure, thanks to the SCUMM engine. No longer did players have to type in verbs, but verbs to intereact with the game environment were given to them through the engine. In DotT players not only get to play with a refined version of the engine, they also get to play in a game that’s superior to [i]The Secret of Monkey Island[/i] and [i]Monkey Island 2: LeChuck’s Revenge[/i] in both story telling, pacing, puzzle design, as well as teaching players game mechanics.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651719339

Similar to [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (MM), players get to control three protagonists, although the roster of playable characters has been trimmed down drastically. Unlike in MM, there are no longer multiple ways to beating the game, nor is there a way to die or fail. The overall maps are a lot smaller than in previous Lucas Arts adventure games, streamlining the puzzle solving process. It’s clear how much more experienced with the genre the developers were at this point as opposed to the first games (cf. my Monkey Island reviews). While in the remasters of both [i]Monkey Island 1 & 2[/i], I preferred using the old look, simply because it was easier for me to operate the menu and handle my items, in this game, I mostly used the new design as I was finally able to navigate through the options and items properly.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651718249

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

So to anyone asking themselves whether or not they should get this game. If there’s only one adventure game that you’re going to get this year, make it either [i]Grim Fandango[/i] or [i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i]. They’re that good.

[b][u]Hey there.[/u][/b] If you like my writing or my occasional interviews with developers, why not follow my Steam curation over at [url= https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8839524-Gaos-Corner/]Gao’s Corner[/url] to keep up to date?

author: {'steamid': '76561197970347698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1459090508}
review:
Played the original back in the old days, was really happy to see it come back in a remasterd version!

So now it is back finally on Steam where you can play in HD graphics and high quality sound, you can still switch between the old version as well! (in any time of the game with the F1 button)

Hope to see more of these titles get a remasterd version.

Just a small list of what i like specific:
-Decent price in the store
-Hardly any bugs
-Like many adventure games not to much system requirements
-Just like the old
-Cool option to switch between the new and old version (at any time of the game)
-Some fun extras like commentary, concept art etc.
-And of course can be runned on any modern machine at any place because of Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561197985939205', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1586705209}
review:
Oldie but goldie! DOTT is in my top 5 of games all time. The best point and click adventure game ever made imo.

Very silly cartoon with a great soundscape.

Completed it once. Next time will be with dev commentary I think =o)

author: {'steamid': '76561197994782386', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1476077582}
review:
Практически идеальный ремейк одной из лучших адвенчур за всю историю жанра.
Обновлена только графика, причём в максимальном соответствии оригиналу, да и на этот последний всегда можно полюбоваться. Старый интерфейс оставлен, с добавлением к нему новой возможности управлять при помощи одной только мыши (нажатие правой кнопки на активном объекте открывает "циферблат" доступных действий). Точно также и с музыкальным сопровождением - есть возможность в любой момент переключаться между "классической" и обновлённой версиями. В общем, отличная работа.
Ну а о самой игре и говорить нечего - шедевр на все времена.

Подробная рецензия:
http://itc.ua/articles/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered-nazad-v-osobnyak-manyaka/

author: {'steamid': '76561198126616019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1626698539}
review:
No creo que exagere si me refiero a el como pieza vertebral en la historia de las aventuras graficas y en la de los videojuegos en general. 

Una obra maestra en la que pensaba que la remasterización le sentaria más mal que mejor y que por el contrario, a mi parecer, no empaña para nada su legado. De hecho se agradece poder jugarlo en pantallas en formato panoramico,  con sus logros y con sus rewards en forma de ilustraciones originales y los comentarios del autor. 

Despues de copiar el puñado de disquettes en los que venia hace veinte años, por ser joven y bisoño, adquirirlo ahora es algo que de algún modo tenia pendiente y a lo que no me podia resistir. Rejugarlo por enesima vez sigue siendo igual de hilarante y adictivo, una autentica joya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003300634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1458942740}
review: The game is exactly what its name says: the original game with beautifully remastered graphics and sounds. As a result, you can fully enjoy this one of the best and most hilarious adventure games of all time on your modern big HD screen in all its beauty.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964416237', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1613179566}
review:
It's a higher definition version of the classic Day of the Tentacle with developer commentary... and that's about it. However, if you loved the original game you won't be disappointed with this remastered version of one of the best point 'n' click adventures of all time. For newcomers, this is a great opportunity to experience a classic, time travel, cartoon point 'n' click adventure developed during the Golden Age of Lucasarts.

http://www.choicestgames.com/2016/03/day-of-tentacle-remastered-review.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197970863276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1459095961}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006602199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1458946588}
review:
If you're not familiar with Day of the Tentacle (DoTT) already, the best way to describe it is as the love child of Adult Swim and modern Telltale Games like Tales from the Borderlands. Day of the Tentacle is also one of the most important adventure games ever made, and for good reason. 

Even without the nostalgia-filtered lenses, Day of the Tentacle stands as one of cleverest and funniest games I've ever played. The writing is filled with quirky charm, and the puzzles strike a perfect balance between cartoon logic, humor, and absurdity--even if they stump you for a bit, save the walkthrough until you're *really* stuck, because there's a lot of excitement and laughs in figuring the puzzles out yourself. The remaster is absolutely visually gorgeous and should be the standard that all remasters are held to; the sound is similarly spectacular and the voice acting is tremendous. 

The only two reasons NOT to get this game are: 1) If you hate adventure games, because DotT is basically just collecting items, manipulating them, and talking to people; and 2) If you're really strapped for cash, because, while I think the price is very reasonable, some people might complain that <10 hrs of content for the price is steep. 

But, seriously, if neither of the above apply, buy this game and start playing now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026067943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1459874628}
review:
Was gibt es dazu viel zu sagen außer "Ich fühle mich als könnte ich die Welt Erobern"
Klasse Remake und immernoch nach vielen Jahren lustig. 
Klare Kauf empfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994901844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1709836882}
review:
Before I say anything like "I really wanted to like this" I must confess to being on of THOSE people who apparently couldnt adjust to modern times.

I tried to play the remastered way but the "cutout" filter effect from photoshop was a major turnoff. The "remastered" soundtrack also and dont get me started on how the unintuitive interface got even more destroyed by the ugly new font. All I can say is "Thank god for the option to play it like it was intended".

These were my major issues and it seems to me that the things I wanted just wasnt there in this remake. To bring some perspective to the issues I mentioned I might add that I absolutely adored the remakes of Monkey Island, especially the graphics and the sound (not the interface). This remake is another beast however.

DotT is however still one of the best adventure games around so Im gonna give it a thumbs up nonetheless. The final judgement is however based on the original (and I do own the original in a box), nothing in this so called "remake effort" would get a thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970798686', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1467814414}
review:
J'ai toujours aimé ce jeu à l'époque, et le travail fait pour le remasteriser est tout simplement merveilleux. Il est toujours possible de switcher en mode non masterisé à tout moment en appuyant sur F1, on reviens à l'écran 4:3 pixélisé original du jeu avec les sons originaux et le panneau des actions en bas. 

C'est un immense fun de redécouvrir ce grand classic, encore le fun d'y jouer, avec des graphiques pas pixelisés et des musiques d'excellente sonorité. Très heureux de mon achat, et merci énormément d'avoir remasterisé ce bon classique !

author: {'steamid': '76561198135148925', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1459377320}
review:
Als erstes möchte ich sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel damals schon gespielt habe. Es war mit unter mein erstes Spiel in meiner Laufbahn als PC-Spieler. 

Für alle die sich den Review ersparen wollen, hier die erste Stunde Playtime.

https://youtu.be/P449LxiHfzw

Day of the Tentacle ist ein Point and Click Adventure das noch immer mit den heutigen Titeln wie Deponia locker mithalten kann. (Für Point and Click Adventure Fans ist die Deponia Reihe zu empfehlen)
Es sieht super aus ( Remastered = Grafik überarbeitet aber Story gleich geblieben).
Das UI (Userinterface) ist überarbeitet und wesentlich nutzerfreundlicher als die Urfassung.
Kleine Ungenauigkeiten ( KEINE BUGS/FEHLER) sind aus Nostalgiegründen weiter enthalten. Darunter fällt zum Beispiel die nicht vorhandene Synchronität der Sprachausgabe ( Es ist minimal aber erklärt durch Entwickler Kommentare)
Die Entwicklerkommentare sind sehr interessant und unterhaltsam. Ich persönlich habe diese deaktiviert, da diese für ein Let's Play eher störend sind!

Für alle Retrofans ist gesagt, dass man Ingame die Grafik wechseln kann zwischen Oldschool und neuer Grafik. Wirklich lustig sich die Szenen anzuschauen und zu vergleichen :)

Allem in Allem ist es Lohnenswert dieses Spiel noch einmal zu spielen!
Grafik 10/10
Story 10/10 (wie schon immer)
Fun-Faktor 10/10 (Sofern man auf diese Art von Humor steht)
Preis-Leistungsverhältnis 8/10 (Wenn man es schon gespielt hat)

Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053267080', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1614859389}
review: Day of the Tentacle ist überraschend frisch geblieben! Die Handlung sowie der tolle Humor wissen auch heute noch zu überzeugen und auch grafisch gibt es nach dem HD Anstrich kaum noch etwas zu meckern. Lediglich die deutsche Sprachausgabe lässt arg zu wünschen übrig. Klare Kaufempfehlung für Nostalgiker und Point & Klick Fans!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970324465', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1499530174}
review:
Ein geniales Adventure aus dem Hause Lucas Arts (R.I.P). Ich habe damals schon die Urversion als Disketten gehabt und war von dem Witz und dem Flair einfach total angetan. Jeder der sich für Point & Click Adventures interessiert MUSS dieses Spiel einfach haben.

Die Remasterd Version bringt dieses Spiel nochmal ein Stück in die Zukunft, wobei die alte Grafik auch einfach schon Kult ist. 

Ich kann dieses Game nur jeden ans Herz legen !! Es hat mich wieder voll in alten Zeiten schwelgen lassen und dafür danke ich den Publisher und dem Team.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971205238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1458923473}

author: {'steamid': '76561198179519129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1677860104}
review:
If you never played DOTT before, here a few recommendations:

* play with one or more friends on one pc. It's really fun to sit together end come up with ideas how to get the items
* stay strong, don't look up in the internet. you will come up with ideas in the morning, at work, during the workout, ...

A more than worthy successor of MM and ZmK, and wonderfully remastered. Graphic, sound, voices and controls are great.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197973816641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1458941291}
review: Its the greatest point and click game of all time. Even if you have played it before, its got updated visuals, UI, uncompressed voice dialogue, concept art, and directors commentary

author: {'steamid': '76561198010414658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1458938506}
review:
Qu'est ce que j'ai bien fait d'avoir attendu ce remaster pour y jouer. Je ne vois vraiment pas ce qu'on pourrait repprocher à cette version, elle est juste parfaite. On a l'impression de jouer à un jeu sorti hier.
J'ai adoré notamment le niveau de difficulté, juste ce qu'il faut et en prenant son temps sans l'aide de soluce, c'est un régal. Il est bien moins dur que "grim fandango".
Pour le reste, il mérite complètement son titre de jeu culte. Je l'ai adoré et pourtant je ne suis pas une fan de loufoquerie en ce qui concerne les jeux d'aventure, préférant de loin les ambiances plus dramatiques.
Donc foncez, il faut le découvrir ou le redécouvrir. Il mérite une place bien au chaud  indispensable dans toute bibliothèque de jeux qui se respecte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004095553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1458844206}
review:
I'm about 20 years too late to write a fresh review of DOTT. It's probably one of Lucas Arts' finest point & clicks - genuinly funny, awesome sound design and a tremendous Chuck Jonesque art direction.

If you have never played the original, buy it RIGHT NOW.

If you have already completed the game, some questions are in order:
-Do you enjoy developer commentaries ?
-Do you like "HD" grafix ?
-Do you care about achievements ?

If you have a majority of "no", it might be wise to just stick to your old copy. Because those are the main perks of this versions.

The only real drawback of this remastered is the stupid "continue" system for the original Maniac Mansion. You can't save and only resume the current game. So if you're stuck in a a dead end, might as well restart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011360521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1459631394}

author: {'steamid': '76561197966103458', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1459446301}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975775250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1544189650}
review:
Da gusto volver a los viejos tiempos en uno de los mejores títulos y con mejor historia que he jugado en mi vida.
Volvemos a ponernos en la piel de Bernard Bernoulli, el tipico nerd de pelicula, Hoagie, un rockero tipico de la época y Laverne,... supuestamente una enfermera pero yo no me dejaría poner por sus manos... para salvar el mundo de una de las craciones del Dr. Fred, el tentáculo morado.

Quizás echo en falta un avance en la historia más que una versión remastered, pero ahora que han vuelto a trabajar con el creador original del juego para remasterizarlo, quizás veamos en el futuro un nuevo título para ver que ocurre con el la familia Edison.

Además, como muchos sabréis, podremos disfrutar del primer título de la saga - "Maniac Mansion" dentro del juego y en versión original. Además de poder jugar a este último título en su versión original también (Pixelada).

Echo en falta que adhieran al juego los audios del juego extraídos.

Si queréis vivir una verdadera aventura gráfica de antaño, con mucho humor y estrujaros el cerebro para resolver los complicados puzles, este es el mejor título que podréis comprar este 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000427083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1458943607}
review: Arguably one of the greatest adventure games ever made, Day of the Tentacle receives the remaster treatment with beautiful HD graphics, upgraded music quality, and a new intuitive interface, but still retains the original light-hearted charm and humor.  Rendering can also be switched on-the-fly between the remastered version and the original pixelated classic.  The puzzles themselves are straightforward, with the occasional stumper.  Experienced adventure gamers will breeze through this fairly quickly, but this classic is not to be missed, especially if you haven't played it before. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993188898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1458880796}
review: My childhood is back, and it's in HD! I played the original over and over back in the day...a lot of the humor slipped past my 5-6 year old mind at the time, so playing it again now is like meeting an old friend again after years apart, and that friend's sense of humor has gotten darker/dirtier in all the right ways. Nostalgia factor aside...well, it's not even really a factor. It's just the icing on the cake which is this awesome, funny, smart game. Definitely recommended, and absolutely appreciated!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982136987', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1458865185}
review:
Nach all den Jahren endlich mal wieder!

Ohne ScummVM oder sonstige Hilfsmittel einen der größten Klassiker und vor allem eines der großartigsten Spiele der Kindheit mal wieder spielen. Wie schon bei Grim Fandango Remastered ohne zu zögern zugegriffen und es keine Sekunde bereut! Auch wenn ich tatsächlich noch alle Rätsel auswendig kannte und dementsprechend recht fix durch war, ist mir allein die Nostalgie die 14,99€ wert.

Was soll man groß sagen? Es ist das klassische Point-and-klick-Adventure mit aufgehübschter Grafik und nachbearbeiteten Soundeffekten. In der überarbeiteten Version hat man allerdings nicht mehr die alten Verben am unteren Bildschirmrand wie "Nimm", "Ziehe", "Rede" usw, sondern es werden kontextsensitiv passende Verben mit einem Klick der rechten Maustaste in einem Kreismenü angezeigt. Diese Neuerung mag man nun mehr oder weniger sinnvoll finden, störend ist sie jedenfalls nicht.

Am Ende kann man das Spiel sowohl für denjenigen empfehlen, der diesen Klassiker damals schon liebte, als auch für den neuen Spieler, der ihn nachholen möchte oder einfach auf verrückten Humor steht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029026209', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1676066847}
review:
Still one of the best adventure games of all times, and the new graphics are quite nice. Definitely nice to play through that one again :)

I didn't really like the new control style for playing with a mouse, so I switched back to the traditional controls. Later tried with a controller and the new control style is better for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759830', 'num_games_owned': 3051, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1547395468}
review:
[h1]Ich habe den Key zu Reviewzwecken vom Entwickler erhalten was jedoch nicht meine Meinung beeinflusst[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Day of the Tentacle handelt es sich um eine Neuauflage des 1993 erschienenen gleichnamigen Spieles von Lucas Arts.
Day of the Tentacle war der Nachfolger des Spieles "Maniac Mansion"
Im Spiel selber wurde nichts geändert, jedenfalls ist mir nichts aufgefallen, ausser das die Grafik verbessert wurde und es eine Sprachausgabe gibt. Trotz der Grafikverbesserung hat das Spiel seinen alten Charme und das Grafikkonzept behalten.
Im Grundlegenden handelt es sich hierbei um einen der wirklich guten vorreiter der Point and Click Adventures und wie die neueren Vertreter Deponia oder Unwritten Tales besticht es nicht nur mit guten Rätseln sondern auch mit Humor und Einfallsreichtum. Bei Day of the Tentacle handelt es sich um eines der Spiele die sich selbst nicht so ernst nehmen und bei denen man fast durchgehend nicht nur um eine Ecke sondern um mehrere denken muss.
Man spielt gesamt 3 Charaktere welche durch die Zeit geschickt werden um ein mutiertes Tentakel aufzuhalten, doch durch einen Fehler in der Zeitmaschine werden alle Charaktere in verschiedene Zeiten geschickt (Vergangenheit, Gegenwart, Zukunft).
Alle 3 Zeiten spielen am gleichen Ort doch sehen ausser vom Aufbau her grundlegend verschieden aus.
Das Ziel ist es nun alle Charaktere wieder in die Gegenwart - 1 Tag zu bringen um das Tentakel aufzuhalten und die Mutation zu verhindern.

[h1]Positiv[/h1]
- Einer der besten Klassiker endlich auf PC
- Steam Errungenschaften
- Verbesserte Grafik
- Sprachausgabe
- Spielablauf selbst wurde vom Klassiker beibehalten
- läuft flüssig und fehlerfrei

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
- Stimmen gefallen mir teils nicht so ganz
- Das Hauptmenü finde ich hässlich

[h1]Negativ[/h1]
- Es gibt zwar ein Tutorial aber das finde ich etwas unübersichtlich
- Es gibt sehr viele Konzeptzeichnungen, hier wäre eine Kachelansich besser gewesen als das man weit über 100 zeichnungen mit einem Pfeil weiter klicken muss.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Ich spielte das originale Day of the Tentacle damals auf meinem 486er Rechner und es begeisterte mich von der ersten Minute an. ich spielte es damals ca 10 x durch was mir jetzt leider zum Nachteil wurde da ich in dieser fantastischen Neuauflage leider viele der Rätsel/Lösungen bereits kannte und nach ca 3h durch war. trotzdem begeisterte mich das Spiel ein weiteres mal so das ich es bei Key erhalt direkt installierte und auf einmal direkt durchspielte.
Day of the Tentakel war damals ein Diamant im Spielehimmel und ist es jetzt genauso wie früher.
Klare Kaufempfehlung für alle Fans dieses Genres.
