author: {'steamid': '76561198017392185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1458685501}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is een van de klassieke 'point and click adventure games' die ik elke paar jaar opnieuw speel , vanwege de grappige dialogen en leuke puzzels. Met de komst van ScummVM zijn veel van deze klassiekers zonder problemen te spelen en kun je diverse filters (HQ3 is mijn favoriet) gebruiken om de oude graphics er wat minder retro uit te laten zien. Dus wat heeft deze versie aan het origineel toe te voegen? Een heleboel:
- het hele spel is opnieuw getekend in breedbeeld en met scherpere tekeningen die trouw zijn aan de originele schetsen komen
- de stemmen zijn opnieuw gedigitaliseerd en klinken kraakhelder
- verbeterde besturing, een handig menu voor je rechter muisknop en ook speelbaar met een gamepad
- audiocommentaar van onder meer Tim Schafer en Peter Chan
- ruim 50 achievements 
- verbeterde muziek, zonder de beperkingen van het origineel voor een voller en mooier geluid
- een groot aantal originele schetsen die gedurende het spelen worden ontgrendeld
Verder blijft het stomweg een van de grappigste spellen in het genre. Ook als je hem, net als ikzelf, al verschillende keren hebt uitgespeeld, hij blijft leuk. En dankzij alle verbeteringen is hij nu nóg leuker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027093835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1466932885}
review:
Es hat sich nichts verändert, das Spiel ist original.
Nach den ersten paar Minuten fühlt man sich irgendwie wieder in den 90igern ... nur ohne nervigen Startdisketen für MS-DOS
Es hat nach wie vor die witzigen Dialoge und seinen Charme.

Klare kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006565858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1601161059}
review:
Easily one of the best Point & Click games of all time. I fondly remember paying this game from my childhood and once I booted it up on my new PC it brought me back to those days. This was my first Point & Click Adventure game as a kid, and I couldn't be happier that they brought it to Steam, remastered. 

Even if you're not the biggest fan of Point & Click Adventure games as I am, I still recommend it, as it's incredibly fun and the puzzles are unlike any other game in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021868303', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1466040651}
review:
Meu jogo favorito da época e do gênero. Dificuldade na medida certa, humor inteligente e duração boa.

Os gráficos novos ficaram excelentes, melhores do que as screenshots estáticas parecem soar.

A jogabilidade nova também ficou muito ágil, mesmo com vários verbos e itens a serem usados.

De brinde, vem o Maniac Mansion original.

Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995208231', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1691228811}
review:
It makes me so happy to have a modern version of a classic game, that doesn't break down upon booting it up. The graphic and sound remasters are amazing and I like the new UI that Double Fine have added into the game.

In regards to the game itself and reliving the good ol' days, as much as I would love to say I remember how to do everything, it's already been proven that I've forgotten so much of DOTT, so much that it's making this playthrough quite enjoyable!

Thank you, Double Fine, for making my wallet perfom a knee jerk payment. I have no regrets picking up this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969948635', 'num_games_owned': 638, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1491170281}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971782452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1663881504}
review:
Ein Klassiker in einem neuen Glanz.
Schon damals als kleines Kind vor dem Pentium 133 gesehen und die Spielanleitung gesucht um das Password drin zusuche.
Tim Schäfer Meisterwerk in einem neuen Glanz und noch dazu, persönlich Remastered.
Ich bekomme jetzt tränen in den Augen =)
Wär wirklich hier einen Adventure Klassiker spielen möchte, und noch dazu einer der bekanntesten. Sollte bei diesem Preis aufjedenfall sofort zu schlagen. Wunderschöne und neue Grafik. In der Deutsche Version ist auch der Klassik Stil auf deutsch. Man kann wenn man will auch auf Englischer Sprachausgabe umstellen oder den Klassik Stil mit dem Remastered Sound genauso wie umgekehrt. 
Die Remastered Version in jeder in Sicht gelungen.
Ein Mango hab ich trotzdem zu bemängeln. Auch wie ich dieses Spiel grad nur Abfeiern tuhe.
Ach wenn es damals genial war mit der Deutschen Sprachausgabe. Hätte man eventuell, dafür hatte man auch genug Zeit, es neu zu Synchronisieren mit Synchronsprecher. Weil ab und zu Fällt einem schon auf das es nicht mit dem Model zusammenpasst die Synchronisation. Dadurch wirkt es Asychron.
Aber trotzdem gebe ich diesem Spiel seine 95% als Metascore.
Weil Tim Schäfer wieder das Kind in mir aufgeweckt hat.

Hier mein Lets Play dazu!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSoWPu-lf-A&index=2&list=PLArck8g64IhMYjDZ3hxlU-WQij99hsBkn

author: {'steamid': '76561198081691855', 'num_games_owned': 10859, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1652928940}
review:
-14,99€ für ein Remaster? F*CK yeah! es ist jeden Cent wert!!-
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25622578/] More in the Retro Curator [/url] 

Ich verneige mich vor diesem Meisterwerk!
So sieht also meine Kindheit in HD aus, immernoch zeitlos...es ist so schön!!!! :3 

Ich bin sonst kein großer Fan von Remaster, gerade was die Übersättigung angeht bzw auch was als teueres Spiel verkauft wird obwohl es 1-2 Jahre alt ist. Siehe Redux oder Konsolen Ports (von PS3 auf PS4 etc.). 
ABER
Dieses Remaster ist genau das, was ich seit seeeeeeehr vielen Jahren wünsche, nach dem erst Monkey Island als HD kam. ENDLICH das beste Spiel der Welt wieder auf modernen PC's mit frischem Anstrich (der nicht nur ein wie bei ScumVM einen hässlichen HD Eindruck macht.) und das sogar mit wunderschönen Texturen und verdammt ansehnlichen Look. Zudem kann man Sound / Grafik manuell Retro oder Remaster einstellen und mit einen Tastendruck wieder das "alte Spiel" genießen. PERFEKT!!!!!!!!!!!!
Maniac Mansion ist natürlich auch wieder spielbar (allerdings nicht in HD, ist aber völlig okay.)
Übersichtlichkeit, Bedienung, Bonus Features incl Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten ist nochmal ein schöner Bonus. All das verleiht es noch den Feinschliff.


Somit ist es rundum perfekt und mal wieder das beste P&C Adventure. :P
Auch Grafikhuren, die das original "abschreckten" können bedenkenlos zuschlagen und es nachholen! Fans des Spiels sowieso!
Ich danke Lucas Arts, Tim Schafer, Dave Grossman und Double Fine für dieses Goldstück auf modernen PC's / Steam! :)  

 Klare Kaufempfehlung für ALLE!!!!!!!!!
(Gerne auch mehr alte Retro Spiele auf Steam, Full Throttle - Vollgas, Toonstruck, Bad Tucker, die Larry Reihe gerade Teil 7 und viiiiiiiiiiiele mehr! - von mir aus alle originalen ohne Remaster. Auch wenn Full Throttle schonmal erwähnt wurde von Tim Schafer.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198006804709', 'num_games_owned': 1035, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1681559382}
review:
Die 90er im aufgemotzten Style.

Ich war schon richtig erfreut als ich den Download angeworfen hatte. Das Spiel selbst kann man wenn man es von früher kennt recht schnell durch spielen. ( ohne MM ). Das Umschalten von neu auf alt klappt prima und man sieht deutlich was sich getan hat.

Für alle dies es nicht kennen, lohnt sich der Kauf. Für Freunde von DOTT ein Pflichtkauf. Allein die Dialoge haben mich gestern richtig zum lachen gebracht und dafür danke ich dem Studio, das daran nichts verändert wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021677425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1287, 'last_played': 1458736588}
review:
Αυτή τη φορά η Double Fine Productions έκανε τ’ απολύτως αυτονόητα. Πήρε στα χέρια της έναν εκπληκτικής αρχικής σχεδίασης τίτλο, του τόνωσε και του βελτίωσε το παρουσιαστικό, όπως ακριβώς έπρεπε, διατήρησε ανέπαφα τα στοιχεία που δεν υπήρχε λόγος ν’ αλλάξουν και κάπως έτσι ανοίγει επιτυχημένα έναν δεύτερο κύκλο ζωής για το πολυαγαπημένο αυτό adventure game.

This time Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions did exactly what needed to be done. They carefully improved and modernized the visual and sound aspects, as well as the interface, of an exceptionally well designed game, left its other elements untouched, just like they should do, and successfully gave a new breath of life to this beloved adventure game.

http://www.ragequit.gr/reviews/item/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered-pc-review

author: {'steamid': '76561197977348173', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1459040535}
review:
Disclaimer: this is my first time playing Day of the Tentacle... and I generally hate point & click games.

This game is fantastic. I was a fan of Maniac Mansion back on NES and bought this game solely to play MM on Steam. (Maniac Mansion, the entire game, is featured in DOTT on a playable in game computer). But as it turns out, I don't want to play MM. I want to play Day of the Tentacle. 

The new interface is reason enough to buy this. It's the best interfact I've ever seen in a point & click game. You can hold Shift and see every single interactive part of the environment. So you won't get stuck for hours wondering what the heck you're supposed to do. And rather than the terrible old method of selecting an action from a menu that takes up half the screen... now you just click right on the object and select your action. And it usually defaults to the most useful action. Amazing interface. The fact that they included the original graphics/sound/interface from DotT really makes you appreciate how polished this new release is.

Just buy it. It's fun and easy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018586514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1458756183}
review:
I can only say that I have very mixed feelings about this Remake of Day of the Tentacle. 
I literally grew up with the game and when I booted this up, my mind was flooded with inky memories of red mummies and hammer jokes. Ultimately, I have a few critique points: The game looks good until people begin to interact. To keep true to the original sprites and to give you the option to change to "Retro Mode" on the fly, they did not smoothen out the animations or added additinal frames, so many scenes look stiff. Further: The interface has not aged well. This game has always needed some kind of "return to Time Machine" button or a way to send stuff in bulk. I was also a bit annoyed by the way the subtitles work (I speak german as my main language, so I want to read stuff to get it). Sometimes they will stay longer than the speech and ruin the timing of jokes.
But let's ask the question: Is it good? 
And i have to admit it: Yes, this game still holds up. 
Day of the Tentacle manages to use the dreadded inventory-puzzle gameplay to its advantage by giving characters unique voices to explain the objects and an constant onslaught of hints through interaction with the environment and dialogue. It is like a Looney Tunes sketch. It has not aged perfectly but by god, there is something timeless about 3 weirdos being heroic and silly at the same time. Each of the characters has a distinct personality, way of walking and talking. The way the game uses them seriously talking about how the world is about to fall to a purple plunger with arms is hillarious and the ending made me chuckle way longer than it had any right to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004012305', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1458709805}
review: It's Day of the Tentacle, exactly how I remember it! I'm glad there's finally a remaster that didn't mess with the game, just made it prettier...oddly enough, the game LOOKS as good as I remember it...though, you realize how much has changed since when you remembered it by hitting that F1 key. STILL. A Lucasarts classic...and it has the full, original Maniac Mansion within the game as a mini-game, so you get two classics in one!

review: One of the first adventure games I played on pc when it originally came out, and it hasn't lost any of its charm and has aged well. It's great that this generations gamers get to experience the magic this game gave to me and so many others

author: {'steamid': '76561197971474111', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1671607084}
review:
Maybe it's because I'm a child of the 80's. Maybe it's because I'm insanely addicted to adventure games. Or maybe it's because this was the catalyst that sparked my love for point and click adventure games, but this game still holds up in my eyes. Sure the jokes may go over the new generation of gamers' heads, but to me this game is still amazing.

This game got me not only inot PAC games, but also hits a special place in my heart as one of the inspiring factors that lead me to become a writer and game designer. The game is very beautifully crafted and if I could shake Tim Schafer's hand and tell him that I would. 

Manaic Mansion was one of those games on the NES that I loved dearly and to hear that this was the sequel to it made it all the better. This game had charm, and tentacles. The only thing I didn't like about the game was the fact that it had to end. 

Thank you Tim Schafer for bringing this classic back into my life and bringing it to a new generation of people who can see where the genre originated from. 

Hint: DO NOT FORGET TO USE ED's COMPUTER: It has the original Maniac Mansion in it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966058501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1535288524}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036064023', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1458747162}
review:
All my childood, remastered anew, this one was always my favorite adventure game of all time, even if kinda short it still the best, it has all what makes a great adventure game : funniest humor, cartoon style and goofy puzzles, i even like this one more than the monkey island series, thank you devs for filling my childhood with this, i would have never beeing the same guy if it weren't for those great games.

as for this version, it was so cool to play it with the commentary for the devs, gave me another reason to do my yearly playthrough :D

Thank you again all Lucasarts devs and Tim Schafer <3

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002040265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1458721355}
review:
This game is seriously excellent.

The scenario, the dialogues, the graphic design, the puzzles, the characters, the music.
The remastered version is very cool, better graphics, better music, developer commentary, a button to switch between the old game and the new game.
Day of the Tentacle is one of my top 5 video games.

It's an awesome PC classic, YOU MUST PLAY IT. 

But seriously Tim, why Jar Jar Binks?

author: {'steamid': '76561198023162438', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1513623454}
review:
10/10. Day of the Tentacle es una obra maestra.
Fue grandioso en 1993 y es grandioso hoy con esta edición remasterizada. El juego ha envejecido muy bien, siendo al día de hoy una de las mejores aventuras gráficas jamás hechas para PC. Extremadamente ingeniosa, divertida y fácil de aprender a jugar. Es uno de esos juegos que te hace amar el género, no todos los juegos son de tiros, también está bueno jugar a algo que haya que pensar un poco.
Una verdadera obra de arte, la joyita de LucasArts. 100% recomendado tanto para quienes conocen como para los que no.

review: Terrific game and one heck of a nostalgia trip. I played this way back when i the 90s and loved it then, I think it's even better over twenty years on. It's weird sort of knowing some of the puzzle solutions and satisfying too. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008498648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1511279037}
review:
Pouring disappearing ink on to a crazy short-tempered, military obsessive man's stamp collection, before stealing a prized stamp, stealing his hamster and sending the two 400 years apart through time travelling toilets. 

Brilliant. Buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998582069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1458814880}
review: Shut up and play it. You owe it to yourself. Unless you are a miserable human being, then don't, because you don't deserve to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014817484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1691172987}
review:
This is by far THE best remastered i have played from Double Fine, not that the earlier remakes aren't great I GOT THEM ALL,
but because it was my favorite game back in the day, along with Monkey Island part II wich is also a terrific remastered.
Every single frame is hand drawn and the art is poping out on your screen! wow it is breath taking to play this game 
in this quality...

Also the bonus material is so fun to watch and they put in dozens of unlocks and achievements that you want to unlock.
The menu must be the best that they made so far because it really makes me feel i play a top title and they thought of everything here. The sounds the special effects that they added, the sound stream is fabulous to says the least! 

Anyone who loves Lucas Arts games must have this one in their collection!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040427321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1458811813}
review:
A solid game, well worth the price. The remaster was flawless as far as I could see, and makes a great game even better.
I completed the game in an hour and 30 minutes, but only because I completed it before in 93. However a new player, it may take over 3 hours to complete. Don't pass this classic up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988116430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1631354286}
review:
Day of the Tentacle comes from the heyday of LucasArts when they were lord and master over the point and click adventure game, before the slow slide into "lets do everything Star Wars." I played this when it first came out in 1993 on my 486 with its brand new 16x speed CD ROM and loved it back then. 

I've waited 18 years to reply this game and haven't been disappointed. Nothing has changed except to give the graphics a new polish to meet current displays, so no more jagged pixils. It's all smooth HD graphics from here on it. The sound, music, appearence and humour are all the same. 

It also comes with Steam achievements, in game commentary and as you explore new concept art is unlocked in the main menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965057980', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1703350258}
review:
Klassikko uudessa kuoressa! Uuden version käyttöliittymä on tehty ehkä vähän hankalan oloisesti, mutta se saattaa olla vain totuttelukysymys. Vaihto uuden ja alkuperäisen version välillä onnistuu lennosta ja toimii hyvin. Mukana tulee myös alkuperäinen Maniac Mansion.

Älä ole tonnikalapää!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005376219', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1458933266}
review:
The original Day of the Tentacle was probably the best point-and-click adventure game in the 90s. After playing the remastered version, I'm glad they stayed true to the graphics and controls while improving on them immensely. They also kept the easter egg where you can play Maniac Mansion, which is DOTT's predecessor game released in 1987.

Do yourself a favour: if you've never played the original, be glad that there's a remastered version that improves upon the original in every aspect and get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095201032', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1467377807}
review:
Souvent le point 'n click donné en référence lorsqu'on demande le préféré.

A acheter uniquement si vous voulez y rejouer (ou si vous n'y avez jamais joué) et que vous voulez en même temps montrer l'intérêt pour le jeu et donc pour une éventuelle suite, un jour ou l'autre (Day of the Tentacle étant la suite de "Maniac Mansion"). Ou alors, si comme moi, vous êtes aussi friands d'anecdotes sur la conception du jeu vu que des commentaires des développeurs (sous-titrés en français) sont disponibles.

Personnellement, je l'avais fini à l'époque et j'ai pris un très grand plaisir à y rejouer 23 ans plus tard, même en le finissant d'une traite en quelques heures (j'y avais pas mal joué à l'époque donc en gros, je me suis souvenu de 90% des énigmes).

La version remastered inclus, tout comme l'original, "Maniac Mansion", jouable sur l'ordinateur de Ed. La version de "Maniac Mansion" est la version "Enhanced" mais n'est pas remastérisé par contre (et en anglais).

author: {'steamid': '76561198047323914', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1656092737}
review: This game made me get into game development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131284284', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1666454111}
review:
This was the first CD-Rom game I played on my old 486!  I bought the Soundblaster 16 with CD Rom just for this game!!!  I spent days configuring an AUTOEXEC.BAT file so that I could boot from a floppy to play this!  (End of trip down memory lane... I hope there are a few others out there who know what a big deal this was!)

The remastered edition is exactly as I remember it, only better!  The story is fantastic and funny, the puzzles are challenging without being overly mindbending and the updates do not change the game at all.  The interface, while completely overhauled, is intuitive and enhances the game over the original, without changing it in any way.  Thank you Tim Shafer, you truly know how to make your followers happy.  I can't wait for Full Throttle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069060918', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1458692558}
review:
The first pc game I ever played, and probably the only one I can honestly say I haven't played in a couple decades.
Never beat it since me and the other tikes at day care had to share the computer at the time.  Nice to finally close this chapter of my life!

Looking back on it now though I'm surprised I never thought much of the depressed man attempting suicide with a novelty gun, human slavery, stabbing a clown, helping a man break into a stranger's car and microwaving a hamster until it's on the verge of exploding.

I somehow doubt I'd see similar concepts in video games at day-cares nowadays.

Shame too.  I love my dark sense of humour and this stuff is/was hilarious.

Happy trip down memory lane!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961576403', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1688992728}
review:
Gäbe es einen Ehren-Oscar für Computerspiele, Day of the Tentacle hätte ihn sich locker verdient. 23 Jahre hat das Adventure von Tim Schafer (Psychonauts) und Dave Grossman (Telltales Sam & Max) schon auf dem Buckel, doch von Altersschwäche keine Spur: Die abgedrehte Zeitreise-Knobelei zählt nicht nur zum Besten, was Lucas Arts je hervorgebracht hat, sie kann sich auch heute noch mit vielen modernen Adventures messen. Den Beweis dafür liefert nun Double Fine, die sich von Lucas Arts die Erlaubnis holten, ein HD-Neuauflage des Kultspiels zu produzieren. Die macht zwar wenig neu, begeistert uns im Test aber gerade deshalb so wie in 1993.

Youtube Walkthrough: https://youtu.be/mjwLVaa_jmw

author: {'steamid': '76561198068642812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1662167766}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046654417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 99, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1711899181}
review: They have done a great update of this game. The updated graphics look awesome while still keeping the same feel. And if you want to go back to the old style you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017818738', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1458690022}
review:
Wer will kann mal über mein Playhtrough drüber scrollen und sich ein eigenes Bild machen. Hierdrunter mein euphorisches Review :D

https://www.twitch.tv/xdr10/v/56048582

Man wird erstmal 15 Jahre zurück in seine Kindheit/Jugend zurück katapultiert. Einfach der Wahnsinn. Hat irre viel Spaß gemacht und wieder viel gelacht. Die meisten Lösungsansätze kannte ich gar nicht mehr, weshalb es beinahe so wie ein erstes Playthrough war... Na gut, nur beinahe. 

Spiel sieht top aus, Synchro sollte man bereits kennen. Und es gibt einen Classic Spielmode im alten Stil, sowie den remastered Spielmode mit Grafik-Feinschliff. Außerdem kann man sich zwischen der "Verben"-Steuerung oder einer Steuerung á la Sam and Max entscheiden.

Ein KLASSIKER: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055546144', 'num_games_owned': 655, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1676129841}
review: Hamster in microwave/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198015536212', 'num_games_owned': 1597, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1462491413}
review:
Les jeux Lucasarts des années 90 sont les meilleurs.

Il y en a pas un qui soit meilleur que l'autre.
Bref Day of the Tentacle est un très bon jeu et cette version remastered donne un bon coup de jeune à ce jeu.

Le seul point negatif que j'ai trouvé, c'est maniac mansion qui n'est qu'en anglais.

Aller, j'attends full throttle remastered et les indiana jones 1,2,3.
Par contre, si full throttle remastered n'est pas en full français, je vais être très déçu car le doublage était/est très bon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012450682', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1692120441}
review:
I played and completed this game after its original release in 1993 so was very excited to see it return, and it was just as brilliant as i remembered it! Its a funny, mad and crazy game, the best thing now of course is that you can easily switch between new/old grapics just by pressing a button.

The puzzles are interesting and sometimes require you to think outside the box, while still making some sort of sense

A purple tentacle is trying to take over the world and you and two friends have to try and defeat him with the help of time travelling toilets, whats not to like ??

P.S did i mention how awesome this game is?

author: {'steamid': '76561198043812086', 'num_games_owned': 1888, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1458685582}
review: Großartiges Remake. Es wurde nur gerade so viel verbessert wie nötig war; also die Grafik und der Ton. Die Kombination aus Tastatur-Kürzeln und Mausbedienung gefällt mir gut. Alles in allem seine fuffzehn Euro wert (für das Original hab ich damals 99 DM bezahlt).

author: {'steamid': '76561198067701157', 'num_games_owned': 883, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1558808622}
review:
Schönes Remake des besten Point&Click Adventure aller Zeiten (imho).
Die Sprachausgabe stammt aus der damaligen CD-Version und wurde aufgepeppt, die Musik ebenso.
Witzigerweise kann man jederzeit mit F1 auf "alt" umstellen für maximalen Retrofaktor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108852006', 'num_games_owned': 9335, 'num_reviews': 310, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1458906847}
review: This is a really great remastered game! You can see that each animation frame and each background was retouched/redone individually. The voice overs are from the original DAT in a much higher quality. There is a commentary and a lot of concept arts. Even if you played the original game a lot of times this has enough to offer to make it worth 15$. Epic game with a worthy remaster = get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026474596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1461526984}
review: *cries from happiness*

author: {'steamid': '76561197995514873', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1661112649}
review:
Das ist eins der besten Adventure aller Zeiten. Ich setze dieses Spiel auf gleiche Stufe wie Monkey Island. Dazu Kommt das das auch eine der besten Remasters ist die ich je gesehen habe. Die Grafik ist super nachgebessert. Absolut scharf und in HD. Leicht nachgebesserter Ton geht voll in ordnung und das beste ist die neue alternative steuerung die es erlaubt mehr vom Bild zu sehen als früher. Natürlich kann man auch mit dem alten Verben Interface spielen wenn man möchte.  

Fazit: Top Remaster - Top Fan Servive 90 % von mir :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198038502757', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1649506120}
review: Estoy contentisimo de tener ya este juego. El precio me parece apropiadisimo, la calidad de la remasterización es increíble, es una de las aventuras gráficas mas locas y divertidas a las que he jugado en mi vida. MUY recomendable

author: {'steamid': '76561198035480798', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1458941371}
review:
Pushing a clown in a game is always a good thing.
If that doesn't work, smoke a cigar!

But seriously, the game is lovely remastered, as is the sound. Brings back such sweet memories of my childhood. 
If you never played this, get this edition. You won't be disappointed. Some references may be old, but the fun is real!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021700615', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1458940951}
review:
Checked Options menu first. Instantly set style to "classic". Game is now pixelated again. F*** yea!

Works now even with SoundBlaster - 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198195783869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1586009088}
review:
Day of the Tentacle oder kurz DOTT ist eines der besten Point and Klick Adventure von Lucas Arts und hat einen herrlich schrägen Humor. Als ich es im Erscheinungsjahr 1993 von zu Weihnachten für meinen 486er bekam konnte ich mich nicht losreissen und spielte es ca. 10 mal durch. Mit den Charakteren Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne muss man ja wie bekannt verhindern das Purpur Tentacle die Weltherrschaft übernimmt. Die Rätsel sind ziemlich leicht wenn man zb. Broken Sword dagegen stellt. 

Die Grafik ist sehr schön auf den Stand der Dinge gebracht worden und sieht noch immer so liebevoll wie damals aus. Der Bonus in den Spiel ist, das man Entwicklerkommentare und Konzeptbilder bekommt. 
Ich kann dieses Point and Klick Adventure jedem der schon Manic Manson gespielt hat ans Herz legen. 
(Schade das Disney Lucas Arts dicht gemacht hat.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003497102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1700237229}
review:
One of the funniest games i've ever played and even better; it's an adventure game.
The remake is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990088225', 'num_games_owned': 1145, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1478355880}
review:
A great remaster! 

I loved this game as a kid and I appreciate the love that has gone into this remaster, it feels very polished.

The new artstyle stays very true to the orignal (it just looks like it's been done up for 1080p widescreen although every scene has been redone from scratch) 
With the touch of a button you can change straight back to the original artstyle, I found I was doing this with every new scene I entered just to appreciate what it looked like before compared to now.

The music has been redone as well, I am sure that new players of the game will prefer the new audio but due to nostalgia I prefer the original midi music, luckily you can taylor the game to your needs in the options so you can have the new artstyle with the original music if you like.

I also like that the developers have included original artwork which can be viewed in a gallery, more gets unlocked the further you progress in the game.

As for the actual game/story... It's strange and bizzare (in a good way) it has some very dark humor and you'll meet some great characters along the way, the voice acting is also great. 

This is my 2nd favorite game from Tim Schafer (Number one being Grim Fandango) and I really am happy that he is also bringing out a remaster of Full Throttle next year! I'm having a nostalgia overload with all this :) 

So if you love point and click games then you should love this game... And if this is your first time playing this game, I really do envy you!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062162831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1458665464}
review:
Das Spiel wurde liebevoll modernisiert und hat nichts von seinem Charme eingebüßt. Die Sprachausgabe ist exzellent und die Steuerung wurde für Maussteuerung und Gamepad optimiert. Die zuschaltbaren Kommentare der Entwickler bieten einen Blick hinter die Kulissen und lassen spüren, wie viel Spaß und Liebe in den vielen Details steckt. 
Ich konnte mich noch an die vollständige Lösung aller Rätsel erinnern, auch wenn ich das Spiel mindestens 10 Jahre nicht mehr gespielt habe. So originell und eingängig ist die Geschichte, so verschroben die Rätsel. Ich werde es auf jeden Fall noch mehrfach durchspielen, um all die aberwitzigen Dialoge zu verfolgen und natürlich werde ich auch noch eine Runde Maniac Mansion spielen. 
Fazit: Besser hätte die Hommage an das für mich beste Adventure aller Zeiten nicht in die Neuzeit übertragen werden können. Viel Spaß mit Gummikotze, Stinktierkatze und Mumienspaghettifrisur!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987105238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1804, 'last_played': 1667619009}
review:
[i]Классика жанра, в которую ранее не играл. Отменный ремастер. Реализация ретроспективы потрясает! Переключение между модерном и классикой происходит "на лету". Прохождение со словариком — или в ожидании русификатора, который вот-вот релизовался для классической версии игры...[/i]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=908697274
[h1]Всем любителям квестов — musthave![/h1]
В обзоре [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/monocrhome/recommended/316790/]Grim Fandango*[/url] я уже подчеркивал этот факт: Double Fine избрали верный курс на возвращение стареньких, добрых и веселых адвенчур. Считай** уже на пороге "рычит" харлей! Ранее не заставшим Day of the Tentacle (как и многие неизвестные квесты в нашей стране), в перспективе множество вечеров будет скрашено в ожидании ремастера Full Throttle, который пожалуй все, кто "в теме", ждут с нетерпением!

[i]Из приятных бонусов современности стоит отметить очевидные вещи: достижения Steam; облако с сохранениями игры; поддержка геймпада для современных любителей поваляться или посидеть перед телевизором...[/i]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=908697224
[h1]Day of the Tentacle Remastered![/h1]
В паре слов об этом произведении можно сказать, что DotT является духовным наследником, и своеобразным продолжением игры Maniac Mansion. Перерисованный под современность, но сохранивший тот самый дизайн художников. Перезаписанный саундтрек подарит живые интерпретации классических мелодий. Ну а геймплей за трех персонажей и взаимодействия с предметами между тремя временными направлениями, доставят массу запутанных и веселых ситуаций!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=908697296
Впрочем, эта игрушка не нуждается в каком-то особенном представлении, ибо это уже возвращенная, бессмертная классика отличных квестов от Lucas Arts и Тима Ш(а)ейфера! Спасибо, Double Fine. З.Ы. Тим, запили русификатор, ну пожалуйста! :]

[i]...и конечно бонус-ретроспектива — игра внутри игры — Maniac Mansion во плоти! Запустив в настоящем сей шедевр из прошлого понимаешь, на сколько простыми стали игры и как, черт возьми в это вообще играли?! Икона всех Point & Click игр![/i]

[h1]________[/h1]
*Ссылка ведет на мой обзор игры в стим — Ваш кэп :}
**Лучше не считай эти дни, а просто живи! :}

author: {'steamid': '76561197978902089', 'num_games_owned': 8122, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 822, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1462157960}
review: A fantastic remaster of a blast from the past - for the price it's a very decent remaster at that. The odd visual glitch here and there, but nothing game-breaking. It still has the same style you'd expect from the old game - so don't expect this remaster to be completely modern. It's also really nice that you can switch from remastered to classic without interrupting the gameplay with a swift click of a shortcut (F1) which gets huge points from me! Overall nice music, great quality vocals and SFX - it gets an 8/10 from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993682738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1458666412}
review:
Arguably the finest game in it's genre. The plot is simple, silly and brief, reflecting a more innocent era of vidya.
It's perhaps a little too short for £10 (I clocked at 3 hours, but then I also remembered a lot of the solutions), but it's still a game everybody should play at least once in their lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983612330', 'num_games_owned': 2735, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1527199791}
review:
bem, uns vão gostar e outros não.
a remasterização realmente ficou cartunesca demais, parecendo flash game.
mas alternando com o original, dá pra ver que já não era tão detalhado (diferente do Monkey Island) e talvez por isso tenham optado dessa maneira.
não ficou ruim, mas podia ter ficado melhor.
na tela do gamepad mostra um controle do PS4 e não tem opção para customizar as teclas, eu não gostei do layout dos botões (no teclado+mouse é melhor).

no mais, o som está muito bom (acho que rolou um upgrade no áudio), tem faixa de comentários, o modo original ficou bem jogável e é isso ... um dos maiores clássicos já lançados no PC.

10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018144108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1697405520}
review:
Ainda me lembro da primeira vez que joguei Day of the Tentacle em um 386, posso dizer que esse jogo é uma das mais fortes razões de eu ter me apaixonado por jogos de PC, muito bem humorado, efeitos sonoros e trilha impecável, personagens e história marcantes, uma verdadeira obra de arte. A versão Remastered está excelente, mantendo o estilo gráfico, atualizando a resolução e outros detalhes, achei melhor que a remasterização de Monkey Island, que considero muito boa também. 
Para os puristas, há a possibilidad e de se mudar para a versão original do jogo à qualquer momento. Espero que continuem a fazer remasterizações de adventures clássicos como Maniac Mansion (primeiro jogo da série, que pode ser jogado dentro deste), Full Throttle, The Dig etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963344822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1458661654}
review:
This is how a Remastered version should be.
Lovely graphics faithful to the original and the sound and music is fantastic. Being able to play along together with dev comments is a nice addition if you have played this game many times before like I have.

To a newcomer I think the price is just right for a timeless adventure game with great production quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037721091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1527366217}
review:
Como empezar.. Day of the Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gráficas de todos los tiempos (con permiso de Monkey Island 2 y Grim Fandango) cuyos personajes, disparatada historia y puzzles lo convirtieron en una aventura irrepetible. 
Ahora de la mano de Double Fine y su creador original llega esta version "Remastered", la cual, como su nombre indica, viene siendo una versión en HD 1:1 del original.. para lo bueno y para lo malo.

Los sprites y escenarios han sido adaptados en resolución y detalle a las HD, moviendose los sprites de los personajes tal cual en la época frame por frame... nada de nuevas animaciones, añadido de fluidez de las mismas, remodelados completos ni nada por el estilo ¿esto es bueno entonces? es estupendo volver a ver este título 23 años despues en unos estupendos HD y adaptado a imagen panorámica... pero se siente TAN copiado y pegado a un filtro gráfico HD...que al final probablemente si eres de la vieja escuela sigas prefiriendo la magia de la versión original con sus pixelazos y música original. (La nueva versión musical REMASTERED justo ha remezclado un poco los MIDI y poco mas,quedando bastante lejos de lo que nuestra memoria recordaba).

Aun con todo se trata de una versión/filtro HD de una gran aventura gráfica clásica que los nuevos aventureros no deberian dejar pasar, y respeta el original punto por punto y tramo por tramo. De nuevo hubiera echado en falta un lavado de cara más profundo, modelados y escenarios realmente rediseñados o actualizados, (que no readaptados en una paleta HD) musica orquestada, etc... pero evidentemente, todo no puede ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113066687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1458727282}
review:
Rah tellement génial de pouvoir redécouvrir ce jeu !
Bon je suis quand même un peu déçu que la refonte graphique soit aussi minime, et que le contenu soit autant similaire au jeu de base, je veux dire, il n'y a pas grand chose qui justifie l'achat du titre si vous l'avez déjà fait de nombreuses fois à l'époque, à part les Succès.
Il semble aussi y avoir un problème parfois le son saccade.

A coté de ça c'est toujours un réel plaisir, et l'interface remaniée est vraiment top !

author: {'steamid': '76561197999270029', 'num_games_owned': 2913, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1316, 'last_played': 1498775129}
review:
8/10

Тим Шейфер и его команда мечты Double Fine продолжают радовать фанатов необычных игр. В особенности тех, кто полюбил абсурдное творчество Шейфера, Гилберта и других бывших членов компании Lucasfilm Games (впоследствии ставшей LucasArts Entertainment). Год назад они подарили поклонникам Grim Fandango Remastered, теперь пришёл черёд Day of the Tentacle Remastered. Поговаривают, что следующая остановка — Full Throttle.
http://www.zoneofgames.ru/forum/index.php?showtopic=38103
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSPMN7RJa2Y

author: {'steamid': '76561197960398757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1511377489}
review:
Ja, was soll man sagen? DAS! beste Adventure aller Zeiten. Story, witzige Dialoge und Puzzles, abgedrehte Charaktere die man aber sofort in Herz schließt. 

1993 die Diskettenversion gekauft, 1994 die Talkie CD-Version und nun die Remastered. Würde ich das nochmal tun? Was soll die Frage???!!! NATÜRLICH! 

Für eine Fortsetzung braucht man mich auch nicht fragen - INSTA Buy - Ob es nun DotT 2 oder Maniac Mansion 3 heißt - egal. Wird gekauft!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008626275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1470402593}
review:
A faithful remaster of a cult classic from the 90's. The witty humour and atmosphere of the original carries over seamlessly, and the puzzles are just as 'kick-yourself' clever as they were in '93. You can also tinker with the options to make your playthrough as nostalgic as possible.

They even replaced one of the obscure portraits in the mansion with Jar Jar Binks. I'm sold.

Full Review Here

-

http://shinigaming.com/2016/03/21/day-tentacle-remastered-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198045804563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1458658725}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una aventura gráfica de LucasArts de 1993 protagonizada por Bernard, un nerd experto en electrónica que aparece como personaje seleccionable en Maniac Mansion; Laverne, una estudiante de medicina algo excéntrica y Hoagie, un rockero pasota. Los tres reciben una carta del Tentáculo Verde pidiéndoles ayuda para frenar los oscuros planes de dominación del Tentáculo Púrpura, quien ha perdido la cordura después de beber agua contaminada. Los tres amigos tendrán que viajar por el presente, pasado y futuro para salvar a la humanidad.

La historia de Day of the Tentacle es sencillamente genial y sorprende lo bien hilada que está con los puzles y el uso de tres personajes dentro del universo del juego, sobre todo si tenemos en cuenta que estamos ante un juego de 1993. Los personajes y diálogos no te dejan indiferente, tenemos un montón de tipos raros y de frases ocurrentes que puedes soltar alegremente sin miedo a que te corten la cabeza, porque no podemos decir lo mismo en Maniac Mansion, ¿verdad? Recuerdo que al terminar algunos puzles que implicaban hablar con personaje y utilizar objetos a través del tiempo flipaba, jamás me había enfrentado a un aventura donde tuviera que dar tantos pasos para hacer “algo” sin caer en el aburrimiento. Antes de Day of the Tentacle acumulabas objetos para usarlos una o varias veces en un lugar concreto a corto plazo sin experimentar una evolución tan significativa.

Sin duda, Day of the Tentacle es uno de esos juegos realmente bien hechos que a pesar del paso de los años siempre sorprende algo de su desarrollo y, ahora, con esta Remasterización, los nuevos aventureros van a pasar un montón de momentos divertidos a través de tres épocas resolviendo puzles, hablando con curiosos personajes y viviendo aventuras contra tentáculos malvados.
Estás ante un pedazo de historia del videojuego. Disfrútalo.

[url=http://lafortalezadelechuck.com/analisis/analisis-day-of-the-tentacle-remastered/]ANÁLISIS COMPLETO EN LA FORTALEZA DE LECHUCK[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198000272256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1483708257}
review:
Awesome! You can play the original Version or the remake and, of course, there's also the first Maniac Mansion inside the Game (but you will discover how to run MM ingame).
So two Classic Games at the price of one, plus the remastered graphic and i must admit: the feeling is the same of the old one, plus game controller support so you can play it on tv from your couch. Artworks, extra stuff like the developer commentary.
-DOTT
-DOTT Remastered
-Original Maniac Mansion (i must admit i hoped for a remastered graphic also for MM)
-Extra Stuff
-Tentacles!
-Hamsters on microwave!
Buy it NOW and support these great games remakes!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067029377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1458880406}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game with the humor and charm that is characteristic of its creator, Tim Schafer.  The style of gameplay and puzzle solving in this game were a staple of my childhood and they bring back a rush of nostalgia.  The dialogue is clever and funny.  The puzzles are intuitive and well-thought out.  And the art gives me the feeling that I am exploring a 1990's cartoon.

In summary, if you would like be filled with warm and fuzzy feelings (in a socially appropriate manner) and have lots of laughs along the way then play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012708019', 'num_games_owned': 3057, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1479984760}

author: {'steamid': '76561198066305221', 'num_games_owned': 1880, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1458907644}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered does what it says on the tin. It takes a classic, fantastic, point and click adventure, and modernises the graphics. Still a quality game 23 years later, this game will appeal to old fans who want to relive the past, or new point and click fans who don't know that things were better in the good-old-days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027733455', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1478819884}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025472239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1528090799}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000757304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1584362996}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is my favorite game of all time.  As a kid, I invested hours, days, weeks obsessing over the story as told by my 386 IBM with 4MB of RAM!  Maniac Mansion, Sierra quest games, and other Lucas Arts adventure titles are close to my heart as well.  What a day to be alive to see DOTT remastered!  As a fan, the commentary is fantastic, and the concept art is infinitely entertaining to explore.

That all being said, I’m a bit disappointed in the updated art and animation quality.  The lackluster, vector look comes off as lazy interpretation of the source art.  And because of this, I often find myself playing with the original, pixelated graphics.  Which is fine by me.

Although the new art didn’t impress me, I have to commend the team putting the time and effort into rereleasing this amazing game.  I’m jealous of the new generation of gamers that get to experience Day of the Tentacle for the first time!

review:
I played monkey island
I played grim fandango
I played full throttle
I played dig

I never played this however, not at the time, but my god is it everything I hoped it would  be.

This is  one I can finally say I have played
And I absolutely love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046434571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1659910915}
review:
It's a given that Day of the Tentacle is one of my favorite games considering that my Steam name is Purple Tentacle (as of right now). I was a huge fan of Maniac Mansion, so my excitement was  palpable when they originally announced that Day of the Tentacle was being released as a sequel. PCs had just started using that new fangled technology called CD-ROMs which allowed them to make a "talkie" version of the game, which was mindblowing at the time. Fortunately, the game lived up to the hype, as it's one of the most revered adventure games ever written. It's a mix of weird b-sci-fi horror with plenty of humor packed into puzzles which fall inbetween not impossibly difficult, yet not so obvious that the challenge is lacking.

Now, as far as the Remastered aspect is concerned, Double Fine has done a fantastic job! A number of people were skeptical that the game was just put through a filter (like you'd find in the Lucas-Arts based emulator SCUMMVM), but after playing the game, I can say that this is not the case. There's a number of little details added that those filters can't add. On top of which, there are a number of little additions that add even more humor to the game, such as being able to read the actual letter Green Tentacle sent to Bernard. There's also some editions to the sound, such as an improved soundtrack (I kind of like the charm of the original, but that might just be nostalgia talking). The original was General MIDI, although I'm not sure what the new version falls under (prerecorded synth? I dunno.).

Finally, there's some nice bonuses like developer's commentary, concept artwork, and I even enjoy the various hidden achivements that come from messing around in game. The UI is also improved, allowing for full screen presentation. I'm currently using the Steam Controller with it, and it feels natural.

All in all, a really well done version of the game! Finally happy to have an official rerelease of the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198022881045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1480761681}
review:
Замечательный ремастер легендарной игры 1993 года. Один из известнейших квестов ныне покойной LucasArts, но, увы, не очень популярный в наших краях, так как в свое время никто не русифицировал. Ознакомиться с игрой посоветую любителям квестов (какие вы любители квестов, если еще не играли в один из лучших его представителей?) и вообще всем, кто хочет ознакомиться с данным жанром. Приятно, что Double Fine так бережно относится к великому наследию LucasArts и продвигает его среди новых игроков, выпуская ремастеры (через год ждем Full Throttle Remastered!). 

К данному переизданию вообще никаких вопросов: возможность переключать графику с новой полностью перерисованной(!) на олдскульную, наличие самой  Maniac Mansion в игре, комментарии разработчиков, ачивменты и цена в 350 руб – Тим Шейфер рекомендует. Опечалило разве что отсутствие русского языка, ведь в 2015 Double Fine обратили внимание на русское игровое сообщество, и я уже понадеялся, что все последующие игры будут с поддержкой великого и могучего. Но нет официального русификатора – будет пиратский, за что большое спасибо переводчикам с old-games. В остальном же полный мастхэв, 10/10, GOTY 1993.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964702528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1458718012}
review:
As good as it was years ago, and then some!

Keep in mind that this game contains a fair bit of 90s pop culture so newer audiences may not pick up on everything. 

If you've never played a point-n-click before this is a great starting point, as well as one of the best point-n-click adventures of all time.

Pros:
Maniac Mansion!
Optional Remastered Soundtrack
Commentary
Great improved visuals
Plays well with a controller
On-the-fly graphics change settings like Monkey Island 1 and 2


Cons:
Some of the original sound effects are no longer present and have been replaced

author: {'steamid': '76561197969340468', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1458662029}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=So0IQoyTWT4

[h1]Overview[/h1]

A letter comes to Bernard’s home with a request from help from his good friend, Green Tentacle. Bernard once went to The Mansion to rescue a friend five years ago, but it looks like it’s time for him to go… “BACK TO THE MANSION.” Bernard returns to the Mansion to free his friend, but he also makes the mistake of releasing the clinically insane Purple Tentacle. Purple Tentacle had drink of the sewage flooding into the water below the Mansion. He was already pretty crazy but now he’s grown arms and vows to take over the world. 

The Mad Scientist, Dr. Fred, comes up with a scheme to easily recover Purple Tentacle. It involves sending Bernard and his two friends, Hoagie, and Laverne back in time to stop Purple from drinking from the sewage. He sends the three back in time but somehow skimped on one vital component of the Time Machine… the power source. The Imitation Diamond blows which sends Hoagie to the Past and Laverne to the Future. Bernard must now discover a way to stop Purple Tentacle and also rescue Laverne and Hoagie in the process. 

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

Since this is a remaster, let's get right into what's changed from the original. The first thing we'll notice is the upscale to wide-screen and beautiful 1080p. Second, we'll notice the distinct upgrade of the character models and the environments. Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle always had beautiful visuals, but now it looks like a cartoon come to life. 

One of the biggest differences from the original is the complete overhaul of the interaction system. The interactive words have been removed from the UI and replaced with a selection wheel. It's a lot easier than dragging the mouse down to a slew of words to interact with an object you've already clicked on. It also cleans up the lower half of the screen to allow us more access to the glorious visuals. The sound has been greatly improved when compared to the classic version. The midi tracks were completely remastered and the voice work is much clearer. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

A couple of slice of life changes didn't make it into the remaster. Mainly, that you can't interact with a new item once the characters begin walking to a new area. You have to wait for Bernard and is friends to finish walking before selecting something new. Secondly, there are a few sounds that haven't been updated in the Remaster. There is a room with a snoring man and Bernard even comments on how loud it is, but the sound doesn't exist in the game. It's a little bit of a nag but it happens in enough places that it's noticeable. 

Nothing has been altered much in the form of gameplay from the classic release. It's still a wonderfully designed adventure title with absolutely hilarious cutscenes accompanying every puzzle. Just be warned that it's still as much of a classic adventure game as it has ever been. Most of the puzzles are fairly easy to figure out but there are some really obscure hints for some others. 

Day of the Tentacle is not solely to blame for this. A lot of classic titles like these give a hint once and expect you to remember what that person said even hours later in the game. These moments happen quite often and since Day of the Tentacle is fairly open ended. You'll find yourself with tons of items and no idea how to use them. Some hints are also incredibly vague, like the mention of a car wash bringing rain that happens in the future. However, the actual car(t) washing needs to happen in the past. At least the design team pokes fun at these hints with achievements regarding some of the more insane hints. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

The best thing about Day of the Tentacle has always been the hilarious script and interaction with the various characters. The jokes still stand up well for this day and age as I found myself chuckling from the multitude of interactions with the cast. I couldn't help but laugh at teeth chattering George Washington and the constant updates on Purple Tentacles' rise to power. For all the upgrades that the remaster performs, it definitely didn't need any in the humor and story department. 

Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle Remastered looks amazing, sounds amazing, and has a hilarious storyline to keep the gameplay moving forward. It can also be slightly ambiguous puzzle wise but we're all in luck that the game is old enough to have tons of guides available. This is one of those games that makes me miss the Lucasarts that used to make these awesome games. 

Day of the Tentacle is one of those games that innovated the adventure genre. It’s funny that this game from 1993 has more ground-breaking measures than a lot of adventure games released in 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048085449', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1458746852}
review:
https://youtu.be/BwRonlg8mDM
[i]Game:[/i] Day of the Tentacle Remastered
[i]Genre:[/i] Point-and-click Adventure
[i]Developer:[/i] Double Fine Productions
[i]Publisher:[/i] Double Fine Productions
[i][u]Copy supplied by developer[/u][/i]

[b]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/b] is the remastered version of the classic 1993 LucasArts point-and-click adventure game, developed and published by Double Fine Productions. I grew up playing this game, and is easily one of my all-time favourite adventure games.

[h1]STORY[/h1]
Five years after the events of [i]Maniac Mansion[/i], the evil Purple Tentacle drinks toxic sludge from a river behind Dr. Fred's laboratory. He grows a pair of arms, develop vastly increased intelligence and a thirst for global domination. Now it's up to Bernard Bernoulli and his friends Laverne and Hoagie to go back to the mansion of the crazy Edisons to stop the tentacle from taking over the world. Dr. Fred sends them back in time with a time machine, which doesn't work, and now the three friends are stuck in the past, present, and future.
This is one of the most classic premises for what many consider to be LucasArts' finest game: a fun, enjoyable, easy to follow story full of hilarious jokes, great visual gags and many references and easter eggs to other games. However, I wouldn't be surprised if many new gamers (and damn do I feel old writing this) won't find this story funny and find it kind of bad.

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
The new, updated graphics look spectacular: in every room every single detail has remained untouched, and the animations and characters have never looked better.
Also, just like in the remastered versions of the first two [i]Monkey Island[/i] games, you can seamlessly change the game from its new look to the old-school SCUMM interface, giving that extra nostalgic feel and taking us back to our childhood.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
When playing with the new graphics, a wheel opens up every time you click on an object, for a better and more accessible experience for gamepad users. However, I found it very easy to misclick your actions, and I often found myself using an object instead of examining it. Thankfully, there is always the classic and reliable SCUMM interface as well as keyboard shortcuts that make everything easier.
The main feature that makes the gameplay more interesting compared to most other point-and-click games, is that you can send different items to the characters through your time machine/toilet, and changing something in the past shows its consequences in the future. Even for todays standards, it's a pretty cool mechanic.

[h1]CHALLENGE[/h1]
As much as I love this game, I can't deny that it is not easy. It is actually very much a frustrating experience, just like with most LucasArts games: most of the puzzles require some incredibly weird and downright ideotic thinking, and I am not ashamed at admitting that I had to look up a walkthrough on more than one occasion out of sheer desperation. But, thankfully, there is the possibility to highlight every usable item in each room, so at least there isn't pixel-hunting.

[h1]SOUND[/h1]
The original voice acting and sound effects all come back with a bang, while the soundtrack has been remastered, and most of the tracks are better than in the original. I highly recommend buying it if you can!

[h1]REPLAYABILITY[/h1]
While there are a lot of concept arts and achievements to unlock (and not all story related), the game doesn't really offer much new when you play it again.

Overall, this is a great remastered version of one of the best and funniest adventure games of all time. Highly recommended to old-school gamers and fans of the original.

[h1]Story: 8.5
Graphics: 9.5
Gameplay: 8.5
Challenge: 8
Sound: 9
Replayability: 6.5

[b]ENJOYMENT: 8.5
FRUSTRATION: 8[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002761589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1458869371}
review:
This game was a huge part of my childhood, as were other Lucasarts adventure games, so it's difficult to be unbiased. I'll try my best though.

A trip to Wikipedia or Google will tell you how influential this game was at the time and its importance to the point and click adventure, so I won't waste time with that. The remaster really does well in capturing the art and music style of the original game without deviating too far and is quite suitable. Eliminating the original 'verb and inventory' interface at the bottom of the screen dedicates more space to the actual game which is a plus, as it holds up quite well even on large screens.

Point-and-clicks might not be as prominent in the current generation (aside from Telltale games) but give it a try if the style of gameplay is something you're interested in. Might not be for everyone, but if you're looking for a humourous game with over-the-top characters, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011861037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1475481476}
review:
Video Version: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQOxJEqkLBA

Review code was provided by the developer.

Before I get into the full review, I need you to understand that Day of the Tentacle is a game from my childhood.  My parents would sit at the computer with my brothers and I all huddled around a CRT monitor yelling at mom to try different combinations of items or click on certain things, in an excited way, not a mean way.  The nostalgia is huge here for me, just like it was for Monkey Island.  However, this also means that because the game is important to me, I’m holding Double Fine to a high standard.

Day of the Tentacle from a story perspective is ridiculous.  Dr. Fred Edison appears first in the game Maniac Mansion, along with some of his family and tentacles that he had created which were in that game, devoid of any personality.  DoTT, being a sequel to Maniac Mansion revolves around Purple and Green tentacle.  Purple drinks some toxic sludge from the back of Edison’s house and becomes evil, even growing these cute little T’rex arms and he then goes on to take over the world.

This is the pure essence of a point and click adventure game.  You pick up items deemed pick-up-able by the devs and rub them together with other objects in hopes of combining logic and dumb luck to stumble on what the devs were thinking at the time.  For those who have never played a game like Day of the Tentacle, these types of games are based on inventory management and progression through the story comes down to using the right item in the right circumstance.  And to keep with the design consistency we’ve seen since the Monkey Island and Grim Fandango remasters, you can hotswap back and forth between the original and remastered versions by pressing F1.

You play as three characters in the same world area but separated by time.  Bernard, the stereotypical pocket protector geek in the present, Hoagie the rotund metal head 200 years in the past and Laverne the utterly bonkers girl 200 years in the future.  And the entire game revolves around Dr. Fred Edisons mansion, how it looked during those various time periods and how actions in each era cause changes in the other times.  For example, Fred has two identical twin ancestors who are only distinguishable because one is right handed and the other left.  By swapping out a right handed hammer for a left handed hammer, see?  I told you it was ridiculous, you can make a statue that is in the present day mansion swap right and left arm positions, a rather important change.

And one of the beautiful pieces of the design is that unlike many other point and clicks, Day of the Tentacle offers a significant portion of the game that is non-linear.  Controlling three characters in three separate eras allows for a fair bit of player discretion and while the ultimate actions are all the same, for the most part you will often have somewhere else you can go solve a puzzle if your current task is proving difficult.

The puzzles in the game is identical to the original.  What is new is a complete rebuild of all of the graphical assets.  Double Fine did a very good job of sticking to the essence of what made the art style so effective and fun in this game.  It remains stylized but updated to match current day computer expectations as far as a cartoon look for a video game.  The characters are goofy looking, intentionally so and very little in the world involves right angles, and just looks enjoyably wacky as a result.

They have also rebuilt the user interface.  The original Day of the Tentacle used a bottom section of the screen to contain your inventory, the action words you would use to interact with the world and also the character swap buttons.  You can use that original style UI as they did redo the visuals if you want, or you can use the new UI that was added which puts your inventory into a hover to open button in the bottom left of the screen.  This new UI also lets you right click on items and choose actions from a dial.  It is just as effective but frees up significant screen space that was previously unused for game art.

In addition to the graphical side, unless I miss my mark, the audio has been remastered.  The voices and some of the sound effects are the same, but the quality scaled up from the original recordings.  New music has been added in place of the original audio as well, with rerecorded versions of songs and a number of other sound assets.
Beyond the remastered art and music, they’ve also includes some nice bonus material in the form of concept art that unlocks as you play and developer commentary which can be turned on and listened to while playing.  Both of these are nice little features for the nostalgia buffs and also perhaps for budding game developers who enjoy seeing behind the curtain of the finished product.

As far as game options, there is little to speak of.  You can select fullscreen, change music, voice and sound effects independently.  You can also select the original or remastered art and music if you wish inside the options as well as swapping between the bar or dial UI.  They included a controls screen that has all of your non-rebindable key controls.  It does support controllers which while awkward, isn’t ultimately a problem because very little in the game is time sensitive requiring fast reactions.  There is one section with Ben Franklin that could cause controller players some trouble, but by the time you get to that bit, you should be pretty comfortable with the controller interface.

What is my conclusion?  All in all, much like the new Monkey Island versions, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an extremely faithful rebuild of a classic point and click adventure game.  There is nothing here that made me question any design choices that they went with.  It looks great, is still a blast to play through and for those of us who have played it before, hits all of the right nostalgia buttons.  If you enjoy point and clicks, this needs to be in your game library.  If you’re not sure, it is an excellent example of one of the most popular genres of games in the early 90s and is a great experience in that regard as well.  Though, if you’re young enough to have never used a VHS tape in your life, you may want to google what SP and EP related to VCRs mean.  It will save you some pain.
